Text: harare reuters  ousted zimbabwe finance minister ignatius chombo charged with three count of corruption for offence that allegedly took place two decade ago wa denied bail on monday and will be detained in custody until his case is heard on dec zimbabwe s new president emmerson mnangagwa named patrick chinamasa a acting finance minister to replace him chombo who face charge including trying to defraud the central bank wa detained after the military seized power in operation restore legacy which it said wa meant to remove criminal around former president robert mugabe his lawyer lovemore madhuku told reporter that he would appeal the magistrate s ruling in the high court on tuesday their decision wa always made up that bail would not be granted here we are hopeful that the high court will show independence madhuku said earlier he told a packed courtroom that chombo who sat impassively throughout the hearing would deny the charge at his trial and had documentary evidence showing the allegation had no basis the magistrate who detained chombo said the former minister could abscond influence state witness or be the target of a mob attack over the allegation that he abused his position when he wa minister of local government over a decade ago chombo who wa appointed finance minister in october wa among member of the g political faction allied to mugabe and his wife grace who were also expelled from the ruling zanupf party two ousted zanupf youth league leader kudzanai chipanga and innocent hamandishe who were both allied to g were also ordered to be detained until dec some mnangagwa supporter have called for unspecified action against g but the president ha urged citizen not to undertake any form of vengeful retribution chombo told the court on saturday how he wa abducted from his home on nov by armed men in soldier uniform and kept blindfolded for nine day he wa promoted to the finance portfolio from the interior ministry by mugabe in an october reshuffle replacing chinamasa who the chief secretary to the president and cabinet said will return to the role until a new cabinet ha been appointed zimbabwe is struggling with a severe shortage of the u dollar it us instead of it own currency in his main act a finance minister chombo told parliament on nov that zimbabwe s budget deficit would soar to  billion or percent of gross domestic product this year from an initial target of  million mnangagwa who served mugabe loyally for decade wa sworn in a president last friday after the yearold former leader quit under pressure from the military he is expected to form a new cabinet this week zimbabwean are watching to see mnangagwa he break with the past and name a broadbased government or selects other figure from the mugabe era s old guard
Title_Text: former zimbabwe finance minister chombo to be held in custody until trial

Text: on friday st louis police arrested two yearold white men in connection with a racially motivated attack on a black womanaccording to the st louis postdispatch jesse reed and david ragain both of jefferson county missouri maliciously attacked the woman a she wa waiting at a public bus stopthe men threw egg and shouted racial slur at the victim according to policethe men were taken into custody after police identified one of the suspect vehicle using video from surveillance camerasboth reed and ragain are charged with assault motivated by discrimination a thirddegree felony they are currently being held on a  bondst louis police believe that the pair ha carried out similar attack against people of color in the past they are asking any person who belief they were targeted by the two men to come forward these weren t two white teenager on a joy ride st louis police chief sam dotson said during an interview with the postdispatchindeed this wa a deliberate planned and unprovoked act of hate carried out by two adult menas reported here hate crime like this can have a lingering psychological impact both on the targeted victim and on the black community a a wholeracially motivated attack cause generalized terror in the group to which the victim belongs inspiring feeling of vulnerability over the other member who could be the next victim people of color have been terrorized by racist white since the united state wa foundedover the past year racially motivated attack have become more and more common across the u a fact which can be directly attributed to the rise of donald trumptrump s racist hate speech ha been cited a the motivation for everything from targeted racist mailing directed at member of the latino community to the brutal assault and beating of a homeless man by two bostonarea brothersas addicting info reported heresince last september america s voice ha been tracking instance where trump his staff and his supporter have assaulted or harassed immigrant and latino a you can imagine his special brand of xenophobia and racism ha caused a lot of white nationalist to feel comfortable with their hate for others using report of trump inspired racist attack the group created an interactive map which show just how dangerous the candidate s hate speech really iswhile we hear trump and his supporter talk a lot about the danger of muslim terrorist in the u racist white terrorist remain the most common and the most dangerous threat to american citizensresidents of the united state are seven time more likely to be killed by a rightwing terrorist than a muslim terrorist nearly percent of hate crime committed in the united state are motivated by racial and ethnic bias another percent are motivated by gender identity and sexual orientation religiously motivated hate crime attack on muslim jew atheist and other nonchristian group also account for nearly percent of hate crimescontrary to trump s propaganda we don t need a watchlist to identify who the real terrorist are we have more than enough evidence to identify the hateful violent and dangerous group that are terrorizing the american peoplefeatured image via limecools on flickr
Title_Text: white men threw egg shouted racial slur at black woman waiting for bus

Text: washington reuters  the top democrat on the u senate and house of representative intelligence committee called on wednesday for the white house to consider declassifying and releasing any intelligence community assessment of the hack into the democratic national committee email system expert have attributed the breach to russian hacker given the grave nature of this breach and the fact that it may ultimately be found to be a statesponsored attempt to manipulate our presidential election we believe a heightened measure of transparency is warranted senator dianne feinstein and representative adam schiff wrote in a letter to president barack obama obama said in an interview broadcast by nbc news on tuesday that the federal bureau of investigation wa investigating the leak of more than dnc email which showed the committee had favored hillary clinton over bernie sander for the partys presidential nomination
Title_Text: senior u lawmaker want information on dnc hack declassified

Text: reuters  the trump administration s effort to combat violence and poverty in central america will not mean greater militarization in honduras the country s president juan orlando hernandez said in an interview under a plan formulated by u president donald trump s chief of staff john kelly when he wa secretary of homeland security the united state is seeking to shore up central america by financing development project and getting mexico to do more to stem the flow of immigrant from the region nongovernmental organization and think tank have voiced concern that the plan pitched a an effort to boost central american economic growth could instead herald a greater militarization in a violent region where coup and gang killing have been commonplace central america is one of the most violent region on earth though the murder rate in honduras fell to killing per people last year from in but the trump administration ha not provided any increase in military support aside from police training and a modest bump in support from usaid hernandez told reuters during an interview in new york still honduras president say the relationship between the united state and honduras is probably better than ever noting improved cooperation hernandez belief will boost investment and security in the central american region we are closer than before hernandez said it is really important for them what s going on with central america and we are working together on economic growth which is very important investment creating job and we are working together on security hernandez said the security of honduras wa of a primary interest to american even if they were not completely aware of it we have a saying in honduras if the people in washington realize that lack of security lack of preparedness in central america is dangerous very dangerous for the u they have to work together with u to create in central america a region of prosperity investment opportunity he said that s going to be one of the best investment of the american people in their best interest and in ours additionally honduras will continue to work with the international monetary fund hernandez said provided his government is victorious in this year s election the imf recently finished a review mission in the country
Title_Text: trump central america plan will not boost militarization honduras president

Text: ammanaleppo syria reuters  when syria s civil war came to the industrial city of aleppo in two textile maker had to choose whether to stay or move their business away nine month after fighting in aleppo ended the struggle of the one who stayed in the city to reopen his factory show why the other will not return yet from the security of neighboring jordan restoring the aleppo industry that have for decade underpinned syria s economy is vital if president bashar alassad is to turn battlefield success into a fuller return of state power moustafa kawai who remained in aleppo moved his cottonweaving machine to a temporary site but now ha worker clearing his battered factory of debris to reopen it our biggest problem is electricity there are also very few worker because everyone s in the army sanction affect the work customer can t come here transferring money is difficult it s hard to buy spare part he said mahmoud akkad a carpet manufacturer who like many aleppo industrialist left syria during the war face no such problem in jordan where he ha rebuilt his plant and kept up export to old customer around the world what do i benefit if i want to set up a factory and there is no safety he said explaining the benefit of moving to an industrial zone in a country unaffected by middle east turmoil the international monetary fund estimated last year that syria s economy had shrunk by percent during the conflict and it manufacturing sector by percent the war ha since gone better for assad a his army and it ally pushed rebel from aleppo and other enclave near important city and islamic state from energy field growing confidence is evident in a new banknote bearing assad s face for the first time and in damascus holding it onceannual trade fair after a long hiatus but the war still dominates syria s economy even where the fighting ha stopped most aleppo factory were destroyed badly damaged or looted their worker fled a refugee or became combatant despite a new power line to the city there is little electricity leaving people reliant on expensive diesel generator water must be pumped electrically fighting continues outside aleppo the army and allied militia who control the city operate checkpoint that some syrian say demand bribe to let good or worker pas a charge the military denies travel outside the city mean using narrow road to bypass rebel territory and more checkpoint western sanction make foreign trade much harder hindering the purchase of new equipment and payment for commercial deal although the government urge industry to return to area where it ha regained control some businessmen say it is not doing enough to bring them back fare shehabi the head of aleppo s chamber of industry said that since the fighting ended the number of factory and workshop had risen sharply before the war there were he said when the rebel left in december there were there are now he said attributing the rise to returning industrialist who are restarting their business but shehabi a supporter of assad who ha been sanctioned by the european union for backing the government is also critical of it reconstruction policy there are some incentive but not enough he said during an interview citing tax deduction and reduced custom tariff for industrial import for all syrian customer a thing the government ha done there were no specific incentive offered for aleppo they should treat u like a devastated area we don t have the level of administration that is needed to really save this industry to make it run again he added in jordan akkad said the syrian government had encouraged him to return and he said he hope to do so eventually it all depends on the circumstance improving he said he ha built one factory that produce most of the same range of rug and carpet he once made in aleppo and is also investing in a new  million plant to make yarn some of his most skilled weaver followed him to jordan and few others remain in aleppo only five percent of my workforce have remained most headed to germany to turkey he said in aleppo had about a third of syria s industrial company and industry worker central bureau of statistic figure show there were about a million people employed in it factory shehabi said during the decade before the war assad s economic reform helped aleppo s business to grow more quickly akkad wa among the first to leave the small inner city workshop and move his operation into sheikh najjar north of aleppo the biggest industrial zone in the city his family owned three factory there and wa one of the biggest exporter of syrian textile sheikh najjar became a battlefield in occupied by successive force whose warfare caused massive damage and who stripped plant of equipment akkad risked losing business relationship built over year today you have customer all over the world this is very costly to get a new network of customer it s more expensive than the plant itself he said he considered starting again in turkey lebanon or egypt some city industrialist have moved to each of the three country and others went elsewhere in syria but akkad chose jordan untouched by the arab uprising his business is now located in a wellpoliced industrial zone there the machine gun of jordan s antiterrorist force guarding the entrance what brought u here wa the security he said when rebel took over moustafa kawai s factory in he bought new machine and started producing on a temporary site in a governmentheld district of aleppo instead of moving away that site  which still represents his entire output  is in a ramshackle building near aleppo stadium across the corridor is a sweat shop owned by a different business where small child make sport shoe in a fug of glue fume showing how far the city s onceadvanced industry ha regressed kawai produce about two tonne of baled cotton a day now compared to tonne a day before the war when reuters visited kawai s operation cotton spinning machine whirred and rattled in a cramped room plasticwrapped bale of white cotton lay to one side electricity is provided by a diesel generator and cost syrian pound  a week to power five machine it often stop working by comparison in his large purposebuilt factory before the war he paid pound a week to power machine in the belleramoun industrial zone in west aleppo the pound wa worth about time more against the dollar than it is now he also had spacious loading bay and other facility there that he lack in the temporary site like much of sheikh najjar belleramoun is now a wasteland of shellpocked building mostly empty but for army checkpoint still kawai ha started work to move back outside his factory six hand were shifting rubble with spade on a street that abruptly ended a hundred yard away with an abandoned canon and an earthen mound beyond it lay noman s land fighter graffiti covered factory wall salvaged metal flange were soaking in oil to strip rust because syria s weak pound make importing new one too expensive we started working here about six month ago we want another year to return completely said bashar aissa the supervisor
Title_Text: hard choice for syrian industrialist in ruin of aleppo

Text: washington reuters  confronted by russia in syria ukraine and cyberspace the next u president will be the fourth to face vladimir putin and the challenge of deterring a kremlin often more willing than the white house to take risk and project power over the last four year the russian president ha annexed crimea and destabilized eastern ukraine stymied u hope to oust syrian president bashar alassad and mounted cyber attack that u official blame on hacker commanded or orchestrated by russian intelligence agency in his latest gambit putin this week suspended a treaty with washington on cleaning up weaponsgrade plutonium while the united state ha imposed economic sanction on russia for it action in ukraine these have yet to force it to calm tension in eastern ukraine let alone surrender crimea some current and former u official argue the white house ha failed to understand putins bitterness about the decade after the soviet union collapsed at a time the russian leader feel the west took advantage of russia when it wa down further they say the united state ha little influence over the course of democracy in russia or on it willingness to use force in syria ukraine or elsewhere to achieve it end the result critic say could be that syria fester ukraine stay off balance and unable to draw closer to europe and that even area such a arm control and nonproliferation pillar of cooperation during the cold war could deteriorate for putin and most of the russian leadership its a zerosum world said andrew weiss of the carnegie endowment for international peace think tank weiss argued the russian leader wa unlikely to change his stripe before russias presidential election in an atmosphere where putins own domestic political fortune depend on having this external enemy namely the united states a u official suggested putin who ha yet to tip his hand but is expected to run again is willing to use force to get his way while the white house scarred by the u war in iraq and afghanistan is not the administration never understood how bruised putin and many many russian feel about the s or how determined they are to regain what they consider russias rightful place in the world much less what putin is willing to do to get there said the official who spoke on condition of anonymity he will keep pushing until he meet serious resistance and so far he hasnt the official added in the eye of many current and former u official syria is a case in point the united state this week announced it wa suspending talk with russia on a ceasefire all but saying the russian and syrian assault on aleppo had made a mockery of the peace effort where they make a desert they call it peace secretary of state john kerry said quoting the roman historian tacitus analyst believe aleppo is likely to fall but the war now in it sixth year will grind on with assad surviving atop a shrunken broken and fragmented country enduring the worlds worst refugee crisis since world war two u official say the white house ha yet to decide what to do next on syria but few expect obama to shift strategy in his waning month in office it is not considering imposing further sanction on russia for now two u official said on monday putin suspended a treaty with washington on cleaning up weaponsgrade plutonium signaling he is willing to use nuclear disarmament a a new bargaining chip in dispute with the united state if the relationship worsens either side could be looking to exert leverage or score point in the nuclear arm control realm said daryl kimball of the arm control association another area where the united state is weighing it option is the stealthy war in cyberspace that is already under way with russia and could escalate a relation worsen u official anonymously say russian intelligence service have interfered in the u election process by launching cyber intrusion into the presidential campaign of democratic nominee hillary clinton and other u political organization and state election office the kremlin denies the allegation the white house ha refrained from publicly accusing russia if hard evidence of russias involvement emerges washington ha a dilemma in fashioning a response because by going public it could tip moscow to it own intrusion prompting retaliation two u official suggested critic are taking too short term a view arguing it can take year to achieve an objective such a the liberation of the baltic state from soviet rule cold warlike policy such a using economic sanction to weaken russias economy or deploying nato troop to the baltic and poland in january to deter russia may work over time theres no quick fix with the russians said one official
Title_Text: next u president putin fourth inherits sinking russia tie

Text: the piece are in place ahead of president donald trump s rally in downtown phoenix on tuesday with the nation waiting to see how it will play outofficials are bracing for a deluge of ten of thousand of supporter and protester leading law enforcement to close road and also for many business office school and even state court to close their door earlyalthough trump visited arizona seven time during his campaign this is his first visit a president and likely to be a very different affair az centralon august president trump on tuesday retweeted a fox news story saying he wa seriously considering pardoning former arizona sheriff joe arpaiofox news exclusive president trump seriously considering a pardon for exsheriff joe arpaio httpstcorgwlixl fox friend foxandfriends august president trump may soon issue a pardon for joe arpaio the colorful former arizona sheriff who wa found guilty two week ago of criminal contempt for defying a state judge s order to stop traffic patrol targeting suspected undocumented immigrant in his final year a maricopa county sheriff arpaio had emerged a a leading opponent of illegal immigration i am seriously considering a pardon for sheriff arpaio the president said sunday during a conversation with fox news at his club in bedminster nj he ha done a lot in the fight against illegal immigration he s a great american patriot and i hate to see what ha happened to him trump said the pardon could happen in the next few day should he decide to do soarpaio wa convicted by u district judge susan bolton of misdemeanor contempt of court for willfully disregarding an arizona judge s order in to stop the antiimmigrant traffic patrol arpaio had maintained the law enforcement patrol for month thereafterthe man who built a controversial national reputation a america s toughest sheriff admitted he prolonged his patrol but insisted he did not intend to break the law because one of his former attorney did not explain to him the full measure of restriction contained in the court orderhe is expected to be sentenced on oct and could face up to six month in jail however since he is year old and ha no prior conviction some attorney doubt he will receive any jail timeciting his long service a an outstanding sheriff the president said arpaio is admired by many arizona citizen who respected his toughoncrime approacharpaio s widely publicized tactic included forcing inmate to wear pink underwear and housing them in desert tent camp where temperature often climbed well past degree fahrenheit he also controversially brought back chain gain including a voluntary chain gang for woman prisoner fox news
Title_Text: altleft plan to hijack president trumps az rallywill he really make them crazy by announcing pardon for americas toughest sheriff on illegal immigration

Text: donald trump s executive order to ban traveler from muslimmajority country ha been met with an onslaught of criticismone of the people continuing to speak out against trump is former secretary of state madeleine albright who slammed trump in an interview with chris cuomo earlier today criticizing trump s ban and the team that helped move it forward albright made a suggestion that could save america from this doomed terrifying presidency it would be helpful if the people at the top of our government actually read the constitution because clearly trump know nothing about it albright smacked down trump s unprepared plan stating that what he wa doing wa actually putting america in danger instead of making america safe again she said it ha actually created more danger because there are country that are now in fact not able to cooperate with u in term of intelligence sharing or generally mistrust and there s going to be tit for tat where we have troop in iraq and we have to worry how they are going to be treated albright also stated that trump created chaos and turmoil not only within the u but on an international level a well i think it s one of the worst decision and then blaming a whole religion for this is truly outrageous and unamerican i think the question is there s danger in the world no question about it but all the fact that you have been presenting in term of who are the one that commit terrorist attack it s not people that come from those seven country albright posed the critical question why weren t the country that are actually a danger on the banned list she stated that trump s ban wa not based on fact because no refugee ha actually attacked the u in over year trump didn t even put the country that the hijacker came from on the list albright said there are lot of question that have not been answered part of what really bother me is that this country is based on diversity and respecting diverse opinion what is happening is that this administration is making decision based on the decision of people that are uninformed about what is going on in the world albright herself wa a refugee having escaped thenczechoslovakia shortly after nazi occupation started her parent were jewish and she lost many family member due to the holocaust albright condemned trump for leaving jew out of his holocaust remembrance day proclamation she said i think that it wa really unbelievable in term of what day it wa issued on holocaust memorial day and not to understand the suffering by the way that one of the thing people remember about the united state is that during the s a ship of jew wa turned away from america is that the thing we want to remember is how we turn people away from this country when they need help you can watch albright crush trump belowjust a few day ago albright stood in solidarity with muslim and said she wa ready to register a muslim we need more voice like albright s to fight the tyranny that america ha just come underfeatured image via jessica kourkounis getty image
Title_Text: madeleine albright slam trump for muslim ban make stunning suggestion that could save u all video

Text: madrid reuters  dna test on the exhumed body of salvador dali showed that a spanish woman who brought a paternity suit against him wa not his daughter the surrealist painter s foundation said on wednesday the court supervising the test had informed it lawyer that maria pilar abel wa not dali s biological daughter after comparing her dna with sample taken from his remains the foundation said in a statement a spokesman for the court declined to confirm the result of the test contacted by phone abel said she had not yet received the result from the court the madrid court in june ordered forensic scientist to exhume dali s body after abel who wa born in dali s home town of figueres filed a paternity claim that alleged her mother had an affair with him this conclusion is not a surprise for the foundation since at no point ha there been any evidence that she wa a relative said the foundation which manages dali s estate the foundation is happy that this put an end to an absurd and artificial controversy dali who died in aged wa one of the th century s most famous and easily recognized artist his painting include the persistence of memory with it iconic image of melting clock and he also turned his hand to movie sculpture and advertising
Title_Text: dna test on dali body refute woman paternity claim

Text: leftist indoctrination for toddler how i wish this wasn t a true story a threeyearold named lee defends the abortion of his sister in a new child s book by an author with her own ghost sister sister apple sister pig by mary walling blackburn focus on an adult topic abortion the story follows lee a he or she a the author stressed search for his sister who might be an apple a pig or somewhere in a tree lee later decides sister is a happy ghost and explicitly say he s glad sister isn t around to inconvenience his parentsthe free ebook is available on art publishing platform eflux the blaze reported the author walling blackburn is assistant professor of art at southern methodist university s meadow school of the art and founder of the anhoek school lee is papa and mama s only child for now although there once wa a sister the book began where doe sister live now at one point lee explained to his papa well she used to live in mama and doesn t anymore after papa agreed lee reiterated she lived before me but mama couldn t keep her mama say she is a ghost when lee s papa asked doe that make you sad or scared lee changed his tune i m not sad that my sister is a ghost if you kept my sister you would be tired and sad and mad when his father questioned why lee continuedbecause we would be wild and loud and sometimes we would fight mama might be scared that she could not buy enough food for u mama might not have enough time to read to me to paint with me to play with me to talk with me papa also noted good reason lee doesn t have a sister right here right now maybe you will have another sister when there is more time and there is more money papa saidbut even during story time lee couldn t forget about his lost sibling he whispered the secret to his uncle the secret is that she s she s a ghost lee and his uncle pretend she s still there the ghost girl can sit beside me his uncle offeredlater lee told his uncle mama had an abortion before she had me but reassures him that sister is a happy ghost even the uncle s friend jess wonder where the ghost sister is lee replied ghost sister ha her own thing to do but that she return when i call her if i need her and he did a the last page read mama papa lee and sister are about to head into the late afternoon towards home in the acknowledgement walling blackburn thanked her own ghost sister and warned masochist look elsewhere because between these page you will not find the luxury of grief culpability s sharp sting or salty guilt via newsbusters
Title_Text: proabortion book for child my sister is a happy ghost

Text: dublin reuters  it is not yet clear if britain and the european union can agree on written assurance to avoid a hard northern ireland border by a monday deadline irish foreign minister simon coveney said on sunday but he said he wa hopeful a meeting between british prime minister theresa may and european council president donald tusk on monday would lead to a deal in time for a dec  eu summit that would allow britain to move on to talk on it future trading relation with the bloc avoiding a socalled hard border on the island of ireland is the last major hurdle before talk begin on the future trade relationship and a twoyear brexit transition tusk said he had asked may to put a final offer on the table by monday but coveney suggested agreement on the wording of written reassurance may come later the hope is that those monday meeting will result in a momentum that can be carried into the leader summit the week after and can allow this brexit negotiation process to open up to phase two of discussion coveney told rte radio asked if he expected an agreed text of written british assurance on the issue monday morning coveney said let s not run before we can walk here obviously we would like that to be the case the irish cabinet is to meet at gmt on monday and give prime minister leo varadkar a mandate to make a decision on the border issue that may or may not be on the back of an agreed wording that remains to be seen over the next number of hour coveney said ireland is not asking the british government to do the impossible and provide a detailed plan border will work but rather for clear principle for the second phase of talk to eliminate the possibility of a hard border what we have to make sure here is that we don t have an unintended consequence of the reemergence of a hard border he said we can t allow that and we won t allow that
Title_Text: ireland say unclear if eu uk can agree wording on border by monday

Text: washington reuters  republican lawmaker on tuesday started trying to kill a brandnew u rule prohibiting bank and credit card company from requiring customer who open new account to sign an agreement that they will not join a group lawsuit in the event of a dispute the consumer financial protection bureau on monday finalized the new rule banning mandatory arbitration clauses requiring consumer to forego classaction suit and instead settle dispute in negotiation overseen by arbitrator frequently hired by company the rule immediately ran into fierce opposition by wall street and republican who control both congress and the white house they have long criticized the consumer agency which is run by a democrat richard cordray senator tom cotton a member of the banking committee ha already announced he is drafting a resolution to kill the rule his fellow republican senator pat toomey chair of the subcommittee on financial institution and consumer protection said he is considering a similar step republican lawmaker plan to eliminate the rule using a law that allows congress to undo new regulation with simple majority vote in both chamber and a signature from the president analyst and consumer advocate have said the agencys rule may survive the congressional challenge still the u chamber of commerce is contemplating a legal challenge and trump administration official are also looking at way to kill the rule isaac boltansky a policy analyst for the investment firm compass point research trading said the rule ha a slightly better than percent chance of surviving in congress joe valenti who track the issue for the liberalleaning center for american progress said the house of representative wa unified against the rule which opponent have argued benefit classaction lawyer not consumer it come down to the senate said valenti noting that the rule would survive if only three republican in that chamber switched side that is possible said ed mierzwinksi the consumer program director for the u public interest research group he noted that senate republican have struggled to gather enough vote for majority and the calendar is swollen with pressing legislation and confirmation hearing in addition mierzwinksi said senator may be leery of appearing to side with wall street against consumer he noted that well fargo co used clause in it accountopening agreement to block customer from suing over it phantom account scandal supporter of the rule say mandatory arbitration denies citizen their day in court and is rigged in favor of big firm they say litigant banding together in a classaction lawsuit have a better chance of getting company to answer publicly for illegal activity and that fear of such a suit can discourage law breaking the consumer protection agency wrote the rule after conducting a lengthy multiyear study of the issue opponent of the rule say the study is flawed and that arbitration is cheaper and faster than classaction lawsuit and produce better award for consumer the chamber is exploring a prompt legal challenge to the rule said matt webb senior vice president for it legal reform institute another possible challenge could come from the acting comptroller of the currency keith noreika he is laying groundwork to invoke an untested provision of the doddfrank financial reform law that allows the council of the countrys top financial regulator to nullify a consumer agency rule if they decide it threatens the safety and soundness of the banking system rohit chopra senior fellow at the consumer federation of america and former cfpb assistant director said a lawsuit will probably fail because the law say the agency can restrict arbitration a long a it hews to it study he said the doddfrank provision that the comptrollers office is looking at wa meant to keep risk to the financial system at bay to suggest that this rule would cause a financial crisis is ridiculous on it face he said
Title_Text: republican strike back at new u ban on forced arbitration

Text: beijing reuters  china s foreign ministry said on tuesday it hoped all party could contribute to resolving the issue on the korean peninsula peacefully after the united state put north korea back on a list of state sponsor of terrorism ministry spokesman lu kang made the comment at a daily news briefing
Title_Text: china say hope all party can resolve north korea issue peacefully

Text: john oliver of hbo s last week tonight dove into the deeply shady world of debt buying and collection on his sunday segment but last week tonight isn t just about giving out information the show often doe surprising thing well in advance of an air date so they can make the biggest impact possible and sunday s episode wa no exception what they did will impact people in the usso what happened oliver started a debt buyingcollection agency in mississippi called central asset recovery professional inc or carp for short he used it to show just how easy and cheap it is to get into this business debt buying is a grimy business and badly need more oversight because a it stand any idiot can get into it and i can prove that to you because i am an idiot and we started a debtbuying company and it wa disturbingly easy not long after carp incorporated they were offered a portfolio of medical debt worth nearly  million and given the name address and social security number of the people who owed that debt we bought it which is absolutely terrifying because it mean if i wanted to i could legally have carp take possession of that list and have employee start calling people turning their life upside down over medical debt the portfolio cost carp  they got it for penny on the dollar that s the norm for this businesscarp didn t start sending employee after these people like a regular agency though instead oliver and last week tonight got together with a charity called rip medical debt and forgave all  million of it those people don t have to worry about what they owe to hospital clinic and individual practitioner anymore they might not even have to worry about whether they ll have to file for bankruptcy anymorejohn oliver just wiped out the medical debt of nine thousand people let that sink in while you watch the entire segment which detail out just how disgusting and grisly the debtbuying business is belowwe re the only industrialized nation in the world that doesn t have some form of nationalized healthcare available to everyone and medical debt is the number one reason people file for bankruptcy here in fact more than percent of bankruptcy in the u have to do with medical debt it can cost hundred of thousand of dollar for one necessary procedure cuttingedge cancer treatment can run into the millionsin english our system is fcked all to hell because of profitthis move technically cost less than the famous oprah winfrey show where she gave her entire audience a new car spending roughly  million but the impact and the message are far greater hat off to john oliver for thisfeatured image via screen capture from embedded video
Title_Text: john oliver started a debt collection agency and what he did with it will blow you away video

Text: linguistics professor and political commentator noam chomsky ha come out with a shocking statement about the republican party we ve all known that republican are pretty much the scum of the earth today but chomsky warns they are the most dangerous organization in human history during an interview with bbc s newsnight wednesday with host evan davis mr chomsky quickly addressed the republican party saying that they are worse than the islamic state terrorist group or anyone else who have caused million of casualty during the th centurychomsky agreed his statement wa outrageous but made it hit home when comparing the republican part to isi is isi dedicated to trying to destroy the prospect for organized human existence he went on to explain what doe it mean to say not only are we not doing anything about climate change but we re trying to accelerate the race to the precipice he said it doesn t matter whether they genuinely believe it or not if the consequence of that is let s use more fossil fuel let s refuse to subsidize developing country let s eliminate regulation that reduce greenhouse gas if that s the consequence that s extremely dangerous chomsky ha a real point the rate at which the gop is deregulating industry and ignoring the effect of climate change the world will see level of human suffering that have never been experienced in historywatch the video here
Title_Text: watch chomsky explains why the gop is the most dangerous organization in human history

Text: washington reuters  u education secretary betsy devos faced hostile question from a senate committee on tuesday a she tried to win lawmaker over to president donald trumps proposal to slash her departments funding by percent devos a republican who narrowly won senate approval for her post in february after strident opposition from democrat and a few fellow party member testified before the senate appropriation subcommittee on education about the proposed budget trump submitted to congress last month trumps plan to cut  billion from the education departments budget would improve educational opportunities and shift the federal role in education devos told the panel i understand those figure are alarming for many she said however this budget refocuses the department on supporting state and school district in their effort to provide highquality education to all our students democrat took turn asking devos about the bigger budget lineitems and talking about student who they say could be hurt by large spending cut the most pointed exchange were on whether private school that receive federal fund would have to agree not to discriminate against student devos would only repeat that school taking federal money must abide by u law but senator jeff merkley and his fellow democrat said she wa refusing to answer the question because federal law is unclear in many area of possible discrimination such a the right of transgendered people lawmaker are expected to alter trumps proposed budget before voting on it the subcommittees chair conservative republican roy blunt said he believed congress would not approve the budget a proposed such a significant cut to the departments budget is likely untenable blunt said pressing specifically to preserve fund for technical program workstudy financial aid and the special olympics civil right group and democrat say the budget would send public dollar to private company disband afterschool care hurt school in poor neighborhood shrink the rank of teacher and make it harder for many to afford college devos is currently working on major transformation in student loan the budget suggests changing incomebased repayment plan and ending loan forgiveness for worker in the public sector which devos said would clear up confusion around the loan with the stated aim of giving parent more choice for their childrens education devos and republican support charter school which are publicly funded but operate independently frequently by corporation a well a subsidy to help pay privateschool tuition many republican on the panel applauded the budgets proposal to boost such school choice program but the subcommittees senior democrat patty murray said the cut highlight the way that the policy and priority you and president trump are pushing would hurt student hurt community and represent a clear broken promise to worker and the middle class
Title_Text: senator grill u education secretary on proposal to slash budget

Text: istanbul reuters  turkish police detained people over suspected link to islamic state in antiterror operation in eight city over the weekend the staterun anadolu agency said on sunday counterterrorism police detained foreign national on saturday during operation in the capital ankara anadolu said some of the detained were believed to be preparing for an attack on oct turkey s republic day the police raided house in bursa a northwestern province of turkey and detained people including syrian national and two azerbaijani national on sunday anadolu said eight of the detained suspect were minor it said on sunday morning police detained people in the northeastern province of erzurum a part of an investigation into terrorist organization the detained included suspected senior member of the organization anadolu said police also detained suspect in five other city including istanbul and izmir a part of antiterror operation over the weekend anadolu said police confiscated several weapon ammunition digital data and document during the operation it said
Title_Text: turkey detains people over suspected islamic state link anadolu

Text: reuters  democrat kevin de leon president of the california state senate announced on sunday he would run for the u senate in challenging incumbent senator dianne feinstein the los angeles democrats announcement did not mention feinstein feinstein who wa first elected to the senate in is the top democrat on the senate judiciary committee and the first woman to hold that role she is also a senior member of the senate select committee on intelligence and wa the first woman to lead that panel from through feinstein said last week that she would run for her fifth term she is the oldest u senator but among several octogenarian including republican chuck grassley orrin hatch richard shelby jim inhofe pat robert and john mccain
Title_Text: california senator dianne feinstein to face democratic challenge in race

Text: reuters  transcanada corp trpto said on friday the u department of state issued a presidential permit for the construction of the keystone xl oil pipeline a project blocked by former president barack obama president donald trump will make an announcement on the pipeline at am white house spokesman sean spicer said in a post on twitter trump signed an executive order to advance the project which will link canadian oil sand to u refiner soon after taking office in january saying it would create thousand of job obama had said the pipeline would do nothing to reduce fuel price for u motorist and would contribute emission linked to global warming a senior administration official told reuters that trump will make the announcement alongside transcanada chief executive russell girling and sean mcgarvey president of north americas building trade union our government ha always been supportive of the keystone xl pipeline and we are pleased with the u decision a spokesman for canadas minister of natural resource said the importance of a common continental energy market cannot be overstated he added the move mark the beginning of lengthy process which will involve getting approval from state regulator the project could also face legal challenge transcanada tried for more than five year to build the mile km pipeline until obama rejected it in the company resubmitted it application for the project in january after trump signed the executive order smoothing it path expedited approval of project is part of trumps approach for a year  trillion infrastructure package he promised on the campaign trail the multibilliondollar pipeline would bring more than barrel per day of heavy crude from canadas oil sand in alberta into nebraska linking to an existing pipeline network feeding u refinery and port along the gulf of mexico
Title_Text: transcanada get presidential permit for keystone xl pipeline

Text: moscow reuters  russia said on tuesday it had dropped accusation against cnn international of violating russian medium law and the u channel could continue broadcasting in russia the head of broadcasting regulator roskomnadzor alexander zharov said the issue wa resolved after cnn agreed to rectify detail of it russian license shown onscreen during broadcast the interfax news agency reported he gave no detail cnn said it did not plan to make any comment on the matter the regulator had raised the accusation in september a day after the russian foreign ministry accused washington of putting unwarranted pressure on the u operation of kremlinbacked medium outlet rt zharov at the time gave no detail of the exact nature of the dispute but he said when the accusation were raised that russia wa not motivated by any political consideration claim against cnn have been dropped the channel will continue working in russia but roskomnadzor will continue monitoring the compliance of the american company s activity with russia s legislation interfax cited zharov a saying president vladimir putin told a security council meeting last month that russian medium outlet working abroad were facing growing and unacceptable pressure
Title_Text: moscow give green light to cnn international broadcasting in russia

Text: moscow reuters  moscow will limit the scope of u military observation flight over russia from jan next year in retaliation for u curb on similar russian flight over the united state the ria news agency reported on wednesday the united state ha accused russia of flouting the open sky treaty an agreement designed to build confidence between the country military which entered into force in and said it plan to take measure against moscow the wall street journal newspaper reported in september that this would include restricting russian military flight over american territory in response to what it said wa moscow preventing u observation flight over it heavily militarized baltic exclave of kaliningrad the united state is reported to have been keen to restrict russian flight over alaska and hawaii a well a limiting the distance of russian observation flight ria on wednesday cited georgy borisenko a senior foreign ministry official a saying moscow would take reciprocal step to respond to the new u measure from jan and limit the territory which u observation flight can fly over
Title_Text: russia to limit u military observation flight ria

Text: washington reuters  steny hoyer the no democrat in the u house of representative said on tuesday that house democratic leader are asking their rankandfile member to vote against a stopgap government funding bill according to a cnn reporter on twitter a house republican aide said earlier on tuesday that the spending bill would fund the government until jan and include funding for disaster aid and a fiveyear extension of the childrens health insurance program
Title_Text: house democratic leader urging no vote on spending bill cnn reporter

Text: springfield mo reuters  president donald trump said on wednesday he still want to see the u corporate tax rate drop to percent saying cutting it is essential for the nation to regain it competitive edge we must reduce the tax rate on american business so they keep job in america create job in america and compete for worker right here in america trump said in a speech aimed at shoring up support for a broad taxcut plan ideally we would like to bring our business tax rate down to percent he said
Title_Text: trump say still want to drop u corporate tax rate to percent

Text: donald trump ha singled out many people during his campaign but none have remained a target in trump s eye and twitter feed quite like fox news anchor megyn kellytrump s issue with kelly exploded after the first republican debate when kelly understandably called trump out on his longwinded history of sexist misogynistic comment toward woman trump being the abrasive ahole that he is blew the incident way out of proportion and continued to slam kelly both on and off twitter for week after the debate now kelly is speaking out against trump claiming that the business mogul had actually tried to woo her in some incredibly creepy way which may have influenced why he wa so bitter when she called him outvanity fairthis month kelly grace the cover of vanity fair magazine in which the yearold journalist spoke about her interaction with the donald at length kelly said that trump used to send her press clipping that were signed donald trump and called her numerous time to tell her how much he enjoyed certain segment of her show ironically after the debate trump criticized kelly s show extensively kelly didn t think much of this at first but when trump announced he wa going to run for president kelly said it became more clear but kelly said that trump s effort were completely futile she said i can t be wooed i wa never going to love him and i wa never going to hate him i would have crawled over a pile of hot coal to make it to that debate no one wa going to be sitting in for me reading my question and i can say with confidence that neither bret nor chris wanted to read my question for many reason kelly revealed that her decision to focus on trump s sexist remark wa because she knew democratic frontrunner hillary clinton would zero in on them if they faced each other in the general election part of what kelly said to trump wa your twitter account ha several disparaging comment about womens look you once told a contestant on celebrity apprentice that it Text: washington reuters  president barack obama said in a commencement speech on saturday that u race relation have improved over the last three decade but that significant work still need to be done i tell you this not to lull you into complacency but to spur you into action because theres still so much work to do obama told about howard university graduate in washington acknowledging that racism and inequality still persist we cannot sleepwalk through life he said the united state ha faced a number of racial controversy in recent year including the shooting of an unarmed black teenager by a police officer in ferguson missouri that sparked sometimes violent protest the united state ha a racial gap in economic opportunity obama said noting that the overall u employment rate is around percent but it is near percent for africanamerican obama the son of a white mother and african father told the graduate to embrace their racial identity be confident in your blackness obama said adding there is no one way to be black theres no straightjacket theres no constraint theres no litmus test for authenticity he added that my election did not create a postracial society but wa one example of how attitude have changed obama also urged the crowd not to try to prod college and university into disinviting controversial speaker  something that ha taken place regularly at campus throughout the united state howard university is one of about historically black college and university in the united state obama argued that the united state and the world ha progressed dramatically since when he graduated from college america is by almost every measure better than it was in obama said noting that u poverty rate is down the number of people with college degree is up and the number of woman in the workforce have risen obama said todays college graduate are better positioned than any other to address the countrys tough outstanding problem you need a strategy obama said adding passion and anger are not enough to effect political change and encouraging them to embrace compromise not just hashtags but votes he noted the low voter turnout among young people in the congressional election he told the graduate they needed to vote every time not just when youre inspired but obama noted an area that ha not improved in recent decade  the u prison population  currently at million it is up more than fourfold from in africanamerican men are six time more likely than white men to be incarcerated obama said and urged the graduate to lobby the u congress to pas a pending criminal justice reform measure senator charles grassley an iowa republican praised obamas remark on twitter writing even conservative would applaud it
Title_Text: obama say u race relation have improved but work to be done

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump urged fellow republican on friday to begin work on tax reform legislation immediately exhorting them to hurry up after two day in which he stunned member of his party with overture to opposition democrat republicans must start the tax reformtax cut legislation asap dont wait until the end of september needed now more than ever hurry trump wrote on twitter
Title_Text: trump urge republican to start tax reform immediately twitter

Text: fashion designer donna karan is standing by harvey weinstein and ha suggested his alleged victim may have been asking for it by the way the woman act and dressduring a red carpet interview at the cin fashion film award on sunday the dkny creator wa asked to weigh in on the scandal hour after the disgraced film mogul wa fired from his companyunlike many hollywood star and celebs karan did not condemn the yearold who ha been accused of sexually harassing multiple woman over the span of decade and instead pointed the finger at his accusersshe told a reporter i think we have to look at ourselves obviously the treatment of woman all over the world is something that ha always had to be identified certainly in the country of haiti where i work in africa in the developing world it s been a hard time for woman to see it here in our own country is very difficult but i also think how do we display ourselves how do we present ourselves a woman what are we asking are we asking for it by presenting all the sensuality and all the sexuality and what are we throwing out to our child today about how to dance and how to perform and what to wear how much should they show karan s comment are striking a a legend in the fashion world and having designed woman s clothing for decade her comment come a many of weinstein s former friend including judi dench and meryl streep have denounced the producer based on the bombshell allegationsshe added that she know weinstein s wife georgina chapman and described the couple a wonderful people when asked whether hollywood ha been busted she replied with a smile i don t think it s only harvey weinsteinafter karan s report circulated online rose mcgowan one of weinstein s alleged victim and a vocal opponent of the producer online called her deplorable in a tweet on sunday mcgowan posted a screenshot of this dailymailcom article with the message donna karan you are a deplorable aiding and abetting is a moral crime you are scum in a fancy dress mcgowan also tweeted this image of herself in her s when weinstein allegedly sexually assaulted herlast year she tweeted under the hashtag whywomendontreport with the message because my ex sold our movie to my rapist for distribution according to the new york time report that initiated weinstein s downfall this week mcgowan sued the producer in the s but settled out of court for  daily mail
Title_Text: top designer donna karan defends harvey weinsteinsuggests victim may have been asking for it by the way they dress

Text: this guy just want everyone deadpastor steven anderson of faithful word baptist church in arizona just doe not know how to shut his mouththe day after the orlando mass shooting anderson praised the murder and called upon the government to execute all gay people across the nationjust this past sunday anderson repeated his call to execute gay people but added a call to purge any christian who support the lgbt communityand now anderson is calling for reinstating the death penalty against anyone who is tried and convicted of committing adultery adultery is not a crime in the united state but anderson called for punishing those who commit it with death in a written manifesto on his blog last week when someone say that homosexuality is worthy of death according to the bible people inevitably will bring up other sin that were also punishable by death in the old testament he wrote they think they are somehow catching u in hypocrisy but the truth is bible believing christian do agree with those other old testament penalty a well we just need to realize that god s law were the law of the land in those day today adultery is not punishable by law in the united state but it should be just a he did when he called for executing gay people anderson laid out his vision of a righteous government presumably made up of conservative christian who will shred the constitution and replace it with the bible and said such a government would make adultery a capital crime worthy of arrest and death if convicted by what one can only imagine would be a kangaroo court this anderson say is the way he would prevent adultery and divorceyes a righteous government would implement the death penalty for those tried and convicted of adultery we all know normal people who have unfortunately committed this grievous sin and of course we wouldn t want them to die for it if we were to somehow vote in a law making adultery illegal it would not be retroactive it would be the law going forward and adultery rate would plummet and so would divorce rate think about it though do you really think a many people commit adultery in society where it is punishable by death of course not so you can relax about your aunt trudy who cheated on her husband thirty year ago if aunt trudy had lived in a society that enforced the death penalty for adultery chance are she would never have committed that sin in the first placeindeed other nation in the world do in fact punish adulterer with death there s only one problemas it turn out punishing adultery by execution is something that occurs today mostly under islamic law conservative like anderson would refer to this a sharia law and usually it overwhelmingly punishes woman especially woman who have been rapedaccording to the weekthe un ha issued numerous call to government to repeal law that criminalise adultery arguing that they are predominantly used to discriminate against woman provision in penal code often do not treat woman and men equally and establish harsher rule and sanction for woman writes human right expert france radaycountries governed by islamic law including saudi arabia pakistan and somalia all strictly prohibit zina or fornication outside marriage prosecution are common and punishment can include fine arbitrary detention imprisonment flogging and in extreme case the death penalty woman are overwhelmingly targetedhuman right organisation argue that in several muslim nation adultery law are often used against woman who have been raped under such legislation the burden of proof is on the woman to provide evidence that she wa raped or be prosecuted for adulteryin short what anderson is proposing is a barbaric practice that is mostly practiced in country that are governed by some form of sharia law and is used primarily to punish womenbasically he is calling for the united state to be governed by christian sharia law you know the same sharia law that conservative freak out about and pas law againstanderson concluded his sermon by claiming that the death penalty deters crime and shrugged at the notion that people don t want their loved one executed just because they had an extramarital affairin country where adultery is still a capital crime it s not an everyday occurrence and usually end up in the news just a capital punishment is a strong deterrent against murder it ha the same effect on other crimestelling u that we would not want people we know and care about to be put to death is a straw man argument we don t want our friend and family to be convicted of murder either but they probably won t kill anyone so we don t worry about it when the child of israel committed adultery they knew the risk going inhowever it s worth noting that multiple study by researcher have been unable to prove that the death penalty is a deterrent to crimethe bottom line is that is that anderson is a maniac who want to bathe america in blood in order to create what he considers the perfect christian utopia million upon million of american would be murdered in this endeavor if anderson had his way and that is precisely why conservative christian can never be allowed to have power in our governmentfeatured image screenshot
Title_Text: conservative christian preacher want government to execute adulterer

Text: reuters  after month of internal discord republican in the u house of representative on wednesday were still trying to craft a bill to overhaul the affordable care act known a obamacare a law they have been attacking since it wa enacted in two attempt in recent week to pas an overhaul bill have collapsed in confusion with conservative pushing for a more complete repeal and moderate keen to avoid going too far for fear of angering their constituent obamacare brought health insurance coverage to million of american the first version of the republican bill known a the american health care act or ahca would have left million more american without coverage according to an estimate by nonpartisan congressional researcher the house ha recently added two amendment to the ahca to try to appease both conservative and moderate here are the latest version of the bills main provision the republican plan would maintain some of obamacares most popular provision it would allow young adult to stay on their parents health plan until age and it would ban insurer from setting a lifetime dollar limit on coverage an amendment introduced by moderate republican representative tom macarthur would let state opt out of obamacares mandate that insurer charge sick and healthy people the same rate it would also allow state to opt out of obamacares requirement that insurer cover essential health benefit such a maternity care and mental health treatment the measure would provide state with  billion largely to fund highrisk pool to provide insurance to the sickest patient an amendment added wednesday would provide another  billion over five year to help those with preexisting condition pay for health insurance the bill would let insurer mark up premium by percent for those who have a lapse in insurance coverage of about two month or more insurer won another provision they had long sought the ability to charge older american up to five time more than young people under obamacare they could only charge up to three time more the republican want to end in obamacares incomebased tax credit that help lowincome people buy insurance these would be replaced with agebased tax credit ranging from  to  per year that would be capped at upperincome level while obamacares credit gave more help to those with lower income the republican plan would be largely agebased the republican bill would abolish most obamacare tax including on medical device health insurance premium indoor tanning salon prescription medication and highcost employerprovided insurance known a cadillac plan those tax paid for obamacare republican have not said how they would pay for the part of the law they want to keep the bill would also repeal the obamacare financial penalty for the tax year for not purchasing insurance a well a a surtax on investment income earned by upperincome american it would repeal the mandate that larger employer must offer insurance to their employee under obamacare more than state including about a dozen republican state expanded the medicaid government health insurance program for the poor about half of obamacare enrollee obtained insurance through the expansion the bill would allow the medicaid expansion to continue until january providing state chose not to expand after that date expansion would end and medicaid funding would be capped on a perperson basis state medicaid plan would no longer have to cover some obamacaremandated essential health benefit fulfilling a republican promise to return more control to the state
Title_Text: factbox republican obamacare plan would dump medicaid expansion tax

Text: manila reuters  the philippine expressed concern on monday about china s testing of a massive dredging ship saying it would track it activity closely despite beijing s assurance it would not develop area where it ha competing claim with manila china which ha poured billion of dollar into building artificial island to strengthen it sovereignty claim across most of the south china sea ha started testing a new ship designed to boost it land reclamation capability the mere presence is a little bit concerning defence secretary delfin lorenzana told reporter where it is going we do not know military official said the ship tian kun had a deck the size of nine basketball court and would become asia s largest dredging vessel china claim almost the entire south china sea through which more than  trillion of seaborne trade pass each year brunei malaysia the philippine taiwan and vietnam also have conflicting claim in the area lorenzana said troop deployed on nine philippineclaimed feature in the south china sea had been ordered to monitor the movement of chinese navy coastguard and fishing boat in the spratly island we are constantly monitoring the movement of the ship he added we have also our air patrol going regularly so we will be able to monitor movement of this socalled very big dredger ship the testing of the dredger come ahead of two major international meeting in vietnam and the philippine this week and the next set to be attended by china and the united state in august the foreign minister of southeast asia and china adopted a negotiating framework for a code of conduct in the south china sea a move they hailed a progress but which critic saw a a tactic to buy china time to consolidate it maritime power all party say the framework is only an outline for how the code will be established but critic say the failure to outline a an initial objective the need to make the code legally binding and enforceable or have a dispute resolution mechanism raise doubt about how effective it will be in beijing chinese assistant foreign minister chen xiaodong said talk on the framework had achieved important progress and there would be result at the manila summit of southeast asian nation attended by chinese premier li keqiang whether the code is binding or how it would be binding and what the code look like in it final form depends on the outcome of the talk between china and the association of southeast asian nation chen told reporter it can t be decided by a single party chinese president xi jinping will attend the other meeting of asiapacific leader in vietnam
Title_Text: philippine to keep wary eye on new chinese dredger

Text: donald trump ha been notorious for touting poll number that look good for him during the campaign whenever he d careen into one of his many controversy and the number dipped he and his mouthpiece would reference junk poll to show that people still loved the donald of course any poll that can be voted in a million time online is bogus however factual data isn t bogus and that data doe not look good for trump right now in fact a new poll show that way more american want trump removed from office than the number of people who think he s doing a good jobaccording to new data from public policy polling percent of american see donald trump a the incompetent dangerously unstable buffoon he is and want him impeached posthaste on the other hand just percent believe he is actually a good president that isn t surprising after all the slavish blind devotion of his mouthbreathing base ha not been a secret for nigh on two year nowon the other side of said insane base there were march around the nation for the holiday weekend demanding trump s removal and protesting his administration and their policy further more democrat are becoming emboldened by these number and are actually drafting article of impeachment one such democrat is rep brad sherman dca speaking in his home district in los angeles rep sherman egged the antitrump crowd on saying we have to act now to protect our country from abuse of power and impulsive ignorant incompetence at this declaration the crowd borrowed from trump s own base and shouted back lock him up of course there s one little difference between trump s base and the democrat there s plenty of evidence to suggest that trump is a criminal while there is absolutely none to suggest the same about hillary clintonof course there will be no impeachment until the democrat take back the house of representative and there will be no invocation of the th amendment to remove and unfit president from office for the sake of the nation therefore we must turn out in and make sure we control both chamber of congress that s the only way we get real credible congressional investigation into the russia ordeal and it s the only way we get rid of trump and his criminal administrationfeatured image via chip somodevillagetty image
Title_Text: new poll way more american want trump impeached than approve of the job he is doing

Text: beijing reuters  the situation on the korean peninsula is at a very dangerous stage chinese foreign minister wang yi told counterpart from the brics group of nation china s foreign ministry said on tuesday the urgent task is to prevent north korea s nuclear and missile program progressing and to avoid a further escalation in tension and to especially prevent resorting to arm wang said speaking in new york on the sideline of a united nation meeting
Title_Text: china say situation on korean peninsula very dangerous
