Text: the gop ha been impatiently waiting for the moment that presumptive democratic nominee hillary clinton would be indicted over the issue of her email and today they finally got their little heart brokenearlier on tuesday fbi director james comey made the announcement that no conservative wanted to hear that after a lengthy investigation into clinton s controversial government email the fbi would not be recommending that the former secretary of state be charged with a crime this make it truly a sad day for the gop and you can tell how bitter they are just by the interview they re givingafter the fbi made that announcement republican nation committee rnc chief strategist sean spicer wa in an embarrassing amount of denial when he went on cnn and insisted that the fbi had issued a clear indictment of clinton s judgement despite the fact that it didn t recommend a formal indictment at all spicer got so worked up over the fact the clinton wouldn t be charged that he completely lost it and threw a bit of a temper tantrum over the investigation s result spicer said these finding of the fbi are a clear indictment on hillary clinton s judgement and fitness to be president the office that she s seeking requires the highest level of judgement making sure that our nation s secret are protected cnn host kate bolduan reminded spicer that the fbi had said that no reasonable prosecutor would even think about bringing charge against clintonnot fully understanding the irony that his party s candidate is the most unfit presidential candidate of our time spicer snapped back this is someone who want to be president kate bolduan then cornered spicer and asked him if he trusted the fbi to conduct a fair investigation and the rnc strategist had to admit that he did spicer confessed well it sound like it the finding that they made are very clear that she did exhibit poor judgement that it wa reckless by their account and it is not their job to decide whether it is formally prosecuted john berman jumped in to point out that trump had also disagreed with the fbi s assessment calling it very very unfair spicer decided to defend trump and accuse clinton of rigging the system i m not a lawyer if she had followed the law and used a state department account or even used a private system like the director pointed out like gmail then this wouldn t be a problem she chose to set up a system for herself around the rule that were established for everybody else for a reason and that reason is she didn t want people to know what she wa doingany other employee that work at the state department that did what she did would have their security clearance pulled and would be facing charge this is absolutely ridiculous bolduan took another opportunity to make a complete idiot out of spicer when she followed up with this question donald trump in his tweet called this very very unfair do you think the investigation wa unfair or do you agree with your candidate who think it wa very very unfair all spicer could do wa reluctantly say that the investigation wa fair but that he still agreed with trump that clinton should be prosecuted he lamented the system clearly look like when the fbi turned it over the department of justice ha already seemed to make it very clear what they re going to do with this you can watch spicer get all worked up in the interview belowfeatured image is a screenshot
Title_Text: rnc chief strategist ha a full meltdown on cnn after hearing fbi wont indict hillary video

Text: you re gonna be so proud of your country we re gonna win so much we re gonna win at every level we re gonna win so much you may even get tired of winning you may even get so tired of winning and you ll say please please it s too much winning we can t take it anymore mr president it s too much candidate donald trump may president trump tweeted about an exciting new opportunity for u cattle farmer a china lift year ban on american beef import after year u beef hit chinese market trade deal an exciting opportunity for agriculture during his senate hearing to be confirmed a ambassador to china thengov terry branstad said he would prefer to serve iowa beef not cut from australia at the u embassy therehe won t get that wish yet but the prime rib he slice into friday when joined in beijing by u department of agriculture secretary sonny perdue and chinese government official to ceremonially mark the return of u beef to china after a year ban will be from closer to home nebraskathe meat shipped last week by a south omaha meatpacker wa reported to be the first shipment of u beef to china since after official sealed a longsought trade deal this month this is a big deal it s definitely very positive news said lee schulz an iowa state university extension livestock economistbut schulz cautioned overcoming the political hurdle that had prevented u beef export to china over fear associated with mad cow disease are only the first step it will be some time before american beef becomes it s what s for dinner for nearly billion chinesehe described the chinese market for u beef a in it infancy in term of it impact on iowa and u producer and processorsthe market today is very different from according to chris freland executive director of the iowa beef industry council still what she saw while visiting china earlier this year make her believe u beef producer have an exciting opportunity to move into the chinese market there are a lot of people there and a rising middle class who can add beef to their diet she saidchina is projected to become the largest beef market in the world and a major destination for u beef product according to american farm bureau federation economist katelyn mccullock adding to the market potential is china s changing taste mccullock saidin much of the market there wa offal tongue kidney and liver for example today there ha been demand for highervalue muscle cut or steakbefore china closed the door on u beef it imported  million worth of beef annually with the united state supplying percent of that today china import about  billion worth of beef every year last year chinese beef import totaled ton and demand is expected to increase ninefold in four year so if we can even have a portion of that coming back for iowa producer that s a celebration for producer profitability freland saidfor entire story the gazette
Title_Text: more winning after year ban china welcome back u beef to their multibilliondollar market

Text: madrid reuters  catalonia s separatist leader carles puigdemont wa on track to regain the leadership of spain s northeastern region after preliminary result showed a coalition of secessionist party winning a majority in regional election puigdemont went on selfimposed exile in brussels in october after conservative prime minister mariano rajoy sacked his regional government when they organized an illegal independence referendum and later proclaimed a catalan republic the separatist party were seen getting a total of seat in the seat assembly official data with percent of the vote counted showed puigdemont s junts per catalunya together for catalonia were seen winning of those seat ahead of two other separatist party final result are expected after midnight
Title_Text: former catalan leader puigdemont seen regaining regional leadership

Text: trump ha wasted absolutely no time letting some of our ally know what he really think of them on a phone call with australian prime minister malcolm turnbull he went off about a pledge the u made to accept refugee from a detention center in australia there are also rumor floating around that he threatened to send troop to mexico if they don t get a handle on the border situationwhile speaking to mexico s president enrique pena nieto last friday he allegedly told nieto to control mexico s bad hombre or else we would send troop in to do it for him the associated press first reported on an excerpt someone in the white house gave them of the phone call s transcript you have a bunch of bad hombre down there trump told pena nieto according to the excerpt given to ap you aren t doing enough to stop them i think your military is scared our military isn t so i just might send them down to take care of it both the white house and pena nieto are denying that the call went this way but a mexican news outlet published something similar to what the ap ha and even said trump wa humiliating pena nieto if it is indeed true that trump said these word then he seriously just cut down and threatened one of our neighbor with military action or worse invasion which would be the next logical step seeing a how he s done everything else he can to piss mexico offwith australian prime minister turnbull who wa trying to confirm that we d honor our pledge to accept refugee trump said this is the worst deal ever and accused turnbull of trying to send the next boston bomber to u he also blasted turnbull about how the deal wa going to kill him politically because that s really what matter to him actually doing his job mehaustralia is one of our closest ally and trump not only tore into him it sound like he hung up on turnbull too well before the call wa scheduled to endwe ve fought alongside and received support from australia in the middle east they are not an ally we want to alienate and yet here trump is working a hard a he possibly can to do just that until they fall in line with what he wantshe also spent part of the call bragging about his inauguration number really he s still not over thatanybody who thought trump would calm the hell down after winning the election and actually treat foreign leader with the dignity and respect of everyone else wa sorely mistaken he us twitter to berate anyone with whom he ha a disagreement why would he treat foreign leader any differentlywhen he s finished bullying the entire world we won t have any ally left except Text: ankara reuters  turkey cautioned it citizen on saturday to take care when traveling to germany citing what it said wa an upswing in antiturkish sentiment ahead of a german national election later this month the advisory is likely to further exacerbate tension between the two nato ally whose tie have soured following last year s failed coup against turkish president tayyip erdogan and his subsequent crackdown on alleged coup supporter the political leadership campaign in germany are based on antiturkey sentiment and preventing our country s eu membership the political atmosphere ha actually been under the effect of farright and even racist rhetoric for some time turkey s foreign mininstry said in a statement last weekend german chancellor angela merkel said during a televised election debate that she would seek an end to turkey s membership talk with the european union in an apparent shift of her position that infuriated ankara merkel whose conservative christian democrat cdu have long been skeptical about turkey s eu ambition is expected to win a fourth term in office in germany s sept election turkish citizen who live in or who plan to travel to germany should be cautious and act prudently in case of possible incident behavior or verbal assault of xenophobia and racism the foreign ministry said the advisory mark a reversal of role earlier this year germany warned it own citizen traveling to turkey about increased tension and protest ahead of a turkish referendum on april which considerably expanded erdogan s power merkel and other eu leader have strongly criticized erdogan s action since the failed coup saying his purge of turkey s state institution and armed force amount to a deliberate attempt to stifle criticism more than people have been detained and suspended in the crackdown including journalist and opposition figure some german national have also been targeted turkey say the purge are necessary given the extent of the security threat it face
Title_Text: turkey caution citizen about travel to antiturkey germany

Text: washington reuters  the obama administration will announce a soon a friday an overhaul of how the united state manages coal development on federal land according to government and conservationist source in a further move to confront climate change in his state of the union address on tuesday democratic president barack obama said he would change the way we manage our oil and coal resource so that they better reflect the cost they impose on taxpayer and our planet the new plan will require federal official when weighing land use decision to consider how mining and burning coal add to greenhouse gas pollution said environmental group source familiar with the plan the overhaul also will aim to maximize return for taxpayer by updating royalty rate when mining company pull coal from federal land said the source were working to have this tomorrow said a bureau of land management official who declined to give detail on the administrations plan environmentalist have urged the white house to freeze new coal lease on federal land until it account for how that fossil fuel development contributes to climate change a moratorium on coal lease could be part of the reform said environmental source familiar with the effort coal lease are often awarded without a competitive bidding process frequently going to a single bidder and official can undervalue the fuel heading to market the nonpartisan government accountability office ha concluded public land should be developed in the public interest but taxpayer have been shortchanged for decades said theo spencer of the natural resource defense council an environmental group the energy information administration say roughly percent of u coal production occurs on federal land the coal industry had been battered in recent year by competition from cheap natural gas and cleanair regulation that have raised cost for burning the black rock this week arch coal one of the nations largest coal company filed for bankruptcy  the latest mining company to seek protection from creditor in the current downturn the national mining association wa not immediately available for comment
Title_Text: white house to revamp u coal program a soon a friday source

to desecrate that memorial to add even more fuel to the fire soloman wa released from custody on wednesday with a court datehuffington post add that william miller a spokesman for the u attorney s Text: washington reuters  republican in the u house of representative are pushing to hold consumer financial protection bureau director richard cordray in contempt of congress for refusing to respond sufficiently to congressional subpoena a report released on friday by republican staff of the house financial service committee argued there wa ample evidence to hold cordray in contempt because of his alleged failure to fully comply with subpoena request republican on the panel have been fiercely critical of the cfpbs regulatory work the report marked the most direct threat yet to pursue legal action against cordray who wa appointed by democratic former president barack obama after the agency wa created under the doddfrank financial reform law the subpoena sought record tied to the cfpbs successful effort to ban mandatory arbitration clause from financial contract including communication between cfpb staff and meeting with outside group the ban hailed by consumer advocate wa finalized in july but republican in congress are working to overturn it republican demanded the document a part of a probe into rulemaking and whether the rule regarding mandatory arbitration clause were written in a proper fashion mandatory arbitration clause require consumer to resolve any dispute through arbitration instead of joining together in classaction lawsuit republican staff on the house banking panel had suggested in june that cordray could face contempt charge for insufficient response to congressional query but fridays report took the conflict to new height a committee spokesman jeff emerson did not immediately respond to a request for comment on whether the panel would actually seek contempt charge in response to the report cfpb spokeswoman jen howard said the agency had already produced thousands of pages in response to the request and wa endeavoring to do more we will continue our effort to understand how we can respond to the committee in a satisfactory manner she said in a statement to reuters in the past cordray ha criticized similar panel subpoena a overly broad and confusing representative jeb hensarling who chair the committee ha been one of cordrays outspoken critic and demanded in the past that republican president donald trump fire him a director democrat have rallied behind cordray and the agency since it creation the republican attack on director cordray and the consumer bureau are entirely baseless and there are no ground at all for them to hold the director in contempt maxine water the top democrat on hensarlings panel said in a statement to reuters
Title_Text: house republican push for contempt charge against cfpb director

Text: reuters  u democratic presidential candidate hillary clinton would be happy to participate in an additional debate beyond those already planned if the other candidate agree a spokeswoman for clinton said on tuesday clinton is campaigning in iowa ahead of state caucus there on monday that mark the first contest in the nomination race for the nov presidential election reporting by amanda becker in chicago editing by sandra maler sap is the sponsor of this coverage which is independently produced by the staff of reuters news agency
Title_Text: clinton happy to join extra debate if other candidate agree spokeswoman

Text: reuters  texas governor greg abbott on friday gave  million to houston to help cover cost related to hurricane harvey a move the mayor said will allow the city to avoid a temporary property tax hike that wa up for a city council vote in october mayor sylvester turner who accepted the money from the republican governor at a city hall press conference said he will pull his proposal for a oneyear tax increase to cover the citys share of debris removal expense and for insurancerelated payment part of houston suffered severe wind and flood damage after hurricane harvey made landfall on aug it wa the strongest hurricane to hit texas in more than year earlier this week abbott rejected turners request for the state to immediately tap it  billion rainy day fund to aid it largest city on friday the governor said he had the flexibility to withdraw  million from a state disaster relief fund for houston this looked like the best solution at this point abbott told reporter he added that once the state get a handle on total hurricane expense the texas legislature will consider tapping into the rainy day fund when it next regular session begin in january or sooner in a special session
Title_Text: texas give houston  million for hurricane harvey cost

Text: there are thing that with all the excitement going on at both the rnc and the dnc are getting overlooked right now however representative hank johnson dga spoke on one such issue that need much closer attention that of illegal israeli settlement in palestine johnson ha a choice word for the settler and it s bangon target there ha been a steady stream of israeli settler almost like termite can get into a residence and eat before you know that you ve been eaten up and you fall in on yourself and they are for the past several decade israel ha been eating up palestinian land and treating palestinian citizen like subject and much worse while their leader bibi netanyahu say israel must occupy all the land in order to ensure their own safety there s no regard for the people already living there termite stream in and eat the wood of our house israeli stream in and eat the house of palestinian an apt description if there ever wa onejohnson went on to say you see one home after another being appropriated by jewish people who come in to claim that land just because somebody did not spend the night therethe home their palestinian ancestor lived in for generation becomes an israeli home and a flag go up the palestinian are barred from flying flag in their own neighborhood nobody in the u would tolerate being told they can t fly the american flag nobody but we ll gladly call a country that doe this and so much more with glee an ally disgustingwhy is this so important right now don t we have more important thing to worry aboutthe answer to those question is yes and no it isn t just important because we re busy supporting an apartheid state or because of israel s gross human right violation it isn t just because we shouldn t support them if we re going to call ourselves the bastion of freedom we think we are it s also because our support of israel ha poisoned many of our leader to the point where they actually want to criminalize freedom of expressionthe bd movement which stand for boycott divest and sanction is under attack here because of our blind love for israel staunch supporter of israel have been quietly criminalizing that movement despite the fact that this very same thing helped bring about an end to apartheid in south africaboycotts are also a staple of american protest yet the proisrael crowd would destroy freedom of expression in dogged support of an ally that maybe shouldn t be an ally staunch defender of the constitution would tear up the first amendment before denouncing israel it s sickisrael us u sure some may say that we need them for intelligence on more hostile middle eastern nation when a lot of our support is because of sheldon adelson his money and aipac so we send billion of dollar worth of weapon and equipment to them for which we the taxpayer are on the hook and pretend not to see their relentless and violent crawl across palestinewe wouldn t turn a blind eye to termite relentless crawl through the structure of our house thoughben cohen of the daily banter put it just a perfectly a rep johnson when he said israeli routinely claim that they have to defend themselves against palestinian attack but occupying someone else s land is an attack itself so it is impossible to defend yourself if you are the person attacking so can we please stop pretending israel is being attacked a of march half of israeli jew actually supported ethnic cleansing we have white supremacist here that support the same thing we fought a war in bosnia over ethnic cleansing it s only something we must stop when we hear call for ethnic cleansing coming from people and place we don t like israel they ve brainwashed u into thinking they re always the victimour growing problem with islamophobia isn t helping eithergoing into the final stretch of this election cycle israel isn t just a distant foreign policy issue something to be dealt with maybe after the new president and congress take office in january israel s atrocious and disgusting policy toward palestine impact u in a direct way because our support of them could cost u our own freedom at least we have some leader here who understand thatfeatured image by alex wonggetty image
Title_Text: dem rep hit one of our most hypocritical ally hard with a single potent word

Text: it s becoming increasingly clear that when tlc decided to promote a story of the fundamentalist christian duggar family they weren t just idolizing rightwing antigay bigot they were legitimizing a toxic cult that for year had lived in the shadow and now thanks to increasing exposure ha begun to fester and grow quiverfull the fundamentalist movement run by a man named vaughn ohlman work to silence and control woman in way that wouldn t seem entirely out of place in region controlled by the taliban it pitch is that woman should be subservient to their husband and relied on primarily for household chore and churning out baby the full quiver in the name is a nod to the number of child each family is encouraged to have a many a possiblebut if mature woman are reduced to home and babymakers then girl are seen a less than thatenter ohlman s brand new retreat designed specifically for christian dad to meet up and plan who they will give their daughter to particularly troublesome one who may be nearly out of high school and haven t found a husband yetcalled the get them married retreat the group s announcement is deeply disturbingwe at let them marry ministry are excited to finally be able to announce our plan for the get them married retreat we ve set our plan and are accepting application pending sufficient signups and barring unforeseen contingency we will be hosting the first get them married retreat this fall unforeseen contingency might include the fact that nowhere in let them marry ministry lengthy post is the consent of the child ever acknowledged let them marry really mean let u marry them off this is made explicit in the rule for the purpose of this conference we ask that a young man who is interested in a young woman approach her father mother brother etc before approaching her in the case where he is interested in a young woman who is not accompanied we ask that the young man speak privately to one of the retreat staff membersas raw story point out ohlman is very big on the idea that child should be married a soon a possible his criterion for when a girl is ready is between the age of and they claim they take a hard stand against yearolds getting married that is their red line the specific are even more disturbinghow much will this retreat set you back depends if you want a family sized cottage be prepared to spend around  if you just want to send your older marriageable kid to a genderspecific bunkhouse with other older marriageable kid they can stay for a low a that get you a bed meal and a schedule full of lecture activity and what they call intentionally blank spot for networking so the next time you come across a duggar and yes they re back on tlc despite everything remember that the family value and longing to return to the good old day mean this sort of theocratic nightmare they have a very specific vision and it s not prettyupdate the salvation army which had originally agreed to host the retreat on their property in wichita kansa ha reportedly backed and quite possibly ran away from this incoming disaster the group will now have to find a new place to hold their child marriage swapfeatured image via youtube screengrab
Title_Text: duggarlinked ministry building a retreat where christian dad can trade their teen daughter

Text: kuwait reuters  an annual summit of gulf arab head of state will convene in kuwait on dec and gulf official said on wednesday despite an ongoing dispute between some member of group a rift between the gulf cooperation council member saudi arabia bahrain and the united arab emirate uae on one side and qatar on the other ha put this year s annual meeting in doubt a senior kuwaiti official confirmed on wednesday that the meeting would take place on dec and but said the level of representation wa not clear yet two gulf diplomat also said kuwait which had led unsuccessful mediation effort between the two side would try again to use the meeting to resolve the rift the crisis which began in june revolve around allegation by saudi arabia the uae bahrain and egypt that qatar support terrorism a charge doha denies qatar say the four country are trying to force doha to fall in line with their own foreign policy view the usallied council wa founded in a a bulwark against bigger neighbor iran and iraq bahrain said last month it will not attend the summit if qatar doe not change it policy and qatar should have it membership in the sixnation group suspended
Title_Text: gcc summit to go ahead despite qatar row diplomat say

Text: washington reuters  the u house of representative passed a  billion defense policy bill on tuesday backing president donald trumps call for a bigger stronger military but failing to decide how to fund the massive spending increase the republicancontrolled house voted  for the annual national defense authorization act or ndaa which authorizes the level of defense spending and set policy controlling how the money is spent but the legislation defies spending cap set in the budget control act and there is no clear plan from congress on how to provide the money for the pentagon the ndaa authorizes  billion in base defense spending for such thing a buying weapon and paying the troop well above the  billion allowed under the previous legislation the ndaa also includes provision such a an increase in active troop level by more than and state that climate change is a national security threat the defense policy bill will become law if it pass the republicancontrolled senate and is signed into law by the president a expected but spending will nonetheless be cut automatically if congress cannot come up with a deal to resolve the gap in funding representative adam smith the top democrat on the house armed service committee said congress failure to address the issue make life more difficult for military leader because they cannot plan in advance this defense bill is  billion over the budget cap so if we dont eliminate or raise the budget cap that additional money will go away and leave u once again in the land of uncertainty for the department of defense he said representative mac thornberry the house armed service committees republican chairman said congress needed to pas an appropriation bill to allow for the  billion securing those appropriation must be congress top priority before the year ends thornberry said in a statement the ndaa also includes about  billion in special war funding which is exempt from the socalled sequestration cap the measure passed by the house on tuesday is a compromise reached by house and senate negotiator between separate version of the bill approved in the chamber earlier this year however a budget fight is expected because senate democrat may not agree to big increase in fund for the military if spending cap on nondefense program are not also eased the republican majority in the senate is so small that most legislation cannot pas without some democratic vote
Title_Text: house back  billion defense policy bill funding uncertain

Text: reuters  puerto ricos federally appointed financial oversight board said on friday it will institute a twoday per month work furlough for government employee but a defiant governor ricardo rossello rejected the measure out of hand the plan which originally envisioned a fourday per month furlough is set to begin on sept and last throughout the fiscal year in an effort to achieve  million in saving it excludes frontline law enforcement personnel rossello openly challenged the boards authority to impose the belttightening measure on the bankrupt u territory however the furlough are part of the boards effort to implement fiscal change and achieve  million in saving for rightsizing the government this fiscal year and ensuring the islands longterm economic viability natalie jaresko executive director of the oversight board said the government had offered a number of idea for achieving saving speaking during a webcast of the boards ninth public meeting she said the government had fallen short of meeting required moneysaving goal however furlough could be scaled back or eliminated early if sufficient saving are achieved per the governments fiscal plan the board said rossello in a televised address late on friday said the furlough were unjustified and unnecessary he also highlighted in a statement released by his office public sector cutback and budgetary saving that resulted in higher than expected financial reserve i do not accept nor will i execute the furlough submitted today by the financial oversight and management board rossello said the board wa created by the federal puerto rico rescue law known a promesa rossello said section of the promesa law mean the board can make recommendations but not impose change furlough would represent a  million hit to the economy in the current fiscal year he said puerto ricos treasury secretary raul maldonado told reuters on wednesday that preliminary tax collection in july the first month of fiscal were running  million to  million ahead of forecast but board member andrew biggs spoke of the commonwealths current state of affair in stark term during the meeting the simple fact is that the government of puerto rico ha run out of money he said he added that the difficult step of raising tax and cutting spending were something that the board and government alike have no choice but to do puerto rico is seeking to restructure roughly  billion in debt and another near  billion in unfunded pension liability while it struggle with the flight of resident to the u mainland and a percent poverty rate reform of the pension system were among the measure discussed at fridays board meeting they would include a percent cut in benefit for an adrift in debt interactive click here for a graphic on the mutual fund puerto rico bankruptcy tangle click here
Title_Text: puerto rico oversight board order furlough governor defiant

Text: named for founding father elbridge gerry who signed a law in a massachusetts governor creating distorted voting district in shape such a that of a salamander gerrymandering ha been the primary tool of the republican party to guarantee and keep power in recent yearsdespite getting more vote from the american people democrat still wound up with fewer seat in the house of representative than republican republican even gained dominance over state legislature in ohio florida wisconsin and several others all thanks to deviously drawn voting district that weaken the impact of democratic voter while giving a total advantage to the goptwelve year ago the supreme court had difficulty deciding whether district in pennsylvania had been gerrymandered or not leading justice anthony kennedy to throw his hand up in frustration that the court could not grant relief to those who were screwed over by conniving lawmaker but he did call for seeking a remedy that would nail lawmaker to the wall for gerrymandering and now wisconsin republican and republican across the nation are panicking because a pair of academic scholar have finally found a solution and it all ha to do with the nemesis of conservative everywhere mathaccording to thinkprogressin a paper published in the university of chicago law review last year law professor nicholas stephanopoulos and political scientist eric mcghee propose a mathematical formula judge can use to identify suspect map an objective test that can be used by judge across the country to sort suspect map from permissible one a hundred different judge can examine the same map and provided that they are all skilled at arithmetic all reach identical conclusion about which map fall within an acceptable range and which one should be presumed to be unconstitutionalin other word republican are fcked if the supreme court adopts the formula to make ruling in gerrymandering caseswisconsin republican have launched legal attack against the formula but a three judge panel that includes two republicanappointed judge have dismissed attempt by gop lawyer to have the case killed before a full trial proceedsif the formula is successfully adopted by the judicial branch a the standard of determining if lawmaker unfairly drew gerrymandered district it could mark a critical turning point that give democrat a chance to compete fairly in red state again and that could devastate the republican party for many election to conservative lawmaker will have to learn how to campaign competitively instead of relying on cheating to win featured image via baystateconservativenewscom
Title_Text: bad news republican two scholar figured out how to defeat your gerrymandering

Text: washington reuters  u democrat took to the senate floor on monday to throw a spotlight on behindthescenes effort by the republican majority to repeal former president barack obamas healthcare law known a obamacare in a series of floor motion inquiry and lengthy speech democrat criticized the closeddoor meeting that republican have been holding to craft a replacement for obamacare formally known a the affordable care act they called for open committee hearing and more time to consider the bill before a senate vote which republican say could come in the next two week although a draft bill ha yet to emerge publicly lacking the vote to derail or change the republican process the maneuver by the democratic minority seemed more aimed at highlighting republican effort on a controversial issue poll have said that a majority of american disapprove of the obamacare replacement that ha passed the house of representative and that senate republican are now considering senate democratic leader chuck schumer said that the closeddoor republican meeting on healthcare amounted to the most glaring departure from normal legislative procedure that i have ever seen republicans are writing their healthcare bill under the cover of darkness because they are ashamed of it schumer charged the resulting legislation would likely throw million out of health insurance he said while granting a big fat tax break for the wealthiest among us senator are not obligated to hold meeting in the open but democrat pointed out that there were lengthy committee meeting and many day of floor debate on obamacare before it passed in several democrat moved for the healthcare legislation to be referred to senate committee for hearing but senate majority leader mitch mcconnell refused mcconnell said all republican senator have been involved to some degree in healthcare meeting and that democrat would have a chance to amend the legislation they produce once it is brought to the senate floor were going to have a meeting on the senate floor all hundred of u with an unlimited amendment process mcconnell said so there will be no failure of opportunity senate republican leader would like a vote on healthcare legislation in july before the july recess if possible but republican have struggled to coalesce around a bill with moderate and conservative pushing in different direction senate republican also face pressure from the right in the house conservative have written to mcconnell to express concern about report that say the senate may water down the house bill
Title_Text: democrat protest senate republican healthcare secrecy

Text: donald trump s conflict of interest were of massive concern for many american and rightfully so there is absolutely no doubt that trump ha been trying to profit off of his presidency and now there s proofthis year trump s company turned  million in profit at trump international hotel which is far higher than expectation the trump organization actually predicted it would lose  million in the first four month of trump s presidency but the business is instead boasting a percent improvement over what the trump family projected when the hotel wa opened in the fallat the center of these profit are member of trump s own cabinet who have either stayed or lived at the hotel the hotel is also frequently visited by trump s inner circle and republican leader who are willing to spend big money and food and beverage at the hotel s bar and restaurant currently the hotel is charging guest an average of  a night which is percent higher than the company s expectation this make the hotel the most expensive in the city many others such a four season and willard are only charging  per nightit s no wonder that several ethic expert and democrat have objected to this arrangement rep peter a defazio dore called the government s lease a highly unethical arrangement he said what make all of this particularly galling is that we now have the unprecedented situation where the president of the united state is both the landlord and tenant of a federal building trump ha made absolutely no effort to address ethical concern about his business even though he had originally promised to do so when he won the electiontrump continues to be involved in his business and continues to profit off of them already he ha been sued by government watchdog group and state attorney general over these business practice however his behavior clearly show that he doesn t care trump ha only been in office for a few month and he s already spent day at his property and continues to host dinner that look more like promotion than anything else what trump is doing is beyond unethical and it must be stoppedfeatured image via tom penningtongetty image
Title_Text: trumps dc hotel raised price and made million in month off his presidency

Text: joe scarborough is furious about donald trump and he is demanding that republican take action before our national security is seriously compromisedthroughout the campaign trump repeatedly criticized hillary clinton for using a personal server to read email containing sensitive information but while clinton s email were never hacked or read by anyone but her trump is going around bragging about highly classified intelligence and sharing it with the russiansas we learned on monday trump literally leaked the intel during an oval office meeting with russian official last week the same meeting that american journalist were barred from covering while russia state medium wa given free accessin short trump is a hypocrite who put the security of our nation in jeopardy because he is incapable of keeping his mouth shutso it wa not a surprise that joe scarborough a former republican congressman exploded in anger on tuesday morning over what should be considered yet another russia scandalthe morning joe host delivered a scathing statement denouncing trump and called upon the current republican in congress to hold him accountable instead of cowardly ignoring a major breach of protocol it s not enough for mitch mcconnell and conservative talk show host to simply attack the lamestream medium or nancy pelosi scarborough said american will not buy that that s a cowardly act and it s intended to hold onto a much of the audience that they can hold onto without embracing trump at this point if you do not call him out for risking american life and doing thing that most intel people i spoke with last night said will lead to the death of american in the future or lead to the death of critical ally in this counterinsurgency battle against isi then you are doing a grave disservice to your voter or to your listener or to the united state of america there is no middle ground here anymore there just isn t this is about national security in the united state of america indeed trump s blabbing put an asset at risk one who is familiar with the inner working of isi a terrorist organization that want to kill americansaccording to the washington posttrump s disclosure jeopardized a critical source of intelligence on the islamic statethe information the president relayed had been provided by a u partner through an intelligencesharing arrangement considered so sensitive that detail have been withheld from ally and tightly restricted even within the u government official saidthe partner had not given the united state permission to share the material with russia and official said trump s decision to do so endangers cooperation from an ally that ha access to the inner working of the islamic stateas a candidate trump claimed that he would protect this country from isi but by handing out classified information like it s candy he just put our nation at serious risk and violated the trust of an asset who is also now in serious jeopardy which mean our ability to get good intel on isi is compromisedin the end scarborough noted that donald trump just keep getting worse here s the problem the arc of this narrative keep getting worse people on the inside say he keep getting worse mentally keep getting worse this is not unfortunately a learning curve this is a man in decline here s the video via vidmeit s time for republican to admit that they screwed up by supporting donald trump it s time for them to oust this administration and schedule a new election so that the american people can put someone in the white house who is competent and not putin s puppet this farce ha gone on long enough and american life are more in danger the longer trump remains in officefeatured image via screenshot
Title_Text: watch morning joe rip trump for leaking classified info to russian demand accountability

Text: brussels reuters  the european union want britain to protect data it ha in storage on continental european after brexit and maintain ban on cheap imitation of locally branded eu produce like cognac or parma ham the proposal were among those made in further position paper published by the european commission s brexit negotiator on thursday for consultation with the other eu member state which offered a glimpse of thinking in brussels about future trade tie with britain despite an eu refusal to start talk the british government ha voiced frustration at the refusal of eu negotiator to open discussion on a future free trade pact until london make concession on element that must be settled to avoid legal chaos when britain leaf in march however in spelling out what it want to happen on some issue on brexit day the union is having to say what it want after that point  for example on the protection of personal data gathered on either side of the english channel under eu law or on trademark and other intellectual property the paper on data protection say britain may continue to use data gathered before exit day once it ha left the eu a long a it continues applying the same level of protection otherwise it must destroy the data britain will also lose access to eu network information system and database on the day it leaf the paper say that would include for example the information system underpinning the european health insurance card ehic scheme it make no mention of how data could continue to flow after brexit unlike the british paper which sought continued close collaboration with the eu on data protection once britain quits the bloc in a separate paper on intellectual property the eu said britain must have legislation in place to keep on protecting locally branded produce under the protected geographical indication pgi scheme the pgi system identifies product a originating from a particular region like cornish pasty or roquefort cheese meaning others cannot market imitation with that same name
Title_Text: eu tell britain to protect data or delete them after brexit

Text: tripoli reuters  former libyan prime minister ali zeidan ha been released after being abducted during a visit to the capital tripoli and held for nine day by an armed group a relative said on wednesday zeidan wa prime minister from  a period when libya slid deeper into the political turmoil and armed conflict that ha plagued the country since muammar gaddafi wa overthrown six year ago he ha since been living in germany with his family it is not clear why zeidan traveled to libya or why he wa abducted he wa being held by a group aligned with the unbacked government in tripoli though he faced no judicial charge a source said the unbacked government ha not commented on the case tripoli is controlled by a number of the armed group that have held power in the capital since some have been given semiofficial status by successive government but the group remain unaccountable and involved in criminal activity a lawyer for zeidan moussa aldoghali told france arabic tv channel that his client wa released without explanation and that he did not know the circumstance of his arrest and detention zeidan wa in good health and wa staying in a tripoli hotel following his release doghali said in october zeidan wa briefly abducted from a tripoli hotel room by an armed group allied to the parliament that sacked him just over a year later
Title_Text: former libyan prime minister freed after abduction in tripoli

Text: reuters  the communication director for u senate candidate roy moore ha resigned amid the alabama republicans effort to combat allegation of sexual misconduct that have roiled his campaign news of the departure of john rogers came a day after u president donald trump defended moore from accusation by multiple woman that moore pursued them a teenager when he wa in his s including one who ha said he initiated a sexual encounter with her when she wa moore ha denied any wrongdoing and ha accused the woman of conspiring with democrat medium outlet and establishment republican in an effort to tarnish his reputation reuters ha not independently confirmed any of the accusation as we all know campaign make change throughout the duration of the campaign campaign chairman bill armistead said in a statement on wednesday john made the decision to leave the campaign last friday  any representation to the contrary are false  and we wish him well fox news journalist dan gallo said on twitter that brett doster a moore campaign adviser told him unfortunately john just did not have the experience to deal with the press the last couple of week and weve had to make a change doster did not immediately respond to a request for comment moore a conservative christian and former alabama chief justice won the nomination for the dec special election in a hotly contested primary against incumbent senator luther strange strange who wa appointed to fill the senate vacancy left by jeff session now u attorney general wa backed by republican leader including the president while moores campaign attracted support from insurgent rightwing figure like former trump strategist steve bannon trump told reporter on tuesday however that he might yet campaign for moore who he said totally denies the misconduct allegation and that democratic nominee doug jones wa a liberal who should not be elected the presidents stance stood in contrast to the reaction from most republican in washington including senate majority leader mitch mcconnell who have called on moore to step aside jones released a campaign advertisement on wednesday featuring the nine woman who have accused moore of improper conduct they were girl when roy moore immorally pursued them the narrator say a photo of the woman a young girl flash on the screen will we make their abuser a u senator
Title_Text: u senate candidate moore spokesman resigns a allegation roil campaign

Text: washington reuters  democratic presidential frontrunner hillary clinton on tuesday released her personal financial disclosure form covering jan to the present with a call to republican donald trump to make available his income tax return the true test for donald trump is whether he will adhere to the precedent followed by every presidential candidate in the modern era and make his tax return available a hillary clinton ha done spokeswoman christina reynolds said in a statement clintons own disclosure form showed more than  million in royalty from her memoir hard choices trump earlier in the day announced that he had filed his personal financial disclosure to the federal election commission on monday
Title_Text: clinton release personal financial disclosure call on trump to release income tax

Text: a the presidential race heat up and the coffer start to pour in for a general election senate democrat are preparing to introduce a package of reform aimed at curbing once and for all the influence of big money in politics this is a liberal s dream come truespearheading the reform is senator chuck schumer of new york who is poised to become majority leader should the democrat take back the senate closely involved with schumer are sen tom udall sheldon whitehouse claire mccaskill and tammy baldwinincluded in the package is a constitutional amendment that would overturn citizen united and other supreme court decision that have allowed dark money to be injected into the political processthe disclose act would be included which would require outside anonymous group that spend money on political campaign to make the identity of their donor public no more dark money no more twice removed party no more secret in campaign financea new program in the package would replace the watered down virtually powerless fec with a five member independent agency that would tasked with enforcing rule an regulation in a fair and open mannerwhen it come to fixing america s broken election system democrat will include in the package the fair act which would effectively end partisan gerrymandering by requiring the state to establish independent commission to draw district line and not lawmaker who hold majoritiessenator claire mccaskill ha apparently bee working on a reform to increase voter turnout and participation which could mean a provision establishing automatic voter registrationaccording to msnbcthere are other effort to address voting right on capitol hill a group of democratic lawmaker earlier this week announced the formation of the voting right caucus which ha member all democrat they said they ll introduce legislation next month that would ban voter id law that force voter to pay an associated cost for instance by requiring them to obtain a birth certificate to get ida new constitutional amendment a new agency to replace the fec automatic voter registration and an end to gerrymandering this is a package every american should support considering the overwhelming majority of american including republican support getting money out of politics oppose dark money contribution and support fair election the gop ha no leverage to oppose any of these measuresbut they will such a package would surely fail a republican controlled senate and house but this is an election year and a year where democrat could make great stride if democrat show up at the poll in drove we could finally have an america free of big money in politicsif democrat are serious about political revolution they will need to come together to have a blue white house congress supreme court and state legislaturefeatured image via chip somodevillagetty image
Title_Text: senate dems to introduce constitutional amendment overturning citizen united

Text: goma democratic republic of congo reuters  suspected ugandan rebel killed at least tanzanian un peacekeeper and wounded others in a raid on a base in congo that un secretarygeneral antonio guterres on friday called the worst attack on the organization in recent history tanzania s president john magufuli said he wa shocked and saddened by the death which come amid rising violence against civilian the army and un troop in democratic republic of congo s eastern borderland the un chief said the attack constituted a war crime and called on congolese authority to investigate and swiftly bring the perpetrator to justice i want to express my outrage and utter heartbreak at last night s attack guterres told reporter at un headquarters in new york there must be no impunity for such assault here or anywhere else the united nation security council condemned the attack on friday and held a moment of silence for the victim state department spokeswoman heather nauert wrote on twitter that the united state wa appalled by the horrific attack un troop were still searching for three peacekeeper who went missing during the more than threehour firefight that broke out at dusk on thursday evening ian sinclair the director of the un operation and crisis centre said un official said they suspected militant from the allied democratic force adf staged the assault on the base in the town of semuliki in north kivu s beni territory the adf is an islamist rebel group that ha been active in the area congo s un mission monusco said it wa coordinating a joint response with the congolese army and evacuating wounded from the base five congolese soldier were also killed in the raid monusco said in a statement congo s army said only one of it soldier wa missing however while another had been injured adding that militant had been killed rival militia group control part of mineralrich eastern congo nearly a decade and a half after the official end of a  war in which million of people died mostly from hunger and disease the area ha been the scene of repeated massacre and at least people died in an ambush in october the government and un mission have blamed almost all the violence on the adf but un expert and independent analyst say other militia and element of congo s own army have also been involved in response to the growing unrest and in an effort to protect civilian the un s undersecretarygeneral for peacekeeping jeanpierre lacroix said monusco had stepped up it activity in the area they don t want u there and i think this attack is a response to our increasingly robust posture in that region he told reporter thursday s raid wa the third attack on a un base in eastern congo in recent month increased militia activity in the east and center of the country ha added to insecurity in congo this year amid political tension linked to president joseph kabila s refusal to step down when his mandate expired last december an election to replace kabila who ha ruled congo since his father s assassination in ha been repeatedly delayed and is now scheduled for december established in monusco is the united nation largest peacekeeping mission and had recorded fatality of military police and civilian personnel
Title_Text: rebel kill peacekeeper in congo in worst attack on un in recent history

Text: washington reuters  former u national security adviser michael flynn on friday pleaded guilty to lying to the federal bureau of investigation prosecutor said adding that he had spoken with a top member of trumps transition team regarding his communication with russias ambassador to the united state federal prosecutor also said flynn had been directed by a very senior member of trumps transition team regarding a december united nation vote flynn also filed materially false statement and omission in his march foreign agent filing over his companys work with the turkish government according to prosecutor
Title_Text: former trump adviser flynn pleads guilty to lying to fbi

Text: havana reuters  the united state said on thursday it had designated career diplomat lawrence gumbiner a the new chief of it cuba embassy that ha been at the center of a diplomatic crisis due to allegation of mysterious health attack on it personnel the previous charge daffaires scott hamilton left cuba earlier this month after washington ordered the evacuation of all nonessential staff and all relative in order to remain with his family gumbiner will arrive at a time of heightened tension between the old cold war foe while the united state ha not formally accused cuba of carrying out what it say are attack that have caused hearing loss and cognitive issue in it diplomat u president donald trump said last week havana wa responsible nsnmd in an interview with reuters cuban government official accused him this week of slandering their country nlnmzch the tension over the attack some of which involved highpitched sound came after trump said in june he wanted to partially roll back the historic detente between the united state and cuba ordering tighter restriction on travel and trade with the island these have yet to be unveiled lnjdj gumbiner a lawyer ha served for the past three year a deputy chief of mission at the u embassy in lima peru according to the website of the u embassy in havana before that he wa deputy permanent representative at the u mission to the organization of american state he ha previously held embassy position in bogota tel aviv and san jose
Title_Text: u appoints new top official at havana embassy a tension flare

Text: london reuters  british gambler believe u president donald trump is now more likely to leave office before the end of his first term than not british bookmaker said on wednesday after a week of tumult at the white house betfair said that punter had bet more than pound  on an early departure for trump in the hour after it wa reported he had asked his thenfbi director james comey to shut down an investigation into tie between former white house national security adviser michael flynn and russia concern that businessman and former reality tv star trumps economic reform could be slowed and he might even face the threat of impeachment ha dented demand for the dollar on uk betting market the odds on trump failing to see out his fouryear term dropped to from even on betfair implying a percent chance that he will leave betfair wa also offering odds of percent that trump would leave office this year implying a percent chance that he would depart betfair said that the odds for such an early departure had never been shorter fellow bookmaker ladbrokes said it odds on the president leaving office via impeachment or resignation before the end of his first term had also shortened in the last week to after a flurry of bet spokeswoman jessica bridge added that ladbrokes had taken close to pound on various wager over trumps future including whether he would be impeached and the year he might be replaced barely a day go by without a trump scandal but money talk and punter are becoming increasingly convinced the president could be impeached sooner rather than later bridge said uk political betting market have exploded in recent year with million wagered last year ahead of surprising result of britains referendum on european union membership and trumps election which wa the most betupon political event ever bookmaker also saw their biggest market for a french election earlier this year buoyed by growing enthusiasm for political betting an unpredictable result and a ban on betting on politics in france
Title_Text: uk punter back an early exit for trump bookmaker

Text: st century wire say yesterday wikileaks editor and founder julian assange confirmed what wire already knew that hillary clinton and the obama white house s claim of the u election process being hacked by the russian government wa a desperate work of fiction not content with that fish tale hillary clinton took the narrative to an embarrassing new low if that wa even possible with another wilder madeup conspiracy story about the russian the following statement made by hillary clinton yesterday epitomizes the term jumping the shark it time for trump to answer serious question about his tie to russia httpstcodosmyvar pictwittercomdryempjx hillary clinton hillaryclinton october apparently hillary clinton s campaign staff fed her a planted online news story by the clinton campaign which ran on a questionable prodemocratic party online news outlet on monday the slate ran the story by one of it alleged journalist named franklin foer complete with a clickbait bloglike headline wa a trump server communicating with russia whatever legitimacy the slate had before last night just evaporatedjohn robert from forbes explains the bottom line is that slate screwed up by publishing this in the first place and by adding more kooky misinformation to an already addled election season a for foer he say on twitter a follow up piece is in the work robert rightly point out that the only followup story for this lemon should start with the word retraction cyber feud assange belief clinton ha gone beyond the pale with her russian conspiracy obsessionduring his exclusive interview with awardwinning filmmaker john pilger when asked what he thought of hillary clinton s shrill antic julian assange said i actually feel quite sorry for hillary clinton a a person because i see someone who is eaten alive by their ambition tormented literally to the point where they become sick the saddest thing about this and the other dishonest and destructive action of the clinton campaign and the democratic party is that no one in the party seems to see anything wrong with this level of deceit and dishonesty like hillary clinton in her sociopathic path to power the party rank and file are acting like a cult coven following their high priestessstill clinton surrogate in the medium are trying to equate clinton simultaneously scapegoating and baiting another nuclear superpower with a decadeold misogynist hot mic audio excerpt of donald trump in a tmzstyle tabloid sting that pretty much sum up democratic party strategy for this election seasonassange wa right clinton the democratic party and their surrogate are eating themselves such are the spoil of power in washington that men and woman will do and say anything to have itread more election news at st century wire filessupport wire subscribe become a member wiretv
Title_Text: hillary clinton jump the shark with trumps secret russian server conspiracy theory

Text: so much for that whole dead broke nonsense hillary clinton ha vowed to be a champion for everyday american the former secretary of state who once described herself and husband bill clinton a dead broke kicked off her campaign on june and in her minute speech on new york city s roosevelt island clinton delivered a message similar to her initial presidential announcement american have fought their way back from tough economic time clinton said in the video announcement on april but the deck is still stacked in favor of those at the top so what do millennials think of a candidate who criticizes the percent but simultaneously owns multimillion dollar property in washington dc and new york and spends her summer in the hampton campus correspondent cabot phillips took to the street of our nation s capitol to find out in campus reform s debut of candidate s crib via campus reform
Title_Text: watch how young hillary supporter react when they see actual photo of her everyday american home video

Text: nairobi reuters  kenya s opposition leader raila odinga said on tuesday he want an interim government to run the country for six month while the constitution is reviewed to curb the president s authority odinga told reuters in an interview that he wa open to talk with president uhuru kenyatta over a constitutional review aimed at lowering the risk of violence from minority group who feel excluded from power kenyatta wa reelected with percent of the vote on oct after odinga boycotted the election saying it would not be fair the repeat presidential vote followed an election in august which kenyatta also won but which wa nullified by the supreme court on procedural ground odinga s supporter have repeatedly protested against the result and at least people have been killed in the turmoil since august generating an atmosphere of uncertainty in east africa s richest economy a pure presidential system enhances ethnicity because each community belief that they are not safe unless their man is at the top odinga said in the interview in his office three of kenya s president since independence from britain in have been from the kikuyu ethnic group and one ha been from the kalenjin group although there are recognized ethnic group in the nation the current president is a kikuyu and his deputy is a kalenjin and many of odinga s supporter who are largely drawn from other ethnic group say they feel excluded from power the constitution devolved some power and money to kenya s county spreading the opportunity for power and political patronage but most of the budget and the power is still in the hand of the central government something odinga want to change we had a new constitution that we enacted in we think that now it is time to revisit it he said a constitutional review could strengthen institution like the election board and cut down the power of the presidency he said we think that maybe six month will be required to carry out all these change that we need in this country odinga served a prime minister in a coalition government that wa crafted in after two month of violence following a disputed election killed people after the oct election odinga s opposition alliance called for civil disobedience including protest and a boycott of product and service by firm friendly to kenyatta s government to force reform the opposition did not challenge kenyatta s oct victory at the supreme court and there ha been no protest action but voter and right activist lodged case on monday the court ha day to review them
Title_Text: kenya odinga say constitutional review talk will pave way out of crisis

Text: zalavar hungary reuters  twice a month a few dozen russian orthodox believer gather in a small catholic chapel whose foundation date back to the th century their temporary place of worship a they do not have a church of their own in western hungary these worshipper now have a good chance of having their own church built in the spa town of heviz after prime minister viktor orban granted billion forint  million in the budget to the renovating and building of russian orthodox church channelling state money to the hungarian branch of the russian church which had just follower in the latest census in the mostly catholic country of million wa seen by political analyst and critic a a bid to win favor with president vladimir putin orban signed off the decree and it wa published on feb the day before he received putin in budapest it wa their fourth meeting in two year and putin wa back on aug for a judo event when they met again on that day orban allocated an additional million forint to the russian orthodox church although the amount are small some analyst and critic see the bolstering of the russian orthodox church with state cash a significant in the context of russianhungarian relation this move is on the one hand a gesture toward vladimir putin and the russian a small community living here in hungary but at the same time it really show the influence of russia on hungary said peter kreko director of thinktank political capital hungary s alignment to russia is unsettling to fellow european union member state where russia s alleged interference is taken with such alarm that several country have moved to set up agency to counter it inside the european union hungary promotes scrapping economic sanction imposed after russia s annexation of crimea in saying it hurt trade trade tie between russia and hungary include a gas supply pact with gazprom and a deal for russia to finance and build a nuclear power plant construction is due to start next year in february orban said hungary wanted open and transparent relation with russia on the western half of the continent there is a strong antirussian sentiment and antirussian politics ha come into fashion orban said at a joint news conference with putin we had to defend our economic relation in this environment when asked about the church grant foreign minister peter szijjarto told reuters we work together with all the church very closely the billionforint grant to russian orthodox church compare to around billion for similar investment and program in other church also in the budget andras racz an associate professor at pazmany peter catholic university said that both side wanted different dividend from the relationship the cooperation is pragmatic from both side just they want different thing the hungarian side want primarily economic benefit while the russian side ha primarily political and strategic motivation which of course includes some longterm strategic economic position building he said after the soviet union collapsed in the russian orthodox church emerged from decade of oppression to find postcommunist politician ready to help reestablish it role religion helped fill the ideological vacuum left by the failure of marxism while the church an integral part of russian history and culture fitted well into the new nationalism the church ha developed into a thriving institution that work closely with the kremlin to promote common interest with backing from oligarch it ha built or restored ten of thousand of church mostly at home but also in over country including distant location such a havana caracas bangkok and pyongyang a the russian orthodox believer left the small christian chapel in zalavar with the smell of incense lingering priest removed russian icon from the wall some russian tourist were happy to hear that a church would be built in the spa town of heviz where thousand of russian arrive on charter flight to take the water of one of the world s biggest thermal lake landing at a nearby airport at a former soviet army base i think this is not only a matter of religion but also our history so this is good this is appropriate aleksander kulchitskii on holiday from the russian city of ryazan said some hungarian however were less convinced klara kispal a pensioner on holiday in heviz said she agreed with orban s antimigration policy but she could not support paying for a russian orthodox church in the town i don t think this is a good move i am religious roman catholic and the government should promote our religion not a foreign religion she said
Title_Text: with budapest closer to moscow orban grant money to russian orthodox church

Text: johannesburg reuters  zimbabwean living in south africa hope the move by the military to seize power from president robert mugabe will end corruption abuse of power and economic hardship even though uncertainty remained a to who wa in charge zimbabwe s military seized power early on wednesday saying it wa targeting criminal around mugabe who ha ruled zimbabwe since independence in several million zimbabwean have fled the country mostly to south africa after the economy shrank by more than a third from to following the collapse of the agriculture sector unemployment rose to over percent many in the diaspora said they were happy to see change back home at last i think it s a step in the right direction for a political situation which wa now a joke kevin mpofu said the arrest that have happened so far are a celebration for many zimbabwean tired of the corruption and abuse of power a yearold zimbabwean working a a marketing officer in south africa who gave his name a billy said it wa about time but it might be year too late he worried that one strongman might follow another it may be hard in future to remove that person a well we might have another year ahead of u of a single person the main goal of the general appears to be preventing mugabe s wife grace from succeeding him the military stepped in after mugabe sacked his presumed successor vice president emerson mnangagwa last week mnangagwa s unexpected downfall followed month of sometimes vitriolic attack by grace mugabe who used national rally organized by zanupf youth to attack her party rival we have suffered way too long under mugabe and ironically to some point grace mugabe is our hero if it wasn t for her big mouth and her big ego this situation would not have happened said yearold mbangeni nyathi johannesburgbased spokesman for tajamuka a pressure group calling for change in zimbabwe we are not sure who is in charge but we are ready for any kind of change our hope is for the military to pave way for free and fair election he added zimbabwe s economy briefly stabilized from  when mugabe wa forced to accept a powersharing government with the opposition but since then the recovery ha unraveled a chronic shortage of dollar ha led to long queue outside bank and imported good are running out asked if he would return to zimbabwe if the economy wa revived billy said definitely there is no place like home
