Text: donald trump flew in an unmarked jet to a meeting with mexican president enrique pena nieto wednesday the meeting wa hastily put together but we give huge credit to trump for making the effort hillary chose to troll trump trump laid out his step plan to improve relation with mexico which includes a border wallthe meeting ended in a news conference with both men standing at podium within a few foot of each other trump stood his ground and handled the press like a champ it wa really a great opportunity for trump to show he can negotiate and meet with world leader ending illegal immigration not just from mexico but from central american country having a secure border which trump say is a sovereign right and mutually beneficial dismantling of the drug cartel and ending the movement of illegal drug weapon and fund across the border improving nafta keep manufacturing wealth in our hemisphere nieto said the usmexican border security must address illegal flow south of arm and cash a well a immigration north trump said while he understands why some mexican have been offended by trump s comment he belief he can work with trump to achieve goal that will improve the situation in mexico a well we recognize and respect the right of either country to build a physical barrier or wall on any of it border to stop the illegal movement of people drug and weapon said trump trump said while the two men discussed the border he said they didn t talk about who would pay for the wall after the news conference pena nieto said he told trump that mexico won t pay for a border wall contradicting trumpto wrap up his speech trump said his meeting with nieto wa excellent and it wa a tremendous honor read more kban
Title_Text: trump in mexico outline goal he want to accomplish with mexican government video

Text: geneva reuters  u president donald trump s criticism of journalist amount to an attack on the freedom of the press and could provoke violence against reporter the united nation human right chief said on wednesday zeid ra ad alhussein said trump had also made worrying remark about woman mexican and muslim and went on to question the president s approach to immigration and decision to pardon former arizona lawman joe arpaio there wa no immediate response from the white house on the wideranging rebuke of trump s repeated reference to the fake medium and some of his other statement and decision it s really quite amazing when you think that freedom of the press not only sort of a cornerstone of the u constitution but very much something that the united state defended over the year is now itself under attack from the president the un high commissioner for human right said it s sort of a stunning turnaround and ultimately the sequence is a dangerous one he told a news conference in geneva referring to the new york time washington post and cnn he added to call these news organization fake doe tremendous damage and to refer to individual journalist in this way i have to ask the question is this not an incitement for others to attack journalist zeid voiced concern that a journalist from the guardian had been assaulted in the united state most recently but gave no detail trump rounded on journalist last week calling them truly dishonest people and criticizing their coverage of a white supremacistorganized rally in virginia and the political fallout from his comment that violence there wa caused by many side nazi salute swastika antisemitic slur and racist reference to africanamerican had no place in the united state or beyond zeid said in his first comment on the event in charlottesville trump ha also made worrying remark about woman mexican and muslim mocked a person with disability publicly and issued a directive on a transgender ban in the military he said the president pride himself a a taboo breaker indeed his supporter see him a such but at the time i expressed my feeling that this wa grossly irresponsible because it ha consequence it emboldens those who may think similarly to sharpen their assault on these community he said zeid voiced deep concern at trump s pardon of arpaio who wa convicted of criminal contempt in a racial profiling case that highlighted tension over immigration policy doe the president support racial profiling of latino in particular doe he support abuse of prisoner arpaio referred at one stage to the openair prison that he set up a a concentration camp he later recanted said it wa a joke zeid said doe the president support this these action have consequence zeid comparing the leadership role of a u president to a bus driver said i almost feel that the president is driving the bus of humanity and we re careening down a mountain path and in taking these measure at least from a human right perspective it seems to be reckless driving
Title_Text: trump attacking freedom of the press un right bos

Text: washington reuters  u democratic presidential frontrunner hillary clinton took quick aim at presumptive republican nominee donald trump on wednesday saying the united state should not take a risk on an unreliable candidate he is a loose cannon and loose cannon tend to misfire clinton said in an interview with cnn citing trump stance including an allegation that climate change wa a chinese hoax clinton a former secretary of state said trump would have to offer policy specific in ahead of the nov presidential election and criticized him for his position on issue including nuclear weapon and abortion he make these grand statement and grand accusations clinton said of the real estate magnate and former reality tv star at some point when youre running for president you actually have to put a little meat on the bone youve got to tell people what it is youre going to do and how youre going to do it clinton lost the democratic primary contest in indiana on tuesday but still look set to win her partys nomination leading her rival u senator bernie sander by more than delegate trumps win in indiana on tuesday pushed his rival out of the race and left him a the presumptive nominee in a preview of the likely general election battle clinton laughed when asked if she wa ready to take on trump saying oh please this is to me a classic case of a blustering bullying guy who ha knocked out of the way all the republican because they were just dumbfounded she said clinton said she knew how to run a campaign against trump and took a swipe at trumps republican presidential rival who started out in the campaign they didnt know how to deal with him clinton said they couldnt take him on the issue because they basically agreed with them and they didnt know how to counterpunch asked how scorchedearth the campaign wa likely to be she replied you know hes the one making that decision hes the one whos run the campaign insulting people demeaning woman degrading people with disability talking about keeping muslim out of the country hes the one thats been running that kind of very negative aggressive bullying campaign im going to keep staying on the kind of campaign im running she said
Title_Text: clinton call trump a loose cannon risky choice for president

Text: washington reuters  u house of representative speaker paul ryan said on tuesday he applauded a new house bill to help puerto rico deal with it  billion in debt i applaud rep duffy for introducing hr which hold the right people accountable for the crisis shrink the size of government and authorizes an independent board to help get puerto rico on a path to fiscal health ryan said in a statement
Title_Text: u house speaker ryan applauds new puerto rico aid bill

Text: in the closing day before the iowa caucus the very first primary of the election ted cruz is having a bit of a panic moment having enjoyed high poll in iowa for month his disastrous last debate performance and general unlikability have him falling fast in his desperation to win his campaign decided to try to lie and shame voter into showing up for him and absolutely nobody is happy about itthis week iowan began waking up to find a scary looking note in their mail on yellow paper made to look like a ticket the letter read voting violation and creepily name the homeowner and their neighbor the instruction are even more patheticyou are recieving this election notice because of low expected voter turnout in your area your individual voting history a well a your neighbor are public record their score are published below and many of them will see your score a well caucus on monday to improve your score and please encourage your neighbor to caucus a well a followup notice may be issued following monday s caucusesin other word cruz s campaign is trying to scare unknowing iowan into voting preferably for him by threatening to make them look bad in front of their community what s more cruz s name only appears in small print at the top of the envelope and no where on the ticket at all it would be easy to open this up and see voting violation blaring at you in read and think you were actually in troublehow scummy is this tactic so scummy in fact that one of cruz s biggest endorser actually swore cruz would never do something a low a this he didn t know it at the time but cruz s campaign had already confirmed that it had yes they really are that desperateit now appears that cruz s underhanded tactic have even caught the eye of iowa s state government and they weren t amused iowa s republican secretary of state paul pate released a statement strongly rebuking cruz s campaign for trying to pull something like this he ha a personal beef with it too because cruz s campaign in all of it hubris decided to name his office in the mailer it implied that iowa s state government wa complicit today i wa shown a piece of literature from the cruz for president campaign that misrepresents the role of my office and worse misrepresents iowa election law accusing citizen of iowa of a voting violation based on iowa caucus participation or lack thereof is false representation of an official act there is no such thing a an election violation related to frequency of voting any insinuation or statement to the contrary is wrong and i believe it is not in keeping in the spirit of the iowa caucus it is of course important in a democracy that people vote ironically cruz ha been instrumental in preventing people from voting but only the one he doesn t like however there are any number of reason why a person would have a low score in these ridiculous flier and still have contributed to the voting process some may have been out of state resident who vote by mail others may have simply decided to not participate in a republican primary in which all candidate don t seem to represent their value in any case it s not up to ted cruz and his desperate campaign to shame a person for not doing what he would like worse making it appear a if the mail recipient is in violation of a law can make people even more fearful of the voting processcruz s campaign ha long been built on lie and smear but it s becoming clear that in his frenzy to catch up with donald trump he s lost all sense of perspectivefeature image via jamelle bouieflickr
Title_Text: cruzs desperate last minute attempt to win iowa is so vile state official just nailed him for it

Text: reuters  burlington store inc joined other retailer including nordstrom inc in deciding not to sell product of ivanka trumps brand online news website business insider reported burlington will no longer stock the brands accessory and clothing online according to the report but it wa unclear if the offprice retailer would sell the product in it store burlington and ivanka trumps representative were not immediately available for comment earlier this month nordstrom said it would stop carrying ivanka trumps apparel because of falling sale pushing president donald trump to defend his daughter on twitter by saying she wa treated unfairly by the retailer neiman marcus nmrcusul ha also said it would not sell ivanka trumps jewelry line while tjx co inc told it employee to dump any sign related to the brand hsn inc ha stopped selling trump home product but still sell trump presidential memorabilia sears holding and it unit kmart had also removed trump home item from their online product offering to focus on more profitable item this month
Title_Text: burlington to drop ivanka trump brand online business insider

Text: donald trump the gop candidate who ha been completely antimuslim for his entire presidential campaign and even proposed a ban on all muslim from coming into the united state ha said that he want to attend the funeral of boxing legend muhammad ali who happens to have been an openly proud muslimnot only ha trump perpetuated xenophobia and a deepening fear and hatred of muslim in his supporter but he ha repeatedly insisted that everyone who follows islam hate u all thing considered it s baffling that trump would want to be at a funeral where there will literally be thousand of muslim while it s not clear why trump want to go ali s family ha responded to trump s desire to attend the muslim funeral on thursday and it s definitely worth sharingali s family spokesman bob gunnell said everything we re doing here wa blessed by muhammad ali and wa requested ali firmly believed in inclusiveness and gunnell said that the boxing legend would have wanted people from all different faith to be at the service while gunnell couldn t confirm if trump would actually show his face or not he said trump would be welcome to attend saliha shakir a friend to ali said that the family know the nasty thing trump ha said about muslim but it wouldn t have stopped ali from extending kindness in the face of hate he would have wanted people to know that islam is an inclusive religion rather than the divisive one that trump ha portrayed it a shakir said none of u care for trump s rhetoric but this is what ali would have wanted he would not have turned him away this response show a great deal of class a ali wasn t naive to trump s islamophobia after trump said he would ban muslim from coming into america in response to a terrorist attack in san bernardino california ali spoke out about islam and it true principle i am a muslim and there is nothing islamic about killing innocent people in paris san bernardino or anywhere else in the world true muslim know that the ruthless violence of so called islamic jihadist go against the very tenet of our religion we a muslim have to stand up to those who use islam to advance their own personal agenda they have alienated many from learning about islam true muslim know or should know that it go against our religion to try and force islam on anybody and he also brilliantly called out trump and those who try to make islam out to be a violent religion speaking a someone who ha never been accused of political correctness i believe that our political leader should use their position to bring understanding about the religion of islam and clarify that these misguided murderer have perverted people s view on what islam really is even after his death ali s value will live on while it s not clear if trump will attend ali s muslim funeral on thursday or the interfaith service on friday he could really learn somethingfeatured image via wikipedia and john moore getty image
Title_Text: trumps trying to attend muhammad alis muslim funeral  his familys response is brilliant

Text: chicago reuters  indiana governor mike penny the republican nominee for u vice president lost another round in federal court on monday in his bid to keep refugee fleeing syrias civil war from resettling in his state the th u circuit court of appeal in chicago affirmed a lowercourt ruling that pences order seeking to bar state agency from helping the resettlement of syrian immigrant discriminates against the refugee based on their national origin the setback for penny come a day before he is scheduled to debate the democratic vice presidential nominee virginia governor tim kaine on national television penny wa among more than u governor mostly republican who urged president barack obama to stop resettling refugee fleeing syrias civil war after november attack by extremist in paris that killed critic of the resettlement program have argued that it leaf the united state vulnerable to infiltration by militant from islamic state also known a isi which ha seized vast swath of territory in syria and iraq and claimed responsibility for attack on civilian in paris and elsewhere but appeal court judge richard posner writing for the threejudge panel that sided unanimously against penny said the governors assertion of a national security threat were presented without evidence and amounted to nightmare speculation all three appellate panel member are republican appointee including judge diane sykes who pences running mate donald trump ha said he would nominate to the u supreme court if he win the nov presidential election a penny spokeswoman kara brook said the fbi and u homeland security department have acknowledged security gaps in screening of syrian refugee she also quoted a state department spokesman who said last month that he wouldnt debate the fact that theres the potential for isi terrorist to try to insert themselves into the refugee program pences order wa blocked by a u district judge in february after a court challenge brought by the american civil liberty union aclu and he appealed the aclu welcomed the courts ruling on monday a upholding the groups position that the governor may not constitutionally or legally discriminate against a particular nationality of refugee that are extensively vetted by the federal government indiana ha accepted syrian immigrant between oct and aug accounting for about percent of all refugee arrival in the state during that period according to the state department
Title_Text: u appeal court side against penny in syrian refugee case

Text: former representative gabby giffords ha made a remarkable recovery after suffering a gunshot wound to the head five year ago but now she is possibly being sued by her attackeron january giffords wa speaking to a group of her constituent outside of a safeway in casas adobe arizona when jared lee loughner began firing on the crowd loughner s bullet killed six people and injured thirteen including giffords the shooter wa detained by people at the event and later pleaded guilty to charge related to the shooting he is currently serving seven consecutive life sentence in prisonhowever although he admitted to his crime and wa sentenced accordingly a lawsuit ha allegedly been filed by loughner against the former congresswoman for  million for psychological and emotional distress it claim claim that he is innocent and wa handpicked to be an assassin my incarceration is illegal i am actually innocent i wa framed i am a victim of project mkultra the govt put a chip in my head to control my mind gabby giffords is in the illuminati and i have evidence of this i wa handpicked illegally to be a sleeper assassin my head is full of chip and this evil empire govt is controlling me within the lawsuit claim all sort of other insane thing a well it say that he ha been waterboarded repeatedly during his incarceration by the atf nsa and cia the suit also alleges that his attorney is a global spy who forced him to plead guilty and that authority are making him sick from microwave testing and chemtrails it even accuses giffords of funding the san bernardino shootersthe timing of this lawsuit ha made some people think that it is a hoax just day before it wa filed a similar lawsuit wa filed in michigan against uber supposedly by the kalamazoo mass shooter jason brian dalton that lawsuit turned out to be fake and apparently the giffords suit look a lot like the dalton suit tucson news reportsthe envelope of both the alleged loughner lawsuit and the fake dalton lawsuit have very similar characteristicsboth have the same three stamp in the top right corner have similar handwriting and are postmarked in philadelphia pathe envelope do indeed look very similar and when you read loughner s alleged lawsuit there seems to be a whole lot of crazy crammed into it almost an unbelievable amount in factaddicting info will keep you updated on this story a it developsread the loughner complaint herefeatured image via justin sullivangetty image
Title_Text: is gabby giffords being sued by her shooter image

Text: islamabad reuters  the family of a former director of the turkish pakturk school in pakistan ha been abducted by authority in the eastern city of lahore the human right commission of pakistan hrcp said less than a year after pakistan sought to deport them pakistan ha forged close tie with turkey in recent year and president tayyip erdogan who opposes the pakturk school ha made several state visit to islamabad turkey ha accused the school of alleged link to turkish cleric fethullah gulen or his hizmet movement which erdogan say wa behind a failed coup attempt in turkey last year pakturk school deny such link but in november last year pakistan ordered their turkish teacher to leave the country hrcp said mesut kacmaz former director of the pakturk international school and college wa picked up on wednesday by armed individual according to their turkish neighbor who spoke to the right group kacmaz his wife and two daughter were roughedup hooded handcuffed and taken in a wagon to a furnished house where several other interrogator were also present hrcp a nongovernmental organization said in a statement late on wednesday hrcp urge the government to immediately release the kacmaz family and desist from deporting them there are credible report of other turkish educationist being arrested upon their arrival in turkey and their subsequent torture the punjab province s police department did not respond to request for comment hrcp said the family ha been living in pakistan for the past year on a valid united nation asylum seeker certificate the school educate more than student in pakistan
Title_Text: turkish family of pakturk school director abducted in pakistan right group

Text: this is the craziest explanation of why donald trump is getting his as handed to him in the poll and you have to hear it for yourselfthe republican nominee s newst campaign manager kellyanne conway wa interviewed by the uk s channel where she wa grilled about trump s poll number and whether he can really winonce again trump s minion dismissed the poll a being cherrypicked by the medium because they supposedly want to destroy himconway claimed that online poll are more accurate because they allegedly show trump in the lead and she argued that college student are keeping their support of trump secret so they aren t alienated on campus donald trump performs consistently better in online polling where a human being is not talking to another human being about what he or she may do in the election it s because it s become socially desirable if you re a college educated person in the united state of america to say that you re against donald trump the problem with online poll however is that anyone can take them and they can be easily skewed if a bunch of people take it with the intention of making the result lean one way or the other in short they aren t scientific like real poll conducted by cnn gallup nbc and quinnipiac all of which show trump losing badly to hillary clintonfurthermore poll are anonymous so there is no need to hide one s support of a candidate but poll overwhelmingly show that trump is getting trounced by hillary among young voter so it s pretty clear why conway would make any excuse to explain the wide gap thereconway then claimed that trump will win the election in november because most of his voter are supposedly undercover yeah you read that right she literally said trump ha undercover voter that are in hiding until they can rush to the voting booth and cast their vote the hidden trump vote in this country is a very significant proposition she saidwhen asked if she ha number to back up her claim conway said she doe but refused to share them i can t discus it conway said it s a project we re doing internally i call it the undercover trump voter but it s real here s the video via youtubesomeone get this woman a straight jacket and a rubber room because this claim is a delusional a the claim that the government will send black helicopter to whisk critic away in the middle of the night or that the government is going to take way all of our gunsseriously this a crock of bullshit the idea that voter are undercover is totally ridiculous donald trump s campaign is imploding and the best his new campaign manager can do is cite the vote of imaginary voter a proof that trump will win it s pathetic and it sound like trump need yet another new campaign managerfeatured image via screenshot
Title_Text: watch delusional trump campaign manager make craziest claim yet to deny trump is losing

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump on wednesday nominated the chief executive of accuweather inc to head the governments meteorological agency that monitor the climate and issue daily weather forecast trump nominated barry myers ceo of privately owned weather forecasting company accuweather to head the national oceanic and atmospheric administration part of the u commerce department myers name wa first floated for the position in january and the washington post reported in may he had emerged a the front runner accuweather did not immediately respond to a request for comment on wednesday the white house said myers ha run accuweather since and over the last decade the company ha experienced it highest grossing year and it largest global web and mobile audience growth he is one of the worlds leading authority on the use of weather information accuweather based in state college pennsylvania wa founded by myers brother joel myers the trump administration proposed in may cutting the noaa budget by percent to  billion including cutting  million for grant and education program noaa provides daily and longterm weather forecast for agricultural planning and emergency response to severe weather like hurricane in july senator bill nelson a democrat raised concern about the nomination accuweather in worked with thensenator rick santorum to back an unsuccessful proposal that would have limited dissemination of national weather service forecast on website many american have come to rely on forecast issued daily by the national weather service nelson said from storm tracking to drought forecast this information is critical to protecting life property and livelihood any nominee who ha a history of trying to undercut the national weather service for financial gain should raise serious questions the center for american progress a think thank associated with the democratic party on wednesday criticized the choice of myers noting that unlike of the previous noaa administrator he lack an advanced scientific degree myers ha bachelors and masters degree in business and also hold a law degree president trump ha responded to noaas remarkable work by nominating an administrator who ha a history of trying to block the agency from issuing weather forecast to the american public michael conathan the centers director of ocean policy said in a statement trump announced his decision to withdraw from the paris climate deal in june saying the accord would cost america trillion of dollar kill job and hinder the oil gas coal and manufacturing industry this week the trump administration began the process to undo the obama administrations clean power plan trump and scott pruitt administrator of the environmental protection agency have both expressed doubt about whether climate change is caused by human activity something that ha been agreed upon by an overwhelming majority of scientist
Title_Text: white house nominates accuweather ceo to head climate agency

Text: washington reuters  u senate finance committee chairman orrin hatch said on wednesday that republican in the senate and house of representative had reached a deal on tax reform legislation asked by reporter if an agreement had been reached in negotiation to hammer out difference between two competing tax bill hatch said we have i think we have a deal hatch said it wa more than just an agreement in principle
Title_Text: house and senate reach deal on u tax legislation hatch

Text: this ridiculous article by politico who pretend to be a nonbiased source for news is sadly what pass a journalism today we ve taken the liberty of highlighting the article in place where poltico ha gone out of their way to blame trump andor his supporter for the violent protester many of whom are paid by leftist organization our comment can be found in parenthesis following the highlighted copyoutside donald trump s campaign rally in recent day protester have gathered and increasingly clashed violently with trump supporter and police inside trump is going to new rhetorical extreme in his attempt to delegitimize a mexicanamerican judge together together doe anyone else find it to be slightly ridiculous that the person writing this piece would honestly think anyone belief trump and the violent antitrump protester were working together they re forming an increasingly combustible atmosphere a the campaign enters the summer and temperature here climb into triple digitstrump ha in the past vowed to become more presidential after dispatching his primary foe and many political observer hoped tension would decrease a trump pivoted to appeal to broader swath of voter in the general electioninstead the end of the primary ha seen a steady rise in tension fueling fear that the convention in cleveland next month will surpass the turbulence of the democratic convention in chicagotense standoff involving police protester and trump supporter are common sight at campaign rally and violence ha occasionally flared up but there ha been an uptick in the scale and frequency of violence over the past two week during the candidate s swing through the west most of the violence ha been directed at police officer and trump supporter outside rally venue but on friday one local leader who condemned the violence also partly blamed trump for it of course it s trump s fault that the left is paying people to riot and to attack innocent people along with the law enforcement officer who are hired to keep the peace while it s a sad statement about our political discourse that mr trump ha focused on stirring antagonism trump s fault instead of offering real solution to our nation s challenge there is absolutely no place for violence against people who are simply exercising their right to participate in the political process said san jose mayor sam riccardo a democrat in a statement on friday in another statement riccardo said trump s rhetoric is no excuse for violence and that city police would investigate and prosecute offender she said no protester had applied for permit to demonstrate in albuquerque where demonstrator shattered window at the site of trump s rally on tuesday police made three arrest and have an outstanding felony warrant for another demonstrator that includes eight count of aggravated battery on a police officer according to albuquerque police public information officer tanner tixier he added that police were working four to five other case that could lead to more arreststidier also shot down a conspiracy theory rumor that antitrump demonstrator were illegal immigrant or paid agitator because this public information officer know each and every protester and whether they ve been paid or are legal citizen of the united state they re just general local criminal i don t even think they knew what they were protesting he saidthe mexican flag ha been a common sight at recent protest in the west which is home to many mexican and mexicanamerican trump meanwhile began insisting during the past week that the judge presiding over one of the lawsuit against trump university gonzalo curiel could not be fair because of his mexican heritage the statement condemned by house speaker paul ryan editorial board and legal watchdog can only inflame tension out here muriel the son of mexican immigrant wa born in indiana because if paul ryan condemned trump the whole republican party must be against him rightdespite the warning sign there is little indication from the trump campaign or antitrump demonstrator that they plan to change course making continued unrest likely in the month ahead in other word there is no indication trump plan to change his policy in order to appease illegal alien and leftist thugsentire article can be found at politico
Title_Text: lol politico publishes article blaming trump and his supporter for horrific violence committed against them

Text: washington reuters  president barack obama and new canadian prime minister justin trudeau on thursday ended a frosty period in bilateral tie by agreeing to tackle climate change and strive to settle a longlasting trade dispute over canadian softwood lumber export the neighboring country are traditionally close but relation had soured under former prime minister stephen harper who hectored the white house in a failed bid to push through u approval for the keystone xl oil pipeline obama and trudeau whose liberal came to power last november promising better cooperation with washington pledged joint step to fight global warming including cutting methane emission from oil and gas operation the country committed to cutting emission of methane by to percent below level by to take step to fight climate change in the arctic and to speed development of green technology they also told official to look for solution to a lengthy dispute over export of canadian softwood lumber a well a promising to make it easier for good and people to cross the long shared border i am grateful that i have him a a partner when it come to the central challenge that we face our two nation are more closely aligned than ever obama told a news conference after talk with trudeau the president and i agree on many thing including of paramount importance the direction we want to take our country in to ensure a clean and prosperous future said trudeau in another sign of friendlier bilateral tie trudeau invited obama to address the canadian parliament this year american have been captivated by the photogenic trudeau whose father pierre trudeau wa prime minister from through and again from to his visit will be capped by a state dinner on thursday but that could be overshadowed by the race to succeed obama in novembers presidential election candidate for the republican nomination will hold a debate on thursday night trudeau declined to say what he would do in case the next president wa donald trump who ha mused about tearing up the north american free trade agreement the friendship between our two country go far beyond any two individual or any ideologies he said i have tremendous confidence in the american people and look forward to working with whomever they choose to send to this white house later this year
Title_Text: obama trudeau mark better canada tie with climate trade accord

Text: berlin reuters  german chancellor angela merkel appointed jan hecker her refugee policy coordinator a her new foreign policy adviser a she braced for tricky talk on a new coalition government next week where immigration is likely to be a key issue a government spokeswoman said merkel humbled in last month s national election by a surge of the antiimmigrant far right is seeking to put together a threeway coalition of her conservative the probusiness free democrat and the environmentalist green  a combination previously untested at the federal level member of her conservative bloc resolved their own difference and agreed to limiting migration on monday paving the way for talk to begin with the other party hecker a former federal judge took over the newly created position of refugee coordinator in october after merkel s decision to allow in over a million migrant he led germany s migration treaty with african state and accompanied merkel on a number of foreign trip focused on migration the decision reflects growing awareness that refugee and asylum policy are inextricably linked to security issue said judy dempsey a senior fellow at carnegie europe he had the overview of libya of the trafficker of the security of the border of the agreement with turkey she said hecker replaces christoph heusgen who had advised merkel for all year of her role a chancellor before becoming germany s un ambassador in new york in late july with hecker s appointment merkel break for the second time with a longstanding tradition of tapping diplomat to fill foreign and political job in the chancellery
Title_Text: merkel name refugee expert a foreign policy adviser

Text: the democrat have more day to discredit donald j trump until he becomes our next president they are really pulling out all of the stop wikileaks founder julian assange emerges from hiding to do an interview with fox news sean hannity in order to set the record straight on the dnc leak he released prior to the election it s interesting how mainstream medium reporter have no interest in the content of those undisputed leaked email they only care about how they got into the hand of julian assangejulian assange ha finally spoken out on the recent news about intel assessment on russia being the source of hacking designed to reportedly help donald trump julian assange spoke with sean hannity on his radio show this afternoon and stated our source is not the russian government he told hannity wikileaks did receive a little bit of information having to do with trump and the rnc but it wa already public somewhere else httpsyoutubegjivosptcbshannity applauded assange and said he s done u a favor by showing how weak u cybersecurity is and exposing government corruption he asked assange if the information he received came from inside the united state assange did not say definitively but insisted it ha not come from a state party at a later point in the interview assange said that info leak from other place could have been from russia hannity also asked him if president obama know this too and is purposefully pushing a false narrative to delegitimize trump assange said yes on thursday afternoon hannity the fox news host and informal trump adviser once again interviewed wikileaks chief julian assange this time on hannity s nationally syndicated radio show hannity gave assange a large platform to deny that the source of the dnc and john podesta email wa the russian government and to also join hannity in some fairly typical bashing of hillary clinton and the liberal mainstream medium hannity gushed onair thanks to assange and wikileaks s work hannity said we can now fix the problem of our gap in u cybersecurity the dnc and podesta email were a wakeup call in a sense assange also exposed the corruption in our government for all to see i have so many question for you hannity said before reminding his audience of wikileaks s perfect record you have not been proven wrong not one single time he reiterated when asked if president obama wa trying to delegitimize donald trump by promoting any evidence of russian interference and cyberattacks aimed at helping trump to defeat clinton in the election assange answered firmly yes this wouldn t be the first time that the cia would be politicized hannity continued making a benghazi analogy assange also wagged his finger at the liberal press in america that tried to make trump voter feel ashamed of themselves for supporting the republican candidate what is the difference between what you and wikileaks have done and what the new york time and cnn have done the host inquired our stuff ha more impact assange replied touch hannity answered i can t disagree with that the conservative host continued to make the case that the socalled mainstream medium wa trying to scapegoat assange and that if hillary were a republican they d be singing your praise day and night america owes you a debt of gratitude hannity said concluding their friendly chatyoutube copy and video provided by jim browski
Title_Text: breaking sean hannity interview wikileaks julian assangeproves hes still alive our source is not the russian government

Text: the world is scrambling to deal with fallout from the spread of the zika virus the global pandemic which appears to be linked to birth defect in child when pregnant woman are infected president obama ha requested that america help lead the global effort to fight the infection which ha reached our shore republican who describe themselves a prolife are resistinghouse appropriation committee chairman hal rogers rky is taking the lead among republican in refusing to helpin a letter to president obama s budget director shaun donovan rogers noted the department of health and human service ha  billion allocated for the ebola fight of and the state department ha  billion left over these fund can and should be prioritized to meet the most pressing need of mounting a rapid and full response to zika rogers and two other republican committee member wrotethe white house will likely ask that some ebola fund be repurposed for the antizika effort but not so much that it would undermine the response to ebola earnest said adding that amount would not be sufficient to take on what we believe is a pretty serious threat from the zika virus strangely republican are arguing that fund already being used to fight the ebola outbreak now be used against zika instead of a separate request but these are the same republican who attacked the obama administration s response to that outbreakalong with their ally in the medium many on the right said obama wa exposing america to ebola with some even floating the conspiracy theory that obama wanted a mass infection of american with the ebola virusinstead the administration s response to that outbreak ha now been cited a a model of america using it superpower status to fight a global problem ebola infection are down to nonexistent in many of the african nation where it killed thousand in part due to the global alliance organized by president obamathere were no outbreak of the disease in america and in fact american infected with the virus survived and are now ebolafree thanks to american doctor at the same time republican and conservative were harsh in their condemnation of the obama responsethe obama administration is asking for fund to show american leadership to help the baby republican profess to care so much about and again they are dropping the ballfeatured image via youtube
Title_Text: prolife gop refuse to help zika infected baby

Text: reuters  four people were killed on thursday when a helicopter belonging to utility hydro one crashed in central ontario the company said in a statement hydro one did not provide detail on it four employee who were killed in the crash saying name would not be released until next of kin had been notified the company which is based in ontario said emergency service were on site in the tweed area of rural central ontario some kilometer mile from toronto it said it had notified the appropriate oversight group the ontario provincial police said in a statement that officer responded to the crash shortly after pm et gmt and were joined by emergency response service including a forensic identification unit police said canada s transportation safety board would investigate a woman named kim clayton tweeted that hydro one staff had been working on power line on her property before the crash on wednesday a small airplane carrying passenger and three crew member crashed after taking off in the canadian province of saskatchewan
Title_Text: four killed in canada helicopter crash

Text: washington reuters  the supreme court two day after hearing a major abortion case from texas on friday temporarily blocked a louisiana law imposing regulation on doctor who perform abortion in a move that would allow two recently closed clinic to reopen in a brief order the court granted a request by abortion provider seeking to reinstate a lowercourt injunction that blocked the republicanbacked law which required doctor to obtain a formal affiliation with a local hospital the abortion provider contend the law wa designed to shut down abortion clinic by requiring hospital admitting privileges that are difficult for their doctor to secure louisiana will now have four clinic in total the order noted that one of the eight justice conservative clarence thomas said he would have denied the application the order said the courts action wa in line with it decision in june to temporarily block part of a texas abortion law that wa challenged by abortion provider in a highprofile case the justice heard oral argument in that case on wednesday the louisiana law mandate that physician who perform abortion have admitting privilege at a hospital within mile km of the abortion clinic the regulation match one in the texas law u district judge john degravelles in january granted a preliminary injunction sought by abortion provider finding the law violated the constitutional right to an abortion established by the supreme court in the th u circuit court of appeal blocked that decision on feb allowing the law to go into effect the high courts action sent mixed signal on how it might rule in the texas case in part because the justice previously allowed the texas admitting privilege provision to go into effect the action could suggest the court ha greater concern about admitting privilege requirement than were indicated during wednesdays argument in the texas case fridays move effectively put louisianas law on hold while the justice prepare a ruling expected by the end of june in the texas case nancy northup president of the center for reproductive right which represents abortion provider in both case welcomed the courts action these underhanded tactic to cut off womens access to safe legal abortion simply cannot stand northup said the texas case also involves a separate provision that requires clinic to have costly hospitalgrade facility the louisiana law wa signed by republican thengovernor bobby jindal in
Title_Text: supreme court temporarily block louisiana abortion law

Text: ever since democratic nominee hillary clinton wa forced to leave the memorial in new york city yesterday due to health concern she wa diagnosed with pneumonia conservative have been giddy and going insane with accusation that the former secretary of state is in no condition to be presidentmsnbc host thomas robert had the perfect response to all the hype about clinton s health on monday when he had republican national committee rnc communication director sean spicer on his show and it s going to make the gop furious while the rest of u laugh during the live interview with spicer robert suggested that the republican might have pneumonia because he coughed a nod to the obsession conservative medium ha had with clinton s health ever since she recently had a coughing fit during a rallyroberts had been questioning spicer about republican nominee donald trump s charity work when spicer coughed and cleared his throat without skipping a beat robert jumped in and asked is that pneumonia spicer insisted that it wa just a cough and robert moved on asking spicer if trump would ever dare to release his tax robert asked so before election day yes or no do you think we ll get them spicer replied that s up to him to decide and robert followed up by asking the rnc official do you care spicer gave basically the same response trump did several day ago by saying i don t think that s really top of mind for the american people right now even though it definitely is even trump s own supporter have been begging him to release his tax returnsrobert wrapped up the interview with yet another subtle dig at the gop he said alright sean good to have you with me i m glad that the cough is just that a cough you can watch robert throw some epic shade at spicer and conservative belowfeatured image via screen capture

Text: peshawarislamabad pakistan reuters  pakistan on wednesday told medical charity medecins sans frontieres msf to stop work and leave it impoverished tribal area that border afghanistan the health organization said ending it year stay in the volatile region msf work out of two health facility in the kurram district of pakistan s federally administered tribal area fata region which ha been plagued by militancy over the past decade and wa the location of many u drone strike targeting commander from al qaeda and other militant group though security ha improved in fata in recent year sectarian militant attack primarily targeting shi ite muslim still occur twin blast in the kurram s most populous town parachinar killed more than people in june local official say msf provides essential healthcare facility in fata an area with some of pakistan s poorest healthcare and lowest literacy rate we have been asked to close our medical activity in kurram agency msf said in a statement to the medium adding that pakistan had refused to issue a no objection certificate noc for the charity to work in the tribal area msf is saddened by the decision from the authority responsible for ngo working in kurram agency the closure brings to and end year of msf working with the fata health service in kurram agency country representative catherine moody said in the statement foreign national and organization working in pakistan require noc to operate in certain area pakistani ngo and journalist also face restriction when working in the tribal area msf provides diagnosis and treatment facility to the community for leishmaniasis immunization for child a well responding to emergency disease outbreak and mass casualty the organization said the region s health directorate did not respond to request for comment but dr mohammad ishaq who work there said msf wa asked to leave because they did not have a valid noc i personally think msf wa doing a great job for the patient in fata he said adding that he did not know why it license to work there wa revoked we have been working in fata since we were never denied an noc in the past this will affect many patient in the area one msf employee said asking not to be identified he added that the organization had staff member working at the two health facility the official who notified msf that their operation would need to be shut down added i did what i wa directed to by my boss in peshawar but really don t know the reason behind msf being stopped
Title_Text: pakistan kick out medical charity msf from country tribal region

Text: kabul reuters  islamic state claimed responsibility for a suicide attack on monday on a compound of afghanistan s national intelligence agency in kabul which killed at least five people and wounded two the blast come a week after the group claimed responsibility for an attack on a training facility of the same agency the national directorate for security in kabul that ended when the attacker were killed before causing significant casualty in a statement issued through the group s amaq news agency islamic state said it wa also behind monday s attack in kabul security official said the explosion wa caused by a suicide bomber who approached the agency s entrance on foot before blowing himself up all the casualty reported were of civilian passersby najib danish a spokesman for the interior ministry said at least five people were killed and two wounded u president donald trump ha been briefed on the attack white house press secretary sarah sander said islamic state s local affiliate which first appeared in eastern afghanistan near the border with pakistan in early ha become increasingly active and ha claimed several recent suicide attack in kabul it ha frequently fought taliban militant and ha been heavily targeted by u air strike and special force operation in it main stronghold in nangarhar province but there remains considerable uncertainty about how the group operates and the exact nature of it connection with islamic state in iraq and syria
Title_Text: islamic state claim blast at afghan intelligence agency in kabul

Text: havana reuters  jill biden wife of u vice president joe biden arrived in cuba on thursday the latest sign of the rapprochement between the cold war foe that saw president barack obama and his family visit in march biden wa greeted at havanas international airport by josefina vidal who is leading negotiation with the united state a head of u affair at the cuban foreign ministry biden plan to watch a match between the u and cuban soccer team on friday in havana go on social medium at one of cubas new wifi hot spot and visit a teacher college among other activity according to u diplomatic source in havana ambassadoratlarge for global womens issue cathy russell and assistant secretary of state for educational and cultural affair evan ryan are accompanying biden who will also travel to central camaguey province before heading to the dominican republic on sunday a white house statement said biden herself an educator wa scheduled to meet with government official and engage with a diverse range of cuban on topic related to culture education and health the obamas visit highlighted the warming trend in bilateral relation announced by both country in december after month of secret talk and more than a halfcenturys estrangement some u lawmaker strongly oppose the move arguing that communistruled cuba must do far more to improve human right before it can deal normally with the united state agreement have been reached in area such a law enforcement the environment resumption of postal service and commercial flight while talk on such thorny issue a fugitive and reparation continue the decadeslong u trade embargo on cuba remains in place and can only be lifted by congress although obama ha used his executive authority to chip away at it both side have said they want to strengthen their economic relationship but the united state ha complained the cuban have been slow to take advantage of opening carved out by obama for example trade with the private sector while cuba say u sanction make most trade and investment impossible u trade representative michael froman is also in havana where he is scheduled to meet on friday with foreign minister bruno rodriguez and foreign trade and investment minister rodrigo malmierca
Title_Text: jill biden wife of u vice president arrives in cuba

Text: berlin reuters  barring an upset the main uncertainty surrounding europe s most important election this year is not whether angela merkel will continue to lead germany after this weekend s vote but who with and how long they will take to get going although a surprise cannot be ruled out in the wake of any russian interference pollster say they are confident about their survey which show merkel s conservative winning the most seat in the bundestag lower house the farright antiimmigrant alternative for germany afd is set to enter parliament for the first time and some expert have said it may gain more support than the roughly percent poll suggest an alarming prospect for many at home and abroad but all the other party have ruled out joining it in a coalition  an inherent part of germany s electoral system  and the most likely scenario is probably a repeat of merkel s grand coalition with the social democrat spd she will start sounding out partner right after the sept vote but coalition building is a protracted process which could paralyze policy for month at a time when brexit ha shaken europe s foundation the process is especially complex this time a the number of parliamentary group could rise to six from four informal sounding and then exploratory talk precede formal coalition negotiation and party leader may also seek approval from their member before signing off on any deal depending on the shape of the coalition the main issue at stake are the integration of the more than million migrant who have arrived in germany in the last two year and investment in europe s biggest economy a well a merkel s leading role in talk on reform of the european union and relation with russia and turkey here are the main scenario conservative social democrat grand coalition the most likely option according to opinion poll merkel s parliamentary party made up of her christian democrat cdu and the bavarian christian social union csu ha governed with the spd for eight of the year that merkel ha been chancellor including the last four what make it possible merkel who ha steered the conservative towards the political center ground look comfortable ruling with the spd such a coalition would likely have a large majority provide continuity and broadly agree on europe turkey foreign policy migration and security issue hurdle it is a last resort for both side especially the spd which fear it will lose out a junior partner it want more emphasis on investment education tackling inequality and fair pension while conservative are more focused on tax cut the spd is also reluctant to back planned defense spending hike conservative free democrat blackyellow the conservative block and probusiness free democrat fdp are traditional partner especially on financial and economic policy having ruled together for almost half of postwar germany s seven decade if they win sufficient vote this is the most likely scenario what make it possible the probusiness fdp ha rebounded this year winning enough vote in a vote in germany s most populous state north rhinewestphalia in may to share power with the cdu there a repeat at federal level would herald tax cut and deregulation and possibly tighter law on immigration asylum seeking and security hurdle the fdp wa wiped out of parliament in after four chaotic year ruling with merkel it ha more radical tax reduction and privatization plan opposes deeper eu integration and want eu country to be able to quit the euro zone party leader christian lindner ha also suggested germany accept russia s annexation of crimea from ukraine something merkel ha ruled out conservative fdp green jamaica  reference to party color black yellow green a yet untested at a federal level this combination rule in the northern state of schleswigholstein what make it possible  if merkel s bloc can t form an alliance with the fdp or the green alone it may try a threeway deal both smaller party have played down this option but may be lured by the prospect of power hurdle  the green and fdp are at opposite end of the political spectrum policy clash would be likely on tax energy the eu and migrant conservative green blackgreen untested at a federal level this ha been mooted a an option under merkel who ha pushed renewable energy the cdu and green have worked together at regional level including in a greensled coalition in the rich southern state of badenwuerttemberg what make it possible the green leader are pragmatic world away from the ecowarriors who founded the party the prospect of power may persuade them to compromise such a coalition would promote a strong europe and focus on fighting climate change the green would push for a phaseout of coalfired power station hurdle doubtful they would win a majority conservative want lower tax while green want to tax the super rich green have a more liberal migrant policy which could pit them against the csu and they oppose plan to increase defense spending clash are also likely on some aspect of energy policy and auto emission regulation following the diesel scandal a minority government would be a first and stabilitycraving german would not like it but may prefer it to new election what make it possible if merkel fails to find a partner she may feel she ha a mandate to rule given her personal popularity she would probably get support for individual policy from the fdp spd and green hurdle merkel s natural caution coupled with german fear of instability a legacy of the fragmentation in the year that preceded the rise of hitler s nazi party spd left green redredgreen or rg highly unlikely never tested at a federal level a tie up between the spd and green preferred partner and the radical left party could be the only way for the spd to take the chancellery it is being tested in the state of berlin under spd leadership and with a left premier in the state of thuringia what make it possible for the first time the spd ha not excluded the possibility of joining the left such a coalition would probably focus on boosting investment and tackling inequality and adopt a more russiafriendly stance hurdle the left s link with communist in former east germany and painful spd memory of an exodus to the left over deep labor market reform more than a decade ago while the spd and green could rule together relatively easily the left want a top tax rate of percent a hour week and to replace nato with an alliance including russia for an interactive on german election click tmsnrtrsfvyqv
Title_Text: postelection conundrum awaits germany merkel
