Text: stockholm reuters  sweden will let some migrant who arrived a unaccompanied minor and turned during the process of applying for asylum stay even if their application are rejected a rare relaxation of rule imposed at the height of the migration crisis more than people sought asylum in sweden in more than of them unaccompanied minor swamping the migration authority and leading to a huge backlog of case monday s agreement between the social democrat and green to relax some rule iron out a rift in the minority government these young people have become a part of sweden they should not be hurt by the extremely long processing time deputy prime minister isabella lovin of the green party told a news conference sweden tightened asylum rule late in saying it could no longer provide housing for all those who had arrived asylum seeker number fell to less than last year of which only about were unaccompanied minor although the fall is also due to the closing of the main route from turkey to the eu through greece the november tightening of sweden s traditionally generous asylum policy wa a blow to the green party which ha also had to accept the sale of stateenergy company vattenfall s lignite mine in germany which it wanted decommissioned the new rule will apply to asylum seeker who were registered a minor before the new tighter law were announced provided the processing time had been longer than month they would be given temporary residency permit to finish high school which could become permanent if they found employment the government said the social democrat and green will still need backing from party outside government to get the agreement signed into law
Title_Text: swedish govt say to grant reprieve to some asylum seeker minor

Text: almaty reuters  uzbek president shavkat mirziyoyev reshuffled senior security official on monday sacking the defense minister who wa a holdover from the previous administration and appointing an ally abdusalom azizov ha replaced qobul berdiyev a defense minister the president s office said without explaining the reason for the reshuffle berdiyev had served a the central asian nation s defense minister since having been appointed by strongman leader islam karimov who died last september after running the former soviet republic for year azizov on the other hand ha been promoted by mirziyoyev who named him interior minister shortly after being elected president last december pulat bobojonov previously a regional governor wa named interior minister on monday the reshuffle leaf rustam inoyatov the head of the snb state security service a the only karimovera senior security official still in office
Title_Text: uzbek leader reshuffle security official remove veteran defense minister

Text: buenos aire reuters  alberto nisman the argentine prosecutor who wa found dead day after accusing former president cristina fernandez of covering up iran s role in the bombing of a jewish community center wa murdered a federal judge said on tuesday in a page ruling judge julian ercolini said there wa sufficient proof to conclude that the shot to the head that killed nisman in january wa not selfinflicted that marked the first time any judge ha said the case wa a murder fernandez and others had suggested the death wa a suicide but a prosecutor investigating the case last year recommended it be pursued a a murder probe nisman s death could not have been a suicide ercolini wrote in tuesday s ruling which also charged diego lagomarsino a former employee of nisman s with accessory to murder lagomarsino ha acknowledged lending nisman the gun that killed him the day before he wa to appear before congress to detail his allegation against fernandez but he ha said nisman asked him for the gun to protect himself and his family fernandez now a senator wa indicted for treason earlier this month over nisman s allegation that she worked behind the scene to clear iran of blame for the attack on the amia jewish center which killed people in an effort to normalize relation and clinch a grainsforoil deal with tehran human right group and the former head of interpol have criticized that indictment tehran ha denied link to the attack
Title_Text: argentina judge say death of prosecutor nisman wa murder

Text: santiago reuters  chile s stock market ha priced in a victory of conservative presidential candidate sebastian pinera even though progressive candidate could form an alliance in a december runoff trader and analyst said the ipsa stock market index ha surged percent this year and is on track for it best year since spurred by a rebound in price of topexport copper and poll that have shown pinera ahead in the race pinera a wealthy businessman and supporter of freemarket policy is expected to come in first by a wide margin in november s firstround vote but he is unlikely to win an absolute majority that would result in a close runoff against the leading progressive candidate the majority is left of center said kenneth bunker a political scientist at universidad central de chile a pinera victory depends on division within the left the most recent gfk adimark poll show pinera who ha consolidated the support of the country s political right leading at percent of the vote centerleft senator alejandro guillier is second with percent well ahead of several candidate promising to continue president michelle bachelet s socially progressive policy hardleft candidate beatriz sanchez who ha proposed billion of dollar in new tax on mining company wa third at percent a campaigning officially began last week guillier appealed for unity saying in a radio interview that he would share his policy platform with rival on the left to try to align their position no one doubt that in the second round we will all be together guillier said at a rally while chile remains one of latin america s most businessfriendly country public debt ha grown a falling copper price hit government revenue and bachelet critic say she ha not prioritized growth last month her top economic official resigned in part over the government s rejection of a  billion copper and iron project on environmental ground investor are particularly attentive to candidate proposal related to mining chile s most important industry guillier and pinera have both pledged to streamline the mine permitting process though guillier ha suggested modifying freetrade accord to promote domestic mineral processing in a banner year for emerging market the ipsa ha outpaced most regional peer brazil s bovespa index ha surged percent peru s leading index is up percent and colombia s colcap index is up percent only argentina s merval up percent ha surged more the industrial and raw material sector have led chile s market gain surging and percent year to date respectively lithium miner sociedad quimica y minera de chile sa ha risen percent in the past month while shipping firm compania sud americana de vapores sa is up percent in recent client note credit suisse and jp morgan have said the socalled pinera effect ha passed and that now might be the time for trader to take profit or wait for election result hugo rubio president of brokerage btg pactual chile said a pinera loss would cause a doubledigit drop in the stock market though the full extent would depend on the candidate it s a risk the market don t seem to be alive to at this stage said edward glossop emerging market economist at capital economics in london the risk are to the downside
Title_Text: chile leftwing candidate could form alliance threatening market rally

Text: washington reuters  near the end of president donald trumps rocky first year in office white house aide view imminent victory on a tax overhaul a a starting point to strengthen his weak approval rating ahead of key congressional election next november some republican said any effort at a political turnaround must include reining in trumps habit of lashing out at critic on twitter white house aide said they recognized that trumps poll number needed to start rising to limit the damage in election in which his fellow republicans continued control of congress will be at stake a democratic takeover of the house of representative and senate could jeopardize trumps agenda we have to grow we have to move up and i think having more success like the tax vote will be important to us said a senior white house official administration official said trump would seek to use momentum generated from the biggest tax rewrite in year to help propel other legislative priority including an infrastructure program and welfare reform final passage of the republican tax bill is expected on wednesday in what would be trumps first major legislative victory since taking office in january but the tax bill carry risk republican insist it will boost the economy and job growth democrat condemn it a a giveaway to corporation and the rich in a reutersipsos poll some percent of adult said they opposed the tax plan while percent supported it unless trump practice greater discipline some republican strategist see disaster looming in the congressional election in which a third of the member senate and all seat in the house will be up for grab stop tweeting and start the new year with a new level of message discipline just try it itll work and youll get those poll number back up said republican strategist scott reed theyve got to focus on that job approval number because its a historic death watch for midterm election the record is strong his discipline is key for year two reed said trump ha repeatedly caused controversy with early morning tweet particularly those aimed at individual he raised hackle recently when he tweeted that democratic senator kirsten gillibrand would do anything for campaign donation there are definitely moment that wed all like to see stop one senior aide said some of the early morning stuff ha not been helpful over the last few weeks there ha been some talk in the white house and among trumps outside adviser about hiring a senior political adviser akin to former president barack obamas political aide david axelrod or former president george w bushs adviser karl rove the white house political director bill stepien is seen a a more datadriven adviser trump who see himself a his own strategist doe not have anyone steeped in politics like his former white house chief of staff reince priebus or former chief strategist steve bannon aide said there wa some discussion of getting trump into event with smaller setting in order to show a more personal side of the president his standard appearance is to go to an event deliver a speech to a big crowd and leave trump is up against a historical trend in which the party that hold the white house typically loses seat in the first congressional election after a presidents initial two year in office democratic president bill clinton had a percent approval rating in november and his party still lost seat in the house and eight in the senate trump wa at percent in a middecember poll from nbc news and the wall street journal republican strategist ford oconnell said trump had done much to keep his conservative base of support happy but had to expand his popularity to do that he need to ease voters concern about his fitness for office what he ha to do to win over people like independent and nevertrumpers is make the american people feel comfortable with him a president said oconnell his achievement are quite striking but hes just not connecting with the public
Title_Text: trump aide hope win on tax will stem slide in poll number

Text: you will not believe this whopper hillary clinton is dealing in vague answer that are really downright lie she claim in an interview that it wa the fog of war that made her lie to the family of the benghazi victim i say it wa cover your a time and that s what they came up with these people are sickening sunday on abc s this week while discussing the uncovered email showing democratic presidential candidate hillary clinton had told the egyptian prime minister that we know the attack in libya had nothing to do with the film prior to telling them it wa a youtube video that caused the terror attack clinton said she did not lie to them but instead wa caught up in the fog of war when confronted by video clip of family member of benghazi victim clinton said i understand the continuing grief at the loss that parent experienced with the loss of these four brave american i did testify a you know for hour and i answered all of these question now i can t i can t help it that people think there ha to be something else there i said very clearly there had been a terrorist group that had taken responsibility on facebook between the time that i you know when i talked to my daughter that wa the latest information we were giving it credibility and then we learned the next day it wasn t true in fact they retracted it this wa a fastmoving series of event in the fog of war i think most american understand
Title_Text: hillary clinton give lame excuse for why she lied to the family of benghazi victim video

Text: de moines reuters  texas senator ted cruz wa victorious in the first republican nomination contest of the white house race but there wa another big winner in iowa on monday night florida senator marco rubio and the republican establishment for month cruz and donald trumps brand of angry scorchedearth insurgent politics defined the race for the republican presidential nomination while more moderate candidate tussled with themselves to try to mount a challenge to them the hope among republican party leader ha long been for a champion to emerge and on monday that person wa rubio who finished a hair behind trump and only a few point behind cruz when rubio took the stage in a hotel ballroom after the final result were announced he gave what amounted to a victory speech this is the moment they said would never happen the firstterm senator said for month they told u we had no chance the fight for the nomination ha unmistakably entered a new phase we have a threeway race said craig robinson the former political director of the iowa republican party rubios night shocked iowa political observer like robinson who had predicted rubio would wind up far behind trump and cruz with perhaps around  percent of the vote he finished with percent rubios performance will strengthen his argument that supporter of other moderate establishment candidate such a former florida governor jeb bush new jersey governor chris christie and ohio governor john kasich should throw their support and their money behind him rubio could use the extra cash his campaign committee raised just over  million from donor in the fourth quarter of putting him well behind cruz who brought in more than  million to date his campaign ha raised nearly  million while cruz ha raised  million rubios super pac which can raise unlimited fund a long a it doe not coordinate directly with him also trail the pac supporting cruz it pulled in  million last year while cruzs pac raked in  million trump a billionaire largely selffunds his campaign rubios third place finish in iowa mean he is the consensus establishment candidate said douglas gross a republican strategist in de moines rubio flew to new hampshire on monday evening and will likely begin making that argument to voter there ahead of the states primary or early nominating contest on feb on the campaign trail in iowa rubio railed at many of the same target a cruz and trump islamic state immigration and president barack obamas healthcare overhaul popularly known a obamacare but he embedded his criticism within a more optimistic inclusive message the americanborn son of cuban immigrant rubio would be the first hispanic president its not enough to just be angry rubio told voter during lastminute campaigning in the weekend before the caucus vote anger is not a plan anger is not solution iowan who supported rubio at the caucus told reuters they responded to his positive message and viewed him a the best candidate to beat hillary clinton in the november election should she be the democratic nominee ive been looking for someone who really will be an agent for change and i think marco rubio will be that guy said kevin huerkamp of clive iowa according to election return rubio swamped both cruz and trump in iowas urban area  de moines iowa city davenport suggesting that he could prosper when the republican race progress to denser more populated state such a florida and ohio this story ha been refiled to replace rubios name in last paragraph with trumps
Title_Text: marco rubio emerges a champion of battered republican establishment

Text: washington reuters  the u senates number two democrat dick durbin said on monday that president donald trumps conduct revealing classified information to the russian a reported by the washington post wa dangerous and reckless this conduct by the president is not only dangerous its reckless it is reckless for him to disclose to the russian foreign minister and ambassador sensitive top secret information durbin told reporter outside the senate durbin said he had not been briefed separately on the matter and that he wa commenting on the post story classified information cannot be kept from a u president durbin added but he hoped republican will make it clear to trump that his conduct jeopardizes our national security
Title_Text: u senate number two democrat call trump conduct dangerous

Text: washington reuters  u senator susan collins a republican member of the intelligence committee said democrat should be called again to testify about report that their party and hillary clintons presidential campaign paid for part of a dossier that detailed accusation about president donald trumps tie to russia the washington post reported last week that marc elia a lawyer for democratic presidential candidate clinton used campaign fund to hire fusion gps the firm behind the dossier committee in both chamber of congress have been investigating the origin and content of the document john podesta who wa clintons campaign chairman and u representative debbie wasserman schultz who wa the head of the democratic national committee at the time a well a elia absolutely need to be recalled to testify collins said in an appearance on cbs face the nation its difficult to imagine that a campaign chairman that the head of the dnc would not know of an expenditure of this magnitude and significance collins said but perhaps theres something more going on here but certainly its worth additional questioning of those two witness and the lawyer absolutely he more than anyone it ha been widely reported that supporter of republican jeb bush a primary opponent of trump initially paid for the firms research perkins coie elias law firm confirmed on tuesday that it had hired fusion gps in april the washington free beacon a conservative online publication backed by billionaire republican megadonor paul singer said on friday it wa the original funder of the fusion gps project to compile opposition research on multiple republican presidential candidate including trump known a the steele dossier because it wa compiled by former mi officer christopher steele the document identified russian businessmen and others who u intelligence analyst have concluded are russian intelligence officer or working on behalf of the russian government representative trey gowdy a republican who run the house oversight committee said in an appearance on fox news sunday that he wa more interested in whether the federal bureau of investigation or the department of justice used the dossier in conducting their own probe i dont expect the democratic national committee to be objective gowdy said almost by definition opposition research is not objective the next thing that house intel is trying to find out is whether or not the u government relied on it
Title_Text: republican senator want democrat to testify on trump dossier

Text: during a campaign stop republican primary candidate ted cruz wa confronted with the most wellknown troll in united state politics in case you are not in on the joke vermin supreme run in every presidential election he is a performance artist who pull stunt that satirize the u election systemthe confrontation wa hilarious to say the least supreme and a group of his supporter ambushed cruz who wa standing outside his campaign bus they swarmed cruz carrying handmade vermin supreme sign shouting into a megaphone supreme asks cruz ted cruz do you agree that the waterboarding water should be fluoridated shouldn t we at least fluoridate the water that we use to water board the bad people with that s supreme s act in a nutshell he make completely ridiculous comment about either real issue or fictional one supreme rose to fame instantly when a video wa published online that showed him campaigning on the promise that if he is elected everyone will get a free ponyobviously not knowing what the heck is going on cruz flees to the safety of his campaign bus once inside supreme shout into the megaphone towards the bus surrender ted cruz surrender we have you surrounded you must surrender immediately put your hand in the air and drop your pant for your safety thank you mr cruz why do you hate america sir why do you hate america taking shot at both cruz s religious zealotry and his hawkish foreign policy platform supreme concludes the protestcampaign eventperformance piece by holding a prayer supreme prays that that uh we don t get into any war and the war that we do get into against narnia that there will not be very many american causality the video of the encounter wa posted to twitter you can watch it below in fullvermin supreme troll ted cruzhttpstcossdaufyd independent journal injo february featured image from video screenshot via twitter
Title_Text: ted cruz wa just trolled by the master campaign troll  vermin supreme video

Text: watchmuir and a we walked through the white house we asked the president about the voice just outside washington dc and across the country the more than a million woman men and child who marched during the inaugurationlet me just ask you while we re standing outside could you hear the voice from the woman s march here in washington we know there were more than a million people who turned out and you are their president now tootrump that s truemuir could you hear them from the white housetrump no i couldn t hear them the crowd were large but you will have a large crowd on friday too which is mostly prolife people you re going to have a lot of people coming on friday and i will say this and i didn t realize this but i wa told you will have a very large crowd of people i don t know a large or larger some people said it will be larger prolife people and they say the press doesn t cover themmuir i don t want to compare crowd size again i i i trump no you should but let me just tell you what you do say is that the press doesn t cover themmuir we saw the march around the country and you are their president now do you sense the responsibility to reach out now and to unite them for those woman men and child who marched who are watching this what would you say to themtrump i do but i have to also say we just had an election a few week ago and they voted in many case and some case they didn t vote i imagine and we did have an election with that being said absolutely have responsibility to everybody including people that didn t vote for donald trump totallyhere s vice president mike penny s amazing speech to the march for life marchersclick here to see abc s published transcript the conversation about abc intentionally ignoring massive march for life crowd ha been removed here is the abc interview in it entirety

Text: de moines reuters  an influential conservative magazines rejection of donald trumps presidential candidacy triggered a fire storm on friday with republican rival saying it is validation of what they have been saying all along that trump is not a conservative with iowa to kick off the republican search for a presidential candidate with it feb caucus trump and his aide reacted with scorn to the editorial in national review which wa signed by prominent conservative intellectual the against trump editorial by national review a new yorkbased magazine founded in by famed conservative thinker william f buckley jr wa scathing trump is a philosophically unmoored political opportunist who would trash the broad conservative ideological consensus within the gop republican party in favor of a freefloating populism with strongman overtones national review said trumps opponent in the nomination fight pounced quickly i dont think donald is running a a movement conservative republican candidate marco rubio told fox news i dont think hes ever said that its clear hes not i mean what hes running a is someone whos a populist whos upset about the direction of this country republican candidate jeb bush told fox that national review wa just telling the truth this transformation to conservative that he claim hes done need to be tested bush said the republican national committee concerned that the magazine wa taking side dumped national review from cosponsoring a candidates debate on feb in houston the national review editorial emerged a some establishment republican figure debate whether trump is a preferable standardbearer for the nov election instead of the other leader in the republican race texas senator ted cruz trump anxious to put his stamp on the race with a victory in iowa tweeted that the national review is a dying magazine and a ghost of it past his campaign manager corey lewandowski said the publications conclusion is irrelevant the bottom line is nobody cares he told cnn the average voter in iowa doesnt care the average voter in new hampshire doesnt care trump is currently in position to seize control of the race poll show he could win not only iowas caucus but also new hampshires firstinthenation primary on feb which would put him on a strong path to the presidential nomination a cnnorc poll on thursday said trump had taken a solid lead over cruz in iowa with percent to percent for cruz cruz ha led other poll in iowa both men will campaign in iowa on saturday the same day that the influential de moines register newspaper will announce it endorsement for the caucus trumps campaign released a tv ad accusing cruz of being weak on illegal immigration against trump began trending on twitter in the united state by friday morning most of the response on the social medium site wa negative toward national review with several twitter user expressing dismay over the publications decision to criticize the frontrunner national review is leading a coalition against trump wrote jeff fogle jefffogle we the people will get him in office if we push hard stick together we can do it without any sense of self awareness nro national review ignores it attack on conservative last cycles tweeted madlaw madlaw additional reporting by doina chiacu in washington editing by dan grebler sap is the sponsor of this coverage which is independently produced by the staff of reuters news agency
Title_Text: magazine antitrump editorial spur republican debate

Text: in robert slater wrote a book called no such thing a overexposure inside the life and celebrity of donald trump it wa a biography but eventually it turned out to be an example of how trump resort to bribery to rewrite his own public historydonald being donald his own ego demanded he get involved personally in the book s creation once he wa made aware of it he had to ensure that it wa nothing but a positive story about himslater described what happened when trump saw the book he asked me to take out an anecdote that he had told me on the plane flying to chicago about how he had informed his second wife that he wa going to divorce her by announcing it first to the new york post greatest anecdote anybody ha ever told me he put the newspaper down in front of her door that said donald is divorcing marla that s how she learned about the divorcedonald wa not even enough of a man to tell his own wife that he wanted a divorce he wa such a coward and bully that he announced it to a tabloid trash newspaper while publicly shaming her for literally the entire world to see how the hell will he ever deal with vladimir putin if he can t deal with talking to his own wifethen there s that bit about the bribe trump promised slater that if he liked the book he would buy a huge number of them this is how trump operates he s so ashamed of his past that he offer money in order to whitewash his own historyslater said that his publisher saw nothing but dollar sign so despite his inclination at first towards integrity and truth they gave in and whitewashed the biography of those fact to ensure a big payday directly from trump s walletat the end of the day trump is the longest term case study for affluenza he wa born a rich ahole who just spent year growing bigger given his celebrity he literally globally shamed his wife at the time then used money to avoid some of the consequence of his actionsfeatured image via getty
Title_Text: trump bribed an author to hide these fact about how cruelly he divorced one of his wife

Text: frankfurt an der oder germany reuters  the first farright party set to enter germany s parliament for more than a half a century say it will press for chancellor angela merkel to be severely punished for opening the door to refugee and migrant the alternative for germany afd which ha also called for germany s immigration minister to be disposed of in turkey where her parent come from could become the third largest party with up to percent of the vote on sept poll show that is far less than similar movement in other european country  in france farright leader marine le pen won percent of the vote in may and in the netherlands farrightist geert wilder scored percent in a march election but the prospect of a party that the foreign minister ha compared with the nazi entering the heart of german democracy is unnerving the other party they all refuse to work with the afd and no one want to sit next to them in parliament leading afd candidate alexander gauland denies they are nazi saying others only use the term because of the party s popularity it ha won support with call for germany to shut it border immediately introduce a minimum quota for deportation and stop refugee bringing their family here we re gradually becoming foreigner in our own country gauland told an election rally in the polish border city of frankfurt an der oder a song with the lyric we ll bring happiness back to your homeland blared out of a blue campaign bus and the yearold lawyer said germany belonged to the german islam had no place here and the migrant influx would make everyone worse off gauland provoked outrage for saying at another event that german should no longer be reproached with the nazi past and they should take pride in what their soldier achieved during world war one and two the nazi ruled germany from to during which time they killed million jew in the holocaust and invaded country across europe the afd could end up a the biggest opposition force in the national assembly if there is a rerun of the current coalition of merkel s conservative and social democrat spd one of the most likely scenario that would mean it would chair the powerful budget committee and open the general debate during budget consultation giving prominence to it alternative to government policy georg pazderski a member of the afd s executive board told reuters his party would use parliamentary speech to draw attention to the cost of the migrant crisis trouble in the euro zone  which the afd want germany to leave  and problem related to the european union we ll have a voice when we re in parliament he said we won t be an easy opposition he expects other party will shun the afd for a year or two but ultimately work with it pointing to the regional assembly in the eastern state of saxonyanhalt where the afd and merkel s christian democrat voted to set up a committee to investigate leftwing extremism gauland told reuters the afd would call for a committee to investigate the chancellor after entering parliament we want m merkel s policy of bringing million people into this country to be investigated and we want her to be severely punished for that for an interactive graphic on german election click tmsnrtrshnqct mp have already changed the qualification for the ceremonial post of doyen of parliament to the longestserving mp rather than the oldest likely to have been an afd member sahra wagenknecht top candidate of the radical left party told reuters it wa important to look at individual for committee but added i won t elect any afd member who belongs to bjoern hoecke s wing and who really represents nazi view into any position of responsibility hoecke ha denied that adolf hitler wa absolutely evil described berlin s holocaust memorial a a monument of shame and demanded a degree turnaround in the way germany seek to atone for nazi crime the justice minister said some of the afd s program like it demand to ban minaret is unconstitutional alexander hensel who studied the afd s role in regional parliament for the otto brenner foundation said debate in state assembly had become more polarized since the afd arrived and some other mp would not shake hand with the newcomer the afd s aggressive rightwing position have intensified the debate while the tone and way people deal with each other in parliament ha become noticeably rougher due to the afd s tough rhetoric and targeted provocation he said unlike previous rightwing movement in germany the afd  founded in by an antieuro group of academic  ha become socially acceptable so radicalized people from the middle class feel able to vote for it alongside classic radical rightwing voter said manfred guellner head of forsa polling institute you don t vote for skinhead but you can vote for professor in suit said guellner referring to the like of gauland who tends to wear tweed jacket the afd is unlikely to gain much more support though said jackson janes president of the american institute for contemporary german study predicting worsening infighting over whether to aim for government or stay in opposition they ll add to the yelling and screaming in the bundestag he said but added i don t see them spreading like a cancer through society
Title_Text: farright party likened to nazi to shake up german parliament

Text: washington reuters  u senate republican were considering a raft of lastminute change to their sweeping tax bill on friday a they edged toward a final vote that could move congress to yearend enactment of tax cut for business and individual deal include a higher tax deduction for owner of passthrough business and a phaseout of full expensing for business capital investment to pay for these change republican say they will no longer repeal the alternative minimum tax for corporation and individual and will raise tax rate on the repatriation of corporate profit held overseas senate republican have yet to unveil a final bill for adoption but here is an unofficial list of anticipated change according to lawmaker and lobbyist passthrough senator ron johnson and steve daines announced their support for the tax bill after securing agreement on a bigger tax break for the owner of passthrough enterprise including small business scorporations partnership and soleproprietorships an original percent deduction would rise to percent full expensing senator jeff flake who wa a holdout over deficit concern agreed to vote yes after republican leader agreed to change a provision allowing the full expensing of business capital investment to sunset after five year flake worried that congress would be unable to eliminate the benefit cold turkey allowing it to bleed red ink for year to come but the arizona republican say the change would instead phase out full expensing over three year beginning in year six retirement saving senator susan collins said she persuaded republican leader to retain catchup contribution to retirement account for church charity school and public employee medical expense collins also said she wa able to include language to reduce the threshold for deducting unreimbursed medical expense for two year to percent of household income from percent state and local property tax collins ha proposed an amendment that would retain a federal deduction for up to  in state and local property tax individual alternative minimum tax rescinding a proposed repeal of the amt and instead increase exemption level and phaseout threshold is also on the table corporate alternative minimum tax so is rescinding a proposed repeal of the corporate amt repatriation another change could be to increase tax rate on u corporate profit held overseas to percent for liquid asset and percent for illiquid holding up from percent and percent respectively
Title_Text: factbox republican sidedeals build support for senate tax bill

Text: in yet another bombshell report newsweek just revealed that vladamir putin and the russian government are actively trying to help donald trump win the election because they believe he will help them weaken our nato alliesthe republican nominee s connection to russia have been a huge topic in the news for many month due to his compliment about putin and the fact that some of his closest campaign ally have connection to russiain addition trump ha declared that he will consider pulling united state support from nato and even strongarmed the republican party to ditch a platform plank condemning russia s aggression toward ukraineand putin ha rewarded trump by directing russian medium to blare out support for him and russian hacker have been busy hacking american computer system in an effort to hurt the democratic party and hillary clintonof course trump ha defended russia despite the cyberattacks being confirmed by western intelligence agency in the united state and europe trump wa even briefed about this and yet he still denies that russia is the perpetratorand that is leading many of our closest ally to worry about what could happen if trump becomes presidentaccording to newsweekofficials from two european country told newsweek that trump s comment about russia s hacking have alarmed several nato partner because it suggests he either doe not believe the information he receives in intelligence briefing doe not pay attention to it doe not understand it or is misleading the american public for unknown reason one british official said member of that government who are aware of the scope of russia s cyberattacks both in western europe and america found trump s comment quite disturbing because they fear that if elected the republican presidential nominee would continue to ignore information gathered by intelligence service in the formulation of u foreign policyand we know russia is backing trump because they ended their hacking campaign when it seemed like he would be replaced a the nominee by a sane republican only to resume hacking on trump s behalf when he wasn t replacedwhen trump launched into an inexplicable attack on the parent of a muslimamerican soldier who died in combat the kremlin assumed the republican nominee wa showing himself psychologically unfit to be president and would be forced by his party to withdraw from the race a a result moscow put it hacking campaign temporarily on hold ending the distribution of document until trump stabilized both personally and in the poll according to report provided to western intelligenceand the united state election is not the only one russia ha interfered with the kremlin also spread misinformation that helped rightwinger take control in germany and caused the united kingdom to vote in favor of brexit both of which help russia weaken alliancesbut their true target is nato which is what stand in the way of russia overpowering europe and our ally fear that a trump victory on november th would embolden russia to do just thatofficials in western europe say they are dismayed that they now feel compelled to gather intelligence on a man who could be the next president of the united state but believe they have no choice moscow is seen a a direct threat to their interest both in it aggressive effort to reshape global alliance and for it power to damage western europe which obtains almost percent of it natural gas from russia should the united state the last remaining superpower tilt it policy away from nato to the benefit of russia the alliance between america and western europe could be transformed in unprecedented way and so for perhaps the first time since world war ii country in western europe fear that the american election should trump win could trigger event that imperil their national security and do potentially irreparable harm to the alliance that have kept the continent safe for decadeshere s video of rachel maddow explaining how big this news is via youtubeoh and one more thing while donald trump and republican continue to whine about how hillary clinton used a private server it turn out hillary wa smart to do so because the russian hacked into the state department email system which mean if she had used that system her email would have been obtained by the russian governmentso russia literally want trump to win so they can use him a their puppet to gain more influence in the world which mean more war less democracy and a united state that is weakerthat cannot be allowed to happen clearly the russian like trump and that should make all american cast their vote for hillary clintonfeatured image youtube
Title_Text: newsweek out trump a putins puppet and our nato ally are terrified video

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump on monday authorized an inquiry into chinas alleged theft of intellectual property in the first direct trade measure by his administration against beijing but one that is unlikely to prompt nearterm change trump broke from his day vacation in new jersey to sign the memo in the white house at a time of heightened tension between washington and beijing over north koreas nuclear ambition the investigation is likely to cast a shadow over relation with china the largest u trading partner just a trump is asking beijing to step up pressure against pyongyang u trade representative robert lighthizer will have a year to look into whether to launch a formal investigation of chinas trade policy on intellectual property which the white house and u industry lobby group say are harming u business and job trump called the inquiry a very big move trump administration official have estimated that theft of intellectual property by china could be a high a  billion expert on china trade policy said the long lead time could allow beijing to discus some of the issue raised by washington without being seen to cave to pressure under the threat of reprisal although trump repeatedly criticized chinas trade practice on the campaign trail his administration ha not taken any significant action despite threat to do so it ha declined to name china a currency manipulator and delayed broader national security probe into import of foreign steel and aluminum that could indirectly affect china china repeatedly rebuffed attempt by previous u administration to take action on it ip practice im sure they will formally reject this if an investigation is launched and there is an implication this is going to require negotiation to resolve it said matthew goodman a senior adviser for asian economics at the washingtonbased center for strategic and international study jonathan fenby an analyst at the t lombard consultancy said china wa not interested in a shortterm trade fix with the united state and will resist attempts to tie it down chinas policy of forcing foreign company to turn over technology to chinese joint venture partner and failure to crack down on intellectual property theft have been longstanding problem for several u administration the information technology industry council the main trade group for u technology giant such a microsoft msfto apple aaplo and google googlo said it hoped china would take the administrations announcement seriously both the united state and china should use the coming month to address the issue causing friction in the bilateral trade relationship before president trump and xi have their anticipated meeting ahead of the november apec leader meeting iti president dean garfield said in a statement the u chamber of commerce the largest business lobbying group said china needed to end forced technology transfer and to protect foreign intellectual property right in an editorial on monday the staterun china daily newspaper said the investigation will poison relation and warned the trump administration not to make a rash decision it could regret trump had been expected to seek a socalled section investigation earlier this month but an announcement wa postponed a the white house pressed for chinas cooperation on north korea section of the trade act of a popular trade tool in the s that ha been rarely used in the past decade allows the president to unilaterally impose tariff or other trade restriction to protect u industry from unfair trade practices of foreign country
Title_Text: trump order probe of china intellectual property practice

Text: mark anderson afpwith a little help from the virginia police in the fairfax county sully district a well a the obscure bilderberg mediarelations outlet and it may latecoming online announcement it s been confirmed that bilderberg will take place in virginia june  at the westfields marriot in chantillythe bilderbergers are naturally attracted to that snooty secluded hotel since they ve met there before in and in the year that jim tucker the late afp bilderberg hound made his last appearance covering the shadowy group after chasing these son of smokestack billionaire since the midsthe annual bilderberg gathering are perhaps the most exclusive and obscure among all the meeting of economic minister g g etc the world economic forum and other more familiar global grouping coming out of last year s meeting in dresden germany the bilderbergers are facing an altered world what with the u president being donald trump whose early action a president included pulling the u out of the bilderbergfavored transpacific partnership britain also voted just after last year s bilderberg meeting to exit the european union early bilderbergers beginning with their first meeting in holland in helped build the eu through all it intermediate stage to the present continue this story at afpread more bilderberg news at st century wire bilderberg file
Title_Text: bilderberg to meet next week in chantilly virginia

Text: don t worry the liberal elite always know what s best for the little peoplegoldman sachs chairman and un special representative for migration peter sutherland said yesterday that britain should take in more migrant in order to avoid creating an environment of xenophobia and racism shocking footage filmed in the french port town of calais show desperate migrant attempting to break into delivery truck heading to the united kingdom in another illustration of how the country s generous welfare system act a a beacon for illegal aliensthe clip show huge gang of migrant roaming around on a highway attempting to attack vehiclespolice or immigration authority are nowhere to be seen a migrant rip open the back door of a truck before attempting to pull down it content to make their way inside while others try to pull off an underside panela tour guide on the bus from where the footage is being filmed tell passenger don t panic guy we have locked all of the door try not to panic guy passenger are heard gasping in shock with one commenting this is what we ve seen on tv the migrant are keen to reach the uk because they can exploit the country s generous welfare system and obtain a much higher standard of living than in france where they are forced to reside in a makeshift tent village in calais known a the jungle around migrant live in the tent village with most of them coming from sudan eritrea libya and syriathe situation is so dire that a leading haulage group warned earlier this month that freight carrier could suspend supply going through calais altogether causing food shortage and massive price hikesdonald armour international affair manager at the freight transport association told the daily express that the uk supply chain is in danger of collapsing a a result of driver refusing to go through calaislast month maru international haulage company announced that they were boycotting calais over fear that somebody will be killed by migrant attempting to enter the ukvia info war
Title_Text: goldman sachs chairman think uk need more migrant to avoid appearance of racismwhile shocking new video tell another story

Text: milan reuters  antiglobalisation protester clashed with police in the italian city of turin on saturday in an attempt to reach the venue of a group of seven g meeting on labor and employment the demonstrator mainly protesting against lowpaid job and shortterm contract failed to push past police blocking access to the reggia di venaria a former royal residence on the outskirt of turin where labor minister from the g advanced economy had gathered some hooded protester threw firecracker and smoke bomb at the police after failing to get through the cordon the meeting called to discus the impact of digital technology on labor started on friday and riot erupted overnight into saturday in the center of turin
Title_Text: protester clash with police at turin g labor meeting

Text: new york reuters  the bill hillary chelsea clinton foundation would spin off it flagship health project into a completely independent charity if hillary clinton were to win the u presidency in november the charity announced on wednesday the clinton health access initiative which ha focused on reducing the cost of hiv medicine in subsaharan africa currently account for about two third of the foundations annual income and expense according to disclosure online the promise to carve it out of the foundation aim to quash concern that donor might try to seek special access in a clinton white house bill and chelsea clinton hillary clintons husband and daughter would step down from the health projects board and the project would no longer use the clinton name and instead would go by it acronym chai if the family returned to the white house next year the announcement said clinton ha defended her familys philanthropic organization against accusation by donald trump her republican rival and others that wealthy donor abroad and at home might expect favorable treatment from the u government she ha said no donor ever received inappropriate favor but her staff have said she recognizes reorganization would be necessary to avoid any appearance of conflict of interest on tuesday new york state attorney general eric schneiderman said his office had opened an inquiry into the donald j trump foundation to ensure the republican presidential nominees charity wa complying with state law governing nonprofit the inquiry followed report by the washington post regarding trumps foundation and his contribution to the charity he ha refused to release his tax return which would show charitable giving longtime clinton associate bruce lindsey ira magaziner and maggie williams would also step down from chais board and the remaining board member would replace all five in consultation with global health expert the charity said magaziner who ha been friend with bill clinton since they were student at oxford university would remain a the projects chief executive the board would draft a succession plan by the end of the year the announcement said if secretary clinton is elected president the change outlined here will be implemented and chai would become an organization completely independent of the clinton foundation the statement said bill clinton set up the foundation a he prepared to leave the white house in hillary clinton joined it board after leaving the u state department in but stepped down last year to seek the presidency the foundation announced last month that it would no longer accept donation from foreigner or corporation for it other work besides chai and said it would close overseas fundraising arm in sweden and the united kingdom
Title_Text: clinton foundation plan to spin off flagship health project

Text: berlin reuters  german chancellor angela merkel said on tuesday european union foreign minister would discus taking further sanction against north korea over it nuclear missile program at the weekend and that these were required urgently north korea s nuclear test are a flagrant violation of all international condition merkel told the bundestag lower house of parliament i say clearly and in the name of the whole government there can only be a peaceful diplomatic solution she added
Title_Text: germany merkel say urgently need more sanction versus north korea

Text: washington reuters  two top u intelligence official told a senate committee on wednesday they could not comment on conversation with president donald trump in answer to question on whether he tried to pressure them to curtail the governments russia probe im not going to talk about theoreticals and im not going to discus the specific of any interaction or conversation that i may or may not have had with the president of the united states admiral mike rogers head of the national security agency said at a senate intelligence committee hearing similarly director of national intelligence dan coat said it would be inappropriate for him to discus his own conversation with the president in a public forum
Title_Text: nsa chief intelligence director wont comment on trump conversation

Text: berlin reuters  talk to form a threeway german ruling coalition will continue into saturday if needed peter tauber secretary general of germany s conservative christian democratic union cdu said early on friday we still believe that it s worth it to work at it with our full energy tabuer told reporter after a marathon session of talk among the three political bloc broke up on the other hand it s evident that it s difficult
Title_Text: german coalition talk could stretch into saturday conservative leader

Text: raleigh nc reuters  thousand of people flocked to north carolinas capital on monday to show both support and disdain for a law that ha thrust the state into the international spotlight over it restriction on transgender bathroom access and gay right lawmaker returned to raleigh to begin a short session designed to address the state budget but controversy over the new law which ha drawn reaction from u presidential candidate u president barack obama and british prime minister david cameron among others is expected to dominate the measure put the state at the center of a debate over equality privacy and religious freedom a state propose legislation seen a discriminatory against gay and transgender people in the wake of a u supreme court last year ruling that legalized samesex marriage north carolina became the first u state to require transgender people to use restroom in public building and school that match the sex on their birth certificate rather than their gender identity fiftyfour people were arrested at the legislative building a they protested against the law on monday general assembly police officer scott cameron said our state is a state of crisis chris sgro executive director of the equality north carolina advocacy group said earlier in the day before activist delivered petition to republican governor pat mccrorys office demanding the laws repeal a group of democratic representative filed a bill seeking a repeal but leading republican lawmaker in the state have shown little willingness to back down and they were greeted at a rally on monday by thousand of people who came on church bus and held sign thanking them for the measure business leader entertainer and politician including obama and republican presidential frontrunner donald trump have come out against the law opponent contend it demonizes transgender people and limit government protection against discrimination for gay and lesbian supporter including social conservative and republican presidential candidate ted cruz say it is needed to protect woman and child from sexual predator in bathroom on monday singer demi lovato and nick jonas joined a growing list of entertainer who have canceled show in the state lovato wrote on twitter that she and jonas were protesting this hateful law a part of the backlash company and association have relocated convention and halted jobcreating investment project initially slated for north carolina republican state representative paul stam criticized company including paypal holding pyplo that have pulled job out of north carolina over the measure they have office in country where homosexual are executed he said the hypocrisy of those who oppose this bill is amazing
Title_Text: battle over nc transgender law intensifies a lawmaker reconvene

Text: yangon reuters  myanmar s army released a report on monday denying all allegation of rape and killing by security force having day earlier replaced the general in charge of the operation that drove more than rohingya muslim to flee to bangladesh no reason wa given for major general maung maung soe being transferred from his post a the head of western command in rakhine state where myanmar s military known a the tatmadaw launched a sweeping counterinsurgency operation in august i don t know the reason why he wa transferred major general aye lwin deputy director of the psychological warfare and public relation department at the ministry of defense told reuters he wasn t moved into any position at present he ha been put in reserve a senior un official who had toured the refugee camp in bangladesh on sunday accused myanmar s military of conducting organized mass rape and other crime against humanity the myanmar military said it own internal investigation had exonerated security force of all accusation of atrocity the investigator finding were posted on the facebook page of the military s commanderinchief senior general min aung hlaing the development came ahead of a visit on wednesday by u secretary of state rex tillerson he is expected to deliver a stern message to myanmar s general over whom national leader aung san suu kyi ha little control a spokeswoman for the u state department katina adam said the united state wa aware of report of the general s replacement and added we remain gravely concerned by continuing report of violence and human right abuse committed by burmese security force and vigilante those responsible for abuse must be held accountable lawmaker in washington are pressing to pas legislation imposing economic and travel sanction targeting the military and it business interest in an oped in britain s guardian newspaper on monday republican representative steve chabot and democratic representative joseph crowley said it wa time to expeditiously impose sanction the u need to send a clear message that there is no excuse for a cruel extensive and grossly disproportionate crackdown on civilian they said the government in mostly buddhist myanmar which is also known a burma regard the rohingya a illegal immigrant from bangladesh leader of asian nation meeting in manila on monday skirted around the exodus of the rohingya disappointing human right group who were hoping for a tough stand maung maung soe s transfer wa ordered on friday and brigadier general soe tint naing formerly a director in logistics wa appointed a the new head of western command made up of three division western command is overseen by the bureau of special operation which report to the office of min aung hlaing a senior un official un high commissioner for human right zeid ra ad alhussein ha described the army s action in rakhine a a textbook example of ethnic cleansing myanmar say the clearance operation wa necessary for national security after rohingya militant attacked security post and an army base in the state on aug the internal investigation put the number of fighter involved in the attack at over more than doubling an earlier official estimate speaking in dhaka pramila patten the un special representative of the secretarygeneral on sexual violence in conflict said she would raise accusation against the myanmar military with the international criminal court in the hague when i return to new york i will brief and raise the issue with the prosecutor and president of the icc whether they myanmar s military can be held responsible for these atrocity patten said sexual violence is being commanded orchestrated and perpetrated by the armed force of myanmar otherwise known a the tatmadaw patten said following a threeday tour of the rohingya refugee camp in the cox s bazar region of bangladesh rape is an act and a weapon of genocide she said refugee have accused myanmar soldier and buddhist vigilante of torching their village murdering their family and raping woman patten said brutal act of sexual violence had occurred in the context of collective persecution that included the killing of adult and child torture mutilation and the burning and looting of village the form of sexual violence we consistently heard about from survivor include gangrape by multiple soldier forced public nudity and humiliation and sexual slavery in military captivity one survivor wa in captivity for day by the myanmar army patten said the myanmar military s internal probe said that according to people interviewed from rohingya village soldier did not fire on innocent villager rape or commit sexual violence against woman nor were there any killing or beating of villager and the security force did not carry out any looting or set fire to rohingya mosque it said the report also concluded that security force only used small arm in clash with rohingya militant and there were no finding to suggest the use of excessive force it also blamed the militant for setting fire to the village and frightening and coercing people to leave their home myanmar is refusing entry to a un panel that wa tasked with investigating allegation of abuse after a smaller military counteroffensive launched in october the country is in the early stage of a fragile transition to democracy after being ruled by a junta for year and the general have retained their autonomy on matter of defense security and border issue under a constitution three general are member of the cabinet suu kyi ha said that any alleged atrocity should be substantiated and investigated while her government is working to stabilize rakhine in order for the rohingya to return for now though the flow is one way the international rescue committee a new yorkbased aid agency reckons that around twothirds of an estimated rohingya remaining in myanmar could head across the border in the coming month
Title_Text: myanmar military denies atrocity against rohingya replaces general

Text: do you remember the time that republican thought automotive company should be allowed to go bankrupt they seem to have forgotten all about thathouse republican are set to give a big wet kiss to volkswagen in the form of a bailout that will prevent them from being sued by over american consumer against whom they admitted committing fraudvolkswagen ha been caught up in a huge scandal after it admitted to cheating on air pollution standard the context behind the scandal and ensuing lawsuit lie with defeat device that vw had installed in approximately of their diesel vehicle in order to fool emission testing in the usremember these are the same republican that worked to block a vw plant from opening in chattanooga tennessee because the plant wa going to be unionized this prof they don t really care about volkswagen they just really love hurting american citizensthe suit filed by the justice department on behalf of the epa could net volkswagen up to  billion in fine however that s not all of their problem the justice department also indicated that it could roll individual lawsuit into their litigation a well the individual lawsuit come from owner that might win up to  each in compensation for paying more than a gaspowered model cost plus decline in resale value add on a potential billion more from consolidated individual case whoa that s a lot of moneywhat will volkswagen do why run to republican of courseyes these are the same republican that wanted gm to just go bankrupt when a bailout for them would save job it s clearly a different story when government action help regular people for rich faceless corporation no bailout is too large or too insane and this bailout is truly insanethe bill which doesn t actually offer monetary compensation to cover vw s lawsuit cost will instead make it virtually impossible for a class action suit to be brought against the corporationfrom the fiscal timesthe simplicity of the vw bailout bill belies the chaos it would create proponent like the u chamber of commerce the bill s leading lobbyist say they merely want to get rid of noninjury classaction case based on potential damage from defective consumer product or corporate action that have yet to result in harm lawyer for classaction litigant argue that defective product deserve compensation even if the consumer hasn t yet been injuredbut the bill go much further stating that court may not certify classaction suit unless the plaintiff affirmatively demonstrates that each proposed class member suffered the same type and scope of injury a the named class representative or representative this is devastating because it set up all classactions to fail say attorney lori andrus who represents several volkswagen plaintiff if every class member must have the same type and scope of injury it force extensive proof for class certification essentially a fullblown trial up front where plaintiff will have to prove that their injury match with their fellow representativessource the fiscal timesto put it simply this isn t only for volkswagen this is a good strawman case that republican can use to do something they have wanted to do for decade shut the door to justice on american consumer that get screwed over by corporation it would allow for rampant abuse of the system resulting in substandard product being sold with little to no recourse available to consumer ever additionally it would overturn decade of judicial precedent where corporation were held accountable for fraud while circumventing federal rule that lay out class action standardsas an extra insult republican are pairing the bill with the fact act which would force public reporting of personal information of asbestos victim in an effort to sabotage their compensation for poisoning it s incredibly inappropriate for congress to send the message that it s ok to hurt people by the million said rebecca kaplan a volkswagen owner the more people you hurt the more this law will protect you featured image via screen capture from youtube
Title_Text: republican are about to bailout a foreign company that screwed over k american consumer

Text: washington reuters  u democratic presidential candidate bernie sander said on tuesday he ha placed a hold on president barack obamas nominee to head the food and drug administration claiming he is too close to the pharmaceutical industry to be an impartial regulator the move by the u senator from vermont come one day after democratic senator edward markey of massachusetts also placed a hold on the nomination until the agency agrees to reform it process for approving opioid painkiller the nominee dr robert califf is a cardiologist and researcher who joined the fda a year ago a a deputy commissioner he previously held senior position at duke university where he founded a large academic research center that received more than half of it funding from the drug industry dr califfs extensive tie to the pharmaceutical industry give me no reason to believe that he would make the fda work for ordinary american rather than just the ceo of pharmaceutical companies sander said in a statement a hold is a procedure by which a senator can prevent a measure from being voted on by the full senate peter pitt a former associate commissioner for external affair at the fda who is now president of the center for medicine in the public interest said no hold ha ever killed a vote on an fda commissioner and he doe not expect it to now it would be very undemocratic not to let the other senator have their say he said the senate committee on health education labor and pension voted earlier this month to confirm califf a fda commissioner a position open since dr margaret hamburg stepped down last february kevin griffis a spokesman for the department of health and human service which oversees the fda said califf is the right person with the right experience to build on the fdas unsurpassed record of protecting public health while encouraging innovation and the introduction of new lifesaving therapy to the market he added we would like to see him confirmed a quickly a possible on monday hhs said that addressing the opioid crisis wa a top priority markey want opioid approval matter to be reviewed by an fda advisory committee and belief the committee should consider the risk of addiction and abuse during the approval process he also want the agency to rescind approval of oxycontin for child and convene an advisory panel to guide that process sander said he shared markeys concern about the fdas approach to opioid painkiller too many american are dying from what ha become an opioid epidemic he said in a statement u death from drug overdoses hit a record in increasing percent to propelled by prescription painkiller and heroin abuse according to the u center for disease control and prevention the fda doe not control drug price but sander said that at a time when million of american cannot afford to purchase the prescription drug they require we need a leader at the fda who is prepared to stand up to the drug companies last year he said one in five american or million people could not afford to fill their prescription sander ha made healthcare a key theme of his campaign to be the democratic partys candidate in the november election he is competing with former secretary of state hillary clinton and former maryland governor martin omalley califf is widely expected to ultimately be confirmed a fda commissioner i dont think senator sanders hold will slow the process down pitt said califf will need to meet with sander and reassure him of the fdas independence pitt said in the meantime he added hes made his point reporting by susan heavey editing by david alexander jeffrey benkoe jonathan oatis and david gregorio sap is the sponsor of this coverage which is independently produced by the staff of reuters news agency
Title_Text: sander block obama nominee to lead fda citing industry tie

Text: bonn reuters  a coalition of u city company and other group said on thursday that many in the united state remained committed to the paris climate agreement despite plan by u president donald trump to pull out the we are still in coalition opened a square meter square foot tent pavilion outside a venue in bonn germany where delegate from almost nation are working on detail of the pact aimed at ending the fossil fuel era by by contrast the u government delegation office at the talk cover only square meter there is a tradition of nonpartisanship for protecting our planet said james brainard republican mayor of the town of carmel indiana at an opening event it is unfortunate we have moved away from it trump who doubt mainstream scientific finding that global warming is primarily caused by manmade greenhouse gas said in june he would pull out of the paris agreement and promote the u coal and oil industry the we are still in coalition of state city university faith group and environmental activist aim to show delegate from other nation at the nov  un talk that many american are working to cut greenhouse gas emission it say it signatory represent more than million american and  trillion of annual economic output fiji which is presiding at the un talk welcomed the coalition a a perfect example of how the paris accord aim to widen action beyond national government i am confident that coalition like yours will scale up because they are noble and inspiring inia seruiratu the fijian minister for agriculture and disaster management told the meeting and jeff moe director of product advocacy for ingersollrandirn said the company wa seeking to halve it greenhouse gas emission the we are still in pavilion is funded by bloomberg philanthropy the hewlett foundation and nextgen america california governor jerry brown also urged more action on climate change relative to the threat the urgency is not there and nobody is in charge that s the biggest problem he told a news conference in brussels brown travel to bonn on saturday

Text: at this point in trump s disastrous presidency it s pretty clear that the only one that think he s doing a great job is the underserving potus himself even his own supporter have lost faith in see thisaccording to msnbc s kyle griffin american are so turned off by trump that they don t even want to get anywhere near a product he touch apparently asking for trump s support is so toxic that it is basically suicide for business that s quite strange for a reality television star who brag about how good of a businessman he isalready we saw trump make endorsement on his twitter feed it turn out those inappropriate shoutouts did way more harm than good nbc news reported when donald trump won the oval office critic worried he would use his elevated stature to enhance his personal power to data of american would not use and might even boycott any product that trump endorses even amongst republican support is low only of gopers said they would be more likely to use a product if trump Text: after a tape wa released in which donald trump wa heard talking about how he love to grope woman even married woman you can expect a rash of his victim to come forward the first one it appears wa with his onetime business partner jill harththe new york time wrote about harth s experience on friday in it she called trump relentless the man she described in the interview wa a predator a wouldbe rapistshe and her longtime boyfriend george houraney attended meeting with trump in the early s even when sitting at a table with her boyfriend harth recalled trump putting his hand up her skirt all the way up to her crotch i didn t know how to handle it i would go away from him and say i have to go to the restroom it wa the escape route darth and houraney had approached trump with a Text: no evidence no worry obama s got this one meanwhile the democrat party s presidential nominee would already be in jail if king obama wasn t stalling the investigation in case you needed more evidence that obama s justice department is more interested in proving white people are racist than actually fighting crime here it is the fbi is offering a huge reward for anyone that can help them frame a white police officer who killed an armed black criminal in a completely justified shootinglast week a white mobile al police officer shot and killed michael moore during a traffic stop i know what you are thinking no not fat white liberal gasbag michael moore this wa black criminal michael mooreon june th officer harold hurst with the mobile pd wa on his way to work when he observed a white lexus make a dangerous left turn into traffic almost causing an accident the officer pulled the vehicle over that wa being driven by michael moore with two additional passenger the id moore gave wa fake and the car wa stolenofficer hurst called for back up and asked moore to step out of the car the officer observed a caliber handgun in moore s waistband and ordered him to put his hand up instead moore reached for the gun so hurst had no choice but to shoot on the ground moore wa still trying to get to the gun in his pant and the officer fired another round moore wa taken to the hospital where he diedpolice recovered a gun from moore s body and one of the passenger in the car confirmed that he had a gun on him at the time of the shooting this is a cutanddry of a justifiable police shooting a you will ever find but not everyone see it that way moore s family and local black activist insist this wa a murder and accuse the police of a cover upbecause any time black people complain about something no matter how little evidence there is to support their claim the fed come running the fbi and the u attorney s office have launched an investigation based on one little weird thingofficer hurst wa on his way to work and had yet to report for duty a such he didn t have his body cam on and didn t capture the deadly confrontation the fed figure this must be evidence that the officer is lying even though all evidence point to the event unfolding the way hurst said they didwith no actual evidence the fbi is offering a  reward to anyone who may have recorded the shooting on a cell phone according to alcom seriously there isn t any real crime going on so the fed want to spend a big wad of cash to help them build a case against a police officer who wa just doing his duty this is patheticobama s justice department ha wasted million upon million of dollar trying to prove how racist america is and come up with nothing with expensive investigation into the trayvon martin michael brown eric garner tamir rice and dozen of other black death yielding no fruit the administration seems hell bent on spending a much money a possible to prove al sharpton is right about somethingmichael moore wa driving a stolen car filled with stolen good he had a fake id and a handgun which wa also stolen a passenger in his car said moore had the gun and made a move for it before being shot why are the fed even looking at this caseand let s keep in mind that this is the same fbi that didn t see a problem with omar mateen the radical islamic terrorist who killed people in
