Text: dubai reuters  the deputy head of the palestinian islamist group hamas vowed to keep close tie with israel s archenemy iran and to maintain it weapon iranian medium reported on sunday rejecting israeli precondition for any peace talk hamas which is designated a a terrorist group by western country and israel signed a reconciliation deal this month with palestinian president mahmoud abbas s fatah faction undoubtedly the palestinian resistance force will never give up their arm the semiofficial news agency mehr quoted saleh arouri a saying at a meeting with the iranian parliament s speaker ali larijani in tehran israel said on tuesday it would not hold peace negotiation with a palestinian government dependent on hamas and demanded that hamas recognize israel disarm and sever it tie with iran our presence in iran is the practical denial of the third precondition cutting tie with iran arouri said earlier quoted by iran s far news agency in august a hamas leader said that iran wa again it biggest provider of money and arm after year of tension over the civil war in syria hamas had angered tehran by refusing to support it ally syrian president bashar alassad in the sixyearold civil war hamas seek israel s destruction it ha fought three war with israel since seizing the gaza strip from force loyal to westernbacked president abbas in
Title_Text: hamas deputy leader say to continue iran tie armed fight

Text: in the wake of election day and donald trump s win many american have been left scratching their head and wondering just what the heck happened according to a report by mcclatchy some civil right group say that voter suppression is what happenedkristen clarke the president and executive director of the lawyer committee for civil right under law said that in hindsight we will find that voter suppression figured prominently in the story surrounding the presidential election while voter suppression is hardly the only factor that brought u to this point a mcclatchy explains it did play an important role fourteen state had restrictive new voting law on the book for the first time in a presidential election this year according to the brennan center for justice at nyu school of law alabama arizona indiana kansa mississippi nebraska new hampshire ohio rhode island south carolina tennessee texas virginia and wisconsinthe law included a mix of photo id requirement for voter cut to early voting opportunity and curb on voter registration activity these law began to spread across the country after the midterm election of supposedly to protect against voter fraud which is virtually nonexistent by the waythe brennan center report that state have imposed stricter voter id law seven made registration more difficult six have cut early voting opportunity and three have made it harder to restore voting right to people with criminal conviction the center explains that these law which have been fueled by race and partisanship disproportionately affect minority the poor and younger voter all group who tend to lean to the leftclarke said on thursday that systemic barrier weren t the only obstacle voter faced this year long line at polling place voter whose name were missing from registration list a lack of assistance for nonenglish speaking voter and poll worker who requested strict photo id in state where no such id wa required also made it much harder to cast a ballot than it should have beenwade henderson the president of the leadership conference on civil and human right said that group monitoring the election have documented beyond any doubt that voter suppression and a conscious effort to shave off or percent of the vote in key state in all likelihood influenced the outcome of this election activist also voiced concern about purge of inactive voter from registration roll in numerous state and a drastic reduction in polling place across the countrya report by the leadership conference found that voting location were reduced in about percent or of county that were previously covered by section of the voting right act the result there were fewer site in which to cast a ballot in those jurisdiction with history of discriminatory voting practicesit is worth noting that many of these law were only able to be enacted because of the gutting of the voting right act while voter suppression is hardly the only factor responsible for trump s win it very well may have been what tipped the scale in his favorfeatured image via sandbox news
Title_Text: report civil right group say voter suppression is responsible for trumps win

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump came around to the decision to allow for more troop to be sent to afghanistan only after a prolonged internal debate in which he frequently tangled with his top national security adviser trump had repeatedly argued on the campaign trail last year that the longrunning war in afghanistan and iraq were a waste of life and billion of dollar that could be better spent at home an emotional visit in april to walter reed hospital where many grievously wounded soldier are taken for treatment only served to harden the presidents reluctance to send more troop trump said he did not want to send more young american to battle only to see them lose limb what are we doing there he asked his national security aide according to a senior administration official in a series of interview senior administration official said trump wa hard to persuade but finally  and begrudgingly  agreed to allow for a modest increase in troop number from the current to more than he first had to be convinced that the approach he wa approving wa markedly different from the strategy employed by his two immediate predecessor george w bush and barack obama since he considered them to have failed the official said in his primetime speech to the nation on afghanistan policy on monday night trump conceded that his original instinct on taking office had been to pull out but he wa then persuaded of the danger of a hasty withdrawal putting new emphasis on antiterrorism goal he said u troop were needed to prevent the taliban from taking over afghanistan and again making it a breeding ground for islamic militant this is not about nationbuilding again we are killing terrorists he said in the white house discussion some of trumps adviser appealed to his pride in his negotiating skill by saying he could succeed with the taliban where obama had failed in part because obama made the mistake of announcing that a surge of additional troop to afghanistan he approved in late wa temporary the president know that in order to get the taliban to the table he know that he first ha to prove that hes willing to keep pressure on them for a long a it take which obama failed to do said one of the official that doesnt mean he expects to sit down with them in qatar tomorrow trump challenged his adviser to provide clear measurement of how progress can be gauged with the goal of turning the tide in a battle in which the taliban appears to have gained the upper hand in recent month he want to be shown that were winning said one official they had to develop the metric for that in advance before he would agree to it he doesnt want to be told in two year that its just a bad a it wa but not worse if that happens then were really talking about a withdrawal he made that clear while trump wa joined in his skepticism by his chief strategist steve bannon who wa fired on friday after month of power struggle inside the white house multiple official said the debate wa less about bannon and more about trump himself the argument that white house chief of staff john kelly defense secretary jim mattis and white house national security adviser hr mcmaster made wa that previous effort faltered because the afghan and pakistani government did not step up and do what is required of them to help defeat the taliban and deny terrorist a haven in afghanistan the three  who have all had distinguished military career  also raised the specter of irans involvement in afghanistan an argument that helped given trumps desire to block tehrans expansionism in the middle east official said it wa hard to put together for him all the piece of a complicated puzzle that includes not just the three major regional player but also india china russia and iran said one official but the idea that he could succeed where his predecessor had failed had a certain appeal so did the idea of emphasizing this is part of the war against islamic terrorism not an effort to rebuild afghanistan something he had consistently opposed the official added the new trump strategy put greater emphasis on the responsibility of the pakistani and afghan government another important factor the official said wa convincing trump that the withdrawal he had advocated for year would force him to shoulder some of the blame for the taliban victory that surely would follow
Title_Text: bruising debate brings a reluctant trump around on afghanistan war

Text: beirut reuters  raqqa will be part of a decentralized federal syria now the city ha been freed from islamic state the usbacked militia that captured it said on friday tying it political future to kurdishled autonomy plan for northern syria the kurdishdominated syrian democratic force sdf said the people of the majority arab city and surrounding province would decide their own future within the framework of a decentralized federal democratic syria in a declaration formally announcing raqqa s liberation from islamic state after four month of battle the sdf pledged to protect the frontier of the province against all external threat and to hand control to a civil council from the city the usbacked sdf which is led by kurdish militia fighter and also includes arab captured the syrian defacto capital of islamic state s selfproclaimed caliphate this week in a decisive defeat for the group that had ruled over million of people from central syria to northern iraq in syria the fight against islamic state ha taken place amid a wider multisided civil war between the government of president bashar alassad who is backed by iran and russia and an array of rebel group supported by other power kurdishled authority in other part of the north say they want a federal system that would allow region to rule themselves without central control by the center they have been moving ahead with plan set it up despite discouragement from their u ally and strong opposition from both turkey and the syrian government in damascus turkey view the rise of kurdish power in syria a a threat to it national security viewing kurdish group in northern syria a an extension of the kurdistan worker party pkk which is fighting a threedecade insurgency in turkey turkey said on friday that a huge banner of jailed pkk founder abdullah ocalan unfurled in central raqqa by the usbacked kurdish force wa proof that washington had been working with terrorist the kurdishled autonomy plan in syria have advanced a diplomacy ha failed to make any progress towards a political solution to the sixyearlong war assad who is fast regaining territory in syria s most populous eastern region with iranian and russian military support ha repeatedly said the state will recover all syria asked about the sdf statement ali haidar the syrian government minister responsible for national reconciliation said raqqa s future could only be discussed a part of the final political structure of the syrian state the sdf dominated by the kurdish ypg militia ha established control over swathe of northern syria in operation backed by the usled coalition against islamic state mostly avoiding conflict with russianbacked progovernment force spokesman talal silo reaffirmed the sdf s plan to hand control of raqqa to a civil council formed of people from the city and to hand over internal security to a police force drawn from local recruit he called raqqa s liberation the final chapter of a struggle that began against islamic state from the town of kobani some three year ago though the sdf is still fighting the jihadist group in deir alzor province the united state ha said it will take the lead in helping to clear rubble and restore basic service to the city with islamic state s selfdeclared caliphate crumbling in it last remaining syrian stronghold assad s russian ally said on thursday the fight with the jihadist group would soon be over president vladimir putin expressed hope a new peace conference could be convened though the kremlin said on friday it wa too early to discus the timing or venue for the proposed congress of the people of syria
Title_Text: raqqa to be part of federal syria usbacked militia say

Text: ankara reuters  turkey s parliament approved a law to allow some stateemployed religious official to administer civil marriage a move opposition party view a another blow to secularism and woman s right under president tayyip erdogan the law passed late on thursday will allow mufti  official employed by the state s religious affair directorate  to perform civil marriage that were previously administered only by municipal official the secularist main opposition republican people party chp ha vowed to take the law to the constitutional court a soon a possible while the leftist prokurdish people democratic party hdp ha also opposed it critic fear the new law could lead to an increase in underage marriage citing the religious ceremony practiced in rural area where bride are sometimes under this pave the way for child bride because according to islam there is no age limit a girl who ha reached puberty can get married chp deputy chairman ozgur ozel told reuters ozel said the law included constitutional breach and disregarded the founding value of the constitutionally secular turkish republic civil marriage under the age of is illegal in turkey although in rural part of the sunni muslim nation of million religious ceremony are common hdp lawmaker huda kaya said the law wa a slightly formalized version of a previous controversial proposal that critic said could allow men accused of sexually abusing girl to avoid punishment if they marry their victim the proposal wa retracted from parliament last year after a public uproar they say this is against secularism the church doe this in the west erdogan said last week erdogan whose root are in political islam and his ruling ak party say the law is designed to speed up the officiating of wedding normally carried out by mayor at municipal office but one chp lawmaker ali seker said each state official had on average fewer than one wedding to conduct per day last year citing official statistic during a debate in parliament the law state that the office of mufti will be given the right to carry out wedding meaning the religious official could also appoint muslim cleric or imam to officiate civil wedding  an authority that ha never been granted to nonstate employee in modern turkey this is the act of legalising a social event that is part of turkey s tradition the spirit of the law must be in harmony with the spirit of social life justice minister abdulhamit gul said erdogan ha spent his political career fighting to bring religion back into public life in turkey and ha cast himself a the liberator of million of pious turk whose right and welfare were neglected under the secular elite liberal turk see erdogan a attempting to roll back the work of mustafa kemal ataturk the westernfacing founder of modern turkey this is a clear alternative to secularism even bringing this bill on the agenda is igniting a spark against secularism said canan gullu chairwoman of the turkish woman s association federation told reuters no matter what they do woman s fight will continue and democracy and secularism will survive
Title_Text: turkey to allow mufti to conduct wedding sparking uproar on left

Text: the following statement were posted to the verified twitter account of u president donald trump realdonaldtrump and potus the opinion expressed are his own reuters ha not edited the statement or confirmed their accuracy realdonaldtrump  drain the swamp should be changed to drain the sewer  its actually much worse than anyone ever thought and it begin with the fake news edt  after year of investigation with zero evidence being found chuck schumer just stated that democrats should blame ourselves not russia edt  sleazy adam schiff the totally biased congressman looking into russia spends all of his time on television pushing the dem loss excuse edt  republican have a last chance to do the right thing on repeal replace after year of talking campaigning on it edt  arriving at joint base andrew with secretaryperry secretaryzinke and secpricemd edt  any senator who vote against starting debate is telling america that you are fine w the ocarenightmare remark link whgovnnwsz pm  jambo remember your duty honor your history take care of the people god put into your life  and love cherish your country edt  source link bitlyjbhlu bitlyjpexyr

Text: barcelona reuters  with the spanish government ready to take over the running of catalonia on friday the loyalty of the local police to madrid or to the catalan cause will be tested if they are ordered to drag their former political master from office spanish police provoked international outcry by using baton and rubber bullet when they stepped in to try to stop an illegal independence referendum on oct after the local catalan force refused to prevent voting in what ha become the worst constitutional crisis in modern spanish history catalonia s secessionist government is intent on resisting spain s plan to remove it from power and there are doubt over how a divided and demoralized mossos d esquadra a the catalan police are called would respond if ordered to evict president carles puigdemont and his autonomous government by force national police could once again be on the front line the local police force is riven by distrust between those for and against catalan independence and is estranged from spain s national police force according to interview with mossos officer and national police the civil guard gave evidence against the mossos chief in a sedition inquiry after his force stood back and allowed voting to take place court document show five mossos officer speaking on condition of anonymity said they believed the strong force wa split among those who wanted independence and those who opposed it with three of those saying they would not use force to remove minister and lawmaker from power i m not going to use force and beat people with my baton if they are passive said a year mossos veteran and secessionist who declined to be named he said many others felt the same but added i would have to obey it my family ha to eat a mossos spokeswoman said the force wa neutral and not subject to any political or ideological criterion prime minister mariano rajoy is intent on thwarting the latest bid for independence by catalonia which ha percent of the spanish population but generates percent of the country s economic output to avoid what he belief will bring economic and social turmoil to the heart of the eurozone officer told reuters there wa also an antiindependence faction in the mossos d esquadra lad squad in catalan which us an encrypted chat app to share view on independence versus allegiance to madrid in a bid to impose it authority the madrid government will replace the mossos senior leadership but the question is whether this will be enough to ensure the force s loyalty the mossos stance will have a powerful influence on the million catalan a the force ha deep root in catalan society having emerged from citizen militia in the th century the mossos s reputation wa enhanced by it handling of an august van attack in barcelona which killed people rajoy will seek senate approval on friday to take the unprecedented step of assuming central control of catalonia including it government and the running of mossos the strategy will replace the mossos leadership including it two senior officer and commissioner and route the chain of command to a national police commander yet to be appointed who will report to the interior ministry official in madrid and a catalan police union said spain s foreign minister alfonso dastis said at the weekend before call for civil disobedience by the catalan government that we are not going to arrest anyone but a senior government source said force may be necessary depending on the reaction in catalonia if the parliament ha to be emptied out and closed if the councillor office have to be cleared out  if they obey there s no problem but if they don t obey it will have to be enforced the source said the monthslong standoff between madrid and proindependence leader progressively damaged morale inside mossos with hundred of officer opposed to independence looking to quit the force officer and union official say some complain they are sidelined by their proindependence colleague luis miguel lorente head of the national arp police union said about mossos officer had contacted his union for information on how to join national police force spain ha sent about police reinforcement to catalonia where protest on both side of the independence debate have drawn hundred of thousand of people onto the street extra police have been billeted in two cruise ship in barcelona harbor one of the ship is painted with cartoon character of tweety pie and sylvester the cat leading to tweety pie being adopted a the mascot of the independence movement by some campaigner participant in the referendum opted overwhelmingly for independence but turnout wa only about percent a catalan who favor remaining part of spain mainly boycotted the ballot secessionist said the result gave them a mandate for statehood spain wa only restored to democracy following the death in of dictator francisco franco under whom the catalan language and tradition were suppressed protest have been peaceful but the referendum showed how tension can swiftly escalate when madrid us national police despised by many secessionist to enforce antiindependence measure if mossos stand back again the senior government source said national police would step in once more a defiant catalan government which remains in power until the senate approves rajoy s plan said this week it civil servant including the mossos would continue to obey it instruction and those of it legislature that raise fear that puigdemont and regional lawmaker will refuse to leave their office or that their supporter may try to help by occupying the office a well a replacing mossos leader madrid may also redeploy mossos officer away from key government building and use national police instead an interior ministry official said relation between the regional and the national force are at rock bottom and no new joint investigation are being launched say officer from each force
Title_Text: demoralized and divided inside catalonia police force

Text: washington reuters  u house speaker paul ryan a republican will not accept a nomination to be a u presidential candidate his spokeswoman ashlee strong said on wednesday the speaker is grateful for the support but he is not interested he will not accept a nomination and belief our nominee should be someone who ran this year strong said in an email to reuters she wa responding to a report by politico that quoted former speaker john boehner a saying that ryan should be the republican nominee for president if the party fails to choose a candidate on the first ballot at the convention in july if we dont have a nominee who can win on the first ballot im for none of the above boehner said at the future industry association conference in boca raton florida politico reported on wednesday they all had a chance to win none of them won so im for none of the above im for paul ryan to be our nominee ryan who is from wisconsin and became house speaker last year ha been touted a a possible dark horse candidate for president should the republican convention fail to agree on any of the current contender on the first ballot ryan ha repeatedly insisted that he doe not want to run for president this year and a committee that sought to draft him closed last week after ryans office urged a halt to it activity ryan ran for vice president in on the unsuccessful republican ticket with presidential contender mitt romney u republican frontrunner donald trump scored big win in republican primary in florida illinois and north carolina on tuesday which brought him closer to the delegate he need to win the nomination but he still might fall short of the majority required enabling the party establishment to put forward another name at the july convention in cleveland a spokesman for boehner said wednesday that the former speaker who is from ohio had endorsed that states governor john kasich in the presidential race his boehners offthecuff comment this morning were about a hypothetical scenario in which none of the current candidate are able to secure the nomination at the convention the spokesman dave schnittger said
Title_Text: house speaker ryan will not accept a presidential nomination

Text: bill maher mocked the idea that ted cruz could possibly have affair with multiple woman and questioned whether five woman would want to have sex with the republican contender for the nomination maher said the national enquirer say they have the good that five woman had extramarital affair with ted cruz yes lady sex with ted cruz that s where you close your eye and imagine you re fcking newt gingrich even bill cosby s pharmacist say i don t think i ve got anything strong enough for that now i don t personally believe any of this is true i think i know who ted cruz is i m not saying he doesn t enjoy screwing woman he just doe it by defunding planned parenthood that s how he get his jolly maher wa referencing the national inquirer which name five woman that allegedly had affair with ted cruz cruz who present himself a a conservative candidate and a family man denies the accusation accusing donald trump of being behind the storymaher is right it doe all seem like a farfetched story who in their right mind would want to have sex with ted cruz and on top of all that there are allegedly fivethen again he is getting people to vote for him even though he ha the most draconian and racist policy of all the gop candidate beating out even trump i suppose anything is possiblewatch video here youtube httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvyhchiutytwfeatured image via video screenshot

Text: washingtonhigh point nc reuters  democratic presidential nominee hillary clinton consulted national security adviser on tuesday after weekend bomb blast renewed fear of domestic attack a republican donald trump accused her of pushing policy that made the united state less safe the two rival in the nov election have been vying to portray themselves a the best equipped to protect the nation the domestic security issue returned to the forefront after a new york city bomb injured people a pipe bomb went off and unexploded bomb turned up in separate incident in new jersey and a man stabbed people at a minnesota mall clinton spoke by phone with former defense department official michele flournoy former cia deputy head mike morell and other adviser her campaign said in an email we cant lose our cool and start ranting and waving our arms clinton said on the call according to her campaign in an apparent reference to trump we shouldnt toss around extreme proposal that wont be effective and lose sight of who we are thats what the terrorist are aiming for the call wa supposed to be open to news medium but when reporter called in they could not hear anything clintons campaign provided note to reporter afterward clinton ha called for better intelligence new effort to counter online recruiting of militant and smashing islamic state stronghold in the middle east she ha said trumps rhetoric against what he call radical islamic terrorism is helping islamic state recruit more fighter at a rally in high point north carolina trump countered by saying that clinton a democratic president barack obamas first secretary of state from to backed policy that made the united state less safe im much tougher than her on this horrible situation but she go around saying its a recruiting tool trump said the new york businessman accused clinton of supporting policy in iraq and syria that he said allowed islamic state to take root trump ha pointed to the pullout of u troop from iraq in  which occurred after the obama administration and iraqi leader could not agree on the withdrawal  and what he ha characterized a a push for regime change in syria a usled coalition ha conducted air strike on islamic state in iraq and northern syria trump also criticized clinton for supporting the entry of some syrian refugee into the united state reiterating his call for tougher vetting of people seeking admission he ha instead proposed safe zone for refugee which he say gulf state would fund theres nothing like doing thing with other peoples money trump said at a rally later on tuesday in kenansville north carolina on monday u authority arrested ahmad khan rahami following a shootout with police in linden new jersey in connection with the saturday night bombing in manhattans chelsea neighborhood rahami is a naturalized american citizen born in afghanistan law enforcement official were also investigating the stabbings also on saturday night at the st cloud minnesota mall a an act of terrorism an offduty policeman fatally shot the attacker dahir adan whom an islamic state news agency claimed a a soldier of the militant group reuters could not verify the claim adan came from a somali family that settled in the united state at the kenansville rally trump said he would dislodge a political establishment that he said ignored working people they go to the same restaurant they go to the same conference they have the same friend and connection they write check to the same think tank and produce the same paper its a gravy train that never ends trump said democrat in turn criticized trumps business activity u senate democratic leader harry reid called the real estate developer a fraud in a speech on the senate floor pointing to his multiple bankruptcy and lawsuit clintons campaign repeated it call for trump to release his tax return after the washington post reported trumps charitable foundation had spent thousand of dollar to settle lawsuit involving his business
Title_Text: clinton call national security team after attack a trump challenge her credential

Text: san diego reuters  the u judge overseeing a lawsuit against presidentelect donald trump and his trump university told both side they would be wise to settle the case given all else thats involved lawyer for the presidentelect are squaring off against student who claim they were they were lured by false promise to pay up to  to learn trumps real estate investing secrets from his handpicked instructor earlier on thursday u district judge gonzalo curiel tentatively rejected a bid by trump to keep a wide range of statement from the presidential campaign out of the fraud trial trump owned percent of trump university and had control over all major decision the students court paper say the presidentelect denies the allegation and ha argued that he relied on others to manage the business trial is scheduled to begin nov and curiel told lawyer he wa not inclined to delay the sixyearold case further trump lawyer daniel petrocelli said he would ask to put the trial on hold until early next year in light of the many task the magnate ha before his inauguration curiel said he would allow both side to file brief on whether to delay the case he also indicated they should consider making a deal it would be wise for the plaintiff for the defendant to look closely at trying to resolve this case given all else thats involved curiel said petrocelli told reporter after the hearing that trump might have to be a little more flexible about settling the case now that he is presidentelect although the lawyer wasnt sure his client would wa willing curiel said that he would allow trump to testify via video given his presidential obligation in the tentative ruling curiel based in san diego said trumps lawyer can renew objection to specific campaign statement and evidence during trial trumps attorney had argued that juror should not hear about statement trump made during the campaign including about curiel himself trump attacked the judge a biased against him he claimed curiel who wa born in indiana but is of mexican descent could not be impartial because of trumps pledge to build a wall between the united state and mexico trumps lawyer argued that curiel should bar from the trial accusation about trumps personal conduct including alleged sexual misconduct his tax and corporate bankruptcy along with speech and tweet they argued the information is irrelevant to the jury and prejudicial to the case in court paper lawyer for the student claimed that trumps statement would help juror a they weigh the republicans credibility defendants have not identified specific evidence that they wish to exclude curiel wrote on thursday accordingly the court decline to issue a blanket ruling at this time the judge also barred trump lawyer from telling juror that the university had a percent approval rate on student evaluation that rating is irrelevant a to whether trump university misrepresented itself curiel wrote curiel is presiding over two case against trump and the university a separate lawsuit by new yorks attorney general is pending
Title_Text: judge tell trump university litigant they would be wise to settle

Text: washington reuters  american who had cast their vote for the next president early on tuesday appeared to be worried about the direction of the country and were looking for a strong leader who can take the country back from the rich and powerful according to an early reading from the reutersipsos national election day poll the poll of more than people who have already cast their ballot in the presidential election showed a majority of voter are worried about their ability to get ahead and have little confidence in political party or the medium to improve their situation a majority also feel that the economy is rigged to mostly help the wealthy the poll which will be updated a additional response are tallied and vote are counted throughout tuesday found  percent agree that america need a strong leader to take the country back from the rich and powerful  percent agree the american economy is rigged to advantage the rich and powerful  percent agree that traditional party and politician dont care about people like me  percent believe the mainstream medium is more interested in making money than telling the truth  percent feel that more and more i dont identify with what america ha become  percent feel it is increasingly hard for someone like me to get ahead in america the reutersipsos online opinion poll wa conducted on election day in english in all state it includes american who have already cast their vote in the presidential election and ha a credibility interval a measure of accuracy of percentage point the poll also includes a variety of question about the presidential race which candidate people supported and why those result will be published later in the evening after most of the vote have been counted and state race have been called
Title_Text: u voter want leader to end advantage of rich and powerful reutersipsos poll

Text: over the last few day republican presidential frontrunner donald trump is finally getting a taste of his own medicine by gop rival marco rubio who finally woke up and realized that the most effective way to deal with a bully like trump is to mock him relentlesslyit s been documented that many bully especially those that bully like trump actually behave that way because of they re deeply insecure it seems that rubio ha finally caught onto this fact and is using it to his advantage but no one can humble and put trump in his place quite like president barack obama it s worth bringing back an epic moment from five year ago when obama absolutely destroyed trump with the utmost class at the white house correspondent association dinnerthe dinner wa the day before the scheduled raid on osama bin laden s compound and it wa obvious that obama wa on point that night obama not only called trump fox news and their fellow conservative out on their birther conspiracy and ridiculous obsession with his birth certificate but made them look like complete imbecile in front of the entire audience who wa loving every second of itonce obama singled trump out exclusively the donald practically tried to melt into his seat and he squirmed his way through the entire assault when speaking about trump s credential and experience in political matter obama hilariously brought up trump s behavior on the reality show celebrity apprentice and sarcastically complimented him on his leadership obama teased ultimately you didn t blame lil john or meatloaf you fired gary busey these are the kind of decision that would keep me up at night well handled sir the audience wa eating it up but then obama delivered the final blow stating that trump would certainly bring some change to the white house obama showed everyone just what a trump presidency would look like when he unveiled this epic and probably accurate imagewhite house correspondent dinnerif you have any doubt about the effectiveness of obama s brutal delivery just take a look at trump s face a the president expertly mock himeveryone but trump wa giggling at the ridiculous prospect of trump for president and yet here we are several year later when trump actually ha a terrifying chance to become the gop nominee if rubio or cruz can t defeat him in all honesty these two could learn something from obama he knew just how to show trump who wa bossfeatured image is a screenshot
Title_Text: this clip of obama obliterating trump year ago should inspire gop rival video

Text: one of donald trump s strongest ally just turned against him and may have just cost herself a cabinet position in the processit s a winwin reallynot only do we get to watch sarah palin slam donald trump for making a shitty deal we get the satisfaction of knowing that he probably won t consider her for any cabinet post at all including secretary of veteran affairsearlier this week trump bragged that he wa meeting with carrier a company in indiana that wa planning to send american job overseas well trump only saved nearly job while more than job were still sent to mexico oh and carrier got a sweet deal for it too taxpayer in indiana will be giving carrier  million to keep the smattering of job that are left it s a very high price to pay and is a waste of taxpayer dollar that set the stage for more company to do the exact same thing in order to snag million of taxpayer dollar all they have to do is threaten to send job overseas and get trump to negotiate to keep some of themin short trump is an easy mark for company to exploit but sarah palin is not supportive of what trump is doingin an oped for young conservative palin blasted trump s bad deal with carrier a crony capitalism that will doom the free market and the country when government step in arbitrarily with individual subsidy favoring one business over others it set inconsistent unfair illogical precedent she wrote meanwhile the invisible hand that best orchestrates a free people s free enterprise system get amputated then special interest creep in and manipulate market republican oppose this remember instead we support competition on a level playing field remember because we know special interest crony capitalism is one big fail politician picking and choosing recipient of corporate welfare is railed against by fiscal conservative for it s a hallmark of corruption and socialism a  trillion debtridden country can t afford this sinfully stupid practice so vigilantly guard against it continuance or we re doomed but know that fundamentally political intrusion using a stick or carrot to bribe or force one individual business to do what politician insist versus establishing policy incentivizing our entire ethical economic engine to roar back to life isn t the answertrump s deal with carrier wa nothing more than a theatrical photoop stunt designed to fool u into believing that he is saving american business but he only did the exact opposite eventually carrier will threaten to send more job overseas and they will expect yet another government handout to be paid by taxpayer it s free money for business so business will likely take advantage of this and will decide to send job overseas in an effort to secure million in taxpayer subsidy it s windfall for corporation but a costly disaster for taxpayer because now corporation will just hold job hostage and will demand taxpayer money in return for keeping just some of those job in the united statesonce again donald trump is a loser who make bad business deal and this time he is dragging america down with himfeatured image screenshot
Title_Text: sarah palin turn on trump blast his bad crony capitalism deal with carrier

Text: email published by the new york time monday indicate that hillary clinton used more than one private email address during her time a secretary of state contradicting previous claim from the account she had previously used it said in march gawker published the email address she used while secretary and so she had to change the address on her account clinton served a secretary of state using the account hrodclintonemailcom selected libyarelated message from hillary clinton s personal email account the new york time note on january clinton messaged jake sullivan using the account Text: new yorksan francisco reuters  legal challenge to president donald trumps temporary travel ban on people from some muslimmajority country heat up again next week when two u appeal court consider whether it is constitutional the legal fight may end up at the u supreme court perhaps in the fall many month after trump first issued an executive order in january saying there wa an urgent need to halt some immigration to the united state for day while official reviewed the visa process trump dropped the original travel order after unfavorable legal ruling and replaced it with a more limited ban which is itself now being challenged in appeal court on two coast arguing that the united state needed to tighten national security measure trumps attempt to limit travel wa one of his first major act in office the fate of the ban is one indication of whether the republican can carry out his promise to be tough on immigration and national security omar jadwat an attorney at the american civil liberty union who will be arguing the case at the th u circuit court of appeal in virginia on monday said the fact that so much time ha passed since the ban wa issued is proof that there wa no pressing national security need for it in the first place the court fight will give those challenging the order an opportunity to argue that the government never intended for the travel pause to be temporary said buzz frahn an attorney at simpson thacher bartlett in palo alto california whose firm ha been closely tracking the ongoing litigation now almost day after the original travel ban the government say the period of day wa reset when the administration issued the new order in march the department of homeland security is and will be continuously examining way to enhance the screening and vetting process to shut down terrorist and criminal pathway into the united states agency spokesman david lapan said some improvement will be classified others will be public but the department ha only just begun way to enhance the security of our immigration system he said in an email opponent  including state and civil right group  say that both the first ban and the revised ban which also put a halt to all refugee admission to the country for four month discriminates against muslim the government argues the text of the order doe not mention any specific religion and is needed to protect the country against attack the th circuit will decide the fate of a ruling from a maryland district judge that struck down a section of the revised executive order barring visitor from syria iran libya sudan yemen and somalia the hearing will take place before fulltime judge of the appellate court ten of them were appointed by democrat and four by republican then on march a threejudge panel at the san franciscobased th u circuit court of appeal will review a decision from a hawaii judge that halted not just the travel portion of the ban but also the section that barred refugee the judge  who will sit on a panel in seattle  have been assigned but their identity have not been made public the th circuit blocked trumps first ban in february in a unanimous vote by one republicanappointed judge and twodemocratic appointee trump lashed out at the ruling on twitter and said he is ready for a fight at the supreme court the nations highest court is more likely to hear a case if the federal appeal court reach opposite ruling or if the issue is of great national importance according to legal expert but the supreme courts session end in june and if it take the case it would probably not be heard until after the justice return in october
Title_Text: trump travel ban back in u court next week a battle stretch on

Text: the army corp of engineer ha denied an easement for the dakota access pipeline a major oil pipeline that had been rerouted to go through a sioux nation reservation and under the missouri river protester and police have been clashing repeatedly at standing rock in north dakota over the possibility that the pipeline will contaminate water supply for the standing rock siouxthe daily beast is reporting that the army corp of engineer denied the easement pending an environmental impact study nbc washington ha just released a statement from sioux chairman david archambault ii that say i heard the army corp sic of engineer will not grant the easement and they will reroute nbc report that archambault also said i am thankful there were some leader in the feral sic government that realized something wa not right even though it sic legal for the first time in hisopry sic native american they heard our voice this is something that will go down in history and is a blessing for all indigenous people protester have been gathering at standing rock for month to support the sioux in their fight against the pipeline and within the last few day military veteran began heading out in support of the protest and to form a shield around the camp method of trying to get the protester to leave including blasting them with freezing water in freezing temperature and shooting them with rubber bullet proved fruitless a the protester refused to let their resolve waverthe report of the victory over dapl construction first began trickling in over twitter via nbc news correspondentsbreaking army corp of engineer ha told standing rock sioux chairman that the current route for the pipeline will be denied nadpl ayman mohyeldin aymanm december breaking nbc news report army corp denies dakotaaccesspipeline permit near standingrock sioux camp cheer over nodapl brian thompson brianny december the camp is celebrating their victory a well they should this should never have happened to begin with watch a video of this developing story below via msnbcfeatured image via screen capture from embedded video
Title_Text: breaking dakota access pipeline stopped by army corp of engineer

Text: leave it to obama to politicize our money some think the past president should be on the money but now obama s made our money like a postage stamp he s made this political and racial which really is what you d expect from this pitiful manabraham lincoln will not be the only person depicted on the  bill much longerthe treasury department announced wednesday that it will overhaul the design of the  note a move overshadowed by it decision to revamp the back of the  bill to include woman and to feature harriet tubman on the front of the civil right icon martin luther king jr famed opera singer marian anderson and first lady eleanor roosevelt will be depicted on the back of the updated  billall three will be portrayed in historical moment in front of the lincoln memorial which is currently pictured on the back of the bill king will be shown delivering his i have a dream speech anderson will be shown performing in when concert hall were still segregated and she wa banned from singing in constitution hall supported by rooseveltin redesigning the  bill a previously unannounced step the treasury will disrupt lincoln s longrunning tenure on both the front of the bill in a portrait and on the back captured a a statue within the lincoln memorial the basic layout of the note hadn t changed since read more we

Text: reuters  pennsylvania governor tom wolf on wednesday signed into law new measure to expand the sale of bottled wine to certain private store a move that could generate million in state revenue through tax and licensing fee pennsylvania is one of just two u state along with utah with full control over it liquor sale system  owning and operating retail and wholesale operation this is truly a historic day for pennsylvania and the most significant step the commonwealth ha taken to reform our liquor system in years wolf said in a statement the new legislation passed by lawmaker on tuesday move wine sale beyond the states publicly run system allowing supermarket convenience store restaurant and hotel that already have license for carryout beer to sell up to four bottle of wine to customer nlnzw it also expands direct wine shipment by the case liquor wine and beer sale at casino and hour of operation at state store including on sunday the move is expected to increase retail wine sale overall and could add more than  million to state coffer the pennsylvania liquor control board is the largest purchaser of wine and spirit in the united state the state ha an percent liquor tax
Title_Text: pennsylvania governor sign law expanding wine sale to private store

Text: there were a lot of argument online after the fearless girl statue wa erected in front of the wall street bull many people thought it wa a perfect representation of standing up to the policy that appease social justice warrior also known a decent human beingsunfortunately one of those argument ha been proven rightaccording to the new york post the firm behind the statue that went up ostensibly to promote gender equality state street corp wa caught underpaying female employee along with more who were blackafter the company wa audited by the department of labor s office of federal contract compliance program they promised they would come up with the money but in the meantime it just look bad the company settled for  million an astounding amount considering the chimed in of course although to pick up his subtle dig at feminism requires reading the reply to his tweet which he wa fishing for a full complement of altright trump troll joined the party and Text: amsterdam reuters  a man faced war crime charge at a dutch court on monday accused of the incarceration torture and murder of opponent of former ethiopian leader mengistu haile mariam in the s a mengistu s representative in the ethiopian province of gojjam eshetu alemu is accused of ordering the killing of young prisoner in and of being responsible for the incarceration and inhumane treatment of more than people the yearold wa born in ethiopia and came to the netherlands a an asylum seeker in he pleaded not guilty on monday stating that the prosecutor are accusing the wrong man an ethiopian court sentenced the defendant to death in absentia in for his role in what wa called the red terror which the communist military junta of mengistu conducted after the ousting of the ethiopian emperor haile selassie in the national prosecutor s office said in a statement the ethiopian sentence however cannot be carried out in the netherlands because it doe not accept the death penalty making a new trial the best option to hold him to account prosecutor said the trial which is based on an investigation by the international crime team of the dutch national police is being heard at a dutch domestic court in the hague rather than one of the international tribunal that sit in the city the court will this week question the defendant who ha been held in custody in the netherlands since and will hear statement from victim  ethiopian living abroad it is not yet known when the court will reach a verdict mengistu wa found guilty in absentia of genocide in the same trial in ethiopia in after he and top member of his military government were accused of killing thousand during his year rule mengistu wa ousted in and fled to zimbabwe where he still life
Title_Text: dutch begin trial over s ethiopian war crime

Text: while london police are wasting resource to track down people who may or may not have offended muslim actual tweet promoting threat of violence towards nonbelievers can be found on twitter roundtheclock we found this tweet only day ago following the brussels terror attacka man who tweeted about stopping a muslim woman in the street yesterday challenging her to explain brussels and lambasted on twitter for his comment ha responded to the criticism today insisting he is not some far right merchant matthew doyle partner at a south londonbased talent pr agency posted a tweet on wednesday morning saying i confronted a muslim woman in croydon yesterday i asked her to explain brussels she said nothing to do with me a mealy mouthed reply he wa later arresteda metropolitan police spokeman said a yearold man wa this evening arrested at his home in croydon on suspicion of inciting racial hatred on social medium he ha been taken to a south london police station and enquiry continue his tweet referred to yesterday s bomb attack on the belgian capital s main airport and metro system that left at least people dead and injured his comment went viral being retweeted hundred of time before he eventually deleted it mr doyle told the telegraph he had no idea his tweet would be the hand grenade it ha proven to be and that twitter s character limit made the encounter sound vastly different to how he thought it went what everyone s got wrong about this is i didn t confront the woman he said i just said excuse me can i ask what you thought about the incident in brussels she wa white and british wearing a hijab and she told me it wa nothing to do with her i said thank you for explaining that and her little boy said goodbye to me a we went out separate way on wednesday afternoon he say someone who s been outraged by his comment turned up at my door gave me a load of abuse and tried to throw a punch at me a for his more inflammatory tweet mr doyle claim they re intended a a joke which people who know him would understand a that s absolutely not who i am i m not some farright merchant i m not a mouthpiece for any kind of racism or radicalism he say if i wa xenophobic i wouldn t live in london i have a muslim neighbour who got burgled and i wa one of the first people to go around to help however he say he doe believe muslim aren t doing enough to speak out against terrorism the horror that happened in brussels could happen here he add and your naive if you think london isn t on some terror shortlist via telegraph
Title_Text: man arrested for asking muslim woman excuse me can i ask what you thought about the terror incident in brussels

Text: republican are flocking away from the gop s presidential candidate in drove one group of republican just joined the rank of those who cannot support donald trump the harvard republican club ha decided that they cannot in good conscience support trump s presidential bidon thursday the harvard republican club s editorial board published a press release that masterfully lay out the case a to why they cannot and nor should anyone else support trump in every presidential election since the member and executive board of the harvard republican club have gathered to discus debate and eventually endorse the standardbearer of our party but for the first time in year we the oldest college republican chapter in the nation will not be endorsing the republican nomineedonald trump hold view that are antithetical to our value not only a republican but a american the rhetoric he espouses from racist slander to misogynistic taunt is not consistent with our conservative principle and his repeated mocking of the disabled and belittling of the sacrifice made by prisoner of war gold star family and purple heart recipient is not only bad politics but absurdly cruel according to the harvard crimson very few member of the harvard republican club planned on supporting trump only of their membership indicated that they support trump an overwhelming majority said that they will not support trump of the club wa still undecided at the time they were asked you can read the full letter belowdear member and alumniin every presidential election since the member and executive board of the harvard republican club have gathered to discus debate and eventually endorse the standardbearer of our party but for the first time in year we the oldest college republican chapter in the nation will not be endorsing the republican nomineedonald trump hold view that are antithetical to our value not only a republican but a american the rhetoric he espouses from racist slander to misogynistic taunt is not consistent with our conservative principle and his repeated mocking of the disabled and belittling of the sacrifice made by prisoner of war gold star family and purple heart recipient is not only bad politics but absurdly cruelif enacted donald trump s platform would endanger our security both at home and abroad domestically his protectionist trade policy and draconian immigration restriction would enlarge our federal deficit raise price for consumer and throw our economy back into recession trump s global outlook steeped in isolationism is considerably outofstep with the traditional republican stance a well the flippancy with which he is willing to abdicate the united state responsibility to lead is alarming calling for the u withdrawal from nato and actively endorsing nuclear proliferation donald trump s foreign policy would wreak havoc on the established world order which ha held aggressive foreign power in check since world war iiperhaps most importantly however donald trump simply doe not possess the temperament and character necessary to lead the united state through an increasingly perilous world the last week should have made obvious to all what ha been obvious to most for more than a year in response to any slight perceived or real donald trump lash out viciously and irresponsibly in trump s eye disagreement with his action or his policy warrant incessant name calling and derision stupid lying fat ugly weak failing idiot and that s just his fellow republicanshe isn t eschewing political correctness he is eschewing basic human decencydonald trump despite spending more than a year on the campaign trail ha either refused or been unable to educate himself on issue that matter most to american like u he speaks only in platitude about greatness success and winning time and time again trump ha demonstrated his complete lack of knowledge on critical matter meandering from position to position over the course of the election when confronted about these frequent reversal trump lie in a manner more brazen and shameless than anything politics ha ever seenmillions of people across the country are feeling despondent their hour have been cut wage slashed job even shipped overseas but donald trump doesn t have a plan to fix that he ha a plan to exploit thatdonald trump is a threat to the survival of the republic his authoritarian tendency and flirtation with fascism are unparalleled in the history of our democracy he hope to divide u by race by class and by religion instilling enough fear and anxiety to propel himself to the white house he is looking to to pit neighbor against neighbor friend against friend american against american we will not stand for this vitriolic rhetoric that is poisoning our country and our childrenpresident reagan called on u to maintain this our shining city on a hill he called on u to maintain freedom abroad by keeping a strong presence in the world he called on u to maintain liberty at home by upholding the democratic process and respecting our opponent he called on u to maintain decency in our heart by loving our neighborhe would be ashamed of donald trump we are toothis fall we will instead focus our effort on reclaiming the republican party from those who have done it considerable harm campaigning for candidate who will uphold the conservative principle that have defined the republican party for generation we will work to ensure both chamber of congress remain in republican hand continuing to protect against executive overreach regardless of who win the election this novemberwe call on our party s elected leader to renounce their support of donald trump and urge our fellow college republican to join u in condemning and withholding their endorsement from this dangerous man the conservative movement in america should not and will not go quietly into the nighta longtime student of american democracy alexis de tocqueville once said america is great because she is good if america cease to be good america will cease to be great de tocqueville believed in the united state american are a decent people we work hard protect our own and look out for one another in time of need regardless of the color of our skin the god we worship or our party registration donald trump may not believe in that america but we do and that america will never cease to be greatthe harvard republican clubgood going harvard republican now hopefully the gop leadership will follow suitfeatured image from gage skidmoreflickr with text added
Title_Text: harvard republican disavow trump call on the gop to abandon him

Text: bah humbug manufacturer and retailer can face civil and possibly criminal penalty for failing to report any product to the cpsc that do not meet the regulation s requirement the best time to wage the war on christmas isn t in december when regular american have their defense up a better time is now and the best way to do it is through faceless unaccountable federal bureaucracy for our own safety of coursethe consumer product safety commission cpsc issued a regulation for christmas light on monday deeming some holiday decoration a substantial product hazard the consumer product safety commission is issuing a final rule to specify that seasonal and decorative lighting product that do not contain any one of three readily observable characteristic minimum wire size sufficient strain relief or overcurrent protection a addressed in a voluntary standard are deemed a substantial product hazard under the consumer product safety act cpsa the final rule saidthe ruling applies to a variety of christmas decoration including star wreathes candle without shade light sculpture blowmolded plastic figure and animated figure however solarpowered product are exemptthey will probably also make exception for light powered by windmill and any holiday light put up to honor martin luther king daythis is typicalthe rule is listed a a voluntary standard however manufacturer and retailer can face civil and possibly criminal penalty for failing to report any product to the cpsc that do not meet the regulation s requirementsours is the ultimate soft tyranny when we get to the point where people are sent to gulag because their neighbor turned them in for celebrating christmas no doubt it will be voluntary like paying taxesvia moonbattery
Title_Text: war on christmas fed to regulate christmas light

Text: table set for thanksgiving in siem reap photo andre vltchekandre vltchek neoa table wa set up for two an advertisement table a table with a photo of a giant turkey two elegant plate and a u flag sticking out into the air thanksgiving at angkor royal cafe a flier read and rd november join u for a traditional thanksgiving feast this wa at one of the international hotel in siem reap a cambodian city near the world architectural treasure of angkor wat and the ancient khmer capital angkor thomthe same day i read an email sent to me from the united state by my native american friend with a link to an essay published by mpn news called thanksgiving guide how to celebrate a sordid history it began with a summary while million of american prepare this week to get into the holiday spirit beginning with thanksgiving how many are prepared to view the day through an accurate lens while to many american the holiday serf a a reminder to give thanks it is seen a a day of mourning by countless of others the truth is european migrant brutally murdered native american stole their land and continue to do so today the day became an official day of festivity in to celebrate the massacre of over people from the pequot tribein a hotel i approached a cheerful french food and beverage manager and asked him whether he wa aware of what he wa suggesting should be celebrated in one of his restaurant oh i know i know he replied laughing it is a little bit controversial isn t it bit controversial i wondered it appears more like you are inviting people to celebrate genocide a holocaust with free flowing wine and a giant turkey i am trying to see thing positively he continued grinning at me then he summarized so i guess you won t be joining u tonight what a pity what a pity i thought what a pity i won t get to eat that famous american pie tonight and turkey and who know what else just because i am not eager at all to celebrate the massacre and land grab perpetrated by the empirethe manager couldn t help asking where are you from i knew he would ask no european would say what i wa saying i m russian i replied oh i see he gave me that i should have guessed smile russianamerican i addedi m convinced that the french manager ha been sincerely oblivious about what i wa stating he is supposed to be oblivious there are after all our genocide and the genocide of the others our genocide those that we triggered or committed should never be discussed or more precisely it is extremely impolite to discus them most of the people don t even know about them including many of the victim on the other hand the genocide committed by the others particularly by adversary of the west are widely discussed publicized analyzed inflated and very often even fabricated all this described in detail in my page book exposing lie of the empire cambodia is the textbook case of the latter here several decade ago the u and it ally first supported the hopelessly corrupt and brutal government in phnom penh while triggering a monstrous carpetbombing campaign of the cambodian countryside mainly near the border with vietnam this wa supposed to prevent the country from going communist or at least ho chi minh style communist hundred of thousand of villager were murdered by the bombing million were forced to hit the road leaving their dwelling a the countryside wa converted into a giant minefield covered by unexploded ordnancefurther hundred of thousand died from starvation and disease furious mad from suffering the people of cambodia rose against the collaborator with the west in phnom penh pol pot and his khmer rouge took the capital virtually unopposed recently deep in the jungle i spoke to the former pol pot s personal guard i asked them pointblank whether they knew anything about communism nothing at all i wa told the u wa murdering our family for no reason corrupt elite were selling the country to the west we were all outraged and ready for revenge we would follow anybody calling for revenge however the west is passing the event to this day a a communist genocide rwanda is yet another case of a twisted narrative i made an entire fulllength documentary film rwanda gambit on the subject there the west turned the history upside down reducing the entire tragedy into a primitive and easytodigest narrative of bad hutu killing good tutsi yet even the former u ambassador robert flatten told me that his country groomed armed and supported the deadly rpf mainly tutsi army which had been before raiding the rwandan countryside from neighboring uganda burning village and killing civilianswhile a former australian lawyer and un investigator michael hourigan supplied me with information about the downing of the plane which in april killed both the rwandan president juvenal habyarimana and burundian president cyprien ntaryamira while on the final approach to kigali airport the order to shoot down the plane were given by the rpf leader paul kagame who wa in turn sponsored by the west this event triggered the terrible bloodletting on the next year in the rwandan army entered the democratic republic of congo drc and participated in the killing of at least million people mainly civilian on behalf of western government and multinational company making it the worst crime against humanity in recent historyin fact almost all the major genocide committed by the west or it ally in modern history are silent one including those in iraq syria iran west papua east timor drc indonesia afghanistan angola and dozen of other unfortunate place all over the worldthe gruesome genocide committed by the west all over the world during the last but especially during the last year are never defined a such never a genocide throughout history european country have been destroying systematically most of the culture on all continent of the planet enslaving virtually all the nonwhite nation plundering and looting it colony read almost all the nonwhite nation of the world while exterminating hundred of million of men woman and child the death toll ha been rising accumulating to near billion according to the testimony of one of my friend a senior un statisticiani will return to the cambodian story soon on the page of this magazine and i will be returning again and again to the genocide committed by europe and north america virtually everywhere unless the history is understood and acknowledged the world ha no future and there can be no solution to the terrible problem that our humanity is facingbut for now let me conclude this brief essay by saying that i did not participate in the consumption of turkey and american pie on thanksgiving holiday in the cambodian city of seam reapmy thought went to those people from the pequot tribe who rebelled stood firm and died for freedom almost year ago these were some of the first fighter against western imperialism these were the american that i admire this is america that had been terribly damaged but not yet completely destroyed no overly sugary sentimental and empty word could fully choke it essence a no gluttony and food orgy could ever fully silence the scream of the pain of those who died in the hand of the european invader during and after the conquest of what ha been so cynically christened a the new world andre vltchek is a philosopher novelist filmmaker and Text: beirut reuters  a dual national member of iran s nuclear negotiating team ha been jailed for five year for spying news agency tasnim said on sunday citing a spokesman for the judiciary gholamhossein mohseni ejei named the convicted man a abdolrasul dori esfahani without identifying his second nationality tasnim reported the sentence on wednesday without naming dori esfahani or detailing the charge tasnim reported in july last year that he wa in charge of banking affair during the talk according to iranian medium he ha iranian and canadian citizenship he wa one of the people accused of spying and passing intelligence to stranger and he wa linked to two intelligence agency mohseni ejei said he said dori esfahani s fiveyear sentence wa upheld after a failed appeal tasnim reported dori esfahani also face charge of financial corruption mohseni ejei said the working of iran s judiciary are opaque and rarely open to public scrutiny iran reached a nuclear deal with the united state and five other major power in that led to the lifting of most international sanction against it in return for curb on it nuclear programme the potential detente with the west ha alarmed iranian hardliner who have seen a flood of european trade and investment delegation arrive in tehran to discus possible deal according to iran expert security official have arrested several businessmen including iranian holding joint american european or canadian citizenship a part of a crackdown on western infiltration
Title_Text: iran name nuclear negotiating team member jailed for spying

Text: new york reuters  u republican presidential candidate donald trump ha fired his national political director after six week on the job campaign source said on wednesday trump told staffer and supporter gathered backstage before a campaign rally in california on wednesday that political director rick wiley should be fired for his handling of a fundraising deal with the republican national committee according to the source the rnc fundraising agreement included state but not nevada where republican in the state are angling for key victory in the november election three source confirmed trump said wiley should be fired after nevada republican party chairman michael mcdonald told trump that wiley wa responsible for leaving nevada out of the deal mcdonald did not return call seeking comment wiley did not respond to email text message and phone call seeking comment the move is the latest in a tug of war between trumps original campaign team including press secretary hope hick and campaign manager corey lewandowski and a group of professional he brought in later to shore up support from more traditional corner of the republican party the new arrival led by veteran strategist paul manafort whom trump hired in late march have urged trump to tone down some of his most provocative position such a his proposed ban on muslim entering the united state but trump reprimanded manafort according to two source familiar with the conversation after manafort told a gathering of rnc member at an april meeting in florida that trump wa only acting when describing his proposed muslim ban or his plan to build a wall along the usmexico border manafort hired wiley on april a statement issued by the trump campaign said wiley had been hired on a shortterm basis a a consultant until the campaign wa running full steam and it thanked him for for helping u during this transition period manafort did not responds to call and email seeking comment
Title_Text: trump fire his national political director campaign source
