Text: kabul reuters  the international military mission in afghanistan will fail if troop level are reduced further with potentially dangerous repercussion for the rest of the world a delegation of u lawmaker warned during a visit to kabul on monday fifteen year after an americanled operation toppled the taliban in response to the september terrorist attack president barack obama is considering whether to maintain the current level of u troop or reduce it to by the end of the year a current plan call for i cannot guarantee success if we keep but i can ensure you failure if we go to  republican senator lindsey graham told reporter in kabul i will have a hard time supporting our continued presence here a its not fair to those left behind they just cant do the job if we go to this place will fall apart quickly graham joined u senator john mccain benjamin sasse and joe donnelly in a visit timed so the bipartisan delegation could visit with troop during the independence day holiday the obama administration should decide on troop level sooner rather than later mccain said arguing that reducing the number of troop could lead to a repeat of the disaster in iraq where islamic state militant seized major city and wide swathe of territory mccain the republican chairman of the senate armed service committee sharply criticized the white houses decision last year to restrict u force from targeting taliban fighter except in selfdefense and other limited circumstance those rule were recently relaxed on the recommendation of american commander in kabul but mccain said it wa almost criminal that the restriction were in place for more than a year the rule of engagement were so restrictive that it gave an advantage to the taliban and other terrorist groups the senator said the lawmaker highlighted afghanistans history a one of the original haven for al qaeda terrorist and pleaded for more patience ultimately were going to win this fight its just going to take decades sasse said the american people well understand that staying partnered with a good ally like the afghan government is the best way to deny future safe haven to those who would plot jihadi attack across the globe
Title_Text: u senator warn against further troop cut in afghanistan

Text: washington reuters  u democratic presidential candidate hillary clinton said in a private speech to banker three year ago that the united state had warned beijing it would ring china with missile defense unless it did more to rein in north koreas missile program according to hacked email according to a purported clinton campaign document attached to an email published by wikileaks clinton said in a speech to goldman sachs on june that the message to china had been you either control them or were going to have to defend against them it wa not possible to confirm the authenticity of the leaked email the clinton campaign ha neither confirmed nor denied the authenticity of hacked email the state department on friday declined to comment on alleged leaked documents when asked whether such a message had been delivered to china an official said it wa not department policy to comment publicly on diplomatic discussion although clintons reported comment raised a stir in asia they are consistent with u effort to convince china to help restrain north koreas nuclear and ballistic missile program which so far have borne little fruit according to the hacked email clinton said in the speech which wa delivered after she left her position a secretary of state that washington could not accept a situation in which north korea developed an intercontinental ballistic missile able to carry a miniaturized warhead she said this not only could threaten treaty ally japan and south korea but also theoretically could reach hawaii and the west coast of the united state were going to ring china with missile defense were going to put more of our fleet in the area clinton said according to the email so china come on you either control them or were going to have to defend against them china ha been angered by plan announced this year by the united state and south korea to deploy the u terminal high altitude area defense thaad antimissile system to protect against the threat posed by north korean missile the united state ha argued thaad is not aimed at containing china but beijing is concerned that the systems powerful radar would compromise it security current u secretary of state john kerry said in february that the united state had made clear that the way to prevent thaad deployment wa to resolve the north korean nuclear issue according to the leaked email and in other paid speech clinton also praised chinese leader president xi jinping a a more worldly somewhat more experienced politician than his predecessor hu jintao and one who had worked to assert his authority over the peoples liberation army clinton said she also told her chinese counterpart that the united state had a much a claim to the pacific a china given that u force had liberated it in world war two china had a right to assert themselves but the united state needed to push back to create a balance to prevent china taking a chokehold on sea lane and country bordering the south china sea she said
Title_Text: clinton warned u would ring china with missile defense hacked email

Text: cairo reuters  an egyptian army officer wa sentenced to six year in prison on tuesday after announcing his intention last month to run in the country s presidential election his lawyer and wife said a military court found colonel ahmed konsowa guilty of expressing political opinion a a serving military officer his lawyer asaad heikal told reuters konsowa appeared in a video last month announcing that he intended to run against president abdel fattah alsisi in the vote which will take place early next year he said he had submitted his resignation from the army in but it had not been accepted konsowa s wife rasha safwat said they would appeal against the verdict sisi the former commander of egypt s military ha yet to announce he will seek reelection but is widely expected to do so
Title_Text: egyptian army officer jailed after announcing presidential candidacy lawyer family

Text: paris reuters  france announced a onebillioneuro plan for university on monday promising to offer more place on popular course cut dropout rate and build more accommodation in a bid to assuage the concern of politically powerful student president emmanuel macron s government ha already faced down street protest over labour reform and risk more industrial action over plan to reform the pension and unemployment insurance system it want to avoid confrontation with student who have forced past government into policy uturn with protracted rally the government said the billion euro  billion will be spent over the five year of macron s term in office student in france who pas high school exam have the right to go to university in their home area but this ha led to popular subject such a law and psychology being heavily oversubscribed and prompted the introduction of an unpopular lottery system where demand is highest that lottery system will now be scrapped and the most pressed university will be allowed to select student on merit the proposal stop short of a blanket ukstyle selection system that student union had opposed france s biggest student union the moderate fage welcomed the plan two other union including the leftwing unef the second largest were critical unef ha said it will join cgtled protest against government reform on nov and urged student to make their voice heard against the education reform jeanluc melenchon leader of the farleft france unbowed party ha also urged student to mobilise after his early attempt to get worker onto the street against the easing of unemployment law failed macron ha got the advantage for now let s not hide it melenchon told franceinfo radio if youth got moving thing would be different but it s not the case for now the reform also include new student housing unit over the next five year and promise to scrap student s social security contribution and increase tutoring only percent of student complete the first year of university the government said our aim is to ensure equal opportunity said university minister frederique vidal we want to make university more accessible by accompanying student in all their diversity
Title_Text: france keen to avoid student anger plan billion euro university reform

Text: united nation reuters  the united state accused iran on tuesday of supplying yemen s houthi rebel with a missile that wa fired into saudi arabia in july and called for the united nation to hold tehran accountable for violating two un security council resolution u ambassador to the united nation nikki haley said information released by saudi arabia showed the missile fired in july wa an iranian qiam which she described a a type of weapon that had not been present in yemen before the conflict saudiled force which back the government in neighboring yemen have been targeting the iranallied houthis in a more than twoyear war saudi arabia s crown prince on tuesday described iran s supply of rocket to the houthis a direct military aggression that could be an act of war haley said that by providing weapon to the houthis iran s islamic revolutionary guard corp s had violated two un resolution on yemen and iran she said a missile shot down over saudi arabia on saturday may also be of iranian origin we encourage the united nation and international partner to take necessary action to hold the iranian regime accountable for these violation haley said it wa not immediately clear what action the united state wa calling for saudi un ambassador abdallah almouallimi echoed haley s call for un action against iran in a letter to the un security council and secretarygeneral antonio guterres later on tuesday seen by reuters he said the missile fired on saturday may amount to a war crime and that saudi arabia wa taking appropriate measure to respond to these terrorist act iran s un ambassador gholamali khoshroo also wrote to the security council and guterres on tuesday rejecting the accusation by saudi arabia a baseless and unfounded iran call for selfrestraint and wisdom instead of provocation and threat that may bring further instability to this already volatile region khoshroo wrote in the letter seen by reuters under a un resolution that enshrines the iran nuclear deal with world power tehran is prohibited from supplying selling or transferring weapon outside the country unless approved in advance by the un security council a separate un resolution on yemen ban the supply of weapon to houthi leader abdulmalik alhouthi two houthi commander yemen s former president ali abdullah saleh his son and those acting on their behalf or at their direction the united state could propose people or entity to be blacklisted by the security council s yemen sanction committee a move that would need consensus approval by the members or it could put forward a new security council resolution to impose sanction on iran to pas a resolution need nine vote in favor and no veto by the united state britain france china or russia
Title_Text: u call for un action against iran over yemen missile

Text: washington reuters  a resolution calling for iran to release two u citizen imprisoned there for month will be introduced on wednesday by house of representative foreign affair committee chairman ed royce a republican and democratic representative gerry connolly their office said the resolution will call for iran to immediately and unconditionally release businessman siamak namazi and his father baquer namazi both of whom have dual citizenship the text of the resolution wa seen by reuters it will also call for u president barack obama to undertake effort to secure their release siamak namazi wa detained by the islamic revolutionary guard corp in october while visiting relative and ha been barred from leaving iran since july his father wa arrested in tehran in february irans continued wrongful jailing of american is very disturbing royce said in an emailed statement on tuesday siamak and baquer namazi deserve to be free and with their family and this resolution should push president obama to step up effort to bring them home the resolution encourages the president to utilize appropriate measures against irans government if the namazis are not released but it stop short of calling for economic sanction a specific request by a representative of the namazi family said one source familiar with the resolution who declined to be named siamak namazi ha criticized sanction against iran writing in a opinion piece in the new york time that western sanction had blocked medicine from reaching the country u state department spokesman sam werberg said the agency doe not comment on resolution before they have been formally introduced he added we are not aware of any charge against either siamak or baquer and we believe that both reported detention are unjust five american citizen were released from iranian prison in january a part of a prisoner swap with the united state iran ha detained several other dual national since that swap including homa hoodfar a canadianiranian woman nazanin zaghariratcliffe a britishiranian woman and project manager with the thomson reuters foundation and nazak afshar a frenchiranian woman
Title_Text: u legislator to call for release of american held by iran

Text: reuters  australia said on sunday it is stopping undesirable such a terrorist pedophile organized criminal and drug smuggler from boarding flight to the country defending it hardline immigration policy that ha drawn criticism from right group immigration minister peter dutton said that australian border force airline liaison officer were operating in major transit airport to push those threat beyond our border where other country allow people to arrive and then assess the threat then the australian model wa to bar those considered a threat liaison officer try to identify the threat particularly given that we ve got foreign fighter coming back through southeast asia and all over the idea is to stop them getting on plane the minister told the nine network according to medium immigration official prevented passenger from boarding flight to australia since australia ha seen the rise of nationalist antiimmigration politics with farright wing party such a one nation garnering strong public support while the popularity of the ruling centerright government ha been languishing under it policy on asylum seeker arriving by boat australia turn back unauthorized vessel at sea to their port of origin when it can and sends those it cannot to controversial camp in the south pacific for longterm detention earlier this year the government announced it would raise the bar for handing out citizenship by lengthening the waiting period adding a new australian value test and raising the standard for english language a part of a shake up of it immigration program
Title_Text: australia defends hardline immigration policy a keeping out undesirable

Text: john kerry and al gore are jubilant that we ve struck a deal sort of to limit carbon emission what a couple of jokester these guy are it s really embarrassing that all these important people came together to discus the weather and not our most pressing topic of what to do about terrorism this is what happens when you let the liberal rule unicorn and rainbowsjohn kerry told fellow negotiator it will help the world prepare for the impact of climate change that are already here and also for those that we already know are on our way inevitably he added the pact would prevent the worst most devastating consequence of climate change from ever happening a deal to attempt to limit the rise in global temperature to less than c ha been agreed at the climate change summit in paris after two week of intense negotiation the pact is the first to commit all country to cut carbon emission the agreement is partly legally binding and partly voluntary earlier key bloc including the g group of developing country and nation such a china and india said they supported the proposal president of the un climate conference of party cop and french foreign minister laurent fabius said i now invite the cop to adopt the decision entitled paris agreement outlined in the document looking out to the room i see that the reaction is positive i see no objection the paris agreement is adopted a he struck the gavel to signal the adoption of the deal delegate rose to their foot cheering and applaudingjohn kerry told fellow negotiator it will help the world prepare for the impact of climate change that are already here and also for those that we already know are on our way inevitably he added the pact would prevent the worst most devastating consequence of climate change from ever happening former u vice president al gore say year from now our grandchild will reflect on humanity s moral courage to solve the climate crisis and they will look to december a the day when the community of nation finally made the decision to act south african environment minister edna molewa call the pact the best we can get at this historic moment she say it can map a turning point to a better and safer world but she added that developed country still have to cut emission more and help poorer nation to counter the effect of global warmingread more bbcread more ap
Title_Text: climate change pact reached carbon tax and redistribution of wealth coming soon

Text: lima reuters  six farmer were shot dead in the peruvian amazon by a group of masked men in an apparent dispute over land right a police officer and a tribal leader said on thursday five body one with hand and foot bound had been thrown in a river and a sixth wa found by the side of an unpaved road in the jungle region ucayali police officer raul huari said the victim were part of a community of peasant farmer that had refused to leave the land they work on when pressured by oil palm grower said robert guimaraes the head of an indigenous federation in ucayali witness testified that a group of between and men carrying shotgun tried to kill some farmer altogether huari said they said they showed up surrounded them and just started shooting fortunately some managed to escape he said in my year of working i ve never seen anything like this huari said the murder appeared to be linked to a land dispute and a special police unit and prosecutor were carrying out investigation the murder occurred on sept marking the threeyear anniversary of the killing of four indigenous activist who had faced threat from logger in a different part of ucayali after the murder which came a peru wa hosting a global environmental summit the government promised to do more to protect remote amazonian village that often lack land title from violent clash with squatter guimaraes said native community continue to face violent threat in ucayali and that no one ha been convicted for the murder peru s culture and interior ministry did not respond to request for comment the native shipibo community of santa clara de uchunya which life near where the farmer killed ha tried to repel oil palm grower from their land for year said guimaraes
Title_Text: six farmer killed in apparent land dispute in peru amazon

Text: reuters  highlight of the day for u president donald trumps administration on tuesday the white house and congressional leader say they are weighing change to their plan to dismantle the obamacare health law a republicans question mount following an estimate that it would cause million american to lose insurance next year msnbc host rachel maddow say on twitter she ha obtained donald trumps tax return and the white house responds by saying the president had paid  million in tax on more than  million in income trump meet saudi arabias deputy crown prince mohammed bin salman at the white house for a discussion likely to touch on investment opportunity in the kingdom and effort to stop the war in syria trumps middle east envoy hold his first talk with palestinian president mahmoud abbas amid palestinian concern that the new administration in washington is more favorably disposed toward israel trumps choice for the top u trade negotiator pledge an america first strategy to aggressively enforce u law and trade deal to stop unfair import and push china to scrap excess factory capacity trumps administration is preparing to release a wideranging executive order to reduce the role that climate change play in policy decision according to a trump administration official who reviewed a draft of the order trump plan to nominate j christopher giancarlo to lead the commodity future trading commission the regulator tasked with policing the massive overthecounter derivative market the white house say trump will nominate goldman sachs group managing director james donovan a deputy secretary of the treasury the white house say the white house say that trump doe not agree with a controversial tweet on immigration and birth rate by republican representative steve king airline industry group iata is concerned about protectionist rhetoric from the united state and other government but see the trump administrations plan to invest in infrastructure a positive for the industry a senior canadian finance ministry official say there is a lot of uncertainty over what direction the united state want to take on issue such a trade and taxation policy ahead of the upcoming meeting of g finance minister share of hospital and health insurer fall after the u congressional budget office forecast that million american will lose medical insurance by next year under a republican plan to dismantle obamacare
Title_Text: highlight the trump presidency on march at pm et

Text: reuters  conservative u supreme court justice on tuesday expressed skepticism about reviving a lawsuit filed by the family of a mexican teenager against a u border patrol agent who fatally shot the yearold from across the border in texas in among the concern raised by justice wa whether nonus citizen injured by drone attack overseas that are directed from the united state could file similar claim if the lawsuit wa allowed to move forward in a closely watched case that could affect u immigration action under president donald trumps administration the courts liberal justice expressed sympathy toward allowing the case to move forward indicating the justice could be headed toward a  split such a ruling would leave in place a lower courts decision to throw out the civil right claim against the agent jesus mesa filed by the family of sergio hernandez the supreme court potentially could delay action on the case to see if trumps nominee to fill a vacancy on the court conservative appeal court judge neil gorsuch is confirmed by the u senate gorsuch could then potentially cast the deciding vote a ruling would normally be due by the end of june justice anthony kennedy a conservative who sometimes side with the liberal justice in close case and whose vote could be pivotal in this one voiced doubt about the familys argument during the courts hourlong argument kennedy indicated the question of how to compensate victim of crossborder shooting is one that the u and mexican government should resolve youve indicated that theres a problem all along the border why doesnt that counsel u that this is one of the most sensitive area of foreign affair where the political branch should discus with mexico what the solution ought to be kennedy asked the hernandez familys lawyer robert hilliard chief justice john robert another conservative brought up the sensitive question of whether u official could be sued for drone attack overseas how do you analyze the case of a drone strike in iraq where the plane is piloted from nevada why wouldnt the same analysis apply in that case he asked hilliard the justice heard the case at a time that the security of the lengthy usmexico border is a hot topic with president donald trump moving forward with plan for a border wall he said is needed to combat illegal immigration the case is one of three the justice currently are considering that concern the extent to which the u constitution provides right to nonus citizen that issue ha become more pressing in light of trumps january order put on hold by the court to block entry into the united state by people from seven muslimmajority country and refugee trump is preparing a rewritten version of the ban the case raise several legal question including whether or not the u constitutions ban on unjustified deadly force applied to hernandez because he wa a mexican citizen on mexican soil when the shooting occurred in june the court could resolve the case by simply deciding not to apply a supreme court ruling in a case involving federal drug enforcement agent that allowed such lawsuit in limited circumstance the court ha been reluctant in subsequent case to extend that ruling to other type of conduct kennedy seemed unwilling to take that step saying the hernandez shooting would be an extraordinary case in which to allow a lawsuit against a federal official liberal justice appeared more willing to examine whether some u right extend to border area where the u government exercise a certain amount of authority even beyond the border line a it doe in the culvert where hernandez wa killed justice elena kagan said it could be described a a nomans land that is neither one thing or another thing likewise justice stephen breyer said the border area could be viewed a a special kind of physical place where u law could extend in certain instance hernandezs lawyer cited a report by the washington monthly magazine that said over a five year period border agent were involved in crossborder shooting killing six mexican national justice sonia sotomayor another liberal said that in order to deter such shooting why should there not be a civil remedy to ensure that border police are complying with the constitution the incident took place at a border crossing between el paso texas and ciudad juarez mexico the u border patrol said at the time that hernandez wa pelting u agent with rock from the mexican side of the rio grande before the shooting u authority have asserted that mesa shot hernandez in selfdefense lawyer for hernandezs family disputed that account saying he wa playing a game with other teenager in which they would run across a culvert from the mexican side and touch the u border fence before dashing back the fbi also said hernandez wa a known immigrant smuggler who had been pressed into service by smuggling gang that took advantage of his youth the family appealed a ruling by the new orleansbased th u circuit court of appeal throwing out the lawsuit
Title_Text: conservative u justice skeptical in crossborder shooting case

Text: harare reuters  the head of the youth wing of zimbabwe s ruling party on wednesday publicly apologized on state television to the military which ha seized power saying it aim to isolate criminal in president robert mugabe s entourage kudzai chipanga whose powerful zanupf youth wing ha been a strong supporter of mugabe and his wife grace said he had voluntarily given his statement apologizing for denigrating defense force chief general constantino chiwenga it wa an abrupt aboutface for chipanga who on tuesday accused the army chief of subverting the constitution defending the revolution and our leader and president is an ideal we live for and if need be it is a principle we are prepared to die for chipanga had said at the party s headquarters in harare
Title_Text: youth leader of zimbabwe ruling party apologizes to military on state tv

Text: washington reuters  a republicanled panel in the u house of representative agreed on tuesday to add  million to a shortterm federal spending bill to reimburse new york authority for presidentelect donald trumps security cost far short of the  million requested by the citys congressional delegation new yorks u lawmaker were quick to express their unhappiness i am extremely disappointed that the continuing resolution to fund the federal government doe not fully reimburse the people of new york for the unprecedented security cost incurred to keep the presidentelect and his family safe between the election and his inauguration u democratic representative carolyn maloney said in a statement the bill which fund u agency through april must pas before a friday deadline to keep government agency running at a capitol hill news conference earlier on tuesday john miller the new york police departments deputy commissioner for intelligence and counter terrorism said he wa in contact with congressional democrat and republican about the cost of security operation to protect trump both before and after the republican take office on jan this is not about party politics its not about politics at all miller said he said trumps security footprint would be even more complex once he becomes president representative nita lowey a democrat said the republican leadership of the house appropriation committee had expressed sympathy for the citys preinauguration reimbursement request but had asked for more specific several house democrat on tuesday also signed a letter to new york governor andrew cuomo and new york city mayor bill de blasio urging that the state and city refuse to pay for trumps extra new york security cost once he is sworn in a president should the presidentelect choose to maintain two permanent residence for his family it is reasonable to request he reimburse the city and the state for all additional security expense from his own significant personal financial resources the letter said trump ha said his wife melania and son barron will move from new york to the white house right after he finish school
Title_Text: u spending bill far short of sum sought for trump nyc security
