Text: sydney reuters  a british explorer reported missing while searching for a remote tribe in papua new guinea ha been spotted next to an airstrip and is awaiting evacuation a friend said on thursday benedict allen a documentary film maker left last month to seek an isolated tribe the yaifo in the north of the remote and rural south pacific country of papua new guinea but took no mean of communication and left no evacuation plan or destination his friend frank gardner told reuters according to his blog allen aimed to be back in britain by midnovember don t try to rescue me please  where i m going in png you won t ever find me you know he wrote on twitter on oct but after he missed a flight home last weekend friend and family raised the alarm benedict allen is not out of danger yet he is currently marooned in a remote part of papua new guinea that is only reachable by air after all the road bridge were cut due to tribal fighting gardner who is also the bbc s security correspondent told reuters urgent effort are now under way to try to airlift him out a soon a possible in case fighting erupts around him gardner had earlier told the bbc that a png tribal commission had been looking for allen and that he had been sighted by an airstrip reuters wa unable to independently confirm the sighting allen who call himself an adventurer on his website describes being beaten daily for six week on a previous trip to png a part of an initiation ritual he also describes trekking a remote section of the amazon during which dying of starvation and malaria he wa forced to eat his dog
Title_Text: missing british film maker sighted in papua new guinea

Text: sen richard blumenthal wa deeply disturbed by james comey s testimony that attorney general jeff session wa hiding a third meeting with the russian during an interview with cnn s erin burnett on thursday blumenthal said that if what comey revealed is true it could be perjury i can t confirm what may have been provided in a classified setting but with a third meeting even without it what we have is a pattern of contact with the russian by michael flynn by session by jared kushner secret and then concealed blumenthal saidit could be perjury he addedfollowing the open hearing comey testified behind closed door where he wa able to discus classified information in this closed door hearing comey revealed that session had met with russian ambassador sergey kislyak a third time during the campaign and concealed itblumenthal said that session is emerging more and more a a key figure in the investigation into russia s interference in our presidential election not only because of his problematic contact with russian he said but also because he failed to safeguard and protect the fbi a part of the department of justice when he learned about the meeting in which the president of the united state in effect had inappropriate conversation with director comey no wonder comey didn t feel comfortable going to the department of justice with his concern that trump wa trying to stop him from continuing the russia investigation session hand are turning out to be just a dirty a trump s and mike flynn s and paul manafort s and carter page s and jared kushner s blumenthal see the pattern here i clearly see it even my grade schooler can see it how the fck are republican still managing to stay so willfully ignorantyou can watch blumenthal s interview here via cnn what we have is a pattern of contact w the russian secret and then conceleaed could be perjury senblumenthal httpstcoiuccxvcxgz outfrontcnn outfrontcnn june featured image via video screen capture
Title_Text: blumenthal it could be perjury if session hid a third meeting with the russian video

Text: berlin reuters  a senior russia s foreign ministry official on tuesday said he wa not worried by the european union s move to integrate european defense saying the initiative wa just word and did not appear to be aimed at moscow kirill logvinov head of the nato section at the russian foreign ministry called at the annual berlin security conference for renewed effort to rebuild trust between european country and russia through dialogue and military cooperation he said the transatlantic nato alliance had revived cold war tension through an enlargement that threatened russia s national security moscow wa open to resuming dialogue and rebuilding trust he said and remained committed to implementing the minsk agreement aimed at ending violence in eastern ukraine  a long a kiev also made good it promise under the deal just to sit down at a table would be an important step back toward building trust logvinov told reporter asked whether russia wa concerned about an agreement by eu member to cooperate on funding joint military project and command he said moscow welcomed any step that would help unify europe we are not trying to splinter any group the better the group work with each other in the europe the better it is for u the faster they speak with a single voice the better it is for our relationship with the eu he said logvinov said the eu s permanent structured cooperation or pesco had been in the work for decade of course we are watching this development but at this point it s just word france germany and other eu government signed an agreement this month to fund develop and deploy armed force after britain s decision to quit the bloc a project that wa first proposed in the s and long resisted by britain under the deal to be signed by eu leader in december participating government will for the first time legally bind themselves into joint project a well a pledging to increase defense spending and contribute to rapid deployment it backer say that if successful the formal club of member will give the european union a more coherent role in tackling international crisis and end the kind of shortcoming seen in libya in when european ally relied on the united state for air power and munition rachel ellehuus principal director for european and nato policy at the u defense department told the conference that the united state welcomed the deal lauding europe s transparent approach to the new initiative unlike past attempt the usled nato alliance back the project aiming to benefit from stronger military many government say russia s seizure of ukraine s crimea in wa a turningpoint for european defense integration after year of defense spending cut that left europe without vital capability but german defence minister ursula von der leyen said pesco wa more about making europe work more efficiently together to deal with humanitarian crisis and wa not related to fraying relation with russia
Title_Text: russian official not worried about eu move on defense pact

Text: new yorkfort lauderdale fla reuters  for many supporter of u president donald trump his decision to bomb a syrian airfield in retaliation for a poison gas attack wa a decisive show of strength and resolve  just what they voted for in november in interview with more than a dozen trump voter many acknowledged that getting the u military directly involved in the syrian conflict wa a far cry from the america first isolationism the republican candidate espoused during the campaign unlike several prominent farright backer who denounced thursdays air strike in syria most of the trump voter interviewed in texas florida and new york on friday said the attack wa not an abdication of his commitment to put u interest above all others love it love it love it love it he said from day one that hes not going to take any nonsense anthony calvanese a construction foreman told a reporter on a sidewalk in new york citys staten island borough he need to start showing our superiority in the world trumps order came despite his vow in the campaign to avoid entanglement in middle east conflict four year ago he also admonished his predecessor democrat barack obama to refrain from retaliating after the syrian government launched a poison gas attack on it own citizen the apparent ideological inconsistency angered some of trumps staunchest supporter on the far right paul joseph watson a londonbased editor at infowars a u medium outlet praised by trump that promotes unsubstantiated conspiracy theory declared on twitter he wa off the trump train selfdescribed white nationalist leader richard spencer called trumps decision a betrayal and the end of america first by contrast several trump voter said they still trusted the president to deliver on his promise todd recknagel a yearold managing partner of a private equity firm in panama city beach florida said the move reinforced his support for trump because it showed the president is willing to adjust his thinking based on event i appreciate the fact that hes not so inwardly focused that hes willing to stand up for principle on something like syria he said in a phone interview ronald reagan wouldnt allow that stuff either he said referring to the s president revered by republican some trump backer said he had no choice but to act given the horror of tuesdays poison gas attack if we allowed this to go by we would be a bad a those who stood by and did nothing a hitler marched across europe in world war tom harney a yacht broker from lauderhill florida said outside a diner in fort lauderdale that sentiment wa echoed by joseph mure jr a lawyer who practice in brooklyn they murdered innocent woman baby children he told a reporter after exiting a staten island courthouse how many bomb did we drop on syria i wish wed dropped twice that amount u warship in the mediterranean sea launched dozen of tomahawk missile at the airfield others said trump who cultivated a tough image during the campaign and promised to strengthen the american military wa demonstrating that the united state remains the worlds leader were no longer leading from behind said art tillberg of coral spring florida referring to a phrase republican used to criticize obamas effort to oust libyan leader muammar gaddafi still not all trump voter agreed with the missile strike echoing objection from some on the far right that it ran counter to his campaign promise anthony sage a yearold retired army staff sergeant said the attack undermined trumps america first message the strike is a waste of american time and money sage who said he served tour of duty in iraq and afghanistan said on friday outside the fort hood army base in killeen texas we should be taking care of people here in america first abdi mohamed a yearold somali immigrant from st paul minnesota who voted for trump in november said the move showed the president wa abandoning his outsider instinct in favor of following the advice of the political establishment he wa against military action in syria but now it seems more and more he is becoming a bit of a cog in the system mohamed said in a phone interview a few trump voter found themselves torn wary of the decision to embroil the united state in syrias sixyear civil war but unwilling to abandon the president they elected im kind of on the fence said melanie grove a small business owner in louisville illinois who organized a protrump rally last month bestcase scenario this would be a strong message that this red line ha been crossed she said in a phone interview worstcase scenario there are a lot of conspiracy theorist that think we are headed towards world war
Title_Text: many trump voter welcome u air strike a show of strength

Text: washington reuters  u senate majority leader mitch mcconnell on tuesday moved to force the senate to vote later this week on the nomination of federal communication commission chairman ajit pai to serve another fiveyear term the vote on pai is expected after democrat plan to harshly criticize him for moving to dismantle obamaera internet access rule and taking other step to deregulate u telecommunication rule mcconnell on tuesday filed a petition to force a vote to end debate on pais nomination pai a former justice department fcc and capitol hill staffer ha been moving swiftly to undo many of the regulation adopted by the fcc during the obama administration since assuming the chairmanship pai joined the fcc a a commissioner in march and wa elevated to chairman by president donald trump in january he would be forced to leave at the end of this year if the senate doe not reconfirm him to a new fiveyearterm in april pai proposed overturning the landmark net neutrality rule on tuesday pai declined to say when he might ask the fcc to give final approval to the proposal the rule which the fcc put in place under democratic president barack obama prohibit broadband provider from giving or selling access to speedy internet essentially a fast lane to certain internet service over others the rule reclassified internet service provider much like utility they were favored by web company like facebook inc alphabet inc and others which said they would guarantee equal access to the internet to all but opposed by internet service provider which said they could eventually result in rate regulation inhibit innovation and make it harder to manage traffic internet provider such a att inc verizon communication inc and comcast corp have argued that the net neutrality rule have made investment in additional capacity less likely earlier this year the fcc voted  to reverse a decision that limit the number of television station some broadcaster can buy pai ha said he plan to take a new look at the current overall limit on company owning station serving no more than percent of u television household and plan a comprehensive review of close to page of medium regulation
Title_Text: u senate plan to vote on fcc chairman tenure this week

Text: sydney reuters  australia will not be allowed to walk away from legal financial and moral responsibility for nearly men when it close it asylum seeker detention center in papua new guinea png on tuesday png s immigration minister said human right advocate are warning of a looming humanitarian crisis when the manus island center close if the men are not properly resettled with hundred of the detainee refusing to leave the center for fear of being targeted by local png immigration minister petrus thomas said late on sunday that australia will remain responsible for the welfare of the men that have been detained in the australianfunded center for more than four year australia refuse to allow asylum seeker arriving by boat to reach it shore detaining them in camp in png and nauru in the south pacific the united nation and right group have for year cited human right abuse among detainee in the center it is png s position that a long a there is one individual from this arrangement that remains in png australia will continue to provide financial and other support to png to manage the person transferred under the arrangement until the last person leaf or is independently resettled in png thomas said in an emailed statement australia ha already said it would spend up to a million  million housing the nearly refugee and asylum seeker in papua new guinea for the next month after it controversial detention center close the manus center is scheduled to close on tuesday after being declared illegal by a png court with men set to be moved to three new transit camp just under men have already relocated despite threat that basic service like electricity and water will be cut off the remaining detainee are refusing to move citing fear for their safety fear of violence have been stoked further after png sent extra security force to the camp the relocation of the men is designed a a temporary measure allowing the united state time to complete vetting of refugee a part of a refugee swap deal the united state ha agreed to take up to possibly refugee from australia s two pacific detention center but so far only men from manus have been resettled in exchange australia said it will resettle central american refugee australia ha said those detainee not resettled in the united state will be allowed to stay in png or the tiny pacific island of nauru but nearly all have refused invitation to settle permanently in both location thomas said png will not force anyone to remain it is the responsibility of australia to pursue third country option he said australia s acting prime minister julie bishop said on monday that canberra wa exploring possible deal for resettlement but added those who have found not to be refugee should go home they ve been found by the united nation not to be owed protection so they should return to their home she said the bulk of the detainee come from wartorn country such a syria and afghanistan and pakistan iran sri lanka and myanmar
Title_Text: png say australia responsible for hundred of asylum seeker when detention camp close

Text: manila reuters  philippine president rodrigo duterte on wednesday announced that russia would donate defense hardware to support the military s fight against proislamic state militant who he said could regroup and attack anywhere and everywhere duterte said russia would provide about assault rifle in a deal to be signed this month and the philippine military would no longer have to use secondhand arm we will have the kalashnikov he said in a speech to troop adding that russia wanted to keep the donation secret moscow s gift would follow china s donation of more than assault rifle and sniper rifle among the fruit of duterte s effort to form partnership with two armsproducing power that are rival to the united state the united state ha for decade been the philippine defense treaty ally and it biggest source or hardware and training providing about  billion in equipment since duterte ha made no secret of his animosity toward washington and his disdain for the u military alliance a senior defense official told reuters the russian weapon would arrive later this month when russia s defense minister attends a regional meeting the rifle would be accompanied by million of round of ammunition and dozen of army truck five russian warship were due to visit in manila to deliver the equipment the official said four have visited the country this year in two separate visit duterte said the military needed to be properly equipped to handle islamic state loyalist who had established a dangerous foothold in mindanao in the south they will not disappear they will regroup anywhere and everywhere duterte said
Title_Text: russia to donate kalashnikov truck and munition to philippine

Text: the super topsecret gop healthcare bill ha been released hidden within all the kerfuffle is a woman s worst nightmare planned parenthood losing it fundingreported by the hill the senate healthcare bill will defund planned parenthood for one year the gop bill follows the same language in the housepassed health care bill that block medicaid reimbursement to planned parenthoodif this bill go through the beacon of woman s health care and abortion service will be gone unless planned parenthood can find another viable option for fundingof course it s not just woman that planned parenthood help they provide health care for woman men young people while also acting a the u s largest provider of sex education all are very crucial servicesit s vital that planned parenthood retains it funding and we need people and our government to understand that thankfully two republican senator lisa murkowski ala and susan collins maine have already suggested they may not support the bill if it defunds planned parenthood the hill reportscollins said wednesday if the bill included defunding language she and murkowski would introduce an amendment to strip it outplanned parenthood president cecile richards released a statement saying if this is the senate s idea of a bill with heart then the woman of america should have fear struck in theirs slashing medicaid and blocking million of woman from getting preventive care at planned parenthood is beyond heartless one in five woman in this country rely on planned parenthood for care they will not stay silent a politician vote to take away their care and their right source the hillis this really what many republican say they want to strip woman of their beacon of health and wellness people need to stay out of other people s business and live and let livefeatured image by ronen tivonynurphoto via getty image
Title_Text: the new gop healthcare bill target woman and plan to defund planned parenthood

Text: the way in which donald trump ha handled the aftermath of hurricane maria s impact on puerto rico an unincorporated territory of the united state ha been nothing short of terrible and incompetent leading many to question his ability to even locate puerto rico on a map the only thing more disgusting than the action of president trump is the behavior of his blind follower and fox news reporter and former talk show host geraldo rivera set the bar relatively low recentlysan juan mayor carmen yul n cruz reached out to trump first by pleading in an interview for him to save u from dying but to no avail cruz then tried in the only way proven effective by taking to twitter almost a week after hurricane maria the strongest hurricane to make landfall in puerto rico since struck the country and left most of the population without power or fresh water she began by retweeting the plea of others and then attempted to get trump s attention directlyse or presidente no eliminar la leyes de cabotaje e inmoral e un acto de opresi n financiera que solo lograr agravar nuestra crisis pictwittercomuujyeultd carmen yul n cruz carmenyulincruz september her first tweet to trump wa a plea to eliminate the jones act an outdated and antiquated maritime law requiring all good transported by water between u port be carried on usflag ship constructed in the united state owned by u citizen and crewed by u citizen and u permanent resident a law that is drastically holding up relief effort cruz s tweet read in spanish mr president not to eliminate the law of cabotage is immoral it is an act of financial oppression that will only aggravate our crisis it is almost certain that trump can t read spanish or comprehend the fact that cabotage is a real term to refer to coastal navigation and trade so naturally he saw this a an insultthe mayor of san juan who wa very complimentary only a few day ago ha now been told by the democrat that you must be nasty to trump donald j trump realdonaldtrump september such poor leadership ability by the mayor of san juan and others in puerto rico who are not able to get their worker to help they donald j trump realdonaldtrump september want everything to be done for them when it should be a community effort federal worker now on island doing a fantastic job donald j trump realdonaldtrump september while trump put off visiting puerto rico for another week geraldo rivera decided to make the trip on behalf of fox news to see what cruz wa so concerned about there are all people at all municipality literally starving dehydrating cruz told rivera we have had our hospital try to go back to speed but then the electricity go off and we have to do all the bacteria testing which take three to four day geraldo wasn t convinced and felt the need to interject but are people dying he interrupted i ve been traveling around i don t see people dying i spoke to the doctor they say they saw patient and they had a person who wa septic but nobody dying mayor cruz tried her best to reason with the mustachioed one dying is a continuum she explained if you don t get fed for seven eight day and you re a child you are dying if you have people like we took out of a nursing home severely dehydrated you are dying watch the madness unfold below and in case you were wondering the death toll in puerto rico due to hurricane maria stood at a of sunday with only nine hospital connected to the electric gridfeatured image via screenshot
Title_Text: geraldo rivera to san juan mayor carmen yuln cruz i dont see people dying video

Text: the timing couldn t have been better just a gary tuckman a reporter for very fake news cnn wa in the middle of a hit piece on president trump he wa literally hit with tear gas being used by law enforcement to keep the radical altleft protester from harming innocent people who came to support our president at his phoenix az rally last nightvery fake news cnn s gary tuckman can be seen clearly struggling to speak to cnn host don lemon in the video belowtuckman told very fake news cnn host don lemon all of our face are burning all of our throat are burning he also relayed what wa very likely bad intel to lemon there were some water bottle thrown at police and the next thing we felt were the burning tear gas but how doe tuckman know they were they bottle filled with water the radical and very violent antifa group that cnn is working so hard to redefine a a kinder gentler resistance group wa accused of throwing bottle of urine at free speech advocate and law enforcement in charlottesville less than week ago so how doe tuckman know for certain that the bottle the nonviolent group he is so quick to defend were only filled with water and since when is lobbing anything at police officer who are protecting our president and his supporter considered nonviolentearlier in the evening another cnn reporter nearly got hit by the lit end of a smoke grenadecnn may want to rethink this whole bunkering with antifa thing during what appears to be ongoing violent protest by the democrat party soros funded altleft groupsthe altleft came prepared last night a they were seen proudly displaying their ar s
Title_Text: watch karma in action cnn get hit with tear gas while defending violent altleft protester at az trump rally

Text: sochi russia reuters  the size of russia s military force in syria is likely to be significantly reduced and a drawdown could start before the end of the year the chief of the russian military general staff said on thursday russia s military support of syrian president bashar alassad notably through air strike ha been crucial in defeating islamic state and syrian opposition force there is very little left to do before the completion of military objective of course a decision will be made by the supreme commanderinchief and the deployment will be reduced valery gerasimov told reporter on the sideline of a meeting between president vladimir putin and military top brass in the black sea resort of sochi gerasimov said force would likely be substantially reduced but leave russia with two military base a ceasefiremonitoring center and a number of necessary structure to support the situation which ha developed in syria putin hosted assad in sochi on monday and discussed moving from military operation to a search for a political solution to syria s conflict nlnnrk on wednesday putin won the backing of turkey and iran to host a syrian peace conference taking the central role in a major diplomatic push to finally end syria s civil war now in it seventh year nlnnsrq in march last year putin said russia had achieved it goal in syria and ordered the withdrawal of the main part of it force however a usled coalition operating in syria said that after that statement russia s combat power wa largely intact
Title_Text: russia likely to reduce troop in syria before yearend military chief

Text: moscow reuters  russian tu strategic bomber have fired cruise missile at islamic state target in syria s deir alzor and idlib province the ria news agency quoted russia s defense ministry a saying on tuesday the strike were carried out at a safe distance from u special force and usbacked militia the ministry wa cited a saying
Title_Text: russian bomber fire cruise missile at islamic state target in syria ria

Text: washington reuters  u republican presidential candidate donald trump said he doe not have to win the new hampshire primary vote on tuesday to secure the nomination apparently tamping down expectation despite holding a doubledigit lead in that states poll the billionaire businessman came in second to texas senator ted cruz in the iowa caucus last week although poll put him ahead his candidacy ha alarmed the republican establishment and ha been marked by row including over his call for a temporary ban on muslim entering the united state no republican ha won the presidential nomination without winning either the iowa caucus or the new hampshire primary since the s but it would not technically be impossible asked whether a loss in new hampshire would derail his campaign trump told the nbc news show meet the press i dont think i need it i hope that i get it i would like to win but i dont know that it is necessary recent opinion poll give him a lead of between and percentage point over the next closest contender trump ha built his campaign in part around his selfdeclared reputation a a winner and a loss in new hampshire would intensify doubt that he can translate opinion poll support into vote he also told meet the press that he ha spent a much a  million less than expected on the campaign so far in part because the medium provides him so much free publicity people like you put me on what do i take a commercial for trump told the shows moderator chuck todd this story ha been refiled to restore dropped word in in nd paragraph restores quotation mark to meet the press in paragraph and reporting by howard schneider editing by louise ireland sap is the sponsor of this content it wa independently created by reuters editorial staff and funded in part by sap which otherwise ha no role in this coverage
Title_Text: trump say new hampshire win not necessary to secure nomination

Text: sometimes it take a wolf to catch a snakerudy giuliani ha been making the medium round over the last two day bragging that he knew about fbi director james comey s letter two day before it went publicthat mean giuliani ha been getting inside information from the supposedly nonpartisan federal bureau of investigation that he ha likely been passing on to donald trump which mean the fbi appears to be colluding with trump s campaign to sabotage hillary clintonand during an interview with wolf blitzer on cnn friday night giuliani wa cornered over it because the only way he could possibly get such information is if a current fbi agent is passing information to him personally or through someone else no i ve spoken to no current fbi agent giuliani claimed when asked by blitzer gosh in the last eight month nine month ten month certainly not about this then giuliani claimed that everything he ha been hearing is just hearsay but that apparently ha not stopped him from spewing the hearsay on fox news and elsewhere in an effort to smear hillary clinton so i ve had lot of conversation with them and they have told me a lot about the i guess the disagreement between the justice department on the one hand and the fbi on the other but it all come from former fbi agent and it s all hearsay but that s hard to believe since giuliani claimed that he knew about comey s letter two day in advance and that letter wa actually released it wa not hearsayblitzer then hit giuliani with a statement written by democratic congressman accusing him of obtaining leaked information from fbi agentsthe statement read this morning rudy giuliani one of donald trump s closest and most vocal campaign adviser appeared on national television and confirmed that he had obtained leaked information about the fbi s review of clintonrelated email several day before fbi director james comey sent his letter to congress last friday about this letter in fact mr giuliani went even further and bragged about the information that he had obtained stating did i hear about it you re darn right i heard about it again the only way giuliani could have heard about this is if a current fbi agent leaked the information to him or passed it to him through someone else either way the fbi ha a serious breach that is being used to help donald trump that s not correct giuliani responded i ve had no conversation with anyone inside the fbi i have heard for the last four month a tremendous amount of information about the consternation within the fbi the fact that fbi agent were very unhappy about the way they were being treated by the justice department but none of it came from any current i haven t talked to a current fbi agent so giuliani just admitted that he is getting this information from former agent who are getting the information from current agentsblitzer actually got giuliani to claim that he didn t know that comey wa going to release the information he did and that it came a a surprise but giuliani did an aboutface only second later and said it wasn t a surprise seriously blitzer did a great job of getting giuliani to tie himself in knotsthe former nyc mayor then repeated his alleged hearsay once again by claiming that he ha heard from his source that fbi agent are angry at the justice department for not indicting hillary clinton despite the fact that director comey recommended that charge were not warrantedgiuliani then claimed that he read article about it somewhere but didn t specify where the article came from and said he s not sure if they are trueso giuliani claim that he is talking to former fbi agent and that what he ha heard is merely hearsay that he spread anyway a if it s the truth and then he claim that he read this information in article even though he doesn t know if what he is reading is the truth and he still repeat it to anyone within earshotand wolf blitzer drove a stake through the heart of giuliani s bullshit by asking one question but let me ask you a question mayor if you don t know it s true why are you suggesting it why are you going on national television talking about these issue if you don t know it s true giuliani once again touted his fbi source only to then be informed by blitzer that fbi agent sign a form agreeing to never reveal information about investigation and that they have a responsibility to not leak information to people like giulianihere s the video via youtubeadmedia campaign the fbi should be thoroughly investigated by the justice department to find out who is leaking information to a private citizen who also happens to be a surrogate for a presidential candidate who will do anything to smear his opponent in an effort to win the election this is a major breach within the fbi and it definitely look like the fbi is working with republican to persecute hillary clinton people need to be fired for this and the first person to lose their job should be director comeyfeatured image via screen capture from embedded video
Title_Text: watch wolf blitzer nail giuliani to the wall for ten grueling minute over his fbi claim

Text: ankara reuters  turkish president tayyip erdogan accused the united state on thursday of mistreating a strategic ally in a blistering speech which appeared to rule out swift resolution to a dispute between two nato member jointly fighting islamic state hour after ankara announced official would meet soon to settle difference erdogan accused the u consulate in istanbul of hiding an individual with link to a network he blame for last year s failed coup he also condemned u support for kurdish fighter in syria and separate u court case against a senior turkish banker and the president s own security guard mocking what he said wa washington s claim to be the capital of democracy turkey s relation with the united state and many western country have been strained since last year s failed military coup against erdogan in which more than people were killed turkey felt many ally were slow to condemn the coup attempt and failed to appreciate the danger it faced western country have grown alarmed at the scale of turkey s postcoup crackdown with people detained and suspended from work tie with the united state hit a low when turkey detained a locally employed worker at the u consulate in istanbul last week the united state say it is still seeking an explanation for the arrest  the second detention of a consulate worker this year it suspended most visa service in turkey saying it needed to review turkey s commitment to the security of it mission and staff turkey reciprocated within hour u secretary of state rex tillerson spoke with turkish foreign minister mevlut cavusoglu on wednesday and expressed his profound concern the u state department said erdogan ha blamed outgoing u ambassador john bass saying he wa putting at risk a decadesold alliance let me be very clear the person who caused this is the ambassador here it is unacceptable for the united state to sacrifice a strategic partner to an ambassador who doesn t know his place erdogan told provincial governor meeting in ankara earlier deputy prime minister bekir bozdag said turkish and u official would meet to work on resolving the crisis and described talk between their foreign minister a constructive but erdogan aired a list of grievance accusing washington of sheltering suspected member of the outlawed kurdish worker party pkk and supporter of muslim cleric fethullah gulen he blame for last year s coup attempt gulen denies involvement on the one hand you say you are the capital of democracy but you hide pkk and feto member erdogan said using the label his government ha given to gulen s network he said washington wa defending a fetolinked person hiding in your consulate and said a christian pastor arrested in western turkey last year wa also clearly linked to gulen ambassador bass said this week no one wa hiding in the u consulate and that he had seen nothing of merit in the charge against the pastor andrew brunson erdogan said u authority had wrongly arrested the former head of turkey s majority stateowned halkbank and were trying to use a detained turkish gold trader a an informant both men were arrested on charge of sanction violation referring to a u grand jury indictment of turkish security official who clashed with protester during his visit to washington in may erdogan said most of them had never set foot on u soil you issue arrest warrant for of my security staff who have never seen the united state he said if the ambassador in ankara is leading the grand united state then shame on you erdogan said someone should have said you cannot treat your strategic partner this way you can t behave like this
Title_Text: erdogan say u sacrificing strategic ally turkey

Text: after a terrorist attack in london donald trump used the occasion to brag about himself and smear president obamathe united state ha been fighting isi since most of that fighting ha been done under the leadership of president obamabut nine month into his own presidency trump is now declaring that he ha done more against isi than president obamawe have made more progress in the last nine month against isi than the obama administration ha made in yearsmust be proactive nasty donald j trump realdonaldtrump september but a usual trump is completely full of shitunder obama s strategy and leadership the united state military killed over half of the commander isi had and various military strike wiped out well over isi fighter some report say over all while reducing isi territory from a wide swath of the middle east stretching from syria through iraq to just a few remaining city strongholdsin addition isi lost most of their valuable resource and recruitment dramatically declinedand in december united state official announced that percent of all isi fighter have been killedby contrast isi cheered when trump took office and have been using him a a recruitment tool trump is also responsible for killing more civilian in nine month than president obama did in just over two year which is just helping isi radicalize more fighter to their causebasically trump is waging a desperate destructive campaign to kill the remaining isi fighter and leader so he can boast that he is doing more against isi but his campaign is full of unnecessary collateral damage that is only helping isi recruitin military parlance trump s campaign is merely a mopup operation which is what take place after the military ha already gone in and wiped out most of the enemy forcespresident obama s strategy and leadership resulted in isi being crippled trump is only getting the crumb that obama did not have time to finish off and he can t even get that right because killing civilian is the best recruitment tool that terrorist organization like isi and alqaeda another terrorist group president obama crippled use to remain relevantso trump can brag all he want it doesn t change the fact that president obama wa a better commanderinchieffeatured image jack gruberpoolgetty image
Title_Text: trump claim he ha done more against isi than obama the scorecard say he is lying

Text: moscow reuters  the head of russian state oil giant rosneft igor sechin will not be in moscow on wednesday where he is meant to appear in court to testify in a major corruption trial of a former minister according to russian news agency russian prosecutor accuse alexei ulyukayev of extorting a  million bribe from powerful political rival sechin in exchange for approving a lucrative business deal in what turned out to be a sting operation ulyukayev who wa fired by president vladimir putin from his post a economy minister shortly after being detained denies the charge and say sechin framed him asked by reporter whether he would be in moscow on wednesday when the hearing is due sechin replied that he would be still be on a visit to western siberia where on tuesday he attended the opening of a new rosneft oil field tomorrow i am meeting with the governor of the khantymansiiysk region gathering the staff will be summing up result of the prime minister s visit sechin wa quoted a saying by interfax news agency sechin ha already missed two hearing in ulyukayev s trial he ha previously said he would attend a soon a his schedule allowed ulyukayev s arrest a year ago came moment after sechin personally handed him the cash in a latenight meeting at the rosneft headquarters in exchange for signing off on rosneft s purchase of a stake in midsized oil producer bashneft according to investigator the fate of bashneft one of the most lucrative state asset to be privatized in year wa the focus of a major turf war between rival kremlin camp source close to the deal and in the government have said ulyukayev wa among those who believed bashneft should go to private investor both he and sechin are deeply embedded in the tangle of allegiance and rivalry in russian politics and business ulyukayev belonged to a faction of economic liberal who argued for less state control over the economy while sechin a close ally of president vladimir putin represents the opposite view rosneft spokesman mikhail leontyev dismissed speculation over possible reason for sechin s likely absence at wednesday s hearing also citing the demand of his schedule this is a made up problem and it wa made up with only one purpose  to avoid attention from the essence of the trial leontyev said this is not the first case in the human or russian history when the court want to hear a testimony of a man with tight schedule ulyukayev face up to year in jail if found guilty
Title_Text: rosnefts sechin to miss hearing at exminister corruption trial medium

Text: quetta pakistan reuters  a suicide bomber killed a senior pakistani police official on his way to work and two others on thursday in the restive southwestern province of baluchistan official said baluchistan wa rocked by a series of attack late last year that claimed over life and raised concern about a growing militant presence including fighter affiliated with islamic state which ha claimed several bombing in the province the violence ha raised concern about security for project in the  billion china pakistan economic corridor a planned transport and energy link from western china to pakistan s southern deepwater port of gwadar three individual have embraced martyrdom including additional inspector general hamid shakeel and his driver provincial government spokesman anwar ul haq kakar told reuters a spokesman for the tehreeketaliban also known a the pakistani taliban claimed responsibility for the attack shakil wa on his way to work in the provincial capital quetta when the suicide bomber intercepted his vehicle baluchistan police inspector general moazzam jah told reuters one other police officer wa killed and three official were seriously wounded he added attack on security official in baluchistan have accelerated with four suicide bombing and one armed attack targeting police in the past six month
Title_Text: bomb kill three including senior police official in restive southwestern pakistan

Text: have you ever heard of the bamboo ceiling the term wa used when referring to the harvard quota against asian student did you know that asian student are harmed by racial quota in college admission like no other group affirmative action wa supposed to help promote equality in college admission but is having the opposite effect by discriminating against asian student in a big way it s why one large asian group ha come out in favor of trump s doj in their effort to stop discrimination against asian student and others in the current racebased college admission policy one asianamerican legal group is pleased with the announcement that the department of justice might examine affirmative action saying it represents a positive development in the fight against racebased college admission policiesstudies on affirmative action have shown that asianamerican student might suffer more from these racebased policy than other ethnic group a studied revealed asian american student often have to score higher on their sat than their white black and latin counterpart to be considered on the same playing fieldlee cheng the cofounder and director of the asian american legal foundation spoke to the daily caller news foundation about his hope that the doj will now be a partner in the fight against racebased policy in college admission now there is a voice in dc that we can appeal to there s an administration and there are people at the federal government level who want to enforce civil right a they were meant to be enforced which is to protect individual right of all american regardless of race so we view that a certainly a very positive development cheng told thedcnf we absolutely intend to keep an eye on the development of school across the country and where we find discrimination under the euphemism of affirmative action we would definitely let the doj know that they should investigate the new york time broke news tuesday night of an internal doj memo asking lawyer in the civil right division whether they are willing to perform investigation and possible litigation related to intentional racebased discrimination in college and university admission the memo doe not make absolutely clear what group are affected by these affirmative action policiesread more daily caller
Title_Text: why trumps doj get asian support in fight against racebased college admission policies

Text: lisbon reuters  former portuguese prime minister jose socrates wa indicted on graft and money laundering charge on wednesday in a vast corruption investigation that he ha dismissed a politicallymotivated socrates ha repeatedly denied wrongdoing and his lawyer joao araujo said he would fight the charge contained in the more than page indictment the page are part of a spectacle they only serve to make believe that there is something when there is nothing araujo told reporter the indictment issued after a fouryear inquiry accuses socrates of playing a pivotal role and receiving million of euro in a scheme involving the disgraced former head of the espirito santo banking empire and portugal telecom both entity have since ceased to exist inflicting billion of euro in loss on taxpayer and shareholder and their former top brass have been accused of other crime in separate investigation socrates a socialist prime minister from to is charged with three count of passive corruption while holding political office count of moneylaundering nine count of forging document and three count of tax fraud committed between and a trial date ha not yet been set prosecutor said socrates gave illicit commercial benefit to a construction company lena in return for payment received via middleman who were also indicted via a swiss bank account a former toplevel manager at stateowned bank caixa geral de depositos ha also been charged with facilitating payment ricardo salgado former ceo of banco espirito santo be and head of the espirito santo banking family is charged with paying socrates to sway portugal telecom to follow a strategy defined by salgado salgado is also accused of paying portugal telecom s former ceo zeinal bava and chairman henrique granadeiro  both of whom were also indicted be which wa a major shareholder in portugal telecom collapsed in under a mountain of debt causing a default of nearly billion euro at portugal telecom which ha since been sold off a total of people and nine firm in the construction resort development consulting and investment sector have been indicted salgado the former portugal telecom executive and lena have denied any wrongdoing socrates resigned a prime minister in the middle of his second fouryear term in a an escalating debt crisis forced him to request an international bailout which imposed painful austerity measure on portugal he wa arrested in and spent month in prison before being shifted to house arrest the socialist regained power in under prime minister antonio costa who wa a minister in socrates first cabinet
Title_Text: portuguese expm socrates indicted on corruption charge

Text: st century wire say it s not that far away guess who want to run for president in just before the new year bell rung the embattled chicago mayor rahm israel emanuel d wa forced to cut short his family vacation in cuba and headed back to the windy city after yet another embarrassing police shooting last week which claimed two life a police responding to a domestic disturbance call killed yearold quintonio legrier an engineering student at northern illinois university and bystander yearold betti jones a grandmotherlast week people family and activist held a vigil for the victim the mayor ha attempted a sort of mea culpa this time but the public is not buying it mainly because this wa the second major highprofile police shooting incident to rock city hall in the last month trouble in his keep the laquan mcdonald shooting ha rattled the dynasty potential of chicago s rahm emanuelcurrently serving his second term in office the yearold mayor is going from one crisis to the next a tension continue to simmer after the initial controversy the killing of yearold laquan mcdonald who wa shot time by city police on camera which prompted angry mob demanding the king step downthere could be a political price to pay for all of this not only are blacklivesmatter on the rampage over these latest shooting event but also legrier s mother janet cooksey appeared on national tv last sunday at a news conference wearing a tshirt emblazoned with the face of mayor emanuel with the word rahm failed u throughout the debacle emmanuel ha not given in to the public pressure even though his approval rating ha plummeted since hostility began on top of this chicago ha earned the reputation of murder capital of america despite the mayor s staunch liberal policy of gunfree zone across the city which some critic credit towards creating a criminal s paradise the mayor is already on shaky ground only last winter emanuel narrowly survived a close runoff election to keep his job in officeall of this ha the potential to cast a shadow over emanuel s political future which is likely to include a democratic party presidential run in it s reported that emanuel already ha a substantial campaign war chest ready to go billion of dollar in fact thanks to some very wealthy backer if emanuel doe go ahead with the plan the driving force behind his campaign will be his hollywood mogul brother ari emanuel who will spare no expense in term of pr marketing and advertising for his brother s political drive to the white house part of the newly found emanuel family fortune derives from their early investment in the virtual taxi service sensation uber with the emanuel investment estimated to be valued over  billion alone this is not without controversy however a it wa mayor rahm emanuel s deregulation of chicago s taxi industry that helped uber share to skyrocket in value critic are saying that there wa a conflict of interest there but in today s seedy political environment of insider trading and open criminality it might be hard for any politician to pull rank over that issue add to this the potential hundred of million more in donation that emanuel will receive from jewish property tycoon sheldon adelson and also from jewish billionaire and emanuel s fellow antigun advocate michael bloomberg and all in the interest of serving israel and you can see how emanuel could be viewed a a democratic frontrunner alreadythe mayor emerged on to the dc sewer scene a part of the clintonobama chicago political machine he s been described by afp s victor thorn a more sinister than karl rove and potentially deadlier than dick darth vader cheney back when emanuel wa barack obama s chief of staff in many commentator remarked on his psychopathic behavior including his frightening machiavellian exhibition in a white house meeting where he said the administration s political enemy need to die die die a he stabbed the table in anger reportedly using either a pen or letter opener regardless that s a bit scary enough to scare the american people considering this is a man who most likely ha his eye on the white house dual loyalty rahm emanuel might have a hard to time putting u interest ahead of netanyahu sthe other strange bone of contention about emanuel a a candidate is that he is reportedly a dual citizen although it believed he gave up his israeli citizenship at year old who share a national identity between the united state and israel and actual served in the idf briefly after college according to mondoweiss emanuel left when the gulf war broke out in order to volunteer in the idf he served in one of israel s northern base until the war ended and upon his return to the u became clinton s advisor in the white house for almost eight year emanuel can often be seen in the presence of israel leader and zionist extremist bibi netanyahu which raise the real prospect of tel aviv finally having it very own u president embedded in the white housethe fundamental question here is when it come down to the crunch which country s interest would emanuel be more loyal towards the u or israel contrary to popular republican belief set you cannot wear allegiance to both because no matter how hard the israel lobby try to portray it both country have very radically different national and social interestsif this issue sink any further down the cesspit of public outrage expect emanuel s hollywood pr machine to go into overdriveread more israel news at st century wire israel file
Title_Text: a troubled king chicagos rahm emanuel desperate to save his presidential run

Text: washington reuters  u congressional leader and white house official will release a document during the week of sept outlining the framework for tax reform a congressional source said on wednesday afterward the goal is for congress to finish the budget process by midoctober the source said
Title_Text: tax reform framework will appear endsept congress source

Text: madrid reuters  spanish prime minister mariano rajoy said on thursday he would ask spain s constitutional court to revoke a referendum law passed on wednesday by the catalan parliament that set the stage for a oct vote on splitting from spain the law passed by a majority of catalan lawmaker wa unconstitutional rajoy told a news conference spain s state prosecutor office said on thursday it would present criminal charge against leading member of the catalan parliament for allowing wednesday s parliamentary vote to go ahead
Title_Text: spanish pm rajoy to ask court to revoke catalan referendum law

Text: washington reuters  u senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said on wednesday he had invited u health and human service secretary sylvia burwell to brief lawmaker on effort over the zika virus mcconnell speaking on the senate floor said there wa an increasing amount of concern about the virus a warmer month approach and i think we could all benefit from having a better understanding of what preparation are being made to protect americans he said he had asked burwell to brief relevant senate committee and leader in both party next week
Title_Text: u health secretary to brief lawmaker on effort over zika virus

Text: reuters  the u congress passed a resolution late on tuesday calling on president donald trump to condemn hate group after trump wa criticized for his response to the violence at a white nationalist rally in charlottesville virginia a month ago the u house of representative unanimously adopted the resolution u representative gerry connolly a democrat from virginia said in a statement the senate approved the measure on monday tonight the house of representative spoke in one unified voice to unequivocally condemn the shameful and hatefilled act of violence carried out by the kkk ku klux klan white nationalist white supremacist and neonazis in charlottesville connolly said the joint resolution passed with the support of both republican and democrat will go to trump for his signature representative for the white house did not respond immediately to an email seeking comment the congressional resolution call on trump to condemn hate group and what it describes a the growing prevalence of extremist who support antisemitism xenophobia and white supremacy it also urge attorney general jeff session to investigate act of violence and intimidation by white nationalist neonazis the ku klux klan and similar group trump alienated fellow republican corporate leader and u ally and rattled market last month with comment about the violence in charlottesville where white nationalist and neonazis clashed with antiracism activist on aug one woman heather heyer wa killed and several people were wounded when a suspected white nationalist crashed his car into antiracist demonstrator the congressional resolution call heyers death a domestic terrorist attack james alex field a yearold ohio man who authority say drove into heyer and other protester ha been charged with seconddegree murder and other criminal count on aug trump denounced hatred and violence on many sides a comment that drew sharp criticism from across the political spectrum for not condemning white nationalist white nationalist had gathered in charlottesville to protest against the planned removal of a statue of robert e lee who led the proslavery confederacys army during the u civil war trump defended confederate monument last month at a rally in phoenix on aug trump accused television network of ignoring his call for unity in the aftermath of the violence in charlottesville i didnt say i love you because youre black or i love you because youre white trump said at the rally i love all the people of our country the resolution also acknowledged the death of two virginia state police officer whose helicopter crashed a they patrolled the charlottesville protest
Title_Text: congress vote to call on trump to denounce hate group

Text: star war icon mark hamill previously mocked donald trump by reading one of the presidentelect s meangirl girl tweet using the voice of the joker and now he s back to poke trump in the eye by mocking the presidentelect s attack on actress meryl streepmost people know of mark hamill a luke skywalker in star war but he s also a very talented voiceover actor his voice a the joker is amazing and using his skill to mock trump is an effective tool his newest jab at trump ha gone viral on twitter and it s about the best thing you ll hear all day am i the only one man enough to confront this overratedflunkyloser without resorting to an ad hominem assault hamill tweeted along with the recordingam i the only one man enough to confront this overratedflunkyloser without resorting to an ad hominem assault httpstcoacjkgryn pictwittercomihxnpgozm mark hamill hamillhimself january last week trump tweeted meryl streep one of the most overrated actress in hollywood doesn t know me but attacked last night at the golden globe she is a hillary flunky who lost big for the th time i never mocked a disabled reporter would never do that but simply showed him he continuedhe added groveling when he totally changed a year old story that he had written in order to make me look bad just more very dishonest mediathe incoming president lash out at people who hurt his feeling people like meryl streep for example he s about to hold the highest seat in the land yet he show no restraint on twitter where he ha nearly million follower some of which probably follow him just to see what outrageous thing he will tweet out next he tweet about nuke he manipulates the stock market by attacking brand showing that he s already abusing the power of the presidency even before he take the oath of office when he take over the potus account we suggest you report his tweet for impersonating a president impersonation account are against twitter s term of usephoto via wiki
Title_Text: mark hamill is back mocking trump by reading antistreep tweet a the joker

Text: bangkok reuters  armed insurgent stopped and torched a bangkokbound passenger bus on a highway in southern thailand on sunday police said all passenger a well a the bus driver and his assistance survived the attack although their luggage were burned with the bus the attack occurred in yala one of the predominantly ethnic malay muslim province in the south where a separatist insurgency ha dragged on for more than a decade more than people have been killed since police said at least gunman were involved in the latest attack they all escaped blocking the road with tree trunk and nail to thwart any pursuer an army spokesman wa not available for comment a with most violence in thailand s deep south there wa no claim of responsibility the insurgent are fighting for secession from predominantly buddhist thailand thailand s military government ha since held talk brokered by malaysia aim at ending the violence the process which aim to established a safetyzone a a confidencebuilding measure by early next year ha been stalled
Title_Text: insurgent burn bus in southern thailand

Text: reuters  a day after president donald trump endorsed u senate candidate roy moore of alabama trumps former chief strategist steve bannon campaigned in the state telling a crowd that allegation of sexual misconduct against moore were part of a smear campaign to keep him from office they want to destroy judge roy moore and you know why bannon asked at the rally in fairhope alabama they want to take your voice away trump originally supported moores opponent in the republican primary luther strange who wa favored by senate majority leader mitch mcconnell and other member of the republican establishment moore defeated strange in the primary and now face democrat doug jones in the dec special election to replace jeff session who became u attorney general in the trump administration bannon who left the white house in august after a power struggle and rejoined the breitbart news network rightwing website wa a major proponent of trumps america first agenda during the election campaign trump bannon said understands where roy moore stands he called the alabama senate race a referendum on the trump program moore ha been accused of sexual misconduct with teenage girl when he wa in his s moore denies the allegation reuters ha not independently verified the report the allegation initially had trump keeping his distance from moore but he ha grown more vocal in his support this week a public opinion poll show moore holding a slight lead over jones bannon remained steadfast in support of moore bannon ha pledged to back candidate in senate primary next year who oppose retaining mcconnell a the senates leader contending that he ha stalled trumps policy agenda when the accusation against moore were first reported mcconnell called on moore to drop out of the race more recently however mcconnell ha tempered his view saying alabama voter should determine whether moore should be elected in his remark moore repeatedly mocked mcconnell the folk in alabama were always going to decide mitch he said they have no interest in what you have to say and while republican appear divided over moores candidacy trumps endorsement prompted the republican national committee to reverse course and expend resource to back moore the rnc cut tie with moore last month when the account of woman who said he had sexually abused them were reported in the washington post
Title_Text: trump ally bannon campaign for moore in alabama

Text: lima reuters  former authoritarian leader alberto fujimori sought forgiveness from peruvian from the bottom of my heart on tuesday for shortcoming during his rule and thanked president pedro pablo kuczynski for granting him a christmas pardon in a video on facebook fujimori vowed that a a free man he would support kuczynski s call for reconciliation hinting that he would not return to politics i m aware the result of my government were well received by some but i acknowledge i also disappointed other compatriot the ailing fujimori said reading from note while connected to tube in a hospital bed and to them i ask for forgiveness from the bottom of my heart the remark were fujimori s first explicit apology to the andean nation that he governed with an iron fist from  they came after two day of unrest a protester slammed the pardon a an insult to victim and part of a political deal to help kuczynski survive a scandal the pardon cleared fujimori s conviction for graft and human right crime during his leadership of the rightwing government late on monday kuczynski a yearold former wall street banker appealed to peruvian opposed to the pardon to turn the page and defended his decision a justified clemency for a sick man whose government helped the country progress i cannot keep from expressing my profound gratitude for the complex step that the president took which commits me in this new stage of my life to decidedly support his call for reconciliation fujimori said
Title_Text: peru fujimori asks for forgiveness thanks kuczynski for pardon

Text: washington reuters  republican presidential candidate marco rubio racked up a number of endorsement from party leader on monday giving weight to his message that he can become the establishment favorite behind whom republican can unite arkansas governor asa hutchinson u senator orrin hatch of utah and former republican presidential candidate bob dole said they would back the u senator from florida for the partys nomination to run for president in the nov election three republican leader from nevada  u senator dean heller and u representative cresent hardy and mark amodei  also announced their support for rubio leading up the states caucus on tuesday im delighted to support marcorubio because he is best choice to keep our country safe hutchinson posted on twitter will you join me and help marco win arkansas the arkansas primary come after nevada in the statebystate nominating contest on march twelve other state and american samoa will also be holding primary or caucus on that date known a super tuesday the endorsement came a rubio try to seize on the exit of former florida governor jeb bush on saturday to win the support of more mainstream member of their party bush dropped out after a poor showing in south carolinas republican primary hatch who said he had initially supported bush because he had more experience called rubio the more serious candidate compared with frontrunner donald trump i feel he ha the background to be able to really help turn this mess around hatch told reporter dole a former u senator from kansa who lost to thenpresident bill clinton in said he switched his support to rubio after bush left the campaign trail because he wa young hardworking and a better candidate than rival ohio governor john kasich he want to grow the party a opposed to u senator ted cruz dole said in an interview on abcs political powerhouse podcast referring to another republican candidate i dont know what he want to grow reporting by megan cassella additional reporting by susan cornwell editing by eric walsh and jonathan oatis this article wa funded in part by sap it wa independently created by the reuters editorial staff sap had no editorial involvement in it creation or production
Title_Text: republican rubio score more endorsement for president

Text: washington reuters  new jersey governor chris christie is expected to end his bid for the republican presidential nomination on wednesday u medium reported but a christie spokesman said the candidate had not made up his mind no decision ha been made spokeswoman sam smith said in an email to reuters politico citing an unidentified source said christie who placed a disappointing sixth in the new hampshire primary on tuesday would suspend his campaign on wednesday fox business network in a post on twitter earlier reported that christie wa dropping out but did not cite any source separately cbs reported the governor could take a long a hour before deciding citing source after election result came in on tuesday evening the twoterm governor said he wa returning to new jersey rather than moving on to south carolina the next primary contest and would reassess his campaign his departure would leave eight republican vying to represent the party in the november presidential election christie had poured much of his campaigns resource into new hampshire and had considered a good showing there critical known for his brash talk christie had been overshadowed by new hampshires republican winner businessman and television personality donald trump and failed to gain traction with voter reporting by tim ahmann and ginger gibson writing by susan heavey editing by doina chiacu sap is the sponsor of this content it wa independently created by reuters editorial staff and funded in part by sap which otherwise ha no role in this coverage
Title_Text: republican nj governor christie to end white house bid medium

Text: beijing reuters  with warm word from chinese president xi jinping on sunday u secretary of state rex tillerson ended his first trip to asia since taking office with an agreement to work together with china on north korea and putting aside trickier issue china ha been irritated at being repeatedly told by washington to rein in north koreas nuclear and missile program and the u decision to base an advanced missile defense system in south korea beijing is also deeply suspicious of u intention toward selfruled taiwan which china claim a it own with the trump administration crafting a big new arm package for the island that is bound to anger china but meeting in beijings great hall of the people those issue were brushed aside by xi and tillerson at least in front of reporter with xi saying tillerson had made a lot of effort to achieve a smooth transition in a new era of relation you said that chinaus relation can only be friendly i express my appreciation for this xi said xi said he had communicated with president donald trump several time through telephone conversation and message we both believe that chinaus cooperation henceforth is the direction we are both striving for we are both expecting a new era for constructive development xi said the joint interest of china and the united state far outweigh the difference and cooperation is the only correct choice for u both xi added in comment carried by chinas foreign ministry china and the united state must strengthen coordination of hot regional issue respect each others core interest and major concern and protect the broad stability of tie xi said tillerson replied that trump look forward to enhancing understanding with china and the opportunity for a visit in the future tillerson said trump place a very high value on the communication that have already occurred between xi and trump and he look forward to enhancing that understanding in the opportunity for a visit in the future tillerson said we know that through further dialogue we will achieve a greater understanding that will lead to a strengthened strengthening of the tie between china and the united state and set the tone for our future relationship of cooperation trump ha so far been an unpredictable partner for china attacking beijing on issue ranging from trade to the south china sea and in december by talking to taiwan president tsai ingwen before tillerson arrived in beijing on saturday trump said north korea wa behaving very badly and accused china of doing little to resolve the crisis over the norths weapon program speaking in seoul on friday tillerson issued the trump administrations starkest warning yet to north korea saying in seoul that a military response would be on the table if pyongyang took action to threaten south korean and u force still china and the united state appeared to have made some progress or put aside difference on difficult issue at least in advance of a planned summit between xi and trump both tillerson and chinese foreign minister wang yi struck a more conciliatory tone in their meeting with tillerson saying the united state and china would work together to get nucleararmed north korea take a different course underscoring the tension north korea conducted a test of a new highthrust engine at it tongchangri rocket launch station and leader kim jong un said the successful test wa a new birth of it rocket industry pyongyangs official medium said on sunday north korea ha conducted five nuclear test and a series of missile launch in defiance of un sanction and is believed by expert and government official to be working to develop nuclearwarhead missile that could reach the united state washington want china the norths neighbor and main trading partner to use it influence to rein in the weapon program china say it is committed to enforcing un sanction on north korea but all side have a responsibility to lessen tension and get back to the negotiating table chinese official also repeatedly say they do not have the influence over north korea that washington and others believe and express fear povertystruck north korea could collapse if it were cut off completely pushing destabilizing wave of refugee into northeastern china
Title_Text: tillerson end china trip with warm word from president xi

Text: berlin reuters  the german military buoyed by million view of it previous social medium reality show the recruit is to launch a new show on monday that show the life of eight soldier serving in un peacekeeping mission in mali the sixweek show provides a realistic and authentic look at an actual military deployment including the crash of an airbus tiger helicopter in july that killed both crew member a defense ministry spokesman said on friday it will be shown monday through thursday on youtube facebook and instagram with a chatbot sending message several time a day about the soldier activity colonel holger neumann said the accident would play a role in one of the later episode and would be treated with the necessary sensitivity the military last month resumed flight of the tiger helicopter but continues to investigate the cause of the crash the show cost million euro to produce and market neumann said describing it a part of the military s drive to make the military a more attractive career option the last show which showed how new recruit were trained sparked a percent increase in traffic at the ministry s career website and a percent boost in call to a recruitment hotline he said ilka hoffmann a board member at the gew union that represents about teacher social worker and education worker said the new program s action film aesthetic wa clearly targeting young people and glamorizing war not everything is a positive a it is portrayed people can die during this deployment or come back traumatized she said the bundeswehr can t want people to sign up out of a sense of adventure she said the union the nonprofit group terres de hommes and other group have also protested the military s school outreach program aimed at  and yearolds saying it viewed the recruitment drive a a violation of un convention on child
Title_Text: despite death german military eye recruitment bump from new reality show

Text: president trump and the first lady took the time to visit the coast guard ahead of the thanksgiving day holiday melania proved once again that her fashion choice continue to provoke a response according to the petty liberal she wa scoring a fashion mishap during the visit we think she s appropriate and sporty looking there wa one thing that she wore that made liberal have a fashion freak out no it wasn t her pink gingham shirt that s a fashion repeat that wa worn a she got off marine one a few month agoit wasn t her converse lowtop tennis shoe it wa her hat check out the visitremember when melania caused a stir when she wore stiletto for her trip to texas president trump and first lady melania traveled down to texas today to assist with and show support for flood victim you d think the press would point out that this is a great gesture by the first couple but that s not the case the press could only focus on the fact that the first lady wore heel on her departure to texas they mocked her saying she wasn t quite ready to help flood victim melania s shoe are impressive but perhaps not what i would wear to a city submerged in floodwaters wrote elizabeth bruenig an assistant editor at the washington postthose stiletto should help her stay above the flood line httpstcodqfkn ryan teague beckwith ryanbeckwith august melania is wearing stiletto to a hurricane zone httpstcowiwlipab erica orden eorden august she had on all black with a pair of black stiletto who care at least she made the trip we can t say the same for michelle obama during the louisiana floodswe checked into what michelle obama wore to visit the louisiana flood oops she didn t go remember that she wa on vacation with barack and the girl but then came home and didn t make the trip with
