is she ready enough nowfirst lady melania trump wore a baseball hat that said flotus a she exited air force one upon landing in corpus christi texas on tuesdayfirst lady melania and president trump arrive in texas to be briefed on harvey s devastating aftermath pictwittercomdzibqbrk washington examiner dcexaminer august the first lady had her hair pulled back in a ponytail under the black hat with white letteringshe also wore white sneaker black pant and a white buttonup shirtlooking greathttpswwwyoutubecomwatchvpoteiafkgread more we
Title_Text: melania visit coast guard with potusone part of her outfit cause liberal freak out video

Text: washington reuters  the ambassador to washington from britain france germany and the european union all strongly backed the international nuclear agreement with iran on monday a long a tehran continues to comply with the pact u president donald trump is weighing whether the deal serf u security interest a he face a midoctober deadline for certifying that iran is complying with the pact a decision that could sink an agreement strongly supported by the other world power that negotiated it we agree that the demise of this agreement would be a major loss david o sullivan the european union s envoy in washington said at an atlantic council panel discussion german ambassador peter wittig said anyone advocating walking away should consider larger issue including an increased danger iran would resume enrichment danger of a nuclear arm race in an unstable region and impact on global nonproliferation effort what kind of signal would this send to country like north korea wittig asked it would send a signal that diplomacy is not reliable that you can t trust diplomatic agreement and that would affect i believe our credibility in the west when we re not honoring an agreement that iran ha not violated if trump doe not recertify by oct congress ha day to decide whether to reimpose sanction suspended under the accord that would let congress which is controlled by trump s fellow republican effectively decide whether to kill the deal although congressional leader have declined to say whether they would seek to reimpose sanction every republican lawmaker opposed the deal reached by democratic president barack obama s administration many like trump have made opposition to the agreement a campaign issue if washington pull out of the deal the ambassador said they would do everything possible to protect any company based in europe that continue to do business with iran from reimposed u sanction britain s ambassador kim darroch said trump and prime minister theresa may had devoted about half their discussion to iran when they met in new york last week although trump did not reveal his decision he said may had explained again why britain support the nuclear pact seeing it a a matter of national security a long a the iranian continue to comply with it in the view of the iaea we will continue to support it he said referring to the international atomic energy agency speaking separately at another event in washington white house national security adviser hr mcmaster defended trump s criticism of the deal i obviously agree with the president on this i think it wa the worst deal it gave iran all of the benefit up front mcmaster said adding that it had the fatal flaw of a sunset clause he wa speaking at an event hosted by the institute for the study of war the socalled sunset clause are provision under which some of the deal s restriction on iran s nuclear program expire from french ambassador gerard araud noted that the other country that signed the pact  russia china and iran  had made clear that they do not support renegotiating
Title_Text: european ambassador to u back iran nuclear pact

Text: niamey reuters  mali and niger two of the west african nation worst affected by jihadist violence appealed on wednesday for international funding for a regional force they have set up to counter islamist insurgency mali s president ibrahim boubacar keita and niger s mahamadou issoufou said the force assembled by the g sahel bloc mali mauritania burkina faso niger and chad wa crucial to fighting a threat that went well beyong their border we bring this combat against terrorism not only to protect our own people and country but for the whole world issoufou told a news conference in niger s capital niamey for terrorism know no border it will go to europe it will go to the united state he said the world ha to be mobilized the idea of the g force wa first dreamed up in but only in july last year did the country set it up it is expected to comprise around troop french president emmanuel macron ha said he expects it to be operational by the autumn islamist group some with link to al qaeda seized mali s desert north in frenchled force scattered them the following year but they still attack peacekeeper soldier and civilian target in mali niger burkina faso and ivory coast issoufou said a multinational force in the lake chad region including soldier from niger nigeria chad and cameroon had had some success against islamist boko haram militant but that this wa financed by africa s biggest economy nigeria whereas no country in the g had sufficient resource it is important that the international community take note of this and get together to give u resource to ensure our mission can be accomplished he said analyst see the g force a the basis of an eventual exit strategy for around french troop deployed to the region on counterinsurgency mission mostly in mali we have only limited mean but if we mutualize our power our sovereign element will have more force more vitality than we imagine malian president keita said issoufou said the force would be divided into three deployment across the sahel region an eastern one consisting of chadian and nigerien force a central one with force from niger mali and burkina faso and a western one with troop from mali and mauritania
Title_Text: niger mali leader seek funding for new antijihadist force

Text: london reuters  britain could bring in tough new control on immigration from the european union without actually having to leave the bloc former prime minister tony blair said on sunday concern over the impact of high level of immigration on public service and housing were cited a a factor by many who voted to leave the eu in last year s referendum prime minister theresa may s conservative government ha said free movement of eu citizen coming to britain must end many brexit supporter blame blair s government which allowed citizen of former communist state to settle immediately in britain despite a long transition period implemented by other eu country for a big influx of eu migrant from there is no diversion possible from brexit without addressing the grievance that gave rise to it paradoxically we have to respect the referendum vote to change it blair who ha said brexit can and should be stopped wrote in the sunday time newspaper we can curtail the thing that people feel are damaging about european immigration both by domestic policy change and by agreeing change within europe to the freedom of movement principle added blair who led a labour government for a decade from asked about blair s proposal defense minister michael fallon said the government had to get on with delivering brexit the country ha taken it decision we are leaving the european union now and that mean freedom of movement ha to end there have got to be restriction on those coming here he told bbc television a leaked government document last week said britain wa considering measure to restrict immigration for all but the highestskilled eu worker plan some company called alarming a paper published on sunday by blair s institute for global change said the government could take step including registering eu migrant when they arrive to keep track of whether they meet eu rule about finding work eu migrant could also be forced to show evidence of a job offer before being allowed to enter britain and those without permission to reside could be banned from renting opening a bank account or accessing welfare benefit it said the paper also proposes seeking an emergency brake to implement temporary control on migration when service are stretched a strengthened version of a deal offered to former prime minister david cameron ahead of the referendum
Title_Text: uk doesnt need brexit to curb eu immigration say former pm blair

Text: tampa fla reuters  president donald trump on monday accused the news medium of ignoring attack by islamist militant in europe trump who ha made defeating islamic state a core goal of his presidency did not specify which attack were going unreported which news medium organization were ignoring them or offer any detail to support his claim all over europe its happening its gotten to a point where its not even being reported he told a group of about u troop at macdill air force base in florida and in many case the very very dishonest press doesnt want to report it they have their reason and you understand that he added without saying what those reason were the white house later released a list of attack around the world from september to december networks are not devoting to each of them the same level of coverage they once did a white house official said this cannot be allowed to become the new normalit wa trumps latest salvo against the news medium a favorite target for derision that he say broadly underestimated his chance during the presidential campaign he ha kept up the attack since his jan inauguration trump at one point cited attack in the french city of paris and nice which were widely covered more than people have died in france alone in the past two year at the hand of attacker allied to islamic state al tompkins at the poynter institute a floridabased journalism school dismissed trumps criticism to suggest that journalist have some reason not to report isi attack is just outlandish tompkins said using an acronym for islamic state
Title_Text: trump militant attack all over europe some not reported

Text: last week a baby dolphin wa found on at beach of the santa teresita resort located in argentina tourist saw the baby dolphin and did what tourist do they took picture of the poor animal it turn out that the baby dolphin died because the people on the beach kept out of the water too longhere is the photo taken by one a person on the beachhttpswwwfacebookcomphotophpfbidsetatypetheaterhere is video footage of the incidentthe wildlife foundation in argentina found photo and video of the tourist tormenting the dolphin they took the opportunity to try to raise awareness about the type of dolphin and what people need to do when they find a dolphin on the beach they write in a press release thefranciscan or plata dolphin is one of the smallest dolphin in the world is between and m long his skin brown tone reminiscent of the habit of the franciscan monk so it get the common name only it is found in argentina uruguay and brazil in our country life mainly off the coast of the province of buenos aire where it is very likely that there are less than individual franciscan in a vulnerable to extinction according to the international union for conservation of nature iucn no le saques fotos ayudalo a volver al agua estas situaciones pueden llevar a su muerte httpstcotudbotbzdz pictwittercomfezmgofcj vida silvestre vidasilvestre february the fact that this specie of dolphin is endangered make the dolphin s death just that much more tragic this incident should help the public understand the urgent need to return these dolphin to the sea when they get close to the shore the foundation said the franciscana like other specie cannot remain for much time outside of the water it ha thick skin full of fat which regulates it body temperature so taking it out of the water rapidly cause it to dehydrate and die what those people did is absolutely horrendous hopefully this tragedy will raise awareness about what people should do when they encounter beached marine life featured image from video screen capture
Title_Text: baby dolphin dy after tourist pas it around for photo videoimages

Text: this new information just add more validity trump s argument that the u need to take a more serious look at the way we vet immigrant if we want to protect our national security while state department and the u citizenship and immigration service branch of the department of homeland security do ask if immigrant have been involved in terrorism the most well known of over a dozen terrorist group aren t listed in application according to the analysis from homeland security expert mark a sauterthe form asks if the applicant ha ever belonged to a terrorist group but neglect to ask if they currently belong to one how hard would that be to update he said that federal official told him that the question about terror group involvement are required by federal law meaning that congressional action is needed to include modernday threat in the written questionshowever detailed written question are asked about nazi cooperation a are question about whether applicant are drunk polygamist or communist one survey doe single out colombian terror organization in the written question though they have never attacked inside the u the lack of specific questioning about the biggest threat to the united state a the country eye thousand in line from syria afghanistan iran and elsewhere seeking residency raise new question about how immigrant are vetted and give ammunition to republican like presidential candidate donald trump who ha called for extreme vetting to weed out likely terrorist the examiner
Title_Text: not kidding obamas weak immigrant vetting process doesnt even include asking if they belong to isi al qaeda or muslim brotherhood

Text: the trump bashing continues a washington post columnist reviewed a fashion layoutinterview ivanka trump did with harper s bazaar and totally bashed the lovely ivanka you d think it would be somewhat middleofroad since it s in the art and entertainment section of the washington post it s almost like ivanka wa set up by harper s to have wapo trash the article fyiif you happen to subscribe to vogue harper s bazaar or people magazine you are putting money in the pocket of the democrat it s pretty sick to trash a person who s done nothing but lead a successful life a a wife mother and successful business woman pretty nastyhere s just a small piece of the garbage washington post put out on ivanka trumphere s the title and writer of the hit piece fashion photograph are all about fresh narrative but ivanka trump is selling the same old story by robin givhanthis woman is the wapo fashion critic the headline growing up trump ivanka trump tell all promise that the story will give reader something if not authenticity then at least some tidbit that will allow people to know her better to know her a more than the title that are applied to her daughter mother business woman sisterwriter lisa depaulo question trump on her friendship with chelsea clinton her father s unorthodox presidential campaign and her selfdeclared woman s advocacy she answer she doesn t answer it s a familiar coy dancethe picture however are a blatant study in avoidance in both image by photographer mark seliger viewer see trump in profile she never look her audience in the eye her gaze is focused off into the distance the viewer is kept more than an arm s length away a she stand perched on the ladder we look up at her she is elevated the positioning suggests that she is in some way above politics and above the fraybut also in her rather regal gown set against a grimy landscape her privileged life and position are underscored she make it very clear in the accompanying article that her wealth ha afforded her a host of advantage in the story she come across a selfaware and in the imagery she is comfortably advantagedphotos by mark seligerread more washington post
Title_Text: the washington post trash ivanka trump in hateful hit piece that smell of trump derangement syndrome

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump said he had a very good phone call with mexican president enrique pena nieto on friday and agreed to work to improve tie after a meeting between the two leader wa scrapped amid a dispute over funding trumps planned border wall we had a very good call i have been very strong on mexico i have great respect for mexico but a you know mexico with the united state ha outnegotiated u and beat u to a pulp through our past leader theyve made u look foolish trump told a news conference at the white house trump said the call wa friendly and he looked forward to renegotiating the u trade relationship with mexico in the future
Title_Text: trump say he had very good call with mexico pena nieto

Text: yangon reuters  pope francis held talk on monday with myanmar s military chief at the start of a delicate visit to a majoritybuddhist country that the united state ha accused of ethnic cleansing against it muslim rohingya people the leader of the roman catholic church will also visit bangladesh where more than rohingya have fled to escape what amnesty international ha called crime against humanity myanmar s army ha denied accusation of murder rape torture and forced displacement that have been made against it the pope s first meeting in yangon wa with military commander senior general min aung hlaing in st mary s cathedral in the heart of the southeast asian nation s largest city they discussed the great responsibility of authority of the country in this time of transition vatican spokesman greg burke said after the minute of talk which were followed by an exchange of gift francis presented the general with a commemorative medal of his visit and min aung hlaing gave the pope a harp in the shape of a boat and an ornate rice bowl burke said the army chief told the pope that there s no religious discrimination in myanmar and there s the freedom of religion according to a statement on the facebook page of min aung hlaing every soldier s goal is to build a stable and peaceful country the army chief wa paraphrased a saying in the statement member of ethnic minority group in traditional dress welcomed francis at yangon airport and child presented him with flower a he stepped off his plane he waved through an open window at dozen of child waving vatican and myanmar flag and wearing tshirt with the motto of the trip love and peace a he set off in a car only about of myanmar s million people are roman catholic thousand of them traveled by train and bus to yangon and they joined crowd at several roadside point along the way from the airport to catch a glimpse of the pope more than people have registered for a mass that francis will say in yangon on wednesday according to catholic myanmar church spokesman mariano soe naing we come here to see the holy father it happens once in hundred of year said win min set a community leader who brought a group of catholic from the south and west of the country he is very knowledgeable when it come to political affair he will handle the issue smartly he said referring to the sensitivity of the pope s discussion about the rohingya large number of riot police were mobilized in yangon but there were no sign of any protest the trip is so delicate that some papal adviser have warned francis against even saying the word rohingya lest he set off a diplomatic incident that could turn the country s military and government against minority christian the rohingya exodus from rakhine state to bangladesh s southern tip began at the end of august when rohingya militant attacked security post and the myanmar army launched a counteroffensive u secretary of state rex tillerson last week called the military operation ethnic cleansing and threatened targeted sanction for horrendous atrocity myanmar s government ha denied most of the accusation made against it and the army say it own investigation found no evidence of wrongdoing by troop myanmar doe not recognize the rohingya a citizen nor a member of a distinct ethnic group with their own identity and it even reject the term rohingya and it use many people in myanmar instead refer to member of the muslim minority in rakhine state a illegal migrant from bangladesh francis is expected to meet a group of rohingya refugee in dhaka capital of bangladesh on the second leg of his trip the most tense moment of his myanmar visit were expected to be the private meeting with the army chief and separately with civilian leader aung san suu kyi on tuesday vatican source say some in the holy see believe the trip wa decided too hastily after full diplomatic tie were established in may during a visit by suu kyi suu kyi s reputation a a nobel peace prize laureate ha been tarnished because she ha expressed doubt about the report of right abuse against the rohingya and failed to condemn the military the pope ha already used the word rohingya in two appeal from the vatican this year asked if he would say it in myanmar burke said francis wa taking the advice he had been given seriously but added we will find out together during the trip it is not a forbidden word a hardline group of buddhist monk previously known a ma ba tha said it welcomed the pope s visit but warned without elaborating of a response if he spoke openly about the rohingya i hope he doesn t touch on sensitive issue that myanmar people couldn t accept said tawparka a spokesman for the group who go by a single name there s no problem if he talk about islam but it s unacceptable if he speaks about rohingya and extreme terrorist
Title_Text: pope meet myanmar military chief in shadow of rohingya crisis

Text: hammer attack have been happening way too often lately honestly if you google nyc hammer attack you come up with way too many case is this the new trend in street crime last year it wa slashing with a razor or knife horriblewe just reported on a hammer attack last weekwhile the left want to take gun away the hammer is the culprit in this subway brawl this is a terrible attack that wa provoked by nothing two men asked if the person on the subway could move over the passenger wa manspreading aka using up two seat by spreading his leg apartnew york launched a campaign last year with poster on the subway telling passenger not to manspread a you can see it wa a total waste of taxpayer dollarsit all went downhill from there an argument over manspreading on a lower east side subway train ended in an allout brawl with one man attacking another with a hammer official said saturdaythe yearold hammer victim wa on a queensbound j train pulling into the bowery station when his yearold pal asked a stranger taking up two seat to make roomthe seat hog complied but that didn t stop the yearold man from getting into an argument with him and six friend he wa riding the train with sparking a fightone of the six friend repeatedly kicked the yearold man in the head and chest official saidj train nightmare ensues after offduty cop shove conductor when the victim tried to defend himself his attacker s friend jumped in and one of them pulled a hammer out of his backpack and bashed the victim repeatedly with itthe victim and his friend were on a queensbound j train coming into the bowerydelancey st station when the older man asked a stranger taking up two seat to movethe victim s friend tried to shield the victim but wa also beaten witness told policethe suspect fled the train at the bowery station and have not been caught police saidfirst responder took both victim to beth israel hospital with nonlifethreatening woundsvia nydn
Title_Text: subway rider attacked with hammer for asking passenger to stop manspreading

Text: reuters  a lifesized nude statue of u republican presidential contender donald trump is going up for auction with profit from the sale going to an immigrant support group juliens auction said on wednesday that the statue called the emperor ha no balls is expected to fetch  to  at the oct auction in los angeles the statue is one of a series that appeared unannounced in public space in new york and four other u city earlier in august the orangetinted likeness showed trump with a massive belly small finger and some missing genitals most were confiscated or destroyed by local authority and the los angeles statue is the only one remaining juliens said the statue were created by an anonymous artist collective called indecline a portion of the auction profit will go to the national immigration forum which campaign for the right of immigrant trump ha pledged to build a wall between the u and mexico to keep immigrant out and to deport the million of undocumented immigrant in the united state should he be elected he is due to give a speech on wednesday a he seek to find a balance in his immigration stance trump is not the only politician to be represented in the october auction of street and contemporary art american pop artist knowledge bennetts hillary clinton cojones featuring the democratic white house hopeful wearing a tuxedo is expected to fetch up to  juliens said
Title_Text: naked donald trump statue up for auction could fetch

Text: on the night of january responsible gun owner justin lowrie decided to skip the aa meeting he wa scheduled to attend so he could get drunk with friendsaccording to the leadertelegram lowrie wa experienced with firearm the yearold alcoholic had been given a concealed carry permit by the state of wisconsin two month before the permit made it perfectly legal for lowrie to take his mm handgun to a drinking partyaround pm a the party wa winding down lowrie and a group of friend were gathered in an apartment building in rice lake he wa holding his handguntwo friend laura polichnia and cheri fullarton were standing arminarm nearby that s when lowrie accidentally shot fullarton in the face killing hermelissa leland a resident of the apartment building where the shooting took place described the scene to wqow we heard a gunshot and all of a sudden people just started screaming and cry and after a couple of minute went by i went out of my apartment and checked to see what the heck wa going on one of my neighbor just came running at me cry he shot her he shot her someone from the apartment complex called before authority arrived at the scene lowrie left the apartment where the group had been gathered he returned to his own apartment located two door away from the apartment where fullarton wa shotthat s where he put the gun to his own head pulling the trigger and ending his own life in a moment of drunken despairthe leadertelegram describes lowrie a a man with a troubled past and a drinking problem during an interview here lowrie s father said his son had been troubled due to his wife leaving him and his mother dying of cancer in the nra say that everyone ha the right to own a gun regardless of mental and emotional health any attempt to prevent a tragedy like this is portrayed a an evil liberal plot to take their gun away and put them in fema camp or something equally a ignorantcheri fullarton wa a yearold mother of threeduring an interview with the leadertelegram her brother roger miller said the family is struggling to deal with the loss we try and remember how she loved her child wa pretty and intelligent he said we re just mad a hell about how he wa screwing around with a gun even if he thought it wa unloaded lowrie s distraught father told the leadertelegram all i know is that justin made the choice that he did in a drunken state and he s not here for me to ask why during the same interview justin lowrie s dad also said i believe the lord is going to save other people through this we all wish he could take it back but he can t we don t get doovers but we can acknowledge the thing that have happened and learn from them to make better choice maybe this will change someone else s life that would be great but the guntotin jesus of rightwing christian fantasy would never allow such a thing to happenhere s more on this story from wqowwqow tv eau claire wi news news weather and sportsfeatured image credit alice taylor via flckr cc
Title_Text: responsible gun owner shoot himself after accidentally killing friend video

Text: berlin reuters  there is no reason to suspect that two bag of bullet found near a christmas market and mosque in western berlin have anything to do with terrorism and the find wa related neither to the market nor to the mosque police said on sunday asked about a possible link with terrorism a police spokesman said not at all ammunition is always being found in berlin he added somebody wa probably clearing their cellar out and found something from their grandfather germany is on high alert for militant attack nearly a year after a tunisian islamist rammed a hijacked truck into a christmas market in central berlin killing people a well a the driver earlier this month expert made safe a device filled with nail that wa delivered to a pharmacy near a christmas market in the german city of potsdam near berlin
Title_Text: berlin police say bag of bullet found near christmas market not linked to terrorism

Text: washington reuters  the u senate will vote on legislation imposing new sanction on russia iran and north korea later on thursday senator mike enzi said in remark on the senate floor the measure ha already passed the house of representative by a  vote it is also expected to garner very strong support in the senate despite concern about it from president donald trump

Text: brussels reuters  nato secretarygeneral jens stoltenberg said on thursday he would not interfere in the u election campaign but said that solidarity among ally wa a key value for the group this is good for european security and good for u security the nato head said in a statement the united state ha always stood by it european allies stoltenbergs comment came after republican presidential nominee donald trump raised fresh question about his commitment to automatically defend nato ally if they were attacked the new york time reported
Title_Text: nato chief stress solidarity among nato ally

Text: reuters  u presidentelect donald trumps pick to lead the environmental protection agency resigned a chairman of the rule of law defense fund in november bloomberg reported on friday citing a financial disclosure report filed with the office of government ethic oklahoma attorney general scott pruitt a critic of federal environmental regulation ha been questioned by environmental activist and democrat on the u senates environmental panel about his tie to the energy industry after resigning a chairman in november pruitt resigned from the board of the rule of law defense fund in december bloomberg said bloombgilrlla the rule of law defense fund describes itself a a public policy organization for issue relevant to the nations republican attorney general the rule of law defense fund and trumps transition team did not respond to a request for comment pruitt could not immediately be reached outside regular business hour reuters wa not immediately able to verify the report with the office of government ethic
Title_Text: trump epa pick resigns from rule of law defense fund bloomberg

Text: the notoriously violent ms street gang known for slashing victim to death with knife and machete is reviving it brutal brand of violence to reassert it dominance in the washington metropolitan area with authority linking at least eight homicide in virginia and maryland in to the gangthe recent uptick in violence can be traced to a failed gang truce in el salvador and in part to a surge of unaccompanied central american child who entered the united state in to flee violence at home according to gang analyststhere is concern over the degree to which ms also known a mara salvatrucha ha exploited an immigration policy that over the past two year ha allowed wave of migrant child to enter the united statesin one of the eight recent killing with ms tie three young men were charged in connection with the fatal shooting of a yearold in loudoun county virginia they were identified a having entered the united state illegally in a unaccompanied child who later skipped immigration hearingswashington timeswatch tucker carlson tell viewer that ms is a far greater threat than isi the police commissioner on long island s suffolk county declared war on the ms gang thursday after the discovery of four mutilated body in a central islip parkthe slaying are a stark reminder that we are in the midst of a war timothy sini said standing across the street from where the body of four young men were found wednesday night we re going to continue that war ms already blamed for six long island slaying emerged a the prime suspect because of the brutality of the executionswednesday s discovery came six week after alleged ms gang member were indicted by the u department of justice for murdersms wa founded in los angeles by immigrant seeking safe haven from a civil war in their native el salvador during the s this is a longterm war sini said and make no mistake about it it s a war upi
Title_Text: tucker carlson why brutal ms gang obamas undocumented children is far greater threat than isi video

Text: washington reuters  u lawmaker said on monday they wanted another  billion added to president donald trumps proposed defense budget of  billion to hire more troop and buy more aircraft and ship in fiscal republican house of representative armed service committee chairman mac thornberry released a proposed defense policy bill intended to address military readiness and the department of defenses unfunded requirement list which is hovering at  billion house staff told reporter on monday the  billion proposed base spending plan for the pentagon and defense related expense at the u department of energy wa more than percent higher than the defense spending budget cap of  billion which would need to be raised by congress for the legislation to be enacted the proposal also included  billion for overseas contingency operation oco to pay for ongoing war this funding would not count against the budget cap the house proposal would put total defenserelated spending at  billion for fiscal trumps budget proposal included  billion for oco funding and total spending of  billion if enacted the house proposal would mean the pentagon could commit to buying more f jet from bethesda marylandbased lockheed martin co for a total of in it would increase the army by to active service troop the proposal would allow the pentagon to buy a total of boeing co fs up from in trumps budget proposal the proposal also give the navy authorization for an additional five ship above trumps original budget request the ship include an arleigh burke class destroyer made by general dynamic corp and huntington ingalls industry inc and a total of three littoral combat ship built by lockheed martin and australias austal ltd the proposal also includes defense acquisition reform measure that would change how the pentagon buy service and would allow the military to buy commercial off the shelf product from existing business to business ecommerce market such a amazoncom inc or w w grainger inc on wednesday democrat and republican on the house armed service committee are slated to meet to discus and potentially alter the proposal
Title_Text: house committee eye  billion increase to trump defense budget

Text: clearwater fla reuters  some of his supporter fret that president donald trump is backing himself into a corner with promise that cant be kept others lament he is not pulling america from international conflict a he vowed  or say he should get off of twitter those grumble are early warning sign for trump a he mark his th day in office on saturday they were heard in reuters interview with trump supporter in swing county that went for democrat barack obama in and but then flipped for trump last year  a slice of the electorate dominated by white voter that is crucial to the republicans reelection hope and that democrat want to win back reuters visited the same four place  pinellas county in florida northampton county in eastern pennsylvania macomb county outside of detroit michigan and gate county in rural north carolina  right after the nov election what reporter found this time in more than two dozen interview is that trump voter are largely standing with their man but with sign of restlessness mainly over foreign policy concern over getting legislation through congress and some skepticism that he wont be able to follow through with promise  from building a wall along the mexican border to repealing obamas signature healthcare law but rather than bash trump many largely blamed democrat and republican alike a fractured congress the federal judiciary and what they see a a hostile news medium they showed a willingness to trust the president almost implicitly saw him a a tireless worker and appreciated his effort to secure the border and curb immigration they had little interest in the infighting between his senior aide in the white house maybe sometimes i question whats going on said karen mayer an attorney in clearwater a west coast florida city in pinellas county where the majority of it voter went for obama in and but then flipped for trump last year he prevailed over democratic challenger hillary clinton by slightly more than percent of the vote there but at the same time i have faith that he ha a strong team mayer said in a statement touting trumps record in the first day the white house highlighted among other thing his attempt to streamline government by proposing a lean budget and his aggressiveness in foreign affair particularly with regard to challenging russia and iran if trump ha reason to worry about his reelection prospect it should be because of supporter like brian mccann who owns a real estate firm in northampton pennsylvania i think hes finding out that he cant follow through on all his talk he said internationally i think hes creating more tension than solutions that wa the main reason that holly peseski a legal assistant in mt clemens michigan graded trumps tenure a a bminus so far i dont like the recent bombing hes done peseski said referring to u missile strike on a syrian airfield and a huge bomb dropped on a militant hideout in afghanistan he wa a little too quick to act peseski had another complaint about trump i wish hed get off of twitter the county reuters visited reflect the rural suburban and largely white coalition that carried trump to the white house trump wa able to flip these county and dozen more like them powered by an enthusiastic voter base that included many people who had not cast ballot in year a well a some democrat who crossed over largely because of their dislike of clinton an analysis of reutersipsos polling data show slippage in trump approval rating with lower enthusiasm among white men without a college degree the core of his political base in comparing trumps approval rating in the first day of his tenure to a day period in april reuters also found a rise in disapproval among independent collegeeducated adult people with belowaverage income white woman and white millennials those woman voter were important to trumps victory he beat clinton percent to percent among white woman who comprise percent of the electorate in pinellas county for instance white woman are by far the largest demographic among it more than registered voter trump beat clinton there by a little more than vote david jolly a former republican congressman who lost his pinellasbased seat in november in part he said because of his criticism of trump ha seen few sign that the presidents support is fading but at the same time hes not picking up new supporters trumps overall approval rating in reutersipsos polling ha declined steadily over the past two week and is now at it lowest level since he took office with percent of american now approving of his performance in office some voter interviewed in the swing county identified the struggling effort to replace obamas healthcare law a an early worry about trump walter watson a retired art teacher in gatesville a town of about people in rural gate county north carolina said he did not like the way trump and republican tried to rush through a new healthcare plan without giving it what he thought wa proper consideration you got to be careful because this is a life and death issue for a lot of people watson said his sparsely populated county backed obama with percent of the vote in but trump won it with percent in congress is the biggest hindrance to trumps success many of those interviewed said i dont think hes going to be able to do even half of what he claimed said bob white a retired finance worker in clinton township in michigan i dont think congress is going to go along with him but even a they express skepticism that trump can achieve all of his campaign promise his supporter are sticking with him for now i think hes trying said watson but he probably overstated what he could do because even a president ha limits
Title_Text: get off of twitter a trump nears day some stirring of discontent

Text: remember when the world laughed at donald trump when he claimed that president obama put a tapp on his wire at his gigantic golden tower in new york apparently he forgot because he is still claiming it is true despite multiple intelligence agency disputing the ridiculous allegationin an interview with financial time trump wa asked if he regret any of his tweet like this oneterrible just found out that obama had my wire tapped in trump tower just before the victory nothing found this is mccarthyism donald j trump realdonaldtrump march now my last tweet you know the one that you are talking about perhaps wa the one about being in quote wire tapped meaning surveilled trump said guess what it is turning out to be true it is not turning out to be true in the least trump tower wa monitored for two year ending in but president obama did not order it the fbi did and the probe led to gran jury indictment of people involved in a russian money laundering operation including one of the country s most notorious mob bossesin addition numerous trump transition team member were caught up in incidental collection while intelligence agency were looking into foreign criminalstrump s desperate attempt to distract from the russia investigation especially since michael flynn offered to roll over in exchange for immunity are at this point patheticfeatured image via getty image chip somodevilla

Text: joe biden wa speaking at the skybridge alternative salt conference when one rich ahole decided to disrespect the former vice president s dead son biden wa furious and he put the heckler in his place effortlesslybill ackman manager of a failing hedge fund wa speaking at the wall street event a well fox business report that during the private vip dinner former florida governor and gop presidential contender jeb bush asked biden why didn t you run biden explained that part of the decision stemmed from the death of his son beau biden who died of brain cancer in the room grew quiet a biden became emotional and said i m sorry i ve said enough that s when ackman blurted out why that s never stopped you before the formal and understated dinner conversation suddenly turned tense according to three people who were present and confirmed both the substance and the wording of biden s responsesbiden these people say turned to someone seated near him and asked who is this asshole a reference to ackmanthen he turned directly to ackman and stated look i don t know who you are wiseass but never disrespect the memory of my dead son these people sayackman attempted what wa described a an apology to which biden said just shut the hell up a spokesman for ackman insisted that the idea that there wa an argument or altercation between joe biden and bill ackman is just utter nonsense he even added that bill had a great time at the dinner and enjoyed spending time with the former vice president but three different source who witnessed the exchange say otherwise biden wa in rare form said one person with direct knowledge of the heated conversation i can t believe it ha never leaked out there are some line you just don t cross and this is one of them why ackman thought he could get away with making this kind of remark is anybody s guess but biden wa not having it and in the process he proved that he ha plenty of spunk left for a presidential run i never thought she wa a great candidate i thought i wa a great candidate biden said at the dinner which raise speculation that he may decide to run for president in the next election while biden who is would be the oldest candidate to ever run for the white house he certainly seems up to the taskfeatured image via alex wonggetty image
Title_Text: joe biden is downright ruthless when rich ahole callously disrespect his dead son

Text: the very cornerstone of bernie sander campaign is income inequality and there s a very good reason for that the statistic are mindblowing after all those in the top one percent make time those in the bottom percent yes it s that bad but for the first time in year the bottom percent have seen some gain unfortunately the top percent have seen more gainsthe top percent income earner in the united state hit a new high last year according to the latest data from the u internal revenue service the bottom percent of income earner registered the best real income growth after factoring in inflation in year but the top one percent did even better the latest irs data show that income for the bottom percent of family grew by percent over level the best annual growth rate since but income for those family in the top percent of earner grew even faster by percent over the same periodsource equitable growththat might sound like a mixed bag and it certainly is but it doe mark the first time since the clinton administration where those who are struggling have seen real growth since the beginning of the recession those below the top percent have been seeing anemic percent growthwhile this news is pretty good it s not great to this day the nonwealthy have only recovered percent of lost wealth from the great recession thing have been much much better for those at the topincome inequality in the united state persists at extremely high level particularly at the very top of the income ladder figure show that the income adjusted for inflation of the top percent of family grew from  in to  in a growth of percent in contrast the income of the bottom percent of family grew only by percent from  in to  in a a result the top percent of family captured percent of total real income growth per family from to while the bottom percent of family got only percent of total real income growth this uneven recovery is unfortunately on par with a longterm widening of inequality since when the top percent of family began to capture a disproportionate share of economic growthwith sander all but out of the race our attention have to turn to what hillary clinton and donald trump might do to correct the problemtrump plan very little other than tax break for people making less than  a year that doe little to solve income inequality but it could take enough money from the irs that republican could claim that we a taxpayer can no longer afford food stamp or health care supplementsclinton s plan is to raise the minimum wage to  an hour middle class green job creation small business incentive college assistance and tax assistanceof course don t look for any real improvement in income inequality until the supreme court rule that corporation are no longer people donald trump is not going to give u that supreme court hillary clinton vow that she willfeatured image via alex wong at getty image
Title_Text: thanks obama the percent are doing better than in year

Text: virginia resident ruddad abdulgader a yearold sudanese native and muslim responsible for an oct biasmotivated assault of a georgetown medical student wa sentenced to month in prison by dc superior court last fridayon oct the medical student who ha remained anonymous due to the nature of his assault wa attacked by two men a he walked along the chesapeake and ohio canal path in the early hour of the morning the assailant shouted homophobic slur at him and hit him in the face with a vodka bottle rendering the victim unconsciousthe virginia resident ruddad abdulgader pleaded guilty on two felony count on nov according to a department of justice press release he wa sentenced friday to month of jail time for felony assault with a bias intent and five month for possession of a prohibited weapon due to immigration law abdulgader may face deportation to sudanunder dc law abdulgader could have received a maximum fourandahalf year sentence for felony assault with bias intent in addition to being incarcerated abdulgader must compensate the victim for his outofpocket medical costsabdulgader s accomplice saad elorch a moroccan native wa also intially charged with the biasassault however the u attorney s office dropped the charge after abdulgader admitted that he wa the only one who physically assaulted the victim elorch pleaded not guilty to misdemeanor charge of assaulting and threatening a police officer the hoyawe are unable to determine if either of these men were ever deported we ll update this story if more information becomes available

Text: washington reuters  a congressional plan to help puerto rico shed billion of dollar in bad debt can win enough support to make it way to a vote in the house of representative u lawmaker who support the measure said on tuesday under the rescue plan an independent panel would erase some of puerto ricos  billion debt load that ha crippled the island state already facing a percent poverty rate and the zika epidemic u speaker of the house paul ryan a republican ha endorsed the fix and the fate of the measure could help define his tenure a party leader which began in october but ryan can rely on some democrat who say the rescue will aid the ailing island even if some of the legislations provision are too punitive of puerto rico this is the only bill that will attract enough support from our colleague on the republican side to pas in a congress they control said rep raul grijalva the leading democrat on the house natural resource committee grijalva of arizona said he expects lawmaker will ratify the plan when they write the fineprint of the legislation at a hearing on wednesday rep rob bishop the panels chairman postponed a lawwriting session in april because of opposition to the puerto rico rescue but on tuesday he said he wa hopeful ryan and democratic leader stress the aid plan for the island mean relief without federal spending though investor will see a cut in their puerto rican bond holding and they are fighting for term that could limit the hit to their portfolio a leading voice for investor the security industry and financial market association sifma on tuesday backed the plan which expects puerto rico to control deficit spending a puerto rico oversight panel or control board could veto puerto rico spending measure that it find irresponsible and sifma endorsed such broad power to enforce and monitor fiscal discipline the oversight board would have the power to push creditor to accept a writedown of debt even over the objection of holdout investor the plan would also ask the oversight board to protect the interest of puerto rico pensioner who rely on a system that is now under funded by at least  billion
Title_Text: lawmaker see path ahead for puerto rico rescue plan

Text: washington reuters  u lawmaker are making progress toward legislation to address puerto ricos financial crisis and could produce a bill a early a thursday the top house democrat said it wa supposed to be filed yesterday they put it off to today it could be filed today i dont mean right this minute but the day is young house democratic leader nancy pelosi told reporter we are making progress were having very constructive conversations she added its an issue of what will work in term of restructuring how the makeup and the scope of the board is in furtherance of having the restructuring work issue that relate to language about pension and minimum wage etc are also part of that discussion
Title_Text: top democrat say puerto rico bill could come early a thursday

Text: reuters  after week at the control of the white house and both chamber of the u congress president donald trump and his republican have yet to pas major legislation into law and are short on time to do so before washingtons long summer recess the house of representative reconvened on tuesday it will be in session for the next nine weekday along with the senate which reconvened on monday both chamber will take a break from july  then return and work july  after that capitol hill will be quiet through the annual august vacation trump set high expectation a a candidate and early in his presidency promising to repeal and replace obamacare invest in infrastructure and work to cut tax and regulation these pledge have helped fuel a powerful stock market rally trumps only big domestic policy win aside from killing a handful of obamaera regulation ha been senate approval week ago of a new supreme court justice the white house ha not sent congress a legislative proposal on any major issue trump ha been swamped by investigation into possible tie between his campaign and alleged russian meddling in the election in congress the house ha approved an obamacare rollback bill but it ha stalled in the senate on tuesday vice president mike penny predicted a republican healthcare bill would be enacted by the end of summer competing tax reform plan have divided republican in both chamber no firm infrastructure plan ha emerged and lawmaker have not yet formulated a budget plan for urgent budget deadline will follow the august break and later in the year lawmaker will begin focusing on the congressional election here is a look at key date coming up june special house election in georgia and south carolina june congress start independence day break july  trump attends g summit in germany his first facetoface meeting with russian president vladimir putin july congress adjourns for fiveweek summer recess julyaugust u treasury may no longer be able to postpone the federal debt limit although this may not arrive until late sept congress reconvenes sept end of federal fiscal year without congressional action funding for many program will expire oct start of federal fiscal year current federal spending deal expires without a new deal the federal government could shut down
Title_Text: factbox time slipping by for trump republican on domestic goal

Text: beirut reuters  lebanon s outgoing prime minister saad alhariri made a brief visit to the united arab emirate from saudi arabia on tuesday despite a deepening crisis back home and a rise in regional tension triggered by his surprise resignation hariri announced his resignation on saturday during a visit to his ally saudi arabia and ha not yet returned to lebanon he said he believed there wa an assassination plot against him and accused iran saudi arabia s archrival and it lebanese ally hezbollah of sowing strife in the arab world his resignation ha thrust lebanon back into the frontline of the regional rivalry that pit a mostly sunni bloc led by saudi arabia and allied gulf monarchy against shi ite iran and it ally hariri s office said he had flown to abu dhabi on tuesday and then returned to riyadh but it gave no reason for the trip it also did not say when he would return home hariri s future tv channel said he would also visit bahrain but gave no reason hezbollah ha accused riyadh of forcing hariri to resign riyadh and aide to the lebanese leader whose family made their fortune in the saudi construction industry have strongly denied report that he ha been detained or wa forced to quit on monday riyadh accused lebanon of declaring war against it because of aggression by hezbollah dramatically escalating the crisis and threatening to destabilize lebanon on tuesday lebanese politician and hezbollah remained silent about the escalation in saudi rhetoric after a series of consultation with president michel aoun a hezbollah ally a rocket fired from yemen wa intercepted on the outskirt of riyadh hour after hariri s resignation on saturday on monday saudi foreign minister adel aljubeir told cnn the rocket wa an iranian missile launched by hezbollah iranian president hassan rouhani called aoun on tuesday to discus development telling him that unity among the lebanese people would ensure that external strife and regional problem could be overcome iran s state news agency irna reported iran will do all it can to bolster the stability of lebanon irna quoted rouhani a saying hariri s resignation ha triggered the collapse of a national unity government agreed last year in a political deal that united lebanon s opposing side this had led to lebanon s first budget since and to agreement on a new law for a parliamentary election which could now get derailed aoun ha said he will not accept hariri s resignation until he return to lebanon to explain his thinking a move widely seen a a stalling tactic hezbollah and it ally will struggle to form a government without hariri or his blessing the post of prime minister must be filled by a member of lebanon s sunni community among which he is the most influential politician the prohezbollah alakhbar daily reported on tuesday that hariri wa placed under house arrest hour after arriving in riyadh last friday that a saudi security team wa supervising his movement and that he had only limited access to his phone fouad siniora a former prime minister and member of hariri s future movement said he had spoken to him on monday and added that hariri would return to lebanon the political crisis ha alarmed investor on tuesday lebanon s dollar bond fell and the cost of insuring exposure to it debt reached it highest since late and moody s rating agency warned of damage to it credit rating fiveyear credit default swap cd for lebanon lbgvyusacmg jumped basis point from monday s close to bps according to ihs markit data lebanon s issue dollar bond lb fell cent to cent in the dollar trading at it lowest ever level thomson reuters data showed the finance minister central bank governor and head of the banking association all issued statement on monday stressing lebanon s financial and monetary stability
Title_Text: lebanon hariri visit uae a home crisis escalates

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump on wednesday called on chinese president xi jinping to exert beijing s pressure on north korea after pyongyang said it successfully tested a new intercontinental ballistic missile the white house said trump emphasized the need for china to use all available lever to convince north korea to end it provocation and return to the path of denuclearization the white house said in it statement after the two leader spoke earlier on wednesday
Title_Text: trump urge china xi to convince north korea to end provocation white house

Text: new york reuters  u presidentelect donald trump chose a former goldman sachs banker and a billionaire investor on tuesday to steer economic policy in his administration and a fierce obamacare critic to dismantle president barack obamas signature healthcare program republican trump is expected to name steven mnuchin a former goldman sachs partner and hollywood financier a his nominee for treasury secretary a source said putting a wall street veteran in the top u economic cabinet post mnuchin who spent year at goldman sachs before leaving in to launch a hedge fund served a trumps campaign finance chairman billionaire investor wilbur ross known for his investment in distressed industry is expected to be named commerce secretary a source said the announcement could come a early a wednesday the flurry of pick showed trump a real estate tycoon with no governing experience rewarding loyalist and established washington veteran a he round out his circle of top adviser republican u representative tom price an orthopedic surgeon from georgia will be trumps health and human service secretary seema verma the founder of a health policy consulting company will lead the center for medicare and medicaid service which is part of health and human service and oversees government health program for the poor and the elderly and insurance standard trump also announced his choice of elaine chao labor secretary under president george w bush to serve a secretary of transportation saying in a statement that her expertise would be an asset in our mission to rebuild our infrastructure while trump made decision on his economic team he continued to mull over who should serve a his top diplomat he dined with former republican presidential candidate mitt romney a onetime critic and the republican presidential nominee at a french restaurant in new york on tuesday night romney sharply criticized trump during the presidential campaign but he offered praise after their dinner he continues with a message of inclusion of bringing people together romney told reporter he said trumps cabinet choice so far and speech on election night were encouraging trump cast price and verma a a dream team to help him once he take office on jan with his campaign pledge to repeal obamacare the health law formally known a the affordable care act it ha been a target of republican attack since it enactment in price ha characterized obamacare a doing real harm to american families and ha cosponsored legislation to replace it verma helped penny the indiana governor add conservative piece to medicaid coverage for the states poor by requiring beneficiary to make contribution to health saving account she also worked on medicaid program in iowa ohio kentucky and tennessee chuck schumer the incoming senate democratic leader wa among the defender of obamacare who criticized prices selection nominating congressman price to be the hhs secretary is akin to asking the fox to guard the hen house schumer said the healthcare overhaul aimed at expanding insurance coverage to million more american triggered a long bitter fight between the white house and congressional republican who said it created unwarranted government intervention in personal healthcare and private industry trump ha said he will replace obamacare with a plan to give state more control over medicaid and allow insurer to sell plan nationally price and verma will both need senate confirmation congressional approval will be needed to repeal and change the health law white house spokesman josh earnest defended obamacare on tuesday saying it had expanded coverage to million of american boosted consumer protection and shored up the finance of the medicare program for the elderly well see if trump care measure up he said trump said after meeting obama following his nov election victory that he would consider keeping the provision of the healthcare law that let parent keep adult child up to age on their insurance policy and that bar insurer from denying coverage to people with preexisting medical condition price an early trump supporter in the u house of representative who lead the budget committee ha proposed a plan that would create agebased tax credit for people who buy insurance coverage on their own house majority leader kevin mccarthy said on tuesday the eventual congressional plan to replace obamacare would likely have much in common with prices idea prices plan would also roll back the laws expansion of medicaid for lowincome people a change that helped obamacare cut the number of uninsured american to million in from million in trump vowed on the campaign trail to save medicare but democrat said prices plan could amount to privatizing the government program for the elderly price ha endorsed converting medicare from a program that cover set benefit to a voucherstyle program to help people buy coverage we say to republican who want to privatize medicare go try it make our day schumer said on tuesday saying the change would be unpopular with the public democrat also criticized the pick because price ha supported barring federal fund for planned parenthood which provides some abortion in addition to birth control health exam and other service trump ha met about people a he look to shape his white house and cabinet team chao his pick for transportation secretary wa the first asianamerican woman to hold a cabinet position a labor secretary she is married to republican senate majority leader mitch mcconnell trump saw retired general david petraeus a potential candidate for the state department or the pentagon on monday on tuesday he met senator bob corker of tennessee chairman of the senate foreign relation committee corker and former new york mayor rudy giuliani a well a romney are in the running for secretary of state trump is set to launch a thank you tour of state he won in the election starting with a rally on thursday in cincinnati aide said
Title_Text: trump pick loyalist for economic post obamacare critic for cabinet

Text: new york reuters  u secretary of state rex tillerson and russian foreign minister sergei lavrov will meet in new york on sunday on the sideline of the united nation general assembly the u state department said in a brief statement the state department did not provide any detail on what the two men would discus during the pm gmt on monday meeting possible topic include the iran nuclear deal the syrian civil war and north koreas nuclear and missile program
Title_Text: tillerson russia lavrov to meet on sunday u state dept

Text: united nation reuters  united nation secretarygeneral antonio guterres warned on thursday that the violence against myanamar s rohingya muslim in the northern part of rakhine state could spread to central rakhine where more people were at risk of displacement guterres told the un security council during it first public meeting on myanmar in eight year that the violence had spiraled into the world s fastest developing refugee emergency a humanitarian and human right nightmare we have received bonechilling account from those who fled  mainly woman child and the elderly he said these testimonial point to excessive violence and serious violation of human right including indiscriminate firing of weapon the use of landmines against civilian and sexual violence more than rohingya muslim have fled to bangladesh in the past month since insurgent attacked security post near the border triggering fierce myanmar military retaliation that the united nation ha branded ethnic cleansing sweden the united state britain france egypt senegal and kazakhstan requested thursday s council meeting guterres demanded immediate humanitarian aid access to area affected by the violence and expressed concern by the current climate of antagonism towards the united nation and aid group the failure to address this systematic violence could result in a spillover into central rakhine where an additional muslim could potentially face displacement guterres said the crisis ha generated multiple implication for neighboring state and the larger region including the risk of intercommunal strife we should not be surprised if decade of discrimination and double standard in treatment of the rohingya create opening for radicalization he said
Title_Text: myanmar violence could spread displace more rohingya un chief

Text: maiduguri nigeria reuters  a suicide bomber killed other people in the northeast nigerian city of maiduguri on sunday a police official said the deadliest attack in over a month a the conflict with boko haram stretch into it ninth year the evening attack which also injured five people struck the city s muna garage area damian chukwu a police commissioner told reuters the area is home to a camp for just some of the more than million people who have fled fighting with the boko haram islamist insurgency which ha left over dead that conflict the epicenter of which is in northeastern nigeria is showing little sign of slowing despite assurance by the government and military that boko haram is on the verge of defeat on friday the united nation office for the coordination of humanitarian affair warned that attack against civilian  including suicide bombing in and near idp internally displaced person camp  continue to be a major concern two suicide bomber also injured other people in a separate attack said chukwu
Title_Text: suicide bomber kill others in northeast nigerian city police official

Text: alec baldwin didn t even wait to taste trump s salty yet delicious tear after his brilliant saturday night live smackdown of the nominee baldwin perfectly captured the disaster that wa trump s performance during the second presidential debate but the true magic happened on twitter no we re not talking about the actor nonchalantly retweeting trump s tantrum we re talking about how he perfectly anticipated the meltdown and left a response before the show wa even filmedafter the show aired the donald had a fullblown meltdown on twitter because where else one baldwin retweeted to make sure the world saw what a mess trump iswhile the world recognized how badass this wa baldwin essentially firing a rocket launcher at trump s stupid plane and walking away without so much a looking at the explosion what many are missing is that he didn t even need to say a word he already did that on friday in anticipation of the gop nominee s ohsopredictable meltdown before trump said a word baldwin had a response prepared fuck your feeling he even used a photo of one of the donald s deplorables to do itit s disheartening that the gop can t field someone who won t be baited into a fullblown tantrum by someone making a few joke about him but this is where we re at be sure to vote blue on november not november a trump told his deplorables at a rally recently this is probably the first time we ve had the literal life or death of our nation riding on an electionfeatured image via getty imagespaul hawthorn
Title_Text: alec baldwin didnt even wait for trump to whine about snl before smacking him around video

Text: shanghai reuters  chinese police said late on tuesday some claim of child abuse at a beijing kindergarten run by new yorklisted ryb education were unfounded the latest twist in a case that ha sparked outrage throughout china ryb s share plunged percent last friday after police launched an investigation into allegation of child abuse at the school though they have recovered some loss this week by gmt the share were up around percent police in beijing s chaoyang district said in a statement posted on their official microblog late on tuesday that they had criminally detained a teacher surnamed liu suspected of using knitting needle to discipline child however they added that claim made by some parent that child had been fed unidentified tablet at the school and account of a naked adult male conducting purported medical checkups on unclothed student were fabricated china s staterun xinhua news agency had reported last week that police were checking allegation that child were reportedly sexually molested pierced by needle and given unidentified pill the chaoyang police added they had recovered hour of footage from the school s surveillance system but had not yet found on it instance of people harming child they added that the hard drive storage for the footage had been damaged the fallout from the scandal ha been widespread china s education ministry ha launched a special investigation into kindergarten nationwide while beijing authority have said they will send permanent inspector to city nursery ryb which say it ha over playandlearn center and nearly kindergarten in around city in china ha suspended one teacher and fired the headmaster of the beijing kindergarten the chaoyang police said it would continue with it investigation to get to the bottom of the child abuse claim and hand out severe punishment according to the law
Title_Text: china police say some claim of abuse at beijing kindergarten unfounded

Text: jerusalemramallah reuters  israel hailed u president donald trump s recognition of jerusalem a it capital on wednesday but the palestinian condemned the move and said it diminished washington s role a a peace mediator in a landmark speech in washington trump reversed decade of u policy in defiance of warning from around the world that the gesture risked creating further unrest in the middle east past u president have insisted that the status of jerusalem  home to site holy to the jewish muslim and christian religion  must be decided in negotiation between the two side palestinian faction called a general strike on thursday throughout the occupied west bank the gaza strip and palestinian area of jerusalem and for rally to be held at midday gmt in protest at trump s move raising the chance of violent clash israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu said in a prerecorded video message that trump s decision had made for a historic day and wa an important step toward peace he added that any peace deal with the palestinian would have to include jerusalem a israel s capital and he urged other country to follow the u lead by also moving their embassy to the city he said there would be no change to access to jerusalem s holy site israel will always ensure freedom of worship for jew christian and muslim alike but palestinian president mahmoud abbas said trump s move wa tantamount to the united state abdicating it role a a peace mediator and declared jerusalem a the eternal capital of the state of palestine israel captured arab east jerusalem in the middle east war it later annexed it declaring the whole of the city a it capital a move not recognized internationally palestinian want east jerusalem a the capital of their future state which they want to establish in the israelioccupied west bank and the gaza strip with this announcement the american administration ha chosen to violate all international and bilateral agreement and resolution and it ha chosen to violate international consensus abbas said the move he said would serve the extremist group which try to turn the conflict in our region into a religious war that will drag the region into international conflict and endless war israelipalestinian peace talk have been frozen since trump s adviser and soninlaw jared kushner is leading trump s effort to restart them but those effort have shown little progress israel s west bank settlement building ha been one of the main obstacle palestinian islamist group hamas which dominates the gaza strip said trump s move wa flagrant aggression against the palestinian people and urged arab and muslim to undermine the u s interest in the region and to shun israel
Title_Text: israel hail trump historic declaration palestinian condemn

Text: johannesburg reuters  south africa s supreme court more than doubled oscar pistorius murder sentence on friday accepting prosecutor argument that the original jail term of six year for shooting dead his girlfriend reeva steenkamp wa shockingly lenient the gold medalwinning athlete a double amputee known a the blade runner for his carbonfibre prosthetics wa not in court to hear the new sentence of year and five month handed down steenkamp s family were also absent but welcomed the revised term the minimum year prescribed for murder minus the time pistorius ha already served and said it showed justice could prevail in south africa this is an emotional thing for them they just feel that their trust in the justice system ha been confirmed this morning tania koen a family spokeswoman told reuters right group in a country beset by high level of violent crime against woman say pistorius received preferential treatment compared to nonwhites and those without his wealth or celebrity status barry steenkamp the father of the slain model told sabc television the family could now get on with their life i always from the beginning said justice had not been served now it ha he said in the same interview her mother june steenkamp said we felt that we didn t have justice for reeva by that toolenient sentence but now we have justice for her pistorius elder brother carl wrote on twitter shattered heartbroken gutted the athlete s lawyer could not be reached for comment the athlete wa jailed in july last year after being found guilty on appeal of murdering model and law graduate steenkamp on valentine s day by firing four shot through a locked bathroom door the case attracted worldwide interest he had originally been found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to five year in jail that conviction wa increased to murder by the supreme court in december and his sentence extended to six year by trial judge thokozile masipa in july last year masipa said in court that while the steenkamps had suffered a great loss fallen hero pistorius life and career were also in ruin and that a long prison term would not serve justice pistorius appearance during the trial without his prosthesis had drawn gasp from the courtroom in a scathing criticism the appeal court said masipa s ruling had erred in deviating from the prescribed minimum sentence of year imprisonment for murder the sentence of six year imprisonment is shockingly lenient to a point where it ha the effect of trivializing this serious offence said judge willie seriti who read out the unanimous court decision i am of the view that there are no substantial and compelling circumstance which can justify the departure from the prescribed minimum sentence seriti also censured pistorius saying his apology to the deceased s family during the hearing did not demonstrate any genuine remorse on his part and that he doe not appreciate the gravity of his action state prosecutor led by advocate andrea johnson had told the appeal hearing this month that there were no mitigating circumstance to justify pistorius sixyear sentence defense lawyer barry roux argued that pistorius did not deliberately kill steenkamp and the appeal should be thrown out roux had said during the july trial that pistorius disability and mental distress following the killing should be considered a reason to reduce his sentence pistorius reached the semifinals of the meter at the london olympics in and took two gold in the paralympics even in prison he ha been in the news in august he wa allowed out to attend his maternal grandmother s funeral and spent a night in hospital for what local medium report said wa a suspected heart attack in august the athlete denied trying to kill himself after he wa treated in hospital for wrist injury on pistorius birthday on wednesday his father henke told local you magazine that although he wa behind bar it wa still a special day for his family full of love and tear legal analyst said pistorius could still appeal to the constitutional court south africa s topmost legal authority but saw his chance of success a slim i don t think it s over he ha one more option said lawyer ulrich roux who is not linked to the pistorius defense all the same there are few ground of success in this venture to be honest lawyer zola majavu said the constitutional court wa unlikely to agree to hear the case in my view that will be a very tall order it is pretty much the end of the road for pistorius
Title_Text: south african appeal court more than double pistorius sentence
