Text: yangon reuters  myanmar authority have found body buried in a mass grave on the edge of a village in rakhine state the militaryrun newspaper myawady reported on tuesday a day after the army said it had launched an investigation at the site about rohingya muslim have fled from rakhine state and sought refuge in neighboring bangladesh in recent month after a violent crackdown there by myanmar security force in response to attack by militant right monitor have accused troop of atrocity including killing mass rape and arson during the crackdown the united state ha said it amounted to ethnic cleansing the myanmar military ha said it own internal investigation had exonerated security force of all accusation of atrocity a team including police a local administrator judge and doctor had examined the grave site at the village of inn din about km mile north of the state capital sittwe on tuesday and discovered unidentified body myawady said this group is continuing the process of investigation to uncover the truth the report said military official were not immediately available for further comment the discovery of a mass grave near a cemetery in the village wa announced in a statement on the army commanderinchief s official facebook page on monday the village is in maungdaw township one of the area worst affected by the violence that ha prompted the united nation top human right official to allege that myanmar s security force may have committed genocide against the rohingya myanmar s armed force launched what they termed clearance operation in northern rakhine where many of the stateless muslim minority lived after rohingya militant attacked police post and an army base on aug myanmar s civilian leader aung san suu kyi ha faced fierce international criticism for failing to do more to protect the rohingya the civilian government which ha no control over the military ha said the army wa engaged in legitimate counterinsurgency operation it ha promised to investigate allegation of abuse in rakhine if it is given evidence
Title_Text: ten body found in mass grave in myanmar army newspaper

Text: it wa a slow burn but president obama made the audience explode in laughter with the punchlineduring a state dinner in honor of canadian prime minister justin trudeau president obama delivered lighthearted remark that included humorous shot at the republican party primary race and the participantsobama began by talking about how america and canada are land of opportunity and then he turned the birtherism of the gop around and threw it right back at them in a burn ted cruz will feel on the campaign trail this visit ha been a celebration of the value that we share obama began we a a people are committed to the principle of equality and opportunity the idea that if you work hard and play by the rule you can make it if you try no matter what the circumstance of your birth in both of our country obama started out serious and thoughtful setting up those in attendance for what would be a hilarious joke at ted cruz s expense thus once again demonstrating his mastery of comedy we see this in our current presidential campaign where else could a boy born in calgary run for president of the united state here s the video via youtubefor year republican have claimed that president Text: reuters  alaska governor bill walker urged state legislature on tuesday to compromise on a budget in order to avoid an unprecedented government shutdown next month the state ha a multibillion dollar deficit that must be sorted before july the start of alaska new fiscal year in order to avoid shuttering government office and service last week alaska warned thousand of state worker about potential layoff unless legislator can agree on a fix to the fiscal crisis the legislature ha been convening through a special session but walker described the negotiation a in a stalemate on monday walker proposed a compromise package that would reduce the states deficit from at least  billion last year to a  million shortfall im not wild about the compromise said walker an independent during a news conference on tuesday but were running out of time pete kelly a republican representing fairbanks and the republicanled senate president told reporter on tuesday evening that the governors message wa well received but that doesnt mean well agree to everything the senate wa evaluating the package but a reduced budget wa still the priority kelly said leader of the democraticcontrolled house declined to comment since alaska ha struggled with substantial consecutive budget deficit in part caused by the states large reliance on oil revenue and the continued low price of oil the state ha balanced it budget over the last few year by drawing  billion from it saving without adding new revenue the states budget ha been slashed from  billion in to  billion proposed for i know some people say we need to do some cuts weve been doing that walker said on tuesday we have done that significantly almost state position were eliminated in recent year along with state program and over state facility such a prison youth detention and motor vehicle site have been closed walker said
Title_Text: alaska governor urge budget compromise to avoid state shutdown

Text: washington reuters  presidentelect donald trumps spokesman said on thursday there will be an announcement on whether the united state will move it embassy from tel aviv to jerusalem stay tuned incoming white house spokesman sean spicer told reporter asked about the issue at a briefing the day before trump take office therell be a further announcement on that while campaigning for the presidency trump pledged to switch the embassy from tel aviv where it ha been located for year to jerusalem the proposal drew an outcry from palestinian and others who said it would kill any prospect for peace palestinian view east jerusalem a the capital of a future state and the status of the city is one of the most sensitive issue in the israelpalestinian dispute the united state and other country do not regard jerusalem a israels capital other nations embassy are located in tel aviv and do not recognize israels annexation of arab east jerusalem following it capture in the middle east war trump ha criticized the obama administration a not being friendly enough to the longtime u ally the obama administration ha been highly critical of israeli settlement construction in the occupied west bank and east jerusalem most country view all israeli settlement on occupied land that the palestinian seek for their own state a illegal the president trump ha made it very clear that israel ha not gotten the attention it deserves or the respect in the last eight year he intends to really show his respect for israel the importance of it in the middle east spicer said
Title_Text: trump spokesman say of possibility of u embassy in jerusalem stay tuned

Text: reuters  donald trumps inauguration a u president on friday wa greeted with note of caution by some foreign leader here is some of the reaction mexican president enrique pena nieto congratulated trump on his inauguration saying he would like to strengthen tie but that sovereignty national interest and protection of mexican would be paramount pena nieto criticized for meeting trump last year even after the new york businessman had insulted mexican in his election campaign said on twitter he would seek respectful dialogue with the new u governmentnlnfag canadas government eager to sidestep potentially protectionist u policy said it wa confident trump would see that working closely with canada benefited both nation we are confident the new administration will see that canadas partnership with the u mutually strengthens our two nation and provides real opportunity to grow our respective economies joseph pickerill spokesman for foreign minister chrystia freeland said in a statementnlnfaa germany will need a new economic strategy geared toward asia should the new u administration start a trade war with china vice chancellor sigmar gabriel said warning against protectionism hour after trump wa sworn in what we heard today were high nationalistic tones gabriel said in an interview with the public broadcaster zdf the first official german reaction to trumps inauguration i think we have to prepare for a rough ride nlnfat pope francis urged trump to be guided by ethical value saying he must take care of the poor and the outcast during his time in office nlnfayf palestinian president mahmoud abbas in a statement posted in his name on the official palestinian news agency wafa congratulated trump he added i look forward to working with him for the sake of peace security and stability in a world that is troubled and in a region that life a tragic era and to contribute to creating a safe future for everyone anders fogh rasmussen former nato chief and now an adviser to ukrainian president petro poroshenko said in a telephone interview with reuters that i had hoped and also expected a more internationally oriented speech instead we got a very domestically oriented antiestablishment speech as president of the united state he should also realize he ha become the leader of the free world  thats why people all over the globe are watching his inauguration speech and thats why i had hoped that he would also address the need for determined american global leadership
Title_Text: factbox trump presidency prompt some note of caution from foreign leader

Text: if you had any doubt left about whether fbi director james comey intentionally helped trump during the time leading up to the election you can consider that doubt removed on tuesday comey came under fire from a democratic senator for refusing to say if the agency is investigating donald trump s campaign connection to the hacking operation spearheaded by vladimir putin a you know the russian foreign minister wa quoted in various news report saying that the russian had had contact with people associated with the trump campaign oregon senator ron wyden said during comey s appearance before the senate intelligence committee now that may or may not be true my question to director comey is ha the fbi investigated these reported relationship and if so what are the agency finding i would never comment on investigation whether we have one or not in an open forum like this comey replied i really can t answer one way or another unless you have a very short memory you are probably aware that comey broke justice department protocol when he sent a letter to republican last year indicating that the fbi had discovered email pertinent to an investigation of hillary clinton s private email server after rightwing medium and donald trump used comey s controversial letter to create a false narrative that evidence had been uncovered of some sort of wrongdoing comey wa forced to admit that clinton committed no criminal wrongdoing unfortunately the damage wa already done will you provide an unclassified response to these question and release it to the american people prior to january wyden asked sir i will answer any question you ask but the answer will likely be the same a i just gave you i can t talk about it comey told the senator who had finally had enough of the suddenly evasive comey a man who only a little over a month ago wa willing to break protocol in what wa clearly an attempt to hurt hillary clinton i will tell you that i think the american people have a right to know this and if there is delay in declassifying this information and relaying it to the american people releasing it to the american people that doesn t happen before january i m not sure it s going to happen if information is not released before january it is likely that senator wyden is correct that it may never happen and comey s evasiveness only lends to the fairly concrete theory that he knowingly interfered with the election by helping trump build his propaganda campaignwatch it happen belowfeatured image via screengrab
Title_Text: comey refuse to say if fbi is investigating trumpputin and get slaughtered by democratic senator

Text: trump fan may have won the election but they aren t taking a break from expressing their racist hatred of michelle obama the donald s deplorables were out in force after the first lady posed for the cover of vogue i could have spent eight year doing anything and at some level it would have been fine obama told the magazine i could have focused on flower i could have focused on decor i could have focused on entertainment because any first lady rightfully get to define her role there s no legislative authority you re not elected and that s a wonderful gift of freedom in exercising her freedom michelle obama ha done quite a bit to push education healthy eating and support for our veteran and in exercising their freedom the right ha responded with nothing but hate the reaction to the first lady appearing in elegant clothing wa typical reader of yahoo news showered obama with racist remark calling her an ape and a monkey and even wishing death upon her for the horrific crime of wearing pretty clothes if you thought this behavior would stop after the election you were wrong trump fan are not done by a long shot and now they have been emboldened by america electing it first official kkk candidateit will get worse before it get betterfeatured image via voguescreengrabs

Text: washington reuters  when barack obama became the first africanamerican to win the white house in his victory wa a turning point in u race relation that set high expectation for progress to come nearly eight year later with donald trump and hillary clinton attacking each other over racial politics the legacy of obamas presidency look decidedly mixed black leader said to some the tone of the republican presidential nominees campaign a well a a recent series of racially charged shooting involving police show that the united state ha come no closer to overcoming it history of racial strife having a black president two attorney general and a chief of homeland security did not result in basic fairness for victim of racially charged violence said cornel west an academic and former obama supporter who ha become a highprofile critic of the democratic president how many policeman who have murdered unarmed innocent black civilian have gone to jail with that kind of black power at the top zero west said obama could have acted more directly while in office to help black west added citing persistently high childhood poverty among africanamerican the economic recovery ha not filtered over into black and working poor communities he said others said obama showed leadership on race while making real achievement on healthcare and the economy that helped american of all ethnicity al sharpton a civil right leader with close tie to the white house described obama a a transformative president held back by the need to serve varying constituency and compromise with lawmaker who had different priority he tried to be a balanced and respectful a he could to the chagrin of many in the black community who felt that he wa leaning over backwards sharpton said unemployment among africanamerican fell by half under obama sharpton noted while obamas remark on race elevated the issue in at the white house obama referred to trayvon martin a black youth gunned down by a white hispanic man a a boy who would have resembled the son he did not have weve never had a president do that sharpton said andrew young a former atlanta mayor congressman u ambassador to the united nation and adviser to slain civil right leader martin luther king jr said obama a a black leader had to seek compromise more than previous white president it wa easier for jimmy carter or lyndon johnson even bill clinton a southern white to do thing specifically for black people young said backlash from white working class voter had contributed to trumps rise young said we really havent had a complete psychological adjustment to a multiracial society he said thats whats rallying people behind trump theyre frustrated by the complexity of this day and age and trump like others give a simple answer and blame it on somebody else clinton the democratic presidential nominee blasted trump on thursday a a divisive candidate who wa stoking racist group trump criticized clinton saying she had let black american down and wa falsely labeling republican a bigoted clinton supporter were more likely to want to address race relation than trump supporter a reutersipsos opinion poll of more than people found in late march obama ha said race relation are not a bad a some suggest friend say he never expected his presidency to wipe away century of racism and slaverys legacy to expect to erase all of that legacy of injustice or racism and discrimination in eight year is unrealistic said valerie jarrett a white house adviser and close obama friend were there people who probably had a false sense of progress based just on an election sure she said the administration want to advance criminal justice reform legislation before obama leaf office aiming for a win on an issue watched closely in the black community but prospect of passage in congress during an election year are uncertain obama who ha made clear his disdain for trump and his frustration with congress ha said he hoped his own voice on race would help improve thing for future generation we plant seed and somebody else maybe sits under the shade of the tree that we planted obama said at a news conference in july
Title_Text: a racial politics loom over election obamas legacy is seen a mixed

Text: athens reuters  greece must speed up winter preparation at refugee camp on island in the aegean sea where there ha been a sharp rise in arrival the united nation refugee agency said on friday nearly refugee mostly syrian or iraqi family crossed from turkey in september  a quarter of all arrival this year unhcr data show while that is a fraction of the nearly million who arrived in  due to a european union deal with turkey to block that route  four of the five island camp are hosting two or three time a many people a they were designed for unhcr urge action on the island to ease overcrowding improve shelter and stock and distribute appropriate and sufficient aid item said philippe leclerc unhcr representative in greece in the moria camp on the island of lesbos one of the main entry point more than people are in makeshift shelter or tent without insulation flooring or heating unhcr said they include pregnant woman people with disability and very young child on nearby samos about people are living in very difficult condition and another including family and lone child are sleeping in tent in the wood due to a lack of space in the camp unhcr said more than people on samos are crammed into facility designed to hold in january refugee in greece suffered subzero temperature when an icy spell gripped part of the country and score of summer tent were weighed down by snow more than refugee and migrant have been trapped in greece since balkan country along the northward overland route to western europe sealed their border in march unhcr ha been gradually reducing it involvement on the island since national institution took over most service in august
Title_Text: overcrowded greek refugee camp illprepared for winter unhcr

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump is expected to announce soon that he will decertify the landmark international deal to curb iran s nuclear program a senior administration official said on thursday in a step that potentially could cause the accord to unravel the official speaking on condition of anonymity said trump is also expected to roll out a broader u strategy on iran that would be more confrontational the trump administration ha frequently criticized iran s conduct in the middle east trump who ha called the pact an embarrassment and the worst deal ever negotiated ha been weighing whether it serf u security interest a he face an oct deadline for certifying that iran is complying with it term we must not allow iran to obtain nuclear weapon trump said during a meeting with military leader at the white house on thursday adding the iranian regime support terrorism and export violence bloodshed and chaos across the middle east that is why we must put an end to iran s continued aggression and nuclear ambition they have not lived up to the spirit of their agreement asked about his decision on whether to certify the landmark deal trump said you ll be hearing about iran very shortly supporter say it collapse could trigger a regional arm race and worsen middle east tension while opponent say it went too far in easing sanction without requiring that iran end it nuclear program permanently iranian authority have repeatedly said tehran would not be the first to violate the accord under which iran agreed to restrict it nuclear program in return for lifting most international sanction that had crippled it economy if trump decline to certify iran s compliance u congressional leader would have day to decide whether to reimpose sanction on tehran suspended under the agreement whether congress would be willing to reimpose sanction is far from clear while republican and some democrat opposed the deal when it wa approved in there is little obvious appetite in congress for dealing with the iran issue now the prospect that washington could renege on the pact which wa signed by the united state britain france germany russia china the european union and iran ha worried some of the u ally that helped negotiate it we the european we have hammered this the agreement is working said a european diplomat who asked to remain anonymous we a european have repeated it s impossible to reopen the agreement period it s impossible french president emmanuel macron said last month there wa no alternative to the nuclear accord formally known a the joint comprehensive plan of action jcpoa a senior iranian diplomat told reuters on thursday the end result of trump s expected move would be to isolate the united state since the european would continue to support it many foreign investor told u that they will not be scared away from iran s market if trump decertifies the deal the diplomat said trump ha long criticized the pact a signature foreign policy achievement of his democratic predecessor barack obama the administration wa considering oct for trump to give a speech on iran but no final decision had been made an official said previously israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu a close ally of trump last month said that unless provision in the accord removing restriction on iran s nuclear program over time are eliminated it should be canceled fix it or nix it netanyahu said in a speech at the un general assembly annual gathering of world leader on sept many of trump s fellow republican who control congress also have been critical of the deal trump blasted the deal in his speech to the un general assembly also on sept we cannot abide by an agreement if it provides cover for the eventual construction of a nuclear program trump said adding that iran s government mask a corrupt dictatorship behind the false guise of a democracy trump is weighing a strategy that could allow more aggressive u response to iran s force it shi ite muslim proxy in iraq and syria and it support for militant group trump s defense secretary jim mattis told a congressional hearing on tuesday that iran wa fundamentally in compliance with the agreement he also said the united state should consider staying in the deal unless it were proven that tehran wa not abiding by it or that it wa not in the u national interest to do so when mattis wa asked by a senator whether he thought staying in the deal wa in the u national security interest he replied yes senator i do last week iran s foreign minister said tehran may abandon the deal if washington decides to withdraw a state department official said the trump administration wa fully committed to addressing the totality of iranian threat and malign activity and seek to bring about a change in the iranian regime s behavior the official said that behavior includes ballistic missile proliferation support for terrorism support for syrian president bashar alassad unrelenting hostility to israel consistently threatening freedom of navigation in the persian gulf cyber attack against the united state and it ally human right abuse and arbitrary detention of u citizen the jcpoa wa expected to contribute to regional and international peace and security and iran s regime is doing everything in it power to undermine peace and security the state department official added the move also would represent another step by trump that would undo key part of obama s legacy if trump move to decertify the accord it would mark another example of walking away from international commitment a he pursues his nationalist america first agenda he previously announced plan to abandon the paris climate accord and the ambitious nation transpacific partnership tpp trade deal two key obama achievement
Title_Text: trump expected to decertify iran nuclear deal official say

Text: stockholm reuters  u vice president joe biden said on thursday the united state believed the nord stream pipeline involving russia and several european energy company wa a bad deal for europe russias gazprom and it european partner agreed the project which will run across the baltic sea to germany last year but many eastern european country and the united state have said the pipeline could limit supply route and the energy security of the european union which get a third of it gas from russia biden made his comment during a news conference in sweden
Title_Text: biden nord stream pipeline is a bad deal for europe

Text: fbi agent are coming forward now to voice their frustration and concern about fbi director james comey s inept policing of the fbi specifically the clinton email investigation wa held up by comey standing in the way one of the specific of the investigation that hindered it wa that the clinton house wa never searched the fbi always doe a search of a household in an investigation the new york fbi agent working the case were livid at the stonewalling in the clinton case fbi agent are now lawyering up and speaking up to tell what they know this is a textbook case where a grand jury should have convened but wa not that is appalling an fbi special agent who ha worked public corruption and criminal case said of the decision we talk about it in the office and don t know how comey can keep going did anyone else think this exact same thingthe agent wa also surprised that the bureau did not bother to search clinton s house during the investigation we didn t search their house we always search the house the search should not just have been for private electronics which contained classified material but even for printout of such material he said there should have been a complete search of their residence the agent pointed out that the fbi did not seize device is unbelievable the fbi even seizes device that have been set on fire another special agent for the bureau that worked counterterrorism and criminal case said he is offended by comey s saying we and i ve been an investigator the idea that the clintonemail case didn t go to a grand jury is ridiculous according to washington dc attorney joe digenova more fbi agent will be talking about the problem at bureau and specifically the handling of the clinton case by comey when congress come back into session and decides to force them to testify by subpoena people are starting to talk they re calling their former friend outside the bureau asking for help we were asked to day to provide legal representation to people inside the bureau and agreed to do so and to former agent who want to come forward and talk comey thought this wa going to go away the most important thing of all is that the agent have decided that they are going to talk read more daily caller
Title_Text: furious fbi agent speak out on clinton email case we didnt search their house we always search the house

Text: paris reuters  the paris climate change deal doe not infringe on u sovereignty frances ambassador to the united state said on wednesday after multiple source said president donald trump would pull his country out of the global pact the paris accord is a political agreement it doesnt infringe on u sovereignty national commitment are voluntary and may be amended ambassador gerard araud said in a tweet he added that major american corporation had expressed their support for the deal

Text: united nation reuters  the united states decision to withdraw from the landmark paris climate agreement wa a major disappointment for global effort to reduce greenhouse gas emission and promote global security un spokesman stephane dujarric said on thursday un secretarygeneral antonio guterres remains confident that city state and business within the united state  along with other country  will continue to demonstrate vision and leadership by working for the lowcarbon resilient economic growth that will create quality job and market for st century prosperity dujarric said he said it wa crucial that the united state remains a leader on environmental issue and that guterres looked forward to engaging with the u government to build the sustainable future on which our grandchild depend
Title_Text: un say u withdrawal from paris deal major disappointment

Text: in case you have been living under a rock democrat got slaughtered in the midterm election that year featured voter turnout that wa at it lowest since world war ii unfortunately republican thrive on low turnout especially when they can take advantage of the supreme court s monumentally stupid decision to gut the voting right act already we are seeing an impact in gop voter have been flocking to the poll to support their favorite kkkendorsed bigot donald trump democrat however have largely been staying home especially in southern stateson saturday president obama addressed the graduating class at howard university where he dropped a truth bomb on the crowd if you stay home we lose obama acknowledges that republican have managed to not only keep barrier in place even after the many decade since the voting right act wa passed in the first place but that they are also erecting new barrier to vote like nonsensical voter id law they claim will combat almost nonexistent voter fraud but he also pointed out a harsh truth with which we need to come to term democrat have a bad habit of not showing up to the poll this is the only advanced democracy on earth that go out of it way to make it difficult for people to vote the president said referencing the legacy of white supremacist attempting to limit the black vote but let me say this even if we dismantle every barrier to vote that alone would not change the fact that america ha some of the lowest voting rate in the free world in only percent of american turned out to vote in the midterm obama told the student it wa the secondlowest participation rate on record he particularly urged black voter to get their behind to the poll noting the low africanamerican participation rate president obama reminded them that democrat staying home made a difference in what he s gotta deal with in other word democrat who stay home elect republican people wonder how come obama hasn t gotten this done how come he didn t get that done he continued you don t think that made a difference what would have happened if you had turned out at percent all across this country people try to make this political thing really complicated the president said pointedly but it s actually quite simple it s mad if you have more vote than the other guy you get to do what you want it s not that complicated and you don t have excuse you don t have to guess the number of jellybeans in a jar or bubble on a bar of soap to register to vote you don t have to risk your life to cast a ballot other people already did that for you then he reminded u of what happens when we don t exercise our right to vote when we don t vote we give away our power disenfranchise ourselves right when we need to use the power we have right when we need your power to stop others from taking away the voting right of those more vulnerable than you are the elderly the poor the formerlyincarcerated trying to earn their second chance you need to vote all the time not just when it s cool not just when it s time to elect a president not just when you re inspired it s your duty the president clarified that it s not just national election that matter it go beyond who you put in the oval office or with whom you fill the seat in congress it s important to vote for progressive policy at every level it is not that complicated the president said don t make it complicated in november remember obama s word and do your dutyfeatured image via screengrab
Title_Text: you need to hear what president obama just said about the importance of voting blue video

Text: who doesn t love leslie knope she even wormed her way into the heart of that staunch libertarian ron swansonparks and recreation ha a beloved place in the heart of many in america in fact especially millennials and no character is more beloved than amy poehler s leslie knopefor many fan it s almost impossible to imagine a reaction to this electoral disaster from the almost annoyingly bubbly knope her optimism doesn t seem to have much of a place here however while perfectly maintaining the voice of the character she show that s not the case you can read my favorite passage belowlike most people i deal with tragedy by processing the five stage of grief denial anger bargaining depression and acceptance my denial over the election result wa intense my anger wa in ron s word significant my bargaining wa short but creative i offered my soul and the soul of all of my friend in exchange for more vote in milwaukee to any demon who cared to accept tom told me it wa a terrible deal but i didn t care in that moment my depression i have already mentioned which brings u to acceptance and here s what i stand on thatno i do not accept iti acknowledge that donald trump is the president i understand intellectually that he won the election but i do not accept that our country ha descended into the hatredswirled slop pile that he life in i reject out of hand the notion that we have thrown up our hand and succumbed to racism xenophobia misogyny and cryptofascism i do not accept that i reject that i fight that today and tomorrow and every day until the next election i reject and fight that story i work hard and i form idea and i meet and talk to other people who feel like me and we sit down and drink hot chocolate i have plenty and we plan we plan like mofos we figure out how to fight back and do good in this infuriating world that constantly want to bend toward the bad and we will be kind to each other and supportive of each other s idea and we will do literally anything but accept this a our fateand let me say something to the young girl who are reading this hi girl on behalf of the grownups of america who care about you and your future i am awfully sorry about how miserably we screwed this up we elected a giant farting t rex who doe not like you or care about you or think about you unless he is scanning your body with his creepy t rex eye or trying to physically grab you like a toy his daddy got him or would have if his daddy had loved him sorry that wa a low blow actually not sorry i m pissed and i m on a roll so zip it superego our presidentelect is everything you should abhor and fear in a male role model he ha spent his life telling you and girl and woman like you that your life are valueless except a sexual object he ha demeaned you and belittled you and put you in a little box to be looked at and not heard it is your job and the job of girl and woman like you to bust outi highly encourage you to read the rest of it a well leslie is exactly right it s time for u to fight harder than ever
Title_Text: leslie knope writes powerful heartbreaking letter to america that everyone should read

Text: reuters  sp global rating warned on thursday that the credit rating for key alaska bond could go down if lawmaker fail to agree on a budget that address the states long termfiscal problem alaska governor bill walker convened a special session of the legislature late last month aimed at passing a budget for fiscal and closing the states nearly  billion deficit which ha been driven by a collapse in global oil price sp on thursday put the states aaplus general obligation aa appropriation and aplus moral obligation rating on alaskas debt on creditwatch with negative implication the bond proceeds are expected to pay for several transportationrelated project the creditwatch placement indicates that we may lower alaskas credit rating if state policymakers defer adopting fiscal reform to correct the states structural budget deficit said gabriel petek a sp global rating credit analyst since the special session began late last month the legislature ha passed a  billion spending plan for fiscal and a bill to reduce the cost of the states oil and gas tax credit program sp said but it is unclear if a hotly contested bill that would transfer money from the states permanent fund to it general fund will overcome opposition in the state house of representative the bill sb would reduce the amount paid out to resident annually from the fund even if it pass sp said it remains to be seen whether sb and other fiscal reform would be sufficient to put alaskas fiscal structure on a sustainable trajectory enactment of sb alone would shrink the deficit but it wouldnt eliminate it in order to fully close the structural fiscal gap other measure  such a new income tax or more spending cut  would also be necessary sp said despite the budget deficit sp said alaska continues to have very strong credit quality due to the large reserve it built up over time when oil price were high
Title_Text: sp ratchet up pressure on alaska over budget

Text: in march only month after detroit emerged from largest municipal bankruptcy filing in american history the democrat detroit city clerk janice winfrey who wa making over  per year and had access to takehome cityowned car boldly asked the city to give her a raise winfrey argued that i oversee a budget of  million and approximately full and parttime employee she told wwj s charlie langton that the timing might be terrible but she feel justified she claimed people should consider all of her responsibilitieson march a compensation panel on monday agreed that the overworked janice winfrey s pay should be increased to  per yearbut how hard did janice winfrey really work and did she really deserve a raisemichigan s largest county voted overwhelmingly for democratic candidate hillary clinton but official couldn t reconcile vote total for of precinct during a countywide canvas of vote result late last monthmost of those are in heavily democratic detroit where the number of ballot in precinct poll book did not match those of voting machine printout report in percent of precinct of detroit election are a total mess janice winfrey should have called a news conference last january and said detroit could not run it election effectively without people stepping up to replace aging incapable poll workershad she done that the detroit city clerk who wa widely praised for transforming the department when she ousted former clerk jackie currie in would not be facing a firestorm of criticism over mishandled voter ballot and malfunctioning machinesshe also wouldn t have had some precinct where capable veteran worked alongside some people who could not read weren t properly trained weren t mobile and didn t know how to use new electronic polling book that long ago replaced paper sheet one veteran polling supervisor who ha worked the poll for year asserted thursday the one thing i noticed and this is where the problem is cropping up is that a lot of folk have mobility issue and other issue said christopher flournoy a residential home improvement salesperson who life in russell woodsflournoy ha been working the poll since he wa in his s and said thing are not a they should be i have personally been shocked when i go to training he said they do provide training and you ll see people come in on walker and with crutch and the one thought i had is how on earth are they going to carry on their responsibility a an election inspector the biggest problem is training and i don t like to say disparaging thing but the trainer are not trained to provide instruction they re winging it they don t have people who have been trained to provide training to adult it becomes a gripe session about the previous election you get handed some material and nobody say good luck but that s implied you ll figure out a you go along the average age of poll worker nationwide is detroit worker are older winfrey said earlier this week and the work is grueling  hour with only two onehour meal time and two other minute break we re getting older folk doing it because they ve always done it like me and we re getting another group doing it because it s an easy way to make a  flournoy said i ve had worker in precinct i supervise who couldn t read they absolutely could not read and couldn t operate the computer he said adding that winfrey should return to giving the aptitude test she created when she wa first elected that s where it go back to training training is supposed to be mandatory but i ve had people to show up and say no i didn t do training but they gave me a credential read more dfp
Title_Text: forget about russiaheres whats really affecting our election prohillary detroit city clerkhired illiterate poll worker and more

Text: geneva reuters  president joseph kabila ha agreed to help aid reach a region of the democratic republic of congo where ethnic conflict ha spawned a humanitarian emergency the head of the un s world food programme said on monday wfp executive director david beasley said he had also asked congo s prime minister bruno tshibala to waive  million in administrative fee the organization had paid to the government saying the sum could feed ten of thousand of people this country is destabilizing and it need attention because if we don t give the attention now it could impact the entire region beasley told reporter by phone from kinshasa the conflict in kasai region turned congo into the world s biggest displacement crisis this year although many people have started going home beasley said congo still had about child on the brink of starvation and million severely malnourished people while visiting kasai where wfp ha percent of the  million needed for the next eight month he said he saw horror in the eye of woman and child a they told of beheading and brutality the kasai region it wa rather appalling in way that are truly hard to explain in way you actually don t want to explain he said beasley said he met kabila for about minute before meeting minister and explained that the trust of aid donor needed to be rebuilt and that the government must provide access safety and visa he gave me his assurance that he would do everything possible to address any and all need that we brought to his attention beasley said beasley a former governor of the u state of south carolina told congo s prime minister that wfp had paid the government  million in administrative fee just for access just for being here and asked him to scrap the fee a i told the government the prime minister and the minister if you take that  million and i m feeding people at cent a day you can do the math  that s people give or take that we can feed in an entire year he said asked about the  million government spokesman lambert mende said that s the first time i ve heard of anything like that we know that we have humanitarian need because many people in kasai are returning to their home and we are working with our partner on that mende said beasley said there wa donor fatigue but addressing the kasai situation immediately would save life and money
Title_Text: wfp chief get pledge from congo president on food aid access

Text: tokyo reuters  japanese prime minister shinzo abe said on thursday that currency policy wa not an issue that should be discussed between leader of country a doing so would make it a political issue abe made the remark in parliament when asked by a lawmaker if he would discus currency in a meeting with u president donald trump next week ill explain our policy if asked abe said
Title_Text: japan pm say forex policy should not be discussed by leader

Text: seoul reuters  north korea denounced on wednesday u president donald trump s decision to relist it a a state sponsor of terrorism calling it a serious provocation and violent infringement north korean state medium reported trump put north korea back on a list of state sponsor of terrorism on monday a designation that allows the united state to impose more sanction and risk inflaming tension over north korea s nuclear weapon and missile program in north korea s first reaction to the designation a spokesman for the foreign ministry denied in an interview with the state medium outlet kcna that his government engaged in any terrorism he called the state sponsor of terrorism label just a tool for american style authoritarianism that can be attached or removed at any time in accordance with it interest the u designation only made north korea more committed to retaining it nuclear arsenal the official said a long a the u continues with it antidprk hostile policy our deterrence will be further strengthened he said referring to north korea by the initial of it official name the democratic people s republic of korea the u will be held entirely accountable for all the consequence to be entailed by it impudent provocation to the dprk the designation came a week after trump returned from a day fivenation trip to asia in which he made containing north korea s nuclear ambition a centerpiece of his discussion announcing the designation trump told reporter at the white house in addition to threatening the world by nuclear devastation north korea ha repeatedly supported act of international terrorism including assassination on foreign soil
Title_Text: north korea call terror relisting serious provocation by trump state medium

Text: remember how sarah palin sued the new york time for mistakenly saying that a concrete link had been established between her facebook post that featured crosshairs over former arizona congresswoman gabrielle giffords district and jared loughner s decision to open fire on her well that didn t work out so well don t retreat reload palin famously posted on facebook along with an image depicting gun sight over various state whose legislator she wa targeting shortly after loughner shot giffords in the head and pumped bullet into numerous others killing six and wounding thirteen othersno concrete link between the two ha been established though it is reasonable to assume palin s encouragement played a role in the shootingspeaking of shooting district judge jed rakoff shot down palin s frivolous lawsuit against the time on tuesday nowhere is political journalism so free so robust or perhaps so rowdy a in the united state judge rakoff wrote in his page decision but if political journalism is to achieve it constitutionally endorsed role of challenging the powerful legal redress by a public figure must be limited to those case where the public figure ha a plausible factual basis for complaining that the mistake wa made maliciously what we have here is an editorial written and rewritten rapidly in order to voice an opinion on an immediate event of importance in which are included a few factual inaccuracy somewhat pertaining to mr palin that are very rapidly corrected rakoff wrote negligence this may be but defamation of a public figure it plainly is not judge rakoff s opinion is an important reminder of the country s deep commitment to a free press and the important role that journalism play in our democracy a spokeswoman for the time said we regret the error we made in the editorial but we were pleased to see that the court acknowledged the importance of the prompt correction we made once we learned of the mistake this is of course bad news for palin and her ally donald trump who want to open up libel law to make it easier to people like palin to file frivolous lawsuit against journalistic institution for every little mistake even if a correction ha been madelately the right ha been practically masturbating over the idea of bullying anyone who report something they don t like with expensive lawsuit a an attempt to keep criticism to a minimumthis is bad news for anyone who ha recently filed a frivolous lawsuit against journalist including altright a term employed by nazi a a form of rebranding journalist cassandra fairbanks who sued a fusion reporter for correctly reporting that she had made a hand gesture that had been adopted by the white power movement during a visit to the white housefortunately judge rakoff refused to allow palin s farcical lawsuit to get off the ground hopefully this sends a message to the right that bullying journalist with lawsuit will not go well for themfeatured image via screengrab
Title_Text: a judge just gave sarah palin some very very bad news

Text: kiev reuters  ukraine s odessa airport said on tuesday it had tightened security measure after being hit by a cyber attack while the metro system in kiev also reported a hack on it payment system we report that the it system of odessa international airport ha been hit by a hacker attack all service of the airport are working in a stricter mode the airport said in a statement separately ukraine s cyber police said that while it wa monitoring all incident they did not appear to amount to a mass cyber attack on the country
Title_Text: ukraine airport say tightened security after cyber attack

Text: florida mom and hardcore gun nut jamie gilt is back in the news again after police recommended that she be charged in the incident that left her with a gunshot wound in her backyou probably all remember this idiot but if you don t she is the prosecond amendment nutter who ran a facebook page jamie gilt for gun sense it s been deleted where she bragged about letting her yearold son handle a firearm all of her responsible gun owning way came to a head earlier this month when she left her freedom extension within reach of her small son and he picked it up shooting while she wa drivingon tuesday putnam county sheriff s capt gator deloach announced that the department is recommending she be charged for her stupidity but their recommendation will surely piss you off according to cbs newspolice say they are recommending a charge of allowing a child access to a firearmgilt could face up to day in jail report cbs affiliate wjax the state attorney s office will ultimately make a decision on if charge will be filedthat s right the police think that she should only be charged with a misdemeanor even though her action put her son in mortal danger cbs news also reported that the florida department of child and family have opened a case but it look a though she still ha custody of her son this is unbelievably outrageousat the very least gilt should have been charged with felony child neglect according to florida law felony child neglect is defined asa caregiver s failure or omission to provide a child with the care supervision and service necessary to maintain the child s physical and mental health including but not limited to food nutrition clothing shelter supervision medicine and medical service that a prudent person would consider essential for the wellbeing of the childthis woman left a deadly weapon within reach of her fouryearold son not only wa it within reach but he handled the weapon and shot her he could have very easily shot himself and died thankfully though her dumb as wa the only person injured now if that isn t a failure to provide supervision i have no idea what isthis woman should never be allowed to own a gun again and she should not be allowed custody of her child until she take some very intensive parenting class her refusal to practice proper gun safety almost killed that little boy and if she walk away from this with nothing but a misdemeanor charge we will have witnessed another great injustice in the state of floridafeatured image via cbs
Title_Text: florida police recommend unbelievably light charge for nd amendment mom

Text: brussels reuters  u vice president mike penny said on monday he wa disappointed the former white house national security adviser michael flynn had misled him on his contact with russia and supported the decision by president donald trump to dismiss him i wa disappointed to learn that the fact that have been conveyed to me by general flynn were inaccurate he told reporter during a visit to nato headquarters in brussels adding that he fully supported the resignation
Title_Text: penny say disappointed over flynn supported resignation

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump is weighing a strategy that could allow more aggressive u response to iran s force it shi ite muslim proxy in iraq and syria and it support for militant group according to six current and former u official the proposal wa prepared by defense secretary jim mattis secretary of state rex tillerson national security adviser hr mcmaster and other top official and presented to trump at a national security council meeting on friday the source said it could be agreed and made public before the end of september two of the source said all of the source are familiar with the draft and requested anonymity because trump ha yet to act on it in contrast to detailed instruction handed down by president barack obama and some of his predecessor trump is expected to set broad strategic objective and goal for u policy but leave it to u military commander diplomat and other u official to implement the plan said a senior administration official whatever we end up with we want to implement with ally to the greatest extent possible the official added the white house declined to comment the plan is intended to increase the pressure on tehran to curb it ballistic missile program and support for militant several source said i would call it a broad strategy for the range of iranian malign activity financial material support for terror destabilization in the region especially syria and iraq and yemen said another senior administration official the proposal also target cyber espionage and other activity and potentially nuclear proliferation the official said the administration is still debating a new stance on a agreement sealed by obama to curb iran s nuclear weapon program the draft urge consideration of tougher economic sanction if iran violates the agreement the proposal includes more aggressive u interception of iranian arm shipment such a those to houthi rebel in yemen and palestinian group in gaza and egypt s sinai a current official and a knowledgeable former u official said the plan also recommends the united state react more aggressively in bahrain whose sunni muslim monarchy ha been suppressing majority shi ites who are demanding reform the source said in addition u naval force could react more forcefully when harassed by armed speed boat operated by the islamic revolutionary guard corp iran s paramilitary and espionage contingent three of the source said u ship have fired flare and warning shot to drive off irgc boat that made what were viewed a threatening approach after refusing to heed radio warning in the passageway for percent of the world s seaborne petroleum export u commander now are permitted to open fire only when they think their vessel and the life of their crew are endangered the source offered no detail of the proposed change in the rule which are classified the plan doe not include an escalation of u military activity in syria and iraq trump s national security aide argued that a more muscular military response to iranian proxy in syria and iraq would complicate the usled fight against islamic state which they argued should remain the top priority four of the source said mattis and mcmaster a well a the head of the u central command and u special force command have opposed allowing u commander in syria and iraq to react more forcefully to provocation by the irgc hezbollah and other iranianbacked shi ite militia the four source said the adviser are concerned that more permissive rule of engagement would divert u force from defeating the remnant of islamic state they said moreover looser rule could embroil the united state in a conflict with iran while u force remain overstretched and trump ha authorized a small troop increase for afghanistan said one senior administration official a former u official said hezbollah and iranianbacked shi ite militia in iraq have been very helpful in recapturing vast swath of the caliphate that islamic state declared in syria and iran in u troop supporting kurdish and sunni arab fighter battling islamic state in syria have been wrestling with how to respond to hostile action by iranianbacked force in some of the most notable case u aircraft shot down two iranianmade drone in june both were justified a defensive act narrowly tailored to halt an imminent threat on the ground trump s opposition to the iran nuclear deal known a the joint comprehensive plan of action jcpoa pose a dilemma for policymakers most of his national security aide favor remaining in the pact a do u ally israel and saudi arabia despite their reservation about iran s adherence to the agreement said u official involved in the discussion the main issue for u wa to get the president not to discard the jcpoa but he had very strong feeling backed by u ambassador to the united nation nikki haley that they should be more aggressive with iran one of the two u official said almost all the strategy presented to him were one that tried to preserve the jcpoa but lean forward on these other issue
Title_Text: exclusive trump to weigh more aggressive u strategy on iran  source

Text: donald trump s former campaign chairman paul manafort is now retroactively registering a a foreign agent the new term for traitor apparently after the water got a bit too hot with regard to his lobbying effort on behalf of a proputin ukranian partybreaking spokesman say former trump campaign chairman paul manafort is registering with u govt a foreign agent the associated press ap april according to a manafort spokesman his work on behalf of the european centre for a modern ukraine which sought to promote vladimir putin s agenda in washington began before he joined the trump campaign though it is not clear if the donald knew about this when he hired him of course it is unlikely that the donald would have cared given his response to michael flynn s work on behalf of foreign power he kept flynn around until he wa practically forced to get rid of him the associated press reportsa washington lobbying firm that worked under the direction of two former trump campaign adviser ha registered with the justice department a a foreign agent the firm said it work could have benefited the ukrainian governmentthe podesta group s cited detail of lobbying it performed from through on behalf of the european centre for a modern ukraine the firm reported being paid more than  million for the effortthe disclosure follows reporting by the ap in august that the firm of former trump campaign chairman paul manafort and his deputy rick gate who served in a senior role in the trump campaign had overseen the lobbying effort the effort sought to promote a prorussian ukrainian political party s interest in washingtonthis is now the second person associated with donald trump s team who ha retroactively registered a a foreign agentsomething is rotten in the state of denmark err the united statesfeatured image via screengrab

Text: moscow reuters  visa consultation in u consulate in russia could be resumed in the near future tass news agency cited u ambassador to russia jon huntsman a saying on monday i believe that in the near future they visa consultation may be resumed the agency quoted him a saying we are trying to do everything possible and i hope that in coming week we will be able to effectively issue visa in august the united state began to scale back it visa service in russia drawing an angry reaction from moscow three week after president vladimir putin ordered washington to more than halve it embassy and consular staff the u consulate are located in st petersburg yekaterinburg in the urals and vladivostok in russia s far east
Title_Text: u envoy to russia visa consultation in consulate may resume soon  tass

Text: we all know that donald trump s skin is very thin he is also a narcissist the like of which the world ha never seen on the word leadership stage therefore the thought of losing the presidential election ha likely not really occurred to him in any real sense however his disastrous debate performance combined with a huge tilt away from his favor in the poll following a week of chaos that wa completely his own doing mean that a loss in november is looking more and more likely the donald just cannot take that though so he ha a new solution in the event of his losing the electon he just won t accept the resultat the debate in which trump seemed to run out of gas and eventually melt down completely he still nonetheless said he would accept the result should he lose to democratic nominee hillary clinton however now that it seems that a loss might be something that is looming trump is going back on his loss according to the new york time trump s assessment is thusmr trump aiming to unnerve mr clinton even indicated that he wa rethinking his statement at their last debate that he would absolutely support her if she won in november saying we re going to have to see we re going to see what happens we re going to have to see so in other word trump is sending a dog whistle fog horn to his most ardent hateful aggressive and uneducated supporter that say just what they already believe if he doesn t win it wa rigged this is beyond dangerous considering that we can never plant the seed of doubt in the integrity of our electoral system and process while we all know that thing like voter id law and false accusation of voter intimidation most definitely are aimed at disenfranchising minority voter because they largely tend to vote left there is absolutely nothing to suggest that anything more nefarious is going on regarding election riggingtrump s inability to accept that no one not even him win all the time is downright dangerous it cannot be stressed enough that we must trust the result of this election and every election no matter how unsatisfied we might be with the outcome that mean that if folk like me wake up on november th to headline of president trump i must accept it and if i cannot tolerate it i must move to another countrytrump s supporter must do the same they have shown themselves to be violent paranoid hateful and ignorant though so it will be no surprise if they refuse to accept any outcome of the presidential election beyond the one they desire this is simply further proof that donald trump s candidacy is dangerous i shudder to think what will happen if he is actually elected presidentfeatured image via mark wilsongetty image
Title_Text: trump explodes in rage at debate result indicates he wont accept an election loss detail

Text: astute cbs reporter rebecca shabad couldn t possibly have been the first person to notice the giant inflatable chicken currently on display behind the white house but she wa the first person to tweet about itbreaking there an inflatable chicken with trump hair behind the white house pictwittercomcpzyheaixa rebecca shabad rebeccashabad august i don t know if m shabad remembers that chicken but it look like it s been resurrected reinflated from the prop used by the tax day marcher back in april danelle morton writing for slate described the inception of the trump chicken which she found for sale in china a month earliera bit restless i began googling around for a symbol grotesque enough for our cause something bloated that would block out the sky like a macy s thanksgiving day balloon i punched in trump balloon into the search bar and discovered the trump chicken a huge inflatable rooster that bore an uncanny resemblance to donald trumpfor china s lunar new year celebration which kicked off the year of the rooster inflatable version of the trump rooster could be found all over china the chinese of course aren t very happy with trump who taunted china on the campaign trail and flirted with taiwan during the transition the inflatable trump rooster cock a a listing on alibaba china s equivalent of amazon call it mocked his bluster with it swooping butterscotch pompadour and tiny hand shaped to mimic the way the president pinch his finger some of the inflatables were gigantic a tall a feeti couldn t believe what i d found in china this may be the trump rooster cock but in america it would be the trump chickenit wa gloriousyin mingimagine chinayin mingimagine chinawelcome back trump rooster cock you re just in time to watch a little chickenhawk try to weasel his way out of the threat he s makingread morefeatured image via eric thayergetty image
Title_Text: activist brilliantly troll chickenhawk trump behind the white house image

Text: dublin reuters  support for ireland s governing fine gael party fell in a poll on saturday a a political crisis that ha left the country three day away from the calling of a snap election showed no sign of being resolved prime minister leo varadkar s minority government wa on the brink on friday after the party propping it up submitted a motion of no confidence in the deputy prime minister week before a summit on britain s plan to leave the european union where ireland will play a key role varadkar ha said that if the motion put down by fianna fail the main opposition party is not withdrawn by tuesday he would be forced to hold an election before christmas support for his party dropped two point to percent in the sunday business postred c poll only marginally ahead of the percent it achieved at last year s election and it worst performance in recent opinion poll fellow centerright party fianna fail rose to percent from percent a month ago and leftwing opposition sinn fein were up two point to percent both also marginally higher than the last election the survey wa taken between november and the day the crisis escalated rapidly and suggested the party would struggle to form anything but another minority administration again the poll suggests no one win at a christmas election if these number hold richard colwell the chief executive of red c wrote on twitter varadkar ha said that there is still time to avoid the snap poll but neither side were stepping down on saturday ahead of the motion of noconfidence to be debated on tuesday although the leader will do their best it is unlikely that the position are going to shift between now and tuesday and if that is the case the only way we can prevent an election is for the tanaiste to resign senior fianna fail mp jim o callaghan told national broadcaster rte the tanaiste is the name given to the position of deputy head of government in ireland currently held by france fitzgerald health minister simon harris said the price of any talk over the next three day will not be the head of the deputy prime minister and that the agreement with fianna fail that allows the minority government to function wa extremely badly damaged varadkar is due to play a major role in the dec  eu summit on brexit telling fellow leader whether dublin belief sufficient progress ha been made on the future border between eumember ireland and britain s province of northern ireland the government ha said enough progress ha not been made to date the border is one of three issue brussels want broadly resolved before it decides whether to move the talk on to a second phase about trade and eu official have said a snap election in ireland would complicate that task
Title_Text: support for irish pm party fall a snap election nears

Text: many people have long suspected that trump is abusive if for no other reason than he s outwardly abusive to so many people his twitter feed alone is rife with abuse he seems to take pleasure in hurting people and that appears to include his family because abuser abuse everyone in one form or anotherduring his inauguration a he stood facing melania he apparently said something extremely hurtful to her she s smiling and if you look at his cheek he seems to be smiling too and then suddenly his smile disappears and he turn pointedly away from her you can see from the change in her expression that whatever he said just crushed herwatch belowwouldn t he want the world to see how happy the two of them are even if it is a fa ade what could she have possibly done to warrant this anyway say she really did do something worthy of rebuke he could have and should have waited until they were alone to say something to her the way he did it wasn t just crushing to her it wa probably also humiliating for herthat wasn t the only time he wa demeaning either when he greeted the obamas prior to his inauguration he left her behind in the car and then left her behind again to walk into the white house it wa president obama and michelle who actually escorted melania insidebut that s where trump get satisfaction in shaming and humiliating people a much a possible for even the slightest transgression typical emotionally abusive behavior some may say she knew what she wa getting into when she got involved with him but that s victimblaming and it come from those who don t get itit s extremely unlikely melania deserved whatever he said to her or his selfsatisfied deliberately supercilious manner when he turned his back on herfeatured image by kevin dietsch via getty image

Text: reuters  the european union will soon ask britain to take responsibility for solving the irish border problem according to document leaked to the guardian michel barnier the european union s chief negotiator will ask britain to work out solution that avoid the creation of a hard border with ireland the newspaper also reported the news come after the guardian earlier reported based on a draft memo it reviewed that britain is considering measure to restrict immigration for all but the highestskilled eu worker the british government declined to comment on the report while the european union wa not immediately available for comment
