Text: london reuters  britain s finance minister philip hammond on sunday faced mounting question over his future week ahead of a budget announcement finding himself at the center of an increasingly fraught debate over britain s departure from the european union the eu last week declared a disturbing deadlock in talk with prime minister theresa may s government on arrangement to leave the bloc raising the chance of britain quitting without a negotiated deal and increasing criticism of the government s handling of brexit on sunday an unnamed source from the democratic unionist party dup said may must warn hammond he face the sack unless he change his approach to brexit the sunday telegraph reported the dup is a small northern irish political party which is keeping may s minority government in power we are very concerned about philip hammond s behavior the senior parliamentary dup source told the newspaper it is evident to u that he is winding people up and causing unnecessary division within the conservative party at a crucial time in the brexit negotiation a dup spokesman later said the party did not recognize the inaccurate comment hammond who is seen by many a may s most proeu minister ha become a focal point of criticism for brexiteers who say he is overly pessimistic about the impact of leaving the bloc and is damaging britain s negotiating stance last week hammond warned that brexit wa causing a cloud of uncertainty over the british economy that needed to be cleared a quickly a possible he ha previously angered eurosceptics by calling for a lengthy transition out of the eu during which there will be little change to rule on issue like immigration in a botched attempt on friday to calm speculation over his future and play down the party s division hammond described the eu a the enemy in negotiation he later said he regretted his choice of word he had been expected to lose his job if may had won an increased majority at a june snap election but the vote instead saw the conservative lose their majority and hammond retain his position a may fought to maintain unity between proeu and probrexit faction the june election also transformed the dup which only ha lawmaker in the seat parliament into an influential voice may struck a deal with the party and is reliant on their support to pas legislation the delicate parliamentary arithmetic also mean may face criticism from lawmaker including several from within her own party who disagree with may s threat to walk away from eu negotiation without a deal unless brussels agrees fair term the opposition labour party s finance policy chief warned on sunday that with the support on rebel from may s party parliament would block any attempt to leave the eu without a negotiated agreement question over the future of one of may s most senior minister come a he is due to present a budget plan on nov which will see britain through one of it most uncertain period in decade amid growing business concern and voter unrest the sunday time reported that hammond wa preparing a revolutionary budget that could see the government ditch it opposition to borrowing more to boost investment and may include tax break for the young paid for by pensioner the view ha galvanized that this budget ha got to be big it s got to be powerful it s got to be revolutionary saying it s got to be brave is really understating it people are very clear that this is basically the last chance the paper reported a senior government source a saying hammond ha limited room to increase public spending without pushing up britain s still high borrowing level the country s budget forecaster have signaled they are about to turn more gloomy about growth forecast meaning less tax revenue to fund hammond s warchest to help the economy weather the process of leaving the eu in the coming year but he is already under pressure now to relax his grip on spending to counter the leftwing opposition labour party whose promise of more spending and higher tax on the wealthy won over large number of voter in the june election at the same time hammond must not alarm investor who fund a budget shortfall which is expected to grow this year their lending help britain plug one of the widest current account deficit among the world s leading economy
Title_Text: uk finance minister future questioned by pm may ally a budget nears

Text: while most american did not know about michael flynn s tie to turkey team trump did when they were vetting the former general they did learn of flynn s work for both turkey and russia they knew he had violated the law and the u constitution and they hired him to be the national security advisor anywaymsnbc s rachel maddow said this on her show on friday night nbc news ha learned from source close to the trumprussia investigation that both the trump transition and the white house did do a background check on flynn she went on to say that the vetting team trump did of flynn wa done very casually the new reporting by nbc news mirror the claim flynn ha been making for some time that he and his lawyer were upfront with the vetting team about the lobbying he wa doing on behalf of the turkish governmentfor it part the white house ha taken to blaming the obama administration flynn worked a the director of the defense intelligence agency dia his job at the dia did require he receive a top secret clearance but it is important to note that he wa fired from that job in he started there in this wa a full year before he wa scheduled to retirethis week press secretary sean spicer indicated that the transition team relied on the vetting that had been done by the obama administration the timing of this is important to note because flynn did not start his consulting work until after he left the dia the vetting he received prior to that role which is what gave him his clearance would not have shown his tie to turkey or russia because that work hadn t happened yetmembers of the military are barred from working for foreign government for life unless they receive congressional approval the reason is that they can be called back to duty at any time and working for a foreign government could cause a conflict of interestfeatured image via mark makelagetty image
Title_Text: team trump knew flynn broke the law and hired him anyway detail

Text: north charleston sc reuters  republican presidential frontrunner donald trump and top challenger ted cruz ended a longstanding truce in spectacular fashion on thursday night with bitter exchange during what may have been trumps strongest debate performance to date the new york billionaire and the texas senator appeared to have a split decision by the end of the night a sign that for all the bluster little took place that could derail trump from his lead position with a contest in iowa on feb to begin the search for a republican presidential nominee projection that the debate would be a freeforall were accurate beyond the trumpcruz theatrics u senator marco rubio of florida turned in a pugnacious performance with attack on cruz and new jersey governor chris christie florida governor jeb bush presented himself a a voice of reason against trump a google snap poll showed viewer believed trump who in the most recent debate wa at time less engaged won the night with percent to cruzs percent and rubios percent until the fox business network debate in north charleston south carolina trump and cruz had been friendly because they have both been chasing conservative of the tea party movement and did not want to anger them with trump now needing to fend off cruzs rise in iowa he pushed his charge that cruz may not be constitutionally qualified to serve a president because he wa born in canada the u constitution say only natural born citizen can become president of the united state who the hell know if you can even serve in office trump told cruz drawing a scattering of boo in the audience born in calgary alberta to a u citizen mother and a cuban father cruz accused trump of bringing up his birthplace simply because cruz wa leading some poll in iowa cruz said trump who led the movement questioning whether the hawaiianborn president barack obama wa really from the united state had asked his lawyer to look into the issue of cruzs birth in september and concluded there were no issue since september the constitution hasnt changed but the poll number have cruz said and i recognize that donald is dismayed that his poll number are dropping in iowa but the fact and the law here are really clear trump said democrat would sue if cruz were on the republican ticket putting their partys chance of winning at risk cruz shot back that he had spent many year studying constitutional law im not going to be taking legal advice from donald trump the birthright issue ha dogged american politics before republican nominee john mccain survived question about his birth in panama because he wa born on a u military installation there and it wa judged to be u soil in republican candidate george romney faced question about his birth in mexico but his candidacy never advanced far and the issue wa abandoned while cruz seemed to have parried the attack for now he wa stung by trump on another issue whether people who live in new york city have the same value a other american cruz ha lately begun denouncing new york values to connect trump to the citys famous liberalism everyone understands that the value of new york city are socially liberal are proabortion are progay marriage cruz said trump in perhaps his most heartfelt remark of the night harked back to new yorks response to the sept attack to defend his home city the people in new york fought and fought and fought and we saw more death and even the smell of death and it wa with u for month the smell the air and we rebuilt downtown manhattan and everybody in the world watched and everybody in the world loved new york and loved new yorkers and i have to tell you that wa a very insulting statement that ted made trump said rubio in third place behind trump and cruz in iowa and hoping a strong outcome there will help him in the new hampshire primary on feb frequently inserted himself into argument and tried to put pressure on cruz he accused cruz of proposing a value added tax a part of his tax plan and of being soft on immigration that is not consistent conservatism he said that is political calculation he attacked christie a well accusing him of have liberal position on education policy and abortion christie interrupted a rubiocruz exchange with this blast id like to interrupt this debate on the floor of the senate you had your chance marco you blew it he said cruz who ha taken the lead in some poll of iowa republican voter did well on social medium social medium monitoring tool zoomph saw total positive mention for cruz climb by more than percent while he sparred with trump trump is far ahead nationally a reutersipsos rolling national poll on jan showed trump had percent of the vote cruz percent bush percent carson percent while percent favored rubio for more on the presidential race see the reuters blog tales from the trail here in paragraph corrects to fox business network from fox business channel
Title_Text: friendly no more trump cruz erupt in bitter fight at republican debate

Text: paris reuters  president donald trump s hawkish new approach towards tehran coupled with banking worry and domestic political turbulence in both country are causing growing uncertainty over iran s  billion deal to buy airliner from boeing airbus and atr iranair s decision to buy a total of aircraft from the two giant and francoitalian turboprop maker atr marked the zenith of a pact between tehran and world power to renew trade in exchange for placing curb on iran s nuclear activity iranair say it  billion deal with boeing is the biggest with a u company since the islamic revolution such high stake make the deal a prominent target for critic of detente in both washington and tehran and expert say that could further frighten off european bank and others whose reluctance to provide finance is already a major obstacle trump struck a blow against the nuclear agreement with iran on friday choosing not to certify that tehran is complying with the deal and warning he might ultimately terminate it his iran strategy angered tehran and put washington at odds with other signatory of the accord  britain france germany russia china and the european union  some of which have benefited economically from renewed trade with iran while trump did not pull the united state out of the agreement he gave the u congress day to decide whether to reimpose economic sanction on tehran that were lifted under the pact even without such sanction the fate of the aircraft deal depends on u administration approval several people involved in the airliner deal fear they have become too big to cancel but too sensitive to implement fully beyond a limited number of jet for which iran ha the fund to pay for in cash without foreign loan i don t see who would be willing to provide financing for iran with such a negative groundswell in the united state said consultant and former aviation banker bertrand grabowski that raise immediate concern for boeing a it prepares to start building longrange twinengined er jet originally due for delivery to iran from next april the fate of those aircraft  part of a total order for jet  is seen affecting job a boeing try to put a floor under declining production of one of it most profitable model for the s it seems increasingly difficult now a western banker said unexpected hurdle have arisen on the iranian side too financial source say boeing ha already had to push iran back in the queue for jet because it ha yet to receive a deposit for now boeing can manage by juggling delivery with other airline but a complete breakdown of the iranair order could put new pressure on production u export are not the only one at stake although the european union back the nuclear deal the export of any western aircraft to iran depends on permit from the u administration because of the number of u part that mean airbus could get caught in the crossfire between boeing and congressional critic who want the whole deal axed something likely to deepen tension over iran with europe iran ha so far imported nine aircraft three from airbus and six from turboprop maker atr losing the rest of iran s business would hit airbus s order book hard because it took the risk of booking all iranian plane sale last december to help beat boeing in their annual order race boeing ha not yet formally posted it order because the airbus and boeing deal are so interconnected with approval passing through washington all eye are now on how trump s administration will treat the highprofile plane deal while kicking the broader nuclear issue to congress iran s foreign minister mohammad javad zarif said on saturday any negative move would be considered a violation of the nuclear pact between tehran and world power industry source say washington ha so far issued license for aircraft sale to iran until the end of the decade after which they must be renewed based on estimated delivery plan that effectively open the door to the boeing s and  airbus jet they said airbus and boeing declined to comment on delivery schedule one source said a possible outcome wa that the status quo would remain in place regarding license already issued because of the political and legal consequence of revoking them but that it would become harder to extend or obtain new one if so the fate of the second part of the iranair deal could be pushed beyond the next u election in even if the nuclear pact survives scrutiny in congress until then and other airline like aseman airline which ha ordered boeing jet and may want to buy turboprop face an uncertain wait for u approval a boeing spokesman said boeing and iranair continue to work on implementing the contract airbus declined to comment in tehran the aircraft deal remain centerstage a iranian hardliners seek to exploit the latest dispute with washington to weaken domestic rival who are open to the west for iran it is important that the deal remains intact the failure of the plane deal will be a major blow for u said a senior iranian official their collapse will have a domino effect on other deal and potential foreign investor
Title_Text: iran aircraft deal hang by thread a trump target tehran

Text: a group of white nationalist and skinhead who support donald trump s presidential campaign who were involved in a stabbing attack in california have announced that they will be at the republican national convention this july in clevelandthe group who call themselves the traditionalist worker party revealed their plansa group of white nationalist and skinhead who held a rally in sacramento over the weekend where at least five people were stabbed plan to show up at the republican national convention in cleveland next month to make sure that the donald trump supporter are defended the violent clash at the california state capitol accentuates concern about the republican national convention with political tension high and thousand of pro and antitrump protester expected to descend on clevelandmatthew heimbach who lead the group ha been described by the southern poverty law center a someone considered by many to be the face of a new generation of white nationalist at a trump rally in march after trump told protester get out of here get out out out out get out heimbach wa one of the mean caught on video roughing up a black woman the woman said trump supporter in the crowd chanted racial and sexual epithet at her a she wa removedduring previous protest at his rally often from black and latino activist trump ha lamented that it is no longer acceptable to rough up dissenter and even said he would consider paying the legal fee of a man arrested after punching a protester at a trump rallyheimbach ha said he want to create a new homeland for white around the entire world in america and said california is full of mexican and that s sort of a problem trump of course ha accused mexican immigrant of bringing crime to america and described them a rapist heimbach discussing immigrant stay in your own nation we don t want you here trump ha promised to build a beautiful wall on the usmexico borderfeatured image via youtube
Title_Text: protrump white nationalist involved in mass stabbing going to gop convention

Text: strasbourg reuters  the european parliament urged eu leader on wednesday to allow the next phase of brexit negotiation to start backing a motion that recognised the talk had advanced sufficiently a a well a line criticising britain s lead negotiator david davis european union leader are almost certain to judge on friday that sufficient progress ha been made on the right of citizen the brexit divorce bill and the irish border to allow negotiation to move to the next phase the eu executive recommended last week that leader approve the start of trade talk the european parliament will have to approve any brexit deal although it motion on wednesday backed by vote for to against wa not binding the eu s brexit negotiator michel barnier told lawmaker the next phase of talk would focus on a short and defined transition period and initial discussion on a future relationship future talk he said would be no less difficult they are tough very tough because the issue are extremely complicated and because the consequence of brexit are very serious he said adding that british prime minister theresa may wa courageous and deserved respect nigel farage of the antieu ukip party called her theresa the appeaser and said she had yielded on virtually everything barnier stressed that britain could not renege on commitment made to ensure the talk moved on the agreement presented in a joint report last friday wa in the view of some in brussels undermined by davis s comment that it wa more a statement of intent than legally binding davis ha subsequently said he want the accord swiftly translated into a legal text we will not accept any going back on this joint report this progress ha been agreed and will be rapidly translated into a withdrawal accord that is legally binding in all three area and on some others that remain to be negotiated barnier said a lot more step were required to secure an orderly withdrawal he added we are not at the end of the road neither regarding citizen right nor for the other subject of the orderly withdrawal we remain vigilant barnier told the parliament
Title_Text: eu parliament back starting next phase of brexit talk

Text: this week s documentary film curated by our editorial team at wire the u ha a highly developed pharmaceutical industry offering treatment for all kind of mental disorder million of american are being medicated for ailment a diverse a depression anxiety bipolar disorder and many others even young child are being put on psychiatric drug if parent decline such treatment social service may intervene many patient who ve been taking these pill for year insist that they do more harm than good they have experienced disturbing side effect such a suicidal thought addiction and even neurological damage a lot of patient were put on their medication a child and by the time they were legally old enough to decide for themselves they had already become addicted they testify that breaking their dependency on the drug is extremely difficult because like any habit forming narcotic they cause severe withdrawal symptomsrtd meet some of the sufferer to hear their story of battling to shake off prescribed medicine father of josh wa given anxiety medication it caused akathisia and dystonia both are physical disorder causing involuntary and uncontrolled body movement and have left him disabled olivia s son wa prescribed psychiatric drug to treat attention deficit disorder adhd olivia soon noticed side effect and refused to continue giving him the pill he wa taken by social service and hospitalised these story and morertd meet a few of them watch this incredible documentary film run time min writer director petr timofeev distributor rttv novosti see more sunday screening here
Title_Text: sunday screening overpill

Text: new york reuters  the political alliance sealed on friday between republican presidential candidate donald trump and new jersey governor chris christie wa more than a decade in the making the culmination of the two mens repeatedly crossing path christie a former rival for the republican nomination for president endorsed trump at a surprise news conference in fort worth texas giving the frontrunner a lift ahead of the march super tuesday nominating contest christie a former federal prosecutor told reporter his endorsement wa not part of any deal that would land him a position such a u attorney general in a possible trump administration trump and christie have been friendly dinner companion and have operated professionally in the same state christie ha been one of new jerseys top political figure since and trump ha been a major employer and realestate developer in the state beginning in the s when he began to run casino in atlantic city the new jersey seaside resort that had fallen on hard time and wa being remade a a sort of la vega of the east coast the close geographic tie differentiate christie from politician who operate farther from trumps base in new york city said ben dworkin director of the rebovich institute for new jersey politics at rider university they were bound to cross path and come to know each other dworkin said trump sat in the front pew at a catholic mass celebrating christies swearingin for his first term a new jerseys governor in january hes going to be a great governor which new jersey could use he will go down a the best governor there is trump told reporter according to the press of atlantic city trumps sister maryanne trump barry a federal appeal court judge introduced the two in according to the record of bergen county christie wa named the states chief federal prosecutor in by president george w bush the trump and the christie have often had dinner together where trump would do all the talking according to american governor a christie biography written by matt katz and published in january christie attended trumps wedding to his current wife melania where christie met bill and hillary clinton according to the book the christietrump relationship if anything would be socializing with big important people theyre both collectors said rutgers university senior policy fellow marc pfeiffer a christie sought to build his national profile trump helped trump gave  to the republican governor association in when christie wa it head according to the center for responsive politics a nonprofit that maintains a database of political donation representative of trumps casino lobbied christie a early a when christie wa a littleown local officeholder in morris county according to the starledger the newspaper Text: after month of speculation about hillary s poor health she appeared to have a pretty serious episode after leaving the  memorial service in nyc fortunately someone wa able to capture her on scrambling to figure out what to do if hillary is forced to drop out of the race of course hillary wouldn t leave the race on her own for the good of the country or for the good of her party this is her final shot at the highest office in our nation and she ha already proven there is nothing that will get in her way from her lifelong goal of becoming our first female president no lie is too big and no scandal will take her down it s her turn but in the event that she end up incapacitated by her illness which according to many prominent physician look more like parkinson s disease here s what would happen if she wa forced to drop outit s never happened before but if hillary clinton ha to drop out before election day the democratic national committee would pick a successor and it wouldn t house of representative would make the selection nyp

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump on thursday stood by his belief that both side were to blame for violence in charlottesville virginia between white supremacist and counterprotesters last month trump had drawn criticism for not initially condemning white supremacist who organized the event on aug with even some of his fellow republican expressing dismay at his opinion trump spoke to reporter aboard air force one a day after a meeting with south carolina republican senator tim scott an africanamerican who had expressed concern about trumps comment we had a great talk yesterday he said of his meeting with scott i think especially in the light of the advent of antifa if you look at whats going on there you have some pretty bad dude on the other side also and essentially thats what i said trump said antifascist group known a the antifa must share blame for neonazis and the ku klux klan fighting with antiracism protester in the street one woman wa killed when a suspected white nationalist crashed his car into demonstrator on thursday the president also signed a resolution sent to him by congress that condemned the violence in charlottesville and opposed hatred bigotry and racism in all forms no matter the color of our skin or our ethnic heritage we all live under the same law we all salute the same great flag and we are all made by the same almighty god trump said in a statement regarding the resolution in berkeley california violence erupted on aug when a small group of masked antifa and leftwing protestors attacked rightwing demonstrator now because of whats happened since then with antifa you look at really whats happened since charlottesville a lot of people are saying in fact a lot of people have actually written gee trump might have a point he said
Title_Text: trump say violence by antifascists prof him right on charlottesville

Text: seoul reuters  north korea said it will release a south korean fishing vessel on friday for humanitarian reason after the boat wa found illegally in water under the north s control six day ago north korean state news agency kcna said the boat and it crew had been captured on oct and they will be released at the designated water of the military boundary line in the east sea latitude longitude at on oct the news agency report said north korea had reached it decision to release the south korean boat after taking into account the fact that all the crewman honestly admitted their offence repeatedly apologizing and asking for leniency the report said in english an investigation by the north had proved the boat and crew had entered north korean water for fishing north korean fishing boat because of age or low fuel have been found drifting south of the maritime border between the two korea at time most north korean crew are released to the north after interrogation by intelligence official if they wish to return it is more unusual for south korean fishing vessel to be found under similar circumstance the south korean government could not be immediately reached for comment
Title_Text: north korea to release captured south korea fishing boat friday kcna

Text: dhaka reuters  a truck carrying relief supply for rohingya muslim refugee skidded off a hilly road in bangladesh and plunged into a paddy field on thursday killing nine people and injuring police and aid worker said the accident happened in a district near the myanmar border where refugee have been arriving since late last month to escape a myanmar military offensive against insurgent that the united nation ha described a ethnic cleansing six died on the spot while three died on the way to hospital a k m jahangir a senior official with the red crescent relief group told reuters some of the injured were in critical condition he added the dead and injured were laborer traveling in the truck to help distribute the aid supply about refugee from myanmar have poured into bangladesh since aug when attack by rohingya militant on security post triggered the myanmar army offensive in response buddhistmajority myanmar denies ethnic cleansing saying it security force are tackling rohingya terrorist
Title_Text: nine killed a rohingya aid truck crash in bangladesh

Text: united nation reuters  the member united nation general assembly will hold a rare emergency special session on thursday at the request of arab and muslim state on u president donald trump s decision to recognize jerusalem a israel s capital sparking a warning from washington that it will take name palestinian un envoy riyad mansour said the general assembly would vote on a draft resolution calling for trump s declaration to be withdrawn which wa vetoed by the united state in the member un security council on monday the remaining security council member voted in favor of the egyptiandrafted resolution which did not specifically mention the united state or trump but which expressed deep regret at recent decision concerning the status of jerusalem mansour said on monday he hoped there would be overwhelming support in the general assembly for the resolution such a vote is nonbinding but carry political weight u ambassador nikki haley in a letter to dozen of un state on tuesday seen by reuters warned that the united state would remember those who voted for the resolution criticizing the u decision the president will be watching this vote carefully and ha requested i report back on those country who voted against u we will take note of each and every vote on this issue haley wrote she echoed that call in a twitter post the u will be taking name under a resolution an emergency special session can be called for the general assembly to consider a matter with a view to making appropriate recommendation to member for collective measure if the security council fails to act only such session have been convened and the last time the general assembly met in such a session wa in on occupied east jerusalem and palestinian territory thursday s meeting will be a resumption of that session trump abruptly reversed decade of u policy this month when he recognized jerusalem a israel s capital generating outrage from palestinian and the arab world and concern among washington s western ally trump also plan to move the u embassy to jerusalem from tel aviv the draft un resolution call on all country to refrain from establishing diplomatic mission in jerusalem haley said on monday that the resolution wa vetoed in the security council in defense of u sovereignty and the u role in the middle east peace process she criticized it a an insult to washington and an embarrassment to council member israel considers jerusalem it eternal and indivisible capital and want all embassy based there palestinian want the capital of an independent palestinian state to be in the city s eastern sector which israel captured in a war and annexed in a move never recognized internationally
Title_Text: after u veto un general assembly to meet on jerusalem status

Text: reuters  democratic presidential frontrunner hillary clinton ha moved to the left in key policy area such a trade during her primary campaign against rival u senator bernie sander of vermont who is known for his liberal stance here is a look at what the former secretary of state ha said she would do should she win the white house in the nov election these policy are drawn from white paper released by her campaign stump speech debate and interview clinton support comprehensive immigration reform with a path to full citizenship she ha pledged to defend president barack obamas executive action on immigration and if legally possible expand on them she ha called for an end to deportation raid and family detention clinton ha however disagreed with liberal democrat about the best way to handle the influx of young people fleeing cartel violence and other issue in central america obama said in that the united state would send these youth back to deter others from attempting the same dangerous journey  a position that clinton ha defended including in a recent presidential debate the fact is that there wa a great effort made by the obama administration and others to really send a clear message because we knew that so many of these child were being abused being treated terribly while they tried to get to our border clinton said i think now what ive called for is counsel for every child so that no child ha to face any kind of process without someone who speaks and advocate for that child so that the right decision hopefully can be made clinton support some freetrade agreement and opposes others saying her decision are based on whether she feel the specific agreement will adequately protect the interest of u worker clinton ha had to deal with the legacy of the north american free trade agreement reached by her husbands administration during her own political career she backed away from nafta when she ran for a u senate seat representing new york a a senator she supported trade agreement with australia chile morocco oman and singapore she opposed the central american free trade agreement during her first presidential campaign in she criticized possible agreement with colombia panama and south korea but once she became obamas secretary of state she worked to finalize agreement with colombia and south korea  a deal that in she had called inherently unfair clinton also worked on the transpacific partnership tpp a secretary of state saying it would be the gold standard of trade agreement a a presidential candidate in she stalled on taking a position on tpp saying she would wait until it wa finalized by the administration clinton eventually said she would not support tpp because it doe not adequately protect u worker clinton ha pledged to not raise tax on the middle class in any way in contrast to sander her democratic rival who favor a nominal income tax premium to fund universal healthcare clinton ha focused on reforming the tax code so the wealthiest pay their fair share she ha proposed ending the carried interest loophole that categorizes the bulk of a hedge fund managers income a return on investment and not compensation enacting the buffett rule so the wealthy with investment income do not pay lower effective tax rate than truck driver or nurses and pushing back against quarterly capitalism and incentivizing longterm investment by wall street clinton ha called for an intelligence surge to combat the islamic state militant group and diplomatic effort feature prominently in most of her foreign policy plan she doe not believe there should be a surge in ground troop in the middle east including in syria she ha said she support increased specialized forces there and enforcing a nofly zone she belief russias participation will be essential for any solution in syria clinton ha also called for steppedup effort by u technology company to combat terrorism in a major foreign policy speech she said social medium company can also do their part by swiftly shutting down terrorist account so they are not used to plan provoke or celebrate violence she ha not said how far she would go to compel the cooperation of private company in this effort
Title_Text: factbox end deportation reform tax code what a president clinton would do

Text: it s one thing to have the medium constantly painting police officer in a bad light on a near daily basis but it s entirely another thing to have civilian discriminating against them on completely illegitimate ground this is exactly what happened this week when jim chamber owner of the eav barbell club in atlanta posted a sign on the front of his gym forbidding police officersthe message that the sign conveys alone is upsetting but the expletive included make it an even more shocking and vulgar while the sign is no longer posted on his gym s door chamber continue to stand by it we ve had an explicitly stated no cop policy since we opened and we also don t open membership to active member of the military he saida a lifelong political activist chamber say that his sign and policy serf a a political statement he say group who work out there are generally minority who are uncomfortable with the presence of law enforcement agent chamber claimed that if any police official had a warrant they could do their job but that he is not breaking the law chamber insists that they never have and won t ever need the help of officer he plan to put the no cop sign back up without the foul languagewhen asked to comment lawyer found the policy strange but said because law enforcement officer are not a protected class under the law only the court can decide if eav barbell club is violating any antidiscrimination law when asked to comment on the incident the atlanta police department stated were we to respond to an emergency there this sign would not stop u from lawfully doing our job read more the gateway pundit
Title_Text: wow atlanta gym owner ban copsmakes no apologies for policy or sign video

Text: donald trump will be seriously seething after he see what gop strategist liz mair called him on cnnas we all know the republican nominee is incapable of keeping his big mouth shut he always ha to whine about something or someone and it hasn t been helping him gain a whole lot of supportfor awhile now republican and the medium were being pushed around by trump but that ha now changed a he ha had a complete meltdown in recent day in addition to all the thing he ha said and done since last june when he began campaigning for the nominationrepublican strategist liz mair is definitely not a during an interview with anderson cooper on cnn on wednesday night his message is being a loudmouthed dck basically and going out there and offending people and then engaging in an airing of grievance that s what he doe he doesn t have another message he doesn t have anything else that he want to convey the republican party ha a message but it s not his message and he ha no interest in carrying it and quite frankly what i think we re gonna continue to see throughout this campaign is we re gonna continue to see the republican nominee basically acting a if he s on a suicide mission and aiming to take the whole rest of the party down with him here s the video via youtubemair is absolutely spot on the only critique here is that the republican party s message ha been moving in trump s extremist atmosphere that allowed trump to rise in the first place their only redemption is to make sure he loses in november and just admit they were wrong and that they are going to seriously change their party this time around and that mean they have to stop pandering to the conservative base that desperately want trump to win and start transforming into a more inclusive partyfeatured image gustavo caballerogetty

Text: wellington reuters  new zealand s ruling national party won the largest number of vote in the country s general election on saturday securing a comfortable margin over the labour party after what had promised to be the most hotly contested race in recent history national and labour had been almost neck and neck in opinion poll with charismatic year old jacinda ardern almost singlehandedly dragging labour back into the race after taking over the party s leadership in august national took percent of the vote the electoral commission said while support for labour wa percent a final tally including overseas vote will be released on oct the result set up the nationalist new zealand first party to hold the balance of power and form the next government with percent of the ballot veteran new zealand first leader winston peter ha been minister under both major party and ha not said which party he would favor a a coalition partner previously he ha backed the party with the largest number of vote all party leader said they would have conversation over the next few day with some of them already trying to woo peter on election night i want to acknowledge the strong performance of winston peter and new zealand first bill english said in a speech to his supporter the voter of new zealand have given new zealand first a role in forming the next government he said for english who campaigned heavily on national s economic credential after taking the party leadership last year the strong showing wa a vindication after national crashed to it worst ever election result in under his first stint a leader opinion poll leading up to the vote had been volatile with two recent one giving national a near point lead over labour national ha been in power for nearly a decade bill english and national have taken the largest number of vote i ve called bill and acknowledged that ardern told her supporter adding she wa planning conversation with both the green and new zealand first party it s not over yet peter sounded buoyant but kept his card close to his chest we have been strong enough and honest enough with our supporter to make it home he said new zealand first had not all the card but we do have the main card he added saying he would not be rushed into giving any answer immediately ardern and english were expected to maintain fiscal prudence but to differ on monetary policy trade and immigration that would likely have implication for the new zealand dollar the world s th mosttraded currency in the new zealand dollar ha tended to rise when national rose in the poll the thin trading condition typical of early morning in asia mean a sharp but shortlived move on the nzd is possible on monday said joseph carpuso senior currency strategist at cba new zealand us a germanstyle proportional representation system in which a party or combination of party need of parliament s member  usually about percent of the vote  to form a government the result secured seat for national in parliament and for labour new zealand first ha nine seat and green which won percent of the vote have seven national s seat were higher than labour and green put together at but neither combination had enough to govern on their own it s all over bar the special vote  but even they won t change the basic math they won t change any crucial seat and national is extremely unlikely to go up so winston peter rule said bryce edward analyst at wellingtonbased critical politics a record million ballot were cast before the day of the election accounting for about a third of the million new zealander enrolled to vote special vote which include ballot from new zealander overseas and those who vote outside their home constituency will be released on oct these are estimated to represent percent of total vote and could have a considerable impact i would expect u to get a bit of a lift out of those special vote said ardern
Title_Text: new zealand ruling national win most vote new zealand first party kingmaker

Text: reuters  the u consumer financial protection bureaus director defended himself in congress on wednesday against a barrage of republican criticism over everything from the agencys handling of the well fargo account scandal to the way he ha personally managed his job appearing before the house financial service committee richard cordray got coy when asked whether he would finish his term which expires in july republican on the committee and elsewhere have pushed for president trump to fire him and cordray is widely rumored to be a possible ohio gubernatorial candidate in cordray who ha headed the agency since when he wa appointed by former president barack obama ha declined to step down since president donald trump took office he did not say whether he will serve out the rest of him term which expires in july i have no insight to provide he said in response to a related question under the doddfrank law creating the agency the president could only remove cordray for cause but longtime republican critic say cordrays decision a a regulator provide ample evidence to fire him for all of the harm caused to consumer richard cordray should be dismissed by the president said house financial service committee chairman jeb hensarling hensarling noted that the cfpb ha failed to finalize regulatory project mandated by congress such a writing rule directing financial institution to collect data about credit application by minority and womenowned business republican claimed the agency failed to detect wrongdoing at well fargo co relying on outside investigator and news report to point out widespread problem with improper account creation the cfpb wa asleep at the wheel said ann wagner a missouri republican the earliest the committee could determine the cfpb began to examine well fargo wa in may after the bank notified the regulator that the los angeles city attorney wa already pursuing a civil case she said yet the cfpb wa front and center in september when the highprofile  million multiagency settlement wa announced cordray said wagner wa conflating issue and said the oversight work became exponential over time the cfpb levied a  million fine against the bank in an enforcement action with the office of the comptroller of the currency and the city and county of los angeles the probe began after a los angeles time investigative story
Title_Text: u consumer financial protection chief defends agency before congress

Text: obama decides to throw hillary under the bus is anyone surprisedthe obama administration leveled a devastating blow to hillary clinton on friday by admitting for the first time that her personal email server contained the highest level of classified u intelligencethe white house said email from former secretary of state s home brew server must be censored from public view when the state department release it final batch on fridaydiplomatic security and intelligence and research bureau will now try to determine if any of the email were marked classified at the time of transmissionfox news chief intelligence correspondent catherine herridge ha noted however that any discussion about marked or unmarked email is a legal red herring because trained official like clinton can spot such intelligence without blatant indicator it is the content that is classified not the format it is in herridge said jan wnd reported to suggest to people that there is somehow a big rubber stamp with classified that s smacked on every document is completely misleading and that s something you only see in the movie mr clinton know better because she had to have special training a secretary of state compelling articulable fact that statute relating to espionage have been violated a former senior federal law enforcement officer saidwhat do you think can hillary not be indicted sound off in today s wnd pollnearly fbi special agent are attempting to determine whether clinton violated a subsection of the espionage act related to gross negligence in handling government document agent are also trying to discern whether comingling of the clinton foundation and state department business violated public corruption lawsclinton campaign spokesman brain fallon called the decision to censor clinton s email overclassification run amok we firmly oppose the complete blocking of the release of these email fallon said statement ap reported since first providing her email to the state department more than one year ago hillary clinton ha urged that they be made available to the public we feel no differently today the white house s acknowledgment come just over a week since it wa Title_Text: obama throw hillary under the bus email scandal just got real with this devastating blow

Text: donald trump is unwellthe beleaguered president seemed vaguely irritated and distracted in what wa meant to be a routine executive order signing after remark by mike penny trump said just a few word before hastily leaving the room the one thing he forgot to do wa the whole reason he wa there in the first place sign the executive orderrealizing trump s mistake penny scramble to stop trump and get him to sign the document instead trump order him to get the folder from his desk and bring it to him to sign outside of the room penny realizing he s about to go viral a a bit player in trump s latest oncamera screw up awkwardly saunter over to the desk grab the folder and rush out of the roomtrump walked out of an executive order signing ceremony without having signed the executive order pictwittercomvsjanotte politico politico march trump appeared reluctant to come back into the room and it s pretty obvious why a he mistakenly left a reporter began asking him question about his baffling remark about michael flynn on twitter this morningmike flynn should ask for immunity in that this is a witch hunt excuse for big election loss by medium dems of historic proportion donald j trump realdonaldtrump march it s understandable that he didn t want to explain the tweet it could lead to trump s eventual downfall a the new york time point out should the doj give michael flynn immunity it would mean they likely have bigger fish to fryimmunity should be granted a soon a congress and prosecutor are persuaded that mr flynn ha information that will lead to a criminal case against one or more people at least a important to the alleged wrongdoing a mr flynn may be the overriding objective must be learning who if anyone in the united state collaborated with the russian a well a who knew about it what they knew and when they knew itwho might that big fish be well there wa only one person working directly above michael flynn donald trumpfeatured image via twitter

Text: detroit election official waited several day to deliver nearly poll book to wayne county official charged with certifying the presidential election newly released document showcounty clerk official on thursday released a memo to state election director chris thomas that said poll book from the precinct weren t available at the start of the canvas which began the day after the nov election five of those poll book which contain the name of voter and ensure the integrity of election were never delivered to county canvasser and presumably remain missingthe revelation come atop other irregularity that have prompted a state audit among other issue the detroit news reported this week that voting machine registered more vote than they should have in onethird of all city precinct i m not happy with how detroit handled this election at all said krista hartounian chairwoman of the wayne county board of canvasser which certified the election we had been seeing improvement but this one wa different this one wa off canvasser compare poll book with printout from voting machine to ensure the number of people who signed in to vote match the number of ballot castin heavily democratic detroit the number didn t match in of precinct or percent the discrepancy emerged during a statewide presidential recount that began last week and ended friday following a decision by the michigan supreme courtit s unclear how many extra vote were counted in detroit that s because tally were off by five or more vote in detroit precinct but county official will not release the exact number of discrepancy in each precinctread more detroit news

Text: singapore reuters  singapore should end harassment of peaceful activist human right watch ha said after participant at a candlelight vigil for a man being executed for drug trafficking were stopped from leaving the country on july around a dozen people including opponent of the death penalty and relative prabagaran srivijayan attended the vigil outside changi prison in support of the man who wa to be hanged early the next morning the man who wa executed on july wa convicted of trafficking gram of heroin into singapore during the vigil participant said they were approached by police and told that a police report had been filed and that they were to remove the candle the police removed the candle and photograph of prabagaran but the participant say they were not asked to disperse a police statement on saturday said people were under investigation relating to whether they had been involved in an illegal assembly assembly and procession for a cause in public place without a permit is a criminal offense in singapore anyone convicted of organizing such an assembly face penalty of up to s  in fine and up to six month in jail the singapore government ha said that the law is required to provide for the individual s right for political expression without compromising on order and safety among those at the vigil were a journalist who is an activist against capital punishment an editor of independent online blog online citizen and a filmmaker whose most recent work focused on the detention in of political activist under singapore s internal security act the three said in social medium posting that they had been prevented from leaving the country and had been told that they were required to stay in singapore to assist police with an investigation human right watch said the government should respect the right of free speech and assembly the government should end it harassment of activist campaigning against capital punishment and respect their right to freedom of expression and peaceful assembly the group said in a release on thursday none of the three had been arrested or charged kirsten han the activist and journalist told reuters
Title_Text: singapore decried for harassment of antideath penalty activist

Text: mike huckabee is fed up with evangelical christian and threw a temper tantrum because they won t support his run for presidentthe republican presidential wannabe aired his grievance with conservative christian during an interview with fox host todd starnes throwing them under the bus in the processhuckabee s poll number stand at a meager percent which make him particularly angry at evangelicals a they flock to ted cruz this of course sent the former preacher into a jealous rage a he accused evangelicals of caring more about getting rich off social issue than changing the law a lot of them quite frankly i think they re scared to death that if a guy like me got elected i would actually do what i said i would do and that is i would focus on the personhood of every individual we would abolish abortion based on the fifth and th amendment we would ignore the supreme court s samesex marriage decision a we all know huckabee ha repeatedly said he intends to ignore the supreme court and abolish a woman s right to choose and samesex marriage should he become president but he say evangelicals are not really into doing either of those thing because it would bring their moneymaking operation to an end a lot of these organization wouldn t have the ability to do urgent fundraising because if we slay the dragon what dragon do they continue to fight and so for many of them it could be a real detriment to their organization s ability to gin up their supporter and raise the contribution and i know that sound cynical but todd it is what it is huckabee then accused conservative christian of running on secular standard instead of on biblical principle and told starnes that these organization should come out and admit to donor that they really don t believe in biblical principle they just want to dupe christian into making them rich look we re a club we re an organization huckabee suggested they say we talk about prayer but we don t necessarily believe that it will change thing there come a time in our life where we either believe in a great god who doe great thing and us sometimes the weak to get it done or else we don t believe in that and we just get human might and we gather all the human resource and we live or die by the human sword here s the audio via right wing watchthis little hissy fit by huckabee is incredibly revealing not only did huckabee decimate any chance he had of getting their support he basically blew the whistle on how these conservative christian organization operate and what they actually believe huckabee just came out and blasted these organization of fleecing donor for money by pretending to believe in god and prayer and not really caring about enacting a social conservative agenda because they wouldn t be able to make any more money once it go into effectthis might actually be the first time huckabee ha been truthful throughout his entire political career and you can bet that conservative are going to blow a gasket over itfeatured image wikimedia
Title_Text: mike huckabee throw evangelicals under a speeding bus for not supporting his campaign audio

Text: washington reuters  a diplomatic dispute between turkey and the united state ha not affected military operation or personnel out of turkey the pentagon said on tuesday i can confirm that these development have not impacted our operation or personnel pentagon spokesman colonel robert manning told reporter the turkish air force base in incirlik continues to fulfill an important role supporting nato and coalition efforts he said that turkey wa a close nato ally and the u would continue to coordinate joint and separate military activity with ankara
Title_Text: pentagon say diplomatic tension with turkey not affecting military operation

Text: many of the parent were not allowed to attend this meeting due to capacity restriction why did larger venue refuse to host this controversial meeting were they afraid to allow american citizen to voice their concern about the false teaching of islam in the public school are american and american business going to cower over the fear of being targeted by radical muslim for fighting back against the indoctrination of islambrentwood tenn school board member in brentwood tennessee received an education on the public s frustration with islam lesson in local school during a radio station sponsored town hall wednesdaycriticisms of the middle school text my world history and geography centered mostly on the omission of negative aspect of the muslim religion and the appropriateness of the material for student in sixth and seventh grade brentwood homepage reportsthe event wa sponsored by supertalk radio and held in a tiny room at a holiday inn express where about folk including student parent teacher lawmaker school board member and political pundit huddled inside organizer reportedly turned some people away when the room reached capacitysunset middle school seventhgrader avery noe pointed out during the meeting that lesson exclude jihadist from islam and questioned why negative aspect of the religion aren t coveredstewart county middle school teacher kyle mallory said teacher cover the material they re given focusing on what s expected on standardized test and asserted the issue with biased lesson on islam stem from the state s textbook selection process mallory teach in a different school district that rejected the my world history and geography text fox report y all had a school board member from here come up to the textbook commission he said nothing wa done it s not a teacher problem we have a state education commissioner not doing her job and i think the state legislature need a noconfidence resolution mallory told fox the my world history text is very biased didn t tell the whole story we need to make sure when we re teaching student in the classroom that we tell them the truth and the textbook weren t mallory saidwilliamson county school board member beth burgos told the brentwood homepage she joined the board because of textbook issue and she back a recent bill introduced by state rep shelia butt to postpone comparative religion course until high schoolboard member susan curlee belief the key to changing the way islam is presented in school and to preventing unintentional indoctrination lie with standardized test my biggest concern is testing she said when my daughter wa in seventh grade i wa told they didn t want to teach islam that way but had to because percent of the test wa going to focus on islam a long a testing is the accountability metric it could be this way curlee told fox the lesson her daughter learned about islam while in franklin special school district last year presented a rosy picture of the religion while glossing over important point a lot of the thing we hear about mohammed and a lot of the warfare that wa waged is very much sugar coated she said my world history which is used by about tennessee school district also alleges islam spread peacefully and that christian and muslim worship the same god my concern is are we going to be asking student on a test to potentially compromise their faith for the sake of a grade curlee saidtennessee state sen jack johnson who also attended the town hall told the brentwood homepage a lot of people share curlee s concern i m concerned because i have three kid in williamson county school johnson said the possibility we could be advocating islam in school and could be misrepresenting history had generated lot of call and email i want to educate myself and learn more about it event organizer told the medium they were forced to hold the town hall in the small holiday inn express room because larger venue in the area refused to host the discussion via eag news
Title_Text: watch parent jam meeting room to denounce false teaching indoctrination of islam in tn public school

Text: hillary clinton s campaign also announced sunday night that it had canceled tentatively planned event with sen bernie sander for mondayinstead her primary rival will now be on the campaign trail wednesday in iowa and wisconsin instead wednesday s de moines stop wa added to make up for appearance tentatively scheduled in iowa on monday october the campaign said in a releasesanders will be in de moines iowa in the morning and will host rally in madison and green bay wi in the afternoonhe will discus the democratic nominee s plan to build an economy that work for everyone not just those at the top and donald trump s plan which would benefit himself and other millionaire and billionaire the campaign saidthough unclear if it s related the schedule change come a few day after audio from a february fundraiser leaked that made public clinton s take on fan of her thenrival sander who she suggested were overly idealistic there s just a deep desire to believe that we can have free college free healthcare that what we ve done hasn t gone far enough and that we just need to you know go a far a you know scandinavia whatever that mean and half the people don t know what it mean but it is something that they deeply feel she saidsanders who ran for president a a member of the democratic party said of course it bothered him that clinton said he sold a false promise to his supportersbut he said sunday his supporter should still vote for her for entire story the hill
Title_Text: socialist millennial magnet bernie sander tell supporter how to vote after hillary caught saying he lied to supporter about free stuff

Text: san francisco reuters  republican presidential candidate donald trump on tuesday warned that a dangerous financial bubble ha formed in the technology industry  and silicon valley responded with a collective eye roll in a reuters interview the new york billionaire said technology startups that had never earned a profit were able to sell share at very high price likening the situation to the overheated stock market in im talking about company that have never made any money that have a bad concept and that are valued at billion of dollar so here we go again trump said many tech watcher have repeatedly warned of a tech bubble a the number of private company valued at  billion or more  known a unicorn  have soared to according to venture capital research firm cb insight so trumps declaration in the eye of silicon valleys entrepreneur and venture capitalist wa nothing new investor and others took to twitter to poke fun at trumps campaign slogan make america great again by repeating the phrase make bubble great again finally someone call it out marc andreessen a general partner at the prominent venture capital firm andreessen horowitz tweeted mocking trump in the interview trump said the high valuation that tech startups are able to fetch today remind him of when an overheated housing market helped drive u stock to unsustainable valuation before the bubble burst you have a stock market that is very strange the presumptive republican nominee said you look at some of these tech stock that are so so weak a a concept and a company and theyre selling for so much money and i would have said can that ever happen again i think that could happen again some startup founder rejected trumps generalization that all company are burning cash and overvalued certainly many of them are and in the last several month a correction ha started to rectify year of exuberant investment still other company continue to raise money successfully and turn profit so far he ha been saying dumb thing but they seem to be getting dumber and dumber vivek wadhwa an entrepreneur and stanford university fellow told reuters i wa going to tweet the comment while calling peter thiel and saying here is your buddy thiel an influential investor wellknown for his contrarian idea is one of the few silicon valley leader to openly support trump thiel wa not immediately available for comment there is nothing in his trumps track record to show that he ha been out here and met with any technology leader and know this industry and know about innovation said aaron ginn cofounder of the lincoln initiative a community that promotes libertarian and technologyfriendly value which is ironic ginn said given how much technology  especially twitter  ha helped trumps campaign he say thing and doe thing that are made for entertainment ginn said read more on our interview with trump here
Title_Text: silicon valley mock trump over his tech bubble warning

Title_Text: trump get pummeled during today show interview matt lauer did not hold back video

Text: barcelona reuters  moment before catalonia s leader carles puigdemont baulked at declaring independence from spain this week crack were already appearing in his secessionist rank some member of his political alliance say they were waiting for him at barcelona s thcentury regional parliament building on tuesday evening fully expecting him to call for an independence vote in the chamber that night instead after arriving late to the cheer of thousand of supporter the former journalist and lifetime advocate of independence told his ally an hour before entering the chamber that there had been a late change of plan according to one of those present there would be no vote instead puigdemont made a symbolic declaration of independence then suspended it and called for negotiation with madrid we are annoyed we are hurt we are angry because he came up with a strategic change one hour before the parliamentary session said carles riera a member of the catalan parliament from the farleft cup party which back an unequivocal declaration of independence and whose support keep puigdemont s minority government alive a spokesman for puigdemont s party denied he had surprised all of his own political ally saying his core coalition had agreed the plan in the morning the cup wa not included in that morning meeting but wa informed afterwards the spokesman said without saying when the cup s claim of betrayal reveals the shaky political foundation upon which catalonia s independence movement is built a jumble of party ranging from anticapitalists to free marketeers whose only common cause is to split from spain there are now doubt over puigdemont s ability to survive the worst confrontation between catalonia a former principality with it own language and culture and madrid in year member of the cup say puigdemont lost his nerve at the crucial moment one cup lawmaker present at the meeting eulalia reguant quit the day after citing his reversal instead of persuading spanish prime minister mariano rajoy to accept talk his gesture wa met with an ultimatum renounce independence by thursday or madrid will use it constitutional power to take control of the region directly now puigdemont find himself in a struggle with not only madrid but also internally with the cup which may end up being the bigger danger for his political career and for his prospect of winning another regional election on a proindependence platform the small cup party had ousted puigdemont s predecessor a catalan president artur ma in it refused to back the mainstream independence coalition junts pel si unless ma stepped down if puigdemont back down and say we tried but this is not working unilateral secession isn t doable i don t think cup will support him again said eurasia analyst federico santi he said puigdemont s party wa already sliding in opinion poll in the final hour before puigdemont stood up in the regional parliament to announce that he wa suspending the independence push he also made it clear to those in his political circle that their voice were not the only one that mattered i am talking to the world he told them when pressed for an explanation according to two people who were present some in the room said they suspected he had taken a phone call from a senior eu figure in brussels though the head of the two main eu political institution jeanclaude juncker and donald tusk said it wa not them one eu official however said there wa reason to believe that an emotional personal appeal tusk had made publicly to puigdemont a couple of hour before he wa due to speak had weighed on the catalan leader s decision puigdemont ha always considered world opinion a crucial to catalan independence a a journalist in the s he traveled europe to research medium impression of catalonia and wrote a book cata que cata what a supporter of the european union he switch easily from catalan to spanish french or romanian the native language of his wife whom he met at the catalan news agency he founded the president made a speech which wa very much addressed to eu institution and government a catalan government source said on condition of anonymity puigdemont also made clear that he considered it would be spain s responsibility if it rejected his offer of dialogue several neighboring country criticized spain s use of force to disrupt catalonia s oct independence referendum which had been banned by madrid hundred were injured when police used baton and rubber bullet on voter the crackdown though fired up independence supporter and hardened expectation among puigdemont s base that he would unilaterally declare independence in parliament when he didn t supporter watching his speech on large screen outside the assembly buried their head in their hand some wept and they rolled up their catalan flag and went home inside the recrimination were well underway some lawmaker in puigdemont s junts pel si coalition said they too had only been informed of his tactic at the th hour though the spokesman for puigdemont s party denied this the government source said catalan company leaving the region in the day before his speech had also weighed on puigdemont s mind several firm including catalonia s two major bank moved their legal headquarters to other part of spain some anxious catalan depositor traveled to neighboring region to open bank account there jordi alberich director of barcelonabased business association cercle d economia met puigdemont on oct he seemed to be very conscious of the consequence of a unilateral declaration of independence alberich said he wa very worried about company fleeing
Title_Text: catalonia independence leader wage his own battle for unity

Text: washington reuters  the u state department said on thursday that president donald trumps proposed budget for the fiscal year would not reduce u aid to israel but that assistance level to other nation including egypt and jordan were still being evaluated our assistance to israel is guaranteed and that reflects obviously our strong commitment to one of our strongest partner and allies state department spokesman mark toner said with respect to other assistance level foreign military assistance level those are still being evaluated and decision are going to be made going forward toner added noting that treaty obligation would be a factor the united state provides assistance to jordan and egypt a part of their peace treaty with israel this version of the story corrects headline by adding dropped word preserves
Title_Text: trump budget preserve aid for israel other country being evaluated state dept
