Text: washington reuters  member of congress on thursday grilled the main u banking regulator about a recent raft of data breach highlighting two incident where worker downloaded more than sensitive and private record onto portable storage device before leaving the agencys employ after the federal deposit insurance corp uncovered those two breach it conducted a review and found five other instance when employee improperly stored and took personal information for ten of thousand of individual according to representative barry loudermilk a republican who chair a house of representative subcommittee on oversight and technology altogether more than people were affected loudermilk said at a hearing covering the breach to date fdic ha failed to notify any of those individual that their private information may have been compromised he added the highestranking democrat on the subcommittee representative don beyer said the concern were shared by member of both party and added the fdic wa too slow in notifying congress about the break in data security it should have informed lawmaker within seven day of the incident he said the fdics chief information officer and chief privacy officer lawrence gross told the hearing the agency is working to eliminate employees use of portable medium and ha installed technology blocking most employee from downloading data from it system to dvd cd and flash drive it is also looking into digital right management software limiting the time period someone can access information and putting up other barrier to redistributing information gross who started his role in november said he is conducting a top to bottom review of the agencys information technology policy and planned to hire an independent third party to conduct an assessment the fdic ha said the downloads were inadvertent but member of congress remained skeptical that the breach were not intentional in at least one casea former employee who downloaded such data wa evasive about her action and not cooperative when initially confronted said representative bill johnson some fdic employee also suggest that it wa highly improbable that this former employees action were accidental in addition this former employee is now working for a u subsidiary of a nonus financial service company which raise additional concerns
Title_Text: congress subcommittee grill u bank regulator about data breach

Text: a new ad from a conservative super pac absolutely destroys donald trump and it us his own word to do the job the commercial come from our principle pac and it showcase ordinary everyday woman reading a series of horribly sexist and misogynist quote from current republican presidential frontrunner donald trumpa few choice quote from the ad includethese are the sort of quote that have terrified the republican establishment about what trump would do to the party in the general election even with candidate without misogynist comment like these on the ballot republican have struggled to convince female voter in percent of woman voted for barack obama a number that wa almost the same at percent in even when john kerry lost the election in he still got percent of the woman s voteyou can hear the audio of trump himself making many of these sexist comment in a story compiled by buzzfeed they went through trump s appearance on radio show like howard sterntrump appeared upwards of two dozen time from the late s through the s with the shock jock and buzzfeed news ha listened to hour of those conversation which are not publically available the most popular topic of conversation during these appearance a is typical of stern s program wa sex in particular trump frequently discussed woman he had sex with wanted to have sex with or wouldn t have sex with if given the opportunity he also rated woman on a point scalethis super pac ad is designed to derail trump s path to the republican nomination but it may be too late for that but a similar ad broadcast from coast to coast by democrat and their affiliated super pac would likely be extremely devastatingfeatured image via youtube
Title_Text: watch not a single woman will vote trump after seeing this video

Text: after giving room to destroy baltimore s mayor now say she s confident she can get uncle sam to pay for the damage what is this the new age of federally financed riot one month after the race riot that trashed baltimore mayor stephanie rawlingsblake said that the city would apply for a  million federal emergency management agency fema grant to replenish the rainy day fund being used to pay for cleanup and police overtime cost in the wake of the mayhem that she herself is on record a encouraging in order to replenish this fund we ve already worked with the state to apply for a federal fema reimbursement and we are confident that we will receive a significant reimbursement from the federal government cbs baltimore affiliate wjz reported her a saying wednesday this smell pretty funny given that fema fund are meant mostly for natural disaster not riot damage but more to the point it s effectively an escape from fiscal accountability and political responsibility given rawlingsblake s role in fueling the riot rawlingsblake remember is the one who lit the fuse by saying we also gave those who wished to destroy space to do that a clear incitement to riot even a she unconvincingly denied meaning any such thing while baltimore burned instead of resigning or being asked to rawlingsblake is now more confident than ever that cash is on it way according to press report this may very well be true given all the evidence of political dealmaking with the obama white house and eric holder s justice department a the riot raged rawlingsblake wa in telephone contact with white house advisor valerie jarrett then she initiated a quickiejustice prosecution of six baltimore cop a well a a broader federal investigation of the city s police force that the white house wanted last week she joined one group of maryland official and another of bigcity mayor to seek federal dollar using the riot a reason no cash ha been explicitly promised at this point but in the world of one hand wash the other it s pretty obvious that deal are being cutread more ibd
Title_Text: federally funded riot baltimore mayor want fed to pay  million for repair of city

Text: the clinton grifter were out in nyc and ready to fundraise for hillary but look like bill didn t waste any time he s such a flirt check out the photo below of the not so loving grasp bill ha on hillary very interesting but what s more interesting is that the effort to make hillary relatable have been intense but doesn t this type of elitist event ruin all that work to make hillary just another gal let s face it the same liberal elite who backed the obamas are jumping on the clinton train but they want you to believe they re not anything like those greedy capitalist republican they like to bash hahahanew york s alist came out to support hillary clinton s presidential campaign last night at a private but starstudded new york city fundraiserthe event wa held in designer vera wang s upper east side apartment on sunday night and wa cohosted by vera vogue editorinchief anna wintour marchesa designer georgina chapman and georgina s husband producer harvey weinstein and plenty of other famous name were happy to fork over a donation for the chance to spend time with the democratic frontrunner who turn today and arrived at the party with husband bill clinton in towtickets for the exclusive event cost  and included a photo with the clinton who seemed to be in a good mood a they walked past paparazzo after most of the other guest had arrived hillary took a break from matching pantsuit and opted instead for a shiny red top and plain black pant while bill who waved and held her hand a he walked beside her donned a simple blue suit other fashionable guest who turned up for the fete included celebrity designer jason wu michael kor and cynthia rowley martha stewart photographer annie leibovitz producer jane rosenthal of meet the parent fame vogue editor andr leon talley and anna wintour s daughter bee shaffer were all shot walking in a well while glee star matthew morrison and his wife renee puente stopped to pose for picturesread more uk daily mail
Title_Text: alist fundraiser for clinton in nyc brings out the rich and famousbut shes just like you

Text: donald trump is not going to like this at allthe republican nominee s pathetic effort to draw hispanic voter to his campaign ha failed miserably especially after his disastrous trip to mexico and the immigration speech he made afterwardstrump visited our southern neighbor to discus the wall and who will pay for it only to be told that mexico will not pay for it defeated trump wa so humiliated that he claimed there wa no discussion about that particular topic only to be embarrassed once more by mexican official when they called him out on his liein fact trump doubled down on his immigration plan declaring that there will be no amnesty and that mexico will pay for the wallin other word trump still want to deport million people and is suggesting that he will somehow force mexico to pay the bill for something they did not build nor supportand that s exactly why hispanic chamber of commerce ceo javier palomarez went on morning joe on msnbc on thursday morning to declare trump s campaign done for among the latino communitypalomarez began by pointing out that net immigration across the mexican border ha basically dropped to about people which might a well be zero in a nation a big a ours then he revealed that the are those who are leaving america instead of coming in that blow trump s entire premise for a wall out of the waterjoe scarborough asked palomarez what his take is on trump s effort to have it both way by suggesting that maybe he won t deport that many people while also repeating his draconian immigration plan to his racist conservative base he s painted himself into this box palomarez replied he s damned if he doe and damned if he doesn t he really had to come back out and fire up his base but in reality he hasn t done anything to help himself in term of growing the number so i think he is done for with the hispanic community palomarez said that trump will never see the white house without a decent portion of the hispanic vote and then he dropped the hammer on the republican nominee with a single word of spanish i don t know if you guy speak spanish but i want you to remember this one word payaso it mean clown this guy is a complete clown palomarez went on to say that trump ha laid to waste any outreach effort republican have made after the election and there s no going back here s the video via youtubethere is no way donald trump can possibly make amends with hispanic voter with two month to go any such attempt would be seen a desperation from a failing candidate whose poll number have only imploded since the rnc convention in julyhillary clinton is poised to win the hispanic vote by even larger margin than president obama did in and trump is so despised that his presence at the top of the ballot could be disastrous to republican down the ticketit s too late to appeal to hispanic for their vote and republican know it the only one who don t are delusional trump fan who really believe he is going to win the election and they are going to be devastated when the result are revealed on election dayfeatured image via screen capture
Title_Text: watch hispanic chamber of commerce ceo call trump a clown on morning joe

Text: london reuters  a top aide to iran s supreme leader warned the united state on tuesday against designating the elite revolutionary guard a a terrorist group saying tehran ha all option on table news agency isna reported the american are supporting daesh islamic state that s why they are angry with the revolutionary guard but they are too small to be able to harm the revolutionary guard ali akbar velayati the top adviser to iran s supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei wa quoted a saying by isna whatever they do we will take reciprocal measure we have all option on the table he added

Text: new york reuters  vermont senator bernie sander ha erased secretary of state hillary clintons wide lead for the democratic presidential nomination since the start of year putting the two in a dead heat nationally according to a reutersipsos poll clinton lead sander percent to percent among democratic voter according to the poll of american conducted feb  following the iowa caucus the poll ha a credibility interval of percentage point democrat had been supporting clinton by more than a to margin at the beginning of the year sander ha narrowed that lead considerably over the past several week clinton beat sander narrowly in the iowa caucus the nations first nomination contest ahead of the november election but is expected to lose to him in new hampshire the two rival clashed on thursday night in their first oneonone debate reflecting the tightness of the race there is still a wide gap between the two in name recognition nationally nearly a quarter of democrat and twofifths of independent say they are still not that familiar with sander in comparison clinton ha almost total name recognition among voter on the republican side donald trump continued to lead the field with percent support his level of support among republican wa relatively unchanged following his secondplace finish in the iowa caucus senator ted cruz of texas followed with percent and senator marco rubio of florida came in third with percent democrat poll result bitlyppdeh republican poll result bitlyurswih for more on the presidential race see the reuters blog tales from the trail here editing by richard valdmanis and lisa shumaker sap is the sponsor of this content it wa independently created by reuters editorial staff and funded in part by sap which otherwise ha no role in this coverage
Title_Text: exclusive presidential hopeful sander clinton in dead heat  reutersipsos poll

Text: pope francis used his annual christmas day message to rebuke donald trump without even mentioning his name the pope delivered his message just day after member of the united nation condemned trump s move to recognize jerusalem a the capital of israel the pontiff prayed on monday for the peaceful coexistence of two state within mutually agreed and internationally recognized border we see jesus in the child of the middle east who continue to suffer because of growing tension between israeli and palestinian francis said on this festive day let u ask the lord for peace for jerusalem and for all the holy land let u pray that the will to resume dialogue may prevail between the party and that a negotiated solution can finally be reached the pope went on to plead for acceptance of refugee who have been forced from their home and that is an issue trump continues to fight against francis used jesus for which there wa no place in the inn a an analogy today a the wind of war are blowing in our world and an outdated model of development continues to produce human societal and environmental decline christmas invite u to focus on the sign of the child and to recognize him in the face of little child especially those for whom like jesus there is no place in the inn he said jesus know well the pain of not being welcomed and how hard it is not to have a place to lay one s head he added may our heart not be closed a they were in the home of bethlehem the pope said that mary and joseph were immigrant who struggled to find a safe place to stay in bethlehem they had to leave their people their home and their land francis said this wa no comfortable or easy journey for a young couple about to have a child at heart they were full of hope and expectation because of the child about to be born yet their step were weighed down by the uncertainty and danger that attend those who have to leave their home behind so many other footstep are hidden in the footstep of joseph and mary francis said sunday we see the track of entire family forced to set out in our own day we see the track of million of person who do not choose to go away but driven from their land leave behind their dear one amen to thatphoto by christopher furlonggetty image
Title_Text: pope francis just called out donald trump during his christmas speech

Text: when you have a crowd of people listening to this kind of idiotic drama i think it s safe to say you should expect to be booed off the stage if you don t tow the line here r the black net root speaker s dramatic introduction for governor o malley let s be clear every single day folk are dying not being able to take another breath we are in a state of emergency we are in a state of emergency and if you don t fill that emergency you are not human a the washington examiner noted saturday former maryland governor and current presidential candidate martin o malley wa being interviewed at the annual netroots nation conference and wa making a statement about the need for civilian police review board the interview wa interrupted by a group of protestors chanting say black life matter in response to a question by one of the protestors about alleged instance of police brutality against african american o malley stated i think all of u have a responsibility to recognize the pain and grief caused by life lost to violence black life matter white life matter all life matter the statement is said to have drawn boo from the crowd a minute or two later o malley apologizedthe incident illustrated neatly illustrated the cultural divide between the left and the rest of america most people without much of a thought would agree that all life matter whether they belong to someone killed in an altercation with police or say a marine gunned down by a terrorist the crowd at netroots nation disagreedmore importantly o malley failed the sister souljah test by apologizing for saying something that should be axiomatic a sister souljah moment refers to an incident during the presidential campaign in which then governor bill clinton condemned a rapper named sister souljah for racially incendiary lyric in some of her song the statement caused a great deal of consternation but clinton received praise for taking on an extremist who wa part of an important democratic constituency clinton went on to be elected and then reelected four year later via the examiner
Title_Text: video dem prez candidate booed off stage forced to apologize for saying all life matter

Text: just imagine how many brilliant young american mind could benefit from their education if their teacher and professor put a much effort into actually teaching their student a they do indoctrinating them with their liberal web of mistruths and distortion an email encouraging extra credit for student participation at a liberal protest ha prompted a conservative backlash at the university of pittsburgh and an explanation from school officialsthe email sent out by a student service specialist with the university s school of social work wa first made public by the university s pitt maverick newspaper on thursdaywatchthe university of pittsburgh is giving extra credit to student who attend an antitrump protest pictwittercomcyzzpnsa fox friend foxandfriends november in the email the administrator urge student and faculty to sign up for a people s agenda for change national day of action rally slated for downtown pittsburgh on nov the email incorrectly contained the suggestion that extra credit be offered for attendance miksch wrote the school doe not allow this practice that language wa to have been removed from the communication before it wa sent but wa not the controversy come at a politically sensitive time for the university of pittsburgh and academic institution across the nation this a protest arrest and even accusation of hate crime continue to roil campus on the heel of presidentelect donald trump s victoryon thursday were arrested when a pitt protest aimed at trump and other social issue saw clash between the demonstrator and police pennlive

Text: reuters  the u senate on monday confirmed william emanuel a veteran managementside labor lawyer to the national labor relation board giving the agency a republican majority widely expected to roll back recent decision that business group have said favored union emanuel a partner with global laborlaw firm littler mendelson wa confirmed  by the republicancontrolled senate president donald trump nominated emanuel and marvin kaplan a lawyer and former republican congressional aide to the board earlier this year kaplan wa confirmed in august the nlrb oversees union election and dispute between privatesector employer worker and union republican will now have a  edge on the board business group and many republican lawmaker have called on the agency to revisit significant change to labor policy adopted during the administration of former democratic president barack obama they include rule designed to speed up the union election process and a decision that made it easier for company to be found to be joint employer and held liable for legal violation by contractor staffing agency and franchisees emanuel did not immediately respond to a request for comment before the vote senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said that during the obama administration the board strayed from it role a a neutral umpire in labor disputes its time to get back to that important original mission he said democratic senator elizabeth warren said however that emanuel should not join the nlrb after spending year trying to prevent worker from organizing emanuel ha worked with republican in congress and trade group including the national retail federation and national association of manufacturer and ha defended employer for decade in nlrb case he is a member of the conservative federalist society an influential group of lawyer credited with pushing trump to nominate neil gorsuch to u supreme court at a senate confirmation hearing in august several democrat questioned whether emanuel would properly consider workers collective bargaining right after long representing employer and trade group he said he would be honest and objective a a board member and noted that it would be unusual for a labor lawyer to have experience representing both union and management
Title_Text: u senate tip labor board to republican majority

Text: fareed zakaria tends to go for the heart of the matter when he s talking about pretty much anything but it s not likely that anybody expected him to criticize donald trump a bluntly a he did zakaria wa live on cnn speaking with wolf blitzer about what it say when a presidential candidate ha to come back time and again to clarify what he say on volatile issue like russiazakaria explained that there s a pattern of ignorance with trump and how when someone point out that he s wrong somewhere he come back with a certain bravado and try to explain it away with a tweet or a statement he listed multiple example of this such a brexit the nuclear triad and even where tim kaine wa governor trump said new jersey kaine actually governed virginia then he said usually he add that the press hate him but there s a term for this kind of thing this is the mode of a bullshit artist damn there s a truth bomb if there ever wa one trump is indeed a bullshit artist there s no other way to put it watch zakaria s entire comment belowfareed zakaria discussing trump on cnn this is the mode of a bullshit artist pictwittercomwxsgeeggfs dave itzkoff ditzkoff august zakaria just hit one of trump s biggest problem on the head with an awfully heavy hammer trump can t ever admit that he made a mistake it s the medium that s dishonest it s his opponent and enemy who are dishonest everyone but him is incredibly dishonest and unfair and he s just a victim for whom our heart bleed pink carbonated peanut butter in the end though a bullshit artist is what he really is and he s the gop s candidate for presidentfeatured image via screen capture from embedded video
Title_Text: watch fareed zakaria flatout call trump a bullsht artist on live television

Text: budapest reuters  hungary s foreign ministry ha summoned u envoy david kostelancik over a plan to fund rural medium outlet in hungary which budapest considers a political intervention ahead of an election due early next year the united state said on monday it would devote  to fund rural medium outlet in hungary to help train and equip journalist in defense of an independent medium it see subject to growing pressure and intimidation hungarian prime minister viktor orban ha increased medium control by legal change regulatory step and takeover of outlet by business sector associate the move have alarmed western partner ahead of election due in april which he is widely expected to win the ministry of foreign affair and trade ha summoned the u charg d affaire asking for an explanation and told him that we consider this a political intervention by the u department of state ahead of the election spokesman tamas menczer said in an emailed response the u program offer technical and financial assistance to medium outlet a well a increased local and international exposure small grant and other tool they can use the fund after may after the election is due the organisation for security and cooperation in europe an intergovernmental human right and medium freedom watchdog ha said medium pluralism ha declined in hungary
Title_Text: hungary summons u envoy over medium funding plan

Text: washington reuters  the trump administration on wednesday moved to amend the starting date of it proposed day travel ban on people entering the united state from six muslimmajority country in a bid to keep it legal battle alive the amendment appears intended to avoid the administrations legal case at the u supreme court becoming moot on ground that part of the executive order have expired challenger to the ban who say the order is intended to discriminate against muslim have said in court paper that it should expire on wednesday day after the executive order wa due to take effect on march a memo issued by the white house a the supreme court considered two challenge to the ban said part of the order put on hold would not expire before they can go into effect and the start date would be when court injunction were lifted the move is part of administration effort to have the high court rule that the controversial ban should immediately go into effect after trumps first attempt to impose travel restriction were blocked by lower court omar jadwat a lawyer with the american civil liberty union which ha challenged the ban said the need for the revision wa a sign of the bans legal flaw and yet again these revision underline that the one thing the president ha consistently wanted throughout is a muslim ban he added lawsuit by hawaii and maryland challenger argued that the order violated federal immigration law and a section of the constitutions first amendment which prohibits the government favoring or disfavoring any particular religion the trump administration ha said it is needed to protect national security soon after the memo wa issued acting solicitor general jeff wall filed court paper saying that it resolved any doubt about the orders effective date if the case wa moot the nine justice would have no reason to rule on it and lower court ruling against the administration would remain in place the supreme court on tuesday gave the trump administration more time to file paper responding to an appeal court ruling on monday that upheld a block on the travel ban the courts action likely delayed any decision on administration request for the ban to go into effect until at least next week federal judge in maryland and hawaii blocked trumps day ban on traveler from libya iran somalia sudan syria and yemen the hawaii judge also blocked a day ban on refugee entering the united state the th u circuit court of appeal largely upheld the hawaii injunction on monday in the second case the richmond virginiabased th u circuit court of appeal on may upheld the maryland judges ruling
Title_Text: trump administration amends travel ban date to keep legal battle alive

Text: dublin reuters  ireland is open to adding to a tentative irish border agreement that collapsed on monday but movement will be needed by the end of the week if brexit talk are to move onto the next phase this year the country s european affair minister said on wednesday a deal on the border which is required if negotiation are to progress to trade talk wa agreed on monday with dublin s blessing after brexit negotiator guaranteed regulatory alignment on both side of the border that ireland share with the british province of northern ireland while the northern irish party propping up the british government rejected the deal dublin insists it will not accept any change to the substance of the agreement ahead of a meeting of eu leader on dec to decide whether to open trade talk the text that ha been agreed we feel it s appropriate it s workable there is compromise on both side and address our concern of upholding what we ve all been asking for that there would be no return to a hard border helen mcentee told reuters in an interview if there is clarification needed on the text if there is possibly additional wording that would clarify what s already in the text that would be agreeable to u i wouldn t see how that would be a problem the democratic unionist party dup ha said it cannot allow any divergence in regulation between northern ireland and other part of the united kingdom dublin is waiting for the british government to come back to the eu s negotiating team with any suggestion or a request for further clarity mcentee said eu diplomat and official say britain must deliver it brexit divorce package offer this week and mcentee added that if it s felt by monday that a deal is not going to happen then she would expect chief brexit negotiator michel barnier to inform the general affair council of eu minister of that a day later however she said the huge amount of work official put in last weekend to bring the side to the brink of a deal on monday showed how much progress can be made in a few short day realistically you would want thing to be moving by the end of the week and there to be some sort of agreement coming into the general affair council she said i think the fact that it wa agreed show most people were happy with that and i think it s just to move from there and i would be hopeful that we would be able to reach that agreement by next week
Title_Text: ireland open to adding to border text but clock ticking

Text: washington reuters  time magazine named u presidentelect donald trump it person of the year on wednesday citing the upheaval in american politics brought about by the new york businessmans election campaign and victory its hard to measure the scale of his disruption time said in it announcement noting trumps career a real estate magnate and reality television star before he won the presidency on nov the republican presidentelect who will be sworn in on jan ran an unconventional and controversial campaign against democrat hillary clinton time noted that view of him were deeply divided for those who believe this is all for the better trumps victory represents a longoverdue rebuke to an entrenched and arrogant governing class the magazine said for those who see it a for the worse the destruction extends to cherished norm of civility and discourse a politics poisoned by vile stream of racism sexism nativism the magazine said it short list for person of the year included clinton turkish president tayyip erdogan and singer beyonce its a great honor it mean a lot trump told nbcs today show in an interview shortly after the announcement but he rejected times characterization of the country a fractured the magazines cover called him the president of the divided state of america i didnt divide them theyre divided now he told nbc were going to put it back together he added i think putting divided is snarky time make it annual choice based on the impact a person ha on world event for better or for worse last year the magazine chose german chancellor angela merkel previous winner have ranged from mahatma gandhi to adolf hitler
Title_Text: time magazine name u presidentelect trump person of the year

Text: san francisco reuters  california lawmaker voted to extend the states climate change fighting effort out to on wednesday giving a new lease on life to the most ambitious greenhouse gas reduction program in the country the state senate voted  in support of a bill that set a target of cutting the states output of heattrapping emission percent below level by the state is currently on track to meet it goal of reducing emission back to level the vote came hour after the state assembly passed a linked bill to increase legislative oversight of the climate change program run by the california air resource board by a vote of  both bill will now go to governor jerry brown who ha said he will sign them senator fran pavley the author of the law that set the states first emission reduction target said that effort ha generated billion of dollar in investment in the states clean energy sector while creating job and reducing emission todays action will ensure the state remains on it prosperous and healthy course she said at a press conference brown said the legislation would impact all industry in the state from oil refining and agriculture to building construction and public utility its about the world in which we live becoming decarbonized and sustainable he said these regulation will work to achieve that goal he said opponent said the emission target have caused job loss in the community they represent the impact in my county are immense senate republican leader jean fuller who represents bakersfield said prior to the vote on wednesday she said the current policy have driven hundred of energy job out of her county which is home to oil producer and manufacturer the change it ha brought to our economy are unforgiveable she said lawmaker did not address a central threat to the states carbon capandtrade program from the california chamber of commerce which ha filed a lawsuit arguing that the states quarterly carbon permit auction amount to an illegal tax on business both climate bill are silent on the question of what policy mechanism  such a cap and trade  should be used to achieve the goal brown a staunch supporter of cap and trade told reporter all option including a ballot measure in were on the table to ensure the future of the carbon market
Title_Text: california legislature pass climate change bill

Text: washington reuters  with a hug and a handshake president donald trump and japanese prime minister shinzo abe opened a new chapter in usjapan relation on friday with trump abruptly setting aside campaign pledge to force tokyo to pay more for u defense aid the two leader appeared to have established a quick friendship during a day of talk at the white house and a flight together aboard air force one to florida for a weekend of golf at a joint news conference with abe trump avoided repeating harsh campaign rhetoric that accused japan of taking advantage of u security aid and stealing american job it wa a welcome affirmation for japan in the face of challenge such a chinas maritime expansion and north koreas nuclear and missile development we are committed to the security of japan and all area under it administrative control and to further strengthening our very crucial alliance trump said the bond between our two nation and the friendship between our two people run very very deep this administration is committed to bringing those tie even closer he added a joint usjapanese statement said the u commitment to defend japan through nuclear and conventional military capability is unwavering the statement amounted to a victory for abe who came to washington wanting to develop a sense of trust and friendship with the new u president and send a message that the decadesold alliance is unshakeable japan got continued u backing for it dispute with beijing over island in the east china sea that china also claim the statement said the two leader affirmed that article of the usjapan security treaty covered the island known a the senkaku in japan and the diaoyu in china abe invited trump for a visit to japan this year and trump accepted u vice president mike penny will make an early stop in tokyo but uncertainty remained in another area that of trade after trump abruptly pulled the united state out of the planned transpacific partnership trade deal abe said he wa fully aware of trumps decision to withdraw from the multilateral trade accord but he said japan and the united state had agreed on a new framework for economic dialogue i am quite optimistic that good result will be seen from the dialogue he said adding that japan wa looking for a fair common set of rule for trade in the region a senior japanese government spokesman said abe and trump did not discus currency issue and that trump did not request a bilateral trade deal the official told reporter that a usjapan economic dialogue will be led by japanese deputy prime minister taro aso and vice president mike penny to address fiscal and monetary policy a well a infrastructure project and trade trump who spoke by phone on thursday night with chinese president xi jinping also said he considered dealing with north koreas nuclear program a very very high priority but gave no hint a to how his approach would differ from that of his predecessor barack obama he predicted a level playing field on trade with china soon the maralago visit will be trumps first use of his florida getaway for diplomatic purpose it will also be the most time trump will have spent with a foreign leader since taking power last month and his second facetoface meeting with a key ally after talk with british prime minister theresa may two week ago trump hosted abe at trump tower last year in his first talk with a foreign leader after his surprise win in the november presidential election abe played down his chance in scoring better than trump in golf my score in golf are not up to the level of donald at all but my policy is never up never in always aiming for the cup he said japan ha had lingering concern about what trumps selfstyled america first strategy mean for u foreign policy in asia a well a what his decision to withdraw from the transpacific partnership trade pact mean for bilateral economic tie abe pledged japan would help create u job hoping to persuade trump to turn down the heat on economic matter and stand by the alliance to avoid question about whether japan is paying trump for abe to stay at the beachfront maralago retreat the white house declared that the entire visit there including golf is the official gift for abe from trump
Title_Text: trump say u committed to japan security in change from campaign rhetoric

Text: washington reuters  the house of representative intelligence committee called on the trump administration on wednesday to provide them with what they expect will be thousand of document related to the investigation of russian effort to influence the election the request may be an effort to avoid a repeat of an unusual document access arrangement made between the senate intelligence committee and cia to review information related to enhanced interrogation technique at secret overseas black site prison during the george w bush administration under that arrangement senate investigator were limited to reviewing document on a shared computer network set up at a central intelligence agency facility which later led to accusation the agency had spied on the work of congressional staffer it will not be adequate to review these document expected to be in the thousand of page at the agency they should be delivered to the house intelligence committee to provide member adequate time to examine their content representative devin nunes the committees republican chairman and adam schiff it top democrat said in a joint statement they said they expect prompt response to request for document u intelligence agency contend that moscow waged a multifaceted campaign of hacking and other action to boost republican president donald trumps election chance against democrat hillary clinton last year trump ha worried lawmaker mostly democrat but also some republican by dismissing such claim and criticizing intelligence agency for raising them they have demanded special committee to investigate but republican congressional leader said they would leave that work to existing committee trumps fellow republican control majority in both the senate and house the leader of the senate intelligence committee republican richard burr and democrat mark warner issued a statement late on tuesday saying their committee wa also moving forward with it investigation moscow ha repeatedly denied any attempt to help trump win
Title_Text: u lawmaker want document on russia election probe

Text: washington reuters  democrat on the u senate foreign relation committee have been undertaking their own investigation without republican on what they term russias malign influence around the world a spokesman for the democratic side of the committee said on wednesday sean bartlett a spokesman for senator ben cardin who ha been leading the effort said the democrat are preparing a major report on how russia seek to sow distrust and confusion promote radical voice on divisive issue and gain leverage while eroding support for democracy and institution the investigation wa first reported by the daily beast it come a a handful of republicanled congressional committee including the senate and house of representative intelligence committee a well a special counsel robert mueller investigate alleged russian interference in the u election and whether there wa collusion between republican president donald trumps campaign and moscow trump ha denied any collusion moscow denies meddling while the foreign relation democrat are not looking into the u contest they said they had discovered russianled effort to influence election in many country the report describes how these effort are led by the governments security service and buttressed by stateowned enterprise kremlinaligned oligarch and russian criminal group that have effectively been nationalized by the state bartlett said in an emailed statement the committees investigation have included contact with foreign government ukraine estonia latvia lithuania and poland are among country that have discussed russian meddling committee republican said they were aware of the investigation but not involved we are aware that senator cardin is developing a report on russian effort to interfere in european election but his staff ha not yet shared it with us said micah johnson a spokeswoman for senator bob corker the committees republican chairman it wa not clear when the report might be released publicly
Title_Text: democrat working on independent russia probe

Text: if there s one thing that conservative and fox news want more than anything it s for president obama and his administration to fail this ha been their narrative since he took office and they d love for him to follow through with what they ve been saying unfortunately for them that s just not the case the economy ha recovered more people have health insurance osama bin laden wa killed marriage equality is the law of the land credit card company are better kept in check and a deal for a nuclearfree iran wa reached on top of countless other achievementson the latest edition of traitor tv fox news seems rather upset that obama and his administration are actually getting the job done five prisoner have just been released from iran four a part of a negotiation one of the prisoner released is washington post journalist jason rezaian who wa held for more than day in iranian captivity according to cnn the release wa arranged a part of a prisoner swap involving seven iranian held by the united state on sanction charge the official confirmed the deal come after more than a year of secret negotiation this is a huge development and also go directly against the narrative republican have been touting during debate and fox news ha been delivering for year they ve insisted that president obama is going to get u into war with iran but more and more evidence to the contrary keep making itself knownand because they re technically a news medium outlet and not officially the medium branch of the republican party fox news fox friend had to report these latest negotiated release with iran however by the look on their face they don t seem thrilled to deliver the good news after all they ve just been proven to be the liar that they are yet again videofeatured image cl
Title_Text: fox news seems super bummed theyre forced to report iran released prisoner video
