Text: washington reuters  representative mike conaways new role leading the house intelligence committee investigation into the trump teams tie to russia ha plunged the lowprofile legislator into one of the most contentious issue in congress and the country republican and democrat both praised his selection he ha administrative experience a a committee chairman and familiarity with delicate subject after leading the house ethic committee from to i like him i hope he can get u back on track representative eric swalwell a democratic committee member said in a brief interview outside the u house of representative while conaway ha tie to mainstream republican and a long association with the bush political family the former accountant from texas wa a strong trump supporter during the campaign in conaway backed trump citing the candidates choice of mike penny a his vice president his promise to appoint conservative supreme court justice and the congressmans own vehement opposition to democratic candidate hillary clinton but unlike devin nunes  who on thursday stepped down a leader of the investigation into alleged russian meddling in the u presidential election including possible collusion with trump associate  conaway wa not a member of the incoming presidents transition team russia denies the allegation conaway is considered less partisan than some other republican committee member such a trey gowdy the chairman of the house select committee that investigated the attack on a u diplomatic mission in benghazi libya democrat accused gowdy of running a partisan inquiry that focused on former secretary of state clinton in an effort to damage her presidential campaign in his statement announcing he would step aside nunes said gowdy and another republican committee member tom rooney would also be leader of the russia investigation fox news reported that nunes called conaway on wednesday night nevertheless some conaway comment about the russia investigation have raised eyebrow during a march committee hearing he asked fbi director james comey whether washington post reporter had helped intelligence agency write their assessment that moscow wa seeking to help trump win the election and in a january interview with the dallas morning news he seemed to make light of the alleged russian meddling in the election saying it and the democrats use of mexican singer to entertain their voter were both foreign interference although he also serf a chairman of the house agriculture committee conaway ha kept a low profile and is better known for his close tie to the bush family than the medium spotlight first elected to the house in and easily reelected six time conaway is the secondranking republican on the intelligence panel house speaker paul ryan told reporter on thursday that he had faith in conaway i am confident that he will oversee a professional investigation into russias action and follow the fact wherever they may lead ryan said
Title_Text: house russia probe put spotlight on lowprofile lawmaker

Text: mexico city reuters  panama ha agreed to extradite a former state governor from mexico s ruling institutional revolutionary party pri who is wanted in his homeland on corruption charge the two country said on monday roberto borge who from to wa governor of the state of quintana roo home to the tourist resort cancun wa detained in panama city airport in june with the aid of interpol a he wa preparing to board a flight to paris corruption promise to be one of the major issue in mexico s july presidential election with public discontent widespread over a spate of conflictofinterest row that have dogged the cabinet and president enrique pena nieto himself the law bar mexican president from seeking reelection mexican prosecutor accuse borge of using fund obtained illegally embezzlement and abuse of public office the mexican foreign ministry and the attorney general s office said in a statement panama s foreign ministry had notified borge that the extradition wa going ahead panama s foreign ministry said in a separate statement that after being notified borge announced that he would have his lawyer appeal against the extradition the ministry did not give detail of how the mexican aimed to justify his appeal borge had long been accused of corruption by opposition party although he ha denied the allegation other former pri governor are also facing prosecution in the runup to next year s presidential contest javier duarte who governed the mexican state of veracruz for the pri until last year wa extradited from guatemala to mexico on july he is accused of embezzlement and engaging in organized crime
Title_Text: panama authorizes extradition of former mexican governor on corruption charge

Text: washington reuters  member of the house judiciary committee are considering filing a friend of the court brief in apple incs aaplo encryption dispute with the u government to argue that the case should be decided by congress and not the court five source familiar with the matter said the source cautioned that no final agreement had been reached on what would be an unusual intervention by congressman in a legal proceeding any filing would occur after a panel hearing on tuesday that will include fbi director james comey and apple general counsel bruce sewell the court deadline is thursday the filing would argue that the feb order from a federal court in california that instructs apple to write special software to unlock an iphone c used by one of the san bernardino shooter threatens the constitutional separation of power the source said they said the brief would come from individual committee member of both republican and democratic party but not the judiciary committee itself reuters could not determine which member were likely to be included lawmaker could wait until the appeal process before intervening the source said apple last week formally opposed the order in court calling the case unprecedented and a violation of free speech right that would override the will of congress on monday a judge in a related new york case sided with apple in agreeing that the court did not have the authority to order apple to unlock a phone the san bernardino case ha come to represent a broader debate over how much authority law enforcement should have to compel company to assist in monitoring digital communication the encryption debate doe not divide along party line with liberal democrat and libertarianleaning republican both supporting apples stance many prolaw enforcement lawmaker of both party and republican presidential frontrunner donald trump support the governments position the unusual congressional intervention would come on top of a wave of support for apple among it silicon valley brother some twodozen company and civil liberty group are expected to weigh in on apples side relative of some of the shooting victim are planning to back the governments case said their lawyer stephen larson the federal bureau of investigation earlier this month sought and obtained a court order requiring that apple write new software and take other step to unlock an iphone c that wa used by rizwan farook who along with his wife went on a shooting rampage on dec in san bernardino that killed and wounded the government ha said the attack wa inspired by islamist militant and the fbi want to read data from the phone to investigate any link the couple might have had with militant group apple is concerned that the order would lead to endless similar request in the u and overseas and ultimately undermine the security of all apple phone a number of large tech firm have publicly said they will file brief supporting apple google facebook and microsoft are expected to file jointly and be represented by neal katyal a georgetown law professor and former acting u solicitor general for the obama administration according to a source familiar with the companies plan amazon linkedin twitter the mozilla foundation and the cloud storage firm box along with advocacy group including the electronic frontier foundation and the center for democracy and technology are also expected to support apple still some major company including ibm are expected to sit out the fight telecom carrier have also been notably reluctant to get involved verizon is unlikely to file a friend of the court brief despite comment from it ceo that the company support encryption with no backdoor source familiar with the matter said a justice department spokeswoman declined comment on sunday about what other brief were expected apples highprofile standoff with the u government is being played out a many of the obama administrations most senior official are traveling to san francisco this week to attend the worlds largest cyber security conference u attorney general loretta lynch national security director michael rogers and defense secretary ash carter are all scheduled to speak at rsa conference where the iphone fight and encryption more broadly are expected to dominate conversation
Title_Text: judicial panel member consider legal brief in apple case source

Text: united nation reuters  u secretary of state rex tillerson on friday urged north korea to carry out a sustained cessation of weapon testing to allow the two country to hold talk about pyongyang s nuclear and missile program tillerson s remark were a retreat from his position earlier this week when he offered to begin direct talk with north korea without precondition backing away from a key u demand that pyongyang must first accept that giving up it nuclear arsenal would be part of any negotiation but the white house distanced itself from those remark by tillerson and said now is not the time for negotiation north korea must earn it way back to the table the pressure campaign must and will continue until denuclearization is achieved tillerson told a meeting of the united nation security council on north korea s weapon program he did not specify how long the lull should last he told reporter after the meeting that the united state would not accept any precondition for talk with north korea tillerson had raised hope this week that the united state and north korea could negotiate to resolve their standoff when he said that the united state wa ready to talk any time north korea would like to talk north korea s ambassador to the united nation on friday made no mention of tillerson s call for a halt to testing when he addressed the same un meeting ambassador ja song nam said his country would not pose a threat to any state a long a it interest were not infringed upon he described the security council session a a desperate measure plotted by the united state being terrified by the incredible might of our republic that ha successfully achieved the great historic cause of completing the state nuclear force north korea ha made clear it ha little interest in negotiation with the united state until it ha developed the ability to hit the u mainland with a nucleartipped missile something most expert say it ha yet to prove north korea conducted missile test at a steady pace since april then paused in september after firing a rocket that passed over japan s hokkaido island but it renewed test in november when it fired a new type of intercontinental ballistic missile the hwasong which flew higher and further than previous test japanese foreign minister taro kono told the security council that north korea wa nowhere near ready to abandon it nuclear and missile program and wa not interested in a meaningful dialogue he said any lull in missile test did not mean that north korea wa sitting idly the latest launch wa conducted day after north korea s provocation in september some optimistic view labeled day of silence a a positive signal however the missile launch in november made it clear that north korea wa continuing to relentlessly develop it nuclear and missile program even while they were seemingly silent kono said tillerson also urged china and russia on friday to increase pressure on north korea by going beyond the implementation of un sanction but the two country were wary of the idea china s deputy un ambassador wu haitao said all party must implement un sanction but said that unilateral sanction undermine the unity of the security council and hurt the legitimate right and interest of other country and should therefore be abandoned russian un ambassador vassily nebenzia said moscow wa committed to implementing un sanction on north korea and echoed china s concern about unilateral sanction u president donald trump want china north korea s main ally and trading partner to impose an oil embargo on pyongyang over and above beijing s adherence to un sanction the security council ha ratcheted up sanction on north korea over it weapon program since un secretarygeneral antonio guterres told the security council on friday it wa time to immediately reestablish and strengthen communication channel with north korea including interkorean and militarytomilitary channel to reduce the risk of a misunderstanding escalating into conflict
Title_Text: tillerson urge long halt to north korea weapon test before any talk

Text: kuala lumpur reuters  two woman accused of murdering the estranged halfbrother of north korean leader kim jong un with a banned nerve agent pleaded not guilty at the start of a highprofile murder trial in a malaysian court on monday indonesian siti aisyah and doan thi huong a vietnamese are charged with killing kim jong nam by smearing his face with vx a chemical poison banned by the united nation at kuala lumpur airport on feb both woman wore bulletproof vest a they were led into the court on the outskirt of the malaysian capital they face the death penalty if convicted police have also named four north korean a suspect in the case and an interpol red notice an international alert just short of an arrest warrant ha been issued for the north korean who remain at large defence lawyer demanded that the prosecution immediately name the four other suspect who have also been charged so they can prepare their case the charge must be clear said siti aisyah s lawyer gooi soon seng judge azmi ariffin dismissed their request the two woman nodded their head when the charge were read out by two interpreter they pleaded not guilty the prosecution said the woman s action showed intent to kill the victim by smearing his face and eye with vx nerve agent which a malaysian postmortem confirmed had killed kim the woman told their lawyer they did not know they were participating in a deadly attack and believed they were carrying out a prank for a reality tv show the prank practice carried out by the first and second accused with the supervision of the four who are still at large wa preparation to see through their common intention to kill the victim lead prosecutor muhamad iskandar ahmad said in his opening statement the two woman sat quietly in the packed courtroom siti wa dressed in a black floral suit while huong wore a white longsleeved tshirt and jean juliana idris who work at the airport told the court a man later identified a kim jong nam approached her and asked her to take him to a police station she said the man who spoke english told her he had been attacked by a woman from behind another one closed his eye his hand were shaking a bit i don t know why she said police lance corporal mohd zulkarnain sanudin who wa on duty at the airport said juliana had brought kim jong nam to him he said kim told him a substance had been wiped on his face kim s eye were red and he could see some liquid on his face zulkarnain said he also said the he had wrongly recorded kim jong nam s nationality a south korean the police report i made showed the nationality a south korean while on the passport it wa written dpr korea whereby i did not know what dpr meant i wa only sure that korea wa south korea he told the court dprk are the initial for north korea s official name the democratic republic of north korea other witness described how kim jong nam had seizure at the clinic  his eye rolled upwards and there wa drooling of saliva and mucus rabiatul adawiyah mohd sofi a medical assistant said kim jong nam wa at the clinic for just over an hour and moved to a hospital by the time they arrived at the hospital emergency ward they could not get a blood pressure reading she said there wa a high probability that there wa either a problem with our monitor or the patient had died said rabiatul the case continues on tuesday
Title_Text: two woman deny murdering north korean leader halfbrother

Text: reuters  a u federal judge in virginia ruled on friday that president donald trumps travel ban wa justified increasing the likelihood the measure will go before the supreme court a the decision took an opposing view to court in maryland and hawaii that have halted the order u district court judge anthony trenga rejected argument by muslim plaintiff who claimed trumps march executive order temporarily banning the entry of all refugee and traveler from six muslimmajority country wa discriminatory the decision went against two previous court ruling that put an emergency halt to the order before it wa set to take effect on march the order remains halted trump ha said he plan to appeal those unfavorable ruling to the u supreme court if needed and differing opinion by lower court give more ground for the highest court to take up the case trenga an appointee of republican president george w bush said the complaint backed by the council on americanislamic relation cair a muslim civil right group found that more than individual who brought the suit had been able to show they were harmed by the travel ban since they might be unable to reunite with their relative but he also ruled that trumps revised order which replaced a more sweeping version signed on jan and rejected by court fell within the presidents authority to make decision about immigration he said that since the order did not mention religion the court could not look behind it at trumps statement about a muslim ban to determine what wa in the drafters heart of hearts trump ha said the ban is necessary to protect the country from terrorist attack but his first order wa halted by a federal judge in seattle and a u appeal court in san francisco due to concern it violated the u constitutions prohibition against religious bias were confident that the presidents fully lawful and necessary action will ultimately be allowed to move forward through the rest of the court systems said white house press secretary sean spicer at a briefing cair said it would appeal the decision to the th u circuit court of appeal lena masri cairs national litigation director said the th circuit and the supreme court are the judicial body that will ultimately decide whether the constitution protects the right of muslim americans a ruling by u district judge derrick watson in hawaii  an appointee of democratic president barack obama  put a stop to the two central section of the revised ban that blocked traveler from six country and refugee while leaving other part of the order in place u district judge theodore chuang in maryland also an obama appointee only put a halt to the section on traveler the virginia lawsuit sought to strike down the revised ban in it entirety watson scheduled a hearing for wednesday to decide whether his temporary order blocking the travel and refugee restriction should be converted into a more formal preliminary injunction the justice department ha said it would oppose that bid the government ha appealed chuangs decision in maryland also to the th circuit and a hearing in that case is scheduled for may other lawsuit against the ban continue to move forward around the country also on friday the southern poverty law center and other group filed a new complaint in u district court in washington dc on behalf of muslim community organization
Title_Text: virginia court rule for trump in travel ban dispute order still halted

Text: washington reuters  the u military said on monday it commander in iraq were urging iraqi and kurdish force to avoid escalation and played down report of fighting after iraqi government force responded to a kurdish vote on independence by capturing the kurdishheld city of kirkuk pentagon spokesman colonel robert manning declined to speculate on whether the united state might cut off military aid and training to iraqi force in the event a major conflict saying i m not going to speculate on that but i will tell you that we re looking at all option for planning consideration we encourage dialogue
Title_Text: u military in iraq urge iraqi kurd to avoid escalation

Text: san francisco reuters  five year ago oklahoma attorney general scott pruitt now president donald trumps nominee for administrator of the environmental protection agency sat in the front row a the u supreme court debated the contentious affordable care act he wa part of a coalition of republican attorney general fighting president barack obamas health law  better known a obamacare  based on a core party principle that states right trump federal power and that program like obamacare represent a radical overreach by the federal government now a trump look to undo obamas legacy and begin constructing his own pruitt and other administration republican are showing little interest in protecting states right instead they are embracing sweeping new environmental healthcare and immigration policy that are to be imposed on all state at the same time democrat who over the last halfcentury have zealously defended sacrosanct federal law  such a the civil right act of that tackled segregation  against argument that state should be allowed to chart their own way are now making plan to employ some of those very states right position to fend off trump administration policy they disagree with if epa nominee pruitt is going to argue state can go their own way then certainly we should be allowed to make the exact same argument hawaii attorney general douglas chin a democrat who opposes pruitts nomination told reuters pruitts office did not return repeated request for comment sprawling flipflop the two parties switching of side is evident across a range of issue including socalled sanctuary city the environment and healthcare sanctuary city  an unofficial description of place where local law enforcement refuse to report undocumented immigrant to federal authority  could be an early test a trump move to beef up federal immigration policy trump threatened to cut federal fund for such city on wednesday a part of an executive order clamping down on immigration lawyer planning to challenge that action told reuters they will base part of their legal argument on one successful approach pruitt and his fellow attorney general took against obamacare in the supreme court in in that case the court held that federal authority could not take away a states medicaid funding for refusing to expand the program although they won that part of the case pruitt and his group failed to stop the national rollout of obamacare immigration advocate hope the logic employed by the supreme court in that case will protect sanctuary city against threatened funding cut however ken cuccinelli the former republican attorney general of virginia who launched the legal challenge to obamacare told reuters he doubt court will apply that ruling to protect sanctuary city still cuccinelli said the new political dynamic will expose republican politician who ran for office on a states right platform because it fit their policy agenda rather than because they were true believer we may find out which folk were doing it for legal reason and purely political reasons he said another early battle highlighting the reversal of position on states versus federal right is likely to be the environment california a it governor made clear in a speech on tuesday will fight any attempt to rein in the states sweeping environmental law which go far beyond federal mandate during his confirmation hearing pruitt on the other hand refused to commit to keeping a decadesold federal waiver that allows california to set stricter emission standard the debate over how power should be shared between state and the federal government go back to the founding of the united state when federalist led by john adam and alexander hamilton argued for a strong central government while thomas jeffersons democraticrepublican party saw states right a a necessary check against tyranny jeffersons faction eventually morphed into the democratic party which backed states right to allow slavery leading up to the civil war of  the democrat moved toward greater reliance on federal power in the th century a they fought battle over civil right and regulating industry since then the two party have been fairly consistent in their stance though on some issue they have occasionally swapped position tension between states right and federal power played out time and again during obamas presidency with states right supporter achieving a mixed record republicanled state challenged obamas clean power plan a an example of federal overreach in a case that is continuing republican state attorney general including pruitt successfully blocked an obama executive order allowing work permit for million of undocumented immigrant known a expanded daca the fifth u circuit court of appeal ultimately struck down the expanded daca policy and an evenly divided u supreme court let that ruling stand last year harold koh a yale law school professor and a former adviser to trumps presidential challenger hillary clinton said that even though he disagreed with the courts reasoning in that case it could now be used to at least slow down new trump executive order on immigration and beyond the argument against daca could come back to haunt them koh said embracing states right could also end up haunting progressive group during the next democratic administration whenever that might be said julia wilson chief executive of legal aid organization onejustice that is exactly whats under conversation right now in the community she said
Title_Text: in trump era democrat and republican switch side on state right

Text: washington reuters  the white houses budget plan for the u department of energy includes  million for nuclear waste program including the restart of licensing for nevadas yucca mountain a project stalled for year by lawsuit and local opposition the move signal that president donald trump may consider that nuclear waste solution could extend the life of existing u nuclear power plant and speed up innovation in next generation nuclear plant that backer say are safer than previous reactor congress will debate the budget and it is uncertain whether fund for waste will remain in the plan while yucca mountain would store waste on a practically permanent basis the budget money would also support program for storing waste at interim site before yucca open these investment would accelerate progress on fulfilling the federal governments obligation to address nuclear waste enhance national security and reduce future taxpayer burden according to a summary of the budget yucca ha been studied by the u government since the s a a potential repository for the nations radioactive waste and billion of dollar have been spent on it but yucca ha never opened because of legal challenge and widespread opposition from local politician environmentalist and native american group in thenpresident barack obama withdrew the license to store waste at yucca amid opposition from thensenate majority leader harry reid a fellow democrat from nevada maria korsnick the head of the nuclear energy institute industry group said the industry wa encouraged by the plan for waste project but that nuclear energy innovator were nervous about cut to program that have supported publicprivate partnership to bring new nuclear technology to market the budget eliminates funding for the advanced research project agency for energy and an innovative technology loan guarantee program that have been popular with both democrat and many republican trumps energy secretary rick perry told lawmaker at his confirmation hearing that restarting the yucca mountain project could not be ruled out but that he would collaborate with state i am very aware that this is an issue this country ha been flummoxed by for year we have spent billion of dollar on this issue perry told the hearing in january ill work closely with you and the member of this committee to find the answer to this issue the white house proposal for the department of energy budget call for an overall cut of percent
Title_Text: white house proposes reviving yucca mountain nuclear waste site

Text: paris reuters  a french prosecutor said on sunday that a man arrested last week after a police raid on a flat near paris had a direct connection with islamic state police discovered a stash of explosive in the raid last wednesday in villejuif south of paris and found tatp a product often used by suicide bomber a second cache of explosive material wa discovered in a nearby town the following day two men who were arrested were put into formal investigation on sunday and placed in detention the paris prosecutor francois molins told a news conference a third suspect wa released with no charge analysis from the material seized showed one of the suspect had been in direct contact in august with rachid kassim via facebook molins said kassim believed to be a senior islamic state militant wa targeted by the u military in a strike near the city of mosul iraq earlier this year tatp ha been used by militant in several attack in western europe in recent year including manchester in may brussels in and paris in more than people have been killed by islamistinspired attacker in the past three year in france which along with the united state and other country are bombing islamic state base in iraq and syria
Title_Text: prosecutor link suspect arrested last week near paris to isi

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump on wednesday backed away from a bipartisan deal on healthcare reached by two senator a day earlier saying he could never support legislation bailing out insurance company on tuesday trump appeared to embrace the deal struck by republican senator lamar alexander and democratic senator patty murray a a shortterm solution so that we dont have this very dangerous little period apparently referring to possible premium spike in the wake of his recent decision to cut off subsidy payment to insurance company but in a tweet on wednesday he took a different tack on the bill which would continue the costsharing subsidy that lower premium for lowerincome american writing i am supportive of lamar a a person also of the process but i can never support bailing out in cos who have made a fortune w ocare
Title_Text: trump back away from bipartisan senate healthcare bill

Text: nfl player were pretty much all over the place with what they decided to do to protest today see list below some player gave the black power salute while others decided to continue kneeling many team decided to kneel before the anthem and then lock arm while standing during the anthemthe fewest player raised a fist with the black power salute they stood out like a sore thumbthe kneeling is still ridiculous even though it s now mostly before the anthemdaily mail reportedthe entire new orleans saint roster briefly took a collective knee prior to the anthem in what quarterback drew brees had called a way to show respect to all the team then stood and many linked armsa handful of buffalo bill player could be seen kneeling for the anthem ahead of their game against the atlanta falconstwo detroit lion player also took to one knee for the anthem before the game against the minnesota viking in minneapolis roughly half the san francisco er took a knee prior to their game against the arizona cardinalsis it too much to ask is it too much to ask for these player to just stand with hand over heart for our national anthem do they even have a clue about how this idiotic protest began kaepernick knelt in support of domestic terror group black life matter and against our law enforcement it ha now morphed into a salute to eternal victimhood and a protest against president trump of course the democrat have jumped on the bandwagon to interpret trump calling all the player son of bitch into a racist word it s sickening to see that an out of work mediocre football quarterback ha caused such a stink for the sinking nfl too bad fan are dropping like fly kaepernick wa seen wearing a tshirt that perfectly describes his effort to be a victim like he want all black to be me against the world lolhere is a list of player and team that protested during the national anthemsaints v dolphinsthe entire new orleans saint team took a knee in solidarity before the national anthem played at wembley stadium in london the player stood in unison for the playing of the anthemkenny still michael thomas and julius thomas of the miami dolphin took a knee during the performancesteelers v ravensthe raven took a knee before the national anthem and were booed by fan no steelers or raven player took a knee during the anthemtitans v texanstexans player linked arm during the national anthem but all stood togetherrishard matthew of the titan remained in the locker room rather than stand with his teammate during the anthempanthers v patriotsthe patriot stood at the sideline at attention several minute before the national anthem and then put their hand over their heart and each otherlions v vikingsjalen reevesmaybin and steve longa kneeled during the national anthem all other detroit player locked armsjaguars v jetsthe jet locked arm for the national anthem no player kneeled every jaguar player took a knee before the playing of the national anthem but stood during the songbills v falconskaelin clay cedric thornton mike tolbert shareece wright taiwan jones and jerel worthy were the bill player who knelt during the national anthem the rest of the player stood with their arm lockedlast week grady jarrett and dontari poe took a knee during the national anthem but stood during this week no falcon player were kneeling during the national anthem most of them on the sideline linked armsrams v cowboysall ram and cowboy player stood during the national anthem dallas remains one of six team not to kneel sit or raise a fist during the national anthem ram outside linebacker robert quinn raised his fist cowboy defensive end damontre moore raised his fist a the anthem endeders v cardinalshalf of the er team kneeled with general manager john lynch and ceo jed york during the national anthem the team issued the following statement after the demonstrationread more si

Text: updatethe listing ha been removed and zimmerman almost assuredly feel like a victimgeorge zimmerman is terrible a habitual woman abuser and child killerturnedterriblepainter the man who sparked Text: tripoli reuters  france s foreign minister jean yves le drian wa in libya on monday to meet rival political leader and offer support for a deal aimed at stabilizing the strifetorn north african country libyan prime minister fayez alseraj and the divided nation s eastern commander khalifa haftar signed an agreement in paris in july committing them to a conditional ceasefire and to work toward election in the deal did not include other key faction western government worried about islamist militant and smuggler thriving in libya s chaos are pushing a broader unbacked deal to unify libya and end the instability that ha weakened the country since the fall of muammar gaddafi in tripoli le drian met seraj and planned to hold talk with abdulrahman swehli a politician connected to some of haftar s rival who head a parliamentary council in the capital libyan official said le drian wa also to visit misrata swehli s home city and a base of opposition to haftar before heading to benghazi to meet haftar and to tobruk to meet the head of an easternbased parliament aligned with him the minister want to consolidate this agreement by getting the party not invited in july to support it said a french diplomatic source he want to ensure that everyone is playing the game and lay the groundwork for election the french minister s visit is in line with president emmanuel macron s push for a deeper french role in bringing libyan faction together in the hope of countering militant violence and easing europe s migrant crisis our objective is the stabilization of libya in the interest of the libyan themselves le drian said in a statement in tripoli a united libya equipped with functioning institution is the condition for avoiding the terrorist threat in the long term he said the paris deal wa meant to support the unbacked accord for a government of national unity le drian met un special envoy ghassan salame on sunday the french diplomatic source said the visit would fit into effort by salame to announce a road map to election during the coming un general assembly seraj and haftar clearly want to measure themselves in election the source said libya would likely need to agree on a new constitution or electoral law before election which will be a difficult task for the country s divided institution organizing poll would also involve big logistical and security challenge past western attempt to broker agreement have often fallen victim to political infighting among rival faction and armed brigade vying for power in the opec oil producer seraj s government ha struggled to impose control and it presidential council is divided haftar ha refused to accept it legitimacy he ha been gaining ground backed by ally egypt and united arab emirate the ceasefire between nonterrorist element is in general respected the french diplomatic source said haftar s advance are accompanied by a strengthening of seraj in the west so it s creating a fragile balance that encourages a compromise
Title_Text: french foreign minister in libya to push peace deal

Text: tripoli reuters  libya s europeanbacked coast guard on saturday turned back more than migrant trying to reach italy by boat amid it heightened effort to block such crossing of the mediterranean the migrant packed into a single rubber boat were intercepted off the coast between the town of al khoms and garabulli east of tripoli after traveling through the night the boat wa close to an italian coast guard ship patrolling in international water when they were cut off and taken aboard a libyan vessel dashing their hope of reaching europe the rubber boat wa being rocked by heavy wave and the motor had cut out we were shouting they are blocking u they are blocking u we were cry pleading for help said patrice emani a yearold from mali he said he wa making his second attempted crossing from libya he wa detained in the western libyan city of zawiya earlier in the year but his family paid for him to be released the captain of the libyan ship that returned the migrant to tripoli port colonel abdelhamid adengouz said they had been rescued from drowning in rough condition with cooperation from italy the migrant were saved from death he said there wa an italian ship present that helped u a large majority of migrant traveling to europe by sea depart from western libya where people smuggling ha flourished amid lawlessness and a collapsing economy but there ha been a sharp drop in departure since july due to armed faction preventing boat from leaving part of the coast and increased activity from libyan coast guard unit which have received training and technical support from italy and the european union human right group have criticized european policy saying no migrant should be returned to a country where they face widespread abuse after migrant are brought back to libya they are registered by international agency before being taken to overcrowded detention center some are offered the chance to return home while others languish in detention or seek a way out most of those intercepted on saturday were from west african country including mali guinea and nigeria and some were from bangladesh all but one were male they said they had paid between and libyan dinar  at unofficial market rate to make the crossing i suffered a lot  kidnapping demand for ransom said christopher daniel a yearold nigerian they blindfolded me and forced me to give them money he said of a period he spent in captivity in the southern city of sabha last year i don t know what to say or do all the money i have wasted  what will i tell my parent
Title_Text: bolstered libyan coast guard intercept packed migrant boat

Text: oklahoma state university student sherene zarrabi love fashion she is so fond of it in fact that she found a job working at a clothing store called danity hooligan while she went to school but now her beloved job is a thing of the past and it is all because of one extremely nasty bos a bodyshaming email and the young woman s respect for herselfwhile she worked at danity hooligan she also ran the store s instagram page during her down time at work she would try on some of the store s clothes snap a picture and post it on the social medium website a a form of advertisinghigh bun and combat boot are my new thing and apparently mirror selfies are my new thing also fallfashion combatboots highbun selfiea photo posted by sherene zarrabi sherenemarie on nov at pm pstwhen i m bored at work i take shameless mirror pic to show off my extra comfy outfit fall clothes make me so happy fallfashion ootda photo posted by sherene zarrabi sherenemarie on nov at am pstyou d think her bos would be thrilled rightapparently not so much instead of rewarding her for the time and effort she put into the business her bos sent an email to the store manager complaining that sherene didn t have a model figurethe email read something i want to make sure you keep in mind i want size small the stereotypical model type to model our clothes please use our picture of our model if stillwater can t find someone who would be considered model material this is not to put anyone down but to communicate the expectation of presenting our branddon t take it personal all i ask is for really good representation in exchange for the freedom i ask you to take down all picture of anyone that doesn t fit the criterion don t take it personal reallyfirst of all this young lady is a beautiful woman and she looked amazing in those clothes this vile human being wa lucky to have such a lovely girl in their clothingsecondly no woman should ever be made to feel a if they are not good enough no matter what size they are body shaming is disgusting and ha no place in our societyfortunately sharene gave zero fcks what her bos thought of her and she responded by promptly quitting and writing the following statement on facebookthis is an email i wa forwarded earlier i just want to start by saying this i am fully comfortable with who i am and the way i look i have recently been attacked and discriminated against by the owner of dainty hooligan she went on our store instagram and deleted all of the picture where i wa modeling the clothing and then sent this email to my manager i do not want to respresent or support a business that ha such archaic value and belief this is the reason young girl have body image issue this is disgusting i quit immediately and i suggest that my friend and family do not support dainty hooligan love yourself no matter what you look likebravoshe is exactly right and the best response to that horrible email wa removing herself from such a toxic environment frankly if the store owner doe not respect all woman they have no business selling clothes to u woman have enough issue with body image a it is we really don t need someone else shaming u Text: you might ve noticed that donald trump didn t really care for president obama s final state of the union address during the address the billionaire twitter troll noted the followingthe sotu speech is really boring slow lethargic very hard to watch donald j trump realdonaldtrump january see first of all state of the union address aren t supposed to be like president camacho s speech in idiocracy in fact they re not supposed to be like literally any of trump s nonsensical liefilled streamofconsciousness pander showsalso trump s talking about obama here arguably the greatest political orator in modern historybut here s another explanation for trump s ridiculous tweet hour earlier trump held another one of his spokenword performance art piece in which he satirizes a hackish frivolously conducted presidential campaign wait correction he s not satirizing anyone on purpose during the address trump got a taste of his own medicine by a pair of comedian who infiltrated the auditorium and hectored trump from the crowdin addition to pretending to support trump jason selvig and davram stiefler began to get restless eventually shouting boring and we re bored we came here to be entertained at the presumptive republican nominee naturally trump can dish it out but he can t take it so reacting to the comedian trump gestured to his security and muttered get em outta here if only we could do the same to trumpso like so many others before him the comedian were escorted out of the room of course this brings up yet another example of trump being incapable of personally dealing with someone he doesn t like while simultaneously expecting u to believe he can stand up to putin and isisfrankly after obama pledged to lead an effort to cure cancer i m shocked trump didn t come out against curing canceryoutube httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvrdmlcfuwwhfeatured image via video screen grab

Text: san francisco reuters  california filed a lawsuit on wednesday over the trump administrations plan to construct a wall along the border with mexico adding to the obstacle facing one of the republican presidents key campaign promise president donald trump ha insisted mexico would pay for building the wall which expert said could cost about  billion and take more than three year to complete with mexico refusing to pay trump ha said since taking office in january that the wall will initially need u funding but that he will find a way to make mexico ultimately pay for it democrat in the u congress however firmly oppose the border wall and at least some democratic senator would need to vote for it inclusion in a spending package democratic attorney general including californias xavier becerra have sued the trump administration on a range of issue the border wall lawsuit filed in a san diego federal court alleges that trumps wall violates federal environmental standard a well a constitutional provision regarding the separation of power and states right representative for the u justice department declined to immediately comment on the case the lawsuit asks a judge to stop the administration from building the wall until it demonstrates compliance with environmental law and issue an order that the department of homeland security cannot waive any federal guideline in order to facilitate the project last month the trump administration said it had selected four construction company to build concrete prototype for a wall which will be will be foot meter tall and about foot wide and will be tested in san diego
Title_Text: california sue trump administration over border wall

Text: washington reuters  for month republican presidential candidate traded insult such a dummy jerk and loser then party frontrunner donald trump repeated a supporters description of ted cruz a a pussy with the contest for the partys nomination moving into south carolina and the stake rising it is possible the most disparaging discourse of the nov election campaign is yet to come the epithet may be characteristic of schoolyard bully but there is some evidence that candidate are reveling in the attention they draw the harshest attack elicit the biggest response at rally on the internet and on cable tv trump the billionaire former reality tv star sent a new hampshire rally into a frenzy on monday when he repeated the term pussy shouted by a person in the crowd effectively questioning cruzs manliness trump went on to win the states primary the next day ahead of the thirdplace cruz by a to margin its one of the reason i won you have to be yourself trump said in a television interview on nbcs today show trump later promised to clean up his foul language and to be more presidential history suggests the language could turn even more coarse in the runup to next saturdays republican nominating contest in south carolina it wa there that u senator john mccain of arizona wa accused in of fathering an illegitimate africanamerican child and former massachusetts governor mitt romney in of supporting polygamy these adult are acting like elementary children leslie mcrobbie a former fifthgrade schoolteacher from new hampshire said of this years republican contender president barack obama a democrat this week spoke of the snark that characterized a republican race of the past when he recalled that ronald reagan wa described by rival a an unshapely man and a yahoo before his election a president in coming off the first nominating contest in iowa and new hampshire the seven remaining candidate for the republican nomination are under pressure either to break away from the crowd or prevent others from doing so insult can foster that former florida governor jeb bush mocked more than once by trump a a lowenergy candidate ha since retaliated by tweeting that trump wa not just a loser but also a liar and a whiner the putdown wa retweeted nearly time and liked by more than user cruz responding to trumps decision to skip a fox newshosted republican debate branded his rival ducking donald and sponsored a special edition filter on picturesharing app snapchat that featured a blondhaired duck with an exaggerated pout meant to represent the realestate mogul when we create so much of the modern campaign around the character that are running and not on the subject the natural byproduct of that is calling people names said political scientist michael artime artime said that while bickering and namecalling have always existed in election this cycle ha seen a notable uptick in the negative in the past if somebody wouldve said what trump said the other night that would have been a very damaging thing to their campaign artime said the kind of politics we get is kind of the politics we deserve he said while many have gleefully or indifferently watched a candidate hurled barb after barb others have condemned it bullying can be highly instrumental and used for social climbing said bob faris associate professor of sociology at university of californiadavis who study aggressive behavior in adolescent and it works he said provided that kid target the right kids for trump perhaps the most blustery of the candidate the target is constantly changing his number remaining constant in the opinion poll while he assails rival for being stupid weak and pathetic he doe look like a bully faris said donald is a whole new development i cant think of a candidate like him presidential historian mike purdy however cite a precedent in the late republican president theodore roosevelt roosevelt loved more than anything else to be the center of attention and he had a huge huge ego purdy said they both have a certain amount of ego they both have trouble controlling their mouths purdy said likening roosevelt to trump purdy said roosevelt called his onetime ally william howard taft a fathead during the presidential campaign and went on to say thenrival taft seeking reelection at the time had the brains of a guinea pig neither won the race purdy noted the attack also came at the expense of substantive political discourse theyre incredibly personal attack and theyre not just attack just on somebodys position theyre attack about personal characteristics he said that is part of the civility i think we need to recapture on friday trump suggested he agreed i do this for effect trump said of his foul language in an interview with wor radio in new york as we get closer you will be shocked at how presidential i will be you will be very proud of me editing by richard valdmanis and howard goller sap is the sponsor of this content it wa independently created by reuters editorial staff and funded in part by sap which otherwise ha no role in this coverage
Title_Text: loser jerk insult fly on republican campaign trail

Text: manila reuters  the philippine ha suspended trade relation with north korea to comply with a un security council resolution over it repeated missile test manila s foreign minister said on friday the united state and other western country have asked the united nation to consider tough new sanction on north korea after it test last week that it said wa of an advanced hydrogen bomb we can say we have suspended trade relation with north korea foreign minister alan peter cayetano told reporter after a meeting with the u ambassador on cooperation on an antidrugs program we will fully comply with unsc resolution including the economic sanction tension on the korean peninsula ha escalated a north korea s young leader kim jong un ha stepped up the development of weapon in defiance of un sanction it ha tested a series of missile this year including one that flew over japan and conducted it sixth and biggest nuclear test on sunday the philippine is north korea s fifthlargest trade partner with bilateral trade from january to june this year worth  million according to the staterun korea tradeinvestment promotion agency on an annual basis north korea imported  million of product from the philippine in an increase of percent from the previous year while manila s import from pyongyang surged percent to  million according to the philippine department of trade and industry dti the main export to north korea in were computer integrated circuited board banana and woman s undergarment the un security council is quite clear cayetano said part of these are the economic sanction and the philippine will comply we have been communicating with the dti secretary and i think it wa yesterday and the other day we have gotten direction from the presidential palace to support the un security council cayetano said the trade ban covered raw computer chip from the philippine
Title_Text: philippine suspends trade with north korea to comply with un resolution

officer brentley vinson in the september shooting death of a man in university city district attorney andrew murray announced wednesdaykeith lamont scott wa shot sept in a confrontation with officer scott wa unarmed initial report from a family member on facebook said he wa holding a book were untrue a reading book wa not found in the front or back seat of mr scott s suv murray saidofficer vinson s gun wa examined after the shooting and four bullet were missing murray said gun taken from the other officer at the scene had not been fired he saidpeople who claimed on social medium that they had Text: washington reuters  north korea would need to clear many condition before a meeting between president donald trump and north korean leader kim jong un could be contemplated the white house said on monday after trump told bloomberg news he would be honored to meet with kim white house spokesman sean spicer told reporter the united state would need to see north koreas provocative behavior ratcheted down immediately clearly condition are not there right now spicer said
Title_Text: north korea would have to clear many condition before trump meeting possible white house

Text: sydney reuters  australia will end air strike against islamic state in iraq and syria and bring it six super hornet plane home after three year a part of the usled coalition in the middle east defence minister marise payne said on friday she told a medium conference the decision wa made following the iraqi declaration of victory over islamic state following discussion with iraq and with member of the international coalition the australian government ha determined that we will bring home our six super hornet strike aircraft from the middle east payne told reporter it ha been long it ha been arduous it ha been brutal all of our personnel made an extraordinary contribution australia ha been in the middle east a part of the usled effort against islamic state since payne said other australian operation in the region would continue with personnel who are part of the special operation task group in iraq including australian special force continuing their deployment australian soldier have also been training iraqi troop at the taji military base outside baghdad
Title_Text: australia to end air strike in iraq and syria bring super hornet home

Text: donald trump recently went after the gun nut vote in a hard way when he declared during the national rifle association s annual meeting on friday that he a president would get rid of gunfree zone of course trump didn t mention during his pandering that many of the property that he owns could be described a gunfree zone he also just backtracked on the issue to a large degree day after the meetingan official with the trump organization told abc news that there are no restriction on licensed individual carrying in our hotel or golf club that statement turn out to be completely false here is a rundown of property that abc news discovered that do in fact have restriction on carrying gun maralago trump s posh florida club doesn t allow gun a hotel staff member told abc newstrump national doral in miami florida doesn t allow gun either a security official told abc news the resort would much rather not have gun on the property said a security official with the hotel who noted that gun are not to be carried on our property we ve had guest that have brought them before he said but those gun had to remain in their safe the whole time in the room a security worker at trump national in jupiter florida said no when asked if gun were allowed on premise by citizen who are licensed to carry them asked about exception for people like offduty cop the staff member directed abc news to a supervisor who said the hotel had no comment at all on gun at the propertytrump international golf club in palm beach county florida also doesn t allow citizen with concealed carry license to bring their gun on the property a golfshop worker told abc news now of course these policy make sense who would want to go to a resort or golf club to relax only to be surrounded by insecure people carrying around firearm the same could be said for any establishment why should the staff or patron at a restaurant or retail store have to deal with the person who just walked in carrying an assault weaponso once again we find a clear disconnect between what trump say and reality maybe trump just want to ban all gun free zone except those that are enacted on premise that primarily serve the wealthy a he ha recently stated in another attempt to pander to the the second amendment is the only amendment that matter crowd trump stated that he think that teacher should be able to carry firearm on school premisesexcept that since he trump he can t even seem to make up his mind on that matter on sunday trump wa questioned about his stance on letting teacher carry firearm during an interview on fox friend that s where he stated that i don t want to have gun in classroom although in some case teacher should have gun in classroom that mean absolutely nothing and is a far cry from what he wa preaching just a few day ago and his pledge he made in january when he said i will get rid of gunfree zone on school you have to and on military base my first day it get signed ok my first day there s no more gunfree zone trump appears to be willing to spout any nra talking point in an attempt to pander to anyone willing to be pandered to in some case doe not in any way mean a blanket throwaway policy like he ha been describing for most of his campaign instead he now offer this ambivalent stance on a topic that impact million of livesfeatured image from photo by scott olsongetty image
Title_Text: trump doesnt want his supporter to know his real stance on gunfree zone

Text: berlin reuters  the bavarian sister party of german chancellor angela merkel s christian democratic union cdu ha said her conservative bloc must agree policy on immigration pension and healthcare before opening coalition negotiation with two other party leader of bavaria s christian social union csu  stung by a drop in support of more than percent in the sept election  have redoubled their push for a per year cap on immigration a demand that merkel ha rejected complicating her effort to form a new government merkel s bloc of the cdu and csu which have worked a partner for decade hung onto their position a the largest group in parliament after a sept vote despite seeing their combined support fall to it lowest since they must find coalition partner to build a government with the most likely path toward a majority being an alliance with the probusiness free democrat fdp and the green csu leader horst seehofer said the conservative ally could not begin negotiating with the other party until they resolved their own position on major issue the sueddeutsche zeitung newspaper reported on monday it quoted the bavarian premier who is fending off call for his own resignation a saying the two party faced their biggest challenge since  when his predecessor franzjosef strauss threatened for week to break up the alliance seehofer whose biggest challenger is bavarian finance minister markus soeder a hardliner on immigration will meet merkel and other top official on sunday with top official in merkel s cdu split on the need for a rightward shift the conflict inside the conservative camp is straining merkel s already difficult task of bringing together party with big difference on energy europe migration and tax armin laschet premier of germany s most populous region north rhinewestphalia told the handelsblatt newspaper that the migrant cap sought by csu leader wa unacceptable but he suggested a compromise could be found that included some ballpark figure laschet also said the green would have to step back from some of their hardline environmentalist demand the cdu s leader in the eastern state of thuringia on monday argued against the rightward shift demanded by the csu and the conservative premier of two state  saxony and saxonyanhalt  where the farright alternative for germany afd party made big gain in sunday s national election our job is to fence ourselves off against the left and the right mike mohring told reuters manfred weber deputy leader of the csu and head of the centerright group in the eu parliament told deutschlandfunk radio it wa important to avoid setting red line before the coalition talk given the urgent need to win back afd voter weber said he expected all mainstream party to focus on preventing the antiimmigrant afd from gaining a permanent foothold in the german parliament he said a threeway coalition among conservative green and the fdp dubbed a jamaica coalition since the party color match those of the black green and yellow jamaican flag offered a chance to build consensus on other issue such a energy and agriculture jamaica offer u a chance to embark on a new start he said the csu is ready to do that merkel ha sought to keep the door open for a renewal of her grand coalition with the social democrat that ha ruled for the past four year but the spd is determined to stay in opposition after suffering it worst result since we got percent of the vote that is not a mandate to govern spd secretary general hubertus heil told broadcaster ard on monday he accused the other party of stalling coalition talk until after a state election due on oct in lower saxony they want to govern now they should govern he said a new poll by the hannoversche allgemeine zeitung newspaper showed the cdu and spd nearly tied in lower saxony with percent and percent respectively
Title_Text: merkels bavarian ally insist on conservative unity before coalition talk

Text: london reuters  british prime minister theresa may forced her most senior minister damian green to resign on wednesday after an internal investigation found he had made misleading comment about pornography on computer in his parliamentary office below are detail about green the investigation into his behavior and may s decision to demand his resignation an ally and a friend from their day at the university of oxford green wa appointed first secretary of state may s defacto deputy in the wake of her snap june election which stripped her party of it parliamentary majority in the tumultuous week after the june vote green helped to stabilize may s premiership and appease some of those within the conservative party who wanted her to quit his departure is a blow for the government a may navigates the final year of tortuous brexit negotiation before britain s exit from the european union in march he is also the third minister to quit in recent week following the departure of the defense minister and the aid minister the departure of green who like may voted in the referendum to stay in the eu also remove one of her most senior advocate of a softer brexit the resignation come a day after may started the delicate process of agreeing a common negotiating position among her cabinet for the longterm relationship britain want to have with the eu after brexit on nov kate maltby an academic critic and family friend wrote an article in the time newspaper alleging that green had made an inappropriate sexual advance toward her in he offered me career advice and in the same breath made it clear he wa sexually interested said maltby who is three decade younger than green he steered the conversation to the habitual nature of sexual affair in parliament he mentioned that his own wife wa very understanding i felt a fleeting hand against my knee green denied the allegation a absolutely and completely untrue may asked the cabinet office responsible for the administrative function of the government to investigate five day later the sunday time reported that the police had found pornography on a computer in green s office during a investigation into government leak green said in a statement that the story wa completely untrue more importantly the police have never suggested to me that improper material wa found on my parliamentary computer he added in a second statement on nov he again said no allegation about the presence of improper material on his parliamentary computer had ever been put to him on wednesday may s office published a summary of it investigation into green it found that green s conduct a a minister wa generally professional and proper and that it wa not possible to reach a definitive conclusion on the appropriateness of his behavior with maltby it said however that the investigation found maltby s account of the event to be plausible on the issue of pornography it found the two statement made by green on and november to be inaccurate and misleading the metropolitan police service had previously informed him of the existence of this material it said these statement therefore fall short of the honesty requirement of the seven principle of public life and constitute breach of the ministerial code mr green accepts this on wednesday may asked for his resignation while i can understand the considerable distress caused to you by some of the allegation which have been made in recent week i know that you share my commitment to maintaining the high standard which the public demand of minister of the crown may wrote to green in a letter it is therefore with deep regret and enduring gratitude for the contribution you have made over many year that i asked you to resign from the government and have accepted your resignation green apologized for breaking the ministerial code he said that he did not download or view pornography on his parliamentary computer but accepted that he should have been more clear in his november statement about what the police had told him he said he did not recognize the description maltby gave of their meeting but said he had clearly made her feel uncomfortable and apologized he added that he deeply regretted the distress caused to maltby after she wrote the article i regret that i ve been asked to resign from the government following breach of the ministerial code for which i apologise he said
Title_Text: explainer  damian green uk pm may deputy resigns over pornography scandal

Text: beijing reuters  president xi jinping s rule in china ha been marked by a muscular stance in many area from corruption to foreign policy  but investor and business leader hoping that the nation s most powerful leader in decade will drive market reform are girding for disappointment a he gear up for his second term hopedfor market liberalization is increasingly being viewed a secondary to xi s statecentered approach to economic policy and his focus on stability the communist party congress beginning on wednesday in beijing is expected to see xi consolidate his power and is unlikely to see a change in his priority party spokesman tuo zhen told reporter at a briefing on tuesday that china will persist with opening up and expanding market access but foreign executive and analyst question whether these kind of comment will mean a lot on the ground i don t see market opening coming it s all about discipline and control said one senior chinabased american executive who declined to be identified china s state council information office referred question on market reform to the country s economic planning agency the national development and reform commission which did not respond to a faxed request for comment some chinese policy insider said that they don t expect any significant speeding up we will not rush on reform the pace of change will not change dramatically said one advisor to the chinese government who wa speaking on condition of anonymity xi s sweeping anticorruption campaign and his move to personally take charge of economic policymaking had initially been seen by china analyst a early sign that he would use his consolidated power to push tough reform through entrenched bureaucracy the party s pledge under xi s thennew administration to let the market play a decisive role in the economy had also given hope to those pushing for reform but many analyst and business leader now see xi s faith in market a tenuous and that reform pledge a a mere holdover from his predecessor a lack of followthrough over the past several year on repeated state council vow to open market to the world have left foreign business with promise fatigue a the european union chamber of commerce in china put it last month those delay coincide with the passage of a raft of new national security and cyber security law and regulation that china s trading partner complain will put them at a disadvantage for the past or year it wa economic development at all cost and i think we are seeing a new paradigm now where national security is dominant and economic issue are channeled through that lens said jude blanchette who study the party at the conference board s china center for economics and business in beijing blanchette said true market reform in xi s second term would mean walking back much of the control he ha fought to acquire an unlikely prospect other painful reform that many economist say are needed have also moved slowly under xi they include overhauling china s debtladen state sector fixing the fiscal system to tackle local government debt bringing in new property tax to ward off housing bubble and allowing farmer to sell their land more freely capital control including restriction on some outbound investment deal have helped stabilize the yuan but at the cost of hampering china s ambition to internationalize the currency chinese reform advocate say the government ha been avoiding potentially disruptive change due to concern over economic and social stability and resistance from vested interest such a powerful staterun company if there are no such reform the conflict will keep accumulating while risk will be even higher which could destroy our prospect to move forward said jia kang director of the china academy of new supplyside economics a beijingbased think tank in xi espoused his own stateled supply side structural reform doctrine an effort in part to tame an explosion of debt by cutting capacity in heavy industry and reduce risk from bad bank loan while xi can tout continued robust economic growth  the government had set a gdp growth target of around percent but it now look like it will be closer to percent  it is still reliant on credit and investment a opposed to more sustainable consumption and expanded state control over the economy is at the center of key xi initiative including the made in china plan which funnel billion of dollar into robotics semiconductor and other industry deemed strategic despite government talk this year about opening some restricted sector to overseas investment some foreign business group express scepticism even a u president donald trump is expected to seek some concession for american business during his planned visit to beijing in early november until we see the equity cap lifted from percent to percent or higher with foreign bank or until we see foreign insurance company able to fully access the market we re just having the same conversation we had five year ago said jacob parker vice president of china operation at the uschina business council xi ha also reasserted that stateowned enterprise soes should be the commanding height of the economy foreign expert on chinese market point to government effort to merge state company into even larger champion a proof of how the state s vision of reform doe not necessarily mean increased use of free market in recent year beijing ha required state firm to reassert their communist party committee hold on corporate decisionmaking a blueprint for soe reform made no mention of the pledge for the decisive role of the market one senior western diplomat in beijing told reuters it ha become increasingly clear that the top priority for xi remains strengthening the primacy of the party and stability when further opening up come into conflict with that priority the argument for stability tends to win the diplomat said
Title_Text: a china leader gather market reform hope fade

Text: madrid reuters  automaker volkswagen s vowgpde cataloniabased unit seat would move it registered office if it wa felt there wa no longer legal security in catalonia but so far ha not had to make that decision seat chairman luca de meo said on tuesday in an internal letter to staff political stability and legal certainty along with being based in the european union were essential for the company in term of worker the economic health of the company and shareholder trust he said in the letter seen by reuters seat employ more than people in the spanish northeastern region
Title_Text: vws cataloniabased unit say will move hq if legal security in doubt

Text: jerusalem reuters  kafr aqab is no one s dream destination the overcrowded neighborhood separated from adjacent east jerusalem by israel s barrier in the occupied west bank is notorious for rutted road drug and violence but for palestinian in marriage in which one partner come from the west bank and the other from territory israel had declared to be part of the israeli state the slum is a haven where they can live legally together when yearold yacout alqam a resident of east jerusalem first met her fianc she loved that he wa very kind very free everything there wa just one catch the problem of identification card said alqam the wide smile on her small frame fading hailing from east jerusalem alqam carry an israeliissued jerusalem residency card which provides her many benefit but not actual citizenship israel annexed the area after the middle east war in a move not recognized internationally her fiance adham abu lateefa is a palestinian from the west bank territory also captured by israel in but where the palestinian authority administers limited selfrule holding a west bank identification card lateefa cannot under israeli rule live in east jerusalem alqam cannot live in the west bank without risking the loss of her residency permit a she must prove she resides in jerusalem to keep it so along with what resident describe a apartment full of other mixed couple he and alqam see a solution in a sort of twilight zone in kafr aqab since it inhabitant pay jerusalem municipal tax alqam can live in kafr aqab and still be considered an east jerusalem resident and because israel s barrier and a military checkpoint separate kafr aqab from the city her fiance can reside there even with his west bank identification card thanks to it special status kafr aqab once a small neighborhood of several thousand people now ha a population in the ten of thousand who live in dilapidated highrise building where apartment sell for about a quarter of what they cost in the rest of east jerusalem haya khader a palestinian teacher from east jerusalem married her high school sweetheart a west bank resident year go soon after they wed a palestinian uprising erupted and israel built the barrier calling it a bulwark against attack on it city palestinian see it a a land grab khader said she hate living in kafr aqab where she said no one is responsible for u leading to poor municipal service israeli authority rarely venture in she said while the palestinian authority ha no jurisdiction khader said she is resigned to the situation but alqam is holding out hope that her fianc will be granted a permit to live in jerusalem through israel s family unification law this version of the story corrects cost of apartment in paragraph
Title_Text: for some palestinian in love this slum is the only place to live
