Text: the truth about springsteen is so disappointing see below but this one take the cakebruce springsteen ha been a sellout all these year he s not the person he portrayed himself to be to the american peoplehe just revealed he nearly gave up one of his most iconic anthem born in the usa admitting he believed it wa too insincere and glib he said he doesn t feel comfortable singing the song it s almost like he s apologizing for appearing to be patriotic are you thinking what we re thinking he sang that song so many time but never felt ok singing it that s the difference between springsteen and someone like lee greenwood lee greenwood ha always been a passionate and fearless supporter of america and the american way springsteen is just a phony speaking at a qa session with tom hank at the tribeca film festival the yearold rocker opened up to the oscarwinning actor insisting that it wa e street band guitarist stevie van zandt who convinced him to keep the hitspringsteen s memorable tune wa written in part tribute to friend who had served in the american army during the vietnam war and the ironic treatment of the veteran upon their return home he divulged stevie van zandt longtime guitarist in the e street band convinced me to keep that song i remember at the time thinking it s too glib it s too glib i think i still think that but stevie said no no no it s about the band the brotherhood of the band the fan the new jersey native who ha been married to patti scialfa since added that he gave his musical peer the benefit of the doubt but still doesn t feel quite comfortable with the songadding i gave him the benefit of the doubt we ve played it an awful lot ever since but i wa always a little frightened of it and the whole record i always have mixed feeling about despite his feeling the epochal song ha received much praise throughout the year and wa ranked th on rolling stone s list of the greatest song of all time a well a placed on riaa s song of the centurythe fan favorite and title track of his album of the same name inspired famed photographer annie leibovitz s iconic photo of springsteen s backside against the backdrop of an american flag for the record cover commenting on the concept in the medal of freedom recipient told rolling stone we had the flag on the cover because the first song wa called born in the usa and the theme of the record kind of follows from the theme i ve been writing about for at least the last six or seven yearsread more daily mailspringsteen just released a song that bash president trump bruce springsteen aka the bos is showing all of his fan just how out of touch he is with his latest song he s been a fervent antitrump guy and ha been very outspoken against president donald trump his new protest song refers to trump a a con man what a way to disrespect the leader of our nation ha bruce springsteen employed thousand of american it s interesting that trump just delivered one of the best ever speech to the builder union please watch the video provided below of what a real working man doe for his crew it s an awesome speech that totally discount everything springsteen is trying to say to bash trump shame on himthe yearold rocker released his and joe grushecky s antitrump song called that s what make u great and it is a direct comment on the president and his administration according to pitchforkspringsteen s part of the song go a follows don t tell me a lieand sell it a a facti ve been down that road beforeand i ain t going backand don t you brag to methat you never read a booki never put my faithin a con man and his crook during an interview with the pittsburgh postgazette gushecky talked about writing the song in january after trump wa swornin a president i had this song and bruce and i had been talking grushecky said i sent it to him and he liked it i said what do you think about singing on it he gave it the bruce treatment in february springsteen said he wa an embarrassed american during a concert in australia on the same tour he attacked trump s first travel ban a unamerican tonight we want to add our voice to the thousand of american who are protesting at airport around our country the muslim ban and the detention of foreign national and refugee springsteen told the crowd america is a nation of immigrant this is fundamentally unamerican what a bunch of bull springsteen ha lost his root and his sense of the working man if he cared to know anything about president trump then he would know trump s bringing back american job he s working hard to get the steel industry up and running again he just held a buy american hire american event promoting keeping job in america what s better than a president who s a builder speaking to builder and construction worker in president trump s speech he call out people by name pretty great he know business and building we re in good hand america the era of economic surrender ha come to an end it s come to an end we have surrendered a a country to outside interest the era of economic victory for our country ha just begun you will see oh you will see president trump
Title_Text: bruce springsteen reveals the shocking truth about his rock anthem born in the usa

Text: melania trump ha been taking a relatively low key position in her husband s bid to become our next president she s more than just arm candy for donald trump she s a tough business woman who s proud to have come to america a an immigrant and earned her citizenship the legal way watch her nononsense interview here with leftist msnbc hack host mika brzezinski who doe everything in her power to provoke her and condemn her husband i followed the law trump said in an interview with mika brzezinski aired wednesday on msnbc s morning joe in discussing the hoop she had to jump through in order to become a citizen of the united state i never thought to stay here without paper i had a visa i traveled every few month back to the country to slovenia to stamp the visa i came back i applied for the green card i applied for the citizenship later on after many year of green card so i went by system i went by the law and you should do that you should not just say let me stay here and whatever happens happens trump who immigrated to the united state from slovenia in said that she and her husband are prepared for people to call him name for expressing his viewpoint i m a fulltime mom and i love it so i decided not to be in the campaign so much but i support my husband percent she said of her role in the campaign itself we have thick skin and we know that people will judge him and people will call name they don t give him enough credit from june that he announced they don t give him enough credit she said leading brzezinski to ask her what she thought about people who felt he insulted mexican with his comment that the country is sending rapist and murderer across the border in his announcement speech via politico
Title_Text: melania trump in rare oneonone interview watch her destroy leftist msnbc hack on immigrationi followed the law

Text: in a perfect democracy there would be multiple viable party to choose candidate from each one would have to work hard and strive for our vote and each one would have an equal chance at winning unfortunately because of the way election law and funding are currently in the united state we re pretty much stuck with a twoparty system and any thirdparty vote go to help one of the two major partiesthink ralph nader in and how his vote in florida gave u george w bush well nader and the supreme courtit s imperfect but until law are changed it is what it is no amount of whining or sitting election out is going to change that what we need are legislator willing to change the law but that s never going to happen if people keep having hissy fitsthis year s election is so critical not just for the nation but the entire world a donald trump presidency would be catastrophic on so many level both with domestic and foreign policyreminding everyone how important this election is and how a thirdparty vote will give u a president trump is none other than the legendary writerproducer and creator of family guy seth macfarlanemacfarlane tweeted remember this november you can help elect president donald trump just by voting for gary johnson or jill stein happy election year remember this november you can help elect president donald trump just by voting for gary johnson or jill stein Title_Text: seth macfarlane just told johnson and stein supporter exactly what they need to hear tweet

Text: there s a peculiar hysteria around marijuana in this country and for the life of me i can t understand it there s so much misinformation out there that it make my head hurt a soon a i saw the headline for this article medical marijuana how to prevent an addiction to weed i knew i wa in for a frustrating experiencethe author of the piece dr david casarett spends half of the article on a mea culpa over his part in creating the current epidemic of opioid addiction fifteen year ago he and his fellow doctor shoved pain killer down our throat that were derived from the same stuff we make heroin from and couldn t see why that would be a problemfifteen year ago a crowd of expert including many physician proclaimed that opioids such a morphine were safe for use in chronic pain we also downplayed the risk of opioid addictionfor example one expert statement on chronic pain management in older adult on which i wa an author said that concern over drug dependency and addiction do not justify the failure to relieve pain so far so good doctor have been overprescribing pain killer for year and then abandoning their patient when they re addicted casarett is very sorry about his role in this and just doesn t want u to make the same mistake with marijuanaproponents of medical marijuana advertise it safety it s natural they say in fact one dispensary owner told me guilelessly it s perfectly safe it s from a flower not like heroin that dispensary owner ignored the fact that heroin is derived from poppy and that poppy are also flowersbesides he told me theoretical risk of addiction don t justify withholding a potentially beneficial treatment but that s exactly what many expert were saying about opioids year ago and we should worry about marijuana addictionand that s when he go off the rail there s one critical difference between marijuana and opioids you can easily become physically addicted to one and it s almost impossible to become physically addicted to the otheryou can become physically addicted to opioids sugar alcohol tobacco and a slew of other chemical and substance it is nigh impossible to become physically addicted the same way to pot it just doesn t happen and casarett a a doctor know this this is why he doe a bait and switch from addiction to dependence the good news is that the risk of marijuana dependence is lower than it is for heroin approximately percent v percent the term dependence is used to describe someone who us marijuana regularly even though it impairs their ability to function normally and despite drugrelated physical and psychological problem nevertheless even if marijuana addiction doesn t turn out to be a devastating a opioid addiction is it can still result in lost job damaged relationship and lost opportunitiesdependence is very different from addiction even the government website on marijuana point out correctly that you can be dependent on marijuana but not be addictedi know you might be thinking that i m just another stoner defending his precious weed but honestly i don t smoke marijuana and i never have i have zero interest in it personally that being said i grew up around a great many people who smoke pot and not one of them ever became addicted to it and they smoked a lot of the stuff none of them even became dependent so addiction wa right out the window this is why i know from first hand experience that marijuana simply is not addictive you have a better chance of becoming addicted to the sugar salt and fat in mcdonald s food than you are to potit s easy to read casarett s article and become concerned that we re facing the next drug epidemic but it s just not truefeatured image via getty
Title_Text: doctor warns america about marijuana addiction compare it to heroin epidemic

Text: newsweek just published a damning investigative report detailing how donald trump is already fundamentally changing american foreign policy to enrich himself even if it mean being a puppet for dictatorsever since russia helped him win the election trump ha refused to sever tie with his company which build hotel and resort around the worldbut trump s business interest are putting him in the position of being controlled by other nation because every decision he make could jeopardize his company and the profit it brings infor instance trump is getting awfully cozy with philippine president rodrigo duterte who is busy slaughtering thousand of his own people in a supposed effort to rid his country of drugsgovernments around the world have condemned the killing so ha the united nation but because trump ha a hotel that is nearing completion in the philippine he is already sucking up to duterte trump ha even invited duterte to the white housethat s right trump is palling around with a mass murderer because he doesn t want to lose money seriouslyaccording to newsweekthe trump family ha an enormous financial interest in keeping duterte happy trump tower at century city in makati philippine is on the verge of completion with potential buyer having placed deposit on at least percent of the condominium according to century property the trump organization s business partner therein addition trump ha also been trying to build hotel and resort in taiwan which is probably the reason why he pissed off china by calling the taiwanese president american president have recognized china a the one and only china in the world since which is why president do not directly contact taiwan by doing so trump is signaling that he recognizes taiwan a a nation something the chinese dispute but once again taiwan ha leverage over trump because his business is trying to build resort there so trump is willing to risk war with china for the sake of profiting from taiwan trump could also be just using the threat of doing business in taiwan in order to force beijing to allow trump to build hotel in china insteadthe same go for russia too trump ha been trying to build a hotel in moscow for decade now he can give vladimir putin something in return for allowing construction to commence in other word trump may drop all sanction against russia and ignore their aggression towards europe in exchange for a multimillion dollar business deal for himself and his childrenturkey is currently trying to blackmail trump by holding his financial interest hostage turkish president erdogan had a turkish executive who work with trump s business partner arrested which is putting pressure on the cash flow trump s company receives from turkey million of dollar are at stake if trump doesn t bow down to erdogan s demand that the united state hand over a person the turkish government claim is a terrorist even though they have provided no evidence to support the claim once trump take office he will likely do what turkey want in order to keep the money flowing to his pocketstrump also ha conflict of interest with japan and argentinawhen ivanka trump sat in during her father s meeting with japanese prime minister shinzo abe and wa included in a phone call with argentine president mauricio macri there were business deal at stake in both countriesat the same time official with her clothing company were working on a licensing agreement with sanei international the largest shareholder of sanei s parent company is the development bank of japan which is wholly owned by the japanese government headed by abeand argentina recently stopped blocking a building project from moving forward after trump and his daughter spoke with macri on the phone only day after the electionin short trump is using the presidency to increase his family s fortune instead of dong what is best for our country and this is a major threat to our democracy and our security because other nation now have the power to influence trump simply by threatening to pull the plug on building project or cutting off profit from being sent to trump s bank account it s a major conflict of interest that set up a constitutional crisis the second trump take office and that cannot be allowed to happen if we do not want america to be trampled over by foreign governmentsfeatured image via steve popegetty image
Title_Text: trump just got smacked by newsweek for putting his wallet ahead of our nations best interest

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump plan to nominate j christopher giancarlo to lead the commodity future trading commission the regulator tasked with policing the massive overthecounter derivative market the white house said on tuesday giancarlo a republican ha been acting chairman of the cftc since jan and wa widely expected to be tapped for the permanent position of chairman he became a cftc commissioner in the nomination come just one day before giancarlo is expected to give a major policy address at the annual future industry association conference in boca raton florida where he plan to lay out his regulatory vision for the agency the cftc won broad new power from the doddfrank wall street reform law to regulate the swap market which until then had been largely unpoliced giancarlo previously served a executive vice president of financial service group gfi group inc throughout his tenure a a cftc commissioner giancarlo ha been critical of the way the agency ha implemented many of the new rule required by doddfrank he issued a white paper in for instance which accused the cftcs regulatory framework of driving global trader away from the united state fragmenting the marketplace and increasing liquidity risk he ha dissented on a number of other major policy area including a proposal requiring automated trader to hand over sensitive code without a subpoena  something giancarlo said would strip owner of intellectual property of due process of law a chairman giancarlo is likely to focus his energy on scaling back rule that he belief are overly burdensome to help boost economic growth  a vision that is also shared by jay clayton trumps pick to head the cftcs sister regulator the security and exchange commission in a speech monday before the institute of international banker giancarlo criticized those who have dwelled heavily on preventing a repeat of the financial crisis saying the impact ha been to sideline capital from productive uses if confirmed a chairman however giancarlo could face some initial challenge getting his agenda adopted currently the fivemember panel is down to two commissioner  giancarlo and sharon bowen a democrat if the two disagree on a decision the measure cannot pas giancarlo acknowledged this challenge in his speech monday saying the agency cannot proceed on a controversial position limit rule without a full commission trump ha not yet nominated anyone for the remaining three position
Title_Text: trump to nominate cftc acting head giancarlo a permanent chairman

Text: marawi city philippine reuters  prayer mat chequered scarf black fatigue and bulletridden wall mark the hideout where the emir of islamic state in southeast asia spent month preparing the most brazen and devastating militant attack in the region a fourstorey house in a quiet alley of marawi city in the southern philippine wa the secret lair of isnilon hapilon until late may after a botched military raid to apprehend him a thousandstrong rebel alliance held large part of the city for five month hapilon s death in a military operation elsewhere in marawi on oct wa the catalyst for the end of philippine longest and most intense urban battle in recent history security force moved in on the house on may trying to capture the country s most wanted man but came under sustained attack from rebel firing rocketpropelled grenade a bombbattered structure shattered window and walltowall hole from machine gun fire tell the story of the ferociousthreeday battle that erupted at hapilon s hideout and promptedthe call to hundred of fighter to expedite the plannedtakeover of marawi hapilon escaped through a large hole that wa blasted out of a rear wall making his way across a rice field to a mosque next to the vast lake lanao from there he joined the guerrilla community volunteer on thursday showed reuters the house in the now empty narrow street where the military belief hapilon had lain low for several month all other property were intact and neighbor had fled long ago at the time no one knew who these people were people saw them about but there wa no reason to suspect anything said mohammed seddick raki who lived nearby other volunteer said woman and child stayed at the rented house and visitor were frequent child s shoe were scattered amid the debris and a woman s robe wa hanging from a window inside the house black shirt pant and plaid scarf synonymous with islamic state were strewn across room littered with broken floor tile and chunk of rock from blasted wall left behind were waterproof boot a balaclava medical supply and camouflage bag and waistcoat typically used by soldier to carry rifle magazine coated in a think layer of dust on floor of every room were pocketsized copy of the koran some with page stained by water leaked through gaping hole in the roof a mosque about meter behind the house wa the venue for an annual gathering in marawi of tablighi jamaat a sunni missionary movement just day before the fighting erupted military official say the foreigner who fought in hapilon s alliance  among them indonesian malaysian and some from arab state  had used that event a a cover to slip into marawi without raising suspicion the deputy task force commander in marawi colonel romeo brawner said hapilon evaded security force because rebel had a network of lookout and gunman ready to defend him they put up heavy resistance they were spread across a large area they were strategically placed he said they were prepared for it hapilon s escape in the last week of may led to anarchy in the city of about rebel took hostage set fire to building ransacked church broke into the local jail to free inmate and looted an armory the government had insufficient security force in marawi to prevent the fighter from fanning out across the city and seizing hundred of building hapilon wa wanted by the u federal bureau of investigation fbi and had a bounty on his head of up to  million he wa killed by army ranger in a night operation and his body wa retrieved from the battle zone in the heart of the city his identity wa confirmed by the fbi s dna analysis the city of marawi wa all but destroyed by government air strike and shelling that leveled commercial area and crushed thousand of shop home and vehicle no one could have known what would happen said mohamed faisal mama a resident in the same basak malutlot district where hapilon wa hiding no one knew them they weren t famous then
Title_Text: exclusive koran boot and scarf all that remain in philippine rebel leader lair

Text: drben carson wa speaking today at thehill s newsmaker series event when he boldly said what only a brilliant neurosurgeon can say about people dr carson said that people who thought his past a a neurosurgeon did not qualify him for his hud position are stupid oh yes he didpeople are so stupid realbencarson pictwittercomihxssirxns matt wilstein mattwilstein october the interviewer asked what were some of the obstacle that you saw wa it maybe not thinking outside the box that idea that you just raised have you changed the mindset at hud dr carson replied that when he started at hud it wa run by the book carson said there wa a shift in focus toward the end goal rather than on the smallest rule and protocolscarson continued when i first came a lot of people were saying but you re a doctor so you can t possibly know anything about housing how can you possibly run hud you know people are so stupid wow he went there and bashed the government bureaucrat who love all of those rule and regulation it s what make dc such a behemoth when it come to getting anything donedr carson went on to explaincarson made an analogy to the ceo of a large medical center who may not know a lot about how to treat an infectious disease or perform a surgery saying he doesn t need to know all of those thing to be a successful and effective ceothe secretary said he surround himself with people who know a lot about the different aspect of running a governmental organization like hud and they are helping to coordinate and create the vision and atmosphere of a successful organizationon a side note if you ever get the chance to hear dr carson speak please go he is so funny and so brilliant it s worth it we re so lucky he s serving our nation right nowread more wfb
Title_Text: watch dr ben carson hit back at his critic like only a brain surgeon can do video

Text: washington reuters  the u senate on thursday unanimously confirmed two nominee to serve on the federal communication commission a the trump administration look to reverse many obamaera telecommunication regulation brendan carr a republican who is general counsel at the fcc and jessica rosenworcel a democrat were both confirmed by voice vote bringing the fivemember fcc to full strength and giving republican a  majority rosenworcel served a a commissioner for the regulator until the end of when lawmaker failed to take up her renomination under former president barack obama the fcc which since january ha been controlled by republican by a  margin is working to reverse a number of obamaera telecommunication regulation including the landmark netneutrality rule prohibiting broadband provider from giving or selling access to certain internet service over others the senate did not immediately vote to reconfirm fcc chairman ajit pai to another term even though he appeared at a confirmation hearing in july with the other nominee pai would need to leave the commission by the end of the year if he were not reconfirmed in a statement pai praised rosenworcel and carrs confirmation and said they have distinguished record of public service and will be valuable asset to the fcc in the year to come their experience at the fcc make them particularly wellsuited to hit the ground running pai chosen by trump in january to head the agency also ha said he want to dismantle other significant regulation a part of a sweeping review he said would remove barrier to business and modernize rule pai also plan significant change to local tv ownership limit and plan other change to medium regulation democrat insisted republican had agreed in to reconfirm rosenworcel a part of a deal to confirm fcc commissioner mike orielly republican denied there wa a deal but the standoff had delayed consideration of telecommunication legislation in the senate under pai the fcc chose not to review att incs planned  billion acquisition of time warner inc the fcc is currently reviewing sinclair broadcast group incs proposed  billion acquisition of tribune medium co one of the largest u tv station operator
Title_Text: senate approves two fcc nominee a it review obama rule

Text: jakarta reuters  ten of thousand of muslim marched from the main mosque in indonesia s capital to a square in jakarta on sunday to protest against u president donald trump s decision to recognize jerusalem a the capital of israel it wa the biggest protest in indonesia since trump s controversial move earlier this month to reverse decade of u policy police estimated the number attending the rally organized by various muslim group at about the protest wa peaceful but row of police behind coil of barbed wire held back the crowd outside the u embassy in jakarta a police spokesman said police and member of the military were deployed to ensure security we urge all country to reject the unilateral and illegal decision of president donald trump to make jerusalem israel s capital anwar abbas the secretary general of the indonesian ulema council told the crowd we call on all indonesian people to boycott u and israel product in this country if trump doe not revoked his action abbas said reading from a petition due to be handed to the u ambassador in indonesia many of the protester were clad in white and waved palestinian flag and held up placard some reading peace love and free palestine there have been a series of protest in indonesia over the issue including some where hardliner burned u and israeli flag the status of jerusalem a city holy to jew muslim and christian is one of the biggest barrier to a lasting israelipalestinian peace jerusalem s eastern sector wa captured by israel in a war and annexed in a move not recognized internationally palestinian claim east jerusalem for the capital of an independent state that they seek while israel maintains that all of jerusalem is it capital
Title_Text: ten of thousand of indonesian rally over trump jerusalem stance

Text: benghazi wa just a ploy to hurt hillary clinton s shot at the presidency admits rep darrell issa like other senior republican who have also admitted the truth about the right s neverending benghazi investigation issa opened up and told the truth to a friendly rightwing radio show you know people often ask trey gowdy and myself what did our investigation do rep darrell issa rca told boston herald radio on friday morning gowdy currently chair the house select committee on benghazi while issa conducted his own investigation in when he served a chairman of the house oversight and government reform committee well what they did is that they opened up an opportunity for the american people to sort of smell what s in the garbage can issa said and i think that s the reason that a devout socialist who want to nationalize almost everything in america is close to and probably will beat hillary here in new hampshire it s not because they like republican it s because they don t trust hillary multiple bipartisan investigation have repeatedly cleared sec clinton and president obama of malicious wrongdoing in response to the attack on the u compound in benghazi libya those investigation found that systemic problem in the policy protecting ambassador and other diplomat on foreign soil led to the tragedy that killed ambassador chris stevens and the contractor hired to provide securitythat hasn t deterred the right from constantly invoking benghazi particularly in relation to clinton s presidential campaign fox news and other conservative medium outlet recently expressed the hope that the michael bay movie hour would provoke an outcry against clinton outside of the circle of the right instead the film ha been a box office flop and is one of the worstperforming film ever released by the supersuccessful directorjust a screaming benghazi failed to derail president obama s reelection it doe not appear to be a potent force in halting sec clinton s presidential campaignfeatured image via flickr

Text: former san francisco er quarterback colin kaepernick ha been essentially blacklisted in the nfl for daring to kneel during the national anthem in order to protest police brutality against people of color he wa the original player to takeaknee and ha paid dearly for it however since donald trump ha seen fit to attack anyone daring to protest in this way the tide on the anthem protest ha taken on new life after trump s original attack player throughout the league were taking knee last sunday the attack continued from trump this week and player continued to defy trump perhaps most notably those on kaepernick s old teamthe er had an entire row of player kneeling during the anthem right in front of those who chose to stand however despite choosing to stand those player had their hand on the shoulder of those kneeling in solidarity trump might continue to petulantly tweet at these people who are using their public platform to shine a light on the very serious and deadly issue of police brutality but clearly thing are not going in the way he had hopedthen again trump seems to think that everyone is a tone deaf and racist a he and his mouthbreathing flagsoaked base are that is clearly not the case though newsflash you orange fascist the world is much less tolerant of bigotry than you might like to think people are sick and tired of your screaming racism through your bullhorn and using the bully pulpit of the white house to attack anyone who would dare to do the right thing heregood on these brave player they ll surely be attacked for what they are doing once again from donald trump s overly active twitter account but at the end of the day they are the one who are on the right side of historywatch the video below courtesy of the er official twittertogether pictwittercompwkdagudcq san francisco er er october featured image via video screen capture

Text: washington reuters  donald trump won the u presidency with less support from black and hispanic voter than any president in at least year a reuters review of polling data show highlighting deep national division that have fueled incident of racial and political confrontation trump wa elected with percent of the black vote percent of the hispanic vote and percent of the asianamerican vote according to the reutersipsos election day poll among black voter his showing wa comparable to the percent captured by george w bush in and ronald reagan in but bush and reagan both did far better with hispanic voter capturing percent and percent respectively according to exit polling data compiled by the nonpartisan roper center for public opinion research and trumps performance among asianamericans wa the worst of any winning presidential candidate since tracking of that demographic began in the racial polarization behind trumps victory ha helped set the stage for tension that have surfaced repeatedly since the election in white supremacist victory celebration in antitrump protest and civil right rally and in hundred of racist xenophobic and antisemitic hate crime documented by the southern poverty law center splc which track extremist movement the splc report there were incident of hateful harassment and intimidation between the day following the nov election and nov with a spike in such incident in the immediate wake of the vote sign point to an ongoing atmosphere of confrontation the loyal white knight of the ku klux klan a white separatist group that vilifies africanamerican jew and other minority plan an unusual dec rally in north carolina to celebrate trumps victory leftwing and anarchist group have called for organized protest to disrupt the presidentelects jan inauguration and a womens march on washington scheduled for the following day is expected to draw hundred of thousand to protest trumps presidency american politics became increasingly racialized through president barack obamas two term but there wa an attempt across the board across the party to keep those tension under the surface say jamila michener an assistant professor of government at cornell university trumps antiimmigrant antimuslim rhetoric brought those division to the fore it activated people on the right who felt empowered and it activated people on the left who saw it a a threat she added that dynamic wa evident last week when vice presidentelect mike penny attended the broadway musical hamilton in new york on friday the multiethnic cast closed with a statement expressing fear of a trump presidency a far different view wa on display the next day a a crowd of about people cheered trumps election at a washington conference of the national policy institute a white nationalist group with a strong antisemitic belief we willed donald trump into office we made this dream our reality npi president richard spencer said after outlining a vision of america a a white country designed for ourselves and our posterity he closed with hail trump hail our people hail victory though trumps election victory wa driven by white voter his performance even among that group wa not a strong a some of his predecessor reagan and george hw bush both won the presidency with higher share of the white vote than the percent that trump achieved the historical voting pattern reflect decade of polarization in american politics but the division surrounding trump appears more profound say ca mudde an associate professor specializing in political extremism at the university of georgia these day he add people say they dont want their child even to date someone from the other party indeed voters opinion of those on the opposite side of the partisan divide have reached historic low survey by the pew research center showed this year that majority of both party held very unfavorable view of the other party  a first since the center first measured such sentiment in and the lions share of those people believe the opposing partys policy are so misguided that they threaten the nations wellbeing the center found that level of division ha spurred activist on both side of the political divide to take their activism in a more confrontational direction in the wake of trumps victory protester on the left took to the street by the thousand in city across the country in some case causing property damage much of the agitation wa motivated by a belief that trumps administration will foster racism and push the court and other political institution to disenfranchise minority voter say james anderson editor of itsgoingdownorg an anarchist website that ha promoted mass demonstration against trumps presidency including a call to disrupt his inauguration many on the left have come to distrust government institution embracing a breed of activism aimed at directly confronting what they see a condemnable political force anderson say the answer now is to organize build power and autonomy and fight back on the opposite end of the political spectrum trumps election is bringing new hope for rightwing activist who felt abandoned by the major party john robert a top officer in the ku klux klan affiliate planning the december rally to celebrate trumps election say the group is committed to nonviolent demonstration but he see trumps election a likely to bring a new era of political conflict and much of the strife he say will be centered around racial division once trump officially take office there is going to be a boiling over at some point in time robert say who know when thats going to be but its not going to be pretty
Title_Text: trump won with lowest minority vote in decade fueling division

Text: donald trump unveiled his vice presidential pick on friday he had claimed that he would postpone the announcement due to the tragedy that took place in france on thursday night but for whatever reason he skipped the normal fanfare and tweeted out the announcement of indiana governor mike penny a his running mate just before amalong with the name of his vp he also revealed a new campaign logo to the worldvia twitter screen capturetwitter wa quick to respond to his new logo with all the brutal mockery we have come to expect from the social medium platform never one to disappoint the result wa absolutely hilariousmany people picked up on the whole tp and toilet paper thing of course you can t think about tp without thinking about beavis and the great cornholiothe new trumppence logo is for crap pictwittercomsgmmnrok superhero of steel superherosteel july trumppence tp toilet paper obviously a joke waiting to be made so you include it in your official logo design c mon amateurhour tanner s salyers tannersalyers july question from trumppence new logo is the tp campaign singleply doubleply tripleply extrapadded with racism alex hayden dilalla alexdilalla july others on twitter noticed the way the t and the p intersected in the new logoyou cannot unsee this version of the trumppence logo credit unknown pictwittercomgfcbqscowu ali a akbar ali july great job on the new trumppence logo pictwittercomixoadpr riley imadesmartcool july the new trumppence logo also come with a secret hand sign based on said logo pictwittercompabqtmuw mike mika mikejmika july that trumppence logo though pictwittercomakdvztv declan cashin tweetdec july some user noticed the similarity of trump s new logo to an old logo used by fellow liberal blog think progressha trumppence stole the old thinkprogress logo please tell me they had it trademarked pictwittercomwciosdb mercurialmiss mercurialmiss july this user wa willing to give credit where credit is duetrumppence logo depicts intercourse abbreviates toilet paper and invokes white supremacism all at once pictwittercomflmxlsro ryan calo rcalo july we aren t sure who came up with the design for this masterpiece but trump might want to go with somebody else when it come time to design his next logo regardless the resulting comment on twitter were definitely the best part of trump s vp announcementfeatured image via aaron p bernsteingetty image
Title_Text: twitter erupts in brutal mockery of cringe worthy trumppence logo

Text: washington reuters  republican presidential candidate ted cruz often tell supporter about his supreme court win against the federal government in defending texas right to execute a mexican man for murder a evidence of his conservative and antiestablishment credential but there is one part of the story that go untold the medellin v texas case decided when cruz wa the states solicitor general set the stage for year of diplomatic tension between the united state and it southern neighbor mexico ha publicly protested u execution of it citizen over the year but interview with diplomat and review of official mexican government communiqus reveal that the turmoil caused by the medellin case ran deeper coming up at nearly every meeting between the united state and mexico and leading to an official protest to the united nation security council in given the level of frustration cruzs role in the court battle raise question about usmexico relation if he were to beat billionaire donald trump to the republican nomination and win the u presidential election in november i think relation would be complicated with a president cruz said sergio alcocer who wa mexicos deputy foreign minister responsible for north america between  alcocer praised cruz a intelligent and pragmatic but said the senator wa too inflexible on issue like immigration and the death penalty cruz take certain position that are very clearly defined and hes much more conservative much more dogmatic than trump alcocer said a cruz campaign official did not respond to request for comment in mexico city a foreign ministry spokesman said mexico had no preference among the u presidential candidate and would not comment on the election in the medellin case cruz defended the death sentence a texas court imposed on mexican citizen jose ernesto medellin after he wa convicted in for his role in the gang rape and strangling of two teenage girl in a houston park in the international court of justice of the united nation ruled that texas and other state had violated the vienna convention by failing to notify medellin and other mexican on death row of their right to contact the mexican consulate after arrest president george w bush ordered texas and other state to review the sentence cruz argued that while the united state had submitted to the international courts decision the white house could not implement an international agreement that required state to change their court procedure without action by congress the supreme court agreed in a  decision winning the case raised cruzs profile in conservative circle he ha recently said he would appoint justice who would narrowly interpret the constitution  a he did in the medellin case  a crucial talking point in the election following the death of supreme court conservative icon antonin scalia it wa an unusual thing at the time for the state of texas to be standing up against the president of the united state in front of the supreme court particularly when that president wa a texan and a republican and the former governor of this state cruz told cheering supporter at a houston rally in february one of the many time he ha brought up the case the supreme court ruling removed a potential legal barrier to three more execution of mexican national in texas who had been part of the same international court case a medellin even a u ally such a the european union and switzerland criticized what they saw a ongoing treaty violation mexico pressed u official and congress to follow the international courts directive and require state to review death sentence where people had been denied consular access the issue came up a one of the top few issue mexico raised in almost every bilateral meeting we had said harold hongju koh who wa legal adviser to the u state department from  alcocer the former mexican deputy foreign minister confirmed the issue of consular access wa raised during negotiation on other crossborder issue like the extradition of criminal its not resolved and its something that mexico need to keep insisting on he said in an interview mexican official said both the bush and obama administration had been open to working on the issue u state department official supported consularaccess legislation introduced in the senate but that wa not enough to spur congress to resolve the issue texas executed medellin in august five month after the supreme court decision drawing swift criticism from the united nation court three year later a texas prepared to execute another mexican national who had not received consular access mexicos thenambassador to the united state arturo sarukhan wrote to u secretary of state hillary clinton saying the action would seriously jeopardize cooperation on a range of issue it serf neither the united state nor the mexicous relationship if the u cannot live up to it treaty obligations said the letter which wa reviewed by reuters in mexico warned washington in another letter that the execution of mexican national who had been denied consular access would mean our whole forwardlooking bilateral engagement could be questioned a year later the government wrote to the president of the united nations security council expressing indignation over the execution of mexican citizen in violation of the international court directive sarukhan the former mexican ambassador said mexico had few option to put pressure on the united state without harming cooperation in other area march st mark now year since the decision wa rendered and the united state is yet to comply with it international obligations the government said in a statement responding to reuters question about the medellin case and cruzs involvement in it critic of the medellin ruling and cruzs boast about it say texas could have simply reviewed the sentence a the international court had asked texas could have provided that remedy time over in the time that it took to litigate that case up and down through the texas court and the supreme court said sandra babcock a law professor at cornell university who wa one of medellins attorney the longterm damage the reputational damage to the united state is still ongoing but cruzs supporter dismiss such criticism his job a solicitor general wa to defend texas not to worry about the international implication they say texas governor greg abbott a former attorney general who wa cruzs bos at the time of the medellin case introduced the presidential hopeful at the february rally in houston he fought against the united nation the world court and the united state of america itself to defend texas sovereignty abbott said to cheer
Title_Text: how ted cruz win in supreme court hurt usmexico relation

Text: bauchi nigeria reuters  nigeria s military ha repelled an attack on monday by suspected boko haram militant on the outskirt of the northeastern city of maiduguri the regional army commander said the situation is now under control major general nicholas rogers who head nigeria s military operation against boko haram told reuters by phone
Title_Text: nigerian military say it repels suspected boko haram attack

Text: washington reuters  the top lawyer for the u consumer financial protection bureau cfpb ha concluded that president donald trump ha the authority to name it acting director three source familiar with the matter said on sunday rejecting an effort by her former bos at the agency to name his immediate successor the office of cfpb general counsel mary mcleod ha prepared a memo concurring with the opinion of the u justice department that trump ha the power to appoint his budget chief mick mulvaney a temporary leader of the federal watchdog agency according to the source who spoke on condition of anonymity one source said the memo would be sent to cfpb staff on monday cfpb official did not respond to request by email and phone requesting comment mcleods opinion place her against richard cordray who resigned a cfpb director on friday and elevated his former chief of staff leandra english to replace him on an interim basis until the senate confirms a permanent successor named by trump hour later the republican president named mulvaney a acting head plunging the bureau into uncertainty
Title_Text: exclusive u consumer finance agency lawyer side with trump over succession  source

Text: rick scott ha been governor of florida for just over one term but already the state is feeling the effect of his conservative fanaticism while the rest of the country continues to combat the spread of hiv and the number of people dying from aid drop florida is seeing the reversein a comprehensive review of how scott s war against government led to his deep slash in public health funding the miami herald discovered two disturbing fact florida now lead the nation in hiv case and it biggest county miamidade is ground zeronew case last year totaled the highest since miamidade and broward together account for percent of that totalalthough florida is among the nation s fastestgrowing state scott ha pushed every year to trim the state work force and nearly one quarter of those reduction have been in the department of healththe county health department largely funded by the state health agency have declined to position compared to in the year scott took office it s indicative of the neglect of this administration across the board in social service said sen oscar braynon dmiami garden we have a rise in aid and we have a reduction in public health spending we re now cutting just to be cutting indeed scott is often cited a one of the conservative movement s standard bearer he s a taxcutting superstar in the same vein a kansa governor sam brownback who imploded his state s economy and michigan governor rick snyder whose neglect poisoned an entire cityhowever he differs from his fellow conservative taxslashers in that he doesn t even seem remorseful for the negative impact he s had at least brownback had the decency to break down in tear after destroying his state s job growth in a disturbing reminder of the reagan era when conservative politician intentionally ignored the aid epidemic contributing to the death of thousand by their apathy scott appears to be unconcerned about this surge in hiv case or perhaps he s just grown used to it after his first year in office the number of hiv case ha grown handoverfistmaking matter worse scott ha routinely fought against working with obamacare in his state for year all the while hiv case piled up a his budget cut took hold this spell disaster for the victim of hiv because the best and only way to prevent it from turning into the much deadlier aid illness is careful health management you can t get that if your governor ha refused to expand access to health insurance to spite the presidentas we ve seen around the country republican who have grown used to screaming about the tyranny of big government are met with disaster when they attempt to get rid of it far from the freedom of living a life of liberty and selfdetermination state that try to cut government spending only cause misery for the citizen they are trying to liberate it s easy to say a a concept that government is bad but harder to accept that you can no longer get healthcare or build safe road without itflorida is learning the hard way that government spending isn t always wasteful oftentimes it is being used to keep the real threat like illness and poverty at bayfeature image via gage skidmoreflickr
Title_Text: florida governor rick scott tax cut his way into massive hivaids comeback

Text: london reuters  london s east croydon station wa due to reopen on monday after police said an item they had been investigating wa not harmful the item at east croydon ha been declared nonsuspicious britain s transport police said on twitter the station will be reopening very shortly the temporary closure caused delay for commuter and for traveller using the city s nearby gatwick airport britain is on it secondhighest level of security alert after several attack in the country in recent month
Title_Text: london east croydon station to reopen after security check police

Text: dublin reuters  the irish government would insist on a role in the running of northern ireland if powersharing devolved government is not restored in the british province but it hope that will not happen foreign minister simon coveney said on wednesday the british government moved on wednesday to directly set northern ireland s budget after the province s main political party failed to reach agreement on restoring a powersharing government that collapsed in january we will have to fall back on the full detail of the good friday agreement in term of the structure that are required in the absence of devolved government coveney told irish state broadcaster rte the prospect of direct rule in northern ireland and the irish government s insistence on having a role in that an appropriate role consistent with the good friday agreement is not where we want to be he said
Title_Text: ireland say would insist on northern ireland role if powersharing not restored

Text: kuala lumpur reuters  north korea ha granted a soccer loving malaysian prince access to it airspace anytime he want his palace said on tuesday a pyongyang prepares finally to host an asian cup tie that became a casualty of the assassination in malaysia of the north korean leader s estranged half brother in february having been delayed twice due to malaysia s fear for the safety of it player the match between north korea and malaysia is now set to be played on oct the game had originally been scheduled for march but the two formerly friendly government suffered a diplomatic meltdown a north korea reacted angrily to malaysian police investigating the role north korean official allegedly played in the murder of kim jong nam at kuala lumpur international airport the president of the football association of malaysia fam tunku ismail sultan ibrahim the crown prince of the southern state of johor met with north korea s seniormost diplomat in malaysia on tuesday to discus the match according to a statement from the johor palace amongst issue discussed were foreign relation and current affair a well a the upcoming group b match of the afc asian cup uae qualifying final round in which both team will ensure the safety of player and team official the statement said north korea also granted the prince full access to it airspace anytime he want to visit north korea from malaysia the palace statement said it is the highest honor a any other world leader will need to stop by in beijing beforehand it said the trial of two woman an indonesian and a vietnamese charged for the murder of kim is set to begin in kuala lumpur on oct but the north korean sought by police were believed to have fled malaysia soon after the murder the meeting took place on the same day a the opening of the united nation general assembly in new york where u president donald trump delivered a stern warning to north korea over it ballistic missile launch and nuclear test
Title_Text: north korea grant malaysian prince access to airspace a soccer match back on

Text: reuters  highlight of the day for u president donald trumps administration on friday trump and japanese prime minister shinzo abe open a new chapter in usjapan relation with trump abruptly setting aside campaign pledge to force tokyo to pay more for u defense aid trump say he is considering issuing a new travel ban executive order while white house chief of staff reince priebus say the administration could still escalate a legal dispute over trumps original travel ban order to the u supreme court several democratic u senator and a republican congressman whose district includes a section of the usmexico border express skepticism about trumps proposed wall there after learning the projects estimated cost is  billion trump change tack and agrees to honor the one china policy during a phone call with chinese leader xi jinping in a major diplomatic boost for beijing which brook no criticism of it claim to selfruled taiwan russiaukraine the washington post report white house national security adviser michael flynn privately discussed u sanction against russia with moscows ambassador during the month before trump took office flynn had previously denied discussing sanction russian president vladimir putin proposes slovenia the birthplace of trumps wife melania a a good place for a meeting with trump but say the decision on a location is not moscows alone trump express support for an undivided ukraine in a letter to lithuanias president using language similar to that of his predecessor barack obama and seen a likely to be welcomed by kiev and north atlantic treaty organization ally trump say iran president hassan rouhani better be careful after rouhani wa quoted a saying that anyone who speaks to iranian with threat would regret it trump pull elliott abrams a a contender for the no position at the state department after learning that the republican foreign policy veteran criticized him during the election campaign source say tom price is sworn in a u secretary of health which trump say will allow his administration to fulfill his pledge to dismantle obamacare and reshape the healthcare system the federal reserve boards top bank regulator say he will resign giving a boost to trumps plan to ease reform put in place after the  financial crisis
Title_Text: the trump presidency on feb at pm est

Text: washington reuters  a bill to slash funding for the u security and exchange commission internal revenue service and other financial regulator passed a key committee in the u house of representative on thursday after a long partisan fight the expansive legislation would also place a halt on the payday lending restriction that the consumer financial protection bureau recently proposed the appropriation committee voted  to approve the bill allocating fund for financial service and general government which now go to the full house one of the committees senior democrat jose serrano of new york warned that the bill in it current form will be vetoed the senate must still pas accompanying legislation after that both chamber will reconcile their bill into a single piece for president barack obama to sign or veto congress ha tangled over budget law for year and federal agency frequently rely on temporary continuing resolution for funding republican cast the bill a a way to streamline agency and hold them accountable for spending decision while saving taxpayer money democrat attacked what they called riders to the bill such a a measure to stop the federal communication commissions net neutrality rule and one to prevent corporation from being required to disclose political donation they also said cut to the sec would hobble the agency in carrying out it duty and implementing the doddfrank wall street reform law earlier this month the cfpb charged with shielding consumer from financial fraud proposed rule to limit shortterm borrowing known a payday loan which can charge interest a high a percent critic say the proposal will cut off credit to poor people who may need small loan during emergency representative steven palazzo a mississippi republican proposed an amendment on thursday to delay implementing the rule until the bureau report to congress on their possible effect saying he wa concerned they could force people to turn to loan shark democratic national committee chair debbie wasserman schultz had been one of the few member of her party to oppose the rule and had sponsored a bill to delay cfpb rule for two year wasserman schultz who is also a u representative from florida reversed her position in the last week she told the hearing on thursday the proposal is inarguably a step in the right direction adding i stand with the cfpb in it effort to protect american from predatory lending
Title_Text: house committee move to cut funding for financial regulator

Text: san diegonew york reuters  a federal judge on thursday said he wa leaning toward approving a  million settlement of fraud claim against president donald trump and his trump university real estate seminar but deferred a final decision to a later date at a hearing in san diego judge gonzalo curiel noted that under the class action settlement former trump university student were expected to recover percent of the money they spent on course and mentoring program that is an extraordinary amount the judge said noting the recovery rate in similar lawsuit is usually closer to between and percent he did not specify when he would rule a florida woman objected to the settlement saying she should have the opportunity to opt out and take trump to court herself patrick coughlin a class action lawyer for the student said the student would actually receive over percent of their money back some student submitted claim form in the class action that date to according to court paper the student who paid a much a  for the seminar claimed they were lured by false promise that they would learn trumps investing secrets from his handpicked instructor trump vowed to continue fighting the fraud claim during the presidential election campaign but agreed to the settlement soon after he ha admitted he did not personally select the instructor but his lawyer have described the claim a mere sale puffery trump accused curiel of bias last year based on the indianaborn judges mexican ancestry sherri simpson of fort lauderdale florida who paid  objected to the settlement provision blocking student from opting out of the deal she ha said in court paper she would like to seek full recovery from trump plus punitive damage and other relief gary friedman a lawyer for simpson argued in court the notice were defective curiel questioned friedman and said he would consider the objection
Title_Text: u judge view  million trump university settlement favorably

Text: washington reuters  u representative mark meadow chairman of the conservative house freedom caucus said on sunday there is a possibility that his group could support a tax reform plan that is not revenue neutral does it have to be what they would say revenue neutral or do you have to have an offset like with the border adjustment tax i think theres been a lot of flexibility in term of some of my contact in conservative in term of not making it totally offset  meadow said in an interview on abcs this week with george stephanopoulos a fiscal conservative meadow had said that tax reform depended on the repeal of obamacare in order to offset the likely cost of tax cut president donald trump ha already said he will move on from dealing with healthcare to his tax plan and in a tweet on sunday morning blamed the freedom caucus for keeping obamacare intact democrats are smiling in dc that the freedom caucus with the help of club for growth and heritage have saved planned parenthood ocare he tweeted meadow whose group wa pivotal in sinking the republican plan to repeal obamacare in the house said he had not yet given up on effort to reform healthcare before tackling tax reform i still believe that there is a good chance if moderate and conservative can come together that we repeal and replace obamacare bring premium down cover more people he said
Title_Text: republican meadow tax plan doe not have to be revenue neutral

Text: two month before the winter olympics in seoul south korea olympic gold medal skier lindsey vonn claimed she would be representing the united state but not president trump when she returned to the winter gamesvonn who won a gold medal in the woman s downhill competition in in vancouver skipped the sochi game because of knee injury i hope to represent the people of the united state not the president vonn said this week amid the buildup to the game in pyeongchang south korea fox newsvonn s ridiculous and unnecessary comment threw her into the middle of a nasty controversy on social medium unfortunately with one hateful statement vonn managed to alienate a large number of fan who were rooting for her to bring home the gold for the united state if she didn t already know someone should have told vonn that u olympic athlete are supposed to be representing the united state of america and not the president of the united state only three day after vonn s statement about boycotting president trump s invitation to the white house she suffered a back injury that caused her to lose the world cup race a she placed th in the competitionyesterday vonn lost her first olympic race in eight year after a late mistake that cost her a medal american responded to her loss on social medium reminding her of her desire to make her race about her hate for donald trump instead of Text: it seems donald trump s cruelty know no bound especially after his latest campaign rallyduring a rally in the middle of a very cold winter night in vermont trump ordered security to throw a bernie sander supporter out of the building without his coatseveral sander supporter gained entrance into the burlington rally at the flynn center throughout the evening in order to heckle and interrupt the republican presidential wannabeof course the sander fan managed to annoy trump to the point where his campaign team actually began to screen people to make sure they were trump fan considering how trump ha treated protester and heckler during previous rally it wa only a matter of time before he treated them heartlesslyat one point in particular trump directed attention toward one man and ordered security to escort him out this normally would not be unusual since heckler and protester are escorted out of rally all the time but in this instance trump noted the extremely cold temperature outside and told security to throw the man out into the freezing air without his coat i thought i heard a little voice over there get him outta there don t give him his coat keep his coat confiscate his coat you know it s about ten degree below zero outside no you can keep his coat tell him we ll send it to him in a couple of week and trump s supporter cheered the cruelty a the man wa parted from his coat and forced to go without it during a freezing night in vermonthere s the video via youtubetrump went on to acknowledge that he expected some sander supporter to interrupt his rally since he wa in vermont sander home statesanders and trump have engaged each other recently through medium and social medium the most notable of which occurred when sander criticized trump for not supporting wage increase for worker during an interview on cbs the very next day trump flipflopped on the minimum wage posting on twitter that it s bad that worker haven t received much of a raise in yearsfeatured image via flickr
Title_Text: donald trump tell security to throw bernie sander supporter out into the cold without his coat video

Text: ankara reuters  the syriankurdish ypg militia ha attacked a turkish military observation post in syria s idlib with mortar the staterun anadolu news agency said on monday adding that there were no casualty the turkish military retaliated after the attack which hit the observation post in the darat izza region and some civilian settlement with five mortar anadolu said

Text: because only a right wing nut belief if you re paying a fortune to attend college you should get an actual education the guiding principle of the university of wisconsin is the wisconsin idea a concept first outlined in by thenuw president charles van hise who declared i shall never be content until the beneficent influence of the university reach every home in the state with the rise of the progressive movement which pioneered populist and socialist reform the uw came to view the wisconsin idea a a mandate to use it research power to influence and direct government policytoday the university proclaims the wisconsin idea is the principle that the university should improve people s life beyond the classroom it span uw madison s teaching research outreach and public service with higher education cost skyrocketing and student loan debt hanging over graduate for decade after college medium tracker is launching a weekly feature that look at individual university of wisconsin professor and measure their area of research and the class they teach against the standard of the wisconsin ideaprof karma r chavez is an associate professor at uwmadison s department of communication art according to a uw employee salary database maintained by the wisconsin state journal chavez made  during the  fiscal year and ha achieved tenure at the schoolchavez teach seven different course ranging from queer theory ca to queer migration ca and rhetoric and queer theory also ca chavez take pride in her work cofounding of the queer migration research network and the uw s comparative u study cuss group i work with various grassroots social justice organization and collective claim on her official uw biographythe queer migration research network describes what it doe a queer migration scholarship critically explores how sexual and gender normativities shape regulate and contest contemporary international migration process that stem from history of colonialism global capitalism genocide slavery and racialized patriarchy in a essay chavez argued that academic and the medium should work together to eliminate reference to border security when discussing the southern border in the context of the immigration debate and instead talk about border militarization chavez claim in her piece that president reagan s administration wa most responsible for rolling out the immense infrastructure that would lead to the most drastic border militarization she further claimed that border security effort use military tactic to control targeted population along the borderaccording to chavez the consequence of border security effort to date ha led to the rape of woman including rape perpetrated by u border official she cite no proof of this shocking assertion writing only that many migrant woman have reported being raped under the condition of militarization for reason that would not exist if not for militarization put another way chavez claim that if the u abolishes all border security effort woman seeking to cross the border will no longer be raped by u border official or those who ply in the smuggling of human across the bordera weekly radio host on wort chavez recently hosted show that criticized israel s effort to defend itself from the terrorist group hamas and examined the cultural history of american nudism nowhere on her website doe chavez try to connect the study of queer migration to the wisconsin idea of improveing people s life beyond the classroom via eag news
Title_Text: insane salary paid to progressive univ of wisconsins queer migration teacher

Text: the houston police department and texas ranger are investigating after a gun nut opened fire on the office of democratic state senator john whitmire a day before president obama is scheduled to speak in austinearly thursday morning around am a shooter fired several round into the twostory office there are bullet slug everywhere whitmire said one lodged in a framed picture it s pretty amazing whitemire a gun control advocate surmised that the weapon used in the attack wa an ar because the bullet were caliber no one wa harmed in the shooting but whitmire and his staff along with law enforcement official are taking the incident seriously we ll take precaution but it s part of the job unfortunately in this day and time whitmire said they are checking in this general area to see if anyone else received any gunfire we don t know yet i don t know yet the targeting of whitmire s office occurred the day before president obama is scheduled to appear at the south by southwest tech and music festival on friday where he is delivered a keynote addressupon hearing of obama s schedule texas open carry gun nut stated their desire to attend the event with their gun to hand out prolaw literature but one of the gun nut had a different idea for what his buddy should do if you get a clear shot please fire for effect conservative gun nut kris elliot wrote on facebookso not only ha the texas open carry obsession resulted in violence against a democratic office it ha resulted in gun nut actually wanting to assassinate president obama and now it s much easier for them to do this because they are legally allowed to carry deadly firearm in public viewmake no mistake these people belong in jail or at the very least an fbi watch list but a long a republican control the state it will remain an exaggerated and embarrassing version of the wild westfeatured image onlyinyourstatecom
Title_Text: texas gun nut open fire on democratic office of gun controlsupporting senator

Text: washington reuters  the u government will open the door next week to a new agency with stronger data protection meant to shorten by many week the time it take to vet government worker seeking secret and top secret security clearance the national background investigation bureau will be headed by charles phalen who ha worked a a security executive at the cia the fbi and defense contractor northrop grumman official said on thursday on a conference call with reporter the bureau will replace an office of personnel management opm clearance system that wa hit by hacker who stole potentially sensitive personal data on a many a million people including government employee and job applicant phalen and opm director beth cobert said a top priority for the bureau will be shortening delay in the clearance process which can hold up the hiring of government employee for month cobert said that opm figure show on average the time required to complete an investigation for a secret level security clearance is now day for a top secret clearance it is day on average these timeline are well too long phelan acknowledged cobert said the new agencys goal would be to reduce the time for completing a secret clearance to day and to cut the time for a top secret investigation to day official said that individual government agency rather than the new central investigation bureau would be responsible for social medium check of security clearance applicant official said that the new bureau would still depend on outside contractor especially for hiring field investigator the new agency will employ government worker and contract employee official said
Title_Text: u to open new vetting agency for secret security clearance
