Text: the dhs ha announced that they ll be raiding place that house illegals and deporting them this could get ugly and it will only garner sympathy for the illegal alien who ve broken federal law by crossing our border over illegal minor came across our border in septoct which is a record for this time of year the big question in all of this would have to be why jeh johnson s rule for deportation have been so lenient because of his leniency word ha gotten back to central america that you can just surrender to border patrol and you re in now we have million and million of illegals who re roaming around america and we have no clue who they are the sanctuary movement is taking it upon themselves to bring in and protect illegals while putting american in danger thousand of criminal illegal alien were simply released last year yes obama let them go all american are in danger from this open border policy and those in the church community should go to jail for aiding this invasion of our southern border leader of the churchbased sanctuary movement vowed on friday to offer their place of worship a refuge for immigrant facing deportation under an obama administration crackdown on central american family who entered the united state illegallythe statement came two day after the washington post first reported the u government wa planning a series of raid to remove hundred of undocumented family a early a january in the first such largescale effort targeting the recent flood of border crossersthe department of homeland security preparation to intensify deportation of central american migrant confirmed by u government source drew immediate fire from democratic presidential candidate and human right groupsleaders of the multidenominational sanctuary movement which ha sheltered at least immigrant from deportation over the past month joined in the criticism on friday alluding to the biblical nativity story of mary and joseph seeking refuge before the birth of jesus a pastor we know that each and every family is a holy family said the rev alison harrington pastor of southside presbyterian church in tucson arizona we open our door to today s joseph and mary the gift we have to offer on christmas day is the gift of sanctuary the sanctuary movement which harrington said encompasses about congregation in a dozen u city made headline in january by providing refuge in philadelphia to a honduran woman whose two child were born in the united state she ultimately won a twoyear reprieve from deportationthe rev noel anderson a coordinator for the affiliated church world service put the overall number of congregation supporting the sanctuary network at about in more than state nationwideimmigrants from el salvador guatemala and nicaragua have been streaming into the united state from mexico by the thousand since early many of them unaccompanied minor and family fleeing extreme poverty gang and drug violence in their home countriesmost were detained after turning themselves in at the border seeking asylum but were released to surrounding community after initial screening to await further proceedingsa u antihuman tracking law bar undocumented central american child from being summarily sent back a they could be if they were from mexico or canadagovernment source speaking on condition of anonymity have said the new campaign by the u immigration and custom enforcement ice agency mark an expansion from mostly targeting individual to pursuing family with undocumented member who have already been ordered to leaveasked why the agency wa singling out family a spokesperson said the crackdown focused on individual who pose a threat to national security public safety and border security whether alone or with family member support for the move came from u senate homeland security committee chairman ron johnson a wisconsin republican who said it would help eliminate the incentive that result from allowing percent of these illegal immigrant to stay harrington said she feared the crackdown will ensnare many who lacked sufficient time or legal representation to prepare asylum claim and were too quickly put through the system
Title_Text: church offer sanctuary to protect illegal alien ahead of dhs raid

Text: washington reuters  the secretive u foreign intelligence surveillance court ha issued it first order allowing the national security agency to collect telephone record under a new electronic spying law congress passed last year according to an order from the court posted tuesday on a website operated by the office of the director of national intelligence the court issued the order on dec the order signed by fisc chief judge thomas hogan said the court concluded that a surveillance application apparently submitted by the nsa met the requirement of the usa freedom act which president barack obama signed last year that law replaced an older one that allowed nsa to collect telephone metadata  record of american citizens and residents call including their origin and destination when a call wa placed and how long it lasted however u intelligence official have said the nsa did not collect the content of phone call under this program and did not look at the data without some specific justification former nsa contractor edward snowden revealed classified detail of the collection program in and last year congress and the obama administration narrowed the governments power to collect such domestic telephone metadata under the new law and revised procedure the government no longer collect bulk telephone metadata but must request targeted information from telecom company after obtaining authorization from the foreign intelligence court the identity of the telecom providers and the individual or number whose metadata the nsa ha targeted were redacted from the version of the court order released on tuesday hogan say in the opinion that the government wa seeking the ongoing daily production of detailed call record relating to an authorized international terrorism investigation but doe not offer further detail about the nature of the investigation in his order the judge accepts the argument that while the government wa obliged to explain why targeting the telephone number of individual is relevant to it investigation it doe not need to demonstrate the same relevance when examining number called from the initially targeted phone the judge also said that although the new surveillance law requires government agency to promptly destroy telephone metadata that it might have mistakenly collected on u person they sometimes can retain such data for a long a six month if they have reason to believe it could provide evidence of a crime
Title_Text: secret u court issue first order for phone data under new law

Text: ljubljana reuters  antiestablishment slovenian presidential candidate marjan sarec who narrowly lost to president borut pahor in an election runoff on sunday is likely to run for parliament in general election due next june political analyst said i expect sarec to announce his candidacy very soon he might win supported by a large number of voter who are dissatisfied with the political establishment tanja staric an analyst at radio slovenia told reuters on monday sarec finished with percent to pahor s percent in the runoff the tightest presidential race result since slovenia s independence in from thenfederal yugoslavia sarec whose centerleft lista marjana sarca ha so far been active only at local level indicated he will run for parliament my result at the presidential election is very good i am very happy with itthis is not my last word in politics he said on his twitter account late on sunday sarec say change of approach are needed to further improve slovenia s economy and lift living standard in an antiestablishment pitch he call for politician to listen to voter closely and come up with practical solution to their problem he also want electoral rule change to allow people to vote for individual candidate rather than party sarec is a former actor and comedian whose second mandate a mayor of kamnik in northern slovenia expires next year analyst forecast election defeat next year for the party of modern centre of prime minister miro cerar because of widespread dissatisfaction particularly over lengthening waiting time for examination and other procedure in the national health system the government face pressure for public sector wage hike but want to keep a lid on spending given relatively high level of budget deficit and public debt a poll published by daily newspaper delo on monday showed social democrat earlier led by pahor before he ran for president a independent though still with sd support led with percent followed by main opposition centerright slovenian democratic party with percent another poll released on monday by the novatv website put the sd in the lead with percent trailed by the sd at percent with half the electorate still undecided pollster have so far not included sarec s party in their sounding
Title_Text: antielite slovene presidential candidate seen running for parliament after narrow loss

Text: mexico city reuters  venezuela s former chief prosecutor luisa ortega met mexico s attorney general on thursday a mexican official said week after she fled her homeland accusing venezuelan president nicolas maduro of involvement in corruption ortega who wa removed from her position earlier this month said a week ago she had evidence that maduro wa involved in graft with construction company odebrecht the yearold ortega ha said she would give detail of the corruption case to authority in the united state spain mexico brazil and colombia mexican attorney general raul cervantes met ortega for around minute in mexico city an official at the attorney general s office said he gave no further detail of the meeting and spoke on condition of anonymity late on thursday ortega posted a picture on twitter of herself with cervantes in mexico saying the two had met to coordinate action in the fight against corruption picture posted on social medium earlier on thursday showed ortega arriving at mexico city airport ortega say she ha been persecuted by opponent in an effort to hide detail of highlevel corruption and that she ha proof of it she wa a key player in venezuela s government before breaking with it in march ortega left venezuela for colombia and traveled to brazil to meet prosecutor last week odebrecht admitted in a settlement with u and brazilian prosecutor to paying bribe across country to win contract according to a u court ruling odebrecht paid about  million in bribe in country including brazil argentina colombia mexico and venezuela between and mexico s government ha been sharply critical of the maduro administration accusing it of undermining democracy
Title_Text: former venezuelan prosecutor meet mexican attorney general

Text: sen john mccain is fed up with donald trump and his big mouth following trump s illadvised decision to challenge north korea with fire and fury the arizona republican let him know it in no uncertain termsspeaking about trump s latest bluster and bravado regarding nuclear war mccain told an arizona radio station that he take exception to the president s word because you got to be sure you can do what you say you re going to do he then added that he doesn t even know what the hell trump is talking about anymore i don t know what he s saying and i ve long ago given up trying to interpret what he say mccain said that kind of rhetoric i m not sure how it help mccain explained that trump and his ego are going to spark a serious confrontation with north korea he advised trump to familiarize himself with former president teddy roosevelt s big stick policy in other word the old walk softly but carry a big stick teddy roosevelt s saying which i think is something that should ve applied because all it s going to do is bring u closer to a serious confrontation mccain warned i think this is very very very serious new sen mccain reacts to trump north korea threat on local arizona radio pictwittercomcgvygpshlr marianna sotomayor mariannanbcnews august trump seems intent on playing a dangerous game with north korean dictator kim jong un after news broke that north korea is believed to have weapon capable of reaching the united state trump decided to double dog dare kim jong un to keep provoking him north korea best not make any more threat to the united state trump declared tuesday he ha been very threatening beyond a normal state and a i said they will be met with fire fury and frankly power the like of which this world ha never seen before this is terrifying when you take into account the type of fire and fury that we have seen here s a little reminder in case you have forgotten just what nuclear war actually look likethe world ha seen fire and fury pictwittercomvvsorkkufg schooley rschooley august fire and fury are the last thing we need when discussing a nuclear warread morefeatured image via justin sullivangetty image
Title_Text: mccain open up a can of whoop a on trump for threatening north korea with nuclear war

Text: the republican senator who gained infamy last year by attempting to sabotage a historic nuclear deal with iran is back at it again this time by trying to derail a crucial appropriation bill so america is forced to violate the agreementarkansas sen tom cotton got the moniker tehran tom after he and many of his republican colleague in the senate sent a brazenly out of line letter directly to the iranian capitol in an effort to convince the country to stop negotiating with president obama the plan not only backfired the iranian delighted in mocking the republican but it led to a major backlash from across the country politics may be getting nasty but it seems betraying your country to score a cheap shot against the president still cross a major lineunable to understand when he ha lost cotton ha since been working behind the scene to undermine the agreement any way he can this week he and his loyal band of obstructionist introduced an amendment intentionally meant to rankle relation between the two country cotton had tried to bar the purchase of heavy water produced in iran heavy water is a component of making nuclear weapon and nuclear energy part of the deal with iran involved the country handing over it stock of heavy water to show they were serious about ending their nuclear program but cotton doesn t want america to take it why because then the deal would Text: albany new york reuters  a new york judge on monday dismissed a challenge to canadianborn ted cruzs eligibility to run in the states republican presidential primary election next month saying the challenger had missed a key deadline for filing two new york resident barry korman of manhattan and william gallo of manhasset long island on feb filed the petition to block cruz a u senator from texas from getting onto the april ballot saying his birth in the canadian province of alberta make him ineligible to be president state law requires that a petition challenging eligibility be filed within three day of when a candidate file to be placed on the ballot korman and gallo filed their petition more than two week after cruz filed his paperwork to get on the ballot the judge said weinstein said at an earlier hearing that the case could cause chaos if it went ahead the case wa one of several similar challenge to cruzs eligibility to run for the white house  including suit in alabama illinois pennsylvania and texas the illinois suit wa dismissed last week on a technicality republican frontrunner donald trump ha repeatedly brought up question about whether cruz meet the constitutional requirement to be president the constitution say that to be president a person must be a naturalborn citizen of the united state cruz ha argued that he is eligible to run because of his mothers u citizenship and many legal expert say it is unlikely any judge in the united state would block his presidential bid cruzs father is a cuban immigrant a lawyer for the objector roger bernstein said an appeal is likely editing by richard valdmanis and leslie adler this article wa funded in part by sap it wa independently created by the reuters editorial staff sap had no editorial involvement in it creation or production
Title_Text: ny judge dismisses attempt to block canadaborn cruz from state ballot

Text: washington reuters  the pentagons next fiveyear budget proposal seek over  billion in funding for a new submarine to carry nuclear ballistic missile plus order for more boeing co ban and lockheed martin corp lmtn fighter jet according to source familiar with the plan the plan also shift the navys strategy for a new carrierbased unmanned drone to focus more on intelligencegathering and refueling than combat strike mission said the source who were not authorized to discus it publicly before the budgets release u defense secretary ash carter plan to map out his spending priority for the  billion defense budget on tuesday ahead of the official budget release on feb the pentagons plan will also underscore the need to fund all three leg of the u strategic deterrent triad  a new air force bomber a replacement for the ohioclass submarine that carry nuclear weapon and new nucleararmed intercontinental ballistic missile said one of the source the navys proposed fiscal budget will fund procurement of material for the new submarine that take a long time to acquire with funding for construction of the first full new submarine to follow in fiscal said one of the source over the next five year the navy would spend over  billion on research and development of the new submarine plus over  billion in procurement funding the source said general dynamic corp gdn ha the lead role on the new submarine to replace the current ohioclass of submarine together with huntington ingalls industry inc hiin boeing would receive well over  billion in new aircraft order a it seek to extend production at the companys st louis facility the navy will request funding for two boeing faef super hornet a part of the fiscal war budget and in the fiscal budget said one of the source navy official also will likely add a request for more boeing super hornet to their annual list of unfunded priorities for fiscal said one of the source those move are aimed at filling a shortfall in the number of strike fighter available on aircraft carrier given delay in the lockheed f fighter jet program and longerthanexpected repair time for current boeing fa jet the fiveyear budget plan call for lockheed to sell a total of f fighter jet to the navy and marine corp  cmodel jet that take off and land on aircraft carrier and bmodel jet which can take off from shorter runway and land like a helicopter according to one of the source the proposal also narrow the mission of a new drone to be built by the u navy the source said to reflect the change the navy plan to rename the new drone program the carrierbased air refueling system or cbars instead of the unmanned carrierlaunched airborne surveillance and strike uclass program said one of the source the drone would have an initial limited strike capability but more could be added in coming year the source said boeing lockheed northrop grumman corp nocn which make the unmanned unarmed xb plane that ha been tested on u carrier and privately held general atomics spent ten of million of dollar to prepare for the previous tender but the program wa put on hold in pending a pentagonwide review of intelligence and surveillance program
Title_Text: exclusive u budget plan includes over  billion for new submarine  source

Text: reuters  a new jersey man who worked at the world trade center a young new yorker a belgian mother of two and five argentine celebrating their high school graduation year ago were killed in the truck attack on a new york city bike path twelve other people were injured in tuesdays attack in lower manhattan by an uzbek immigrant who allegedly drove the truck onto the path along the hudson river it wa the deadliest attack in the city since sept u and foreign official identified the dead a  darren drake of new milford new jersey his father james drake told local news medium that his son wa a project manager at moodys investor service at the world trade center near the scene of the rampage  nicholas clef of new york city clef wa a software engineer who lived in a west village apartment within biking distance of the hudson according to a friend who spoke with multiple news medium outlet clef attended little red school house and elisabeth irwin high school known collectively a lrei from kindergarten through th grade he graduated from the private manhattan school in and in recent year worked on it technology staff parttime the schools director phil kassen wrote on it alumnus page on facebook nicholas wa kind caring curious interested and a great friend kassen wrote he always had a kind word when you would pas him in the hall and the biggest smile and always offered to help no matter the situation  anne laure decadt of staden belgium decadt wa visiting new york with her two sister and mother she wa cycling on the bike path when the truck hit her from behind cnn affiliate vtm reported her mother and sister were not hurt decadt was a fantastic wife and the most beautiful mom to our two son of month and year old this loss is unbearable and difficult to understand her husband alexander naessens said in an interview with local belgium news medium  the five argentine men were all from the city of rosario their journey to new york had been organized by ariel erlij whose company ivanar sa distributes steel product the businessman had helped pay for two of his friend to go on the trip the five men were  erlij  hernn diego mendoza  diego enrique angelini  alejandro damin pagnucco  hernn ferruchi
Title_Text: factbox belgian mother of two young new yorker among victim of truck attack

Text: bauchi nigeria reuters  suspected member of islamist militant group boko haram took over a town in the restive state of borno in northeast nigeria on saturday resident said the attack come day after a suicide bomber killed at least people at a mosque in neighbouring adamawa state in one of the deadliest attack since president muhammadu buhari came to power in pledging to end the eightyear insurgency resident said attacker entered magumeri around km mile from borno state capital maiduguri around pm gmt they said the insurgent shot sporadically and threw explosive device prompting local to flee to a forest we hurriedly took our family to the bush before they could get u almost every resident is hiding here said wakil bulama one of two resident who spoke to reuters by telephone a military source who did not want to be identified said magumeri had been attacked but could not confirm whether it had been seized boko haram ha waged an insurgency in northeastern nigeria since in it attempt to create an islamic state in the region the group ha killed more than and forced around million people to flee their home
Title_Text: suspected boko haram militant take over northeast nigeria town resident

Text: washington reuters  there will be no planned announcement on friday of u president donald trumps nominee for fbi director the white house said trump fired the former director james comey on may in a surprise announcement that sparked day of political turmoil on thursday the president said he wa close to choosing a replacement
Title_Text: white house say will not announce fbi director nominee on friday

Text: jarkuduk uzbekistan reuters  uzbekistan will no longer have thousand of student teacher and healthcare worker pick the cotton harvest prime minister abdulla aripov said on saturday confirming a halt to a practice condemned abroad a forced labor government official and other source told reuters earlier this week the central asian nation one of the world s leading cotton exporter had abruptly withdrawn student teacher and medical worker from the autumn harvest it s forever aripov said when asked by reporter whether the government had pulled student and state employee from the field only for the current harvest rather than for good student should study state employee should work he said officially the harvest work ha been voluntary and paid at about  per kilogram in reality those who refuse risk expulsion or dismissal from their job unless they bribe an official or hire someone to work in their place according to source familiar with the matter the move dovetailed with reform undertaken by president shavkat mirziyoyev in the tightly ruled former soviet republic since veteran strongman leader islam karimov s death a year ago mirziyoyev ha moved to liberalize foreign exchange and travel regulation and had about people struck off a blacklist of potential extremist reform that may help him rebuild tie with the west and attract foreign investment despite ending the use of child labor in under international pressure including boycott campaign uzbekistan ranked among the top five worst offender in the global slavery index compiled last year by activist group walk free foundation the foundation estimated that almost percent of the uzbek population  million  lived in modern slavery placing he country second only to north korea in that category
Title_Text: uzbekistan drop use of student teacher nurse a cottonpickers pm

Text: brussels reuters  eu foreign policy chief federica mogherini said on wednesday that the european union and the united state would continue to work together following donald trumps election a u president euus tie are deeper than any change in politics well continue to work together rediscovering the strength of europe mogherini high representative of the union for foreign affair and security policy said in a tweet eu official and diplomat said european government may need to strengthen their own cooperation if a trump administration pull back from international commitment

Text: cairo reuters  the former leader of egypt s muslim brotherhood islamist movement mohamed akef ha died in a cairo hospital after an illness the group s lawyer said on friday akef wa supreme guide of the movement a the leadership is known until the end of he wa among those detained in a crackdown after egypt s elected president mohamed mursi also of the muslim brotherhood wa ousted by the military in akef s daughter announced his death on her facebook page the group s lawyer abdel monem abdel maqsoud told reuters he had received a call from the prison service to report akef s death in cairo s qasr eleyni hospital president abdel fattah alsisi ha engaged in the toughest crackdown on islamist in egypt s modern history since toppling mursi when sisi wa still head of the armed force he wa later elected president sisi present himself a a bulwark against militant extremism a egypt battle an islamist insurgency in northern sinai but he ha come under attack from right group who say his time in power ha seen the worst crackdown in their history

Text: ankara reuters  turkey is investigating report that turkish folk dancer applied for asylum after attending a folk dance festival in the hungarian capital budapest staterun news agency anadolu said ankara prosecutor have launched an investigation into the dancer who received special passport to attend the festival a only five dancer of a group of returned to turkey it wa not clear where the remaining dancer may have sought asylum the hungarian immigration office said they did not submit asylum request in hungary but gave no further detail the folk dance team from ankara arrived on nov four day before the event the private dogan news agency said the team had previously attended an event in bosnia and herzegovina in july and the whole team had returned to turkey afterwards according to medium report it wa not immediately clear why the dancer sought refuge turkey ha jailed more than people in the aftermath of a failed coup attempt last year and is seeking thousand of others for alleged tie to the coup
Title_Text: turkey investigates report that folk dancer sought asylum

Text: donald trump might be desperately trying to win over the latino vote with his false claim that he love hispanic but he s going to have a really hard time especially when he continues to expose himself a a racist in his everyday interactionson monday trump s campaign cancelled an interview with freelance journalist marcos stupenengo at the very last minute stupenengo who is originally from argentina wa already in the trump tower and had gotten the campaign s approval to do the interview with trump for tv azteca while he wa waiting for trump stupenengo took a phone call and wa heard talking in spanish nearly a soon a the word came out of stupenengo s mouth the trump campaign did a complete and turned him away according to a buzzfeed report but a he waited to conduct the interview stupenengo received a call and began speaking in spanish that s when the trump campaign informed him they had no interest in taking part in an interview with him according to a source with knowledge of the incident once trump s campaign decided to cut the interview one of trump s secret service agent wa forced to tell stupenengo that he had to leave the agent apologized to stupenengo and said that he didn t know what wa happening when buzzfeed reached out to stupenengo the journalist s comment were short i can say that after year of journalism worse thing have happened to me team trump is actually lying through their teeth and denying that this incident ever happened trump spokeswoman hope hick said there wa no interview scheduled we do not know this individual or anything about the alleged situation stupenengo isn t the only spanishspeaking reporter that ha been shunned by trump last august trump kicked univision s jorge ramos out of a press conference telling him to go back to univision featured image via spencer platt getty image
Title_Text: trump abruptly cancel interview for an extremely racist reason

Text: berlin reuters  german foreign minister sigmar gabriel on saturday denied a report that said the social democrat whose party ha agreed to enter talk with chancellor angela merkel s conservative on forming a coalition wa eyeing the post of finance minister news magazine der spiegel reported that gabriel had recently told senior member of his spd party that he wa interested in becoming german finance minister if the spd agreed to a rerun of the current grand coalition with merkel s conservative what spiegel is writing is sheer nonsense gabriel told deutschlandfunk radio i m in a caretaker government and no one know what the next government will look like more than two month after a national election germany ha not managed to form a new government so the conservative coalition from the last legislative period is still in power merkel who lost many supporter to the farright in september s election is banking on the spd to extend her year tenure after attempt to cobble together an awkward threeway alliance with the liberal free democrat and environmentalist green crumbled if the spd were to agree to another grand coalition  an option that the spd say is by no mean a foregone conclusion  and demand the finance ministry it would likely result in change to germany s european policy such a more focus on spending and investment rather than austerity wolfgang schaeuble who wa germany s conservative finance minister until he took on the role of president in october became unpopular among struggling euro zone state during his eight year in office due to his focus on austerity spd leader martin schulz said on thursday that europe could not afford to undergo another four year of the kind of european policy that schaeuble had practiced
Title_Text: germany gabriel denies report he is eyeing finance minister post

Text: moscow reuters  russia doe not believe that u president donald trumps new strategy on afghanistan will lead to any significant positive change in the country the interfax news agency cited an unnamed russian foreign ministry source a saying on tuesday trump on monday committed the united state to an openended conflict in afghanistan reversing course from his campaign pledge and signaling he would send troop to americas longest war in a fight to win
Title_Text: russia think trump new afghan strategy will not bring benefit ifax

Text: donald trump is an established denier of climate change and lover of absurd conspiracy theory during the first presidential debate on monday hillary clinton slammed him for claiming that global warming is a chinese hoax donald think that climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the chinese clinton said on the debate stage i think it s real i think science is real trump promptly interrupted her to declare that he hadn t ever said anything of the sort i did not i did not countered trump i do not say that go figure this wa a boldfaced lie in trump tweeted thistrump later claimed he wa just joking after bernie sander nailed him to the wall for this ridiculous theory but he still insisted that climate change is a hoax that benefit china well i think the climate change is just a very very expensive form of tax a lot of people are making a lot of money i know much about climate change i d be received environmental award and i often joke that this is done for the benefit of china obviously i joke trump said to fox news in january but this is done for the benefit of china because china doe not do anything to help climate change they burn everything you could burn they couldn t care less they have very you know their standard are nothing but they in the meantime they can undercut u on price so it s very hard on our business the gop nominee ha repeatedly claimed that global warming is a hoax he argued this point on fox news in and his twitter feed abounds with similar statementssooner or later you d think trump would learn that lying about what he ha said doesn t work especially if it wa said on television or social medium but apparently this is a lesson that hasn t quite sunk in yetwatch trump lie about claiming that global warming is a chinese hoax herefeatured image via win mcnameegetty image
Title_Text: trump is full of sht he most certainly ha said that global warming is a chinese hoax video

Text: nbc news chairman andy lack confessed to nervousness about megyn kelly s upcoming network morning show saying the risk is unnerving and a little scary lack s confession about kelly s upcoming debut is not exactly a vote of confidence for their  million golden girl kelly the former fox news host is debuting her daily am et show megyn kelly today on sept her summertime sunday night with megyn kelly newsmagazine program served a a test launch of sort but it disappointed both critically and in the ratingslack signed kelly away from fox with an offer reportedly worth more than  million a year her show will follow savannah guthrie and matt lauer on nbc s treasured today show which win it time slot in the vaunted to demographic wfb
Title_Text: nbc news chief make ugly confession about debut of new show with unpopular  million host megyn kelly

Text: weakness invite aggression and it s hard to imagine we could have a weaker more apathetic president so this news should come a a surprise to no one north korea on sunday defied international warning and launched a longrange rocket that the united nation and others call a cover for a banned test of technology for a missile that could strike the u mainlandwhatever motif pyongyang may have about using it rocket launch to develop nucleartipped longrange missile it now ha two satellite circling the earth according to norad the north american aerospace command which monitor all satellite in orbitboth of the kwangmyongsong or shining star satellite complete their orbit in about minute and based on data released by international organization tracking them the new one passed almost right over levi s stadium about an hour after the super bowl ended it passed almost directly overhead silicon valley which is where i am and where the stadium is tech watcher martyn williams said in an email to the associated press the pas happened at pm after the game i would put it down to nothing more than a coincidence but an interesting one the game in santa clara california ended at pm local timenorth korea claim sunday s successful satellite launch wa it fourththe first two have never been confirmed by anyone else but expert worldwide agree it got one into orbit in and norad which is hardly a propaganda mouthpiece for pyongyang now ha both that and the satellite launched on sunday on it official satellite listkwangmyongsong the satellite launched sunday ha the norad catalog number and kwangmyongsong  launched in is they are described a earth observation satellite and weigh about kilogram pound apiecetheir main application according to pyongyang are monitoring the weather mapping natural resource and forest distribution and providing data that might help farmer improve their cropsnorth korea s staterun medium quoted scientist and researcher at the north s state hydrometeorological administration a saying sunday they are are delighted at the news of the launch it deputy director ryu pong chol reportedly said it will give a big boost to north korean weather forecastersthat remains to be seenno signal from the previous satellite which north korea claimed transmitted the song of general kim il sung and song of general kim jong il after achieving orbit have ever been confirmed by outside observer that might be because it wa never stable enough to transmit anything back homesignals from the new satellite had also yet to be detected amateur and expert alike are doing their best to listen in around the world but it is unclear exactly what frequency the satellite is supposed to be using or what it will be transmittingvia ap
Title_Text: every american should be concerned about what flew over the super bowl stadium last night

Text: washington reuters  the u senate is expected to vote at am edt gmt on thursday on whether to limit debate and move toward the final confirmation of president donald trumps choice of federal judge neil gorsuch to take a seat on the u supreme court democrat are expected to thwart the republican effort by denying the vote needed in the member chamber to advance gorsuch if so republican are expected to take the rare step of changing senate rule so that they can advance the nomination with a minimum of republican vote which would clear the way for gorsuchs confirmation on friday
Title_Text: senate set to vote thursday on limiting supreme court nominee debate

Text: washington reuters  donald trumps election a president raise the prospect the united state will pull out of the nuclear pact it signed last year with iran alienating washington from it ally and potentially freeing iran to act on it ambition outgoing president barack obamas administration touted the deal a legacy foreign policy achievement a a way to suspend tehrans suspected drive to develop atomic weapon in return obama a democrat agreed to a lifting of most sanction the deal harshly opposed by republican in congress wa reached a a political commitment rather than a treaty ratified by lawmaker making it vulnerable to a new u president such a trump who might disagree with it term a republican trump ran for the white house opposing the deal but contradictory statement made it unclear how he would act in an upset over democrat hillary clinton trump won on tuesday and will succeed obama on jan a businessmanturnedpolitician who ha never held public office trump called the nuclear pact a disaster and the worst deal ever negotiated during his campaign and said it could lead to a nuclear holocaust in a speech to the proisrael lobby group aipac in march trump declared that his numberone priority would be to dismantle the disastrous deal with iran he said he would have negotiated a better deal with longer restriction but somewhat paradoxically he criticized remaining u sanction that prevent american company from dealing with iran by contrast he ha conceded it would be hard to destroy a deal enshrined in a united nation resolution in august he said he would not rip up the nuclear deal but that he would police that contract so tough they dont have a chance iran denies ever having considered developing atomic weapon but expert said any u violation of the deal would allow iran also to pull back from it commitment to curb nuclear development those commitment include reducing the number of it centrifuge by twothirds capping it level of uranium enrichment well below the level needed for bombgrade material reducing it enriched uranium stockpile from around kg to kg for year and submitting to international inspection to verify it compliance say goodbye to the iran deal said richard nephew a former u negotiator with iran now at columbia university there is very little likelihood that it stay either because of a deliberate decision to tear it up by trump or step that the u take which prompt an iranian walk back the spokesman of the atomic energy organization of iran behrouz kamalvandi wa quoted a saying by tasnim news agency iran is prepared for any change adding that iran would try to stand by the deal the nuclear deal wa divisive in iran with hardliner opposed to better relation with the west arguing that pragmatist president hassan rouhani wa giving up too much of the countrys nuclear infrastructure for too little relief rouhani said on wednesday the u election result would have no effect on tehrans policy state news agency irna quoted him a saying nlndah some of washingtons closest middle east ally have been skeptical of the nuclear deal israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu ha been outright hostile gulf leader say the deal ha emboldened irans pursuit of regional hegemony in part through support for proxy group fueling regional conflict iranian supreme leader ali khamenei whose power supersedes that of rouhani regularly criticizes the united state and say it should not be trusted but ultimately assented to the term of the deal known by it acronym jcpoa the big winner in the aftermath of a trump victory is irans supreme leader said suzanne maloney a foreign policy expert at the brookings institution he will have the most cartoonish american enemy he will exult in the hopefully brief crash of the american economy and he will be able to walk away from irans obligation under the jcpoa while pinning the responsibility on washington further complicating any trump effort to renegotiate the deal is that it is a multilateral agreement involving u ally in europe a well a fellow world power russia and china european and asian firm have been returning to iran and making major investment there meaning the united state would likely be alone in pulling out of the deal possibly isolating it from it partner on wednesday the head of gas renewables and power for french oil and gas company total totfpa in iran said trumps election would have no impact on investment npncw khamenei ha already promised to set fire to the nuclear deal if the west violates it iran ha repeatedly complained it ha not received benefit promised though european company have been eager to explore business prospect in iran few deal have been enacted in part because european bank have been reluctant to finance deal involving iran as to whether he can negotiate a better deal it take two or seven side to agree to begin that process something i rate a highly unlikely said zachary goldman executive director of the center on law and security at new york university and a former u treasury official and if we walk away from the deal i think we will be in the worst of all world  iran will feel freed from it commitment and we may be blamed for the deal falling apart
Title_Text: trump election put iran nuclear deal on shaky ground

Text: washington reuters  u senate democratic leader chuck schumer on wednesday called on the trump administration to preserve all document related to it dealing with russia including during the campaign and transition into office amid growing pressure for a deeper investigation schumer speaking to reporter also said trump campaign official should be called on to testify publicly over the matter and said attorney general jeff session should recuse himself from any related probe on russia
Title_Text: top senate democrat press trump administration amid call for probe

Text: st century wire say earlier in the week wire reported about the google employee who released a controversial word memo which went internally viral complaining about the silicon valley tech giant s ideological echo chamber a repressive intolerant corporate cultural where political correctness rule and which only caters to the leftist progressive side of the political paradigm any other viewpoint or opinion will not be tolerated at google the man who wrote the memo a a google engineer named james damore ha since been fired for voicing his opinion on the company s politicsas a result of the employee blowing the whistle on this issue other google employee like one jaana b dogan see tweet below appear to have threatened to leave the company in protest if human resource did not retaliate against the political whistleblowergoogle staffer dogan then go further and mock damore by hurling slur based on racial identity politicsof course the irony not surprisingly unknown to those at google is that dogan and others kneejerk political reaction only proved james damore s point that google ha fostered an insular political and intellectual ghetto which doe not tolerate any variance away for the prevailing groupthink de jour in the video released last weekend by youtube gamer pundit mister metokur the commentator predicted that the person who wrote that memo is probably going to be fired mister metokur wa right but there s an even bigger aspect to this story why is all this important because that same repressive political culture at google is reflected in how it program the new censorship algorithm of it search engine effectively disappearing political view and article it doe not like and wish to bury bloomberg business reportsalphabet inc s google ha fired an employee who wrote an internal memo blasting the web company s diversity policy creating a firestorm across silicon valleyjames damore the google engineer who wrote the note confirmed his dismissal in an email saying that he had been fired for perpetuating gender stereotype he said he s currently exploring all possible legal remedy the imbroglio at google is the latest in a long string of incident concerning gender bias and diversity in the tech enclave uber technology inc chief executive officer travis kalanick lost his job in june amid scandal over sexual harassment discrimination and an aggressive culture ellen pao s genderdiscrimination lawsuit against kleiner perkins caufield byers in also brought the issue to light and more woman are speaking up to say they ve been sidelined in the maledominated industry especially in engineering rolesearlier on monday google ceo sundar pichai sent a note to employee that said portion of the memo violate our code of conduct and cross the line by advancing harmful gender stereotype in our workplace but he didn t say if the company wa taking action against the employee a google representative asked about the dismissal referred to pichai s memodamore s page memorandum accused google of silencing conservative political opinion and argued that biological difference play a role in the shortage of woman in tech and leadership position it circulated widely inside the company and became public over the weekend causing a furor that amplified the pressure on google executive to take a more definitive standafter the controversy swelled danielle brown google s new vice president for diversity integrity and governance sent a statement to staff condemning damore s view and reaffirmed the company s stance on diversity in internal discussion board multiple employee said they supported firing the author and some said they would not choose to work with him according to posting viewed by bloomberg news we are unequivocal in our belief that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success a a company brown said in the statement we ll continue to stand for that and be committed to it for the long haul continue this story at bloombergread more google news at st century wire google filessupport wire subscribe become a member wiretv
Title_Text: a predicted google fire man who complained about firms repressive political culture

Text: the rightwing wa quick to claim that clinton had experienced her own moment with her basket full of deplorables remark but nothing could be further from the truth clinton s remark turn out to be fairly accuratein fact if anything clinton actually undersold just how deplorable trump s supporter actually are during an appearance on cbs s face the nation on sunday slate s chief political correspondent jamelle bouie explained how the statement clinton made is supported by scientific evidencebouie looked at polling data that showed that more than half of republican believe that president is a muslim or wa born in another country so i m inclined to see it a strategy and not so much a a gaffe because when i heard the remark my first question wa well is this true right regardless of how it sound what it look like what is the case about donald trump supporter bouie asks and if you break down the number and you look at the realclearpolitics average and it give trump percent of the registered voter there re about million people compare that to poll show to percent of all republican who say that barack obama either wasn t born in the united state or is a muslim if one doesn t think that believe that birtherism is a bad enough belief to hold to earn the title of deplorable then bouie ha the data to show that roughly have of republican are racist you look at pilot data from the american national election study and it show upward of percent of republican saying thing like black are more violent black are lazier muslim are more violent muslim are lazier bouie point out among trump supporter in particular percent of them agree with statement that political scientist categorize a being explicitly racist bouie continues so i m looking at clinton s statement and half which is about million people again doesn t really seem that out of bound forty to percent of republican i would say looking at the full spectrum of data agree with belief that we would categorize a explicitly prejudiced so regardless of whether or not clinton need to walk it back or not i think she s being correct and accurate conservative are angry at clinton because they still cannot accept that pointing out bigotry and racism do not make the person bringing it up racist clinton may have halfheartedly backtracked on her statement her sentiment wa worded poorly even if it wa accurateas bakari seller pointed out on sunday while on cnn s state of the union it doesn t matter how many of trump s supporter are bigoted racist or not because they are all supporting a candidate who is a bigotthere is no leftwing conspiracy out there to make republican and trump supporter like deplorable a polling indicates they selfidentify a being racist bigot on their ownyou can watch the clip belowfeatured image from video screenshot
Title_Text: jamelle bouie say science prof half of gop are deplorable video

Text: amateur president donald trump s hostility towards the environmental protection agency is revealing by his pick to head the epa who attacked his own agency during an address to the conservative political action summit last week the former reality show star is hell bent on raping the environment this time with an executive order directing the environmental protection agency and the army corp of engineer to consider rolling back a regulation aimed at protecting america s waterway from pollutionapparently the alleged president doesn t realize that human need water to live there s a price to pay for such action such a lawsuit and that s something trump is familiar with but he s about to get a ton of sht coming down on him via democratic attorney general for rolling back that protection on clean watertalking point memo report we strongly oppose president trump s action today that undermines clean water act protection and the public health and environment of our state the attorney general in new york hawaii massachusetts oregon vermont and the district of columbia said in a statementthe group of attorney general led by new york attorney general eric schneiderman suggested taking legal action against the trump administration in the statement we won t hesitate to protect our people and our environment including by aggressively opposing in court president trump s action that ignore both the law and the public s paramount need for clean water the ag wrote abandoning the clean water rule will allow uncontrolled pollution of these critical water resource it could also harm the competitiveness of our state economy by forcing u to spend more to clean up the pollution of deregulated water coming from upstream state that refuse to control such pollution they added in the statementas for scott pruitt trump s pick a environmental protection agency administrator it wa recently revealed that he used a private email to conduct state business while he wa attorney general in oklahoma and lied about it under oath trump picked a man to head the epa who previously wait for it sued the epa timestrump and pruitt are dangerous for our environmentphoto by mario tamagetty image
Title_Text: dem ag respond to trump rolling back clean water rule see you in court

Text: reuters  with golf long regarded a a stern measure of character and a natural setting for dealmaking u president donald trump and japanese prime minister shinzo abes weekend outing in florida could be viewed a more than a leisurely bonding exercise between two world leader u president trump and japanese prime minister abe will form a twosome for their round of golf on saturday presumably at the trump international golf club near his maralago resort in palm beach detail are still under wrap trump told a local sport radio station last weekend golf wa a better way to get to know someone than lunch and saw his matchup with abe a a fun meeting between partner rather than adversary abe might feel the occasion carry more weight his prime minister grandfather nobusuke kishi and u president dwight eisenhower played near washington in a round newspaper described a a triumph of diplomacy between former world war two enemy abe teed off the latest round of golf diplomacy in november giving trump an expensive goldcolored driver during their meeting at trump tower in manhattan where he sought assurance about the future strength of the decadesold alliance between the two nation with anxiety over trumps tough talk on currency security and trade with japan some in tokyo have expressed concern abe might be too generous in any haggling on the fairway when pitted against the real estate mogul and author of the art of the deal in purely a golfing sense abe is likely to find trump a formidable opponent he is pretty remarkable for a yearold guy jaime diaz editorinchief of golf world and a senior writer for golf digest told reuters as i understand it his handicap is that seems a little low but i think he is very capable of playing to a five or six handicap he is a legitimate good player its not a trumpedup claim that he is somebody who shoot in the s trump say he ha won club trophy and said such a winning pedigree made him the ideal man to run the country during the election race see how beautiful my hand are look at those hand those are powerful hands trump said at a detroit rally last year during the republican primary they can hit a golf ball yards retired boxer oscar de la hoya questioned trumps trustworthiness on the golf course while speaking to reporter in la vega in may during the buildup to the wbc middleweight title clash between canelo alvarez and amir khan according to the ap hollywood actor samuel l jackson did the same in an interview he did with united airlines rhapsody magazine in january reuters could not independently confirm these account after the jackson interview trump issued a tweet that said in part i dont cheat at golf the white house did not return a request for comment on the cheating allegation diaz who ha twice played with trump at trump national golf club charlotte in north carolina in and more recently at the doral resort in florida described the president a someone who would not need to resort to cheating to beat most player i know he ha won all these club championship at golf course that he owns and a lot of people are suspect about that but he would be a tough guy to beat with a five handicap the golf writer said he address the ball with good body language confident and flowing and fluid he just look like he is going to hit a good shot it is far harder to find allegation of cheating or boastfulness directed at the more circumspect abe who is a member of the ultraexclusive three hundred club in kanagawa prefecture southwest of tokyo the club confined to only member charge some  million yen  for membership fee and yen for green fee the yearold abe take the game very seriously and local medium have reported that round with his wife can get tense if he is playing poorly when he is playing golf he concentrate so everyone else becomes intense a well a company president who play abe once or twice a year told reuters on condition of anonymity he wa unsure of abes handicap but confirmed report that the prime minister usually shoot between and over hole which would place him squarely in the field of average weekend hacker a straight driver with a stable game all round abe is generally smartly turned out sometimes in short pant and knee sock and always with a baseball cap on his head i wa impressed that abe hold the flag on the green while other player are putting the source said people in a high position like him do not have to do that for others he is very polite the conservative politician is not so reserved a to shun refreshment at the th hole back at the clubhouse however where he might indulge in a couple of glass of beer or red wine after a bath to freshen up added the source for graphic on the trumpabe scorecard click tmsnrtrsltvfm
Title_Text: abe hope to avoid landing in rough in golf outing with trump

Text: kabul reuters  civilian casualty in religious attack in afghanistan primarily against shi ite mosque have significantly increased in the last two year according to the united nation some casualty of which were fatal have been recorded by the un assistance mission to afghanistan unama since the beginning of last year in more than incident nearly double the figure for the previous seven year googlcjre the latest attack took place three week ago at two shi ite mosque one in kabul and the other in the central province of ghhor killing at least people islamic state claimed responsibility for them and a string of others across the country in recent month sectarian violence ha been relatively rare in sunnidominant afghanistan but since islamic state ha escalated fear by killing score of shi ites the minority shi ites accuse the government of ignoring their need unama recommended further action by the afghan government to protect people and place of worship from attack
Title_Text: casualty in religious attack in afghanistan rise steeply un

Text: washington reuters  u commerce secretary wilbur ross will lead a trade mission to china in midnovember a part of president donald trumps first visit there the commerce department said in a notice posted on it website the department said the multisector mission will advance the bilateral commercial relationship by promoting business deal between u and chinese firm a well a addressing market access barrier faced by u companies the commerce department said in a statement the department said it wa taking application from trade association and company large and small through sept it said the mission would promote new sale and investment between u business and chinese entity and provide them with access to senior decision maker in the chinese government reuters on tuesday quoted a u official a saying that trump would likely stop in china a part of a trip that will take him to an asean summit in the philippine and an apec summit in vietnam the trade mission come at a time of heightened trade tension between the united state and china following trumps decision on wednesday to block a chinesebacked private equity firm from buying a usbased chipmaker in july a highlevel uschina economic dialogue meeting did not produce an agreement the trump administrations demand of reducing the u trade deficit with china
Title_Text: commerce ross to lead trade mission on trump china visit

Text: donald trump ha decided to throw out year worth of tradition for his inauguration by replacing the man who s done the announcing for presidential inauguration since eisenhower s in charlie brotman that might not seem like a big deal but given that his voice is so familiar for this it s hard to understand why they would make such a moveand it s not like it s a relief for brotman he s heartbroken about it he had already started preparing for his role in the ceremony saying he wa told he wouldn t be involved in an email at first i wa destroyed he said according to dc s abc affiliate wjla i ve been doing this for year that s eleven inauguration for which he s worked at he might be old but he s still healthy and apparently still perfectly able to do this given that he wa already preparingthe presidential inauguration committee issued a statement that said since million of american and countless entertainer have come to recognize charlie brotman a the voice of the inaugural parade the presidential inaugural committee will be proud to honor charlie a announcer chairman emeritus on january th we are thrilled for steve ray to be introducing a new generation of american to the grand tradition of the inaugural parade that s not the same a having him actually do it and he s weighing whether to even accept that or the vip seat he s been offered this is something that would be more appropriate had brotman said he wa retiring or wa otherwise unable to do it againsteve ray is a freelance announcer who ha done a lot of work including promotional spot for the washington national but one fishy point about this is that he helped with for trump s campaigntrump ha been working hard to grant favor to people who worked on his campaign giving many of them high position within his transition team did he tell the inauguration committee to find someone who had worked for him did he tell them that he knew ray and that ray should do the announcingbrotman belief it s more likely ageism at work maybe they re afraid i might drop dead at the mic right now nobody s really explaining this decision regardless unlike trump who s petty and childish a all fuck and would scream about betrayal on twitter while wishing for his replacement to fall flat on their face brotman wish ray no illwill in fact he s flat said that he want ray to do spectacular and that he wish ray luck in thisfeatured image by ethan miller via getty image
Title_Text: donald trump just threw year of inaugural tradition out the window and somethings fishy

Text: berlin reuters  a series of controversial remark by u republican presidential nominee donald trump show that the world should be concerned if he is elected president a spokeswoman for german foreign minister frankwalter steinmeier said on wednesday trump a billionaire businessman seeking his first public office ha courted controversy with a string of inflammatory statement about woman mexican muslim and war veteran among others steinmeier unlike chancellor angela merkel who ha said she will not comment on the u election is not neutral on the issue because he belief it is important to draw attention to the danger posed by trump said spokeswoman sawsan chebli he is indeed not neutral on this question because he think that if you follow what trump is saying then you need to be really anxious about what could become of this world if he doe in fact become president chebli told a regular government news conference steinmeier is from the centreleft social democrat the junior partner in merkels conservativeled ruling coalition a spokeswoman for merkel said the chancellor did not wish to interfere in the u election campaign on monday prominent republican national security official including a former cia director described trump a unqualified to lead the country and said he would be the most reckless president in american history trump is currently in the firing line after suggesting on tuesday that gun right activist could act to stop democratic rival hillary clinton from nominating liberal u supreme court justice
Title_Text: german foreign minister say trump dangerous for the world

Text: washington reuters  donald trump ha given  million of his personal money to his presidential campaign in an effort to boost his white house bid day before the nov election according to medium report the wall street journal citing two adviser said the republican presidential nominee wired the money on friday morning a fox news reporter said trump told him he would give  million to the campaign on friday
Title_Text: trump seek to boost presidential bid with  million infusion report

Text: brussels reuters  the european union expressed serious concern on wednesday after u president donald trump recognized jerusalem a the capital of israel saying it could have repercussion for peace prospect the aspiration of both party must be fulfilled and a way must be found through negotiation to resolve the status of jerusalem a the future capital of both state eu foreign affair chief federica mogherini said in a statement trump reversed decade of u policy by recognizing jerusalem a the israeli capital and saying washington would begin the process of moving it embassy to jerusalem from tel aviv
Title_Text: eu seriously concerned about trump jerusalem decision

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump told the wall street journal on wednesday that he might consider withholding billion of dollar of obamacare payment to health insurer to force democrat back to the negotiating table on healthcare insurer and major medical group have warned that not funding the payment called costsharing reduction subsidy which help cover outofpocket medical expense for lowincome american could wreak havoc in the individual insurance market trump told the wall street journal that by withholding the payment democrat will call him to negotiate major medical and insurance group penned a letter to trump on wednesday urging him to maintain funding for the subsidy which amount to about  billion a year and are paid directly to insurer they help cover premium deductible and other medical expense for about million people who purchase health insurance on the individual health insurance market house of representative republican sued the obama administration for funding the subsidy which they argue have to be appropriated by congress a federal judge in may ruled in favor of the republican prompting an appeal by the obama administration the case is pending in the u court of appeal for the district of columbia circuit major insurer including humana inc and aetna have left or announced their intention to leave the obamacare exchange citing multimilliondollar loss and patient population that are far costlier and sicker than they expected they warned that withholding the subsidy would destabilize the market further and leave million of consumer with little or no choice in picking a health insurance plan
Title_Text: trump may halt insurer payment to force democrat to table on healthcare

Text: mexico city reuters  the wife of a detained former mexican governor is living in britain and ha demanded back artwork golf club and crystal that were seized by the government according to a letter obtained by news site animal politico karime macias is the wife of former ruling party veracruz governor javier duarte who is awaiting trial on charge of embezzlement and organized crime in a case that public auditor said wa the worst they had ever seen in mexico in the letter which the news site posted online macias said she wa forced to leave the country and shelter in the uk because of persecution at home reuters did not obtain the letter and could not verify it authenticity macias lawyer did not respond to a request for comment macias ha not been charged with any crime neither the attorney general s office nor the veracruz government responded to request for comment macias confirmed in the letter that diary in which she had reportedly written i deserve abundance repeatedly were hers and said that her phrase were of a spiritual nature macias said she wanted back personal item including painting luxury pen golf club and book that she said were seized by prosecutor without a warrant adding that she feared other item found were planted there in april duarte wa arrested in a guatemala hotel where he had been with his wife after fleeing the country he ha denied any wrongdoing and macias wa not detained top mexican auditor asf said in that the irregularity in public fund under duarte were the highest amount it had ever seen prosecutor say duarte headed an organization consisting of at least nine other people whose criminal operation were carried out in veracruz the eastern gulf state of campeche and mexico city between and at a hearing in july a judge gave prosecutor six month to proceed with the investigation against duarte he is one of four exgovernors detained this year from president enrique pena nieto s institutional revolutionary party or pri corruption is one of the central issue in mexico s july election with public discontent widespread over a spate of conflictofinterest row that have dogged the cabinet and pena nieto himself
Title_Text: wife of disgraced mexican governor taking refuge in uk report

Text: donald trump infamously went further into the gutter than usual at a recent debate where he talked about his hand size which we all know wa just code for the size of his dck well one chicago hot dog stand ha taken this horrible comment and run with it and now their customer can literally take a bite out of trump s little wienerdubbed the trump footlong the hot dog from the wiener s circle hot dog stand is pushing something that is definitely false advertising because the hot dog is anything but a footlong in fact it s only inch they tweeted out their new product and it will likely drive up sale just because people are so eager to humiliate trump regarding his grossly unpresidential remark regarding his own genitalsthe trump footlong at te wiener circle starting tomorrow just look at those long resplendent finger pictwittercomkyezqmtde the wiener circle dogsnshakes march of course most people would still be hungry after just one inch hot dog so most folk will likely opt for the trump super pac which is four of these little bugger for just  definitely a deal if you ve ever eaten off of a food truck or stand of any kind in a city the size of chicago besides your hardearned money would be going to infuriate and humiliate the biggest buffoon in american politics definitely well worth itjust wait until trump get a load of this one i bet that s the last time he alludes to the size of his dck on camera during a presidential debate or anywhere elsefeatured image via screen capture from ai archive

Text: after a brief and almost meaningless visit to texas during which donald trump didn t meet with a single victim of hurricane harvey the president s cavalcade moved on to missouri where he returned to what he really care about more money for wealthy peoplehe s first of course his tweet from wednesday morning prove unequivocally that the only victim he care about is himself he sent out a placating message about horror and devastation which he didn t ask even one harvey refugee about just minute after a tweet about north korea and only minute before he went back into martyr mode after reading the false reporting and even ferocious anger in some dying magazine it make me wonder why all i want to do is maga donald j trump realdonaldtrump august with that much obsession on his own wellbeing why wouldn t the next logical step be another campaignstyle stop to try and convince people to support his awful tax plan did i say campaignstyle what i mean is this wa not a white house event this wa straightup partisan if donald trump operated under the rule of law the rnc would have to reimburse taxpayer for his missouri speech in which he explicitly called for the ouster of a democratic senator claire mccaskill speaking to a crowd in springfield trump saidwe must lower our tax and your senator claire mccaskill she must do this for you and if she doesn t you have to vote her out of officethat s campaigning not laying out policy but he doesn t have much policy yet to reveal the gop ha yet to agree on much of what will go into their tax reform package trump himself would like to see the business tax rate lowered to a number so low that it would cripple the government without slashing spending on the poor but even most republican oppose so low a rate and his plan for tax relief for the middle class and repatriating offshore profit are so far still out in the ether somewherethe bottom line is now that he s got that awful trip to texas out of the way trump is on the warpath and his only focus is now on winning he even warned the member of his party not to disappoint him on tax the way they did on trumpcarei am fully committed to working with congress to get this job done and i don t want to be disappointed by congress do you understand meoh we understand donnie you were embarrassed by mitch mcconnell and humiliated by john mccain so now you want a mcvictory to soothe your fiery case of butthurt american see through your tax reform though the rich get richer and the poor get poorer it s the republican wayfeatured image via michael b thomasgetty image
Title_Text: enough about texas lets talk tax trumps priority shift to break for the rich

Text: beijing reuters  china called on monday for all country to make constructive effort to ease tension after north korea said the latest un sanction against it are an act of war and tantamount to a complete economic blockade the un security council unanimously imposed new sanction on north korea on friday for it recent intercontinental ballistic missile test seeking to limit it access to refined petroleum product and crude oil and it earnings from worker abroad the usdrafted resolution also cap crude oil supply to north korea at million barrel a year and commits the council to further reduction if it were to conduct another nuclear test or launch another intercontinental ballistic missile icbm north korea on sunday rejected the resolution calling it an act of war speaking in beijing chinese foreign ministry spokeswoman hua chunying said the resolution appropriately strengthened the sanction but wa not designed to affect ordinary people normal economic exchange and cooperation or humanitarian aid hua noted it also called for the use of peaceful mean to resolve the issue and that all side should take step to reduce tension in the present situation we call on all country to exercise restraint and make proactive and constructive effort to ease the tension on the peninsula and appropriately resolve the issue she told a daily news briefing the north s old ally china and russia both supported the latest un sanction tension ha been rising over north korea s nuclear and missile program which it pursues in defiance of year of un security council resolution with bellicose rhetoric coming from both pyongyang and the white house in november north korea demanded a halt to what it called brutal sanction saying a round imposed after it sixth and most powerful nuclear test on sept constituted genocide north korea on nov said it successfully tested a new icbm that put the u mainland within range of it nuclear weapon u diplomat have made clear they are seeking a diplomatic solution but proposed the new tougher sanction resolution to ratchet up pressure on north korea s leader china with which north korea doe some percent of it trade ha repeatedly called for calm and restraint from all side and for a return to talk
Title_Text: china call for constructive effort to ease korean tension

Text: donald rumsfeld is widely regarded a one of the worst secretary of defense to serve in the united state despite that fact on fox news he is still regarded a a credible voice on national security and he appeared on the conservative network on wednesday night to announce his support for donald trumprumsfeld told host greta van susteren that trump wa a known unknown and that he could not vote candidate mitt romneyrumsfeld s tenure a secretary of defense wa marred by a series of blunder and lie that lead directly to the death of thousand of american soldier and iraqi he ridiculed request before the war began for a larger invasion force which led to resource being stretched to the breaking point when the bloody iraqi insurgency rose up against the troopsunder rumsfeld the u military set up a torture site at the notorious abu ghraib prison a black mark on the american record that ha been cited by hundred of terrorist and their ally a a justification for aggression towards the Title_Text: russia say need to prevent new sanction against iran keep nuclear deal ria

Text: washington reuters  the u senate banking committee will hold a confirmation hearing on nov for jerome powell president donald trumps nominee for chairman of the federal reserve the committee said in a statement on wednesday trump last week tapped powell a fed governor since to become head of the u central bank breaking with precedent by denying janet yellen a second fouryear term but signaling a continuation of her cautious monetary policy powell is quickly garnering support from republican lawmaker including senate majority leader mitch mcconnell who met with powell on tuesday and said he looked forward to supporting his nomination republican senator mike crapo who chair the banking committee said on wednesday that powell wa wellequipped to lead our economy and the country in a positive direction powell is widely expected to continue to raise interest rate gradually a yellen began to do in late and to shrink the central banks  trillion balance sheet
Title_Text: senate panel set november confirmation hearing for fed chair nominee powell
