Text: in a twist of fate donald trump happened to be in scotland on the day the world woke up to learn that in a xenophobic ferver the united kingdom had voted to disembowel itself by leaving the european union within minute of vote being counted global financial market were sent into complete and total disarray the pound sterling dropped to it lowest value in a century the uk s prime minister david cameron announced he would be resigning country around the world stopped accepting british monetary exchange because the market were too unstablewhat did donald trump who hope to someday soon lead the united state have to say about this unfolding disaster he wa stoked he reasoned that his turnberry golf resort wa going to make a killing i think it s a great thing that happened trump told reporter shortly after his helicopter landed at trump turnberry people are angry all over the world people they re angry when the pound go down more people are coming to turnberry frankly trump added during an afternoon news conference for traveling and for other thing i think it very well could turn out to be a positive to be clear the pound didn t just go down it collapsedchart via the washington posttrump wa not in scotland for the socalled brexit vote he wa there to oversee the opening of a new hotel and golf course having unofficially suspended his campaign for the weekend to worry about his golf course profit trump wa notably over the moon about the uk s selfinduced financial collapse but trump also seemed irritated that what might be one of the most consequential vote in modern history wa ruining his publicity stunt when reporter pressed him about his feeling towards brexit trump started ignoring the question entirely and focused on how great the suite were at his hotelbut on twitter trump also took the opportunity to prove that he ha absolutely no understanding of what the vote wa all about anyway in an effort to prove that the world wa ripe for rightwing nationalistic takeover he tweeted a comment so oblivious that it made international headlinesjust arrived in scotland place is going wild over the vote they took their country back just like we will take america back no game donald j trump realdonaldtrump june scotland it wa pointed out uniformly voted to stay in the european union the fact that british rightwing nationalist chose to leave is already kickstarting a scottish independence movement very soon the united kingdom will be neither united nor a kingdom but at least trump think his golf course will do well true leadership indeedfeatured image via jeff j mitchellgetty image
Title_Text: trump in scotland collapse of the united kingdom will be great for my golf course actually

Text: washington reuters  south carolina governor nikki haley a republican who ha been mentioned a a possible vice presidential pick said on wednesday she is not interested in the post but will support the partys eventual nominee while i am flattered to be mentioned and proud of what that say about the great thing going on in south carolina my plate is full and i am not interested in serving a vice president haley a popular indianamerican governor said in a statement
Title_Text: south carolina gov haley say not interested in being vice president

Text: trump ha been on a hour freak out with the host of msnbc s morning joe and his clear incoherence ha everyone from mental health expert to average american once again concerned that the president is seriously mentally ill the evidence that our president is indeed mentally unfit for office is circumstantial but persuasive and trump keep digging the hole deepermost people would agree that a man who can t stop himself from fabricating a rumor of a bleeding facelift to publicly attack the host of a cable show he doesn t like is unfit for office in normal time that alone would be ground for invoking the th amendment s clause on the president s mental capacity for trump that s only the tip of the iceberg the latest in a seemingly unending string of incident that should raise serious concernsthe white house seems to be painfully aware that the question swirling around his stability are undermining the credibility of his role a president consequently and for the first time in u history the white house ha to run with the narrative that you cannot question the president s mental health trump is sane because they say he is sane and shut up about itjust hour after trump got into a public fight with the host of morning joe on twitter while he watched the show live kellyanne conway went on abc s good morning america to say it wa unpatriotic to ever question whether trump ha lost his mind even while he continues to provide evidence that he ha had some sort of mental breakdownafter summarizing an incomplete list of the thing trump ha been called online kellyanne said it doesn t help the american people to have a president covered in this light i m sorry it s neither productive nor patriotic the toxicity is over the top in short kellyanne want u to believe trump is the victim in all of this meanwhile he continues to play the part of the bullyworth remembering trump s favorite network fox news once aired glenn beck claiming obama hated white people it star anchor sean hannity repeatedly accused obama of being a pathological narcissist and it resident mental health expert repeatedly diagnosed both barack and michelle obama with various pathology including once saying michelle needed to lose weight none of that irrational hatred or vitriol caused obama to livetweet a rant about fox news host or personally smear them on social mediabut then obama wasn t mentally ill so why would hefeatured image via youtube
Title_Text: conway declares it unpatriotic to question trumps mental health after his latest meltdown video

Text: washington reuters  the u senate on thursday voted to confirm president donald trumps pick to head the department of energy former texas governor rick perry who ha promised to renew americas nuclear weapon arsenal perrys rise to americas top energy official came against opposition from democrat worried about his tie to oil company his doubt about the science of climate change and the fact that he once called for the departments total elimination  a comment he ha since said he regret the senate voted to in support of perry perry wa governor of texas from to making him the longestserving governor of the oilproducing state in it history a energy secretary perry would lead a vast scientific research operation credited with helping trigger a u drilling boom and advancement in energy efficiency and renewables technology and would oversee americas nuclear arsenal in his senate confirmation hearing perry said much of his focus running the department would be in renewing the countrys nuclear weapon arsenal trump want to ensure the arsenal is at the top of the pack and said the united state had fallen behind in it nuclear weapon capacity democratic lawmaker expressed worry perry would weaken the departments function and potentially target it army of scientist focused on climate and clean energy research perry sought to reassure them saying he would protect scientist and the growing renewable energy industry democratic oregon senator ron wyden a senior democrat on the senate energy and natural resource committee said perry had failed to persuade him he would push back against trump administration plan to cut the departments budget and focus on clean energy rd as trump is threatening to slash does budget gov perry hasnt convinced me hes up to the task of creating those job and putting point on the board in the fight against climate change wyden said republican alaska senator lisa murkowski chair of the energy committee said perry would be a strong partner a we focus on everything from reducing rural energy cost to advancing the alaska gasline project
Title_Text: senate confirms trump pick perry a energy secretary

Text: since the rise of presumptive republican nominee donald trump the gop ha been throwing up their hand in disbelief and trying to blame everyone but themselves for the success of such a horrendous presidential candidate all while completely ignoring the fact that conservative have paved the way for a candidate like trump to succeed with decade of hateful rhetoric and ignorancebill maher expertly pointed this out on friday night during his hbo show real time when he sent a very special message to republican stop blaming liberal for the candidate you created pointing out several headline that showed that conservative think piece have been pointing the finger at liberal maher destroyed the concept that liberal condescension and political correctness forced otherwise reasonable people into trump s hateful embrace maher brilliantly dissed the illogical ragedriven individual that support trump sarcastically stating that they would vote rationally if not for overbearing liberal scientist and historian and nutritionist telling real american that they re dumb it hurt their feeling when we insult their value with our fact he continued i m sorry you find it irritating when liberal point out that global warming exists or that racism exists or that gay people exist but here s the thing you people were wrong about all that maher also attacked conservative opposition to fact and reason which ha been going on long before trump entered the political arena maher hilariously joked that liberal were to blame for thing like the manbun and gluten free cupcake so the gop must accept blame for the racism and widespread hatred of muslim because those are the very attitude that the republican party ha propelled over the last several year they are what is truly to blame for trump s risemaher even stated that he himself ha mocked political incorrectness in the past criticizing liberal for overreaction however maher said that none of that justifies embracing a dangerous buffoon simply because his lack of political correctness is cathartic to a huge round of applause maher sent a message straight to the gop trump is your problem but somehow the party of personal responsibility doesn t want to take responsibility for this one you can watch the brilliant segment belowfeatured image is a screenshot
Title_Text: bill maher scorch republican stop blaming liberal  trump is your problem video

Text: beijing reuters  some northern chinese city failed to improve air quality by much last month hitting the smogprone region s overall result in a drive against pollution the government said a it warned provincial official to comply with stringent step to clear the sky some city did not improve air quality by much or even experienced some volatility and in a way they have dragged down the regional air quality level ministry of environmental protection mep spokesperson liu youbin said at a regular briefing on thursday he did not identify the underperforming city but the comment come amid concern about the country s ability to reduce pollution in winter a it battle to avoid a repeat of the nearrecord level of choking smog that enveloped key northern area at the start of the year there is no jesting in war for those local official who do not enforce the measure of the campaign effectively and could not improve air quality in time we will hold them accountable liu added data earlier this month showed only four of northern chinese city met their air quality target in october and air quality in chinese city worsened in october with level of hazardous breathable particle known a pm up percent on the year to an average of microgram per cubic meter beijing is under huge pressure to meet politically crucial air quality target and clear the sky of toxic smog that blanket the north of the country a home turn up the heat which is powered by coal liu said overall air quality in the northern city wa improving compared with september average pm level in the region dropped percent in october from the month before he said it show that our measure are working a long a we are persistent and diligently enforce existing measure regional air quality will definitely improve he said under the sixmonth campaign northern chinese city were ordered to thin traffic and cut industrial output thousand of pollution source including steel mill coalfired boiler cement and ceramic plant mine and building site will be shut these measure part of beijing s yearslong time war on smog have already roiled commodity market fuelling worry that the tough inspection are hurting the already slowing economy
Title_Text: no joke china government warns northern city to get serious in war on smog

Text: brussels reuters  the chairman of european union leader donald tusk said the bloc is ready to start negotiating a transition period with britain after it leaf the eu and it wanted more clarity from london on how it see their new relationship after leaving tusk said britain will have to respect all eu law during the transition a well a respect it budgetary commitment and the bloc s judicial oversight but it would no longer take part in decisionmaking that will be done by the remaining state we are ready to start preparing a close ukeu partnership in trade but also fight against terrorism and international crime a well a security defense and foreign policy tusk told reporter after british pm theresa may arrived in brussels with a brexit deal tusk said however too much time wa spent on negotiating the outline of britain s exit which he said wa the relatively easier part we all know that breaking up is hard but breaking up and building a new relation is much harder he said so much time ha been devoted to the easier task and now we have de facto less than a year left of talk before britain is due to leave in march
Title_Text: tusk say eu to start transition talk with britain

Text: our government is giving out green card like candy at double the rate to muslim over everyone else a green card is a path to american citizenship so this is very important besides the security risk this is an attempt to change the nation forever look at europe the citizen of europe are screaming to get their sovereignty back after basically being invaded by thousand and thousand of muslim this is a quiet invasion but is still very serious and wrong national security ha never appeared to be a priority for the obama administration but this is downright alarming a the u encounter burgeoning threat from radical islamist with islamic terrorism on the rise in the united state and western europe it s worth mentioning that the obama administration issued around green card to foreigner from muslim country during a fiveyear period according to data published by the department of homeland security dhs the stats the latest made available by dhs also show that the u government admits more than double the number of immigrant from muslim nation than from the european unionthis disturbing information wa circulated by the senate judiciary committee s subcommittee on immigration which assesses that if there s no change in the current policy the u will likely grant another migrant possibly more from muslimmajority country green card in the next five year according to the dhs figure cited by the panel uncle sam issued approximately green card to immigrant from muslim nation from fiscal year through fiscal year over the same period the u issued only green card to migrant from the european union according to a committee announcement that reminds u a green card entitles recipient to access federal benefit lifetime residency work authorization and a direct route to becoming a u citizen some of the recipient are admitted to the u a refugee so they immediately qualify for federal welfare benefit like food stamp and medicaidthe dhs stats include a breakdown of the country where the migrant came from pakistan and iraq sent over the most with apiece and bangladesh had seventythree thousand came from iran from egypt from somalia from uzbekistan turkey and morocco had each jordan and albania each and lebanon and yemen each had rounding out the fivedigit club is indonesia syria sudan afghanistan and sierra leone the rest including saudi arabia algeria kosovo and libya only sent over a few thousand during the fiveyear period covered by the dhs data by contrast only green card were granted to migrant from the european union country united kingdom with the highest number during this period the senate committee reveals that dhs ha not yet published statistic covering fiscal year and fiscal year so we ll be on the lookout for thatnational security ha never appeared to be a priority for the obama administration but this is downright alarming a the u encounter burgeoning threat from radical islamistsread more judicial watch
Title_Text: national security alert obama administration giving out green card like candy to migrant from muslim nation

Text: kabul reuters  a suicide bomber in an explosivespacked vehicle attacked a nato convoy in afghanistan on monday wounding a small number of foreign troop and at least three civilian official said the soldier were taken to the nearby bagram air field and none of their injury appeared lifethreatening nato s headquarters in kabul said at least three civilian were hurt district governor abdul shukor qodossi said without giving detail on the extent of their injury a statement from the taliban militant said american had been killed and wounded and three armored vehicle destroyed the attack came on the th anniversary of the attack of september which triggered the usled military operation that toppled the taliban regime in afghanistan
Title_Text: suicide bomber attack nato convoy in afghanistan some wounded

Text: london reuters  zimbabwean president robert mugabe ha lost the support of the people a spokesman for british prime minister theresa may said on monday while urging a peaceful and swift resolution to the uncertain political situation there we don t yet know how development in zimbabwe are going to play out but what doe appear clear is that mugabe ha lost the support of the people and of his party the spokesman said
Title_Text: uk say clear that zimbabwe mugabe ha lost the support of the people

Text: washington reuters  the u policy of trying to persuade north korea to give up it nuclear weapon is probably a lost cause and the best that could be hoped for is a cap on the countrys nuclear capability the director of u national intelligence james clapper said on tuesday however underscoring conflicting view in the obama administration the state department said u policy wa unchanged and continued to be to seek the verifiable denuclearization of the korean peninsula president barack obama ha repeatedly stated that the united state will never accept north korean a a nucleararmed state clapper made clear at an event at the council on foreign relation think tank in new york he did not think that the policy the administration ha stuck to in spite of repeated north korean nuclear test wa realistic i think the notion of getting the north korean to denuclearize is probably a lost cause clapper said at the council on foreign relation think tank in new york they are not going to do that  that is their ticket to survival pyongyang ha persisted with it missile and nuclear weapon program including a sept nuclear explosion despite strong international sanction clapper said he got a good taste of how the world look from north koreas viewpoint when he went to pyongyang on a mission in to secure the release of two american they are under siege and they are very paranoid so the notion of giving up their nuclear capability whatever it is is a nonstarter with them he said the best we could probably hope for is some sort of a cap but they are not going to do that just because we ask them theres going to have to be some significant inducements u state department spokesman john kirby said he had not seen clappers remark but told a regular news briefing in washington that the administration did not believe denuclearization wa a lost cause no nothings changed thats not our position our policy objective is to seek to obtain a verifiable denuclearization of the korean peninsula that is the policy that is both the goal and what we want to see and there is a way to do that chinese foreign ministry spokesman lu kang asked on wednesday about clappers remark said the best way to resolve the north korea nuclear issue wa still via talk china and russia have pushed for a resumption of sixparty talk on denuclearization in north korea the talk which also involve japan south korea and the united state have been on hold since clapper also said it bothered him that the united state wa not capitalizing on using information a a weapon against north korea thats something they worry about a lot that is a great vulnerability i dont think we have exploited right now we are kind of stuck on our narrative and they are kind of stuck on theirs clapper wa asked if he thought north korea could mount a nuclear warhead on a missile that could reach the west coast of the united state and reiterated the intelligence assessment that this had to be a worstcase assumption he said north korea had yet to test it kn intercontinental ballistic missile so neither north korea nor the united state knew whether it worked nevertheless we ascribe to them the capability to launch a missile that would have a weapon on it to reach part of the united state certainly including alaska and hawaii he said they could do it we have to make the worstcase assumption here
Title_Text: getting north korea to give up nuclear bomb probably lost cause u spy chief

Text: south of mosul iraq reuters  iraqi authority are holding foreign wife and child of suspected islamic state fighter after government force expelled the jihadist group from one of it last remaining stronghold in iraq security and aid official said most came from turkey many others were from former soviet state such a tajikistan azerbaijan and russia iraqi army and intelligence officer said other asian and a very few french and german were also among them the wife and child are being held at an iraqi camp south of mosul most had arrived since aug when iraqi troop drove islamic state out of mosul one intelligence officer said that they were still in verifying their nationality with their home country since many of the woman no longer had their original document it is the largest group of foreigner linked to islamic state to be held by iraqi force since they began driving the militant from mosul and other area in northern iraq last year an aid official said thousand of foreigner have been fighting for islamic state or daesh in iraq and syria we are holding the daesh family under tight security measure and waiting for government order on how to deal with them said army colonel ahmed altaie from mosul s nineveh operation command we treat them well they are family of tough criminal who killed innocent in cold blood but when we interrogated them we discovered that almost all of them were mislead by a vicious daesh propaganda he said reuters reporter saw hundred of the woman and child sitting on mattress crawling with bug in tent without airconditioning in what aid worker called a militarized site turkish french and russian were among the language spoken i want to go back to france but don t know how said a frenchspeaking veiled woman of chechen origin who said she had lived in paris before she said she did not know what had happened to her husband who had brought her to iraq when he joined islamic state a security officer said the woman and child had mostly surrendered to the kurdish peshmerga near the northern city of tal afar along with their husband the kurd handed the woman and child over to iraqi force but kept the men  all presumed to be fighter  in their custody many of the family had fled to tal afar after iraqi troop pushed islamic state out of mosul iraqi force retook tal afar a city of predominantly ethnic turkmen that produced some of islamic state s senior commander last month most of it prewar population of have fled an interior ministry official said iraq wanted to negotiate with embassy the return of the woman and child we can t keep this number in our custody for a long time he said official had counted so far at least nationality said army lieutenant colonel salah kareem aid worker and the authority are worried about tension between iraqi who lost their home and are also living in the camp and the new arrival many iraqi want revenge for the harsh treatment they received under the extremist interpretation of sunni islam which they imposed in mosul and the other area they seized in the family are being kept to one side of the camp for their own safety an iraqi military intelligence officer said the norwegian refugee council nrc which is supporting the woman and their child said iraq must swiftly move to clarify it future plan for these individual like all those fleeing conflict it is imperative that these individual are able to access protection assistance and information nrc said in a statement they are in defacto detention western official are worried about radicalized fighter and their relative coming home after the collapse of islamic state s caliphate french official have indicated a preference for citizen found to be affiliated with is to be prosecuted in iraq the general philosophy is that adult should go on trial in iraq a french diplomatic source told reuters last month of those found to have been fighter we think child would benefit from judicial and social service in france the woman in the camp were cooking noodle or lying on mattress with their baby in the hot tent many were still wearing the black abaya and face veil which were mandatory in area the militant controlled my mother doesn t even know where i am said a yearold french woman of algerian descent she said she had been tricked by her husband into coming with him through turkey into syria and then iraq when he joined islamic state last year i had just given birth to this little girl three month before she said holding the infant and asking not to be named he said let s go for a week s holiday in turkey he had already bought the plane ticket and the hotel after four month in mosul she ran away from her husband to tal afar in february she wa hoping to make it back to france but he found her and would not let her leave she tearfully recounted how her fiveyearold son wa killed in june by a rocket while playing in the street i don t understand why he did this to u she said of her husband who she said wa killed fighting in mosul dead or alive  i couldn t care less about him she and a few other family had walked for day to surrender at a kurdish peshmerga checkpoint beyond alayadiyah a town near tal afar where the militant made their last stand we were getting bombed shelled and shot at she said kurdish official said dozen of fighter surrendered after the fall of tal afar but gave no detail one tal afar resident said he had seen between and fighter fleeing the town in the final day of the battle
Title_Text: exclusive iraq holding foreign wife child of suspected islamic state fighter

Text: not to let u be disappointed in hearing something ludicrous come out of his mouth in so long dr ben carson just dropped a doozy on u while he wa being interviewed on fox newsstill unable to keep his eye open for more than half a second at a time carson wa asked his opinion about harriet tubman being placed in the twentydollar bill he seemed flabbergasted at the notion and said that former president andrew trail of tear jackson who is currently on the  wa a tremendous secretary err umm president and he belief he should get to hold his place on currencywhen asked what he thought of harriet tubman he said i love harriet tubman i love what she did but we can find another way to honor her and that not being bad enough he said maybe a  bill tubman risked everything to free herself and others who were being held a property and then wa a key participant in trying to get woman the right to vote being recognized on the  bill is the least we can do to continue to honor her and her legacy to say that she belongs on currency that is barely in use and could likely be considered a joke is not only condescending but outright insultingrealbencarson maybe harriet tubman should go on the  bill httpstcoompugspn pictwittercomzthyswni politico politico april featured photo by alex wonggetty image
Title_Text: ben carson reminds u why we hate him  suggests where harriet tubman belongs video

Text: radio host and frequent fox news contributor laura ingraham and fox news the five host kimberly guilfoyle were seen leaving the funeral service for former fox news chief roger ailes with sean hannity kimberly guilfoyle wa one of the few woman at fox news who stood up for roger ailes when he wa being accused of sexually harassment by former fox and friend host gretchen carlson guilfoyle tweeted a message of support for the ailes family on twitter following his deathrip rogerailes sending my love and prayer to beth zachary roger wa a friend and a mentor to so many of u foxnews he will be missed kimberly guilfoyle kimguilfoyle may guilfoyle also bravely eulogized ailes on fox news it wa her current boss the murdoch boy who fired roger ailes the man who put fox news at the top of the rating due to allegation of sexually harassment by gretchen carlson and later from former fox host megyn kellyformer fox news bos roger ailes wa eulogized in the town of palm beach at st edward roman catholic church saturday morning in a service heavy with reference to suffering beth ailes wife elizabeth came to me friday and asked that i officiate st edward monsignor thomas j klinzing told dailymailcom she asked me to base some of my reading on the theme of suffering i believe roger suffered quite a bit with those accusation klingzing wa referring to ailes firing from the network he founded last year after fired fnc anchorwoman gretchen carlson accused him of sexual harassment followed by other woman coming forward with similar accusationsailes coffin wa carried out at am to the altar of the yearold church famously president john f kennedy s winter white house church a five member of the palm beach police department presented the colorsthe ceremony wa kept secret by ailes family member and wa attended by fewer than family and friend and took place with heavy security under the watch of three private security guardsthe medium guru and political strategist died on thursday in palm beach florida aged rush limbaugh and his wife kathryn were in the front row douglas kennedy a nephew of jfk who work at fox news read from letter of paul to the roman a passage about how nothing can separate a believer from the love of godsean hannity read a responsorial psalm i wouldn t be what i am today without roger hannity told dailymailcom exclusively after the funeral he took me a a local radio host in atlanta and gave me the opportunity of a lifetime he saw thing in people that no one else would see he is an american patriot of the highest level for entire story daily mail
Title_Text: rush limbaugh wife kathryn sean hannity and ethel kennedy attend roger ailes funeral under heavy security video

Text: washington reuters  a bipartisan senate proposal to shore up obamacare insurance marketplace would cut the u deficit by  billion over the next decade and would not substantially change the number of american with health insurance a nonpartisan arm of congress said on wednesday legislation introduced last week by republican senator lamar alexander and democratic senator patty murray would restore for two year subsidy to private insurer to help lowerincome people buy insurance president donald trump this month cut off those subsidy the bill also would provide state more flexibility to change some rule in the affordable care act the signature legislative achievement of the republican trumps democratic predecessor barack obama the nonpartisan congressional budget office previously estimated that various republican proposal to repeal and replace obamacare would cause more than million people to lose health insurance in contrast the cbo on wednesday said reinstating the subsidy a called for in the alexandermurray bill would not substantially alter the number of insured the cbo also estimated that the fix would not impact health insurance rate because they are already set health insurer said they raised premium on average percent to make up for the lost federal subsidy the cbo said it expected health insurance premium to be lower with the insurer payment than without them while the alexandermurray legislation would reduce the federal deficit the cbo previously found that eliminating the subsidy called cost sharing reduction would raise the federal deficit by  billion over a decade because premium would rise in the absence of the subsidy the government would be compelled to spend more on financial assistance to lowincome american about million american obtained insurance through obamacare and the law helped drive the u uninsured rate to a record low but republican have called it an unwarranted government intrusion in a healthcare system that represents a fifth of the u economy it is unclear whether the alexandermurray bill will ever come to a vote in congress trump ha sent mixed signal about it initially supporting it last week and then opposing it senate majority leader mitch mcconnell said he would not bring it up without trumps support trump ha derided the insurer payment a a bailout and ha vowed to let obamacare implode it doe not bail out insurance company it doe benefit consumer it doe benefit taxpayer to the tune of  billion alexander said on wednesday on the senate floor insurer say they do not profit from the subsidy but pas them on directly to consumer to reduce deductible copayments and other outofpocket medical expense for lowincome people trump who a a candidate promised to get rid of obamacare ha been frustrated by the inability of a congress led by his own party to pas a bill to repeal and replace it and ha taken step that bypass lawmaker to chip away at the law house of representative speaker paul ryan ha signaled his opposition and on wednesday said his chamber would not take up the matter or try again to pas broader republican legislation to repeal and replace obamacare this year with broad democratic backing and the support of a dozen republican senator the alexandermurray bill ha sufficient backing to exceed the vote needed for passage in the seat senate if mcconnell allows it to come to a vote two prominent republican in the house and senate on tuesday announced a competing obamacare fix that is more conservative and appears to address many of the trump administrations objection to the alexandermurray proposal the proposal by republican senator orrin hatch chairman of the senate finance committee and republican representative kevin brady chairman of the house way and mean committee includes provision to suspend requirement for individual and employer to buy health coverage under obamacare ryan told reuters in an interview he favored the hatchbrady proposal
Title_Text: bipartisan obamacare fix would cut u deficit nonpartisan analysis

Text: washington reuters  the u drug enforcement administrations acting director criticized president donald trump for telling law enforcement officer not to be too nice to suspect urging dea agent to show respect and compassion and saying he felt compelled to speak out when something is wrong acting director chuck rosenberg sent an agencywide email on saturday one day after trumps speech to officer in brentwood new york on long island the email wa seen by reuters on tuesday trump suggested to officer that a part of a tougher approach to suspect they do away with practice like protecting the head of a suspect being put into a patrol car that suggestion drew criticism from many local law enforcement agency a well a rosenberg i write because we have an obligation to speak out when something is wrong the acting dea chief said in the email the president in remark delivered yesterday in new york condoned police misconduct regarding the treatment of individual placed under arrest by law enforcement rosenberg who wa not nominated by trump but is a holdover from the obama administration wa the first head of a federal agency to challenge trumps remark in a wide arena incident of police brutality and law enforcement killing of black suspect have sparked mass protest nationwide and led many department to purchase body camera to record interaction between officer and the public trump a republican campaigned on a prolaw enforcement platform winning the support of several police union by promising to be tough on crime and more supportive of police than his predecessor democratic president barack obama chuck canterbury national president of the fraternal order of police the nations largest police union said trumps off the cuff comments are taken too literally by news medium the president know just a every cop out there know that our society doe not and should not tolerate the mistreatment or prejudgment of any individual at any point in the criminal justice process canterbury said in a statement on saturday the dea combat drug trafficking into the united state from office nationwide and several international post rosenberg said he wa not seeking to advance a political agenda but to remind his agent of their core value including accountability diversity and integrity this is how we conduct ourselves this is how we treat those whom we encounter in our work victim witness subject and defendant this is who we are he wrote
Title_Text: drug enforcement chief criticizes trump in email to agent

Text: a furious georgia republican issued a horrifying threat to a democrat over her push to remove confederate statue in an ominous social medium post state rep jason spencer warned that if former state rep ladawn jones doesn t abandon her fight against monument to slavery she might go missing in a contentious back and forth on facebook spencer told jones that people in south georgia are people of action not drama and then added that people who don t understand that will go missing in the okefenokee too many neck they are red around here he wrote don t say i didn t warn you about em jones a black woman who represented an atlantabased district from to did not back down from spencer s threat of physical violence enjoy but know winter is coming jones wrote back you know it too otherwise you wouldn t have found a need to even make this post or those hollow threat of not coming to south ga spencer now swears that he really wasn t threatening jones of course no to the contrary he wa just trying to keep her safe by giving a warning to her of how people can behave about this issue insert eye roll here she is from atlanta and the rest of georgia see this issue very differently spencer said just trying to keep her safe if she decided to come down and raise hell about the memorial in the back yard of folk who will see this a an unwelcome aggression from the left jones later said in an interview that she and spencer had developed a friendship during their time representing the people of georgia and that she wasn t worried about his online threat if it were anybody other than jason spencer then i would be alarmed but we had a unique relationship in the georgia legislature jones said if that had come from anybody else i d take it a a serious threat but she did say that she wa very concerned by his appalling reaction to her effort to remove the statue of people who fought against the u in their quest to continue the practice of owning people based on skin color because if that s representative of what people in south georgia think then yikes you can read the tense exchange in it entirety herefeatured image via screenshot
Title_Text: georgia republican threatens to disappear democrat over monument to slavery

Text: career criminal professional grifter the ultimate democrat politician voter in illinois and michigan witnessed the nastiest moment thus far of the democratic presidential campaign sunday night when former california gov jerry brown accused arkansas gov bill clinton and his wife hillary of unethical behavior and funneling state business to her little rock law firmwith former massachusetts sen paul tsongas standing by during a onehour tv debate in chicago brown launched a harsh personal attack on the democratic frontrunner citing a washington post story published sunday that raised question about the relationship between the state of arkansas and the law firm of which hillary clinton is a partnerwatch the exchange between governor jerry brown and bill clinton hereclinton ardently defended his wifes integrity and he charged that browns attack wa driven by electoral desperation and poll resultsthe confrontation came a the three democrat met for the last time before tuesdays presidential primary in illinois and michiganagainst that backdrop brown unleashed his barrage after he and tsongas were asked by a debate panelist about clintons electability in a possible fall campaign against president bush i think hes got a big electability problem brown said citing the post story a well a other newspaper article that addressed the governors environmental record in arkansascalling it a scandal of major proportion brown said he is funneling money to his wifes law firm for state business its the kind of conflict of interest thats incompatible with the kind of public servant we expect the post story did not say that either clinton or his wife had channeled money or state business to the law firm it did note that the rose law firm ha several state agency and large corporation on it client liststabbing a finger at his rival clinton said let me tell you something jerry i dont care what you say about me but you ought to be ashamed of yourself for jumping on my wife youre not worthy to be on the same platform with her clinton mocked browns populist campaign approach and his bulldog tactic i dont think you can take much of what he say seriously clinton said jerry come here with his family wealth and his  suit making lying accusation about my wife i never funneled any money to my wifes law firm never never clinton insisted that his wife had turned down her partnership share in any income the firm receives from state businessthe candidate then began shouting over one another clinton alluding to brown aide patrick caddell a longtime washington political consultant and suggesting the former california governor wa somebody elses mouthpiece i feel sorry for jerry brown clinton barked he reinvents himself every year or two clinton whose campaign ha thus far survived supermarket tabloid allegation of infidelity and question about his draft history ha been forced to respond to suggestion from all of his democratic rival that he cannot defeat bushlast week clinton had to address a new york time report that documented the clintons investment in a real estate deal with a man who later became head of a saving and loan that eventually failedbrowns attack wa the most pointed of the campaign and may have marked a transition point in american politics a point at which the career and conduct of a male politicians spouse becomes fair game for attackfrom her role on cbs minute defending her husband against charge of philandering to a less celebrated role a a campaign adviser hillary clinton ha played an exceedingly public role in the campaignvia chicago tribune
Title_Text: priceless watch bill clinton defend hillarys criminal activity in presidential debate

Text: washington reuters  u president barack obama urged republican presidential nominee donald trump to stop whining about the nov election being rigged saying no serious person could suggest u election could be manipulated because of their decentralized nature i have never seen in my lifetime or in modern political history any presidential candidate trying to discredit the election and the election process before vote have even taken place its unprecedented the democratic president said id invite mr trump to stop whining and go try to make his case to get votes obama said at a joint white house news conference with italian prime minister matteo renzi
Title_Text: stop whining about u election being rigged obama tell trump

Text: beirut reuters  lebanese president michel aoun s office said on saturday that saad alhariri had phoned him from outside lebanon to resign a the country s prime minister and that aoun awaited hariri s return to hear the circumstance of the resignation
Title_Text: lebanese president say pm hariri phoned to resign from outside country

Text: moscow reuters  russia is concerned that japan is allowing washington to use it territory a a base for a u military buildup in north asia under the pretext of countering north korea russian foreign minister sergei lavrov said on friday his remark came at a joint press conference with his japanese counterpart taro kono after talk between the two men in moscow and prompted kono to defend japan s stance toward north korea and it tie with the united state japan had wanted to focus on resolving a sevendecade old territorial dispute between the country but lavrov s comment on north korea cast a shadow over the meeting we are expressing deep concern with fact to back it up that japan along with south korea is becoming a territory for the deployment of element of the u global missile defense system which is being rolled out in that region under the pretext of the north korea threat lavrov said we have no problem directly with japan we do not see risk there we see risk because of the proliferation of a global u missile defense system on the territory of country that neighbor russia including japan he said that in the past few week the united state had conducted military exercise in the region and adopted additional sanction despite the absence of provocation from pyongyang we are alarmed that in the last two month when north korea conducted no test or rocket launch it seemed that washington wa not happy about that and tried to do thing that would irritate and provoke pyongyang lavrov said referring to u official he said it s a if they are hoping that they the north korean will lash out again and then it would be possible to engage in military option a you know the u leadership ha said many time that all option are on the table including military option and we note that japanese prime minister shinzo abe at a meeting with president trump in early november said that he support the american position percent lavrov said japanese foreign minister kono after listening to lavrov s remark responded that japan and it ally were not seeking regime change in north korea he said tokyo had to act to defend itself after pyongyang testfired missile which flew over japan s territory this is unprecedented the most important and most pressing threat not just to japan and russia but to the international community a a whole it s absolutely unacceptable kono said speaking through an interpreter we believe it s necessary to use all possible mean and to increase the pressure on north korea a much a possible to stop it nuclear program and the rocket launch he said japan welcome the position of the united state which is that to protect japan and south korea all mean of deterrence will be used earlier this year japan s abe expressed hope of a breakthrough in tokyo s dispute with moscow over a group of island in the pacific but that prospect ha now dimmed the island are known in japan a the northern territory and in russia a the kurile island at the end of world war two soviet force took control over the island from japan the island dispute ha meant that moscow and tokyo have still not signed a formal peace agreement to end wartime hostility lavrov and kono said at their talk that they had made progress on measure to boost russianjapanese economic cooperation on the island and to ease access for japanese people wanting to visit they offered no detail about any progress on resolving the core of the dispute about who ha sovereignty over the island
Title_Text: russia take tokyo to task over defense alliance with washington

Text: another republican ha dropped out of the race this time it s kentucky senator rand paul in a released statement paul said it s been an incredible honor to run a principled campaign for the white house today i will end where i began ready and willing to fight for the cause of liberty youtube httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvmasdefthe self described libertarianish paul touted himself a an alternative to establishment republican marketing himself a a grassroots guyhowever paul finished th place in the iowa caucus and and although he wa one of the first to announce his candidacy his campaign never gained any traction since the beginning of his candidacy poll consistently showed paul in the back of the pack paul always failed to break away from ben carson donald trump marco rubio and even the lowly jeb bushpaul struggled to raise money from both large and small donor resulting in a cash strapped campaign that wa never able to spend and then replenish through donor whether big or small his idea of a noninterventionist and nonviolent approach in u foreign policy apparently didn t sit well with republican ted cruz the guy who plan on killing lot of folk especially in the middle east is the current front runner for the republican nominationfeatured image via wikimedia common
Title_Text: another one bite the dust gop candidate hang up presidential run video

Text: donald trump is literally ordering the government to take two step back for every step forwardregulations protect the american people there are regulation that give u clean water and clean air regulation that keep worker safe at work with fair wage regulation that prevent dangerous or poisonous product from being sold to consumer regulation that keep our food safe regulation that protect u from predatory banking and regulation that protect endangered specie and those are just the tip of the iceberg without regulation company could pollute whenever and wherever they want our country would be a disaster there s a reason why we have regulationsbut donald trump promised during his first week to kill percent of regulation the regulation are going to be cut massively he said during a meeting with corporate ceo on his third full day in office last weekand now he is following through by signing an executive order that requires federal agency to kill two existing regulation for every new one created and gut funding for new regulation for the entire yearaccording to reuterstrump plan to sign an executive order on monday that will require that for every new federal regulation proposed two must be revoked an administration official saidthe order say federal agency will propose rule they want to eliminate and the white house will review those decision the order set a budget of  for new regulation in and the administration will set a regulation budget each yearbasically trump s cabinet could propose a useless regulation and then use it a an excuse to cut two crucial regulation like a food safety rule or rule that regulate pollutionwhile there surely are regulation that could be loosened to help small business owner waging total war against regulation and mandating that two be repealed for every new one created is completely asinine and doe nothing but hurt the american people and take the country backwardsagain most regulation on the book were created for a reason and need to remain to protect the environment our health and our livesthis is not a game but donald trump sure seems to think it isfeatured image via shawn thewpoolgetty image
Title_Text: trump executive order mandate two regulation cut for every new one created

Text: islamabad reuters  an unexplained dispute between pakistan s interior minister and an elite paramilitary unit under his command is adding to political confusion in islamabad prompting question about a rift in tie between civilian leader and the powerful military the spat come at a moment of heightened concern over the feverish political climate in nucleararmed pakistan which the united state seek to include in it new strategy for south asia interior minister ashan iqbal wa taken by surprise when the elite ranger unit which provides security around parliament withdrew it guard without explanation on wednesday i wa told the ranger have unilaterally withdrawn from the important installation where they were on duty which for u wa shocking iqbal told domestic television channel dawn news this wa a gross violation outside parliament on thursday the frontier constabulary wa on guard instead a police official on duty confirmed the ranger were no longer stationed there the order for them to leave did not come from the interior ministry it must have come from somewhere else said the official who asked not to be identified because of the sensitivity of the topic the pakistan army s public relation wing denied any military involvement in the incident attributing it to poor coordination it wa a local miscoordination that got a lot of hype i don t think there is a clash of institution major general asif ghafoor said at a press briefing the army will do what it need to do within the constitution but to create a perception that the army want to impose martial law these are thing which are not even to be talked about he added ranger official could not immediately be reached for comment iqbal did not immediately respond to reuters telephone call to seek comment pakistan s military ha ruled the country for of the year since independence from britain in since there have been democratically elected government but the army retains sweeping influence and any hint of discord stir worry among advocate of a strong civilian government the ranger had this week denied iqbal entry to a court building where matter relating to an antigraft case against sharif were being heard prompting him to threaten to resign saying he refused to be a puppet interior minister the move follow july s supreme court disqualification of former prime minister nawaz sharif which he blamed on a conspiracy against him feeding speculation about a rupture in civilianmilitary tie senior leader from sharif s pakistan muslim league nawaz pmln party pointed finger at the country s military after his disqualification for not declaring a source of income the army denies playing a role but the ranger departure from the area around parliament point to a persistent disagreement between civilian and military leader one analyst said they can t just leave their post said zeeshan salahuddin communication and strategy director of the islamabadbased centre for research and security study if they have done so without order that clearly show the continuing rift between the two and the displeasure of the military we have concern about the future of pakistan s government too in term of them we want their government to be stable u secretary of state rex tillerson said following a meeting with pakistan s foreign minister on wednesday the government will take action after completing an inquiry into the withdrawal iqbal added the ranger are a force subordinate to the ministry of the interior and when they are deployed they are supposed to work under the civil administration he said
Title_Text: row over pakistani paramilitary unit fuel political confusion

Text: new york reuters  green group on friday slammed u president donald trump for choosing a nominee for white house environmental panel who wrote in an opinion article last year that carbon dioxide is not a pollutant the white house said on thursday that trump had nominated kathleen hartnett white who served a texass top environmental regulator under the states former governor u energy secretary rick perry to the white house council on environmental quality the council set the administrations environmental policy goal white now a senior fellow at the texas public policy institute ha questioned the notion that burning fossil fuel is causing harmful increase in global temperature in an opinion article in the austin americanstatesman newspaper on june she said natural gas had been falsely maligned and should be known a the gas of life environmental working group president ken cook said on friday that assertion indicated that white would facilitate the rampant looting of environmental and public health protection policies according to a news release the environmental working group describes itself a a nonprofit nonpartisan organization dedicated to protecting human health and the environment the sierra club environmental group called white a fossil fuel industry apologist in a news release on friday white did not immediately respond to a request for comment kathleen hartnett white is eminently qualified having served a an environmental regulator and on numerous environmental board and commissions a white house spokeswoman said her nomination wa cleared by the office of government ethic we look forward to mr white being confirmed an overwhelming majority of scientist think that carbon dioxide emission from burning fossil fuel is a major contributor to global climate change triggering sea level rise drought and more frequent violent storm white is not the first person trump ha picked to join his administration who reject that scientific consensus in march u environmental protection agency administrator scott pruitt said he did not believe carbon dioxide wa a major contributor to global warming
Title_Text: green group criticize trump pick for white house environmental policy post

Text: istanbul reuters  an istanbul prosecutor ha issued arrest warrant for the parent of a former police investigator who gave evidence at the trial of a turkish banker in the united state last week the hurriyet newspaper reported on wednesday turkey ha called for the arrest of huseyin korkmaz after he testified at the trial of mehmet hakan atilla a former executive of statelender halkbank who is accused of helping iran evade u sanction the istanbul prosecutor s office wa not immediately available for comment u prosecutor have accused atilla of working with turkishiranian gold trader reza zarrab and others to help iran evade u sanction through fraudulent gold and food transaction the case ha strained relation between turkey and the united state which are nato ally atilla ha pleaded not guilty and halkbank ha denied involvement with any illegal transaction but zarrab ha pleaded guilty and testified for u prosecutor korkmaz said he fled turkey in fearing retaliation from the government after leading an investigation in into zarrab which implicated highranking official hurriyet said the istanbul prosecutor s order to arrest korkmaz s parent came after his testimony in the u case in which he said he gave document related to the investigation to his mother to keep last week turkish police summoned a federal bureau of investigation fbi official over statement made by korkmaz in the u court the staterun anadolu agency reported
Title_Text: turkey order arrest of former police investigator parent hurriyet

Text: barcelona reuters  catalonia s regional government said it would allow voter in sunday s banned independence referendum to vote at any polling station they found open in the region if their designated voting booth wa closed in a further step to make it easier to vote voting slip printed at home will be accepted a valid jordi turull the regional government s spokesman told a news conference after a court banned the vote spanish police arrested catalan official seized campaign leaflet and sealed off many of the school designated a polling station
Title_Text: catalan government say voter may use any polling station in referendum

Text: to compete with his frenemy donald trump texas senator ted cruz ha hit upon an old if dubious campaign strategy lie cheat and steal his way to victoryin what is becoming a pattern with the tea party conservative cruz ha yet again sent election official scrambling to their rulebooksdesperate for money to fund his campaign cruz told supporter that a group of supersecret megadonors had personally promised him that they would match all of ted s donation dollarfordollar within the next hour cruz begged for people to join on this campaign buy one get onei just got off the phone with a few very generous supporter who after our big win in iowa last night have pledged huge support for my campaignfor the next hour these most generous supporter have agreed to match all online donation to my campaign made through the link belowif that sound like a scam you might find floating between your most gullible facebook friend that s because it just might bethe problem a the intercept wa quick to point out wa that either cruz is lying or breaking the law pick your poison tedcampaign finance expert however say there s no way cruz could be doing exactly what he promised without violating the law that s because there s no way a few very generous supporter could legally be matching a large number of contribution to the campaignthe operative rule is that individual donation to campaign are legally capped if this money is going to his campaign any one of those donor can only give a maximum of  per cycle including any money they have given before said fred wertheimer a campaign finance expert at democracy in other word rich donor and poor donor can only donate up to a certain amount so what s a megadonor to do that s where super pac come in but here s the thing cruz can t coordinate with his super pac without breaking the law so how can he be instructing his rich friend to match his campaign contributionsthe other option of course is that ted cruz is lying there are no supersecret megadonors cruz just want to get people running for their checkbook this is a pretty strong possibility because blatantly spreading falsehood is absolutely in cruz s wheelhousecruz ha been fairly open about running a dishonest campaign from the very beginning already reviled by democrat and republican alike the only way he ha managed to get a leg up ha been through deceit and pandering in iowa cruz s propensity for sliminess came to a head when his campaign sent out flier telling voter they had committed voting violation and on the night of the caucus maliciously spreading false rumor that ben carson one of cruz s biggest rival had suddenly dropped outis it so hard to imagine that cruz would lie to the very people who support him in order to trick them into giving him more money sadly it s completely believablefeature image via flickr
Title_Text: cruzs latest shameful fundraising scam is so absurdly illegal its like he want to be caught

Text: springfield ill reuters  bipartisan talk to reach a fiscal budget for illinois ahead of a tuesday deadline have derailed a the states republican governor and top democrat refused to budge from their demand the two side have been at an impasse since last year leaving illinois a the only state without a complete budget for the fiscal year that end on june bipartisan rankandfile working group pushed by governor bruce rauner have been meeting with sporadic report that progress wa being made on a budget for the new fiscal year but following a short meeting on friday with the governor legislative leader made it clear that common ground ha not been reached senate republican leader christine radogno accused democrat of pulling the plug on negotiation they want to push the balanced budget issue reform off into the fall after the election she told reporter its clear their priority is political and not for the good of the state house speaker michael madigan defended the budget passed by democrat in his chamber this week saying he is not willing to hold resident hostage while the governor expands his demand for probusiness and antiunion reform there will be a complaint the state doe not have sufficient money to pay for that budget madigan said and ive said for the last year and a half im prepared to negotiate with the governor to find the money to pay for those services house republican blasted the  billion general fund budget passed on wednesday and again on thursday by democrat a being  billion short on revenue because the spending plan doe not include big cost like pension and debt payment madigan who ha advocated a socalled millionaires tax said his first revenue choice would be taxing the wealthy through exclusion and deduction in the illinois income tax code including the earned income tax credit rauner contended negotiation were continuing but he warned that the fifthlargest u state must stop spending money it doe not have well never have balanced budget if we dont grow our economy and we need reform to grow our economy get more job and higher family incomes he said house republican pleaded with democrat during fridays session to break with madigan and continue to work with them my request is that you dont give up said house republican jim durkin who added that a deal wa close
Title_Text: illinois budget talk fizzle amid partisan entrenchment

Text: london reuters  british prime minister theresa may said on wednesday she expects parliament will have a vote on the final brexit deal before the country ha formally left the bloc we will be able to achieve that agreement and negotiation in time for this parliament to have the vote she told parliament
Title_Text: uk pm may confident parliament will have vote on final brexit deal

Text: donald trump is playing a dangerous game by falsely accusing his predecessor of wiretapping his phone line before the election most people realize when trump seems unhinged in his twitter timeline it s usually to distract the public from what is really going on such a his scandalous tie to russia and his new travel ban which remarkably resembles his old travel ban republican and democrat are both left scratching their head over trump s accusationsrepublican rep trey gowdy sc who spent two year investigating hillary clinton over the attack in benghazi said monday he s seen no evidence to support trump s claim that former president obama wiretapped his office during the presidential campaign i don t think the fbi is the obama team and i don t think the men and woman who are career prosecutor at the department of justice belong to any team other than a blindfolded woman holding a pair of scale gowdy told politico we have the tool to keep u safe and it s prudent for those tool to be used lawfully and appropriately gowdy continued if they re not used lawfully and appropriately there s a paper trail and we ll be able to find it out gowdy continued to say that it wa hard to crossexamine tweet and any information regarding a fisa warrant used against trump would be available to the trump administrationby the way if a fisa warrant wa issued that would have to be allowed by a judge meaning in that instance there would be some sort of evidence against trump so much so a to wiretap his phone or at least any call to and or from russia the obama team is no longer in charge gowdy added so any information the current department of justice ha that suggests the previous department of justice acted inappropriately they are welcome to release it but there is no evidence to release a sitting president cannot issue a wiretap that s not how presidenting work k there is a process to go through firsteven jason chaffetz said today that there is no evidence to back up trump s claim still yet chaffetz is willing to investigate trump s claim while refusing to launch a probe into the alleged president s tie to russiafeatured image via alex wonggetty image
Title_Text: even trey gowdy think trumps wiretap conspiracy is crazy

Text: a category four hurricane ha hit texas it s set to be the most disastrous hurricane since katrina hit louisiana in yet donald trump is using it a an opportunity to deport peoplethousands of people are evacuating the affected area trying to beat the storm instead of helping ensure that evacuation go smoothly the trump administration is doing the exact opposite they are creating checkpoint and forcing people to show their paper proving they are documented resident of the united statesthe federal government is closing border patrol checkpoint in the path of the hurricane but they re leaving checkpoint open outside the path the texas tribune report border patrol checkpoint will not be closed unless there is a danger to the safety of the traveling public and our agent border patrol resource including personnel and transportation will be deployed on an a needed basis to augment the effort and capability of localresponse authority the agency said in a statementthe border patrol is a law enforcement agency and we will not abandon our law enforcement duty i m sure you can imagine the consequence sure checkpoint will only be open outside the path of the hurricane but they can still cause traffic to back up for mile it will also all but ensure that undocumented immigrant and their family will stay behind only to be potentially killed by the hurricane or the resulting floodscivil right agency like the aclu are furious this is a disgusting move from the border patrol that break with past practice american civil liberty union director of immigration policy and campaign lorella praeli said the border patrol should never keep checkpoint open during any natural disaster in the united state everyone no matter the color of their skin or background is worth saving everyone no matter the color of their skin or background is worth saving except to donald trump they really aren t trump doesn t care about anyone but he doe care about appeasing his racist xenophobic base john edward used to talk about two america today we have the america that donald trump care about about of the country and we have the rest of u who could all die in the path of a hurricane for all he caresfeatured image via poolgetty image
Title_Text: disgusting trump is using hurricane a an opportunity to deport people

Text: earlier today donald trump once again disgraced the united state by demonstrating his incompetence with empty threat to north korea via his twitter account showcasing his inability to handle a crisis trump tweeted that he would meet with his military expert and could only say we ll see when he wa asked about his plan to attack north koreafurther proving that no one in his administration take him seriously defense secretary james mattis wa sent out to give a more powerful statement on north korea outshining his own bos threat in a statement mattis warned north korea that the united state military would certainly respond to any threat mattis said any threat to the united state or it territory including guam or our ally will be met with a massive military response a response both effective and overwhelming mattis also urged north korea to listen to the un security council all member unanimously agreed on the threat north korea pose and they remain unanimous in their commitment to the denuclearization of the korean peninsula we are not looking to the total annihilation of a country namely north korea but a i said we have many option to do so of course the reason mattis had to make this statement in the first place is because no one can believe a word that trump say even eight month into his presidency trump ha managed to destroy every ounce of credibility he might have had and many of the task he should be doing are now falling on the shoulder of his more capable administration member no one take him seriously so he need to send others to make statement for himyou can watch mattis cover for his bos in the video belowdefense secretary james mattis any threat to the united state will be met with a massive military response httpstcowzbwvgoik cnn politics cnnpolitics september featured image via drew angerergetty image

Text: qaryatayn syria reuters  twenty six syrian hostage who escaped from their islamic state captor received an emotional homecoming on sunday in the central province of homs witness and official said they were among at least people abducted and taken by fleeing islamic state militant to a secret location in the desert east of the town of alqaryatayn on oct when the syrian army and progovernment militia regained control of the town the others are still missing according to local official who have not disclosed the identity of any of the hostage alqaryatayn lie nearly kilometer mile west of deir alzor city the current focus of the syrian government s offensive with russian jet and iranbacked militia against islamic state about people turned out in alqaryatayn on sunday to welcome home the returning hostage according to reuters reporter who visited the warscarred town during a trip organized by the syrian authority parent wept a they embraced returning son while other relative and local resident threw sweet and sugar in the air in celebration thank god for your return said an elderly man a he embraced a young man most in the crowd declined to be interviewed syrian authority said jihadist had taken revenge after being forced out after three week of fighting around the outskirt of alqaryatayn by slaughtering score of the city s inhabitant a senior local official said the hostage escaped after they got past an iraqi jihadist militant while he took a nap and seized his gun and shot him dead but the joy surrounding the hostage return wa still overshadowed by execution witnessed in the town in the past few week when militant rounded up local official and member of the security force police and member of their family and executed them in broad daylight according to official we forgot our joy when thinking of the nightmare that we went through found ghosn a local government official told reuters tv saying city official had identified at least out of people slain during the revenge killing
Title_Text: syrian hostage who escaped islamic state receive rapturous homecoming

Text: she burst on the scene last august when she upset a year incumbent democrat in the minnesota state primary election to become the nation s first female muslim state legislatorilhan omar the yearold community organizer who came to america a a refugee from somalia wa touted by democrat a a model success story from a refugee camp to the state capitol with intelligence and insight beamed former minneapolis mayor rt rybak who endorsed omar this is a wonderful story to tell a american and a great source of pride for the state of minnesota s open arm but on thursday omar made her mark in another wayshe wa one of only two member of the minnesota state house to vote against a bill that would allow life insurance company to deny payouts to the beneficiary of terrorist who die in violent attack on americansomar who represents the heavily immigrant cedar riverside area of minneapolis wa joined by fellow democratic rep john lesch of st paul in voting against the billomar s vote stick out because at least somali refugee have been confirmed by the fbi to have left the u to join overseas terrorist organization including alshabab the alqaida affiliate in somalia and isi in syria and iraqdozens of other somaliamericans have been tried andor convicted of providing material support to overseas terroriststhe minneapolisst paul area is home to the nation s largest somali refugee communitythe minnesota insurance bill wa introduced by rep joe hoppe rchaska in response to syed farook s jihadist rampage in san bernardino california in december in which he shot and killed people and injured at an office christmas party farook made sure his life insurance policy worth  were valid before conducting the deadly shooting with help from his wife tashfeen malikafter farook died in a shootout with police his mother fought to remain the beneficiary of the life insurance policy the insurance company balked and the case ha gone to courtdemocratic rep debra hilstrom said the goal of the minnesota bill is to make certain that folk don t benefit from terrorism and this limit the beneficiary to the premium that were paid in it limit the exposure for the insurance company when someone is committing an act of terrorism wndwatch
Title_Text: first female muslim legislator vote to make life insurance company do the unthinkable for dead terrorist video

Text: washington reuters  the u state department halted the planned sale of some assault rifle to the philippines national police after senator ben cardin said he would oppose it senate aide told reuters on monday aide said cardin the top democrat on the u senate foreign relation committee wa reluctant for the united state to provide the weapon given concern about human right violation in the philippine news of the thwarting of the weapon sale wa met with disappointment among the philippine police and government on tuesday but they said alternative supplier would be found police spokesman dionardo carlos said the philippine had yet to be notified about the sale being stopped the relationship between the united state and the philippine a longtime ally ha been complicated lately by president rodrigo dutertes angry reaction to criticism from washington of his violent battle to rid the country of illegal drug more than people have been killed in police operation or by suspected vigilante in connection with the antinarcotics campaign since duterte took office on june the u state department informs congress when international weapon sale are in the work aide said foreign relation committee staff informed state that cardin would oppose the deal during the departments prenotification process for the sale of  assault rifle stopping the deal u state department official did not comment ronald dela rosa the philippine national police chief and staunch supporter of the war on drug said he liked the american rifle but suggested china a an alternative smallarm provider we really wanted the u rifle because these are reliable he told broadcaster abscbn but if the sale will not push through we will find another source maybe from china in october duterte told u president barack obama to go to hell and said the united state had refused to sell some weapon to his country but he did not care because russia and china were willing supplier according to some u official washington ha been doing it best to ignore dutertes rhetoric and not provide him with a pretext for more outburst an open break with the philippine could create problem for the united state in a region where chinas influence ha grown
Title_Text: exclusive u stopped philippine rifle sale that senator opposed  source
