Text: london reuters  british police said on friday that they were treating a a terrorist incident report of a blast at a west london metro station armed police rushed to report of a fire on a train at a london underground station with local medium reporting there had been an explosion on a packed rushhour commuter train deputy assistant commissioner neil basu the senior national coordinator for ct policing ha declared it a terrorist incident the metropolitan police said in a statement on friday
Title_Text: british police say terrorist incident at london metro station

Text: istanbul reuters  turkish authority issued detention warrant on monday for people believed to have worked a matchmaker for a network accused of orchestrating last year s failed military coup a spokesman for the istanbul police said sixtytwo of the suspect had been detained in the operation centered in istanbul and spread over other province he said operation to locate the rest were ongoing the suspect were marriage official for supporter of the usbased cleric fethullah gulen who the turkish government say wa behind the failed july coup the spokesman said gulen denies any involvement in the coup attempt they were believed to have helped set up arranged marriage for some of gulen s follower he said turkish official say the gulen network closely monitored the personal and professional life of some supporter including their education career and marriage turkish police and state intelligence official identified the suspect in a joint operation using conversation traced on bylock an encrypted messaging application commonly used by gulen s supporter the spokesman said turkey ha identified user of bylock and ha launched investigation into of them the interior minister said last month more than people including security official military personnel and civil servant have been detained in the aftermath of the coup the crackdown ha alarmed turkey s western ally and right group who say president tayyip erdogan is using the coup a a pretext to muzzle dissent the government say the measure taken under emergency rule that wa imposed after the coup are necessary due to the security threat turkey face
Title_Text: turkey issue warrant for matchmaker in cleric network

Text: baghdaddubai reuters  iran on sunday shut it border crossing with iraq s kurdistan in support of measure taken by the iraqi government to isolate the kurdish region the iraqi foreign ministry said at the request of the iraqi government the islamic republic of iran closed today the border crossing with the kurdistan region of iraq the iraqi foreign ministry said in a statement in baghdad earlier in the day iranian foreign ministry spokesman bahram qassemi had indirectly dismissed claim these crossing were shut a far a i know nothing new ha happened in this area the iranian student news agency isna quoted him a saying an iranian mp mohammadjavad nobandegani said tehran did not want to publicize the closing of the border there is no need for explicit publicity the mp wa quoted a saying by iran s ilna news agency the closure would negatively impact resident who depend on border trade he said adding that national interest sometimes require u to act this way iran last month halted flight to and from kurdish region in northern iraq over the independence referendum by the autonomous kurdistan regional government krg tehran also carried out war game at the kurdish border in september tehran fear the spread of separatism to it own kurdish population which is around million iran back shi ite group which have been ruling or holding key security and government position in iraq since the usled invasion which toppled saddam hussein
Title_Text: iraq say iran ha shut border with kurdistan

Text: ankara reuters  a formal u recognition of jerusalem a the capital of israel would cause catastrophe and lead to new conflict in the middle east turkish deputy prime minister bekir bozdag said on monday speaking to reporter after a cabinet meeting bozdag who is also the government spokesman said jerusalem s status had been determined by international agreement and that preserving it wa important for the peace of the region the status of jerusalem and temple mount have been determined by international agreement it is important to preserve jerusalem s status for the sake of protecting peace in the region bozdag said if another step is taken and this step is lifted this will be a major catastrophe israel captured arab east jerusalem in the middle east war it later annexed it declaring the whole of the city a it capital a move not recognized internationally palestinian want jerusalem a the capital of their future state on sunday u president donald trump s adviser and soninlaw said trump had not yet made a decision on whether to formally recognize jerusalem a israel s capital a move that would break with decade of u policy past u president have insisted that the status of jerusalem home to site holy to the jewish muslim and christian religion must be decided in negotiation on saturday turkish president tayyip erdogan held a phone call with palestinian president mahmoud abbas in which they discussed the status of jerusalem source in erdogan s office said the source said erdogan told abbas that preserving the status of jerusalem wa important for all muslim country adding that international law and united nation decision should be followed on the issue any move by the united state to recognize jerusalem a israel s capital would fuel extremism and violence arab league secretarygeneral ahmed aboul gheit said on saturday a senior jordanian source said on sunday that amman ha begun consultation on convening an emergency meeting of the arab league and the organisation of islamic cooperation before trump s expected declaration this week
Title_Text: turkey say recognizing jerusalem a capital would cause catastrophe

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump removed his chief strategist steve bannon from the national security council on wednesday reversing his controversial decision early this year to give a political adviser an unprecedented role in security discussion trumps overhaul of the nsc confirmed by a white house official also elevated general joseph dunford chairman of the joint chief of staff and dan coat the director of national intelligence who head all u intelligence agency the official said the change move the nsc back to it core function of what its supposed to do it also appears to mark a victory for national security adviser hr mcmaster who had told some national security expert he felt he wa in a battle to the death with bannon and others on the white house staff vice president mike penny said bannon would continue to play an important role in policy and played down the shakeup a routine this is just a natural evolution to ensure the national security council is organized in a way that best serf the president in resolving and making those difficult decisions penny said on fox news bannon said in a statement he had succeeded in returning the nsc back to it traditional role of coordinating foreign policy rather than running it he cited president barack obamas national security adviser susan rice for why he advocated a change susan rice operationalized the nsc during the last administration so i wa put on nsc to ensure it wa deoperationalized general mcmaster ha nsc back to it proper function he said trumps white house team ha grappled with infighting and intrigue that ha hobbled his young presidency in recent day several other senior u foreign policy and national security official have said the mechanism for shaping the trump administrations response to pressing challenge such a syria north korea and iran still were not in place critic of bannons role on the nsc said it gave too much weight in decisionmaking to someone who lacked foreign policy expertise bannon who wa chief executive of trumps presidential campaign in the month leading to his election in november in some respect represents trumps america first nationalistic voice helping fuel his antiwashington fervor and pushing for the president to part way at time with mainstream republican before joining the trump administration bannon headed breitbart news a rightwing website u representative adam schiff ranking democrat on the house of representative intelligence committee called the shift in the nsc a positive step that will help mcmaster gain control over a body that wa being politicized by bannons involvement as the administrations policy over north korea china russia and syria continues to drift we can only hope this shakeup brings some level of strategic vision to the body he said bannons removal from the nsc wa a potential setback for his sphere of influence in the trump white house where he ha a voice in most major decision but a trump confidant said bannon remained a influential a ever he is still involved in everything and still ha the full confidence of the president but to be fair he can only do so much stuff the confidant said speaking on condition of anonymity the white house official said bannon wa no longer needed on the nsc after the departure of trumps first national security adviser michael flynn flynn wa forced to resign on feb over his contact with russias ambassador to the united state sergei kislyak prior to trump taking office on jan the official said bannon had been placed on the nsc originally a a check on flynn and had only attended one of the nscs regular meeting the official dismissed question about a power struggle between bannon and mcmaster saying they shared the same world view however two current national security official rejected the white house explanation noting that two month have passed since flynns departure mcmaster they said speaking on the condition of anonymity also ha dueled with bannon and others over direct access to trump the future of deputy national security adviser kt mcfarland a former fox news commentator intelligence director ezra cohenwatnick a flynn appointee and other staffing decision trump is preparing for his first facetoface meeting on thursday and friday with chinese president xi jinping with the threat of north koreas nuclear and missile program a key component of their talk bannons seat on the nscs principals committee a group that includes the secretary of state defense and other ranking aide wa taken by rick perry who a energy secretary is charged with overseeing the u nuclear weapon arsenal
Title_Text: trump drop steve bannon from national security council

Text: los angeles reuters  thursdays republican debate on fox news channel could be round of megyn kelly versus donald trump but the journalist and fellow moderator say they are not preparing to stoke the fire with question about his headlinegrabbing battle with the network trump accused kelly of lobbing him tougher question than those directed at his rival in an august debate that wa the republican candidates first televised encounter kelly asked about trumps remark about woman prompting a stream of attack from the candidate who skipped a fox debate in january frankly i have been ready for seven month to move beyond what happened after that august debate kelly said in a recent interview i feel like its getting boring trump ha bigger thing to worry about and so do i the brash billionaires unfiltered style ha helped generate unprecedented rating for news network including fox owned by rupert murdochs st century fox inc foxao the cable channels august debate attracted million viewer a record for a presidential primary debate on any network according to nielsen the january forum without trump drew million still the secondlargest audience in the networks history trump is set to appear at thursdays rematch with fox news anchor kelly bret baier and chris wallace mr trump will be at the debate tomorrow and look forward to participating spokeswoman hope hick said on wednesday the moderator said they do not plan to mention trumps comment about kelly his complaint about unfair treatment by the cable news network or his absence from foxs january debate kelly said she ha not prepared a comeback if trump get personal i have my questions she said thats all i need last weeks debate on time warner incs twxn cnn turned into a raucous match where rival ted cruz and marco rubio ganged up on trump who fired back wallace called it an embarrassment to republican the three seemed hellbent on taking out each other on a lot of fairly minor points he said rather than discussing issue that affect peoples lives on tuesday trump and democratic frontrunner hillary clinton took big step toward securing their parties nomination with a series of statebystate victory after republican debate there remains plenty to explore because the remaining candidate  trump cruz rubio and john kasich  have now staked out position kelly said they will have to own those position or try to wiggle out she said but there is not that much wiggle room left on some of these things a fifth candidate ben carson appeared set to end his campaign and said he would skip thursdays debate cruz ha clashed with wallace on air and accused him of being too soft on trump the contender try to work the ref and complain and hope they will get it a little easier next time wallace said all three moderator said they ask tough question of each candidate i think fox ha been fair across the board baier said he said he hope for a discussion that is fiery but the most substantive debate so far a rival try to score point we will let the contrast and the conversation between candidate go baier said but there will be some balance thats what its always about not letting it get off the rails reporting by lisa richwine editing by peter henderson and jonathan oatis this article wa funded in part by sap it wa independently created by the reuters editorial staff sap had no editorial involvement in it creation or production
Title_Text: another debate brawl fox news kelly set for trump rematch

Text: tunis reuters  the united arab emirate ha information that tunisian woman or woman traveling on tunisian passport might commit terrorist act in the gulf country tunisia s state news agency tap said tunisia late on sunday suspended flight from dubai carrier emirate to tunis with official saying the airline wa refusing to carry female tunisian traveler emirate ha given no reason for not allowing female tunisian to board it flight since friday a spokesman for tunisia s presidency did not elaborate on the security threat in a brief tap article emirate had stopped it dubaitunis connection on monday in tunisia anger ha been building after woman said they had been banned at tunis airport from boarding emirate flight to dubai tunisian civil organization and political party called on the government to respond foreign minister khemais jhianoui told a local radio station the uae should apologize for the travel ban which he said it authority had not informed tunisia about
Title_Text: uae ha information tunisian woman may commit terrorist act tunisia say

Text: the trouble with quote on the internet is that you don t know if they re genuine or something today is abraham lincoln s birthday and to honor him the gop tweeted out an image of the statue in the lincoln memorial with a quotewhat a respectable way to commemorate one of the greatest president this country ever saw there s just one problem the quote isn t lincoln s it s most likely from a ad for a book by edward j stieglitz he in turn wa given credit for the phrase in former illinois governor adlai stevenson also used that quote but there s no evidence that lincoln ever said it and the gop look really stupidthe funny thing is that one could assume the general population wouldn t know whether the quote is lincoln s or not in the age of google however one ha to be far more careful about attributing quote and anything else because someone will inevitably look it up and make you look stupid if it s wrongso twitter decided to make the gop look really stupid and what they came up with ha u rolling stop making fool of yourselves guy we re going to bust our rib laughing at you for the rest of eternity give or take an eonfeatured image via screen capture
Title_Text: twitter hilariously fcks with gop for tweeting fake lincoln quote tweet

Text: moscow reuters  russia is ready to consider a new u resolution on north korea provided it doe not escalate military tension and focus on finding a diplomatic solution russian foreign minister sergei lavrov said on tuesday russia s foreign ministry said in a statement that lavrov had conveyed that stance to u secretary of state rex tillerson in a phone call initiated by the u side the ministry said lavrov had also spoken of the merit of involving un secretary general antonio guterres in helping find a diplomatic solution to the north korea crisis
Title_Text: russia say will consider u resolution on north korea but with caveat

Text: remember this if they bring a knife to the fight we bring a gun yep that wa obama speaking to an audience in philadelphia oh wait we ve got more i want you to argue with them get in their face yet obama had this to say about trump in fact it s been interesting when you look at what s happening with mr trump when he ha made some of the remark that for example challenge the heroism of mr mccain someone who endured torture and conducted himself with exemplary patriotism uh the republican party is shocked and yet that arises out of a culture where those kind of outrageous attack have become far too commonplace and get circulated nonstop through the internet and talk radio and news outlet and i recognize that when outrageous statement are made about me a lot of the same people who were outraged when they were made about mr mccain were pretty quiet via gp

Text: houston reuters  buckeye partner lp s yabucoa oil terminal in puerto rico remained closed on friday the company said day after hurricane maria left a trail of destruction and at least people dead across the caribbean the u oil storage and transportation company did not say if the tank at the millionbarrel terminal were damaged by the storm which made landfall near yabucoa but it said a full assessment of the facility is under way we are working to maintain the safety and wellbeing of our yabucoa puerto rico employee it said in a statement a larger terminal operated by u nustar energy lp on the island of st eustatius with capacity to store up to million barrel of oil also ha been unable to reopen after a previous hurricane irma affected several tank the closure of oil terminal in the caribbean and restriction to load and discharge large vessel in several texas port have constrained flow of crude and refined product across the atlantic in recent week maria the second major hurricane to hit the caribbean this month lashed the turk and caicos island on friday after knocking out power to all of puerto rico and pushing several river to record flood level
Title_Text: buckeye partner puerto rico oil terminal still closed after maria

Text: barring something completely unforeseen donald trump will be our new president in just a few week that mean that all personal liberty could fly right out the window except for one the liberty to discriminate based on who people love trump and the new congress haven t even taken office yet and the legislative hatred ha already begunted cruz who s never met a gay person or a woman who didn t make him feel selfrighteous is expected to reintroduce the first amendment defense act fada which despite it completely inoffensive name is all about allowing bigot to freely discriminate trump is expected to sign itin the text the bill say that business can refuse service based on one of two belief and both are ridiculous that marriage is or should be recognized a the union of one man and one woman or sexual relation are properly reserved to such a marriage a for the second one well unless a couple is entering an establishment demanding space to specifically have sex it doesn t seem there s ever a reason to declare that one a for the first marriage is what the law say it is and the law say that marriage is between two consenting adult who get married okay that s not the legal definition but the supreme court when antonin scalia wa still alive said that defining marriage is unconstitutionalthe ceo of equality texas agrees that the proposed law shouldn t be a law at all the legislation that senator cruz is proposing specifically elevates two narrow interpretation above any other religious practice chuck smith ceo of equality texas said the bill is titled the first amendment defense act but in reality it is an unconstitutional attempt to totally redefine what the first amendment protects source kxanit would also put the federal government in the weird position of suing itself the fada would allow business to sue if the government wouldn t let them discriminate the u attorney general would be required to defend the business against the governmenttrump will likely sign the bill at least according to his campaign s website if i am elected president and congress pass the first amendment defense act i will sign it to protect the deeply held religious belief of catholic and the belief of american of all faith here s the videothe other bad news is that by the time this reach the supreme court we will likely have another conservative justicefeatured image via drew angerergetty image
Title_Text: ted cruz about to reintroduce failed prohate bill trump likely to sign it video

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump began talk with republican senator on tuesday to try to build consensus for proposed tax cut in a meeting that wa overshadowed by an exchange of insult between the president and one of the lawmaker trump ha asked his fellow republican who control congress to pas a package of tax cut including a deep reduction in the corporate income tax by years end but hour before he wa to promote the tax plan at a weekly lunch for republican senator on capitol hill trump engaged in a distracting tussle with one of those lawmaker bob corker a leading fiscal hawk and the head of the senate foreign relation committee bob corker who couldnt get elected dog catcher in tennessee is now fighting tax cuts trump wrote on twitter later adding that the senator is incompetent trump arrived at the capitol building with senate majority leader mitch mcconnell for the lunch and gave a thumb up to waiting reporter a protester threw a handful of small russian flag toward trump and shouted comment about accusation of collusion between his presidential campaign and moscow both trump and russia deny colluding but a special counsel appointed by the u justice department and congressional committee are looking into the matter alienating any member of his own party could be costly for trumps legislative initiative in the senate because republican control the chamber by just a slim  margin corker warned trump in television interview against interfering in congressional effort to finalize the legislation to cut tax and called the presidents visit with senate republican a photo op hopefully the white house will step aside and let that occur in a normal process the tennessee republican told nbcs today program thats the best way for u to have success corker also described trump in a twitter post a an utterly untruthful president and in television interview accused trump of debasing the united state house of representative speaker paul ryan urged reporter to ignore the trumpcorker spat and concentrate on the tax plan put this twitter dispute aside the fact is we have an historic chance of fixing this tax code ryan said ryan added that he know corker well and predicted that the senator is going to vote for tax reform ryan said he want the house to pas the republican tax cut bill by the nov u thanksgiving holiday echoing trumps call to speed up the partys effort to get the measure approved before years end cnbc reported that republican plan to release their tax bill on nov after an expected house vote on thursday on a senateapproved budget plan house leader are eager to get a tax bill voted on before the dec deadline for a possible government shutdown come into view a it is likely to distract from the tax overhaul financial firm cowen and co said in a research note the senate timeframe on tax remains much more of a mystery with a senate finance draft likely in the late novemberearly december time frame cowen analyst chris krueger said securing congressional passage of his tax plan is critically important to trump who ha yet to get major legislation through congress since taking office in january including a healthcare overhaul he promised a a candidate last year tax cut were another of trumps campaign pledge the white house argues that tax cut are needed to boost economic growth and create job but ha shown sensitivity in recent week to argument that it is endangering americas longterm fiscal health trump said he believed the tax overhaul would help bring in  trillion in foreign profit from u company its going to bring back i would say  trillion back into this country trump told reporter in the oval office nobody even know the amount trump said market analyst estimate that about  trillion in profit is being held offshore by u multinationals to avoid the current percent u corporate income tax trumps tax plan would require multinationals to bring in or repatriate those profit at a sharply reduced tax rate payable over several year one of the key element of the proposal is to slash the corporate income tax rate to percent from percent while the broad parameter of the tax proposal have been made public detailed legislation ha not yet been unveiled democrat have painted trumps plan with it  trillion in tax cut a a gift to the rich and corporate america that would balloon the federal deficit trump promised on monday to protect a popular retirement program a republican lawmaker seek way to pay for the proposed cut
Title_Text: trump in tax meeting amid fight with republican senator

Text: washington reuters  executive from facebook inc fbo twitter inc twtrn and alphabet incs googlo google have been asked to testify about russian meddling in the u election before a house of representative panel on nov a congressional aide said on thursday executive from the company were already due to appear the same day before the senate intelligence committee which is also investigating moscows alleged role in the election but the aide said they had also been asked to offer testimony at a public hearing of the house intelligence committee aide to the committees leader declined comment it is house intelligence policy not to discus the interview schedule some u lawmaker increasingly alarmed about evidence that hacker used the internet to spread fake news and otherwise influence last years election have been pushing for more information about social network in particular the senate and house intelligence committee are two of the main congressional panel probing allegation that russia sought to interfere in the u election to boost republican president donald trumps chance at winning the white house and possible collusion between trump associate and russia moscow denies any such activity and trump ha repeatedly dismissed allegation of collusion facebook confirmed that company official would testify google and twitter did not immediately respond to request for comment
Title_Text: social medium executive to testify nov about russia and u election

Text: berlin reuters  german police presented on tuesday diary pair of glass and other item belonging to late beatle john lennon that were stolen from his widow yoko ono in and eventually ended up in berlin police arrested a man in berlin on monday suspected of receiving the stolen item which include lennon s last diary that ended on the day he wa shot and killed in new york on dec this day contains the entry that on that morning john lennon and yoko ono had an appointment with annie leibovitz to take a photo which i think is world famous berlin prosecutor michael von hagen told a news conference the leibovitz portrait of a naked lennon curled up around ono on their bed ran on the january cover of rolling stone magazine hagen rejected suggestion that ono might have lent or given away the object the diary especially were also treated by yoko ono a something sacred and the idea that she would have given away three original diary especially the one that end on the very day lennon died can be completely ruled out carsten pfohl head of property crime for berlin police said investigator had found one of the pair of glass and a receipt in lennon s name hidden in the trunk of the car of the accused on monday police suspect that the item were stolen by ono s former driver and then taken to turkey and were only brought to berlin in or another suspect life in turkey they said the berlin police wa alerted after they were found by the administrator for a bankrupt auction house which had previously valued the object at million euro  million   euro
Title_Text: german police present stolen john lennon diary

Text: jimmy kimmel landed a rare onair appearance from donald trump on the may th edition of his show and wasted no part of the segment in grilling trump on everything possibly the most interesting twist however came when kimmel read a question from bernie sander who will be tonight s guest on jimmy kimmel live the question hillary clinton backed out of an agreement to debate me in california before the june th primary are you prepared to debate the major issue facing our largest state and the country prior to the california primary trump ever the attentionwhore replied with something surprisingly philanthropic yes i am how much is he going to pay me because if i debated him we would have such high rating and i think i should take that money and give it to some worthy charity if he paid a nice sum for a charity i would love to do that trump later said that whatever network picked it up could donate the money to charity for this debatethe sander campaign wasted absolutely no time in responding to trump on thisgame on i look forward to debating donald trump in california before the june primary bernie sander berniesanders may this would be a truly interesting debate especially given that primary season isn t over yet despite all expectation that both nomination would be locked up by now there have already been so many monkey wrench thrown into the primary that one would think nobody would notice this one however one would be very wrong this could throw the biggest monkey wrench yet into the work depending on how the two candidate interacted with each other and the moderator in such a settingas of the time of this posting there wa no formal arrangement to actually hold this debate and setting it up could be a logistical nightmare for the campaign that could change quickly though depending largely on whether the network see any potential in it honestly they d be idiotic not to want to do it it s hard to imagine that anybody in the country wouldn t want to see these two put their argument sidebyside in a debate formatas bernie said game on featured image via michael vadongage skidmoreflickr image merged by rika christensen
Title_Text: donald trump and bernie sander agree to debate before californias primary

Text: new york reuters  donald trump clashed on wednesday with a union official who accused the presidentelect of lying about the number of job saved in a deal to keep air conditioner maker carrier from moving some job from indiana to mexico chuck jones president of united steelworker local which represents worker at united technology corps carrier plant in indianapolis in an interview on cnn criticized trump for at least the second time in two day over the deal trump in a twitter post on wednesday offered a sharp reply chuck jones who is president of united steelworker local ha done a terrible job representing worker no wonder company flee country on tuesday jones told the washington post that when trump spoke at the carrier factory last week he got up there and for whatever reason lied his as off indiana state official have agreed to give carrier  million in tax break to encourage it to keep about job in the state although about of the job are in the companys headquarters and were not scheduled to go to mexico only of the position are union factory job and carrier still plan to send an estimated job to mexico some employee are disappointed jones said on cnn on wednesday we had a lot of our member when the word wa coming out of they thought that they would have a job he said in more remark on cnn later on wednesday jones responded to trumps twitter post thats pretty lowdown low life he said he doesnt like to be challenged and i challenged him trump who made tough talk on trade a centerpiece of his election campaign had vowed to impose hefty tariff if carrier did not reverse course on shifting job to mexico trump posted another tweet after jones later remark on cnn if united steelworker wa any good they would have kept those job in indiana trump wrote
Title_Text: trump say union head who accused him of lying ha done a terrible job

Text: it s come to this legal citizen are being pushed aside for the refugee invader sweden began to import refugee decade ago and now ha a reputation for being a failed experiment in multiculturalism yes sweden is now the rape capital of the world say goodbye to sweden a local family in the swedish city of liding ha been ordered by the government to leave their home so that it can be given to migrant arriving from a foreign countryfather of two teenage boy uffe rustan received a voicemail from his local municipality telling him he would need to vacate the property by august in order to make way for asylum seeker from the middle east i wa evicted from my home over the phone when i asked for the reason he said that people come from other country he left the news and basically just said have a nice weekend rustan told a newspaperrustan life with his teenage son rasmus and linus all of whom were born in liding he rent the home from the city and ha been living in it for less than a year it feel like i m worthless even though i pay tax and my kid go to school here you cannot put a family on the street for another family said rustan just when it start to feel like home we are evicted rustan said that the news wa depressing and wondered why native swede were being treated worse than migrant arriving in the country for the first time despite suffering from a housing shortage sweden is handing over property to economic migrant with some politician even encouraging citizen to give up their garage to asylum seeker sweden is not the only european government that is turfing it own citizen out of social housing to accommodate the influx of muslim migrant while migrant are in some case enjoying all the comfort of good quality hotel low income german are being ordered to leave their home a the telegraph reported german are beginning to receive notice of eviction to make way for asylum seekersread more infowars
Title_Text: its come to this swedish family kicked out of home to make way for refugee invader

Text: it s no secret that donald trump ha deep insecurity about his job performance compared to his predecessor making matter worse trump s favorability continues to take a nosedive while former president barack obama is seeing a postoffice surge america got it first example of just how thinskinned and vain trump really would be a president when he repeatedly lied and had his staff lie about the size of his inauguration crowdwe re about to get a second glimpseon wednesday trump hosted the new england patriot football team at the white house in honor of the super bowl win however not everyone made the trip month ago player started announcing that they would boycott the trip due to trump s divisive rhetoric his history of racism sexism xenophobia and intolerance were enough to make many player not want to lend their support to his presidencyin an additional blow trump s idol tom brady decided last minute that he would not be attending the ceremony either brady s official excuse wa family reason it s unclear if there wa another more trumprelated reason the news wa probably devastating to trump who ha long considered brady one of his few friendsas a result of the boycott trump s group photo with the patriot wa noticeably sparse it looked even worse when the new york time dug up the patriot white house visit yeah they win super bowl a lotpatriots turnout for president obama in v patriot turnout for president trump today httpstcooxmeoqzoni pictwittercomplmjwhowj nyt sport nytsports april awkward featured image via chip somodevillagetty image
Title_Text: patriot white house group photo sure to infuriate trump after obama comparison surface

Text: new york reuters  provocative farright commentator milo yiannopoulos resigned on tuesday a a senior editor of the breitbart news website after he wa vilified and lost a book deal over comment that condoned certain intimate relation between men and young teenage boy yiannopoulos thanked breitbart for letting him transmit conservative and libertarian idea to an audience that otherwise would never have heard them but said he did not want his poor choice of words to detract from his colleagues important work this is my decision alone he told a news conference in new york city when your friend have done right by you you do right by them for me now that mean stepping aside yiannopoulos wa banned from twitter last year after making remark on race religion and sex that incited racial attack on an africanamerican actress on feb violent protester forced the cancellation of a speech he wa due to give at the university of california at berkeley the latest controversy stemmed from a video more than a year old in which yiannopoulos said he thought that when it came to relation between men and boy there are certainly people who are capable of giving consent at a younger age than the law allows on monday after the video resurfaced organizer of the conservative political action conference or cpac rescinded an invite for him to speak at the annual event the same day publisher simon schuster said it canceled the publication of yiannopoulos book dangerous which wa due out on june at tuesdays press conference yiannopoulos apologized for the remark and called the firestorm over them a horrible degrading humiliating experience the yearold briton told reporter he wa sexually abused between the age of and by two men but did not realize at the time it wa abuse i can look back now and see that it was yiannopoulos said my experience a a victim led me to believe that i could say anything on the subject i dont believe that sex with year old is ok i am horrified by pedophelia yiannopoulos said some of the remark were taken out of context and that he wa at time speaking about his specific experience of being abused despite the most recent backlash which he described a the worst of his career yiannopoulos said he planned to continue to try to grow an audience in the month ahead yiannopoulos said he would launch a new medium website he said he would focus more on entertainment and campus tour in his professional future instead of breitbart journalism
Title_Text: firebrand milo quits breitbart news after child sex remark

Text: brussels reuters  european government are complicit in grave human right violation in libya through their support for authority there who often work with people smuggler and torture refugee and migrant amnesty international said on tuesday amnesty said up to people are now held in libyan detention center for migrant and are subject to torture forced labor extortion and unlawful killing other human right organization have said similar thing in recent month the european support for libyan authority is part of a plan to cut african immigration across the mediterranean it aim to lower the number of people who drown during the crossing and curb the scale of a political problem high arrival cause to eu government italy ha spearheaded the plan in particular by training and equipping the coastguard and by spending million to back un agency working on relief effort in libya european government have not just been fully aware of these abuse by actively supporting the libyan authority in stopping sea crossing and containing people in libya they are complicit in these crime said john dalhuisen amnesty international s head for europe on tuesday italian prime minister paolo gentiloni defended the eu s policy in a speech to parliament ahead of this week s meeting of the bloc s leader in brussels and said sea arrival had dropped by twothirds since last july it s thanks to u that a light is being shone on human right in libya he said referring to million of euro italy and the eu spent on improving condition for people stuck there a spokesperson for the bloc s executive european commission said we are aware of the inhumane and terrible condition some face we share the same objective a amnesty saving life it said the bloc s funding helped the un agency for migration the iom send more than people in libya to their home country in africa at the same time it said the bloc ha also been slowly taking in genuine refugee libya is the main gateway for migrant trying to cross to europe by sea though number have dropped sharply since july a libyan faction and authority have begun to block departure under pressure from italy the main landing point more than have made the journey over the past four year the eu back libya s coastguard in it effort to intercept people heading to europe but they work closely with people smuggler who torture people for money amnesty said by supporting libyan authority in trapping people in libya european government have shown where their true priority lie namely the closure of the central mediterranean route with scant regard to the suffering caused said dalhuisen some eu official and diplomat chafe at the bloc s reliance on militia that have emerged since the fall of libya s leader muammar gaddafi in but eu leader will recommit at their meeting in brussels on dec  to a strategy they say is bearing fruit in the form of fewer sea crossing the presidency of libya s unbacked government said last month it wa a victim of illegal migration not a source of it and appealed to foreign power to help stop flow from migrant country of origin
Title_Text: amnesty say eu is complicit in violation of migrant right in libya

Text: clinton s state department waste and mismanagementthese are all state department expenditure during her tenure  million on a nobid contract for crystal stemware  million on cost overrun at the embassy in kabul afghanistan over  million on mostly unused police training facility in iraq  to buy copy of president obama s book  to polish marble at the brazilian embassy  to try to make state department facebook page more popular  to hire an event planner for a th of july party in madrid  to send three comedian to india more than  to purchase art in mexico  to purchase art in china
Title_Text: revealed hillarys overthetop spending during state department reign will blow your mind

Text: tegucigalpa reuters  honduran president juan orlando hernandez extended the lead over his rival to just over one percentage point in a seesawing delayed vote count for a presidential election that ha sparked a political crisis latest result showed on thursday the website of the electoral tribunal said that with percent of ballot counted after sunday s election hernandez had secured percent of the vote in the central american nation with his centrist opponent salvador nasralla on percent the process ha been disrupted by technical glitch and nasralla initially held a five point lead over preelection favorite hernandez until the count ground to a halt on monday with more than half of the ballot counted when the count restarted some hour later the result started to swing in favor of hernandez and nasralla cried foul rejecting the figure and saying that he wa being robbed
Title_Text: honduran vote count give hernandez point lead over rival

Text: antitrump besties matt damon and george clooney sat down with good morning america s michael strahan to discus their good friend democrat megadonor and accused rapist and serial sexual predator harvey weinstein not only did both actor who owe much of their successful career to harvey weinstein wait until their reputation were on the line to speak out about the sexual predator but they waited until only day before their new movie suburbicon is about to debut to say that they actually knew more about the abuse woman received at the hand of the bully movie mogul than they had previously admitted tonotably absent in the interview is the third actor ben affleck who completes the trio of bestie actor after affleck spoke out on the harvey weinstein controversy he wa also accused of covering up weinstein s behavior a well a video that show affleck used his power to prey on innocent woman notice how quickly damon throw affleck under the bus saying he knew but only told damon who of course never told anyone elseamericans who are sick and tired of sanctimonious holierthanthou liberal who have no value or moral yet try to shame american for supporting political candidate who don t hold the same liberal view a theirs are left with only one option boycottsuburbicon and boycotthollywood in the interview that aired on monday morning george clooney and matt damon said that they knew weinstein wa a bully and womanizer who bragged of bedding actress but had no idea about the level of criminal behavior that wa occurring behind closed door in hotelsdamon also confessed that he wa aware weinstein had sexually harassed the first lady of miramax gwyneth paltrow just before the actress shot the film adaptation of jane austen s emma for the studio i knew the story about gwyneth from ben affleck because he wa with her after brad pitt and so i knew that story said damon but i wa working with gwyneth and with harvey on the film the talented mr ripley he then added i never talked to gwyneth about it but ben told me that whatever or agreement they had come to there wa an understanding and he treated her incredibly respectfully always affleck and pitt have not spoken about the incident and damon s revelation that he learned about weinstein s behavior from his friend may cause even more problem for the embattled actor a it seems to contradict his initial statement i am saddened and angry that a man who i worked with used his position of power to intimidate sexually harass and manipulate many woman over decade said affleck almost one week after news of the scandal broke in a carefullyworded response that seemed to suggest he had never before heard any of the allegationsdamon s decision to characterize the relationship between paltrow and weinstein a always respectful is a bit odd a well considering her admission that she had been sexually harassed by the mogul is part of the reason the men were sitting down for the interviewclooney meanwhile said that like many of weinstein s victim he had been told a number of time by the mogul that he wa bedding a number of star harvey would talk to me about woman that he had had affair with said clooney i didn t necessarily believe him quite honestly because to believe him would be to believe the worst of some actress who were friend of mine and i didn t really think that they had affair with harvey and clearly they didn the then added but the idea that this predator this assaulter wa out there silencing woman like that it s beyond infuriating and the fact that the story is coming out now and the more it come out i want to know all of it daily mailwatch a these two actor desperately attempt to save their upcoming movie suburbicon a well a their hollywood careershe didnt do it out in the open matt damon on harvey weinstein httpstcofbsmwurca pictwittercomojxeptapz good morning america gma october it s indefensible that s the only word you can start with harvey s admitted to it and it s indefensible i ve known harvey for year he gave me my first big break a an actor in film on from dusk till dawn he gave me my first big break a a director with confession of a dangerous mind we ve had dinner we ve been on location together we ve had argument but i can tell you that i ve never seen any of this behavior everi ve heard rumor and the rumor in general started back in the s and they were that certain actress had slept with harvey to get a role it seemed like a way to smear the actress and demean them by saying that they didn t get the job based on their talent so i took those rumor with a grain of salt but the other part of this the part we re hearing now about eight woman being paid off i didn t hear anything about that and i don t know anyone that did that s a whole other level and there s no way you can reconcile that there s nothing to say except that it s indefensiblea lot of people are doing the you had to know thing right now and yes if you re asking if i knew that someone who wa very powerful had a tendency to hit on young beautiful woman sure but i had no idea that it had gone to the level of having to pay off eight woman for their silence and that these woman were threatened and victimized i ve been talking with a lot of people about this and i don t know many people who knew of thatthere s an argument that everyone is complicit in it i suppose the argument would be that it s not just about hollywood but about all of u that every time you see someone using their power and influence to take advantage of someone without power and influence and you don t speak up you re complicit and there s no question about that
Title_Text: watch sanctimonious antitrump hollywood implodesbest friend turn on each other to save their career and their new movie suburbicon

Text: munich germany reuters  republican senator john mccain broke with the reassuring message that u official visiting germany have sought to convey on their debut trip to europe saying on friday that the administration of president donald trump wa in disarray mccain a known trump critic told the munich security conference that the resignation of the new presidents security adviser michael flynn over his contact with russia reflected deep problem in washington i think that the flynn issue obviously is something that show that in many respect this administration is in disarray and theyve got a lot of work to do said mccain even a he praised trumps defense secretary the president i think make statement and on other occasion contradicts himself so weve learned to watch what the president doe a opposed to what he says he said european government have been unsettled by the signal sent by trump on a range of foreign policy issue ranging from nato and russia to iran israel and european integration the debut trip to europe of trumps defence secretary jim mattis and secretary of state rex tillerson to a meeting of g counterpart in bonn went some way to assuaging concern a they both took a more traditional u position but trump is wrestling with a growing controversy at home about potential tie between his aide and russia which he dismissed on thursday a a ruse and scam perpetrated by a hostile news medium mattis made clear to ally both at nato in brussels and in munich that the united state would not retreat from leadership a the european continent grapple with an assertive russia war in eastern and southern mediterranean country and attack by islamist militant u vice president mike penny will address the munich conference on saturday with a similar message of reassurance penny will say that europe is an indispensable partner for the united state a senior white house foreign policy adviser told reporter mattis told a crowd that included head of state and more than defense minister that trump backed nato president trump came into office and ha thrown now his full support to nato he too espouses natos need to adapt to todays strategic situation for it to remain credible capable and relevant mattis said mattis said the united state and it european ally had a shared understanding of the challenge ahead trump ha alarmed ally by expressing admiration for russian president vladimir putin mattis however ha spoken out strongly against russia while in europe after talk with nato ally in brussels on thursday he said that he did not believe it would be possible to collaborate militarily with moscow at least for now the european may need more convincing that washington stand with it on a range of security issue there is still a lot of uncertainty sebastian kurz austrias foreign minister told reporter the big topic in munich is looking to the usa to see which development to expect next european intelligence agency have warned that russia is also seeking to destabilize government and influence election across europe with cyber attack fake news and propaganda and by funding farright political party we should be under no illusion about the stepchange in russian behavior over the last couple of year even after crimea british defence minister michael fallon said referring to moscows annexation of the ukrainian peninsula we have seen a stepchange in russian military aggression but also in propaganda in misinformation and a succession of persistent attack on western democracy interference in a whole series of election including the united states nato secretarygeneral jens stoltenberg held talk with russian foreign minister sergei lavrov in munich seeing progress on encouraging moscow to be more open about it military exercise that the alliance say are unpredictable russia say it is the western alliance not moscow that is destabilizing europe by sending troop to it western border we have different views stoltenberg said of the crisis in ukraine where the west accuses the kremlin of arming separatist rebel in a conflict that ha killed people since april russia say the conflict is a civil war in the latest incident lithuanian prosecutor have opened a criminal investigation into a false report of rape by german soldier stationed there on a nato mission to deter russia mattis without explicitly citing the case rallied to the defense of german force a he spoke in the german city of munich i have great respect for germanys leadership in europe  and for the ethical performance of your troop on the battlefield he said u intelligence agency concluded last year that russia hacked and leaked democratic email during the election campaign a part of an effort to tilt the vote in trumps favor mccain acknowledged concern in europe and beyond that america wa laying down the mantle of global leadership and cited global trend he found disturbing including hardening resentment toward immigrant and an unwillingness to separate truth from lie mccain urged the forum not to give up on the united state make no mistake my friend these are dangerous time but you should not count america out and we should not count each other out mccain said
Title_Text: trump team in disarray u senator mccain tell europe

Text: washington reuters  u commerce secretary wilbur ross ha divested his interest in oil tanker company diamond s shipping and is in the process of selling off his holding in another shipping firm navigator holding a trump administration official said on tuesday ross had originally intended to retain his shipping interest following his confirmation in february but the yearold investor came under criticism after disclosure on sunday that one of navigators major client is the russian gas company sibur a firm whose owner include member of russian president vladimir putins inner circle information about the business tie between navigator which operates gascarrying ship and sibur wa based on leaked document from offshore law firm appleby that are part of the socalled paradise paper which show detail of business dealing by wealthy people and institution ranging from ross to britains queen elizabeth and trading firm glencore glenl reuters ha not independently verified the document he began divesting his navigator interest in may the administration official said of ross he is nearing completion of that process an office of government ethic disclosure filed by ross on june showed that he sold an interest in navigator valued at  to  on may the official did not provide an explanation for rosss divestiture ross had owned stake in the firm through several partnership ross a billionaire investor who is helping to shape republican president donald trumps trade policy had told u senator during his confirmation hearing in january that his research showed that retention of shipping interest would not present a conflict of interest u ocean shipping regulation is handled by the federal maritime commission a separate independent agency diamond s shipping based in greenwich connecticut operates petroleum product tanker and crude oil tanker operated under the flag of hong kong the marshall island and malta ross told medium on monday that he had nothing to do with londonbased navigators relationship with sibur and had never met any of siburs owner these include putins soninlaw kirill shamalov and gennady timchenko a putin associate who is subject to u treasury sanction ross said in multiple medium interview that he had fully disclosed his stake in navigator holding a part of government ethic requirement
Title_Text: u commerce chief ross divesting shipping interest official

Text: edinburgh reuters  scotland s devolved government ha recommended that it parliament at holyrood withhold consent for legislation to withdraw britain from the european union on the ground that it could water down their power a document filed by the scottish government said on tuesday the approval of the devolved parliament in scotland and wale doe not represent a veto to the brexit process although it would stretch britain s constitutional tension yet further by forcing the uk government of prime minister theresa may to ignore the expressed wish of the devolved body scotland would work with the welsh government to propose amendment to the bill which if agreement were reached would allow it to recommend it passage in the devolved assembly the document said the bill will end the supremacy of eu law in the uk and convert all existing eu law into domestic one along with the welsh government the scottish government cannot recommend to the parliament that it give consent to the bill a currently drafted the document filed with the scottish parliament said the scottish government is also clear that the result of withdrawal from the eu should not be centralization of power in whitehall and westminster however that is what the bill proposes scotland s first minister nicola sturgeon ha been arguing that brexit a proposed fly in the face of the devolution agreement which up to now ha allowed assembly in edinburgh cardiff and belfast to legislate on their own domestic policy such a health and education scotland and northern ireland voted to keep eu membership in a june referendum while england and wale voted to leave it remains a matter of regret to the scottish government that the uk plan to withdraw from the eu the government nevertheless accepts that preparation should be made for withdrawal from the eu including preserving a functioning legal system the document said the scottish government s key objection to the bill a introduced relate to the provision on the competence of the scottish parliament and government and those on power for uk and scottish minister to alter domestic law it said the scottish and welsh government argue that returning power now exercised by the eu to the uk government will imply restriction on the power of scottish and welsh chamber but britain s scotland minister david mundell ha said that the repeal will ultimately result in a boost in devolved parliamentary power
Title_Text: scottish government recommends rejection of eu withdrawal bill

Text: moscow reuters  six russian longrange bomber struck islamic state target in syria s deir alzor province russian news agency quoted russia s defence ministry a saying on tuesday the tum bomber took off from a base in russia flew to syria and bombed is target a well a weapon and ammunition depot they said it wa unclear when the bombing run wa carried out
Title_Text: russian longrange bomber hit islamic state target in syria agency

Text: beirut reuters  kidnapper in lebanon have released a saudi arabian man whose abduction wa announced by riyadh last week lebanon s national news agency reported on wednesday the case come during a diplomatic crisis between lebanon and saudi arabia the kidnapped saudi wa released he wa handed over to the lebanese army intelligence the agency reported saudi arabia kuwait the united arab emirate and bahrain have advised their citizen against traveling to lebanon and urged those already there to leave a tension have risen lebanese president michel aoun on wednesday accused saudi arabia of holding hostage saad alhariri who resigned a lebanon s prime minister on nov in a televised statement broadcast from riyadh where he had traveled on nov saudi arabia and hariri both deny that he is being held by the kingdom when saudi arabia said last week that one of it national had been abducted lebanese interior minister nohad machnouk said the safety of saudi resident and visitor wa a priority for the lebanese authority
Title_Text: kidnapped saudi released in lebanon lebanese news agency

Text: today s lesson in the horror of how easily a person can obtain and legally carry a firearm come from big surprise texas for two week now the lone star state ha been imposing it ammosexuality on not just the resident who feel the need to keep an arsenal at home but on the college campus community a wellthat s right like it or not and most college say not campus carry ha become a reality now any student over with a legal concealed carry permit can carry a loaded weapon onto any college campus across the state texan lawmaker proving they are dumb a stump have decided that would be the best way to curb the onslaught of campus shootingssome people may say well at least they have to be properly trained concealed carry permit come with a safety training course while that may sound nice it s true on paper in reality it s far more frighteninguniversity of texas at austin student zachary stone in preparation for a debate on the issue of campus carry decided to go out with zero experience having never fired a gun before and see what it took to get the concealed carry permit necessary to carry at school he chronicled his experience for the new york time and it is absolutely horrifyingthe class required is a hour course where you learn such important rule a you can only shoot in selfdefense no vigilante justice not to intervene in a crime and certainly not to stop someone from running away that would be murder his instructor told him stone say everything he needed to learn to pas the written part of the test which wa basically a list of where you can carry a concealed weapon he learned in the last minute he got a on the written testwhen it came time for the livefire portion of the test stone wa a wreck fire i shot the gun flew back my neighbor each hit the center but i missed a foot too high fire i didn t realize i d have to shoot again so soon i hadn t taught myself how to aim yet and i wanted a few second to learn from the first shot i also hadn t learned how to deal with the recoil anxiously i pointed and shot a few second after my neighbor i still missedthat s when the instructor yelled at me you need to line up your sight i had no idea what that meant he explained that for me to aim properly the dot at the front of the gun needed to be inside the post at the back of the gunthat wa remarkably useful information fire my next shot hit the center x stone found himself being screamed at every step of the way because he had no idea what he wa doing lining up his sight paled in comparison to the reloading process which required him to eject the magazine something he had no clue how to doi tugged on the magazine it didn t move so i pulled harder i pulled a hard a i could nervous to put so much force on a gun empty or noti called out to the instructor my magazine s stuck show me try to pull it out that really shouldn t happen i pulled on the magazine for the instructor you need to push the release he said what s that i asked the button i pushed something no the button he saidthat did the trickkeep in mind that this young man had already passed the written portion of the test and wa now on his way to being a responsible gun owner legally licensed to carry a concealed weapon to school after repeating the liveshooting portion until round had been fired each it wa time to tally the score and see if zachary had the marksmanship necessary to be considered safe enough for public placesto pas you need out of point if you fail you get two more chance i did pretty well in the end i got pointsthe target are huge the distance close in percent of those who applied were given licence to carry concealed in texas a stone proved it s nearly impossible to fail after less than one day s time with a rented gun and absolutely zero real training zachary stone had a permit to bring a gun to classat his debate after telling the story he asked one question that the progun crowd would struggle with given that the system allows me lacking firearm experience to get a license would you be comfortable if we sat with each other in class upon learning i m secretly carrying a gun the system sucksfeatured image via wikipedia
Title_Text: responsible gun owner who had never fired one get concealed permit in a single day

Text: washington reuters  there is no information that russian hacking of american political organization wa aimed at affecting the outcome of the presidential election u republican senator john mccain said monday mccains comment contrasted with an assertion by a senior u intelligence official that american intelligence agency concluded with high confidence that not only did their russian counterpart direct the hacking of democratic party organization and leader but did so to undermine democratic candidate hillary clinton its obvious that the russian hacked into our campaigns mccain said in a reuters interview but there is no information that they were intending to affect the outcome of the election and thats why we need a congressional investigation
Title_Text: mccain say no information russia sought to influence election probe needed

Text: the onestate wonder side with the left on a number of issue from his view on gay marriage his flipflopping on gun control to his support for communist common core sheriff clarke ha now unearthed a video showing u the anticop side of governor john katichmost of u have been pulled over by law enforcement and many of u have been frustrated after receiving a ticket we didn t think we deserved we re not all governor s however and we don t stand up in front of a crowd where we likely have some influence and call law enforcement officer idiot too bad this video wasn t exposed before he narrowly won his home state of ohio have you ever been stopped by a police officer that s an idiot he s an idiot you just can t act that way and what people resent is people who are in the government who don t treat the client client with respect who knew that the person being pulled over by the police for potentially breaking the law is considered a client here is the original tweet from the awesome milwaukee sheriff david clarkehttpstcolxdirztjr johnkasich is anti gun and anti cop and peoplesay trump is not conservative seriously httpstcoihrwlwiev david a clarke jr sheriffclarke march

Text: kabul reuters  nato country have strong reason to maintain support for afghanistan and will respond to u president trump s call for more troop and funding the alliance s secretary general jens stoltenberg said on wednesday it is in the interest of europe of nato ally to help stabilize afghanistan stoltenberg said during a visit to kabul with u defense secretary jim mattis which wa overshadowed by a militant attack on kabul airport trump made clear last month that he expected nato to step up it contribution in afghanistan when he announced a tougher new strategy against the taliban and other militant force however the political reaction in europe ha been mixed with little public appetite for more involvement in germany where chancellor angela merkel is working to form a government after last weekend s election her conservative party back the mission but senior figure from her two likely coalition partner the liberal free democrat and environmental green have expressed scepticism in italy the antiestablishment star party riding high in opinion poll ahead of election early next year ha said it would pull italy s force of more than troop out germany ha been a strong supporter of the nato mission in afghanistan for many many year stoltenberg said germany is the lead nation in the north of afghanistan and i m absolutely certain that germany will continue to provide support stoltenberg said nato assistance wa aimed at ensuring afghanistan did not become a safe haven for international terrorism but he reiterated that nato troop would not be returning to the combat role they ended in and would continue training and advising afghan force a well a providing equipment and funding we are not going back to the big combat operation we had before it will still be a noncombat operation stoltenberg said afghan force which have suffered thousand of casualty fighting the insurgency had been managing a very difficult situation but they had prevented the taliban from gaining control of any major provincial center and would be boosted by plan to strengthen the afghan air force and special force unit there will be setback but if we look at what we have achieved so far we have been able to build a strong afghan national security force and we ll build it even stronger
Title_Text: nato chief say europe ha interest in helping afghanistan

Text: al franken returned to dc this week after a series of bombshell allegation of sexual harassment by several woman he claim to be tremendously sorry for his serial groping incident but can t seem to recall them yes you ll love this clintonesque tactic where you just claim you have no idea how this happened daily caller reportedthe minnesota democrat ha faced more and more outcry even from within his own party a the allegation continue to stack in total four woman have now accused franken of inappropriately touching or groping them without consent many in progressive circle are now calling for franken s resignation to date franken s office ha said he will not resign and instead ha issued controversial apology to the woman the apology issued by franken range in length and content however there is one very disturbing trend that each of them ha in commonwhen you read the four apology below what is the common thread franken is unaware that he is sexually assaulting woman franken regularly state in his apology that he is unaware that his groping wa offensive and often doe not remember if it even happened i take thousand of photo at the state fair surrounded by hundred of people and i certainly don t remember taking this picture i feel badly that m menz came away from our interaction feeling disrespected it s difficult to respond to anonymous accuser and i don t remember those campaign event i take a lot of picture in minnesota thousand of picture ten of thousand of people those are instance that i do not remember it ha from the story it ha been clear that there are some woman and one is too many who feel that i have done something disrespectful at that assert them and for that i am tremendously sorry
Title_Text: all of al frankens apology to woman he groped have one disturbing thing in common
