Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump told several lawmaker on tuesday that he would work with democrat in congress to overhaul the nations healthcare system if republican fail to pas a measure to repeal and replace obamacare a key lawmaker said on healthcare he made that clear that if he didnt get what he wanted that he wa going to work with democrat on a plan for healthcare and that he wanted bipartisan tax reform u representative richard neal the top democrat on the house way and mean committee said following panel members meeting with trump at the white house earlier on tuesday
Title_Text: trump say he is willing work with democrat on healthcare tax lawmaker

Text: moscow reuters  a senior russian lawmaker said on tuesday it wa clear that u president donald trumps national security adviser michael flynn had been forced to resign in an effort to damage relation between russia and the united state flynn resigned late on monday after revelation he had discussed u sanction on russia with the russian ambassador to the united state before trump took office and misled vice president mike penny about the conversation its obvious that flynn wa forced to write the letter of resignation under a certain amount of pressure leonid slutsky head of the lower house of parliaments foreign affair committee wa quoted a saying by the ria news agency the target wa russiaus relation undermining confidence in the new u administration well see how the situation develops further he said
Title_Text: russian mp say flynn wa forced to resign to damage russiaus tie

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump plan to announce the most ambitious tax reform plan since the reagan era in the next few week the white house said on thursday sending stock price and the dollar higher on hope for a cut in corporate tax rate in a white house meeting with airline executive trump promised a phenomenal tax plan but offered no specific other than citing the need to a lower tax burden on business thats coming along very well were way ahead of schedule the president said were going to be announcing something i would say over the next two or three week that will be phenomenal in term of tax and developing our aviation infrastructure white house spokesman sean spicer later told reporter that trump would unveil a comprehensive tax plan including tax cut for individual a well a business despite the likelihood of disagreement in congress before tax reform can be enacted the u dollar rose along with bond yield and stock in response to the news under u law only congress can substantively change the tax code which ha not been overhauled thoroughly since tax legislation must begin in the house of representative house way and mean committee chairman kevin brady a texas republican who ha been talking to the white house about a tax reform bill said he wa pretty positive about trumps remark were going in the same direction in a good way brady told fox news both u political party generally agree on the need for tax reform but action ha been stymied by the complexity of the code which is riddled with loophole spicer said to expect a comprehensive plan something we havent seen since its going to recognize the need to give so many working american the relief that they need what he want to do is create a tax climate that not only keep job here but incentivizes company to want to come here to grow here to create job here to bring their profit back here during last years election campaign the president pledged to cut the u business tax rate from to percent from percent investor have been waiting for detail on trumps election campaign pledge to stimulate u economic growth through spending on infrastructure project and tax cut that wa really the crux of the dollar rally shortly after his election and i think investor are getting really excited about that again bk asset management managing director kathy lien said a trumps comment sent the u dollar to it best oneday gain against the yen in three week before trumps comment on thursday tax reform appeared to be losing momentum in congress the white house and house republican have been in discussion about a house tax reform plan that includes a controversial border adjustment proposal the measure ha come under fire from retailer oil refiner and automaker who fear it percent import tax could raise consumer price in a sign of the bumpy road ahead republican senator david perdue of georgia called border adjustment a bad idea and urged his colleague in a letter not to support it lawmaker have also been considering way to upgrade u infrastructure such a road bridge airport and rail system at thursdays meeting trump discussed what he called an obsolete u air traffic control system a well a outofdate airport infrastructure train system and road he told the executive he wa determined to change all of that and said they would be very happy with his proposal you people are regulated probably a much a almost anybody although i can think of a couple of industry that are even worse trump said
Title_Text: trump vow phenomenal tax announcement offer no detail

Text: beirut reuters  the syrian government declared victory over islamic state in the eastern city of deir alzor on friday a big blow to the jihadist a their last stronghold in syria crumbles deir alzor on the west bank of the euphrates river is the largest and most important city in eastern syria and is the center of the country s oil production the armed force in cooperation with allied force liberated the city of deir alzor completely from the clutch of the daesh terrorist organization the military source said using an arabic acronym for islamic state the army backed by russian bomber iran and shi ite militia is advancing toward the last significant town held by islamic state in syria albu kamal which is also located on the western bank of the euphrates a rival offensive by kurdish and arab militia supported by a usled coalition with air strike and special force is pressing islamic state on the eastern bank iraqi force on friday said they had begun their own final offensive against islamic state on the iraqi side of the jihadist territory that straddle the border between the two country entering the city of alqaim islamic state had for year besieged a government enclave in deir alzor until an army advance relieved it in early september starting a battle for jihadistheld part of the city the army captured alhamidiya sheikh yassin alardhi and alrashidia district in recent attack and the alhawiqa district wa the last to be held by the jihadist a military medium unit run by the army s ally hezbollah reported engineering unit were searching street and building in those district for mine and booby trap left by islamic state the military source said
Title_Text: syria declares victory over islamic state in deir alzor

Text: madrid reuters  spain s state prosecutor ha summoned more than catalan mayor who have backed an independence referendum in an escalation of madrid s effort to block the vote that it ha declared illegal official engaging in any preparation for the vote could be charged with civil disobedience abuse of office and misuse of public fund the prosecutor said in a letter delivered to local authority on wednesday if the mayor do not answer the summons police should arrest them it added one mayor said the legal move wa unprecedented we don t think any european country ha ever tried to make more than mayor testify said neus lloveras mayor of vilanova i la geltru near barcelona head of the association of municipality for independence ami we have nothing to hide when we have to go and testify we will say everything we have been saying for day that we owe it to our people to keep working to make sure they can freely express themselves at the ballot box he told reporter but the small anticapitalist cup group which governs catalan municipality said it would not answer the summons and called on other political force to do the same catalonia s regional parliament passed law last week to prepare for a referendum on oct spain s constitutional court suspended the vote after prime minister mariano rajoy challenged it in the court judge are now considering whether the legislation contravenes spain s constitution which state that the country is indivisible so far of a total municipal leader have said they would allow public space to be used for the referendum according to ami the mayor of barcelona  the region s most populous area  ha yet to take a definitive position and ha asked for reassurance that civil servant involved in the process will not risk losing their job the website set up by the catalan government to give information on the vote referendumcat stopped working on wednesday evening with spanish medium reporting that the regional prosecutor had ordered all website promoting the referendum to be shut down civil guard police confirmed that they had gone to deliver a warrant at the website s office but declined to say if judge had ordered it to be closed catalan leader carles puigdemont quickly posted two new web address on twitter linking to a page with information on the referendum poll show a minority of catalan want selfrule although a majority want the chance to vote on the issue hundred of thousand of people took to the street of barcelona this week to show support for independence in a separate order the constitutional court told regional government official on wednesday they had hour to show how they were preventing the vote from going ahead
Title_Text: spain call catalan mayor for questioning on independence vote

Text: there s been a lot of talk about the ad russian paid for on facebook that affected the outcome of our presidential election here are the majority of the ad facebook released to congress that were promoted on their social medium site by russian we ve left out a few of the antimuslim ad and a few of the antigun ad but the political ad are included belowfrom organizing hate rally against president trump to supporting black life matter no one expected the facebook ad paid for by russian to look like thesehere s a fake facebook page called black matter that wa being advertised by russian operativesand another ad on facebook from the black panther that wa paid for by russiansthis ad for a fake organization called don t shoot utilized a common protest call and hashtag in the black life matter movement having a variety of popular page like this make for a guaranteed audiencethis ad paid for by the russian wa clearly an attempt to stir division between american on the topic of black life matter versus our law enforcement officersover people liked this ad highlighting the divisive issue of immigration in americathe russian tried to stir up hate for muslim with ad promoting the unity of muslim in americait s not clear if this ad wa supposed to cause muslim to vote for hillary or antimuslim american to vote against herhere s one more antimuslim post like the one below where k people agreed that the muslim veil should be banned in americalast but not least here s the only blatantly protrump ad we could find this ad is promoting a few of his rallieshere s the only blatantly antihillary ad we could findit appears that the russian also had a soft spot for the communist clown democrat candidate bernie sandersimages via tech crunch
Title_Text: facebook release ad paid for by russiansand theyre not what anyone expected

Text: earlier this year jason chaffetz the house oversight chairman who carried around a two year obsession when it came to investigating hillary clinton suddenly shocked washington when he announced that he will not run for another term in congress in now that the probe into trump s tie to russia is getting too hot for a lot of republican to handle it is being reported that chaffetz won t even finish his term in fact according to politico he could be gone by june now this development come just one day after former fbi director robert mueller ha been named a a special counsel into the russia probe this is most curious seeing how just last year chaffetz showed the world just how much he like investigating people in fact he once said he had year of investigation lined up for hillary had she won the presidency however now that it s his guy in the oval office chaffetz suddenly ha no interest in sticking around to see this thing through to the endcould it be that chaffetz know that trump s day are numbered and he doesn t want to be around with the rest of the republican who are ending their career by keeping their wagon firmly hitched to the disaster that is donald trump or could it be that chaffetz himself know more than he is letting on after all it just leaked that house majority leader kevin mccarthy and house speaker paul ryan knew that trump wa being paid by the russian and tried to cover it upthis scandal could be coursing through the entire republican party and by the time we get to the bottom of it all they might all find themselves on the wrong side of the law and going down in flamesgood going gop you see what you ve done to your party and to the nation by backing the treasonous trump if the rest of you had any sense you d be resigning before the shit hit the fan just like jason chaffetzfeatured image via chip somodevillagetty image
Title_Text: jason chaffetz prepares to run for the hill a the russia probe heat up detail

Text: it s hard to imagine that donald trump could give america any more reason why he shouldn t be the country s next president but trump just can t help it when he s not offending minority or destroying our relation with our country trump is coming up with more shady excuse about why he can t release his tax return even after his own vice president mike penny said that they would both be releasing their tax documentshowever in a joint interview yesterday trump and his running mate seemed to be changing their story once again ignoring the fact that everyone from hillary clinton to prominent republican to even his own supporter have begged the business mogul to release his tax return trump had the nerve to tell abc news david muir that no one care about his tax return he said i think people don t care i don t think anybody care except some member of the press and not surprisingly penny slightly walked back his comment about trump releasing his tax return he must have gotten yelled at by his bos and told muir that he d meant only after they were audited and that this is all a distraction once again trump gave the ongoing audit of his tax a an excuse despite the fact that part of trump s audit have been completed and the irs ha said trump could release them not to mention many former presidential candidate have released their tax document while under audit it s not a big deal unless you have something to hidebragging that he s given most extensive financial review of anybody in the history of politics trump continued when the audit is done i ll release them i don t know when that s gonna be it could be soon it could be not how comforting so much for the transparency and trustworthiness he s trying to build with american voter you can watch the interview belowtrump to davidmuir people don t care about whether he should release his tax httpstcomdccpdaqefhttpstcociiokdye this week thisweekabc september once again trump is ignoring even the advice of his own supporter who understand that every time he act out or doe something shady to hide his past he s basically handing the election over to clintonfeatured image via ralph freso getty image
Title_Text: what trump just said about his tax return will make his supporter furious video

Text: reuters  u presidentelect donald trump named peter navarro an economist who ha urged a hard line on trade with china to head a newly formed white house national trade council the transition team said on wednesday navarro is an academic and onetime investment adviser who ha authored a number of popular book and made a film describing chinas threat to the u economy a well a beijings desire to become the dominant economic and military power in asia trumps team praised navarro in a statement a a visionary economist who would develop trade policy that shrink our trade deficit expand our growth and help stop the exodus of job from our shores trump a republican made trade a centerpiece of his presidential campaign and railed against what he said were bad deal the united state had made with other country he ha threatened to hit mexico and china with high tariff once he take office on jan navarro is a professor at university of california irvine and advised trump during the campaign his book include death by china how america lost it manufacturing base which wa made into a documentary film a well a describing what he see a americas losing economic war with china navarro ha highlighted concern over environmental issue related to chinese import and the theft of u intellectual property china is paying close attention to trumps transition team and the possible direction of policy a spokeswoman for the ministry of foreign affair said after being asked about navarros appointment cooperation is the only correct choice we hope the u work hard with china to maintain the healthy stable development of tie including business and trade ties the spokeswoman hua chunying told a daily press briefing while trump in the statement praised the clarity of navarros argument and the thoroughness of his research few other economist have endorsed navarros idea marcus noland an economist at the peterson institute for international economics likened a tax and trade paper authored by navarro and wilbur ross who ha been named a trumps commerce secretary to the type of magical thinking best reserved for fictional realities for what he said wa it flawed economic analysis navarro ha also suggested a steppedup engagement with taiwan including assistance with a submarine development program he argued that washington should stop referring to the one china policy but stopped short of suggesting it should recognize taipei saying there is no need to unnecessarily poke the panda china considers taiwan a renegade province and ha never renounced the use of force to bring it under it control chinas foreign minister wang yi said in an interview carried on thursday in the communist party of chinas official newspaper that chinaus relation face new uncertainty but with mutual respect for core interest they will remain stable only if china and the united state respect each other and give consideration to others core interest and key concern can there be longterm stable cooperation and effect winwin mutual benefit wang said after his nov election win trump stoked chinas ire when he took a telephone call from taiwan president tsai ingwen in a break with decade of precedent that cast doubt on his incoming administrations commitment to beijings one china policy in an opinion piece in foreign policy magazine in november navarro and another trump adviser alexander gray reiterated the presidentelects opposition to major trade deal including the transpacific partnership tpp trump will never again sacrifice the u economy on the altar of foreign policy by entering into bad trade deal like the north american free trade agreement allowing china into the world trade organization and passing the proposed tpp navarro and gray wrote these deal only weaken our manufacturing base and ability to defend ourselves and our allies trump ha vowed to pull the united state out of the tpp a freetrade pact aimed at linking a dozen pacific rim nation that president barack obama signed in february it ha not been ratified by the u senate the presidentelect ha also vowed to renegotiate the nafta pact with canada and mexico saying it had cost american job
Title_Text: trump pick death by china author for trade advisory role

Text: ankara reuters  turkey on thursday welcomed an iraqi parliament move to reject a referendum on kurdish independence the parliament in baghdad authorized the prime minister to take all measure to preserve iraq s unity in response to the move to hold an independence referendum in iraq s semiautonomous kurdish region on sept kurdish leader massoud barzani vowed to press ahead with the vote calling it a natural right barzani s referendum decision is a historic mistake turkey will follow policy that take iraq s territorial integrity a a basis deputy prime minister bekir bozdag said the northern iraq referendum must be canceled if not it will have a cost and retribution he said adding the move would erode the region s peace and bring security risk turkey ha the region s largest kurdish population and fear a yes vote could fuel separatism in it southeast where kurdish militant have waged an insurgency for three decade in which more than people have been killed ankara ha built solid tie with barzani s administration founded on strong economic and energy link a well a ankara and erbil s shared suspicion of other kurdish group and iraq s central government iran and syria also oppose the vote fearing it could fan separatism among their own kurdish population western power worry the plebiscite  which would include the oilproducing city of kirkuk  could ignite conflict with the central government in baghdad and divert attention from the war against islamic state militant turkey s foreign ministry in a statement on thursday said we find the iraqi kurdish leadership s insistent stance regarding the referendum and it increasingly emotional statement worrying it should be noted that this insistence will definitely have a cost it added we call on them to act with good sense and abandon this erroneous approach immediately
Title_Text: iraqi kurdish referendum historic mistake turkey

Text: tripoli reuters  gunman fatally shot the mayor of libya s thirdlargest city misrata late on sunday ambushing his car inside the city security official said the north african oil producer ha been in chaos since the uprising that unseated muammar gaddafi but misrata libya s biggest port had been relative peaceful until now gunman chased the car of mayor mohamed eshtewi after he left misrata airport following his arrival on a plane from turkey a security official said adding it wa unclear who wa behind it in october a bomb exploded at the city s court killing about four people and wounding others in an attack claimed by islamic state misrata almost km mile east of tripoli is the gateway for food and other import into libya and the country s only taxfree zone it is one of the few place still frequented by foreign business people fearing poor security elsewhere
Title_Text: gunman assassinate mayor of libya biggest port city

Text: robert parry consortium newsmake no mistake about it the united state ha entered an era of a new mccarthyism that blame nearly every political problem on russia and ha begun targeting american citizen who don t go along with this new cold war propagandaa difference however from the mccarthyism of the s is that this new mccarthyism ha enlisted democrat liberal and even progressive in the cause because of their disgust with president trump the s version wa driven by republican and the right with much of the left on the receiving end maligned by the like of sen joe mccarthy a unamerican and a communism s fellow traveler the real winner in this new mccarthyism appear to be the neoconservative who have leveraged the democraticliberal hatred of trump to draw much of the left into the political hysteria that see the controversy over alleged russian political meddling a an opportunity to get trump already the neocon and their ally have exploited the antirussian frenzy to extract ten of million of dollar more from the taxpayer for program to combat russian propaganda ie funding of nongovernmental organization and scholar who target dissident american for challenging the justification for this new cold warthe washington post which for year ha served a the flagship for neocon propaganda is again charting the new course for america much a it did in rallying u public backing for the invasion of iraq and in building sympathy for abortive regime change project aimed at syria and iran the post ha begun blaming almost every unpleasant development in the world on russia russia russiafor instance a post editorial on tuesday shifted the blame for the anemic victory of german chancellor angela merkel and the surprising strength of the farright alternative for germany afd from merkel s austerity policy which have caused hardship for much of the working class or from her open door for mideast refugee which ha destabilized some workingclass neighborhood to you guessed it russiathe evidence a usual is vague and selfinterested but sure to be swallowed by many democrat and liberal who hate russia because they blame it for trump and by lot of republican and conservative who have a residual hatred for russia left over from the old cold warthe post cited the atlantic council s digital forensic research lab which ha been pushing much of the hysteria about alleged russian activity on the internet the atlantic council essentially is nato s think tank and is financed with money from the u government gulf oil state military contractor global financial institution and many other source which stand to gain directly or indirectly from the expanding u military budget and nato interventionsblaming russiain this new cold war the russian get blamed for not only disrupting some neocon regime change project such a the proxy war in syria but also political development in the west such a donald trump s election and afd s rise in germanythe atlantic council s digital lab claimed according to the post editorial that in the final hour of the german campaign online supporter of the afd began warning their base of possible election fraud and the online alarm were driven by anonymous troll account and boosted by a russianlanguage botnet of course the post evinces no evidence tying any of this to the russian government or to president vladimir putin it is the nature of mccarthyism that actual evidence is not required just heavy breathing and dark suspicion for those of u who operate web site troll some volunteer and some professional have become a common annoyance and they represent many political outlook not just russianplus it is standard procedure these day for campaign to issue lastminute alarm to their supporter about possible election fraud to raise doubt about the result should the outcome be disappointingthe u government ha engaged in precisely this strategy around the world having prous party not only complain about election fraud but to take to the street in violent protest to impugn the legitimacy of election outcome that u strategy ha been applied to place such a ukraine the orange revolution in iran the green revolution in russia the snow revolution in and many other locationspreelection alert also have become a feature in u election even in when both donald trump and hillary clinton raised question about the legitimacy of the balloting albeit for different reasonsyet instead of seeing the afd maneuver a a typical ploy by a relatively minor party and the german election outcome a an understandable reflection of voter discontent and weariness over merkel s three term a chancellor the atlantic council and the post see russian under every bed and particularly putinloving to hate putinin the world of neocon propaganda putin ha become the great b te noire since he ha frustrated a variety of neocon scheme he helped head off a major u military strike against syria in he aided president obama in achieving the iran nuclear agreement in  putin opposed and to a degree frustrated the neoconsupported coup in ukraine in and he ultimately supplied the air power that defeated neoconbacked rebel force in syria in so the post and the neocon want putin gone and they have used gauzy allegation about russian meddling in the u and other election a the new propaganda theme to justify destabilizing russia with economic sanction and if possible engineering another regime change project in moscownone of this is even secret carl gershman the neocon president of the usgovernmentfunded national endowment for democracy publicly proclaimed the goal of ousting putin in an oped in the washington post writing the united state ha the power to contain and defeat this danger the issue is whether we can summon the will to do so but the way neocon propaganda work is that the u and it ally are always the victim of some nefarious enemy who must be thwarted to protect all that is good in the world in other word even a ned and other usfunded operation take aim at putin and russia russia and putin must be transformed into the aggressor mr putin would like nothing better than to generate doubt fog crack and uncertainty around the german pillar of europe the post editorial said he relish infiltrating chaos and mischief into open society in this case supporting the farright afd is extraordinarily cynical given how many million of russian died to defeat the fascist seven decade ago not to belabor the point but there is no credible evidence that putin did any of this there is a claim by the virulently antirussian atlantic council that some anonymous troll account promoted some afd complaint about possible voter fraud and that it wa picked up by a russianlanguage botnet even if that is true and the atlantic council is far from an objective source where is the link to putinnot everything that happens in russia a nation of million people is ordered by putin but the post would have you believe that it is it is the centerpiece of this neocon conspiracy theorysilencing dissentsimilarly any american who question this propaganda immediately is dismissed a a kremlin stooge or a russian propagandist another ugly campaign spearheaded by the post and the neocon again no evidence is required just some analysis that what you re saying somehow parallel something putin ha saidon tuesday in what amounted to a companion piece for the editorial a post article again pushed the unproven suspicion about russian operative buying  in facebook ad from into to supposedly influence u politics once again no evidence requiredin the article the post also reminds it reader that moscow ha a history of focusing on social inequity in the u which get u back to the comparison between the old mccarthyism and the newyes it s true that the soviet union denounced america s racial segregation and cited that ugly feature of u society in expressing solidarity with the american civil right movement and national liberation struggle in africa it s also true that american communist collaborated with the domestic civil right movement to promote racial integrationthat wa a key reason why j edgar hoover s fbi targeted martin luther king jr and other africanamerican leader because of their association with known or suspected communist similarly the reagan administration resisted support for nelson mandela because his african national congress accepted communist support in it battle against south africa s apartheid whitesupremacist regimeinterestingly one of the argument from liberal national democrat in opposing segregation in the s wa that the repression of american black undercut u diplomatic effort to develop ally in africa in other word soviet and communist criticism of america s segregation actually helped bring about the demise of that offensive systemyet king s association with alleged communist remained a talking point of diehard segregationist even after his assassination when they opposed creating a national holiday in his honor in the sthese parallel between the old mccarthyism and the new mccarthyism are implicitly acknowledged in the post s news article on tuesday which cite putin s criticism of police killing of unarmed american black a evidence that he is meddling in u politics since taking office putin ha on occasion sought to spotlight racial tension in the united state a a mean of shaping perception of american society the article state putin injected himself in into the race debate after protest broke out in ferguson mo over the fatal shooting of michael brown an african american by a white police officer do you believe that everything is perfect now from the point of view of democracy in the united state putin told cbs s minute program if everything wa perfect there wouldn t be the problem of ferguson there would be no abuse by the police but our task is to see all these problem and respond properly the post s speculative point seems to be that putin s response included having russian operative buy some ad on facebook to exploit these racial tension but there is no evidence to support that conspiracy theoryhowever a this antirussia hysteria spread we may soon see american who also protest the police killing of unarmed black men denounced a putin s fellowtravelers much a king and other civil right leader were smeared a communist dupe ignoring realityso instead of democrat and chancellor merkel looking in the mirror and seeing the real reason why many white workingclass voter are turning toward populist and extremist alternative they can simply blame putin and continue a crackdown on internetbased dissent a the work of russian operative already under the guise of combating russian propaganda and fake news google facebook and other tech giant have begun introducing algorithm to hunt down and marginalize news that challenge official u government narrative on hotbutton issue such a ukraine and syria again no evidence is required just the fact that putin may have said something similaras democrat liberal and even some progressive join in this russiagate hysteria driven by their hatred of donald trump and his supposedly fascistic tendency they might want to consider whom they ve climbed into bed with and what these neocon have in mind for the futurearguably if fascism or totalitarianism come to the united state it is more likely to arrive in the guise of protecting democracy from russia or another foreign adversary than from a realitytv clown like donald trumpthe new mccarthyism with it orwellianstyle algorithm might seem like a clever way to neutralize or maybe even help oust trump but long after trump is gone a structure for letting the neocon and the mainstream medium monopolize american political debate might be a far greater threat to both democracy and peaceto read more on the new cold war the wire cold war filessupport wire subscribe become a member wiretv
Title_Text: russia did it  the new age of mccarthyism

Text: donald trump ha won the white house and now republican have control of the senate and congress too house speaker paul ryan ha hinted at plan to privatize medicare ryan s ayn randish vision for america ha been well documented with his plan to slash the safety net while giving a big middle finger to the middle and lowerincome classesyes this is a war one in which american will suffer greatly million of lowincome american on medicaid could lose their health coverage if trump and the republicancontrolled congress follow through with their plansvox report that trump ha already endorsed ryan s plan on medicaid and ha attacked food stamp at length his vice president mike penny is a longtime friend and congressional ally of ryan s who if anything ha argued for larger cut than the one ryan wantswe can expect an increase in poverty i ve been working on these issue since robert greenstein the founder and president of the center on budget and policy priority and washington s leading advocate for poor and lowincome american said according to vox this is by far the gravest threat to the safety net and to lowincome people that i ve seen in my close to half a century of working on these issue i think there s a potential in the first seven month by the august recess for congress to pas policy that do more to increase poverty and hardship and widen inequality than we ve seen in half a century if obamacare is repealed without a viable replacement million people will be denied coveragepaul ryan like his conservative colleague seek fewer regulation for insurance company insurance company would offer worse policy and the quality of care would go downtrump s replacement plan is even worse than ryan sthe committee for a responsible federal budget estimate it d spare just million people who d otherwise lose insurance through obamacare repeal full repeal without replacement take insurance away from million trump s plan take it away from million the difference is minimaland yet here s the thing trump ha already broken numerous campaign promise and he s not even in office yet he ha suggested that he won t fully repeal obamacare but now he s beholden to republican who control the senate and the house even if he say no the wheel are in motion he s the one who started turning thembecause eating while poor is badcbpp estimate that the most recent house budget get percent of it cut from program for low and moderateincome people that includes at least  billion in cut to food stamp and nearly  billion in mostly unspecified cut to other lowincome program like ssi which provides cash to the disabled and elderly pell grant and what little remains of welfarerepublicans have been trying to eradicate president obama s signature healthcare legislation so it wa watered down tea party republican went to town hall where democrat attempted to answer question from constituent the noise from republican wa deafening and hardly a word could be heard about the bill so it got watered down because conservative told u that socialism is bad they told u this after driving to the town hall meeting on taxpayer funded public roadsas it happens medical professional do not want obamacare repealed trump and his republican colleague just want you to think thatfeatured image via zach gibsongetty image
Title_Text: republican declare war on the poor go after food stamp medical coverage

Text: well we ve known this wa coming even with opposition to close gitmo obama ha wanted to close gitmo since elected and ha pushed for it repeatedly recently he s been releasing prisoner at a fast pace not good because of those released rejoin the jihadi cause of terrorism yes out president is putting his desire to fulfill a campaign promise over the safety of the american peoplethe pentagon is expected to submit to congress tuesday president barack obama s plan to shutter the u military prison at guantanamo baythe president who campaigned in to shut down the u naval facility in cuba is hoping to make good on his promise which is sure to ignite a partisan battle on capitol hillpentagon spokesman navy capt jeff davis said the obama administration will meet the tuesday deadline for sending congress a proposal for closing the facility which still house detainee the plan is to submit to congress what our thought are on the issue and what we see is a way ahead necessary to achieve the closure of guantanamo and to specifically point out the need for legislative relief davis told the hillaccording to davis the white house s plan is to transfer away a many detainee and bring the remainder to the u a step that is opposed by many in congress particularly within the republican partyfor many year lawmaker have banned any transfer of detainee into the united state in addition they have placed restriction on transfer to other country insisting that gitmo detainee pose a threat to national securityhowever some in congress including arizona sen john mccain r have said they are open to the possibility of bringing detainee into the u a long a the president submits a plan by feb the pentagon began it search for u site where detainee could be held those location include federal facility in colorado south carolina and kansasother lawmaker though are opposed to the plan today s news report indicate that the president is doubling down on a dangerous plan to close guantanamo a move that i will continue to fight in the senate sen kelly ayotte rnh said monday in a statementcongressional approval is likely the only way in which obama could achieve his goal of closing the cuban facilityread more the blaze
Title_Text: obama put american in grave danger with new plan to close gitmo and move prisoner to u

Text: washington reuters  the myanmar military which ha been accused of ethnic cleansing against the country s muslim rohingya minority ha been invited back a an observer in a major multinational military exercise next year led by the united state and thailand lieutenant colonel christopher logan a pentagon spokesman told reuters that thailand had invited myanmar to take part in the annual cobra gold exercise which involves thousand of u and thai military personnel and participant from other asian country myanmar had been invited to observe the humanitarian assistance and disaster relief portion of the exercise logan said a senior officer at the directorate of joint intelligence of the royal thai armed force told reuters it wa unclear whether myanmar had accepted the invitation but thailand wa eager for them to join asked why thailand decided to invite myanmar despite concern over the crackdown against the rohingya and whether this issue wa part of their deliberation the official said that never came up in the discussion we separated that issue the rohingya we focus on training on education on military cooperation that is our wish to have myanmar involved that is politics we are soldier this is a military exercise added the official who declined to be named because he wa not authorized to speak to the medium the myanmar military did not respond to several request for comment when asked whether the u military had attempted to apply pressure on thailand not to invite myanmar because of the international condemnation of it crackdown the pentagon declined to comment on internal deliberation myanmar s military cracked down on muslim rohingya from rakhine state following rohingya militant attack on an army base and police post in august the crackdown ha caused around rohingya to flee to bangladesh in recent month the united state and the united nation have described the campaign a ethnic cleansing of the stateless rohingya people the myanmar military ha said it own internal investigation had exonerated security force of all accusation of atrocity in rakhine but earlier this week the united state imposed sanction on serious human right abuser and corrupt actor including myanmar general maung maung soe who oversaw the crackdown against the rohingya zachary abuza a professor at the u national war college said inviting myanmar to the exercise wa outrageous and sent the wrong message to invite them after what the u government ha labeled ethnic cleansing when the treasury department just yesterday designated the commander for these egregious violation of human right just seems wrong and that is putting it too mildly said abuza who focus on southeast asia and security issue including human right in the cobra gold exercise nation either participated or observed the exercise including myanmar it included about u personnel cobra gold is an annual exercise in thailand the war game are expected to be held in february the united state and thailand have carried out joint war game for decade even though bangkok s record on human right and democracy ha often been criticized in washington the usthai relationship cooled when the thai military took power in a coup but ha improved under president donald trump two reuters journalist were arrested in myanmar on dec and on thursday appeared in court and have been remanded in custody reporter wa lone and kyaw soe oo have been in detention for nine day with no detail on where they are being held they have not had access to visitor or lawyer
Title_Text: myanmar accused of crackdown invited to usthai military exercise

Text: riyadh reuters  kuwait s foreign ministry ordered it national to leave lebanon immediately according to a statement on thursday carried by state news agency kuna the decision came hour after saudi arabia warned it citizen against traveling to lebanon and asked those in the country to leave a soon a possible
Title_Text: kuwait foreign ministry order it national to leave lebanon immediately kuna

Text: berlin reuters  germany want to reach out to the future u administration under presidentelect donald trump to safeguard essential transatlantic relation chancellor angela merkels foreign policy advisor christoph heusgen said on wednesday speaking to lawmaker in merkels conservative party heusgen also said germany would have to shoulder more international responsibility in future he said germany would steadily increase military spending towards the nato goal of percent of gross domestic product earlier merkel said there would be contact at all level with the united state in the run up to meeting of the group of this year of which germany is the chair
Title_Text: germany to reach out to trump government to keep good tie merkel advisor

Text: a the poll closed for the republican primary on super tuesday illinois experienced a phenomenon that could only have been captured by being in the right place at the right time the moment lightning struck the trump tower in downtown chicagoinstagram user mrmikeyv posted a video of this coincidental onceinalifetime event captioning the clip perfectly by writing lightning storm ironically hitting the trump building on supertuesday poll were closing just a this force of nature occurred revealing that the business mogul had taken illinois a a win a well a florida and north carolina clearly mother nature wasn t happy about thatlightning storm ironically hitting the trump building on supertuesday mbdavis thepassportreport instachicagoa video posted by mrmikeyv on mar at pm pdtthis ironicallytimed strange message from mother nature wa a result of a major storm in northern illinois which resulted in approximately six tornado that damaged several house and a church the super tuesday poll revealed that trump got percent of the vote in illinois along with delegate from the statedespite running a campaign based on bigotry violence and some of the most extreme rhetoric a presidential campaign ha ever seen trump ha been unstoppable even though he hasn t proposed one solid solution that will actually make america great again trump ha risen above negative report about lawsuit from his failed business his awful misogynistic track record with woman support from white supremacist and constant flipflopping and lie still he s continued on to defeat every single one of the gop s incapableyetbetterthantrump candidate aside from ted cruz and john kasich although they probably don t stand a chance against the front runner america is getting desperate for way to end this trump nightmare once and for allperhaps it wa divine intervention that caused the sky to open up and rain down on illinois a trump won yet another state striking one of the candidate s precious tower in disappointment unfortunately the trump tower still stand and wa barely phased by it trump is also still standing running for the gop nomination and winning featured image via instagram Title_Text: lightning struck trump tower a poll closed on super tuesday video

Text: washington reuters  the u senate voted monday to approve a senior transportation department nominee and advance another nomination after republican accused democrat of blocking some nominee to push for funding of a new york area infrastructure project derek kan who wa previously an official at san franciscobased ride service company lyft inc won confirmation to be undersecretary of transportation for policy on a  vote senate republican have said their democratic rival were stalling a number of nominee over a dispute over funding for the  billion gateway program which includes building a new tunnel underneath new yorks hudson river at least eight other transportation department nomination are pending and other job vacant including a top auto safety regulator in addition to confirming kan the senate voted  on monday to advance the nomination of steven bradbury a washington lawyer to be general counsel at the transportation department during the administration of president george w bush bradbury wa one of the principal author of the legal justification for enhanced interrogation techniques called the torture memos by critic senator tammy duckworth an illinois democrat said in june that bradbury lacked the judgment to stand up against the bush administrations use of torture bradbury defended his work in june saying the questions we addressed raised difficult issue about which reasonable people could disagree in september president donald trump met with top elected official from new york and new jersey over the fate of the gateway program deemed critical to northeast u transportation but trump made no commitment to finance the project republican senator john thune accused democrat of holding nomination hostage while awaiting assurances that the trump administration will approve and fund the gateway project while no one question the importance of this corridor there are many other important project that also are awaiting approval and funding at the department no project should get to cut the line based on the machination of a handful of our colleague thune said senate democratic leader chuck schumer said on monday he opposed kan because of administration roadblock to the project time is running out and we must quickly build new tunnels schumer said a senate democratic aide confirmed separately that democrat were holding up some nomination because they want assurance from the transportation department the gateway project will quickly move forward after its funded the transportation department regulates the nations vehicle airplane railroad pipeline port and highway
Title_Text: senate approves trump transportation department nominee

Text: we d love to know your thought on this we think it s sort of unreal that this company wa forced via social medium to drop the name and change it from refugee dress to oxford dress doe anyone see the irony in this name changewe also want to weigh in on just how unattractive this dress is and how it just look like a sheet your thoughtsa controversial refugee dress wa still being sold tuesday on the website of clothing retailer uzinyc six day after the company said it had changed the name of the much criticized dresswhat s interesting is that the name of this dress ha been around since we named the dress in when we could not see ourselves escaping the reality of a global economy spinning out of control the brand wa forced to change the name of the  dress from refugee dress to oxford dress after a storm of criticism on social medium but while the company had renamed the title of the page it seemed to have forgotten about the picture caption which still label the dress a a black refugee dress that label can still be seen by scrolling down the homepage of the website and clicking a photo preview of the garmenttwitter is abuzz over the dressso this brand thought it wa appropriate to sell a refugee dress disgusting uzinyc httpstcomxlmdqwgp pictwittercomwskojhfe rianna croxford thecrox july uzinyc recently told mic that it originally created the dress to draw attention to the refugee crisis we feel that it is important to keep these issue within public discourse cofounder mari gustafson told the website the american economy ha recovered and through perseverance and luck our company ha recovered a well we are now able to provide job for others and give them a sense of hope and stability we are sorry if we have disturbed anyone gustafson told todaycomlast week critic of the dress took to twitter to complain about the use of the phrase refugee to market a dress refugee are neither nomad nor sale gimmick one twitter user wrote apologize rename dress donate to unhcr via fortune
Title_Text: refugee dress sold online forced to change name after social medium go ballistic

Text: london reuters  the british government said on tuesday that most european union citizen currently living in britain will be allowed to remain in the country after brexit in outlining plan for a mass registration program the department for exiting the european union and the interior ministry said eu national will be given a twoyear grace period to apply for settled status after britain leaf the eu the legal status and right of eu national is one of the thornier issue in britain s complicated exit from the bloc there are about million eu citizen living in britain caseworker will be able to use discretion when processing application meaning they should not be refused for minor technicality and the majority would be granted the department said in a statement the cost of an application should be no more than the cost of a british passport and eu citizen will also be given a statutory right of appeal if denied we have been clear that safeguarding the right of eu citizen is our top priority in negotiation brexit minister david davis said we will support everyone wishing to stay to gain settled status through a new straightforward streamlined system
Title_Text: britain say expects most eu citizen can stay after brexit

Text: beirut reuters  a syrian government delegation will arrive in geneva on wednesday to attend peace talk this week state news agency sana said quoting syria s foreign affair ministry the delegation will be headed by syria s un ambassador and chief negotiator bashar alja afari sana said on tuesday the delegation had delayed it planned departure to the talk set to begin on tuesday because of the opposition s insistence that syrian president bashar alassad step down
Title_Text: syrian government to arrive in geneva tomorrow for peace talk sana

Text: we all remember the absolutely disastrous visit donald trump had with german chancellor angela merkel he infamously made her look at him like he had lost his mind when joked about her allegedly being wiretapped by the obama administration while he wa busy trying to defend his own false claim that obama wiretapped trump tower refused to shake merkel s hand during a photo op and even tried to give her a bill for nato worth billion of dollarstrump however seems to have a very different memory of his visit with the german leader while speaking of the visit with the associated press trump said yeah it s funny one of the best chemistry i had wa with merkel a if that weren t ridiculous enough considering that the whole world saw how that visit actually went trump continued this time trying to excuse his rudeness with the handshake debacle and i guess somebody shouted out shake her hand shake her hand you know but i never heard it but i had already shaken her hand four time you know because we were together for a long time he went on to boast because um i m at odds on you know the nato payment and i m at odds on immigration featured image via justin sullivangetty image
Title_Text: delusional trump hilariously think angela merkel like him detail

Text: washington reuters  one of rex tillersons first directive a u secretary of state wa an order to senior staff that his briefing material not exceed two page it wa a reflection of tillersons management style honed at the helm of exxon mobil an oil company known for it relentless focus on efficiency and one reason his closest aide at the state department refer to him a the ceo rather than the secretary more than a dozen current and former u official familiar with briefing procedure said tillersons predecessor would typically request far more detailed information his aide rc hammond said the directive reflected tillersons focus on key fact rather than lack of interest in finer point of foreign policy he is asking people to be efficient with their information hammond said adding that if tillerson needed more information he would ask for it he is a decisionmaker and he need the fact in front of him a a firsttime government official with no prior diplomatic experience tillerson face close scrutiny over how successful he will be in managing both the state department bureaucracy and it relation with donald trump and his administration senior state department official who have attended meeting with tillerson say they find him sociable and a man of substance whose direct manner and probing question reflect his training a an engineer seeking to solve problem rather than play politics the veteran oil executive also made a good impression on his first foreign trip to a group of summit in bonn germany last week four senior diplomat who met him told reuters they were relieved to find that he wa pragmatic and open to dialogue yet a key concern for u diplomat is how effective his team can be in shaping foreign policy in the new administration just two state department position of key post requiring executive branch nomination have been filled according to the nonpartisan partnership for public service  tillersons and that of u ambassador to the united nation for example tillerson still ha no deputy after trump rejected his top choice elliott abrams people want to back him one veteran senior official said about the former exxon mobil bos but people are feeling that this building is being stripped said the official referring to a sense that with so many top position vacant the state department is not fully equipped to help make policy in the new administration there is also unease over possible deep staff cut and the future of some department two people said employee in the bureau of management and resource were told to apply for other position within the state department hammond tillersons aide said no decision had been taken to close that division on one recent matter of longstanding u foreign policy tillerson appeared to be sidelined on feb while tillerson wa at a dinner with israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu in a state department dining room news headline emerged suggesting the united state wa backing away from supporting a twostate solution for israeli and palestinian the twostate solution is the bedrock of the international communitys policy for a settlement between israel and the palestinian but trump suggested last week he wa open to abandoning it if both side agree no one had been informed of any change in policy and the secretary wa about to leave on his first major trip said one senior state department official referring to tillersons visit to bonn tillersons acting deputy tom shannon also did not take part in trumps meeting with netanyahu at the white house the following day when his bos wa on his way to europe according to one u official it wa unclear whether tillerson had been left out of the loop deliberately or by accident said two official a white house official told reuters he did not know whether tillerson wa briefed in advance in response to broader concern about communication between the state department and the new administration he said both coordinated very well there are open line of communication in both directions the official who declined to be named said the white house and the state department coordinate closely across a full range of issue that concern both organizationsto be sure on another important issue tillerson had his say in persuading trump to back washingtons stance on one china policy which acknowledges beijings position that taiwan is part of it trump ha in the past appeared to question whether the united state would continue to respect that hammond said tillerson wa on the phone with trump several time a day this is the general style of the president to have quick checkin with people get peoples advice on things he said information for ceo flow up and a a former ceo tillerson understands that tillerson ha said little publicly since he started and his aide are quick to draw a contrast between him and predecessor john kerry a former senator and presidential candidate who reveled in extensive foreign travel and deal making tillerson is not john kerry it is unfair to compare the two said hammond he will quietly go about his job a a counselor and advisor to the president for tillersons state department the concern is how to maintain a similar degree of communication with an administration grappling with a succession of crisis nine official involved in foreign policy and security issue said over the past month the white house ha faced legal setback over it immigration order the resignation of trumps national security adviser and an investigation into possible link between his campaign and russian intelligence mondays resignation of michael flynn who served a trumps national security adviser for just day in particular created a vacuum at the national security council which act a a key partner for the state department in formulating washingtons foreign policy
Title_Text: ceo tillerson face internal skeptic crisisbattling white house

Text: washington reuters  leader of the u senate finance committee said on tuesday they reached an agreement to finance a federal insurance program for million of lowerincome child and pregnant woman that wa due to expire at the end of the month republican senator orrin hatch chairman of the finance committee and the panels top democrat senator ron wyden said in a statement the agreement would provide money for the childrens health insurance program chip for five year chip reauthorization is not typically contentious a the program receives bipartisan support but lobbyist and industry official have said any healthcarerelated legislation ha become more complicated following the failure of republican to repeal and replace obamacare i am hopeful we can move forward swiftly to ensure no lapse in care for our nations most vulnerable children hatch said in a statement calling the agreement a good first start wyden said in a statement he hoped to get the extension of chip into law as soon a possible
Title_Text: key u senator reach deal on funding childrens health program

Text: washington reuters  u senate majority whip john cornyn on wednesday indicated republican leader want change to their draft healthcare legislation completed this week so lawmaker could review the revised plan over next weeks congressional recess cornyn speaking to reporter outside senate leader mitch mcconnells office said having the change done by friday would be optimal and allow the congressional budget office time to provide a new analysis of the bills impact
Title_Text: senate republican leader want health bill revised by friday cornyn
