Text: andrea tantaros is ramping up the pressure on her former employer and colleague to answer for their behavior and face the consequencesearlier this month the former fox host declared war on the conservative network by slapping them with a sexual harassment lawsuit which name bill o reilly among other such a roger ailes and bill shineaccording to the lawsuit fox news masquerade a a defender of traditional family value but behind the scene it operates like a sexfueled playboy mansionlike cult steeped in intimidation indecency and misogyny indeed tantaros say she wa never allowed to wear pant on set and that ailes seriously creeped her out on multiple occasion by obsessing with her leg and asking her to spin around for him so he could ogle her when refused to comply with his outrageous demand he retaliated by firing her from the five and placed her on a lower rated showtop executive attempted to pay tantaros off if she would drop her allegation but she turned the offer downfox news ha denied the allegation of course but that isn t stopping tantaros from charging aheadbuzzfeed report that tantaros is upping the ante by daring fox news personnel to take a lie detector test and offered to take one in return so that it can be determined who is telling the truth and who is lyingit s a brilliant move on tantaros part if fox decline it can be assumed that they have something to hide like guilt it would also vindicate tantaros and give further credence to her allegationstantaros even released the question she want certain fox news personnel to answerfor instance a series of question for roger ailes will seek to determine if he did in fact say inappropriate thing to tantaros in the workplace or if he ever retaliated against her for refusing his advanceshere s an image of the question via buzzfeed editor kyle blainea series of question posed to ailes replacement bill shine includes whether or not he knew about tantaros complaint about ailes and whether or not someone within the company arranged for negative comment to be spread about her on social mediaquestions for fox news executive vice president dianne brandi inquire if she had knowledge of tantaros complaint about the hostile working environment and if fox ha paid money to more than six woman to settle sexual harassment suitsand finally question for irena briganti and bill o reilly include whether briganti helped ailes retaliate against tantaros and whether o reilly hit on her and made inappropriate comment about hertantaros lawyer go on to state that an innocent person would jump at the chance for this kind of vindication and added that their client would not risk offering this proposal if she were not telling the truth to put it bluntly andrea tantaros is taking her feud with fox news to whole new level and these question are damning all on their own without fox answering any of themfor year fox news treated woman like powerless sex object now they are finding out just how powerful woman can be especially when they are pissed off about being treated like shitfeatured image via screenshot
Title_Text: andrea tantaros dare fox news to take lie detector test over sexual harassment allegation

Text: dirty harry must ve jarred something in his head that make him unaware that he s lying in public he used to be pretty good at hiding it senate minority leader harry reid dnv is changing the story about how he sustained those gruesome new year s day injury that have left him blind in one eyepreviously reid claimed that an exercise band he wa using broke i wa doing exercise that i ve been doing for many year with those large rubber band and one of them broke and spun me around and i crashed into these cabinet and injured my eye emphasis added reid said at a press conference on january you can see the video of that press conference herebut now in an interview conducted by fusion a joint venture between abc and univision excerpt of which have been released today reid tell univision anchor jorge ramos that the exercise band slipped rather than broke the elastic band strap had no handle on it slipped spun me around uh about oh i guess four foot reid point with his right hand to the wall of the interview room and so i smashed my face into a cabinet reid tell ramosreid s latest version of the incident a told to ramos differs from previous version advanced by his team in another very significant way source familiar with the incident said reid wa exercising in his bathroom with the exercise band attached to the shower door politico reported on january emphasis addedas breitbart news reported previously that version of the story almost certainly told to politico by reid s staffer with his approval is not crediblenow however reid tell ramos a different story the exercise band wa not attached to the shower door in his bathroom reid say but wa instead attached to a big metal hook that came out from the wall in an unspecified room in his new nevada homehere s a partial transcript of the excerpt of the interview released by fusionramos you said recently that the accident had nothing to do with your decision to retirehowever we are seeing the consequence of what happenedwhat really happenedwas it really with an elastic bandreid yeah i had a big that thick reid gesture with his hand that i had been using for about four year and i wa you know trying to maintain my uh firmness and uh that wa my weight training i wa doing that in my new home here in nevada and a big metal hook that came out from the wall that wa hooked there that the strap had no handle on it slipped spun me around uh about oh i guess four foot reid point with his right hand to the wall of the interview room and so i smashed my face into a cabinet so hard that uh ramos it looked like somebody had hit youreid i am so fortunate that um it wasn t over just a fraction of this way and hit me in the templeramos how s your eyereid i am sightless in my right eyewatch the full video of the excerpt of the fusion interview hereramos then switched gear and asked reid about the most difficult moment of his year in the senate ramos failed to ask some key follow up question about reid s new year s day injury incidentfor instance ramos failed to ask reid if the accident took place in his bathroom a reid s office had previously claimed according to reid s latest version of the story we do not know in which room of his house he now claim he sustained these injuriesbreitbart news ha asked senator reid s office which ha carefully controlled the release of information about his new year s day injury to comment on his changed version of the story of his new year s day injury but ha received no replyvia breitbart news
Title_Text: why did harry reid lie about the accident he had that left him blind in one eye

Text: washington reuters  student and faculty at georgetown law school gathered on tuesday to protest that u attorney general jeff session wa delivering an address about the right of free speech on college campus to an invitationonly audience without giving critic of the trump administration an opportunity to ask question several dozen protester stood on the front step of the school some with duct tape over their mouth to symbolize that they felt their view were censored from the event some held sign denouncing racism censorship and u president donald trumps decision to rescind daca the obama administrations deferred action for childhood arrival policy that shield immigrant who were brought to the united state a child taking turn with a bullhorn student and some faculty member accused the school of shutting them out from attending the speech and asking question in his address session focused on concern about whether the right of speaker on college campus were being trampled by student protester who find their view offensive session complained that protester were silencing speaker he also said the department plan to file a brief in a college free speech case this week protester are now routinely shutting down speech and debate across the country in an effort to silence voice that insufficiently conform with their views he said one protester thirdyear law student charlotte berschback complained on the sideline of the protest that invitation to the session speech had been withdrawn from student who had rsvped and had initially been told they would have a seat we pay a ton of tuition she said we should have a role in deciding who come to our school she added that liberal student had been excluded from attending the session event and that the school should have used a lottery process to let student attend session cited concern about multiple incident at college campus around the country including the university of california at berkeley and middlebury college in vermont session mentioned recent violent protest at berkeley he said the school was reportedly forced to spend more than  and have an overwhelming police presence simply to prove that the mob wa not in control of the campus the justice department later said it wa also filing a brief on behalf of student at georgia gwinnett college who are challenging a school policy that requires them to use free speech zones to express their view
Title_Text: student protest u attorney general speech at georgetown

Text: sao paulo reuters  a political campaign fund set up in brazil with public money to help fight corruption is not big enough for the country s general election the head of the country s top electoral court said on friday brazil s scandalplagued political class voted on wednesday to establish the billion reais  million fund to finance election campaign after corporate donation were banned in the wake of the country s biggest ever corruption scandal backer of the fund said organized crime would step in to finance politician if taxpayer fund were not made available but gilmar mendes the head of brazil s tse electoral court said the fund would need more money this is a discussion we re going to have to continue the debate on whether there are sufficient resource it is evident that they will not be enough mendes who is also a supreme court justice said the ban on corporate funding coupled with the drying up of underthetable contribution and kickback during brazil s car wash corruption probe ha left lawmaker struggling to raise money for their campaign critic of the campaign fund said it wa aimed at providing funding for lawmaker seeking reelection to shield themselves from prosecution for corruption mendes said one possibility to boost campaign financing next year would be to increase federal transfer to another fund that finance political party called fundo partidario the current budget estimate transfer of million reais to this fund in   reais
Title_Text: brazil election campaign fund not big enough judge say

Text: washington reuters  the national rifle association is on track for record spending this year on u political campaign including missouris u senate race where a gunowning democrat is waging a tough fight against an incumbent republican backed by the gun right group democrat jason kander an afghanistan war veteran is running just percentage point behind republican u senator roy blunt in opinion poll in missouri despite the nras expenditure of  million so far trying to protect blunt a well a the republicans u senate majority gun violence ha transfixed the united state in from a massacre at an orlando florida nightclub to a rash of police shooting fueling demand by some democrat and activist for tighter gun law those effort have been thwarted a in year past by the nra and it supporter who say such measure would infringe on the right to bear arm guaranteed by the second amendment of the u constitution congress ha not approved major guncontrol legislation since the s an aug reutersipsos poll found percent of respondent agreed there should be strong restriction on firearm and percent supported moderate regulation percapita firearm ownership in the united state far exceeds any other country according to government estimate in the missouri race and other senate contest in state such a north carolina nevada florida and new hampshire the guncontrol battle gripping washington is playing out on the campaign trail the nra ha spent  million in this election cycle with a month to go before voting on nov compared with a previous high of  million in the entire campaign cycle according to federal data gathered by the center for responsive politics the nra did not respond to request for comment in addition to senate republican the lobbying group is also backing republican presidential nominee donald trump blunt is a twodecade veteran of congress he accuses kander of being soft on gun ownership right blunt ha an a rating from the nra kander ha an f which the nra say he earned by backing expanded background check on gun buyer and legislation that failed this year in congress to bar people on terrorism watch lists from buying gun the difference between senator blunt and myself is that i want to stop criminal and suspected terrorist from having the same access to gun a the rest of u which is why i support background checks kander said in a statement to reuters on thursday kander missouris secretary of state counterpunched against blunt last month with a second tv commercial that ha had more than million view on youtubecom in the ad the former u army captain assembles a militarystyle rifle while blindfolded he say he ha supported gun ownership right but add i also believe in background check so that terrorist cant get their hand on one of these a fierce debate in washington over such background check in june led to a hour sitin by democrat on the floor of the house of representative the reaction to that ad ha reset the debate in the missouri senate race said tim daly managing director of gun and crime policy for the liberal center for american progress a think tank in washington kanders polling number were already rising when the sept ad wa first broadcast but daly said kander planted fresh doubt over the nra position on background check blunt and his campaign spokesman were not available for comment the nra is blunts no financial backer in the missouri race surpassed only by a group closely associated with u senate majority leader mitch mcconnell that back republican like the bluntkander battle other key senate race feature intense debate over gun a republican work to defend their control of the senate in north carolina the nra ha pumped in  million to support threatened incumbent republican senator richard burr the first televised debate in new hampshire this week between republican senator kelly ayotte and her democratic challenger governor maggie hassan began with a moderator asking how they could reduce gun violence without infringing on gun right ayotte ha come under attack from american for responsible solution for her opposition to tough gun background check the group work to reduce u gun violence in the united state
Title_Text: nra gun right group pours money into republican u senate campaign

Text: when you want to learn more about what a person is really like talk to the people they have been around a lot it s one thing to push a persona into the spotlight that ha been sculpted to how one would like to be perceivedwhile it is quite another to get to the truth behind the actual personso when half a dozen former contestant from republican presidential frontrunner donald trump s reality show the apprentice come forward to issue statement condemning the candidate we should all probably listen some of those who have come forward are the winner from season randal pinkett alongside kwame jackson who wa runnerup in season they are also planning a press conferenceaccording to bloomberg in statement the contestant slammed trump s rhetoric a divisive and accused him of running a campaign of sexism xenophobia racism violence and hate winning project manager from the apprentice marshawn evans daniel said trump is passionately and strategically reigniting a dirty and divisive culture soaked in a history of prejudice fear and hate it is unpatriotic antiamerican selfserving regressive and downright lazy pinkett stated a alum of the apprentice we have had the opportunity to work with donald in various capacity including a employee of the trump organization based on that experience and donald s campaign we do not believe he is worthy of becoming president of the united state of course trump responded to these criticism in the most trumpian way possible and said the group of former contestant are six failing wannabe he said how quickly they forget nobody would know who they are if it weren t for me they just want to get back into the limelight like they had when they were with trump total dishonesty and disloyalty they should be careful or i ll play hour of footage of them individually praising me ask how successful they ve been since they left six failing wannabe out of hundred of contestant so sad a statement in response that pretty much prof the former contestant point of what a hateful vindictive person trump is a you may have noticed in trump s mind he s never wrong it s always someone else s fault it s always someone else doing something to him and never ever the other way around this is a true sign of an egomaniacal narcissist it s amazing that he can fit his giant braggadocio head through any doorwe need to listen to these former contestant they ve had to work with him and aren t afraid to tell it like it is donald trump cannot be our next president it wouldn t only be bad for the nation but the entire worldfeatured photo by amanda edwardsgetty image
Title_Text: former apprentice contestant unite against trump  issue brutal statement

Text: after being embarrassed on live television saturday night when john dickerson factchecked his lie about supreme court history ted cruz showed no shame a he repeated the same line on sundaythe gop debate started off on saturday night with dickerson asked cruz about whether or not president obama should be able to name a successor to supreme court justice antonin scalia who died earlier that daycruz claimed that a supreme court nominee named by a lame duck president ha not been confirmed by the senate in year dickerson however pointed out that former president ronald reagan s nomination of justice anthony kennedy to the bench in wa confirmed by the senate in the final year of reagan s presidency thus dickerson caught cruz lying which stunned the candidate into silence a the crowd booed the moderator for bringing up pesky factsduring an appearance on abc s this week the texas senator told george stephanopoulos the very same lie and then blamed democrat a the reason why kennedy wa only confirmed in claiming that it would never have happened if they had just automatically confirmed universally despised nominee robert bork instead of rejecting him and his extremism george the senate ha not confirmed a nominee that wa named in the final year an election year in year this is a lame duck president and by the way the only reason anthony kennedy wa nominated that late is that democrat in the senate had gone after and defeated two previous nominee robert bork which set a new standard for partisan attack on a nominee and doug ginsburg so it wa the democrat that had dragged it out for many month to make it that late and right now the court is exquisitely balanced the fact is however that there is a process to supreme court nomination and confirmation many president have had their nominee rejected by the senate so it s not like reagan wa the first to have a nominee fail to be confirmed the bottom line is that cruz is still wrong on his supreme court historybut cruz wasn t done upon being asked if he would filibuster anyone president obama nominates to fill scalia s seat cruz replied absolutely and said that the people should decide who fill the seat by electing the next president this should be a decision for the people george we ve got an election and you know democrat i cannot wait to stand on that stage with hillary clinton or with bernie sander and take the case to the people what vision of the supreme court do you want let the election decide it if the democrat want to replace this nominee they need to win the election here s the video via abc abc breaking news  latest news videosthis is a particularly hard argument to make since american elected president obama for a full four year second term in by five million vote president obama ha nearly a full year left in office so it is absolutely absurd not to mention an admission that republican will refuse to do their constitutional duty to suggest that president obama should force america to wait a full year or more before the supreme court is functioning with a full nine member bench again president obama earned the right to nominate a supreme court justice when he won the election ted cruz and his republican comrade need to get over it and do their damn job featured image via video screen capture
Title_Text: ted cruz repeat lie about scotus nomination vow to block anyone obama chooses video

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump on friday pledged new effort to speed approval for highway and other project a part of his proposal for a  trillion boost to fix aging u infrastructure at the u transportation department trump said his goal wa to solve one of the biggest obstacle to creating this new and desperatelyneeded infrastructure  and that is the painfully slow costly and timeconsuming process for getting permit and approval to build trump said the white house is moving ahead with massive permit reform and setting up a new council to help project manager navigate bureaucratic hurdle this council will also improve transparency by creating a new online dashboard allowing everyone to easily track major project through every stage of the approval process trump said he said the council will make sure that any federal agency that consistently delay project by missing deadline will face tough new penalty we will hold the bureaucracy accountable the white house is also creating a new office in the council of environmental quality to root out inefficiency clarify line of authority and streamline federal state and local procedure so that community can modernize their aging infrastructure without fear of outdated federal rule getting in the way transportation secretary elaine chao said the department is asking for public input on other change it can make to speed approval trump said it took four year to build the golden gate bridge and five year to build the hoover dam  but today it can take year just to get the approval and permit needed to build a major infrastructure project the republican president who wa a new yorkbased real state developer before taking office ha repeatedly decried the process of winning approval for highway permitting it includes different approval involving different federal agency being governed by different statutes trump said he spoke in front of two huge chart detailing the hurdle to build highway and held up a massive report that he said wa needed before a maryland highway wa built how can a country prosper under such restraints trump asked why should we continue to accept what is so clearly unacceptable i wa not elected to continue a failed system  i wa elected to change it the administration proposes  billion in government funding over year a part of a goal of getting  trillion in public and private infrastructure spending senate democratic leader charles schumer ha said the budget cut  billion in infrastructure spending across several cabinet department however including  billion in planned highway trust fund spending
Title_Text: trump announces push to speed up desperatelyneeded infrastructure

Text: washington reuters  a powerful u lawmaker on wednesday demanded secretary of state john kerry provide an explanation of a  billion claim settlement paid to iran just a tehran released american prisoner last month republican ed royce chairman of the house of representative foreign affair committee wrote that the timing of the settlement and the administrations failure to brief congress has led some to express concern that the payment represents a de facto ransom for the release of american hostages royce asked kerry to provide by feb information including list of all u official who participated in negotiation with iran over the settlement agreement the prisoner release and the nuclear agreement announced in july he also asked for legal analysis of the dispute a timeline of negotiation over the dispute and an explanation of how the interest payment in the settlement wa calculated among other information on jan the state department said the united state and iran had settled a longstanding claim at the iranus claim tribunal releasing to tehran  million in fund frozen since plus  billion in interest state department spokesman john kirby said kerry would respond to the letter he did not offer further specific on when and how we can confirm receipt of chairman royces letter and a with all congressional correspondence well respond a appropriate kirby said u republican lawmaker who are strongly critical of democratic president barack obamas iran policy have been questioning the payment for week no republican supported the nuclear agreement when congress had the opportunity to review it last year after the settlement wa announced obama said it wa a better alternative than letting more interest accumulate while waiting for a legal judgment
Title_Text: u republican question timing of  billion iran payment hostage release

Text: rep debbie wasserman schultz dropped a big bomb during an interview on cnn today she claimed that jeh johnson s testimony about the dnc computer hack is wrong in every respect and utterly misinformed whoa who s telling the truthschultz told the cnn anchor he s wrong in every respect let me be very clear at no point during my tenure at the dnc wa i contacted by the fbi dhs or any government agency or alerted or made aware that they believed that the russian an enemy state wa intruding on our network in case you missed it former dhs director jeh johnson testified to lawmaker this week that the dnc rejected his agency s offer to protect it network despite receiving warning about a computer hack instead the dnc chose an outside cyber security firm to help solve the computer hack that led to wikileaks publishing thousand of it emailscnn s bolduan asked schultz how both account could be true secretary johnson say dnc rebuffed the help offered you are saying no one contacted you schultz replied with a shocking statement secretary johnson is utterly misinformed that is simply not accurate schultz went further and blamed the fbi for not helping they left the russian on our network for more than for almost a year before we discovered that they were there
Title_Text: debbie wasserman schultz accuses obamas dhs director jeh johnson of lying under oath video

Text: if someone were to ask regular people on the street how they would wake up a sleeping person they would probably shake them or possibly yell wake up normal stuff right however there is nothing normal about your average second amendment enthusiasta man in chandler arizona ha been arrested after he allegedly lied to police about fatally shooting an intruder on new year s eveit seems like it wa your average night young people were having a gettogether of some kind on new year s eve we have all been to one of these and there is always that one person that fall asleep early this seems to be exactly what happened in this casegage bodenheimer wa at his friend nathaniel thomas apartment while there gage fell asleep on the floor not a huge surprise so far because it get late and not everyone is a night owl it wa supposed to be a nice night with friend but someone invited the second amendment and he ruined the partywhile gage wa sleeping on the floor his friend nathaniel decided he should be awake instead of nudging him or speaking loudly nathaniel decided to point a gun at his friend and pull the trigger in an effort to make repeated trigger click to awaken gagemoments later gage wa dead a nathaniel thinking the gun wa unloaded ended up blowing his friend away with the obviously loaded gunnathaniel must have heard from the nra that he wa not responsible for his own firearm irresponsibility because he called and reported that he shot an intruder in his home there were a couple problem with that one is that the cop could tell immediately that something wa amiss due to the nature of the scene second there were witness there in the apartment the whole time all the police had to do even if they were so inept at investigating the scene wa to ask any person present what happenedthe whole affair wa infinitely dumb on nathaniel s part then again your average person who us a gun a an alarm clock is not the brightest bulb in the chandeliernathaniel wa promptly arrested after witness informed the police of what happenedfeatured image via photobucket
Title_Text: responsible gun owner try to use gun a alarm clock  end up shooting friend dead

Text: robert de niro gave antidonald trump protester across the united state his backing friday a he spoke about how depressed the tycoon s win in the presidential election had made himthe yearold star wa on the red carpet at the world premiere of his new film the comedian in los angeles when he wa asked how he wa coping with trump s victory over democratic rival hillary clinton how am i doing i m very depressed the famously laconic raging bull actor told reporter we have to just wait and see how thing go and keep our eye ever vigilant on the new government asked if he thought the protest were an appropriate response to the outcome of tuesday s election he replied yes absolutely thing aren t being done right demonstrator took to the street in miami los angeles new york and other u city for a third straight night on fridayin manhattan they held sign reading your wall can t stand in our way a reference to the antiimmigration barrier the billionaire ha promised to build on the u border with mexicode niro hasn t minced his word in his criticism of trump describing him a a punk a pig and an idiot i d like to punch him in the face he said before the electionearlier in the day a town in southern italy where de niro s grandparent came from offered the actor a mean of escape if after the disappointment of trump he want to take refuge here we are ready to welcome him said antonio cerio the mayor of ferrazzano the comedian de niro s passion project which took him eight year to bring to the big screen wa part of this year s program for the american film institute s annual afi fest in los angeles yahoohere s a clip of trumphater megyn kelly promoting dinero s hateful rant against donald j trump
Title_Text: robert deniro wanted to punch trump in the facesupports antitrump riotersnow want american to support his new movie video

Text: new york reuters  aetna inc chief executive officer mark bertolini said he expected some benefit of president barack obamas national healthcare reform law will stick under presidentelect donald trump like allowing young adult to stay on their familys health insurance bertolini speaking at the new york time dealbook conference said he expects the expansion of medicaid to more people will continue but with new mechanism for federal financing he also see some sort of subsidy for individual insurance remaining trump ha promised to repeal the affordable care act known a obamacare which passed in and wa obamas signature domestic policy
Title_Text: aetna ceo expects some aca benefit to stay dealbook conference

Text: chicago reuters  target corp tgtn walmart store inc wmtn and other retailer are shelving consideration to move supply base closer to the united state in the face of a possible border tax banking instead on killing support for the tax idea in congress president donald trumps push to impose a tax on import such a the percent levy initiated by house republican could raise u consumer price by a much a percent industry official said last week the president said he favored an import tax that could be adjusted to reflect the country of origins tax rate for u product the decision by retailer to forestall supply chain investment in country such a bolivia and romania to focus on lobbying congress show how trumps ambitious agenda ha instilled a new level of risk operating outside u border but the vagueness around the tax proposal and whether they may ever be implemented mean retail industry executive are still not willing to change their operating infrastructure the retail industry leader association which is leading the industry lobbying effort ha conducted meeting with lawmaker since december focusing on the cost of a new tax and encouraging lawmaker who oppose the tax prospect for a quick passage of a tax bill took a hit last month when the republican attempt to overhaul the national healthcare law failed to get a vote in the u house of representative trump and republican leader have said they still intend to pas a healthcare reform law first casting further doubt on when congress may consider tax reform the border tax proposal likely will be as messy a the healthcare bill according to brian dodge senior executive vicepresident of public affair for the retail lobby group target for one think the industrys lobbying effort are succeeding we are working on educating lawmaker and president trump hasnt embraced it yet so we definitely think we are making progress a senior company official at target said on condition of anonymity there is good reason for retailer to fight the tax idea rbc capital market forecast such a levy could reduce profit of six large u retailer by a much a  billion in it first year with walmart alone seeing it federal tax bill jump to  billion from  billion for a graphic please click tmsnrtrsovlopb best buy co inc bbyn which relies heavily on electronics import could see it earnings completely wiped out rbc warned best buy declined to comment firm with less exposure to overseas supplier  ranging from offprice chain like tjx co tjxn and ross store rosto to cosmetic seller ulta beauty ultao  would feel less impact than heavy importer like walmart target and costco wholesale corp costo analyst and consultant said tjx company and ulta beauty declined comment ross store and costco did not respond to request seeking comment steve osburn director of supply chain for retail consultancy kurt salmon said it is more cost effective to spend on lobbying than on supply chain relocation at this point retailer also have other investment need especially around winning consumer who want to shop from home they are putting a lot of money in ecommerce initiative to compete online so there are not a lot of fund to spare he said one outlier is luxury handbag maker rebecca minkoff which sell it own product and supply other retailer like nordstrom inc jwnn and amazoncom inc amzno the prospect of a u border tax factored into it recent decision to supply u customer from europe a it mitigates logistics cost to supply to the united state according to uri minkoff the firms founder and ceo the process ha intensified in the past six months said minkoff the decision to bank more on the lobby effort to kill support for the tax idea come after retailer spent the last few month considering whether to move some of their production to supply base like bolivia brazil and other south american country with low wage rate a well a european country like hungary bulgaria and the czech republic industry source told reuters a return to the united state wa also a consideration the source said shifting production from existing supply base like china is costly may involve intellectual property issue and disrupts longterm supply contract making it hard to plan and execute such move two industry source said consultant have told retailer they could mitigate shipping cost enough to offset any border tax while avoiding the cost of moving production into the u the source said but so far they are not proceeding with major supply chain change according to retailer and industry consultant walmart is not ready to spend money to deal with this said a supply chain consultant who work with the retailer but requested anonymity for fear of disrupting the firms relationship with walmart walmart ha reviewed it option with supply chain consultant but ha not yet commissioned a concrete contingency plan source with direct knowledge of the matter said walmart declined comment executive at smaller retailer and brand like samsonite crate and barrel and steve madden said there is little competitive impetus for action because they believe a border tax would hurt them and competitor equally samsonite wa studying reviving it u manufacturing base but is not close to taking action setting plan based on policy proposal that are yet to be implemented is not right samsonite chief executive officer ramesh tainwala told reuters minneapolisbased target is limiting itself to conducting feasibility study we just dont want to get ahead of ourselves and invest capital the target official said target declined comment
Title_Text: u retailer bet on congress over bolivia to thwart trump border tax issue

Text: washington reuters  michael caputo who wa an adviser to president donald trumps presidential campaign said he told a u house of representative committee on friday that he never heard of anyone in the campaign talking with russian today i spent my time in front of the committee detailing the fact that i had no contact with russian and i never heard of anyone in the trump campaign talking with russians caputo a political consultant told reporter after testifying at a closed meeting of the house intelligence committee
Title_Text: trump exadviser say he never heard of campaign contact with russian

Text: washington reuters  u president donald trump plan to nominate former treasury official randal quarles to be the federal reserves top banking regulator the white house said on monday if confirmed by the senate quarles would be the first vice chair of supervision at the fed a role created after the financial crisis but never filled during the obama administration quarles is viewed a an industryfriendly figure who will likely listen to bank that have complained about the impact of regulation implemented since the financial meltdown his nomination ha been widely expected since april former fed governor daniel tarullo effectively ran banking supervision until he stepped down in february overseeing a strict implementation of the doddfrank wall street reform law and administering rigorous stress tests annually to bank on how prepared they are to withstand unexpected shock quarles currently run a private investment firm that he founded the cynosure group from salt lake city utah he wa previously a partner at private equity firm the carlyle group he wa also under secretary for domestic finance at the treasury under president george w bush and wa the u executive director of the international monetary fund in an opinion piece in the wall street journal in march quarles and lawrence goodman another former u treasury official argued against breaking up big bank because it would risk damaging the wider economy he ha also talked about refining obamaera financial rule introduced after the financial crisis quarles will be a central figure in pushing the trump administrations plan to loosen the leash put on wall street bank following the crisis trump laid out his plan last month but he need official at key regulatory post to carry out his agenda he ha gradually been nominating head of financial agency but only treasury secretary steven mnuchin and security and exchange commission chairman jay clayton have been approved by congress other agency are either awaiting presidential pick or are operating under acting chief others have leader appointed by trumps democratic predecessor president barack obama
Title_Text: trump to nominate quarles to be fed top banking regulator

Text: no worry fbi director james comey is ha assured everyone that crooked hillary told the truth she s been lying and under criminal investigation for most of her adult life and now we re supposed to believe that she is suddenly telling the truth hillary clinton did not swear an oath to tell the truth before meeting with the fbi for three and a half hour last weekend and the interview wa not recorded fbi director james comey told house lawmaker on thursdaythe lack of a sworn oath doe not remove the possibility of criminal penalty against clinton if she lied to the fbi though he said he had no basis to conclude that she wa untruthful still a crime to lie to u comey told the house oversight committee fbi policy is not to record interview a part of it investigationsyet the revelation will nonetheless raise question among republican who have been skeptical of the fbi s investigation and have demanded to see the transcript of the former secretary of state s interview in downtown washington on saturday well that s a problem rep john mica rfla told comey when the fbi chief explained the term of the interview it s pretty clear that the american people would like to see what hillary clinton said to the fbi senate majority leader mitch mcconnell rky told reporter on wednesday a day before comey s appearance before house lawmakersunder fbi policy and to the dismay of civil libertarian and staunch transparency advocate the bureau doe not conduct electronic recording of interview under the current policy agent may not electronically record confession or interview openly or surreptitiously except in rare circumstance the bureau said in a memothe fbi did however complete a federal form summarizing the interview known a an fd comey saidcomey himself wa not among the five or six agent who interviewed clinton he testified on thursday but he assured lawmaker that clinton told the truth throughout the sessionvia the hill
Title_Text: breaking fbi didnt record hillary interview didnt make her swear under oath to tell truth

Text: just when you find yourself wondering if the world ha gone completely mad you read a story like this that confirms that indeed it ha gov jerry brown is allowing parole for a transgender inmate who is trying to force california to become the first state to pay for sex reassignment surgerya federal judge in april ordered the state to provide the surgery which had been scheduled for july it wa delayed after the state appealedthe governor s office said friday that brown wa taking no action on the board of parole hearing recommendation to release michellelael norsworthy which mean her parole will proceedthe decision make it less likely that the yearold will be able to have surgery funded by the prison before she is released parole board spokesman luis patino said it usually take about a week for an inmate to be released after the governor allows a parole to proceedbrown decided norsworthy is no longer dangerous year after she fatally shot franklin gordon liefer jr following an argument in a fullerton bar in november norsworthy then wa convicted of seconddegree murder after she shot liefer three time he died six week latershe is being held at mule creek state prison a men s prison in ione near sacramento prison record refer to her by her birth name of jeffrey bryan norsworthy though she ha lived a a woman since the sshe wa diagnosed with gender identity disorder in and began taking female hormone she began asking the correction department for the surgery in after learning a judge for the first time had ordered massachusetts to provide an inmate with the procedure however that decision wa overturned on appeal in december and the u supreme court declined to intervenethe th circuit agreed to hear california s appeal of u district judge jon tigar s ruling and a hearing is scheduled for thursday the appellate court noted that the case raise serious legal question about whether denying the surgery violates norsworthy s constitutional right against cruel and unusual punishmentthe california department of correction and rehabilitation say it ha met all of it legal requirement by providing norsworthy with counseling and hormone therapythe state filed paperwork in federal court friday saying it ha agreed to provide sex reassignment surgery for another inmate shiloh quine to settle a separate lawsuit cdcr evaluates every case individually and in the quine case every medical doctor and mental health clinician who ha reviewed this case including two independent mental health expert determined that this surgery is medically necessary for quine correction department spokesman jeffrey callison said in an emailed statementquine formerly known a rodney james quine is serving a life sentence for murder kidnapping and robberynorsworthy testified at her parole hearing in may that she accepts responsibility for her crime she said at the time she wa pretty much drinking every day all day but is now sober and attends alcoholic anonymous meeting in prisonshe said she also take step to control her anger and make better judgmentsvia fox news
Title_Text: transgender prisoner in ca jail for murder is granted parole for sex change

Text: moscow reuters  kremlin spokesman dmitry peskov said on friday it wa not yet known if russian president vladimir putin will run for reelection when his term end next year peskov said putin met former finance minister alexei kudrin to talk about a strategy for economic development up to asked if kudrin wa helping draft putin s program for the next term peskov told reporter it is now yet known if putin will run for the next presidential term the next sixyear term expires in
Title_Text: kremlin say not yet known if putin will seek reelection

Text: pittsburgh pa  democratic presidential candidate hillary clinton toured the u rust belt on saturday promising to reject bad international trade deal during a factory visit and securing the endorsement of investor mark cuban at a pittsburgh rally the dallas maverick owner who said a recently a last month that there wa a good chance he would vote for donald trump instead criticized the republican nominees leadership in front of an energetic crowd leadership is not yelling and screaming and intimidating cuban said you know what we call a person like that in pittsburgh a jagoff cuban added using disparaging pittsburgh slang cuban had spoken with clinton campaign chairman john podesta several time in recent week and called him on thursday to say he wa ready to endorse clinton a campaign aide said clinton along with her runningmate tim kaine a u senator from virginia is on a threeday tour of pennsylvania and ohio after becoming the first woman to accept a major u partys presidential nomination at the democratic convention in philadelphia on thursday pennsylvania and ohio are two state in the u rust belt that are dealing with job loss caused by the decline in u manufacturing neither lean heavily in favor of either political party but both voted for obama in and trump ha zeroed in on white workingclass voter in the region a critical to his campaign and plan to visit both state early next week in a visit earlier on saturday to johnstown wire technology in johnstown pennsylvania clinton told the largely union crowd there that she would create goodpaying job by investing in infrastructure and reject a pending asia trade deal that ha become a flashpoint in the u presidential campaign we are going to say no to unfair trade deal were going to stand up to china clinton said i feel strongly about this and i need your help she added the pending trans pacific partnership tpp negotiated by president barack obama ha drawn criticism from both clinton and trump clinton say it doe not do enough to protect u worker trump ha said he would rip it up and questioned whether clinton would keep her stance if she win the nov presidential election leo gerard the president of the united steelworker which represents roughly of the worker employed by johnstown wire technology assured the crowd in his introduction of clinton that republican have been telling lies about clintons stance on the deal cambria county where johnstown wire technology is based is percent white and ha a median household income of  clinton and kaine will continue their jobsfocused tour that began in philadelphia continuing on to youngstown and columbus they are trying to contrast their plan to use infrastructure investment to create job with that of trump whom clinton said friday ha a downbeat vision of america we are visiting place that prove what american can do clinton said in johnstown this country and our people have what it take to get ahead and stay ahead if they have the leadership that give u that chance
Title_Text: clinton secures mark cuban endorsement in pittsburgh

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump asked thenfbi director james comey to shut down an investigation into tie between former white house national security adviser michael flynn and russia an associate of comey who ha seen the memo said on tuesday the associate told reuters that the detail of the document a first reported by the new york time were accurate i hope you can let this go trump told comey according to the language of the memo which the source confirmed the white house denied the report in a statement to reporter saying it wa not a truthful or accurate portrayal of the conversation between the president and mr comey the memo wa written by comey immediately after his meeting in the white house oval office with trump one day after flynn resigned over his contact with russian flynns resignation came hour after it wa reported that the justice department had warned the white house week earlier that flynn could be vulnerable to blackmail for contact with russian ambassador sergei kislyak before trump took power on jan a spokeswoman for the fbi declined to comment on the detail of the memo
Title_Text: trump asked comey to shut down flynn probe source

Text: a new york man wa stunned this week to find out who stole his donald trump yard sign the former vice president of academic affair at a local collegecharlie tulumello of amherst put recording equipment in his yard after protrump yard sign kept disappearing in the middle of the night seven sign in total disappeared before the culprit former keuka college administrator norman muir wa finally caught the first one i thought maybe they were kid prank mr tulumello told a local cbs news affiliate monday this is supposed to be the united state of america free speech those thing are not supposed to be done mr tulumello told the station that his wife wa uneasy at night a the theft continued so he put up a special sign warning people to stay off his property didn t work this fella just kept coming the new yorker said i wa aggravated angry this person come up on my property in the middle of the night you don t know what to think i mean these are stupid sign but you re coming onto my property in the middle of the night stealing that s not right via wt

Text: washington reuters  after winning a primary election that effectively clinched the republican presidential nomination donald trump paused to laud a boyishlooking yearold who ultimately proved to be an indispensable figure on the path to the white house honestly jared is a very successful real estate person but i actually think he like politics more than he like real estate trump said of his soninlaw jared kushner standing to his right during a victory speech after the indiana party primary election in may but hes very good at politics kushner the slender cleancut new jersey real estate scion who married trumps daughter ivanka in helped guide the republican trump to victory last week over democrat hillary clinton and is poised to remain an influential adviser during his presidency kushner emerged a an important voice early in trumps campaign launched in june he wa involved in almost every aspect of trumps campaign offering advice on key personnel decision strategy speech fundraising and other area late in the campaign he began laying the groundwork for a possible trumprun television network in the event his fatherinlaw lost according to a person familiar with the matter kushner spearhead his familys real estate development company kushner company and is the publisher of the new york observer weekly newspaper which he acquired at age while a federal antinepotism law prohibits a president from hiring family member to serve in his administration kushner is set to remain a key insider and trusted confidant reince priebus appointed trumps white house chief of staff on sunday told nbcs today show on monday that kushner obviously will be very involved in decisionmaking kushner serf on trumps transition executive committee kushner is a harvard graduate with a new york university law degree and a masters in business administration like trump kushner followed in the footstep of a real estate powerhouse father his father charles kushner is a real estate developer philanthropist and major democratic donor whose reputation wa left in tatter after a lurid criminal case he wa sentenced to two year in prison after pleading guilty in to count of tax evasion witness tampering and making unlawful campaign donation during the case he admitted to smearing his brotherinlaw who had cooperated with prosecutor by hiring a prostitute to have sex with him in a motel room then sending a secretly recorded video of the encounter to the mans wife charles kushners own sister in an unusual twist the man who prosecuted charles kushner wa chris christie now the governor of new jersey who also ha served a an adviser to trump kushner is an orthodox jew whose wife ivanka converted to judaism before they married the family keep kosher observes the sabbath and attends an upscale synagogue on new yorks upper east side antisemitism controversy steve bannon former head of the rightwing breitbart news website took a leadership post in the campaign in august after it became clear that trump his child and kushner trusted his advice and analysis a source said at the time breitbart news is closely associated with the altright movement a loose online group of white supremacist antisemite and others opposed to multiculturalism trump who take office on jan named bannon a chief strategist and senior counselor on sunday dana schwartz a jewish reporter for kushners newspaper in july criticized trump for his twitter post accusing clinton of corruption using a star of david image and a background of  bill schwartz then wrote an open letter to kushner after being deluged with antisemitic tweet schwartz asked kushner how do you allow this because mr kushner you are allowing this when you stand silent and smiling in the background his jewish soninlaw youre giving his most hateful supporter tacit approval kushner responded by writing in the observer in my opinion accusation like racist and antisemite are being thrown around with a carelessness that risk rendering these word meaningless he went on to write that his grandmother and grandfather survived the nazi holocaust while other relative did not i know the difference between actual dangerous intolerance versus these label that get tossed around in an effort to score political points kushner wrote kushner became a major player in real estate in his mids after his fathers conviction at he orchestrated what wa the mostexpensive singlebuilding purchase in u history in with the  billion acquisition of a story skyscraper at fifth avenue in manhattan kushner told the real deal trade magazine afterward in new york you have to act quickly or else you get left in the dust
Title_Text: soninlaw kushner poised to wield clout in trump presidency

Text: bristol palin is no smarter than her mother halfterm governor of alaska sarah however she sure doe think she know a lot about a lot of thing a if being an abstinence activist who ha had two outofwedlock child weren t enough bristol ha also decided that she is some kind of racism expertever since black actor and their ally have decided to boycott the oscar because for the second year in a row they have no black star nominated for their prestigious award white folk all over the place have been telling black america at large that there s no problem here when we all know damn well there is now bristol palin ha added her voice to the mixshe said that she agrees with fox contributor stacey dash who want to ride the world of pesky racist institution such a bet and black history month this is bad enough coming from the clueless star who is black herself to refresh dash said the following either we want to have segregation or integration if we don t want segregation then we need to get rid of channel like bet and the bet award and the naacp image award now lilywhite bristol palin go and blog about something that in no way concern her taking to her own blog bristol wrote i have to admit i don t know who waka flocka is or what he sings but i agree with him on this though ice cube didn t mention stacey by name isn t it interesting how he echoed her sentiment exactly we shouldn t segregate ourselves or limit black history month to one month a year i wish thing were really colorblind i don t know how other people think about it but i hope my son see early on that not everyone get a trophy and this is the problem with people like stacey dash and bristol palin ignoring problem like racism doesn t make them go away in fact it always them to fester and grow under cover of dark exposing these thing is how we rid the world of them these actor and their supporter are taking on a systemic problemno you privileged clueless little girl this isn t about trophy and segregation this Text: tokyo reuters  japanese prime minister shinzo abe said on wednesday that he want north korea to understand it ha no bright future if it continues on it current path and that the reclusive country need to change it policy abe told reporter he want to discus the north korea situation with russian president vladimir putin and south korean president moon jae in separately when they meet this week in vladivostok abe and putin are also expected to discus economic cooperation and a peace treaty between the two nation
Title_Text: japan pm say north korea ha no bright future if it continues current path

Text: riyadh reuters  saudi arabian woman awoke to news of a royal decree permitting them to drive starting next year  and some were already behind the wheel on wednesday even though license will not be issued for nine month saudi arabia will never be the same again the rain begin with a single drop manal alsharif who wa arrested in after a driving protest said in an online statement online video showed a handful of woman driving car overnight after king salman s decree wa announced late on tuesday i wish i could translate my feeling right now i feel like no one can understand it fully but u said abeer alarjani who plan to start driving lesson this weekend now i ll finally dare to dream for more the move represents a big crack in the law and social more governing woman in the conservative muslim kingdom the male guardianship system requires woman to have a male relative s approval for decision on education employment marriage travel plan and even medical treatment saudi arabia the birthplace of islam ha been widely criticized for being the only remaining country to forbid woman to drive king salman s decree end a conservative tradition seen by right activist a an emblem of the country s suppression of woman nlnmp it is expected to boost the fortune of yearold crown prince mohammed bin salman who ha ascended to the height of power in the kingdom in three short year with an ambitious domestic reform program and assertive foreign policy a muted response from saudi s powerful clergy which ha long backed the ban suggested power shared between the al saud dynasty and the wahhabi religious establishment could be shifting decisively in favor of the royal many younger saudi regard crown prince mohammed s ascent a evidence that their generation is taking a central place in running a country whose patriarchal tradition have for decade made power the province of the old and blocked woman s progress sharif the activist described the driving ban s removal a just the start to end longstanding unjust law that have always considered saudi woman minor who are not trusted to drive their own destiny the saudi ambassador to washington said on tuesday woman would not need their guardian permission to get a license nor to have a guardian in the car when driving in a country where gender segregation ha been strictly enforced for decade in keeping with the austere wahhabi form of sunni islam the decree mean woman will have regular contact with unrelated men such a fellow driver and traffic police other rule have loosened recently with the government sponsoring concert deemed unislamic by the clergy allowing woman into a large sport stadium for the first time and permitting them to dance beside men in a central riyadh street over the weekend nlnmt amnesty international welcomed the decree a long overdue but said there wa still a range of discriminatory law and practice that needed to be overturned that risk inflaming tension with influential wahhabi cleric with whom the ruling al saud ha enjoyed a close strategic alliance since the kingdom s founding the statebacked council of religious scholar expressed support for the driving decree grand mufti sheikh abdulaziz al alsheikh who ha repeatedly opposed woman working and driving and said letting them into politics may mean opening the door to evil ha yet to comment some islamist cleric are currently in detention in saudi arabia following an apparent crackdown on potential opponent of the kingdom s ruler this month nlnlwg bernard haykel professor of near east study at princeton university said the driving announcement may help explain those arrest they might have raised a storm against the government by mobilizing opposition in the name of religion they have been stymied he said still some men expressed outrage at the aboutface by prominent cleric who in the past have sometimes justified the driving ban by saying woman s brain are too small or that driving endangered their ovary whoever say this is permitted is a sinner woman driving mean great evil and this make them especially sinful one riyadhbased twitter user wrote where is the grand mufti said another evil ha come to arab
Title_Text: saudi woman rejoice at end of driving ban long backed by cleric

Text: washington reuters  israeli prime minister benjamin netanyahu asked u president donald trump on wednesday to recognize israeli sovereignty over the golan height territory israel seized from syria in the middle east war most of the world considers the golan a high plateau between northeastern israel and southwestern syria to be occupied by israel which annexed the territory in in a move not recognized internationally during a briefing with israeli and foreign medium after meeting trump at the white house netanyahu wa asked whether he had raised the golan issue yes he replied asked how the u president had responded he said i wouldnt say that he wa surprised by my request netanyahu did not elaborate israel made a similar request to the obama administration in but it wa rejected diplomat said at the time while israel ha long coveted sovereignty in the golan it is unclear whether the white house would take such a step now given that it could further complicate the syrian conflict if the united state were to recognize israels claim it would likely anger syrian president bashar alassad who is backed by russia and iran in his war with islamist militant and rebel group the trump administration ha talked about working more closely with russia to end the syrian conflict recognizing israels sovereignty in the golan could undermine those effort it could also spur iran and it proxy in syria particularly the lebanese shiite militia hezbollah to turn more of their focus against israel targeting it force stationed across the golan height israel ha warned hezbollah with which it fought a sixweek war in against attacking it territory it ha carried out occasional air strike in the syrian portion of the golan to target hezbollah fighter including unit smuggling arm israels argument for sovereignty over the territory is based partly on the fact that syria ha splintered over the past five year of fighting to the extent that israel say there is no one to whom it could hand back the golan but with the united state and israel looking to forge an evertighter relationship it is also possible that trump who ha shown himself to be unpredictable at time could decide to recognize israels sovereignty a well a around israeli settler in the territory many of them working in agriculture there are about druze of syrian citizenship many of whom have relative living in just across the valley in syria
Title_Text: netanyahu asks trump to recognize israeli sovereignty over golan height

Text: dubai reuters  iran will not be bullied by the united state and will react strongly to any wrong move by washington on tehran s nuclear deal supreme leader ayatollah ali khamenei said on sunday u president donald trump said on thursday that iran wa violating the spirit of the deal under which it got sanction relief in return for curbing it nuclear program state television quoted khamenei a saying iran wa standing firm and any wrong move by the domineering regime regarding the nuclear accord will face the reaction of the islamic republic washington extended some sanction relief for iran on thursday under the nuclear deal with world power but said it had yet to decide whether to maintain the agreement trump must make a decision by midoctober whether to certify that iran is complying with the deal known a the joint comprehensive plan of action jcpoa if he doe not congress ha day to decide whether to reimpose sanction today despite all the commitment and discussion in the negotiation america s attitude toward these negotiation and their outcome is completely unjust and amount to bullying khamenei said in a speech to iranian police academy graduate the american should know there will be no retreat by the islamic republic the foreign ministry in tehran condemned a continued iranophobia washington s move on thursday to impose sanction on individual and firm including two based in ukraine state news agency irna reported the u treasury accused the of supporting iran s ballistic missile program or it revolutionary guard or engaging in cyber attack against the u financial system u secretary of state rex tillerson said on sunday he believed iran wa in technical compliance with the nuclear deal but had stepped up destabilizing activity in yemen and syria and continued to have an active ballistic missile program none of that i believe is consistent with that preamble commitment that wa made by everyone in the nuclear deal he told cbs face the nation iran said last month it could abandon the nuclear agreement within hour if the united state imposed any new penalty after washington ordered unilateral sanction over tehran s ballistic missile test iranian president hassan rouhani speaking on sunday before leaving to attend a un general assembly meeting in new york said washington should join the country that continued to support the nuclear deal which he compared to a dinner party they can choose the right path and also enter the room where the food is served we would not have a problem with that irna quoted rouhani a saying the united state imposed unilateral sanction saying tehran s ballistic missile test violated a un resolution that endorsed the nuclear deal and called on tehran not to undertake activity related to ballistic missile capable of delivering nuclear weapon iran denies it missile development breach the resolution saying the missile are not designed to carry nuclear weapon
Title_Text: iran khamenei warns u against wrong move on nuclear deal

Text: dublin reuters  ireland s secondlargest party fianna fail which help prop up the government indicated on friday it would force an election if the country s deputy prime minister doe not resign over a policing scandal asked in an interview with national broadcaster rte whether the only thing that could prevent a snap general election wa the resignation of deputy prime minister france fitzgerald senior fianna fail member dara calleary said i think so
Title_Text: ireland fianna fail party say will be election if deputy pm doe not resign

Text: bernie sander had an amazingly touching moment at the democratic convention that brought the usually stoic vermont senator to tear during the roll call of the state to cast their official delegate vote for the presidential nomination the usual procedure wa disrupted when the democrat abroad delegation wa up for a votebernie sander brother larry wa part of the democrat abroad group which is comprised of voter who live overseas the delegation held back one of their vote after making their official submission for clinton and sanderslarry sander wa designated a the person who would deliver the final vote and he launched into a speech about the parent of the sander brother i want to read for this convention the name of our parent eli sander and dorothy glassberg sander they did not have easy life and they died young they would be immensely proud of their son and his accomplishment they loved him they loved the new deal of franklin roosevelt and would be especially proud that bernard is renewing that vision it is with enormous pride that i cast my vote for bernie sander the tearful statement wa greeted with loud cheer and applause from convention goer sander wa later featured a vermont made the last vote in the roll call a he called for a vote by acclamation to declare hillary clinton the nominee the motion wa accepted and clinton became the first woman in american history to be a presidential nominee of one of the two major partieslarry is sander older brother and ha lived in oxford england since the s he is active in uk politics and ha served a a spokesperson for the green party of england and wale he ran for a seat in the british election but came in fifthfeatured image via youtube
Title_Text: watch the amazing moment that made bernie cry at the convention
