Text: seoul reuters  north korea congratulated china on it th communist party congress on wednesday amid increasingly frayed relationship between the traditional ally a china tightens sanction over pyongyang s nuclear weapon program the central committee of the north s ruling worker party of korea said that china had made great progress in accomplishing the cause of building socialism with chinese characteristic under the correct guidance of the communist party we are greatly pleased over this the party central committee said in the message carried by the official kcna news agency adding that it sincerely wished the china congress satisfactory success chinese foreign ministry spokesman lu kang said that many foreign political party organization and dignitary had sent their congratulation including the worker party of korea this all show that the international community is paying close attention to the th party congress we express our thanks for this lu told a daily news briefing official and expert in south korea had worried that pyongyang may conduct a weapon test to coincide with the opening of the twiceadecade congress in beijing but there wa no sign of that a chinese president xi jinping gave his opening speech while the united state and it ally and many people in china believe beijing should do more to rein in pyongyang the acceleration of north korea s nuclear and missile capability ha coincided with a neartotal breakdown of highlevel diplomacy between the two china pyongyang s sole major ally and which account for more than percent of world trade with the isolated country ha said it will strictly enforce un security council sanction banning import of coal textile and seafood while cutting off oil shipment to the north
Title_Text: amid strained tie north korea congratulates china on party congress

Text: tokyo reuters  campaigning began on tuesday in an election that pit prime minister shinzo abe s liberal democratic party against the fledgling party of hope led by tokyo governor yuriko koike and other smaller party contesting seat in japan s more powerful lower house of parliament the following are the stance on key policy from the ldp party of hope and the constitutional democratic party of japan cdpj another new party made up of the rump of the disbanded opposition democratic party the election is oct  proceed with a planned sale tax hike in to percent from the current percent use part of the revenue from the increase for childcare and welfare program hope  freeze the scheduled sale tax hike to ensure economic recovery  the sale tax should not be raised to percent at once  accelerate the abenomics recipe of hypereasy monetary policy and fiscal spending to realize economic recovery and break away from deflation  maintain the objective of turning japan s budget balance to a surplus without setting a deadline for achieving it the party previously said it aimed to hit the goal by fiscal  boost japan s productivity and cope with labor shortage through innovation in such area a robot internet of thing and artificial intelligence  maintain the bank of japan s ultraeasy monetary policy a debate on withdrawing the stimulus is premature hope  scrap overreliance on fiscal spending and monetary easing maintain the bank of japan s massive stimulus for the time being but call on the government and the boj to work together to seek a smooth exit from ultraloose monetary policy  impose tax on company huge internal reserve and use the proceeds to improve japan s fiscal health and make up for a shortfall of revenue from freezing the sale tax hike  seek to adopt a basic income system in which all citizen receive a set amount of money on a regular basis to help lowincome household  maintain the bank of japan s ultraeasy policy for the time being but urge the central bank to work with the government to seek a smooth withdrawal of stimulus in the future  boost wage of childcare and nursing care worker  put a cap on working hour and raise minimum wage  realize equal pay for equal work  revise the pacifist constitution to provide a firm legal basis for japan s military which is called the selfdefense force article of the constitution which wa drafted by the united state after world war two renounces war a a mean for resolving international dispute and the maintenance of armed force for this purpose hope  hold debate on possible revision to article and other part of the constitution  oppose the ldp s plan to clarify the status of the military in the constitution  take a leading role a the international community applies pressure on north korea to convince pyongyang to abandon it nuclear and missile program  further solidify japan s alliance with the united state and strengthen tokyo s missile defense capability hope  echo the ldp s call for strict enforcement of sanction against north korea early return of those japanese national abducted by north korean agent decade ago and tighter alliance with the united state  use diplomacy to resolve the north korean crisis peacefully uphold exclusively defensive security policy  utilize nuclear power a an important part of japan s energy mix for now a long a it safety is ensured but will lower the country s dependence on nuclear energy a more renewable energy source are introduced hope  end nuclear power by amid public safety worry after the fukushima nuclear disaster offer government aid on research to increase the ratio of renewable energy to percent  put an end to nuclear power a soon a possible
Title_Text: factbox japan main party key election pledge ahead of october vote

Text: washington reuters  the head of the u consumer financial protection bureau accused congressional critic of relying on misstatements to criticize his agency which wa set up under former president barack obama to pursue bad behavior by financial institution richard cordray the bureaus director wrote to correct the record in a letter sent to a congressional panel on wednesday regarding a recent report critical of the cfpbs work in a highprofile scandal the fivepage letter took issue with multiple conclusion reached in a report released earlier this month by republican staff on the house financial service committee some member of the committee have pushed for republican president donald trump to fire cordray who ha headed the agency since he wa appointed by obama a democrat in the report said the cfpb had been an ineffective watchdog against well fargo co missing extensive improper sale practice and taking action only after work on the banks unauthorized account scandal had been done by others the committees report also depicted the cfpb a reluctant to cooperate with the panels well fargo probe cordray insisted that his agency had done critical work in policing well fargo and said the report devolves into various misstatement and allegations about the cfpbs work the cfpb along with the office of the comptroller of the currency and the city and county of los angeles struck a  million settlement against the bank in september cordray argued that improper sale practice were underway at well fargo a far back a while his agency wa only fully staffed in he maintained the cfpb had acted properly in monitoring the bank and the cfpbs presence allowed the federal government to provide relief to wronged consumer across the country a part of the settlement he went on to accuse republican staff of refusing to receive a september briefing from his staff on well fargo instead demanding he personally brief them with one days notice which he wa unable to do he said he also offered to publicly testify at a committee hearing devoted to well fargo but did not receive an invitation a committee spokesman did not immediately respond to a request for comment cordray is one of a handful of remaining regulatory head that were appointed by obama republican have criticized the cfpb since it created a part of the doddfrank wall street reform law effort to fundamentally reshape the agency have ramped up since the november election
Title_Text: u consumer financial watchdog accuses congressional critic of misstatement

Text: the music icon spoke at the north minneapolis conference on peace on saturdaystevie wonder spoke out about black life matter and youth gun violence at the north minneapolis conference on peace on saturday it is in your hand to stop all of the killing and the shooting wherever it might be wonder said you cannot say black life matter and then kill yourselves because you know we ve mattered long before it wa said but the way we show that we matter the way that we show all the various people of color matter is by loving each other and doing something about it not just talking about it not just waiting to see the medium and press come when there s a horrible thing watchwonder s statement came after he highlighted the fatal shooting of philando castile during a traffic stop by former minnesota police officer jeronimo yanez on friday yanez wa acquitted of all charge by a jury billboardthe amazing website heyjackasscom provides uptodate information on the current guncrime situation in the gunfree city of chicago why are there no protest in the city of chicago from black life matterevery minute a person is shot in the city of chicago where is the outrage from the black community over the killing of their own in their community

Text: socialist indoctrination start in kindergarten and is reinforced throughout the american student s educational journey parent need to pay attention to the drivel their child are being taught at school this kind of socialist teaching is not limited to public school many of u have discovered that private and parochial school are equally guilty of this type of indoctrination conservative hollywood actress sam sorbo suggests home schooling your child to avoid government indoctrination the role of government is to redistribute wealth according to a course at the milwaukee school of engineeringa test administered on april in professor john traxler s healthcare economics class told student that one of the main function of government is income redistribution then asked them to explain what the statement meant the correct answer wa c taxing the wealthy and giving it to those in poverty josh fisher a student in the class told campus reform he wa flabbergasted when he saw the question given that it is premised on an unabashedly liberal view of a politically contentious issue when i saw it i wanted to get up and leave he said i thought there s no way this is a real question at all fundamental concept include demand and supply elasticity and marginalism inflation unemployment business cycle role of government state the course description on the school s website adding these concept are then used to explain and analyze market structure including perfect competition and monopoly the website also defines the course learning outcome which include analyzing the role of government and the effect of regulation on the healthcare section a described by economics i listen to talk radio a lot now ben shapiro steven crowder andrew klavan mark levin and milo yiannopoulos fisher said so i knew that this type of liberal perspective being pushed on student wa happening but i had no idea it wa so blatant maybe the worst part is that so many of my classmate now believe this to be true several professor who spoke with campus reform about the matter said that while the question defines income redistribution accurately it wa unnecessary to include an endorsement of that controversial concept this question assumes a false premise said antony davy a professor at duquesne university i do not accept the premise that redistribution is a main function of government in general he added though he did concede that it is a main function of our government today when asked if this is common to be taught in economics class he claimed no that s not common to be taught it is common to teach that that is something government can do one way to read the question is that it is simply a definition c is the definition of income redistribution the real slant is in the start saying that income redistribution is one of the main function of government noted mount holyoke college economics professor jim hartley some people think that is true but others disagree so if the question wa written a income redistribution mean the question is fine if it started some people believe one of the main function it would be fine he explained the assertion in the first sentence is the evidence of bias but the question is unaffected by the bias he also added that the first sentence is not necessary for the test question and thus is really just serving a propaganda fisher told campus reform that he wa reluctant to challenge his professor on the matter saying i didn t want to risk to affecting my grade he push his agenda pretty hard the student who provided the tip wish to remain anonymous but added that traxler is pretty set with his opinion anyways so i don t think fighting him would have made a difference via campus reform
Title_Text: wow milwaukee school of engineering professor exposed after student take photo of insane test question one of main function of government is income redistribution

Text: jakarta reuters  indonesian president joko widodo will on friday hold his cabinet meeting on the holiday island of bali in a bid to reassure visitor that there is nothing to worry about from the rumbling mount agung volcano authority last month raised the alert status of mount agung in northeastern bali to the highest level imposing an exclusion zone of up to km mile around it crater a it spewed cloud of ash steam and other volcanic material widodo will take the unusual step of gathering his cabinet in bali a part of government effort to assure visitor that the island is safe to come to and to stave off a major drop off in visitor number during the upcoming holiday season for those who have plan to vacation in bali there s no need to doubt or be worried about the status of mount agung bali is very safe to visit energy minister ignasius jonan said in a twitter message after visiting an observatory overlooking the volcano before the cabinet meeting president widodo is expected to make a statement after the cabinet meeting the cabinet usually meet at the state palace in the capital jakarta or on it outskirt in bogor the relatively small island of bali famous for it beach and temple ha an outsized importance for indonesian tourism in januaryseptember bali received million foreign tourist arrival nearly half of the million arrival in indonesia tourism minister arief yahya said this week that indonesia wa expecting an estimated trillion rupiah  billion in lost income and around million fewer tourist because of the volcano according to daily newspaper kompas many business operator and hotel have seen cancellation since authority first raised the alert in september and most expect the holiday season to be slower than in previous year thousand of tourist were left stranded late last month when a volcanic ash cloud forced the closure of bali s airport for several day country like australia and singapore have advised their citizen to be cautious when traveling to bali
Title_Text: indonesia hold cabinet meeting in bali a volcano threatens tourism

Text: trump s attorney general jeff session is a furious a trump is over the blocking of an executive order that would have denied muslim entry into the united state rather than reassess their own morality the islamophobic tag team ha gone after the judge who have pointed out their plan are unconstitutional for trump a former reality tv star and current yearold fox news viewer the inability to understand the basic of america s justice system is pretty much a given but his attorney general seems just a clueless and it s literally his job to understand the lawhighlighting his sheer incompetence to perform the job he wa handpicked to do session formerly an alabama senator best known for being a racist slammed the state of hawaii and discounted it importance in the united state with a shocking rant during an interview with rightwing conspiracy theorist mark levin we ve got case moving in the very very liberal ninth circuit who they ve been hostile to the order session said we won a case in virginia recently that wa a nicelywritten order that just demolished i thought all the argument that some of the other people have been making we are confident that the president will prevail on appeal and particularly in the supreme court if not the ninth circuit so this is a huge matter i really am amazed that a judge sitting on an island in the pacific can issue an order that stop the president of the united state from what appears to be clearly his statutory and constitutional power that judge sitting on an island in the pacific session wa so quick to dismiss he s a federal judge working in a federal court in the u state of hawaii hardly a random nobodyas ever the trump administration s goto defense of their badly botched policy is to attack the critic for not letting them do whatever they want trump s socalled travel ban would have overtly banned many muslim from entering the united state based exclusively on their religion and ethnicity the constitution is pretty clear on that the ruling wa so straightforward that it wa actually confirmed by several other federal judge before trump announced that he wa dropping his stab at it and starting overand given session track record it is a bit more odious that he would choose to go after the island in the pacific populated by a diverse group of american racist dog whistle aren t supposed to be this loudupdate a reporter have pointed out session smear on judge derrick watson is even more obviously partisan because he actually voted for himfyi jeff session voted to confirm derrick watson the Text: washingtonnew york  democratic presidential frontrunner hillary clinton ha spent about  per vote so far in the race for the partys nomination less than her rival bernie sander who spent  according to campaign finance report filed on wednesday clintons efficiency with money could offset concern among some of her backer that sander the u senator from vermont ha outraised her in each of the last two month a he wage a fierce fight to get onto the presidential ballot the former first ladys campaign ha spent a total of  million since launching last april and ha yielded a total of million vote in state nominating contest that includes  million for million vote in march the filing show sander in turn ha spent  million since launching his bid for the white house while netting million vote sanders campaign ha often touted it ability to tap a large number of small donor to outraise clinton in march sander pulled in nearly  million from people with an average donation of just over  it said that compared to  million for clinton in march from people some percent of sanders donor have given less in total than the  maximum according to his campaign meaning he can go back to them for more fund some of clintons backer say they are nervous about her campaigns fundraising strategy of relying heavily on donor who are able to write big check and who max out more quickly i think were going to see her doing more small dollar fund raisers said lorraine hariton who ha raised more than  for the campaign but the clinton campaigns spending efficiency ha helped it preserve a warchest at the end of march clinton had  million left in the bank  more than anyone else running for president sander had just  million preserving the war chest is crucial for clintons chance of winning the white house in the general election against a republican letting her campaign effectively in swing state attack her opponents vulnerability and defend her own should she face off against republican frontrunner donald trump she will need a bank account sufficient to compete with a candidate who ha mastered the knack of earning free coverage approaching the end of the primary campaign with a surplus is a far different scenario from the one in which clinton found herself at the end of her failed bid for the nomination against barack obama when she ended up  million in debt an example of the campaigns frugality it cut advertising spending by  million to  million in march a month heavy with primary and caucus by using more digital advertising instead of television ad clinton spent only  million on digital ad the campaign also reduced real estate cost and limited increase in payroll a it staffed up we set ambitious goal to ensure wed have the resource we need to win a competitive primary and weve blown past every goal recently surpassing the milliondonor mark spokesman josh schwerin said
Title_Text: sander raise more cash but clinton make campaign dollar go further

Text: vienna reuters  munich prosecutor said on friday they expect to complete their investigation into airbus s  billion sale in of eurofighter combat jet to austria the deal ha been the subject of investigation by austrian and german prosecutor for year our investigation is about to come to an end we aim to complete the proceeding soon a spokeswoman for munich prosecutor said but declined to comment on a report by german weekly der spiegel that said the authority would file charge soon the munich authority is focusing on whether money supposedly spent on socalled offset deal which are common in large arm deal to provide business for local firm wa instead used to influence decisionmakers on the main sale munich prosecutor are investigating people on suspicion of breach of trust according to the spokeswoman airbus which ha repeatedly denied all allegation said when asked for comment neither the prosecutor investigation in munich and vienna nor our own extensive investigation have led to evidence suggesting bribery in connection with the sale of eurofighter jet to austria vienna prosecutor are pursuing a separate investigation into allegation of fraud against airbus and the eurofighter industrial consortium based on complaint from the austrian defense ministry which is seeking up to billion euro  billion in compensation last month airbus again denied any wrongdoing in a submission to the austrian prosecutor and threatened the country s defense minister with legal action the munich prosecutor are investigating where million of euro ended up which airbus  eads at the time  paid to a now defunct company between and the spokeswoman said the austrian proceeding continue independently of the german investigation a vienna prosecutor s spokesman said adding that he could not say when a decision might be taken on whether to file charge an austrian parliamentary inquiry into the eurofighter deal found no evidence of bribery or that airbus and it partner illegally influenced austrian politician
Title_Text: munich prosecutor say nearing end of austrian eurofighter probe

Text: ap published an article today that attempt to discredit the very popular fox news cable network over their coverage of the seth rich murder instead of questioning fox news coverage of the seth rich murder case perhaps american should be questioning why the ap is not covering the suspicious case of the seth rich murderan excerpt from the ridiculous ap story including the photoshopped photo they used to discredit fox can be found below how professional is this photo david bauder the writer for this ap hit piece on fox news actually said that he hope for the sake of their more liberal host like shepard smith that the story isn t true yet the ap publishes a huge picture of fox news with an electronic banner that appears to be on the front of the fox news studio the fake news medium and trump illegible we re pretty sure you don t post an inflammatory photoshopped picture like the one below if you re not trying to discredit fox newsnew york ap thing had started settling down following a tumultuous year at fox news channel before it wa hit with a cover headline in the new york daily news fake news channel and question about the independence of it journalist on wednesdaya defamation lawsuit filed this week accuses the network of making up quote and pushing a false story that benefit president donald trump even inviting the chief executive into the editorial processin essence fox is accused of creating fake news to debunk a story trump ha complained is fake news the charge is a very serious one if substantiated said kathleen hall jamieson communication professor and director of the annenberg public policy center at the university of pennsylvania it speaks to the credibility of fox a a news organization in a year fox ha been hit by the forced departure of it late chairman roger ailes and most popular personality bill o reilly following harassment charge ailes successor bill shine resigned primetime host megyn kelly and greta van susteren left and there have been several sexual harassment and race discrimination lawsuitsyet the network s conservative audience ha remained mostly loyal while not a dominant a it wa before msnbc s resurgence in the past few month fox ranked a the most popular primetime network on cable television in july for the fifth time in the past seven month the nielsen company saidfox host like sean hannity tucker carlson and the team on trump s favorite morning show fox friend make no secret of their opinion and those show have strongly backed trump in his first six month fox though is different from some politically oriented news organization in maintaining a staff of respected journalist who try to play it straight people like shepard smith chris wallace bret baier and john robertswe hate to tell you ap but about of fox news viewer wish shepard smith would go away that s the side of fox that would be most damaged if the allegation are proven true since they involved the reporting of an investigative news story on the network s web site not material from it opinion program any news organization that ha any aspiration of being bona fide expects the public to take what they are saying seriously not that they are being fed something that is being made up said paul levinson chairman of fordham university s communication department i m no fan of fox but i m hoping this turn out not to be the case the private detective who filed the lawsuit rod wheeler said he wa paid to investigate the death of dnc staffer seth rich by a wealthy gop donor anxious to establish a link between rich and the leak of email damaging to hillary clinton s campaign the idea wa if that could be done it would end story about trump s possible collusion with russiansreally ap do you have proof of your allegation that the seth rich story wa manufactured to end story about trump s possible collusion with russian so far there hasn t been one iota of truth that substantiates the leftist medium s fabricated trumprussia collusion story but there seems to be an awful lot of evidence pointing to the fact that the former dnc staffer seth rich s murder wa not about a robbery on june breitbart news caught the ap publishing a totally manufactured story about a meeting between trump s epa administrator and dow chemical s ceo that never happened breitbart june the associated press is at it again pushing more fake news sadly the oncegreat news wire service is trying to cover up it mistake nearly the exact mistake that cost three editorial staffer at cnn their job in a scandal that first exploded a week ago todaya breitbart news investigation ha led to the correction by the associated press which originally resisted of the fake news it printed a deeper question of responsibility accountability and journalistic ethic consume the ap heading into fourth of july weekendthis time the associated press invented an imaginary meeting between epa administrator scott pruitt and dow chemical ceo andrew liveris and then alleged that some kind of impropriety happened a a resultthis is exactly the same mistake cnn made a week ago when it alleged that anthony scaramucci the founder of skybridge capital and an associate and ally of president donald trump held meeting with russian investment fund leader and wa under investigation by the senate intelligence committee and treasury department a a resulta breitbart news investigation uncovered that no such meeting took place the senate intelligence committee wa not investigating the matter and the treasury department had already at the urging of sen elizabeth warren dma to now treasury secretary steven mnuchin before trump s inauguration looked into it and determined the matter to be entirely without merit the very fake news scandal that is consuming cnn right now is the biggest scandal in the network s history and come a medium dcwide find themselves under intense scrutiny amid a litany of industry mistakesbreitbart news s investigation into cnn s very fake news piece forced the network to retract it and ha led to the resignation of three top official from inside cnn now that the associated press ha made literally the exact same mistake with different actor and player alleging a meeting took place that never occurred something that supposedly led to something untoward that also didn t happen the news wire service is not stepping up and holding it staff to the same level of accountability the only difference between the cnn scandal and this ap scandal is that the ap did not also inaccurately allege the existence of nonexistent senate and treasury investigation
Title_Text: verified fakenews ap attempt to discredit fox news over alleged fake seth rich storyworries shepard smiths reputation could be harmed

Text: it s like something out of a dystopian novel having just abandoned america s leadership position in fighting climate change and realizing the move wa deeply unpopular trump ordered a day of celebration for himself the event wa titled pittsburgh not paris a reference to a line he used to justify pulling out of the paris climate dealpresident donald trump s campaign announced a pittsburgh not paris rally across from the white house on saturday to celebrate the united state withdrawal from a global climate agreementhere s the twist trump is holding it in washington dc not pittsburgh why because he s too scared to actually go to pittsburgh and face the wrath of the people he just screwed overhours after invoking the pittsburgh not paris line the mayor of pittsburgh made it abundantly clear that the city hate trump and found it disgraceful that they used their city s name a a pretext to destroy the planetthe president may carry around a little map of the election result but he clearly doesn t look at it very closely pittsburgh resident almost all voted against him the industrial city is a steadfast democratic stronghold and in fact one of the reason it remains so democratic is that it know full well what happens when republican don t hold factory and company to environmental standardsas mayor bill peduto explained pittsburgh is the example we were that city that china is like today where the smoke wa so filled the air so much that the streetlight would stay on hour that legacy and the willingness not to return to it ha led pittsburgh and many other city to announce that they will adhere to the environmental standard laid out by the paris agreement even if the president is too dimwitted to do so for the countryatlarge mayor peduto made his contempt for trump s action abundantly clear on cnntrump i wa elected to represent pittsburgh not parispittsburgh mayor we voted for hillary clinton with nearly of the vote pictwittercomxtrcebnj the situation room cnnsitroom june mayor peduto s comment and the knowledge that pittsburgh hate trump may have led him to schedule his pittsburgh rally in a park next to the white house there he can prevent people who disagree with him from coming and booing like everything trump doe it wa about image people booing would have been a much more accurate depiction of where the country stand on trump s decision everyone from policy expert to scientist to politician to average american found trump s bankrupting of america s role in fighting climate change to be disgusting and dangerous instead like so many of these campaignstyle rally trump hold the thing will be one long exercise in vanity for the man who once claimed to be working for the people the symbolism of holding his anticlimate rally in the swamp of washington dc is a bit on the nosefeatured image via alex wonggetty image
Title_Text: trump hold pittsburgh not paris rally in dc after being told pittsburgh voted hillary video

Text: dubai reuters  a spokesman for yemen s houthi group on thursday dismissed u accusation that iran had supplied a missile fired at saudi arabia last month saying it wa an attempt to divert attention from the united state decision to recognize jerusalem a israel s capital after three year of war america suddenly find evidence that iran support the houthis abdelmalek alejri said in a message on his twitter account america did not find any evidence in all the missile fired from yemen until now the story is clear they want to give arab a story to divert their attention from jerusalem instead being angry at israel they wave the iranian bogey he added the united state on thursday presented for the first time piece of what it said were iranian weapon supplied to the iranaligned houthis describing it a conclusive evidence that tehran wa violating un resolution iran ha denied supplying the houthis with such weaponry and on thursday described the arm displayed a fabricated president donald trump on dec announced u recognition of jerusalem a israel s capital stirring anger across the arab and muslim world and concern among washington s european ally a well a russia
Title_Text: yemen houthis say iranian missile charge a distraction from jerusalem decision

Text: tunis reuters  the number of foreign tourist in tunisia rose by percent in compared with the previous year official data showed indicating that a vital industry crippled two year ago by islamist attack is recovering tourism account for about percent of tunisia s gross domestic product provides thousand of job and is a key source of foreign currency but ha struggled since two deadly militant attack in a total of million tourist visited the north african country in the year until dec data provided by the presidency showed the number of european tourist rose by percent to million the data showed the number of french visitor rose by percent and the number of german by percent in the same period the number of algerian visiting rose by percent to million tunisia s tourism revenue rose by percent to billion dinar  billion data showed in tunisia s tourism revenue had hit a record at billion dinar with almost million tourist visiting the rise is helping the government weather an economic crisis a it plan to raise tax from part of reform agreed with the international monetary fund in return for a loan package high unemployment ha driven youth to seek illegal migration to europe

Text: john coleman founder the weather channel appeared on cnn s reliable source with host brian stelter after writing an open letter to ucla denying the existence of anthropogenic global warming this is a great takedowncoleman told stelter that cnn ha taken a very strong position on global warming that it is a consensus well there is no consensus in science science isn t a vote science is about fact and that he wa terribly disappointed by his former network the weather channel because it ha bought into climate change but so ha all the medium that s no big surprise coleman note that he is not a paid shill a ha been claimed of the koch brother concluding his letter with a link to heartland s nongovernmental international panel on climate change nipcc website coleman s open letter to ucla wa sent to numerous local television station in the los angeles area a well a the los angeles timescoleman produced a special report for kusitv entitled global warming the other side the program suggests that global warming is a scam and present what colemen contends is evidence of a deliberate manipulation of world temperature data by nasa and other group
Title_Text: baloney cnn anchor slammed by weather channel founder over global warming scam video

Text: st century wire say president trump s executive order protecting the nation from foreign terrorist entry into the u is under fire in the american legal system the american civil liberty union and multiple u state attorney general are filing law suit against the federal government lot of law suitsus district court judge james robart issued a temporary restraining order against enforcement of the trump executive order calling it unlawful unamerican and unconstitutional the white house ha replied by saying that they believe the order is just and within the president constitutional authority and that at the earliest possible time the department of justice will file for a stay of the orderare we about to see a legal battle to dwarf all legal battle do the aclu and the agitated attorney general have any legal foot to stand on a opposing trump s executive orderrt report below with more analysis on this situation rtthe state department since being notified by the justice department of the ruling from the u district court for the western district of washington ha been in contact with the homeland security department and legal team to coordinate operation according to reuterscustoms and border protection official said they would reinstate visa in compliance with the order at the earliest possible time the department of justice intends to file an emergency stay of this order and defend the executive order of the president which we believe is lawful and appropriate the white house said in a statement the president s order is intended to protect the homeland and he ha the constitutional authority and responsibility to protect the american people in response the doj will not file an emergency stay request of the order friday night a spokesperson said reuters reportedlast friday trump issued an executive order that banned citizen from iran iraq libya somalia sudan syria and yemen from entering the u the rollout of the executive order caused mass confusion deportation and protest by saturday the lawsuit had begun with at least active lawsuit in statesat the state level virginia washington minnesota new york and massachusetts have filed case against the federal government the attorney general of state and the district of columbia issued a joint statement earlier this week calling the executive order unconstitutional unamerican and unlawful after week in office president trump face  lawsuit far more than his predecessor faced in that span httpstconxmetwclnj pictwittercomkerfnga npr npr february in california the american civil liberty union aclu filed a lawsuit that seek classaction status which new york and massachusetts have joined there are individual lawsuit in georgia illinois pennsylvania texas and elsewhere nbc news reported the lawsuit claim violation of the first fifth and fourteenth amendment which guarantee religious equality due process and equal protection under the law a well a denial of asylum and discriminatory visa processing we re being sued right now in different court we re going to be sued tomorrow in different court erez reuveni from the justice department s office of immigration litigation told a virginia judge on fridayon friday afternoon a u district court judge in washington state ruled that the combined case put forward by washington and minnesota provided evidence that the executive order ha caused immediate harm judge james robart also said that the lawsuit ha substantial likelihood of success in challenging the constitutionality of the order the seattle time reportedrobart asks doj bennett how many arrest of foreign national there have been from the country since she say she doesnt know sydney brownstone sydbrownstone february the constitution prevailed today washington attorney general bob ferguson said in a statement no one is above the law not even the president on monday ferguson became the first state attorney general to file a lawsuit against trump the department of homeland security dhs and highranking trump administration official on wednesday minnesota joined the suit a a plaintiff in their complaint the state argued that the executive order wa motivated by animus and a desire to harm a particular group and that the discriminatory term and application of the executive order are arbitrary and cannot be justified by federal interest a such the order is unconstitutional and violated the visaholders right they saidrobart s restraining order cover the whole country for at least two week until the preliminary injunction hearing the stranger reported it also stop the government from enforcing the part of the ban that grant exemption to nonmuslim refugee on the basis of their religioneven agowa bob ferguson seemed stunned at breadth of victory holy cow ok he said to colleague following ruling immigrationorder jim brunner jimbrunner february earlier on friday u district court judge leonie m brinkema expanded and extended her order staying the enforcement of the travel restriction in virginia she also allowed the commonwealth to join the lawsuit by tareq and ammar aqel mohammed aziz yemeni brother who are permanent legal resident and who were turned back at dulles international airport on saturday the two men said they were forced to sign form giving up their status a lawful permanent resident against their will and without their knowledge or consent according to court documentsbrinkema noted that although the president ha almost unfettered power when it come to securing u border this is not no limit sha also had harsh word for the executive order which she said wa wa poorly planned and rolled out it s quite clear that not all the thought went into it that should have gone into it she said there ha been chaos without any kind of actual hard evidence that there is a need to revoke visa that had already been grantedvirginia attorney general mark herring praised the ruling outside the alexandria courthouse according to the washington post saying he wa really pleased the judge recognized real harm is happening in virginia brinkema did not hold government official in contempt for reportedly preventing immigrant access to lawyer a violation of her previous order she told the court that she didn t have enough information to make the contempt determination even though virginia had cited news report and affidavit from lawmaker that u custom and border patrol agent had not allowed attorney access to the visa holder there were so many lawyer there willing to help and not a single one got access virginia solicitor general stuart raphael said during the hearingbrinkema also required that by thursday the federal government provide virginia with a list of all people with valid visa who were denied entry or removed from the u who had virginia tie since the order wa signed at least student at state university a well a professor and other employee were affected by the executive order virginia official saidon thursday the aclu filed a lawsuit in a california federal district court accusing the trump administration of violating the religious freedom of those visa holder who were barred from entering the country it proposes classaction status on behalf of national who are living or have lived in the united state and are from the seven country listed in the executive order senior adviser to defendant trump have engaged in antimuslim rhetoric that provides additional support for the notion that the executive order wa prompted by animus toward islam and muslim the suit saidnew york attorney general eric schneiderman and massachusetts attorney general maura healey announced tuesday that they would join lawsuit filed by the aclu chapter in their respective state a i ve made clear president trump s executive action is unconstitutional unlawful and fundamentally unamerican schneiderman said in a statement that is why my office will be filing to join the federal lawsuit against president trump and his administration i m proud to partner with these organization to fight to permanently strike down this dangerous and discriminatory order although the bay state ha joined in the aclu s lawsuit massachusetts state attorney were in court seeking an extension to the sevenday restraining order against trump s travel ban that wa originally granted there on sunday u district judge nathaniel gorton did not issue an extension but is reviewing argument and will rule by sundayhowever robart s nationwide restraining order provides coverage in case gorton s ruling doe not extend the local stayi dont wake up every day looking for a way to sue donald trump but we are day in and ive filed three case already maura healey maurahealey january if an executive order look like a muslim ban act like a muslim ban and ha been talked about a a muslim ban then it s probably a muslim ban friday s complaint readthe initial lawsuit in the commonwealth wa filed sunday on behalf of two state university professor from iran with green card who were detained at boston s logan airport on their way back from an academic conference an amended complaint added six new plaintiff including several noncitizens legally in the u who are afraid they will be unable to return if they leave the country whdh reportedindeed visa for two of the plaintiff a doctoral student at the university of massachusetts with family in iran and a businesswoman who often travel to the u have already been revoked meaning they will not be allowed to return to the country if they leave said joshua press an attorney with the department of justice according to the boston heraldin virginia on friday reuveni said in court that visa had been revoked a a result of the executive order the number sucked the air out of my lung simon sandovalmoshenberg of the legal aid justice center who represents the aziz brother told the washington posthowever the state department later said the number wa actually less than the u government issue about visa a year to people from the seven restricted country some of those visa last longer than one year so the overall number of people from the seven country in the u is much higherreuveni also argued that since sunday greencard holder no longer face any enhanced scrutiny when entering the country however other legal visa holder already in the u have had their visa revoked and so will not be able to return if they leave virginia elliott a spokeswoman for the bureau of consular affair at the state department told the washington poston sunday dhs issued a blanket waiver for lawful permanent resident ditching the casebycase waiver that had been in operation prior on thursday white house counsel don mcgahn issued what he called authoritative guidance that greencard holder were not covered under trump s executive orderwhat the government say is happening and what volunteer at airport are experiencing are not the same thing howeveralthough immigration attorney are legally allowed to give facetoface legal counsel to permanent resident still in the secured area of airport that s not what s happening in practice despite brinkema s previous ruling immigration attorney at dulles international airport in virginia aren t allowed into the secure area to talk to visa holder instead they wait until people exit into the main part of the airportproud to work with the great group of volunteer attorney dullesjustice pictwittercomcetqphfm christine b cdbachy february when people come through the international arrival we line that area and lawyer are trying to get all the information they can from people coming through arrival molly hartshorn a volunteer with dulles justice coalition told rt there s a great wall of attorney asking people how wa custom did you see anything strange did anything get handed out on the airplane that wa strange did they make you sign anything even on tuesday after the ruling lawyer were still only gaining information from arriving passenger who were allowed to enter the u sirine shebaya a volunteer lawyer told vox although returning greencard holder were being allowed in the country after extensive screening firsttime lawful permanent resident were still being turned awaya beautiful crew of folk who fed u and stood with sign to support all those coming in from custom pictwittercomdvyfatxs justin eisele jteisele february custom and border patrol agent refused to talk to shebaya or azadeh erfani who work with the capital area immigrant right coalition according to vox that doesn t mean that the cbp employee agree with the executive order however asylum law requires cbp officer to affirmatively ask if an applicant fear return when placing them into expedited removal an immigration official told the intercept by pressuring them to simply get on a plane without going into formal removal proceeding they are violating our obligation under the refugee convention we are violating international law continue this report at rtread more trump news at st century wire trump filessupport our work by subscribing becoming a member wiretv
Title_Text: trump administration face flood of lawsuit over executive immigration ban

Text: washington reuters  a u house of representative committee said on friday that it ha scheduled a new hearing on kaspersky lab software a lawmaker review accusation that the kremlin could use it product to conduct espionage kaspersky lab ha strongly denied those allegation which last month prompted the trump administration to order civilian government agency to purge the software from it network and agreed to send chief executive eugene kaspersky to washington to testify before congress the house committee on science space and technology announced the oct hearing a day after report that russian governmentbacked hacker stole highly classified u cyber secret in from a national security agency contractor who had kaspersky software installed on his laptop the house science committee did not say who would be called to testify at the hearing eugene kaspersky last month told reuters that the committee had invited him to testify at a sept hearing and that he would attend if he could get an expedited visa to enter the united state that hearing wa later canceled though the committee held a closeddoor classified session on kaspersky software on sept eugene kaspersky said in a statement on friday that he hoped to attend the hearing i look forward to participating in the hearing once its rescheduled and having the opportunity to address the committees concern directly he said an appearance before congress would mark kasperskys most highprofile attempt to dispel longstanding accusation that his firm may be conducting espionage on behalf of the russian government the investigation into the nsa hack is focused on somebody who worked at the agencys tailored access operation unit a unit that us computer hacking to gather intelligence according to two people familiar with the classified probe kaspersky antivirus software wa running on the contractors laptop at the time of the hack and investigator are looking into whether hacker used the software to breach the computer and steal the data said one of those source
Title_Text: u house committee call new hearing on kaspersky software

Text: washington reuters  u republican and democratic senator called on sunday for a special bipartisan panel to investigate cyber attack against the united state by foreign country with a focus on russias alleged effort to influence the u presidential election charles schumer who will be senate democratic leader in the new u congress in january and republican john mccain chairman of the senate armed service committee said separately on sunday a select committee wa needed to ensure effective congressional focus on the hacking of democratic party email during the campaign the fact that theyre hacking our political system and trying to influence the outcome a it seems to be that is serious serious stuff schumer of new york told a news conference in new york he said the panel should also examine hacking by other country including china and iran two other senator republican lindsey graham of south carolina and democrat jack reed of rhode island joined schumer and mccain of arizona in sending a letter to senate republican leader mitch mcconnell requesting the panel by having one dedicated committee on the subject they said the investigation could be targeted while avoiding the jurisdictional overlap that would occur if multiple panel started conducting their own review recent report of russian interference in our election should alarm every american they wrote cybersecurity is the ultimate crossjurisdictional challenge and we must take a comprehensive approach to meet this challenge effectively a spokesman for mcconnells office said on sunday he would review the letter from the four lawmaker last week mcconnell said he would support effort to investigate russian interference in the presidential election u intelligence agency have concluded that russia tried to influence the nov election by hacking individual and institution including democratic party body the matter ha angered republican presidentelect donald trump who say he won the vote fairly russian official have denied accusation of interfering in the u election the u electoral college is expected to officially vote on monday for trump a the countrys next president at meeting scheduled in every state and the district of columbia the institutions elector generally chosen by state party will cast official ballot for president and vice president trump won a majority of electoral college vote while the popular vote went to democrat hillary clinton u president barack obama suggested on friday that russian president vladimir putin personally authorized the democratic party email hack mccain told cnns state of the union program that the u response to the russian attack had been totally paralyzed and said cyber warfare is perhaps the only area where our adversary have an advantage over us the trump transition team did not respond to a request for comment john podesta clintons presidential campaign chairman said on sunday it wa an open question whether trumps adviser colluded with russia to hack into democratic party email to try to sway the election outcome leaked email had revealed detail of paid speech that clinton gave to wall street party infighting and comment from clinton top aide who said they were shocked about the extent of her use of a private server to send email while u secretary of state the leak led to embarrassing medium coverage and prompted some party official to resign podesta said there wa evidence that trump associate had contact with a russian intelligence official and the website wikileaks before u intelligence agency accused russia of being behind computer attack of democratic email including podestas he did not specify what the evidence wa its very much unknown whether there wa collusion i think russian diplomat have said postelection that they were talking to the trump campaign he told nbcs meet the press program not what mr trump knew but what did trump inc know and when did they know it were they in touch with the russian i think those are still open questions he added trumps incoming white house chief of staff reince priebus rejected the notion that trump or his associate were aware of and in touch with the russian during the hack attack even this question is insane priebus told fox news sunday of course we dont interface with the russian
Title_Text: senator call for probe of cyber attack by russia

Text: during the presidential campaign donald trump wa thrilled when great britain voted to leave the european union now that he s on his first world trip a blotus and after calling one of our greatest ally bad very bad he finally fessed up his real beef with the european union and if you haven t guessed it s that it s too hard for him to get richerwhile trump did love one thing about europe the belgian chocolate which he called the best which is high praise coming from the man who claim to know a lot about chocolate at least in cake formour national laughing stock didn t leave it there though he admitted that the real problem he ha with europe ha nothing to do with global economics or even immigration trump s problem with europe is that it take him too long to open golf coursesaccording to one source to the guardian he made a lot of reference to his personal journey he explained for example the functioning of europe on the basis of his difficulty in doing business in ireland one source told the francophone papera second source told the newspaper every time we talk about a country he remembered the thing he had done scotland he said he had opened a club ireland he said it took him two and a half year to get a licence and that did not give him a very good image of the european union one feel that he want a system where everything can be realised very quickly and without formality this in a nutshell perfectly encapsulates most of what is wrong with trump while he s playing the role of world leader in reality his world view is so small that if it s not directly about him he tune out he won t even read his national security briefing unless the author pepper his name frequently throughout even then the briefing have to be short and it s best if they contain pictureseven beyond that trump is a businessman and regardless of the fact that he technically work for u he s still only working to enrich himselffeatured image via franco origiliagetty image
Title_Text: donald trump complains to europe that they make it too hard for him to get richer

witnessed the circus that ensues when a celebrity husband cheat on his celebrity wife with another woman forcing the sister to even the score in an elevator you can watch it hereback to the solange and her racist manifesto where she go to great length to explain the racism she encounter in just about every aspect of her life like the time she got pulled over or the other time she had to show her passport crossing an international border she describes the perpetrator of racism a a product of their white supremacy and are exercising it on you without caution care or thought the main point of Text: washington reuters  president barack obama will meet with the mayor of flint michigan on tuesday to discus the citys problem in dealing with leadcontaminated water the white house said obama who on saturday ordered federal aid for state and local response effort in genesee county which includes flint will meet with mayor karen weaver white house spokesman josh earnest said the situation is anything but being ignored by the white house earnest told a news briefing at the white house
Title_Text: obama to meet michigan mayor to discus contaminated water white house

Text: moscow reuters  russia is extremely concerned by u president donald trump s comment questioning the iran nuclear deal and suspect that washington itself may have violated a landmark arm control treaty foreign minister sergei lavrov said lavrov s comment made to russian reporter at the united nation in new york and published by his ministry on wednesday illustrate how deeply moscow and washington are at odds over an array of issue and suggest any attempt to improve already battered relation face an uphill struggle addressing the united nation general assembly on tuesday trump said iran s pact with six world power to curb it nuclear program in return for loosening economic sanction wa an embarrassment to the united state washington could not abide by an agreement if it provides cover for the eventual construction of a nuclear program trump said lavrov whose country is a signatory to the deal said russia strongly disagreed with that stance it s extremely worrying he said we will defend this document this consensus which wa met with relief by the entire international community and genuinely strengthened both regional and international security trump s threat in the same un appearance to totally destroy north korea if it had to defend itself or it ally also went down badly with russia which share a border with north korea and belief negotiation and diplomacy are the only way to resolve a crisis over pyongyang s missile program if you simply condemn and threaten then we re going to antagonize country over whom we want to exert influence said lavrov referring to trump s comment he saved some of his harshest criticism however for what he said wa a possible violation by the united state of a landmark arm control treaty which ban russian and american intermediaterange missile on land a senior trump administration official accused russia earlier this year of violating the same pact the intermediaterange nuclear force inf treaty something moscow denied but lavrov said it looked like it wa washington which is in the midst of a  trillion year modernization of it aging ballistic missile submarine bomber and landbased missile that wa in breach of the same treaty we have suspicion on at least three front that the american are creating weapon system which violate or could violate the treaty obligation said lavrov who said moscow had relayed it concern to the united state lavrov ha met u secretary of state rex tillerson twice in new york this week
Title_Text: russia rebuke trump over iran north korea accuses u of missile treaty breach

Text: kinshasa reuters  an election to replace congolese president joseph kabila cannot take place before april the electoral commission said a delay that the opposition said would cause an impatient population to take matter into it own hand the schedule outlined by the electoral commission would torpedo an agreement between kabila s camp and his opponent to hold the election  originally scheduled for november  before the end of this year dozen of people were killed last year in protest against kabila s refusal to step down at the end of his term part of democratic republic of congo are in the hand of insurgent who say they will not stop fighting while he remains in power the electoral commission ceni said in a statement following a meeting with civil society representative on tuesday that it would need at least day to organize the poll once voter registration is completed enrolment began in part of kasai a region ravaged by insurrection in midseptember and will take about three month the commission say that mean the vote could not be organized until april at the earliest ceni is expected to announce election date this month what the ceni ha announced is not an electoral calendar but an electionkilling agenda opposition leader claudel lubaya told reuters everything now rest on the shoulder of the population which must take matter into it own hand the opposition suspect kabila is trying to cling to power by postponing election until he can find a way to remove term limit that prevent him from standing for reelection a president in neighboring rwanda and congo republic have done kabila who took power after his father laurent kabila wa assassinated in denies that and say the election delay are due to difficulty enrolling million of voter and mobilizing hundred of million of dollar in financing his spokesman ha repeatedly said that the electoral commission operates independently and that kabila ha no control over the timing of election the head of the un peacekeeping mission in congo maman sidikou said ceni wa badly underfunded international donor have contributed only percent of the  million that the united nation had been expecting he told the un security council congo ha never experienced a peaceful transition of power and kabila s refusal to step down ha fueled mounting insecurity across a country where million died in regional conflict between  most from hunger and disease an insurrection in kasai ha killed up to people and displaced million since august and militia violence ha also spiked in the eastern borderland where dozen of armed group are active
Title_Text: no congo election until mid vote commission say angering opposition

Text: washington reuters  the chairman of the u senate foreign relation committee said on wednesday he did not expect congress to lift the halfcenturylong embargo against cuba this year but it could happen under a new president if there are change in havana president barack obama ha been moving quickly toward more normal relation with havana in the past month but the crippling trade embargo is one of the remaining major obstacle its not going to happen this year but i think its something that could happen a we move into a new presidents administration republican senator bob corker told journalist at a breakfast sponsored by the christian science monitor if cuba were to evolve it behavior and people were able to see result from whats happening with the executive order change that are occurring then i think its possible he said obama and cuban president raul castro announced in december that they would normalize relation after decade of hostility those change have been strongly opposed by many congressional republican who say cuba need to do more to improve human right before trade is eased obama a democrat ha used his executive power to ease restriction on travel and trade his administration just announced that next month obama would become the first u president to visit havana since but the u trade embargo imposed on the communistruled nation in cannot be lifted without congressional approval republican control congress and although several agree with the overwhelming majority of democrat who want the embargo ended the partys congressional leader are strongly opposed corker ha not taken a position but ha noted in the past that the embargo ha not changed cuban policy the politics are more complicated because two cubanamerican senator vying for the republican presidential nomination marco rubio and ted cruz are vocal opponent of obamas policy and party leader are unlikely to come out against them during the campaign corker said thing are already changing although havana still need to change to me it appears that thing are gradually moving along we have air flight that are now going in and it seems to me that this is going to be a year where those thing take hold corker said obviously theres still tremendous human right abuse that are taking place in cuba he said
Title_Text: senator corker congress wont end cuba embargo under obama

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump told several chief executive of large insurance company on monday that will be a catastrophic year for the affordable care act a he seek to make good on a campaign promise to repeal the measure the republican president told the insurer they must all work together to save american from the law known a obamacare and try to bring down health care price he said he hoped to work with democrat on a health care plan to repeal the law which provided coverage for million of uninsured american

Text: the rumor that hillary clinton is sick have been flying around the right a conservative desperately search for any way possible to take her down and elevate the disaster that is donald trump even katrina pierson tried to claim that hillary ha a rare brain disease with no evidence whatsoever these notso lovely people point to video of her coughing and appearing to have a seizure criticize her for getting helped up some stair and even claim that her glass are evidence that she s gravely illrudy giuliani who s increasingly extreme and will do anything to remain endeared to donald trump earned a lot of flak for claiming that hillary clinton is sick too without a any evidence other than online video the washington post decided to hit giuliani back on that with an oped titled is rudy giuliani okay the first three paragraph of the oped are both scathing and sarcastic and perfect for what giuliani ha done during his minute speech at the gop convention last month in cleveland it wa notable that when he said donald trump love all people from the top to the bottom mr giuliani animatedly gestured toward his knee a he said top and above his head a he said bottom also why did he say that he and his wife judith have been friend with mr trump for year though he met his wife in only year agoalso we re noting this purely out of concern during his speech he often licked his lip indicating dry mouth which according to the mayo clinic can be a symptom of nerve damage stroke or alzheimer s disease at the end of his address bead of sweat were visible on his pate did that not suggest heart diseasemr giuliani is just but he seemed slightly stooped a he walked to the lectern where his wide stance made u wonder if he s unsteady on his foot then there wa his slurred diction a when he referred to jushtified police shooting and syrian refyoongees more evidence of a stroke come to think of it giuliani did look a bit decrepit at the convention didn t hesee how he can t seem to stand up straight photo by chip somodevillagetty image and what is up with that squint did he have a a stroke that affected his vision photo by john mooregetty imageswe can make ludicrous claim like giuliani toothe post wanted to give giuliani and the rest of the right wing a taste of what it s like for people who aren t doctor of any sort let alone their doctor tell the world that they re obviously ill the truth however is that we actually have less cause to question hillary s health than the donald s because hillary ha had a real medical exam and released ittrump however ha not the record he released wa a complete sham like literally everything else he s done his doctor is a quack at best and like his tax he won t release his actual health record so how are we to know how healthy he really is despite his quack s assertion that he d be the healthiest president everof course the post acknowledges that their assessment of giuliani s health is ridiculous a they should and a we did above their goal wa to put the entire ermagherd herllery er serck crowd on the right in their place and they did an outstanding job of itso how doe it feel to have someone who is not your doctor or a doctor of any kind diagnosing you with health problem based solely on how you appeared on television mr giulianifeatured image by jeff swensengetty image
Title_Text: searing wapo oped crush rudy giulianis claim that hillary is sick

Text: alabama state rep patricia todd d made wave earlier this week when she dressed her thought up in an extremely articulate oped for alcom that address the current controversy over where people Text: washington reuters  the united state cannot trust russia and must see positive actions by russia before easing u sanction nikki haley u presidentelect donald trumps nominee to be u ambassador to the united nation said on wednesday russia is trying to show their muscle right now it is what they do and i think we always have to be cautious i dont think that we can trust them haley told lawmaker during her senate confirmation hearing i think that russia ha to have positive action before we lift any sanction on russia

Text: football legend herschel walker weighed in on the nfl kneeling controversy giving the player one key piece of advice keep it off the field walker say donald trump is right when it come to standing for the national anthem and that commissioner rodger goodell need to take control of the situationthe viral video above show walker lending his support to trump he happens to be a personal friend who worked for the president and wa on trump s hit show the apprentice he criticized both the player who have decided to kneel and nfl commissioner roger goodell for allowing the protest i think it mean making a leaguewide rule that if you want to protest protest off the job walker said where wa everyone before the season started i didn t see anyone protesting in front of the white house protesting in front of congress or protesting in front of police officer why did we wait until football season to start this again if you re behind it you have to be behind it all the way if you want to protest protest off the job he stated that anthem protest weren t the way to change anything and said everyone need to stand out of respect we can t just point the finger at one person and most of all you can t point it at the president bravovia tmz

Text: new york reuters  a federal spending agreement reached late on sunday will reimburse new york city for money spent securing u president donald trump and his family at trump tower in manhattan altogether new york city and other state and local government that have hosted the president would receive  million in the latest federal budget deal official in floridas palm beach county home to trumps private club maralago have also asked for help in paying security cost we are getting what we are owed mayor bill de blasio said in a statement on monday thats good news for our city and the hardworking police officer faced with this unprecedented security challenge he and police commissioner james oneill worked for several month with new yorks congressional delegation to have the fund included in the deal he said congress is expected to approve the legislation by the end of the week the deal includes  million for cost incurred between election day in november and inauguration day in january a well a  million after trump wa sworn in the funding which must be shared with other local government is on top of the  million allocated last fall the city spends on average  to  a day for the new york police department to protect first lady melania trump and the couples young son when president trump is not in town those cost are expected to swell to a daily average of  when trump is in the city the mayors office said their home atop the story skyscraper on fifth avenue near central park is the site of regular protest and is in an area popular with tourist when outlining his  billion executive city budget for fiscal on wednesday de blasio said the city normally handle occasional visit from president but not ongoing cost to keep the first family secure in trump tower were not budgeting for something thats a federal responsibility he said according to a transcript of his remark it is ridiculous to expect local law enforcement to bear the extraordinary and ongoing cost of protecting the president of the united states congresswoman carolyn maloney who helped lead the states congressional delegation in making the reimbursement request said in a statement on monday
Title_Text: federal spending plan reimburses new york city for trump security

Text: a group of saint louis university baseball player won t be punished after an insanely racist conversation they had amongst themselves became public while it might seem that a group of student in a position to represent the school might face some form of discipline if they were to say call the president a baboon reference multiple awful stereotype about black people and complain that a colored is running the country unfortunately the school is continuing a proud american tradition almost a ancient a the sentiment these student were busted expressing protecting sport team from facing the music for their actionslast may the team traveled to washington dc where the conversation in a pitchersonly groupme chat swiftly went from where do we eat to donald trump s inner thought one player suggested the kfc in the white house you know because all black people eat fried chicken har har another helpfully added that they got river of the grape kind there another reference to a popular africanamerican stereotype among stupid people i heard they got a colored running the country someone else said this tru another player replied unfortunately it is the asker responded fcking watermelon eating baboon and luke sommerfeld needed a macbook chargervia deadspinit s unclear if luke ever found his charger but one thing is for certain the pitcher on the saint louis university baseball team are a bunch of racist fcksone of the player texted a screenshot of the message to his roommate former team manager brendan twomey who held on to it for almost a year until his girlfriend saw it on her phone together the two filed a complaint to the university deadspin give a brief rundown of the event that transpired the report wa filed on april on april twomey and his girlfriend spoke to a university investigatoron april after not having heard anything about the status of the investigation twomey and his girlfriend sent the image to the black student alliance who posted it to their facebook page dr mona hick slu s dean of student said there had been a miscommunication and a meeting to discus the case wa supposed to be held the next daybut according to slu s biasrelated incident report log the investigation had been closed on april and labeled not applicable for discipline when i received that screenshot obviously i knew it wa wrong but i wa in a tough situation
