Text: washington reuters  a u senate panel probing alleged russian interference in the election abruptly canceled an interview with president donald trumps lawyer michael cohen on tuesday after he issued a statement about his testimony in violation of committee policy the committee expects witness in this investigation to work in good faith with the senate senate intelligence committee chairman richard burr and vice chairman mark warner said in a statement after canceling the closeddoor session cohen wa later asked to appear at an open hearing on oct burr a republican and warner a democrat said it wa against the committees policy for witness to make public comment before being interviewed the intelligence panel other congressional committee and special counsel robert mueller are investigating whether russia intervened to tilt the election in trumps favor and whether trump or top aide colluded with moscow the russian government denies any attempt to influence the election and the republican president ha repeatedly denied any collusion calling the investigation a witch hunt the allegation have shadowed the first month of trumps presidency two people familiar with the matter told reuters that trump wa using money donated to his reelection campaign and the republican national committee to pay for his lawyer in the probe while previous presidential campaign have used those fund to pay routine legal fee trump would be the first u president in the modern campaign finance era to use them to cover the cost of responding to a criminal probe election law expert said in his statement cohen denied that he or trump colluded with russia to interfere in the election and said such charge were made to discredit trumps presidency i emphatically state that i had nothing to do with any russian involvement in our electoral process cohens statement said given my own proximity to the president of the united state a a candidate let me also say that i never saw anything  not a hint of anything  that demonstrated his involvement in russian interference in our election or any form of russia collusion cohen said cohen and his attorney stephen ryan had traveled to capitol hill for the closeddoor interview with committee investigator but were told the meeting had been postponed we didnt want to send a message except for what we do is behind closed doors burr later told reporter at the capitol the committee had changed it policy since trumps soninlaw and close adviser jared kushner issued an page statement before meeting with intelligence committee staff in july he said asked if the committee would subpoena cohen burr said he did not think it would need to cohens name surfaced in a dossier compiled by former british intelligence officer christopher steele that reported cohen played an important role in liaison with the russian government and secretly met with kremlin official in prague in august the steele dossier cohen said in his statement wa riddled with falsehood and intentionally salacious allegations i have never in my life been to prague or to anywhere in the czech republic he said current and former u intelligence official have said that while they cannot verify all the detail in the steele dossier neither have they debunked it entirely former utah governor jon huntsman trumps nominee to be ambassador to russia said at his senate confirmation hearing on tuesday there is no question underline no question that the russian government interfered in the u election last year he pledged to bring up the issue with the government there huntsman previously served a u ambassador to china under democratic president barack obama
Title_Text: senate panel cancel interview with trump lawyer asks him to open hearing

Title_Text: return of defeated is fighter real threat to russia ria cite fsb chief

Text: geneva reuters  the un high commissioner for human right launched a thinly veiled attack on u republican presidential frontrunner donald trump and other presidential hopeful on friday in a speech entitled the road to violence bigotry is not proof of strong leadership it is evidence of the lowest and most craven lack of faith in the principle that uphold a land of the free zeid raad al hussein said in a speech at a university in cleveland ohio less than mile away from where i speak a frontrunning candidate to be president of this country declared just a few month ago his enthusiastic support for torture inflicting intolerable pain on people in order to force them to deliver or invent information that they may not have we have heard hateful slander of foreigner and multiple candidate declaring their support for extensive and intrusive surveillance of people based on their religious belief  vast and discriminatory system to single out and discriminate against muslims zeids speech the klatsky lecture at case western reserve university also recalled the nazi holocaust and the genocide of bosnian muslim for which former bosnian serb leader radovan karadzic wa jailed last month he said the eye of the world would be on cleveland when it host the republican national convention in july and it wa his deepest hope that american would use it to demonstrate their profound understanding of human dignity and human right and yet in what may be a crucial election for leadership of this country later this year we have seen a fullfrontal attack  disguised a courageous taboobusting  on some fundamental hardwon tenet of decency and social cohesion that have come to be accepted by american society he said the price for the dangerously divisive rhetoric would be paid by innocent people falling victim to violent act not by politician we have heard these call to hatred  call stigmatizing and demonizing minority beginning the validation of violence he said real courage would mean standing up for the great and enduring value of this society
Title_Text: un right chief decries bigotry in u presidential race

Text: this past week saw one of the most colorful debate regarding the cnn and u mainstream medium meltdown over the russiagate conspiracycrosstalk say trust in the mainstream medium is at an alltime low but no one should be surprised and the medium ha itself to blame this sad state of affair is a selfinflicted wound and actually a conscious business model the medium no longer ha an interest in reporting news medium today propagates ideology host peter lavele is crosstalking with guest eric alterman senior fellow at center for american progress patrick henningsen st century wire and lionel lionel medium watch read more cnn fake news at st century wire cnn filessupport wire subscribe become a member wiretv

Text: reuters  well fargo co customer aiming to sue the bank over bogus account opened in their name may be in for an unpleasant surprise the fine print requires them to take their claim to an arbitrator instead of a court mandatory arbitration rule inserted into accountopening agreement prohibit customer from joining class action or suing the thirdlargest u bank in court instead the agreement require individual closeddoor arbitration u senator highlighted the issue on tuesday a they grilled well fargo chief executive officer john stumpf during a hearing asked if he would set aside the mandatory arbitration agreement for customer affected by the phantom account stumpf demurred im not an expert in that he said adding he would talk to his legal team that wa not enough for some lawmaker if we had class action on this in the problem never would have gotten so out of hand senator elizabeth warren a democrat from massachusetts said later when questioning regulator about the practice class action can be more affordable for unhappy customer especially those with limited resource because they can band together to sue rather than having to hire lawyer individually consumer also complain that target company often choose the arbitrator proceeding are confidential and decision are hard to appeal three well fargo customer filed a lawsuit friday in a utah federal court seeking class action status on behalf of hundred of thousand of customer nationwide they say were harmed by the san franciscobased banks fraud and recklessness it wa unclear whether they could get around the mandatory arbitration clause though last year well successfully invoked the clause to defend against a class action suit tied to bogus account in that case the judge said customer had to arbitrate because of agreement they signed when opening legitimate account at the bank the consumer financial protection bureau a brainchild of warren wa part of the regulatory group that negotiated a  million settlement from well fargo over the bogus account the bureau is considering rule to ban bank credit card issuer and other company from forcing customer to submit to arbitration and waive their right to join class action lawsuit under the proposal company could still use arbitration but would have to tell consumer they could join class action lawsuit instead mandating arbitration when signing up for financial product ha become standard practice after a u supreme court decision validated the practice still the tide may be turning said joseph peiffer a new orleans lawyer who ha represented investor and others in class action lawsuit class action dissuade company from ripping people off a thousand dollar here and a thousand dollar there peiffer said
Title_Text: u lawmaker probing well fargo scandal blast arbitration pact

Text: washington reuters  republican u lawmaker expect to unveil this week the text of longawaited legislation to repeal and replace the obamacare healthcare law one of president donald trumps top legislative priority a senior republican congressional aide said on sunday since taking office in january trump ha pressed his fellow republican who control congress to act quickly to dismantle former democratic president barack obamas affordable care act and pas a plan to replace it but lawmaker in the party have differed on the specific democrat have warned that republican risk throwing the entire u healthcare system into chaos by repealing the law that wa passed by congressional democrat over united republican opposition republican condemn it a a government overreach and trump ha called it a disaster the aide cited progress in meeting and phone call starting on friday and lasting through the weekend involving house of representative speaker paul ryan health and human service secretary tom price white house budget chief mick mulvaney trump domestic policy adviser andrew bremberg and others we are in a very good place right now and while drafting continues we anticipate the release of final bill text early this week said the aide speaking on condition of anonymity the aide called the expected bill a consensus republican plan but offered no detail ashlee strong a spokeswoman for ryan said we are now at the culmination of a yearslong process to keep our promise to the american people the obamacare law ha proven popular in many state even some controlled by republican and it enabled about million previously uninsured people to get medical insurance although premium increase angered some
Title_Text: u republican expected to unveil healthcare bill this week

Text: judge napolitano just took the fun out of the democrat s party tomorrow they have nothing it s what we ve known but it s great to hear from napolitano who is a fair guy it doesn t appear a though these conversation that the president had with director comey could constitute the level of constitutional obstruction of justice necessary to commence any further proceeding like impeachment like democrat want to do judge napoltanoearlier today intel director spoke up on the fact that trump did nothing the senate intel committee is holding an open hearing on the foreign intelligence surveillance act today and the intel director are saying there is nothing to the claim that trump asked anyone to shut down an investigation nsa director adm mike rogers say he s never been directed to do anything he deems illegal immoral or inappropriate nsa director adm mike rogers say he s never been directed to do anything he deems illegal immoral or inappropriate pictwittercomhiuldogm fox news foxnews june he dropped the line that should shut down the trump witch hunt for good but you know it won t the press is already spinning this one senator marco rubio even doubled down and asked a similar question video belowrubio ha anyone asked you to issue a statement you knew to be falsensa dir i standby my statement natl intel dir i do likewiserubio ha anyone asked you to issue a statement you knew to be false nsa dir i standby my statement natl intel dir i do likewise pictwittercomqbnyhu fox news foxnews june we have never not once found an intentional violation of this program natl intel director coat about compliance track record we have never not once found an intentional violation of this program natl intel director coat about compliance track record pictwittercomsthyqha fox news foxnews june it s not like mike rogers is untrustworthy the guy ha an incredible resume on wikimichael s rogers born october is a united state navy admiral who serf a director of the national security agency nsa commander of the u cyber command uscybercom and chief of the central security service cs since april prior to that rogers served a the commander of the tenth fleet and commander of the u fleet cyber commandrogers is a native of chicago illinois he graduated from new trier high school in he is a graduate of auburn university and the naval war collegerogers received his commission through the naval reserve officer training corp nrotc program and ha served in the united state navy since graduating from auburn university in he started his career a a surface warfare officer working in naval gunfire support operation off grenada beirut and maritime surveillance operation off el salvador in he wa selected for transfer from unrestricted line officer to restricted line officer and redesignation a a cryptology officerduring the u invasion of iraq rogers joined the military s joint staff which work for the joint chief of staff where he specialized in computer network attack from onward he served a director of intelligence for the military s pacific command in he became director of intelligence for the joint chief of staff and wa subsequently named commander of u fleet cyber command and commander of the u th fleet with responsibility for all of the navy s cyberwarfare effort a such rogers wa the first restricted line officer to serve a a numbered fleet commander and the first information warfare community iwc officer to achieve the rank of vice admiralin january the obama administration announced rogers nomination a director of the national security agency and the commander of the u offensive cyberoperations unit in the department of defense rogers succeeded general keith b alexander who served a the nsa director for nine year and became the first iwc officer to achieve the rank of admiral although the nsa directorship doe not require senate approval rogers had to be confirmed by the senate to head united state cyber command for which the senate unanimously confirmed himin his first public remark a nsa director rogers stated that he believed that nsa whistleblower edward snowden wa probably not working for a foreign intelligence agency despite frequent speculation and assertion by the nsa s ally to the contrary rogers added he clearly belief in what he s doing i question that i don t agree with it i fundamentally disagree with what he did i believe it wa wrong i believe it wa illegal the washington post reported on november that defense secretary ashton b carter and director of national intelligence dni james r clapper jr had recommended to president obama that rogers be terminated a director of the national security agency carter reportedly recommended he be terminated due to poor performance whereas clapper considered it wise that the position be held by a civilian both clapper and carter had put rogers on notice for poor performance in internal security and for a poor leadership style his termination wa reportedly delayed due to stalled change to the bureaucratic structure of the intelligence community later rogers reportedly met with then presidentelect donald trump without notifying his supervisor in what is an unprecedented action for a military officer trump wa reportedly considering replacing clapper with rogers a dni however that position went to former senator dan coat with rogers remaining nsa director
Title_Text: judge napolitano james comeys pretestimony reveals trump did nothing illegal video

Text: when will american stop being afraid of standing up to leftist agitator and tell them no when will american find a backbone and stop allowing the left to dictate what they re allowed to say or somehow make u better peopleoddly sport channel have decided to assume the role of america s social conscience sport used to be a unifying force for american a place for perfect stranger to come together and bond over their love and support for a particular team the disney owned espn sport network ha been working very hard to change thatfear and intimidation are two of the tool the left us in order to make people comply with their message of unity through division and according to one tv and radio sport host these tactic are beginning to take hold in the nflfox sport host jason whitlock joined tucker carlson monday evening on fox news tucker carlson tonight to talk about the state of protesting during the national anthem in the nflwhitlock understands that protesting is perfectly within player right a american but he take issue with the method in which people like unemployed quarterback colin kaepernick go about protesting there are nfl player black and white who know that if you really want to address police brutality social justice inequality in this country protesting the national anthem is the perfect way for your message to get completely lost whitlock told carlsonnfl player have so many platform on which to voice their approval or displeasure on whatever issue they re championing this week but to use the national anthem a the vehicle for their message only cause their message fall flat in the eye of a lot of football fan these silent protest don t make them look heroic but rather selfishwhitlock also posed an interesting theory to carlson concerning player who aren t participating in these social justice protest i want to know why nfl player aren t offering voice of dissent whitlock asked you can t tell me that there aren t nfl player who recognize the stupidity of the style of protest colin kaepernick ha chosen whitlock said but they re all afraid to say it because of the backlash another good pointwe have seen sport entity like the nfl and espn become bastion of social justice promotion in an age where people are being divided into more group than the divergent series mrctv
Title_Text: watch black sport host blast white espn sport host for asking white athlete to take a knee during national anthem

Text: washington reuters  a u senate investigation into russias meddling during the u election should include a thorough review of any financial tie between russia and president donald trump and his associate democratic senator ron wyden said wednesday in a formal written request made to the leader of the u senate intelligence committee wyden said financial relationship between trump a real estate developer with property around the world and russia are deserving of scrutiny because of resistance by trump and some in his orbit have not been forthcoming about their finance efforts to understand these relationship and to separate fact from speculation have been hampered by the opacity of the finance of president trump and his associates wyden who also sits on the intelligence panel wrote to republican richard burr and democrat mark warner the letter though devoid of new detail is the latest piece of evidence suggesting trumps business dealing are attracting expanded interest from investigator amid a raft of new report scrutinizing potential financial entanglement between the president and russia trump ha declined to release his tax return bucking decade of precedent for president and presidential candidate the letter followed new disclosure in recent week of previously unknown meeting and financial arrangement between trumps associate and wealthy russian and came a democrat attempt to focus public attention on question about trumps connection to russia on monday the state development bank vnesheconombank disclosed that it executive had met jared kushner trumps soninlaw and a top white house adviser in december and last week paul manafort trumps former campaign chairman admitted he had done business work for russian billionaire oleg deripaska trump ha repeatedly insisted allegation that he or member of his administration have an untoward relationship with russia a fake news he ha also said that he ha no business deal in russia a reuters investigation published earlier this month found that dozen of member of the russian elite have bought at least  million worth of property in seven trumpbranded luxury tower in southern florida according to public document interview and corporate record wyden ha repeatedly tried to push into public light more information about u investigation into russias role in the election he organized a twosentence letter from seven senator to the white house last november asking the outgoing obama administration to declassify additional information about russias interference in the election thenpresident barack obama announced a review of russias activity soon after u intelligence agency later released a review of it assessment of russias multipronged influence campaign concluding moscows action were intended to help trump win and discredit his opponent democrat hillary clinton russia ha denied the allegation wyden in january also asked federal bureau of investigation director james comey if his agency wa investigating link between russia and associate of trump comey declined to answer but last week confirmed the fbi wa probing possible tie examining finance ha long been within the purview of the oversight role of the intelligence panel wyden wrote citing a recent committee report said that financial intelligence ha emerged a a significant area of intelligence community activity aiming to follow the money of adversaries
Title_Text: russia probe should focus on trump financial tie senator

Text: donald trump s russia problem just won t go away in fact the investigation is steadily expanding and with the revelation that trump himself is now personally under criminal investigation trump s number two man mike penny ha hired his own lawyer there are also report that one of trump s own lawyer michael cohen ha lawyered up a well of course there wa also the revelation that trump s own soninlaw and top adviser jared kushner is also under federal investigation by special counsel robert mueller for potential financial crime now it seems that trump is more nervous than ever and seems to believe that his own longtime civil litigation lawyer marc kasowitcz is no longer enough trump ha now retained john dowd a highprofile attorney who ha represented the like of senator john mccain razthis addition is a major development dowd is experienced with keeping corrupt politician out of jail he is year old and the ultimate washington insider this mean that trump s legal trouble are mounting and the white house know it dowd join an already beefy team in addition to dowd and kasowitz trump ha also retained mark bowe and jay sekulownow this is a risky move for someone a distinguished a john dowd trump s intemperate twitter rant and revealing public statement would make him an almost impossible to manage client his own incriminating statement along with his penchant for refusing to pay his bill have already made many highpowered washington law firm to turn down the opportunity to represent the man baby president granted the guy is getting up in age and already ha a long career behind him perhaps he is not afraid of taking what is sure to be a losing case due to trump s own foolish word and actionseither way this russia investigation is no longer just smoke there s fire there a well and the people around trump and in the white house know it it would be a prudent decision for every single person working in the west wing to lawyer up stat unless they want to spend the rest of their miserable life in federal prison which is likely where many if not all of them belongfeatured image via olivier doulierypoolgetty image
Title_Text: trump run scared from russia investigation hire another high profile lawyer

Text: washington reuters  supreme court justice on monday signaled they are likely to leave in place a lowercourts ruling that virginias republicanled legislature unlawfully considered race when drawing u congressional district by packing black voter into one of them the court heard oral argument in the case at a time when democrat are accusing republican in various state of taking action to reduce the influence of black hispanic and other voter who often favor democrat the focus of the case is on the composition of the majorityblack u house of representative district held by democrat bobby scott the only black member of virginias congressional delegation the eight justice down one following the feb death of conservative antonin scalia heard an appeal by current and former republican house member challenging the june lower court ruling that threw out the district following that ruling some black voter from scotts district were moved to an adjoining district which is currently represented by white republican randy forbes one of the challenger in the case this is likely to make the district a possible democratic pickup in the nov election without scalia the court could split  with it four liberal on one side and four conservative on the other which would leave intact the lowercourt decision none of the courts liberal indicated they are likely to back the republican challenger the court may not even decide the merit of the case the justice could instead rule that house member from adjoining district do not have legal standing to challenge new boundary line that imperil their reelection prospect some of the justice signaled hostility to the idea that elected house member should receive legal protection when their ability to win reelection is put in doubt this is now an incumbencyprotection standing rule liberal sonia sotomayor said of the challengers legal argument liberal elena kagan said even if lawmaker suffered an injury the question remains whether they have a legally recognized interest in their reelection prospect several voter in scotts district challenged the redistricting plan approved by the republicanled legislature in saying it minimized minority voting power in violation of the federal voting right act and the u constitutions guarantee of equal protection under the law the voter who brought the case in argued that the district that scott represents stretching from richmond to norfolk wa racially gerrymandered cramming black voter into it and reducing black influence in neighboring district a ruling is due by the end of june the case is wittman v personhuballah u supreme court no
Title_Text: justice hostile to virginia republican in black voter case

Text: the center for immigration study is amazing at getting to the fact in the immigration battle they bring to the table a huge set of figure that should shock every american into action on the state and federal level the bottom line is that you are paying way too much for legal and illegal immigrant to come to america and live off of your tax dollar we cannot and should not go on like this please read up and sharea new study on the use of welfare benefit by illegal and legal immigrant in the u find that household headed by immigrant use an average of  in benefit annually fully percent higher than the rate used by native born welfare recipientsthis study come on the heel of another study finding that percent of immigrant household are signed up for at least one welfare program immigrant are such heavy user of welfare not because they don t work but because on average they have little education and thus earn low wage said mark krikorian executive director of the center for immigration study ci if we continue to permit large number of lesseducated people to move here from abroad we have to accept that there will be huge and ongoing cost to taxpayer the study based on the census bureau s survey of income and program participation sipp note that the higher use of welfare benefit because by and large the current wave of immigrant are less educated and have fewer needed job skill and are therefore more apt to apply for welfare benefitsthe study found the average immigrant household receives percent more cash welfare percent more food assistance and percent more medicaid dollar than the average nativeborn applicant additionally the highest amount of welfare is taken by immigrant from central america and mexico at  per household a rate percent higher than native citizen the greater consumption of welfare dollar by immigrant can be explained in large part by their lower level of education and larger number of child compared to native ci said in a press release over percent of immigrant household are headed by a high school dropout compared to just percent of native household in addition percent of immigrant household have three or more child v just percent of native household while it is important for american to understand the rate of welfare use among immigrant expressing that use in dollar term offer a more tangible metric that is tied to current debate over fiscal policy with the nation facing a longterm budgetary deficit this study help illuminate immigration s impact on the problem said the report s author jason richwine richwine also noted that even a illegal immigrant are supposed to be barred from receiving welfare they receive it anyway by applying for benefit for their americanborn child often called anchor baby via breitbart
Title_Text: study reveals massive spending shocking welfare use by immigrant cannot go on

Text: paris reuters  france said on wednesday it wa surprised by new u travel restriction on citizen from chad which paris said wa an ally in the fight against terrorist group and urged the united state to quickly reverse it decision u president donald trump on sunday imposed a new ban on citizen from north korea venezuela and chad expanding to eight the list of country covered by his original travel ban that have been derided by critic and challenged in court we learnt with surprise of the united state decision to expand it entry ban on chadian citizen french foreign ministry spokeswoman agnes romatetespagne said chad is a decisive partner in the fight against terrorism it ha mobilized from the start and paid a heavy price in this battle france considers it former colony a it main ally in the fight against islamist militant in west africa and the headquarters of it strong counterterrorism operation barkhane force is in the chadian capital n djamena the united state also ha a base in the city france hope that with this in mind the united state and chadwill find a quick solution that will enable this ban to be lifted romatetespagne said
Title_Text: france criticizes u travel ban on chadian ally urge reversal
