Text: washingtonkhobar saudi arabia reuters  u president donald trump publicly appealed on saturday for saudi arabia to list national oil company saudi aramcos share in new york intervening in a battle among the worlds top stock exchange would very much appreciate saudi arabia doing their ipo of aramco with the new york stock exchange trump wrote on twitter important to the united states trump did not say why he raised the issue at this time or whether he wa responding to any information about the nyses bid but by describing the listing a a priority for washington he could help sway the saudis decision the saudi government seeking to raise money a low oil price strain it finance plan to sell about percent of aramco next year in a sale official say could raise about  billion making it the worlds largest initial public offer ever saudi authority have said they intend to list aramco in riyadh and on one or more foreign exchange setting off a competition among new york london hong kong tokyo and other bourse an aramco spokesman had no comment on trumps tweet while a spokeswoman for the nyse declined to comment nyse group president thomas farley said at a conference in riyadh last week that he had not given up on the ipo and wa in talk with saudi authority the london stock exchange ha also received some government support for it bid although that ha been less public prime minister theresa may and the chief of the lse pitched investment in britain to the head of saudi arabias sovereign wealth fund on a visit to riyadh earlier this year while trumps tweet named the new york stock exchange it did not mention rival nasdaq inc which is also vying for the aramco listing generally public servant should be impartial not give preferential treatment to anyone and avoid endorsements said scott amey general counsel for the government ethic watchdog project on government oversight in washington we have already seen violation in this administration and it doesnt help that the president isnt leading by example nasdaq replied to trump in a tweet saying it agreed the united state wa the best destination for global companies but that aramco belongs on nasdaq with the most valuable operating company in the world nearly two year after announcing their plan to sell aramco share saudi official say they have not yet decided on foreign listing venue source told reuters in august that riyadh favored new york for aramcos main foreign listing but some financial and legal adviser have recommended london a a less problematic and risky option aramcos lawyer warned about litigation risk associated with the u justice against sponsor of terrorism act or jasta passed last year the law allows the saudi government to be sued on the ground that it helped to plan the sept attack on the united state an allegation which riyadh denies mohammed alsabban who ha been an adviser to former saudi oil minister ali alnaimi told reuters that trumps intervention would not resolve the jasta problem president trump ha forgotten completely that the risk of implementing the jasta law against saudi asset are still there sabban said probably during his administration he could prevent any case against saudi arabia however when president trumps term end this will raise fear that the jasta law could still be applied still trump may be able to wield diplomatic clout in riyadh saudi leader welcomed him warmly during a visit to the kingdom in may partly because he ha taken a tough stance against their nations diplomatic archrival iran and riyadh is eager for close military tie with washington president trumps tweet indicates that from the white houses perspective at least a public listing of aramco is not a dead a some recent report indicated said bob mcnally president of washingtonbased energy market and policy consultant rapidan energy group the tweet suggests the white house belief saudi arabia may be approaching a decision on where to list and wish to either claim credit or push a possibly wavering saudi arabia for a new york listing mcnally added exchange hosting aramco can look forward to a boost in fee income from trading the stock the prestige associated with the company may help them attract more big listing including ipo of other state company from the gulf a government there sell asset in an era of cheap oil
Title_Text: trump back new york in bourse battle for saudi aramco listing

Text: havana reuters  cuba and the united state aim to reach new agreement on cooperation in law enforcement health and agriculture over the coming month a senior cuban official said on monday a part of the former cold war foes drive to normalize tie the communistruled island and it northern neighbor reestablished diplomatic relation a year ago after decade of hostility and have since signed deal on the environment postal service and direct flight a bilateral commission met on monday in havana to establish a roadmap for talk over the rest of this year which would include more highranking official visit said josefina vidal head of the cuban delegation in march barack obama became the first sitting u president in year to visit cuba the agenda is quite ambitious vidal told a news conference adding that talk about intellectual property right were also in the card the two side had discussed holding dialogue on human right and claim the u embassy in cuba said in a statement they already outlined their respective claim late last year with the u seeking upwards of  billion in compensation for nationalized property and cuba demanding at least  billion in reparation for the u trade embargo and other act it described a aggression the united state look forward to holding these meeting in the near future the embassy said tomorrow we will discus specific step related to bilateral security during the law enforcement dialogue vidal who is the cuban foreign ministrys chief of u affair said the island wa hopeful that whomever became next the u president would continue to deepen the detente the united state will hold a general election on nov when you look at the poll the majority of the american population and the cuban american community are in favor of the normalization of relations she said so i expect their opinion will be taken into account
Title_Text: cuba and united state draw up roadmap for talk to deepen detente

Text: ammon bundy and his armed ganged of militant have upset an entire nation over the last couple of week for their supposed special treatment by the police while that did appear to be the case for the longest time the raid wa partially broken up by authority after a shootout with one of bundy s pal lavoy finicum now a federal court is refusing to give people that same impression and they re sending the message loud and clear there will be no special treatment after law have been broken no matter who you think you areon friday u district court judge stacie beckerman told ammon bundy and his brother that they would remain in jail and not be let out on bail pending their trial on federal conspiracy chargesif anyone know anything about the court system it s not a quick process that mean ammon bundy is going to be in jail for a long time that should give him quite a long time to think about what he s done and it should also discourage other socalled armed militant calling themselves federalist out to protect people right from thinking they can get away with breaking the law toopic via twitterthe reason for the denial should come a no surprise though there are still four militant occupying the malheur national wildlife refuge if the judge released bundy or any of the other perpetrator already arrested they could simply return to the building and that s exactly what prosecutor communicated to the court before bail wa denied they also hilariously used the bundys own word against them this creates an inherent risk of flight moreover their own statement demonstrate his unwillingness to comply with the term of pretrial supervisionon august bundy posted on facebook that there is no justice in a federal court the fed have used the court to take right not protect them breakingnews read u attorney s reason for wanting ammon bundy kept in jail koinnews oregonstandoff pictwittercomynczehj dan tilkin dantilkinkoin january we have a strange feeling bundy didn t like the judge s decision that s just a good guessmeanwhile the rest of the gang is refusing to standdown unless they re promised no charge will be made by the fbi take a look at the latest video posted below these guy really do think they re special whenever their supply and snack run out expect them to meet the same fate a bundyfeatured image via screen capture
Title_Text: ammon bundy just got sweet justice handed to him by a federal judge video

Text: yangon reuters  two reuters journalist detained in myanmar will be allowed to meet their family once their first day period of remand expires according to local medium report reporter wa lone and kyaw soe oo have been in detention for day in an undisclosed location and have had no access to their family lawyer or colleague they were arrested after being invited to meet police official over dinner on the outskirt of myanmar s largest city yangon on dec the authority are investigating whether they violated the country s colonialera official secret act which ha a maximum prison sentence of year after the first remand expires they will be able to meet their family they will be sent to the court for testimony tin myint permanent secretary of ministry of home affair wa quoted a saying by radio free asia in myanmar those remanded must be brought to court within day but it s not immediately clear when the pair wa first remanded and whether the authority will seek court approval to remand them for a second day period the home affair ministry did not responded to several request for comment family member of the two journalist say they have not received any official communication about the question of remand or the investigation and neither ha reuters tin myint said the case against the two reuters reporter will be transparent and the authority will follow the rule of law according to daily eleven newspaper major government including the united state britain and canada leading international political figure and top united nation official are among those who have demanded the release of the reuters reporter the two journalist had worked on reuters coverage of a crisis in the western state of rakhine where an estimated rohingya muslim have fled from a fierce military crackdown on militant a spokesman for myanmar leader aung san suu kyi this week told reuters that the police had almost completed their investigation and the two reporter will be treated in line with the law the ministry of information said last week that wa lone and kyaw soe oo had illegally acquired information with the intention to share it with foreign medium
Title_Text: myanmar to grant family access to two reuters journalist after remand period expires medium

Text: berlin reuters  president barack obama said on thursday he would support any move by presidentelect donald trump to improve healthcare for amercicans trump say that he can improve the health system i believe that if he is able to insure the same number of people  better than i am  i would support this obama told german television station ard according to a translation into german during the u presidential campaign trump called for the affordable care act also known a obamacare to be repealed and replaced and labeled the law a disaster he ha since said he is considering retaining part of obamas healthcare law
Title_Text: obama say would support trump move to improve u healthcare

Text: washington reuters  u democratic senator patty murray said tuesday she thought a bipartisan deal to repair obamacare wa still possible despite the announcement by her negotiating partner republican senator lamar alexander that they had failed to reach an agreement murray in a statement said she had made some tough concessions in the talk when it came to giving state more flexibility under obamacare she wa disappointed that republican leader had decided to freeze the bipartisan approach but i am confident that we can reach a deal if we keep working together  and i am committed to getting that done alexander and murray had been working to protect the government payment made to insurer to help reduce medical expense for lowincome american enrolled in obamacare alexander also wanted state to have more flexibility to design insurance plan under the program
Title_Text: democratic senator murray think bipartisan obamacare deal still possible

Text: buenos aire reuters  an argentine submarine with crew on board wa missing in the south atlantic two day after it last communication prompting the navy to step up it search effort late on friday in difficult stormy condition the ara san juan wa in the southern argentine sea km mile from the patagonian coast when it sent it last signal on wednesday naval spokesman enrique balbi said the emergency operation wa formally upgraded to a searchandrescue procedure on friday evening after no visual or radar contact wa made with the submarine balbi said detection ha been difficult despite the quantity of boat and aircraft involved in the search balbi said noting that heavy wind and high wave were complicating effort obviously the number of hour that have passed  two day in which there ha been no communication  is of note the navy belief the submarine which left ushuaia en route to the coastal city of mar del plata in buenos aire province had communication difficulty that may have been caused by an electrical outage balbi said navy protocol would call for the submarine to come to the surface once communication wa lost we expect that it is on the surface balbi said the germanbuilt submarine which us dieselelectric propulsion wa inaugurated in making it the newest of the three submarine in the navy s fleet according to the navy president mauricio macri said the government wa in contact with the crew s family we share their concern and that of all argentine he wrote on twitter we are committed to using all national and international resource necessary to find the ara san juan submarine a soon a possible argentina accepted an offer from the united state for a nasa p explorer aircraft which had been stationed in the southern city of ushuaia and wa preparing to depart to antarctica to fly over the search area balbi said a hercules c from the argentine air force wa also flying over the operational area brazil uruguay chile peru britain and south africa had also formally offered assistance
Title_Text: argentina intensifies search for missing submarine with crew

Text: the hague reuters  dutch judge jailed a onetime aide to ethiopia s former communist ruler mengistu haile mariam for life on friday for war crime carried out during ethiopia s red terror purge of the s including the execution of prisoner eshetu alemu wa found guilty at his trial in the hague of ordering the killing of camp detainee  many of them under year of age  who were taken from their cell and strangled with rope in a church in the hearing held under dutch universal jurisdiction alemu a former mengistu regional representative wa convicted of all charge brought by prosecutor including arbitrary detention inhumane treatment torture and mass murder the fact that the majority of victim were child younger than make the crime all the more cruel said presiding judge mariette renckens alemu came to the netherlands a an asylum seeker in and had been in custody since he ha pleaded not guilty to the charge but wa not present when the verdict wa read out negus gebeyehu a prisoner in a camp under alemu s control gave an emotional speech in the hague court following the verdict a other victim cheered justice ha been done for ethiopia he said i wa imprisoned a a young man and i survived this is also the day for u to forgive an ethiopian court had sentenced alemu to death in absentia in for his role in the red terror which mengistu s communist military junta conducted after ethiopian emperor haile selassie wa ousted in mengistu wa found guilty in absentia of genocide in the same trial in where he and top member of his military government were accused of killing thousand during his year rule today s verdict show perpetrator that the netherlands will not be a safe haven jirko patist of the national prosecutor s office said the netherlands is one of the european country that ha established an international crime prosecution unit to prosecute alleged war criminal residing in the netherlands even if their crime were committed abroad
Title_Text: ethiopian exofficial get dutch life sentence for war crime

Text: president barack obama appeared today at the bill melinda gate foundation s goalkeeper event an event aimed at effecting change on a global scale in the area of world hunger education access and quality clean energy healthcare gender equality clean water climate action and a host of other goal the foundation want to help u work towardmany speaker were on hand for the event including president obama canadian prime minister justin trudeau william malala stephen fry and more all with story of empowerment and positive change and possibility but in america s current climate of fear and unease about what will happen with health care in this country it wa president obama s speech that wa particularly emblematic of the struggle we face in determining the outcome of the american way of life when it come to insurance medical care and ongoing health concernsthis is in stark contrast with what we see in everyday life in america where we seemingly can t even agree on whether or not white supremacist are bad or if it s okay to run over protester we are engaged in a fight for our very life and at least legislatively speaking obama know how hard it look from where we arefrom the video you re about to watch when i see those people trying to undo that hardwon progress for the th or th time with bill that would raise cost or reduce coverage or roll back protection for older american or people with preexisting condition the cancer survivor the expecting mom or the child with autism or asthma for whom coverage once again would be almost unattainable it is aggravatingand all of this being done without any demonstrable economic or actuarial or plain common sense rationale it frustrates and it s certainly frustrating to have to mobilize every couple month to keep our leader from inflicting real human suffering on our constituent president obama couldn t be more right although he is diplomatic here and doe not call out donald trump and the republican by name it is vital that we hold them to account it is absolutely imperative that we make sure they cannot tear away at the fabric of our society and rip away at the moral cloth we ve woven in beginning the process of ensuring every american ha access to health carewatch the video herefeatured image via yana paskovagetty image
Title_Text: obama just made a very powerful statement about trumps attempt to repeal obamacare video

Text: pastafarianism is a fairly new religion it adherent are atheistic in belief and they worship the flying spaghetti monster the religion took off in founded by bobby henderson in response to the kansa board of education s decision to allow socalled intelligent design which is nothing more than biblical creationism in a very transparent disguise to be taught a a valid point of view in public school ever since the religion became popular with non believer everywhere pastafarians have been fighting for the same right that every other religion ha including the right to wear religious headgear in driver s license photo for pastafarians that mean wearing colander in their photosthe latest fight in this arena come from chris avino of georgia avino wa allowed to wear the colander in a temporary driver s license photo but the decision wa reversed for the picture that would be used on his permanent document official insist that the state of georgia doe not deem it appropriate to allow customer to be issued identification card of license that portray satirical or offensive point of view this ruling come courtesy of angelique mcclendon an attorney for georgia s georgia department of driver service mcclendon s decision come because she say that while headdress scarf and veil can be worn in photo for religious purpose that a colander is not a veil scarf or headdress a colander is a kitchen utensil commonly used for washing or draining food mcclendon also went on to condemn pastafarianism altogether saying that it is not a religion but instead philosophy that mock religion avino however took his cause to twitter and seems to be considering taking the state through the legal system regarding his religious right to wear his colander he answered mcclendon s ruling by saying just because a colander is not traditionally used a a headdress doe not mean that it cannot serve that purpose in fact it doe serve that purpose for the ten of thousand perhaps even hundred of thousand of believer who claim pastafarianism a their religionyou may find our belief to be strange but a strange a you may feel they are they are still our belief some may find it strange that christian believe that jonah spent day in a whale s belly according to some text some may find it strange that muslim believe that muhammad wa carried to the seven heaven on the back of a winged horse some may find it strange that scientologists believe that xenu the dictator of the galactic confederacy brought billion of people to earth in a dclike spacecraft stacked them around volcano and killed them with hydrogen bomb maybe you the reader of this letter do not personally believe that muhammad flew to heaven on a winged horse but do you question the validity of islam a a religion he went on to make the very valid point that it is not up to the state to decide which religion deserved recognition and that if they recognize one they must recognize all our religion exists it is legitimate it s claim are no less valid than the claim of other recognized religion i am in no way breaking the law or breaking any rule by wearing my religion s headdress a colander during my driver s license photo but dd is dd is infringing on my st amendment right to express my religious belief freely within the law of the united state of america within the law of the state of georgia and within the rule of the dd the thing is when you strip away the commonality and acceptance of mainstream religion like christianity and such without question they are no more valid than pastafarianism there is not a shred of evidence that any of them are true therefore if christian muslim jew hindu and others get recognition pastafarianism should a well chris avino is right it is not up to the state to decide that his religion deserves no recognition all religion are equally ridiculous and i champion his right to wear his colandersue the pant off them mr avino and wear your religious colander with pridefeatured image via twitterraw story
Title_Text: pastafarian fight georgia for right to wear colander in license photo  will probably win

Text: washington reuters  u republican white house frontrunner donald trump said on sunday he would be open to harsh measure to deal with the threat from islamic state including going beyond the controversial interrogation tactic known a waterboarding in an interview on abcs this week program trump discussed reviving the tactic and implementing other interrogation technique pointing to the recent beheading of christian in the middle east a evidence of the need for stronger interrogation method for suspected operative of extremist group were like living in medieval times he said if i have to do it and if its up to me i would absolutely bring back waterboardng and if its going to be tougher than waterboarding i would bring that back too when pressed by interviewer george stephanopoulos if that meant the united state employing similar method of beheading captor trump responded were going to do thing beyond waterboarding adding perhaps if that happens to come the issue of waterboarding and other method of interrogation wa raised during saturday nights new hampshire republican debate aired on abc with the billionaire businessman saying he would not only revive the controversial methods use but bring back a hell of a lot worse if elected waterboarding is the practice of pouring water over someones face to mimic drowning a an interrogation tactic critic say it is torture and democratic president barack obama banned use of the method day after taking office in trumps rival and a fellow leader in opinion poll senator ted cruz of texas said during the debate that he would only allow limited use of the practice but said it did not constitute torture waterboarding wa used by the cia under the bush administration during the early day of the war in iraq and afghanistan in the aftermath of the sept attack it defender say it helped to keep america safe by garnering more information from captive but critic argued the method never actually yielded actionable intelligence republican have been critical of obamas decision to eliminate the practice saying it telegraph a position of weakness to the nations enemy and concedes that the united state erred in using waterboarding on sunday trump argued that the evil nature of modern time required more robust interrogation technique saying that u enemy are thriving in the absence of them they laugh at u our enemy laugh at u george they say waterboarding they dont even think its a form  you know they dont even view that a real torture he said new hampshire where trump maintains a lead over republican rival in the u nominating contest for the nov election cast it primary ballot on tuesday the week after iowa kicked off the process editing by caren bohan mary milliken and jonathan oatis sap is the sponsor of this content it wa independently created by reuters editorial staff and funded in part by sap which otherwise ha no role in this coverage
Title_Text: trump call for waterboarding other method in u fight against islamic state

Text: on wednesday night s episode of late night host seth meyers ripped trump a new one for his continued support of fox news and his defense of bill o reilly it s not only despicable that trump a known sexual harasser would defend fellow sexual harasser bill o reilly but he did this less than a week after he proclaimed that april would now be known a national sexual assault awareness month meyers not one to ever let trump get away with anything dedicated his popular segment a closer look to this very subject and it wa glorious at the beginning of the segment seth focused on trump s undying and equally disturbing love and admiration for fox news and his favorite program on the failing network you probably have at least a passing familiarity with fox news if you ve ever visited an elderly relative or gotten drunk at a bar in a smalltown applebee s he said introducing the segment particularly with one viewer the president of the united state he then went on to show picture of trump s free twitter advertisement for fox and said the president literally just recommends tv show now instead of a bible trump should have been sworn in on a tv guide that of course drew raucous laughter from the crowd but it s so true he cannot stop plugging this network and along with himself he s made fox news more of a laughing stock than it wa before he wa elected now he s coming to o reilly s defense which is sure to make thing worse for the network who ha already lost over advertiser amid the newest sexual harassment scandal they just can t seem to get away from a much a they ve tried to sweep it under the rug soon the only advertiser left on his show are going to be ivanka trump s clothing line and steve bannon s skin worsener meyers jokedwatch the full segment belowfeatured image via video screenshot
Title_Text: seth meyers slam trumps defense of state tv fox news and sexual deviant bill oreilly video

Text: cairo reuters  jordan said on friday a u air strike on a syrian air base wa a necessary and appropriate response to a chemical weapon attack this week which the united state and it ally blamed on syrias government the chemical incident wa an inhuman act which drew wideranging international reaction the latest of which wa the u military strike jordan considers this a necessary and appropriate response to the continued targeting of civilians government spokesman mohammed almomeni said quoted by state news agency petra syrias government denies using chemical weapon
Title_Text: jordan say u strike on syria wa necessary response petra

Text: washington reuters  prospect dimmed on monday for the u house of representative to vote this week on republican legislation to restrict gun sale to suspected extremist before congress go on a sevenweek summer break republican including house speaker paul ryan have been under pressure to act on gun legislation since the june mass shooting at a gay nightclub in orlando florida congress begin a summer recess on friday but with the house floor schedule filling with other bill republican said gun legislation wa unlikely to come up before september when prospect for serious action could be overshadowed by the fall presidential election campaign representative jim jordan of ohio who head the conservative house freedom caucus said i do not anticipate that bill the measure backed by the national rifle association would give government authority three day to convince a judge to block the sale of weapon to someone suspected of involvement in violent extremism but ryan ha been unable to win support from conservative republican who say the measure pose potential constitutional problem and should be subjected to regular legislative channel including formal hearing republican lawmaker say discussion aimed at finding compromise are continuing but the measure did not come up at a monday meeting with republican leader to discus the weeks agenda said another lawmaker who predicted it would not see a vote this week the stalemate leaf hanging democratic demand for stronger gun restriction despite an unprecedented hour sitin by house democrat last month and sideline any potential movement on an alternative bipartisan bill seen a a possible compromise a vote is going to be stalled until congress return from it long summer break one republican aide said lawmaker initially believed congress could pas some kind of measure before their summer recess after the orlando shooting raised national security concern and poll showed a majority of american in favor of greater restriction
Title_Text: prospect for house vote on gun control measure dims

Text: washington reuters  u senate republican rammed forward president donald trumps taxcut bill on tuesday in an abrupt partisan committee vote that set up a full vote by the senate a soon a thursday although some detail of the measure remained unsettled a disabled protester shouted kill the bill dont kill us in a capitol hill hearing room the senate budget committee with no discussion quickly approved the legislation on a  partyline vote that left democrat fuming republican committee member quickly left the room after the vote a democrat complained about a lack of discussion on a bill that would overhaul the u tax code and add an estimated  trillion to the  trillion national debt over year after the vote trump told reporter i think were going to get it passed adding that it would have some adjustment republican are hurrying to move their complex tax legislation forward hoping to avoid the protracted infighting that doomed their effort to repeal obamacare four month ago since trump took office in january he and fellow republican in command of both chamber of congress have approved no major legislation a fact they want to change before facing voter in the congressional election if the senate approves it tax measure later this week it would need to be reconciled with a version already approved by the house of representative before anything could be sent to the white house for trump to sign into law republican leader conceded that they had yet to round up the vote needed for passage in the senate where they hold a narrow  majority its a challenging exercise senate republican leader mitch mcconnell said at a news conference democrat have called the republican tax plan a giveaway to corporation and the rich the senate bill would slash the corporate tax rate to percent from percent after a oneyear delay it would impose a onetime cutrate tax on corporations foreign profit while exempting future foreign profit from u taxation tax rate for many individual and family would also be cut temporarily before rising back to their previous level in key tax break would also be curbed or eliminated making the bill a mixed bag for some middleclass family some tax paid by wealthy american would be repealed wall street moved higher on the news that the bill would move to a full senate vote with the benchmark sp spx index closing up a little over percent a written the bill would widen the u budget deficit by an estimated  trillion over year republican maintain that gap would be narrowed by additional economic growth senator bob corker one of few remaining republican fiscal hawk in congress said he worked out a deal satisfying his concern that the tax cut add too much to the national debt he said the bill would be modified to automatically raise tax revenue if growth target were not reached we got a commitment that put u in a pretty good place he said although detail were not immediately available corker said he expected more information to come out on thursday a part of the bill the concession immediately drew a detractor a republican senator john kennedy told reporter he would rather drink weed killer than vote for the thing adding i dont like voting for automatic tax increases the corker concession wa one of several lingering uncertainty in the bill that senate aide said would be nailed down a the measure neared a floor vote republican senator susan collins who remains undecided on how she will vote on the bill said productive discussions continued and that she would offer an amendment preserving the  deduction for property tax payment the deduction is in the house bill but not the senate version republican senator ron johnson voted for the bill in the budget committee even though he had said it did not cut tax deeply enough for some noncorporate business the final version could address his concern aide said tax writer were working to change the tax rate for noncorporate business preserve an individual deduction for property tax payment and incorporate corkers tax revenue idea democratic senator jeff merkley told msnbc that the corker concession wa an absolute gimmick that could be undermined later its just a justification to let those who have argued that they dont believe in increasing the deficit actually vote for a bill which doe exactly that merkley said a the tax fight played out a new battle opened on another front a democratic congressional leader chuck schumer and nancy pelosi skipped a white house meeting with trump to discus spending immigration and other issue after trump criticized them on twitter lawmaker must renew government funding before it expires on dec or risk a shutdown democrat hope to use their leverage on the budget issue to renew protection for young immigrant who entered the country illegally a child
Title_Text: senate republican shove tax bill ahead a democrat fume

Text: donald trump s tuesday meeting with the new york time wa already controversial to begin with and it ended in a similar fashion not only ha the newspaper been a target of trump s twitter attack after reporting true but negative coverage on him but trump abruptly canceled his meeting without notifying the paper only to follow through at the last minutebut even after the meeting had happened it wasn t the end of the volatile emotion surrounding trump s visit upon exiting the meeting and walking through the main lobby of the new york time building trump wa met with loud boo from the crowd that tried to cover up the cheer in the footage below trump can be seen walking through the lobby and waving to the crowd who had very mixed reaction to the presidentelect reporter were busy shouting question to trump but the crowd drowned them outcbs news tried to ignore the negative reaction a it tweeted donald trump is greeted with cheer a he leaf meeting with the new york time however the video clip accompanying that caption tell a different story at the end of the video the cbsn anchor corrected himself and said alright so a mix of cheer and some boo i think update donald trump is greeted with cheer a he leaf meeting with the new york time httpstcosaohiwr pictwittercomtvaphpuyq cbs news cbsnews november this is yet another first for america it ha been unheard of for both a presidentelect and vice presidentelect to be booed in public appearance and within day of each other it s clear that trump and penny are the most controversial divisive team the country ha ever been faced with and their level of disapproval is unprecedentedthe medium should certainly be latching onto this instead of pretending that people are only cheering for trump to suggest that the american people are ready to accept trump and penny is dishonest these video show a nation that is divided and upset with this election and the medium should portray the truth of it regardless of whether trump throw a twitter fit or nottrump leaf the time pictwittercomkuptaujxt michael calderone mlcalderone november video a mix of cheer boo and shouted question a trump leaf the nyt building httpstcoricnjiwz brian stelter brianstelter november featured image via screenshot
Title_Text: trumps new york time meeting end in disaster a crowd greets him with boo video

Text: johannesburg reuters  south africa s ruling african national congress ha adopted a resolution calling for the nationalization of the central bank and land expropriation without compensation a senior party official said on wednesday any mention of nationalization in south africa is enough to spook investor since leftwing element of the anc have also called for mine and bank to be stateowned similarly land is an emotive issue two decade after the end of apartheid and the anc ha been under pressure to redress racial disparity in land ownership unlike most central bank in the world the south african reserve bank ha been privately owned since it wa established in but it shareholder have no control over monetary policy financial stability policy or banking regulation following a meeting of party delegate the head of the anc s economic transformation committee enoch godongwana told reporter changing the ownership of the south african reserve bank would not affect it independence he said the party had also agreed to initiate amendment to the constitution to achieve land expropriation without compensation but gave no timeline he said there would be no illegal occupation of land following the proposal made in july by the anc at a policy conference to nationalize the bank s shareholding south africa s reserve bank said that changing it shareholding would not affect it mandate because that mandate is derived from the constitution godongwana said no timeline had been laid down for the plan to acquire the central bank s share or for any directive to parliament to change the country s law to effect the change no change in the constitution no change in the reserve bank act he said we ve also said it s not likely to have an impact at all because shareholder in the reserve bank do not affect monetary policy in any way godongwana said the change would come after more work wa done to prepare for the bank s nationalization in july when the party said it would like the central bank to be wholly stateowned investor were initially worried and knocked the rand the currency wa little changed on wednesday immediately after the announcement by godongwana but analyst said market would react negatively the sarb resolution will spook the market even if it is ultimately unlikely to be implemented said anne fruhauf political analyst with consultancy teneo on the land issue godongwana said some of the delegate became rowdy during the heated debate that nearly collapsed the conference anc official rejected report that delegate had come to blow during the debate godongwana said the delegate eventually agreed to initiate some amendment to the constitution in order to achieve expropriation of land without compensation the condition is that it must be sustainable and not impact on food production and food security he said adding that there should be no illegal occupation of land asked how the market would react godongwana said my suspicion is they are going to say wow and react badly my sense is if i wa the market i would simply hold off most of south africa s land remains in white hand year after the end of white minority rule expert say the plan to expropriate land in south africa will not signal the kind of often violent land grab that took place in neighboring zimbabwe where whiteowned farm were seized by the government for redistribution to landless black however some economist and farming group have said the reform could hit investment and production around million hectare million acre of land have been transferred to black owner since apartheid ended equal to to percent of the land in white hand in the government say the total is only a third of a percent target by set by the anc
Title_Text: south africa anc call for nationalizing central bank land expropriation

Text: reza aslan is a cnn host who is a muslim religious scholar who should be fired but probably won t be he tweeted out a vile response to president trump s tweet from the drudge report he also called our president a man baby who should be ignored what kind of jackwagon disrespect our president like thisaslan first tweeted that he considers trump a man baby who should be ignored this is after our president scooped nbc when he retweeted the drudge tweet that it wa feared that another terror attack happened in london nbc tweeted see below that they wouldn t retweet trump tweet ridiculous move by nbc that turned out to backfire on them the president is a man baby that must be ignored in time of crisis cnn s religious scholar reza aslan the next tweet from aslan is the one getting the most press because of it hate and vulgar language this piece of shit is not just an embarrassment to america and a stain on the presidency he s an embarrassment to humankind cnn s religious scholar reza aslan doe cnn condone this vile behavior from it host we ll see if they do anything about this hateful man who is no journalistmore information on him reveals he s an iranianborn cnn employee from his personal websitereza aslan is an internationally renowned writer commentator professor producer and scholar of religion his book including his new york time bestseller zealot the life and time of jesus of nazareth have been translated into dozen of language around the world he is also a recipient of the prestigious james joyce awardin addition to his role a a consulting producer on the acclaimed hbo series the leftover aslan is also the host and executive producer of two other original television program rough draft with reza aslan premiered on ovation and cnn s upcoming documentary series believer he also served a an executive producer on the abc drama of king and prophet his book zealot ha been optioned by lionsgate and producer david heyman with a script penned by oscar nominated screenwriter james schamusin aslan cofounded boomgen studio the premiere entertainment brand for creative content from and about the middle east which ha provided an array of targeted service ranging from strategic messaging to grassroots marketing to publicity and social medium outreach to producer studio and filmmaker including jon stewart s rosewater netflix s the square disney s aladdin on broadway and prince of persia the sand of time the weinstein company s miral discovery and tlc s all american muslim and national geographic s amreekaaslan s first book international bestseller no god but god the origin evolution and future of islam ha been translated into seventeen language and wa named one of the most important book of the last decade by blackwell publisher he is also the author of beyond fundamentalism confronting religious extremism in a globalized age originally titled how to win a cosmic war a well a editor of two volume tablet and pen literary landscape from the modern middle east and muslim and jew in america commonalty contention and complexitiesaslan s degree include a bachelor of art in religious study from santa clara university major focus new testament minor greek a master of theological study from harvard university major focus history of religion a phd in the sociology of religion from the university of california santa barbara and a master of fine art from the university of iowa where he wa named the truman capote fellow in fiction an adjunct senior fellow at the council on foreign relation he is also a member of the los angeles institute for the humanity and the pacific council on international policy he serf on the board of director of the ploughshare fund which give grant for peace and security issue narrative four which connects people through the exchange of story pen usa which champion the right of writer under siege around the world the los angeles review of book and the levantine cultural center which build bridge between american and the arabmuslim world through the artsaslan is a tenured professor of creative writing at the university of california riverside and serf on the board of trustee for the chicago theological seminary and the yale humanist community which support atheist agnostic and humanist at home and abroad a member of the american academy of religion the society of biblical literature and the international qur anic study association aslan s previous academic position include the wallerstein distinguished professor of religion community and conflict at drew university in new jersey  and visiting assistant professor of religion at the university of iowa born in iran he life in los angeles with his wife author and entrepreneur jessica jackley and their three son
Title_Text: fire this guy muslim cnn host tweet out vile response to president trumps tweet after londonbridge terror attack

Text: reuters  a federal court judge on wednesday threw out a texas voter identification law that wa supported by the trump administration but the states attorney general said his office would appeal the ruling the judges ruling said change to the law passed earlier this year by the states republicancontrolled legislature that were meant to be less discriminatory than an earlier one did not accomplish that u district judge nelva gonzales ramos of the southern district of texas said the state did not allow enough type of photo id for voter even though the th u circuit court of appeal wa clearly critical of texas having the most restrictive list in the country president donald trump campaigned on cutting voter fraud picking up a theme of fellow republican across the country critic have said the texas law and similar statute enacted in other republicangoverned state are an effort to suppress voting including among black and hispanic who tend to favor democrat trump ha made unsubstantiated allegation that million of people voted illegally for his democratic rival hillary clinton in last novembers election in which clinton won the popular vote but lost the decisive electoral college count todays ruling is outrageous texas attorney general ken paxton said in a statement paxton a republican added that change to the law passed by the legislature included all those asked for by the th circuit the justice department filed a brief last month asking the court to halt action against the texas voter id law saying the states new law fixed discriminatory issue of the states voter id law texas democrat welcomed ramos ruling jim crowera tactic have kept texas republican in power said state democratic party chairman gilberto hinojosa from discriminatory gerrymandering to discriminatory voter id law it ha become entirely clear that texas republican are rigging our election system ramos wrote in a page ruling that voter with little education or simply a lack of confidence may forfeit their legitimate right to vote because of fear of being charged with perjury she said texas wa overreaching by threatening severe penalty for perjury and noted that the states history of voter intimidation led her not to accept the new voter id law a a solution for the purposeful discrimination in the one it attempted to improve upon
Title_Text: u judge throw out texas voter id law supported by trump

Text: moscow reuters  russian opposition activist ivan skripnichenko died after being attacked by a man angry he opposed vladimir putin over a month later nobody ha been arrested his family can t see his autopsy and authority say he probably died of heart disease the assault on the yearold fatheroftwo is one of a growing number of vicious attack on opposition figure in the runup to a presidential election in march which putin the incumbent is widely expected to contest most activist do not believe that putin or the kremlin have a hand in the attack which have included caustic liquid being thrown in a victim s eye a car being set alight and in one case an activist being bashed over the head with an iron bar but critic say the way the authority have handled the case  it s rare for anyone to be arrested and a nationalist group which say it carry out such attack openly boast about it activity  show that they are at best turning a blind eye and at worst tacitly condoning the violence yulia latynina a journalist critical of the authority wa forced to flee russia this summer after having faeces thrown at her her car torched and noxious gas pumped into her home for her skripnichenko s death is part of a dangerous trend and she ha accused the authority of losing control of the violent extremist responsible when you splash antiseptic in people s face pour shit over people beat up activist puncture their tire or burn something sooner or later someone will be burned alive or die in a fight latynina said on her own radio show and that s murder according to skripnichenko s family an unidentified man accosted him late on aug a he stood by a makeshift memorial to slain opposition leader boris nemtsov on a kremlin bridge a rallying point for government critic nemtsov had been shot dead on the same spot in by a chechen gunman in one of modern russia s most highprofile killing don t you love putin the man asked skripnichenko is putin a girl that i should love him the activist parried the man knocked skripnichenko s cap to the ground and a his victim rose after picking it up punched him hard in the face breaking his nose skripnichenko hit his head on the pavement a he fell his attacker then kicked him a he lay prone mikhail silich an activist who wa with skripnichenko at the time of the attack confirmed the family s account after the attack skripnichenko left hospital and told other activist he thought he would be ok his family say he went to a different hospital a week later to get his nose reset and began to feel unwell in the canteen when he didn t come home that day they phoned the next morning to be told he had died his family and activist say the authority are not investigating his death properly investigator have neither identified nor arrested skripnichenko s attacker have not opened a criminal case and the dead man s family say they can t obtain his autopsy report citing procedure moscow s investigative committee which is handling the matter told skripnichenko s widow olga that she would need to wait day to get such a report the committee did not respond to a reuters request for comment on progress in the case despite the attack taking place in sight of the kremlin s wall on the same spot where nemtsov wa gunned down two and a half year earlier investigator say there is no cctv footage ilya novikov the family lawyer say that s hard to believe the cause of death is in question too investigator preliminary conclusion wa that he had died of heart disease skripnichenko s sister nastya say doctor who examined her brother said he did not appear to have suffered serious head wound yet she is skeptical he died of heart problem and suspect the attack triggered problem that took time to unfold my brother never complained about heart problem she told reuters saying doctor had given him a clean bill of health in a checkup a recently a this spring my brother wa into crosscountry skiing flew a glider did parachute jump and cycled at a semiprofessional level i absolutely link my brother s death with the attack russia s liberal opposition ha no seat in parliament and scant hope of mounting a serious challenge to putin next year though alexei navalny an opposition leader who doesn t fit the traditional liberal mould is trying to make a run but in a country under western sanction because of it annexation of ukraine s crimea and support for prorussian separatist in eastern ukraine prokremlin politician often cast anyone critical of the authority a the enemy within critic say such rhetoric is fuelling attack against the opposition and that those who carry them out feel a sense of impunity because they are rarely punished navalny became temporarily blind in one eye in april after having caustic liquid thrown at him soon afterwards a progovernment tv channel broadcast footage of navalny s attacker running away from the scene but blurred out his face opposition activist identified the man a a member of a radical group investigator said there wa not enough evidence for a prosecution in another incident nikolai lyaskin a navalny ally wa hit over the head with an iron bar in moscow last month an assault navalny said wa designed to turn him into an invalid police detained a suspect and opened a criminal case but they then issued a statement saying the suspect had told them that lyaskin the victim had paid his assailant to stage an attack on him police released the suspect after hour on condition which were not disclosed the spot where skripnichenko wa attacked is a favorite target for nationalist who dislike the makeshift shrine there to nemtsov for them the former deputy prime minister turned putin critic is a prowestern traitor they have sometimes trashed his shrine and picked fight with it defender serb a radical nationalist group ha vandalized the memorial several time at an apartment block in moscow where nemtsov once lived serb s leader igor beketov tore off a plaque that activist had hung honoring nemtsov a state tv report about the incident complained the opposition wa using nemtsov s name for various purpose and gave beketov air time to explain his grievance outside the apartment block skripnichenko family lawyer novikov became embroiled in a fist fight with beketov after serb member ripped up a photo of nemtsov serb pelt it target with faeces antiseptic and urine it ha smashed cake into navalny s face but denies the caustic liquid attack it ha also hinted it threw faeces at latynina tamara lugovykh an activist who knew skripnichenko said she fear the authority will do everything not to link his death to politics in interview with reuters seven activist said the attack chimed with the regular intimidation they face they saw parallel with the investigation into nemtsov s murder which convicted a group of chechen but failed to identify who ordered the killing and why real blood ha been spilled on the same spot a few meter apart said activist andrei margulev at the bridge shrine a portrait of skripnichenko is now on display next to that of nemtsov ivan had plan to have child with his wife sergei kireyev an activist who knew him said but anything can happen on the bridge there are no rule
Title_Text: no rule russian activist death a symbol of preelection violence

Text: rep maxine water is taking a page right out of donald trump s playbook and turning it into a piece of political art since trump took office water ha been among trump s biggest critic most though have tempered their rhetoric about the putin puppet in chief but not water like trump she refuse to be politically correct only unlike trump she s really good at iton wednesday water took to twitter after it wa revealed that former fbi director james comey didn t want to be alone with donald trump water understood she tweetedso comey told jeff session he didn t want to be alone with trump woman across the country can relateso comey told jeff session he didn t want to be alone with trump woman across the country can relate maxine water maxinewaters june twitter went nut pictwittercomkqqppdfqc ilhan omar ilhanmn june i only met the man once but let me tell you i couldn t wait to get away from him pictwittercomjlbykhij maxine p water maxinevvaters june i want all my daughter to grow up like maxine water zach de la rocha agenthades agenthades june come feel exactly like trump ex wife feel violated and stalked pictwittercomkxzwdiisfu the sport whisperer monte june the real maxine handling the twitter maxine water is throwing shade pictwittercomfqdtwjmi george m johnson iamgmjohnson june my dog would just pee on him but apparently he like that jefferson davis mtntrout june lol pictwittercomnhmyatn lashunda j mjdrew june pictwittercomrumcrlhde respectmygame battletested june pictwittercomuazqersf iseedumbppl freeblackman june i don t even want to b alone with his tweet mary kay andrew mkayandrews june auntie maxine bringing the afternoon tea pictwittercomzdylfvrefj portia mcgonagal portiamcgonagal june it doesn t even seem a though trump s own wife want to be alone with himas for water well if this country wa a tad less racist and misogynist she d be our next president and she d do a damned fine jobfeatured image via aaron p bernsteingetty image
Title_Text: maxine water just threw an epic twitter bomb at trump

Text: a group of mostly prolife college student came together in detroit last weekend to stand up for the most vulnerable among u they were praying to end abortion when a group of loud vile protester approached them and and start screaming my body is true don t like it fck you in their face while protester screamed at them the prolifer remained calm and peaceful while praying and doing their best to ignore them the more they prayed the rosary the louder the vile protester screamed at them not my ovary screw your rosary these proabortion advocate are doing exactly what democrat are encouraging and even paying them to do party leader like our former president barack obama and now hillary are becoming more and more engaged and vocal in their support of these nasty people hillary just released a video of herself telling democrat to keep fighting against trump and the oppositiondemocrats are bullying innocent people simply because they have an opposing view they re attempting to shut down free speech and freedom of religion by threatening people who don t agree with them is this really how they plan to save their party is this how they prove they re the party of tolerance or compassion and love is this the future of the democrat partywatch protester interrupt a pastor during his opening prayer in a town hall meeting being hosted by republican senator cassidy of la we all know that these people are being paid but are they really doing the democrat party any favor by behaving in such a vile and disrespectful way during an opening prayer
Title_Text: will vile leftist turn democrat awaywatch angry leftist openly bully american engaged in peaceful prayer video

Text: washington reuters  the u senate will most likely vote on four gun control measure on monday the no republican in the senate said after the weekend shooting massacre at a gay nightclub in florida two of the proposal are sponsored by democrat and two by republican senator john cornyn of texas said on thursday i think its pretty definite he said of the monday time frame
Title_Text: senate gun control vote on monday say a leading republican

Text: the character of the modern left and the core of the censorious campus leftism at the moment ha seldom been better described than by this passage from harry jaffa in how to think about the american revolution most importantly he understands that the distinction between liberalism and radicalism had dissolved which explains bernie sandersliberalism and radicalism both reject the wisdom of the past a enshrined in the institution of the past or in the morality of the past they deny the legitimacy to law government or way of life which accept the ancient evil of mankind such a poverty inequality and war a necessary and therefore a permanent attribute of the human condition political excellence can no longer be measured by the degree to which it ameliorates such evil the only acceptable goal is their abolition liberalism and radicalism look forward to a state of thing in which the mean of life and of the good life are available to all they must be available in such a way that the full development of each individual which is how the good life is defined is not merely compatible with but necessary to the full development of all competition between individual class race and nation must come to an end competition itself is seen a the root of the evil mankind must escape the good society must be characterized only by cooperation and harmony the old liberalism saw life a a race in which justice demanded for everyone only a fair or equal chance in the competition but the new liberalism see the race itself a wrong in every race there can be but one winner and there must be many loser thus the old liberalism preserved the inequality of the few over and against the many it demanded the removal of artificial or merely conventional inequality but it recognized and demanded the fullest scope for natural inequality but the new liberalism denies natural no less than conventional inequality in the heaven of the new liberalism a in that of the old theology all will be rewarded equally the achievement of the good society is itself the only victory but this victory is not to be one of man over man but of mankind over the scourge of mankind no one in it will taste the bitterness of defeat no one need say i am a loser but i have no right to complain i had a fair chance the joy of victory will belong to all unlike the treasure of the past the good of the future will be possessed by all they will not be diminished or divided by being common on the contrary they will for that reason increase and intensify no one will be a miser or a conservativevia powerline
Title_Text: best description ever of liberalism in one paragraph

Text: chris christie know how to create awkward political moment that s for sure see photo gaffe gallery below remember the game hug the very awkward moment behind candidate trump where he just stood there with a blank stare his latest and most awkward political moment ha to be beachgate where he wa captured lounging with his family on a nj beach after closing it to the public ouch we re just happy he wasn t hired by president trump but wa let go by jared kushner wheeewin previous report we ve also discussed the election night gaffe of a bold chris christie shoving his way into photo with newly elected president trump see photo above the word wa that the president wasn t too happy about this and that this behavior cost christie a position with the new trump administration the christie bridgegate scandal wa another factor that s been reported the newest revelation expose the ultimate mistake from christiechris christie made his ultimate mistake with donald trump when he bragged about talking to president obama on election night and offered to let trump an infamous germaphobe use christie s cellphone to talk to obama if you win he s going to call my phone and i ll pas it over to you christie said according to excerpt of a new book obtained by the daily maila visibly angry trump snapped at his top campaign aide hey chris you know my f king phone number just give it to the president i don t want your f king phone trump fumedchristie who never received a role in the white house despite his steadfast support for the president wouldn t recover from the phone debacle the attorney in new jersey gave the garden state governor the ax right after trump s victorywe have to say that after the latest chris christie gaffe of beachgate where he closed the nj beach to the public but opened it to only his family ha u convinced that trump and kushner did the right thing man hug awkwardstanding by trump with blank starecaught on the beach with family after closing beachvia nyp
Title_Text: report nj gov chris christies big mistake that cost him wh job

Text: cartagena colombia reuters  pope francis his eye bandaged and blackened after a minor accident in the popemobile left colombia on sunday after appealing to the country to untie the knot of violence after a year civil war his last day in the andean country got off to a rocky start when he lost his balance and bumped his head while riding in the popemobile he bruised his cheekbone and cut his left eyebrow blood staining his white cassock the vatican said he received ice treatment and wa fine a smiling pope continued the trip wearing a bandage over his cut i wa punched i m fine the yearold pontiff joked afterward the bruise on his face clearly visible at the end of the day when he said mass for about people in the city s port area the bruise had swollen and he had a black bag under his eye if colombia want a stable and lasting peace it must urgently take a step in this direction which is that of the common good of equity of justice of respect for human nature and it demand he said in a strong voice in the homily of the mass accompanied by caribbean and salsa music only if we help to untie the knot of violence will we unravel the complex thread of disagreement he said the pontiff left colombia on an avianca flight to rome after watching a cumbia troupe perform traditional coastal singing and dancing with president juan manuel santos and his wife maria clemencia francis used the trip to urge colombian deeply polarized by a peace plan to shun vengeance after a bloody civil war he also said leader had to enact law to end injustice and social inequality that breed violence cartagena a top tourist destination famous for it colonial walled rampart wa the home to saint peter claver a spanish priest who ministered to slave in colombia in the s defying spanish colonial master who treated them a chattel the pope used the occasion to again decry modern slavery and human trafficking and defend the right of immigrant human right group estimate that million of people around the world are victim of human trafficking and form of modern slavery such a forced labor and prostitution here in colombia and in the world million of people are still being sold a slave they either beg for some expression of humanity moment of tenderness or they flee by sea or land because they have lost everything primarily their dignity and their right the pope said just before praying before claver s relic some afrocolombians who receive assistance from the jesuit religious order of which the pope is a member prayed with him in the church francis visited the impoverished neighborhood of san francisco and blessed the cornerstone of a shelter for atrisk afrocolombian girl vulnerable to child prostitution drug and violence earlier in the day the first latin american pope said he wa praying for the wellbeing of all country on the continent but particularly venezuela which ha been caught up in a social and economic crisis i express my closeness to all the son and daughter of that beloved nation a well a to all those who have found a place of welcome here in colombia referring to the ten of thousand of venezuelan who have crossed the border to find food and medicine from this city known a the seat of human right i appeal for the rejection of all violence in political life and for a solution to the current grave crisis which affect everyone particularly the poorest and most disadvantaged of society he said national human right day is celebrated in colombia on sept in honor of claver who died in venezuela ha been convulsed by month of neardaily protest against leftist president nicolas maduro who critic say ha plunged the oilrich country into the worst economic crisis in it history and is turning it into a dictatorship world body and foreign government have expressed concern about the shortage of food and medicine in venezuela and called for political dialogue between maduro and the opposition church leader in venezuela have made a series of highly critical speech since late last year
Title_Text: slightly injured pope end colombia tour with unity appeal

Text: new york reuters  president donald trumps reversal in the past week on maintaining obamacare subsidy to insurer are sowing new confusion over what kind of health insurance will be available to consumer and at what price when enrollment for begin in two week trump said last week his administration would stop paying billion of dollar in subsidy that help insurer give discount to lowincome household one of several move to dismantle the signature healthcare law of his democratic predecessor barack obama since then trump ha alternately supported and dismissed an effort by republican and democratic senator that would reinstate the subsidy for two year until a broader replacement to the affordable care act commonly known a obamacare can be negotiated we are worried that consumer on obamacare plan will be confused by all the back and forth and proposed policy change and that this will cause them to not seek out assistance said bryna koch special project coordinator at the arizona center for rural health which help consumer choose and sign up for individual health plan offered under obamacare trump who promised during his election campaign to repeal and replace obamacare which he ha called a disaster ha said the subsidy amount to a bailout for insurance company by law health insurer must still offer the discount on deductible copays and other outofpocket cost even if the government stop reimbursing them insurer say they do not profit from the subsidy anticipating trumps move insurer proposed higher price on monthly premium in to recoup the money in all but a handful of state they submitted two set of premium rate  a lower rate to use if the subsidy remained and a higher rate to use if the funding wa cut the fate of the subsidy remained in limbo on thursday a senior white house aide said that trump would demand step toward repealing obamacare in any healthcare legislation comment that cast doubt on the prospect for the bipartisan effort to shore up insurance market a california court is expected to consider on monday a request by democratic attorney general to keep the subsidy flowing until a legal challenge to trumps decision is resolved if the funding is not restored when enrollment open on nov many consumer will see premium rate that are on average percent higher than they would have been otherwise even before trumps decision on the subsidy the congressional budget office said the republican presidents policy to roll back obamacare enrollment effort would lead to million fewer people signing up for insurance in than previously forecast the cbo still expects million people to sign up for next year  an increase from this years enrollment of million the federal government ha already halted a subsidy payment to the insurance industry for october but leading insurer are not yet sure whether that is the last word anthem inc chief executive officer joseph swedish told reuters he could not yet predict how ending the subsidy or restating them through potential congressional action would affect pricing next year anthem ha submitted premium rate that account for the subsidy being cut should the subsidy be restored at any time after nov insurer may be able to revert to the lower monthly premium rate or provide rebate for consumer a midyear change in premium would be highly unusual but this would be the right thing to do said marc harrison ceo of intermountain healthcare a utahbased health plan and hospital chain intermountain healthcare would pursue this washington states insurance regulator said it would allow insurer to change rate a soon a practical  even the next month  if lawmaker reinstate the funding an approach backed by the national association of insurance commissioner but that could run up against federal government objection the affordable care act doe not allow for change to premium rate after they have been finalized an official for the u department of health and human service said at the same time the administration is working to approve higher rate in several state that did not take into account trumps cut in subsidy for
Title_Text: obamacare whiplash leaf state insurer with dueling price plan

Text: berlin reuters  german foreign minister sigmar gabriel on wednesday said he would travel to the united state to meet with the newly confirmed u secretary of state rex tillerson underscoring the importance of maintaining trusted relation with germanys closest ally outside europe gabriel said he looked forward to meeting with tillerson who is to be sworn in his post later on wednesday adding that he would be seeking answer about the new u administrations foreign policy it relationship to the nato alliance and other key issue the world will not wait for u there are urgent issue on the global agenda about which germany and america a well a europe and america should be closely coordinating gabriel said in a statement
Title_Text: german foreign minister say to meet with tillerson in washington

Text: washington reuters  the u interior department finalized rule on tuesday aimed at preventing methane leak from oil and gas production on federal and tribal land one of the last major obama administration rule aimed at fighting climate change interiors bureau of land management blm said on tuesday the rule updating yearold regulation that govern flaring venting and natural gas leak from oil and gas production could avoid wasting up to billion cubic foot bcf of natural gas per year this rule to prevent waste of our nations natural gas supply is good government plain and simple said interior secretary sally jewell we are proving that we can cut harmful methane emission that contribute to climate change while putting in place standard that make good economic sense for the nation environmental group praised the rule but industry and some western state called it unnecessary one industry group sued blm the incoming trump administration ha promised to cut what it call superfluous restriction on energy production an interior department fact sheet said that between and oil and gas producer vented flared and leaked bcf of natural gas on federal and indian land wasting a much a  million annually in royalty revenue venting and leak during oil and gas operation cause major emission of methane a greenhouse gas at least time more potent than carbon dioxide the rule would phase in a limit on flaring over several year affecting percent of oil well which account for percent of gas flared the blm said oil and gas operator can comply by expanding gascapture technology or connecting well to existing infrastructure through gathering line operator would have to use technology such a infrared camera to detect methane leak invisible to the naked eye blm could also set and adjust royalty rate for oil and gas drilled on federal land to at or above percent currently blm ha no discretion to raise the rate todays announcement is a win for western taxpayer for too long big oil company have wasted natural gas that belongs to all american with no accountability said chris saeger director of ngo western value project blm is right to address methane waste from existing oil and gas facility these action build on important state and federal progress already underway said fred krupp president of the environmental defense fund moment after the rules release the western energy alliance and independent petroleum association of america filed a lawsuit against the blm in a wyoming court
Title_Text: obama administration completes rule to curb methane from federal oil gas production

Text: washington reuters  the head of the pentagon and the u intelligence community have recommended to president barack obama that the director of the national security agency admiral michael rogers be removed from his position source familiar with the matter said on saturday the recommendation by defense secretary ash carter and director of national intelligence james clapper first reported by the washington post wa delivered to the white house last month obama chose rogers to take over at the nsa in and gave him the task of repairing the damage after the huge leak about it electronic spying program by contractor edward snowden but there have been other security lapse the source said including the one that led to the arrest of nsa contractor harold martin earlier this year rogers is being considered a a potential new director of national intelligence by presidentelect donald trump a post that oversees all u intelligence agency the washington post reported that a decision by rogers to travel to new york to meet with trump on thursday without notifying superior caused consternation at senior level of the administration but the recommendation to remove him predated his visit rogers is head of both the national security agency and the u militarys cyber command carter wa also disappointed with the cyber commands performance in the war against islamic state another source said the white house pentagon nsa and office of the director of national intelligence declined to comment a trump campaign spokesman had no immediate comment u representative devin nunes chairman of the house of representative intelligence committee and a republican said later on saturday he had written to carter and clapper asking them to testify to the committee about the matter the obama administration want to split leadership at the national security agency and cyber command arguing that the job of leading two agency with differing mission is too much for one person but some member of congress led by republican senator john mccain the senate armed service committee chairman oppose that plan saying that cyber command need access to the nsas resource to do it job effectively
Title_Text: senior u official recommend removal of nsa director source
