Text: washingtonbrussels reuters  a u senate panel approved measure on thursday that were causing concern in europe among negotiator hammering out a new transatlantic pact on electronic data transfer an issue for many company such a facebook and microsoft in a step toward addressing global concern about data privacy the senate judiciary committee approved legislation headed next to the full senate for a vote that would give some european the right to sue in the united state over allegation of electronic data privacy violation but amendment were added at the last minute that raised question from the european union in brussels that is where negotiator are working on a broad safe harbor agreement which face a deadline next week that will protect the free transfer between the united state and europe of data such a web search and social medium update a previous safe harbor pact wa ruled invalid by a top european union court in october amid concern in europe about u internet surveillance the senates judicial redress act approved by the committee is not seen a crucial to securing the new safe harbor pact but european privacy regulator have been clamoring for passage of the act a a sign of good faith that is a very very important signal of trust and reliability european commission director for fundamental right paul nemitz told reuters at a conference in brussels complicating this gesture were two amendment pushed by republican senator john cornyn of texas and adopted unanimously one would limit the ability to sue in u court to citizen of country already in an international data deal with the united state such a safe harbor another would require the u attorney general to certify that participating country do not have policy impeding u national security eu authority have given safe harbor negotiator until the end of january to strike a new deal several source familiar with the talk said negotiator have made progress in the past week but hurdle remain u federal trade commissioner julie brill said on thursday in brussels that reaching agreement would require the european commission to consider the change the united state ha made to it national security law in recent year under the eu charter individual member state retain power over national security which in practice mean brussels is unable to negotiate with washington on such issue the moderator of the conference panel noted
Title_Text: data privacy bill in congress transatlantic deal elusive

Text: if you ve ever thought our government is completely run by the national rifle association your mind won t be changed by this articlea federal appeal court in san francisco ruled on monday that any law that city or state pas to protect their citizen from gun violence are unconstitutionalthe case wa about three business partner in alameda california who wanted to open a gun store but they were denied a zoning permit the court ruled in the partner favor saying that the right to bear arm meant the right to buy arm if the right of the people to keep and bear arm is to have any force the people must have a right to acquire the very firearm they are entitled to keep and to bear wrote judge diarmuid f o scannlain a reagan appointee for the  majority quoting the second amendment one cannot truly enjoy a constitutionally protected right when the state is permitted to snuff out the mean by which he exercise it all of this make sense until you realize that city and state can regulate virtually anything else that s sold if a city chooses not to allow a bar or a massage parlor that s their right it should also be the right of a city to help mitigate crime and if fewer gun do that they can ban the sale of gunsunlike gun manufacturer though massage parlor and bar don t have massive lobbying arm to control their every move these graph are a couple year old but little ha changed most of the nra s bribery money go straight into the pocket of congressman of them republican and democratsyou can bet that it wa the nra who propelled this case to a higher court in the first placejudge barry g silverman named to the bench by president bill clinton wrote in dissent describing the case a a mundane zoning dispute dressed up a a second amendment challenge conspicuously missing from this lawsuit is any honesttogod resident of alameda county complaining that he or she cannot lawfully buy a gun nearby judge silverman wrotethe most ridiculous part of this case is that the ordinance that caused the gun store to be turned away doesn t ban gun store it simply say they cannot be less than foot from a residence they wanted to build it foot awaywhat this mean is that a much a republican claim to value property right and life when it come to gun there are no property right if you don t drool over the thought of gun your right to keep your child away from gun is nonexistent because in the united state it s increasingly becoming gun before peoplefeatured image by ethan miller at getty image
Title_Text: another win for the nra court rule that city cant protect themselves from gun violence

Text: this is how far republican will go to protect a racist in their partythirty year after congress rejected jeff session nomination a a federal judge the alabama republican who only had a problem with the kkk because they smoked marijuana is once again up for a critical government post that could set voting right back for generationsdonald trump s nomination of session a attorney general ha raised alarm bell across the nation a civil right group fear he will gut the justice department particularly the division that investigates and fight voting right and civil right violationsas a federal attorney session slapped voter fraud charge against black volunteer in his home state who were tasked with picking up and delivering absentee ballot to the post office so they could be counted session lost the case and no one wa indicted because the volunteer did nothing wrong session just hate black people and see their voting a a crimeeven former colleague testified that session is a racistaccording to the new york timesin testimony before the committee former colleague said that mr session had referred to the naacp the southern christian leadership conference and other civil right group a unamerican and communistinspired an africanamerican federal prosecutor then thomas h figure said mr session had referred to him a boy and testified that mr session said the ku klux klan wa fine until i found out they smoked pot if you still need proof that session is a racist just consider that white supremacist cheered when trump announced his nominationbut there is one piece of testimony that republican have been suppressing for decade that would be a nail in the coffin of session effort to become attorney generalin coretta scott king the widow of martin luther king jr wrote a letter of testimony to the republicancontrolled judiciary committee that ended up rejecting sessionsbuzzfeed report that racist senator strom thurmond refused to put the letter in the congressional record and the content have been kept from public view ever since but knight rider reporter aaron epstein published a piece of it in that explains why we should not believe session when he claim he isn t racist for a century the racial practice that characterized our region were established and enforced by men who like mr session protested that they too were not personally hostile to black king wroteand that line alone should disqualify session from ever being more than a racist senator because the last thing this country need is a racist attorney general in charge of the very institution that investigates voter suppression discrimination and hate crime against people of colorfeatured image wikimedia
Title_Text: coretta scott king wrote a letter opposing jeff session and republican have been hiding it since

Text: washington reuters  president donald trump kept up his criticism of mexico on friday saying it has taken advantage of the u for long enough a a crisis over border security and trade deepened massive trade deficit little help on the very weak border must change now trump wrote on twitter on thursday mexican president enrique pena nieto scrapped a planned trip to washington to meet trump who ha repeatedly demanded that mexico pay for a wall on the u border to halt illegal immigration the white house also suggested on thursday that the united state could impose a percent tax on good from mexico to pay for the wall sending the peso tumbling speaking about the scrapped summit senior trump aide kellyanne conway on friday told fox news that the relationship wa not imploded this one meeting ha been canceled and that wa a mutual cancellation in a separate interview on cbs news she said the tax wa one funding possibility and waved off the chance of mexican retaliation that could cost american job telling cbs news they can do what they want mexico should pay for that wall because they get an awful lot from this country conway told cbs the white house ha said it tax proposal is in the early stage a plan being weighed by house republican would exempt export revenue from taxation but impose a percent tax on imported good the idea known a a border adjustment tax would be a significant change from current u policy retailer and other business that sell imported good are not keen on the idea and some lawmaker have expressed concern about it impact on u consumer the cost for everything from grocery to car to office supply would go up by percent making it harder for middle class family to pay for thing they need every day senate democratic leader chuck schumer said in a statement
Title_Text: trump say mexico ha taken advantage of u for long enough

Text: molcaxac mexico reuters  in the small southern market town of molcaxac mile km from the u border alicia villa is praying to god that republican candidate donald trump doe not become the next president of the united state over the past two decade a mexicos rural economy stalled molcaxac and hundred of town like it became dependent on dollar sent by relative who made the perilous journey north a lifeline she fear will be cut by a trump white house villa said fund sent by a daughter working illegally a a house cleaner in sacramento california have supported her family for year because the work she doe a receptionist in molcaxac doe not pay enough to make end meet i am catholic and i have asked god and the virgin of asuncion that he lose villa said of trump placing her head in her hand and intoning a prayer in the square of the deeply religious hill town dominated by a striking blue church inside the church wa adorned with note thanking migrant relative for money sent to help build home start business and pay for marriage in the town surrounded by river mountain and meadow in the state of puebla trump say he will kick out everyone who doesnt have paper and we really need them to be there said villa adding that she had not seen some family member living in the united state in year trump a realestate tycoon who ha narrowed the gap with democratic rival hillary clinton ahead of next tuesdays vote ha vowed to make it harder for illegal immigrant to live and work in the united state to increase deportation and to limit remittance unless mexico pay billion for a wall along the nearly mile km usmexico border such policy would take a heavy toll in molcaxac where local authority say more than percent of the population life on remittance sent home by immigrant to the united state many of them undocumented our town ha improved a lot since our people started to leave for the united states said stonemason esteban marquez whose workshop wa partly funded by remittance from one of his child mexico ha more than million citizen living without regular paper in the united state or about half of the entire undocumented population those men and woman send back a large chunk of mexicos foreign exchange earnings contributing more than  billion in remittance wired this year through september according to mexicos central bank puebla received  billion in remittance in the same period making it the fifth biggest recipient among mexican state so many people from puebla live in the new york area that new jersey governor chris christie a trump supporter visited the state in courier have grown rich transporting salsa and fresh cheese to homesick native up north the money ha transformed place like molcaxac a picturesque town dotted with wellbuilt home attesting to the flow of dollar it is not just the potential loss of income trump could spark that worry molcaxac local the lack of employment in rural mexico is one of the main reason drug gang find it easy to recruit among young people and those deported from the united state they say here in mexico the truth is there is nothing for them said stonemason marquez the people who stay need to survive and since there is no work they get pulled into crime opinion poll in the runup to the election suggest that villas prayer stand a good chance of being answered with most putting clinton consistently ahead of her republican rival but the poll also show her losing ground in the final stretch real clear politics which average the result of most major poll show clintons advantage had declined from percentage point to point over the past week even those of more modest mean in molcaxac are on edge with americas election only god know if they are going to be able to stay there said serafina martinez who at still work in the field she worry it would be hard to survive without the little her son in california sends when he can i would like him to keep helping u with pennies said martinez her curved back laden with firewood and grocery still the uncertainty ha also helped local in an unexpected way the mexican pesos value plunge every time trump advance making the dollar remittance stretch further but there is no doubt in the mind of molcaxacs townspeople that they would rather see clinton in the white house clinton ha proposed comprehensive immigration reform with a path to citizenship and say she will end detention of immigrant family i think she will win and that give u hope that our relative will be able to regularize their papers said teresa amador selling flower in the main market i have a son who wa born there and he is going to vote for the lady
Title_Text: dependent on migrant dollar rural mexico prays for trump defeat

Text: beirut reuters  syrian government force on tuesday reached troop besieged for year by islamic state in the eastern city of deir alzor the militant last major stronghold in syria the army said tank and troop pressed quickly toward a governmentheld enclave in the city where islamic state ha trapped thousand of civilian and syrian soldier since the advance ha opened a land route linking that territory to the outside the advance into strategic prize deir alzor a city on the euphrates river and once the center of syria s oil industry is a significant victory for president bashar alassad against islamic state and another stinging blow to the group the group is being fought in syria by government force backed by ally iran and russia and separately by a usled alliance of arab and kurdish fighter in iraq the jihadist were driven out of their mosul stronghold earlier this year islamic state still hold half of deir alzor city and much of the province however a well a part of it former stronghold raqqa to the northwest where the usbacked offensive is being fought our armed force and ally with support from syrian and russian warplane achieved the second phase of their operation in the syrian desert syria s military said they have managed to break the siege state medium and a war monitoring group said advancing force had linked up with the besieged troop at a garrison on the western edge of the city footage on syrian state tv showed soldier cheering near the garrison state medium said resident in governmentheld part of the city were celebrating the advance the syrian observatory for human right said a nearby military air base and three district remained under siege by is battle still raged around the city the britishbased war monitor said deir alzor governor mohammed ibrahim samra told reuters that government troop were also pushing toward the air base the force have begun to lift the siege he said our resident have been waiting for this moment force are trying to break the siege on the military airport a well the coming day will see the clearing of deir alzor city of militant and advance on nearby countryside under islamic state control samra added assad congratulated the troop in a statement from his office the army and it ally made rapid advance in recent day pushing through islamic state line with the help of heavy artillery and russian air strike a russian warship in the mediterranean sea fired cruise missile at islamic state position near deir alzor to boost the offensive russia s defense ministry said the city ha been cut off from governmentheld syria since after rebel group rose up against assad during the first flush of syria s sixyear war islamic state then overran rebel position and encircled the army enclave and nearby air base in the united nation said in august it estimated civilian were living there in extremely difficult condition during the siege highaltitude air drop have supplied them deir alzor lie southeast of islamic state s former base in raqqa hemmed in on all side islamic state fighter have fallen back on foothold downstream of deir alzor in town near the iraq border the deir alzor gain form an important launching pad for expanding military operation in the area the army said for damascus the latest advance cap month of steady progress a the army and it ally turned from victory over rebel in western syria to push east against islamic state the eastward march ha on occasion brought them into conflict with usbacked force still the rival campaign have mostly stayed out of each other s way and the usled coalition ha stressed it is not seeking war with assad in a statement on sunday an alliance of iranbacked shi ite militia allied to damascus including lebanon s hezbollah accused washington of trying to hinder the advance to deir alzor an official in the proassad alliance said senior iranian revolutionary guard corp commander qassem soleimani wa closely monitoring fighting a sign of iran s close military involvement
Title_Text: syrian army ally break islamic state siege in eastern city

Text: riyadh reuters  u president barack obama aired his human right concern with saudi arabias king salman on wednesday but his talking point on that subject are expected to be get less attention when he meet gulf arab monarch on thursday activist have urged the american leader to push saudi arabia over it human right record but the regions many geopolitical crisis are likely to dominate a summit already overshadowed by strained tie between washington and the gulf the president who arrived on wednesday hope to allay gulf countries fear over iranian influence and encourage them to try to douse sectarian tension in the region in an effort to confront the threat posed by islamic state most of the gulf arab monarchy have in private been sorely disappointed by obamas presidency regarding it a a period in which the united state ha pulled back from the region leaving space for their archrival iran to expand it influence human right have not figured high on the list of issue straining the relationship but saudi arabia ha increasingly chafed at what it see a a campaign of vilification by western medium think tank and right group rob malley obamas adviser on the middle east said right issue would be raised and deputy national security adviser ben rhodes met human right advocate at the white house just before the riyadh visit to hear their concern during a twohour meeting on wednesday with the saudi king and a group of top prince obama expressed his broad concern about human right issue the white house said without listing specific case but early sign were that disagreement over human right would be relegated to the margin of thursdays talk obama ha spoken of his desire to persuade gulf state to arrive at a cold peace with iran to ease sectarian tension and allow all side to focus on what he see a a greater threat emanating from islamic state on thursday he will attend a summit of the gulf cooperation council which group the monarchical state of saudi arabia kuwait qatar bahrain the united arab emirate and oman apart from oman they are ruled by sunni muslim dynasty that see revolutionary shiite iran a a threat to their security and say it involvement in iraq syria lebanon and yemen ha fueled conflict and deepened sectarian division the white house share the view of gulf arab state that tehran play a destabilizing role but it willingness to enter a nuclear deal between iran and world power last year caused fear in riyadh that washington wa not listening to gulf arab concern riyadh ha come under fire in western country for it restriction on woman suppression of freedom of expression strict blasphemy rule and a judicial system that applies islamic law and frequently beheads convict right group are also pushing for obama to press saudi arabia to end the war in yemen for which peace talk are due to take place in kuwait this week and where air strike by a saudiled coalition have killed many civilian i urge you to take this final opportunity to speak out publicly on human right issue inside the saudi kingdom elisa massimino president of human right first a u monitoring and activist group wrote in an open letter saudi arabia ha said other country should not interfere in it domestic affair by criticizing it human right record it insists it islamic legal system is it own business and that it court are fair and independent it say the war in yemen wa in support of it internationally recognized government and aimed at restoring stability it say it ha taken great care to avoid civilian casualty
Title_Text: regional crisis not human right to dominate obamagulf talk

Text: this version of the november nd story corrects deadline for party to register candidate in eleventh par mexico city reuters  mexican leftist presidential hopeful andres manuel lopez obrador showed lead over potential rival in two newspaper poll published wednesday shortly after he unveiled key policy of his campaign platform ahead of next july s election lopez obrador is almost certain to be the candidate for his national regeneration movement morena but other party have yet to announce who will run for them making accurate polling difficult the survey in business newspaper el financiero showed lopez obrador a former mexico city mayor who ha already vied twice for the presidency ahead in any of ten potential candidate grouping with lead ranging from to percentage point a separate poll in national daily el universal showed amlo a the politician is known locally at the top in six candidate combination but with smaller margin ranging from to point the yearold laid out his policy platform on monday vowing to boost infrastructure spending without upsetting economic stability he also published a page manifesto outlining goal such a cleaning up graft with tighter financial regulation lopez obrador narrowly lost in and by a larger margin in in both case refusing to accept result he dismissed a marred by fraud he previously ran a popular moderate government a mayor of mexico city but rival depict him a a dangerous firebrand and liken his policy and style to the socialist project in crisishit venezuela next year s election is expected to be contested by multiple candidate including independent for the first time which will fragment the vote a change that could favor either lopez obrador or the ruling institutional revolutionary party pri president enrique pena nieto is barred by law from a second term in both poll interior minister miguel angel osorio chong emerges a the strongest potential candidate for the ruling party which is considering at least four highranking official mexican political party have until march to formally register candidate but most have set a middecember deadline to benefit from a longer campaign period a coalition headed by the centerright national action party pan and centerleft party of the democratic revolution prd is also contemplating several option for candidacy el universal conducted facetoface interview between nov and nationwide resulting in a percent margin of error el financiero conducted facetoface interview between nov and nationwide and said the poll ha a percent margin of error
Title_Text: mexican leftist lopez obrador lead presidential race poll

Text: reuters  a war of word between donald trump and the parent of a muslim u soldier killed in iraq in is dominating the election campaign khizr and ghazala khan were criticized by the republican presidential candidate after they appeared at the democratic national convention last thursday and shared the story of their son u army captain humayun khan the khan are what is known in the united state a a gold star family meaning they have lost an immediate relative in a military action the gold star refers to the centerpiece of flag given to these family on monday more than gold star family wrote to trump condemning his treatment of the couple saying he wa cheapening the sacrifice of soldier who have died and demanding that he apologize to the khan the following are some fact about gold star family what are gold star family gold star family have lost a member of their immediate family in a war or other conflict while serving with the u military the military award each family an official flag bearing a gold star or a lapel pin with a gold star on a purple background called a service flag family with relative on active duty display a flag with a blue star history of gold star family grace seibold whose son wa killed in europe in during world war one founded a group that came to be known a american gold star mother for woman who lost son in the war in the same year president woodrow wilson approved a suggestion to let u woman wear a gold gilt star on a traditional black mourning arm band signifying their loss in the united state began observing gold star mother day on the last sunday of september an organization called the gold star wife wa formed before the end of world war two and the gold star lapel button wa created in the term gold star family wa widely used after world war two different service flag a blue star signifies a relative serving in the military while a gold star mean a family member ha died in service during world war one relative of active duty service member flew service flag bearing a blue star a the gold star tradition took hold family covered the blue star with a gold one to symbolize their loss these flag were often hung in window how many gold star family are there the national gold star family registry note on it website that fallen service member have been registered by relative here which family wrote to trump mondays letter to trump wa signed by relative of u service member killed in iraq afghanistan vietnam and korea
Title_Text: factbox gold star mark sacrifice of u military family

Text: istanbul reuters  a turkish police officer shot and seriously wounded a state prosecutor after they argued in his office in the southern province of antalya on tuesday the dogan news agency reported the wounded man wa flown by helicopter ambulance to hospital from the korkuteli district of the province some km mile northwest of the city of antalya the agency said it said the incident occurred around pm gmt when the police officer whose wife work a a clerk at the court house where the prosecutor s office is located entered the room and they began arguing staterun anadolu news agency also described the attacker a a police officer
Title_Text: turkish police officer shoot prosecutor in antalya medium report

Text: donald trump who notoriously called people who finish in second place loser just had his word come back to bite him in the as and a could be expected the new york daily news wa right there to give him some much deserved mockery they referred to trump a dead clown walking in the headline and went on to call him a bombastic bozo in the articlethe paper which ha become known for it brilliantly blunt cover didn t cut trump any slack at all they called it like they saw it once agains and ran an absolutely delicious cover depicting trump a a clown we all know that donald trump is far too thinskinned to be running for any political office much less that of the presidency and will likely blow a gasket and throw his gazillionth childish twitter tantrum a he always doe when anyone mock or criticizes him without further ado here is the brilliant covervia ny daily newsthis is nothing less than absolutely perfect trump s campaign ha turned an important part of the american political process for a major party into little more than a circus that s why people are calling them the gop clown car that s exactly what they are and trump ha been in the driver s seat the entire time driving that car straight into a hell of humiliation trump s remark afterward may have been humble but there wa also a touch of fear to them he said he wa really honored and then remarked on going to new hampshire we love new hampshire we will go on to win new hampshire we will go on to win the nomination he then seemed to admit that he may not win the general and even mused about his postdefeat plan who know i think i might come back here iowa and buy a farm watching this buffoon lose is just the most delicious brand of schadenfreude imaginable at this point in time and i for one will make sure to pop plenty of popcorn in anticipation of the inevitable twitter tirade that is just waiting to burst forth featured image from gage skidmoreflickr
Title_Text: ny daily news mock bozo trumps iowa caucus defeat with yet another brilliant cover image

Text: this is why john mccain really regretted blaming president obama for the orlando mass shootingon thursday mccain told reporter in a senate hallway that president obama is directly responsible for the mass shooting in orlando that resulted in people being killed and people being wounded barack obama is directly responsible for it because when he pulled everybody out of iraq alqaeda went to syria became isi and isi is what it is today thanks to barack obama s failure mccain saidreporters gave mccain a fair chance to walk his comment back but he only repeated his claim he pulled everybody out of iraq and i predicted at the time that isi would go unchecked and there would be attack on the united state of america it s a matter of record so he is directly responsible you can listen to mccain s remark belownot long after mccain issued a statement claiming he misspoke even though he made his remark twice i misspoke mccain said i did not mean to imply that the president wa personally responsible i wa referring to president obama s national security decision not the president himself a i have said president obama s decision to completely withdraw u troop from iraq in led to the rise of isil i and others have long warned that the failure of the president s policy to deny isil safe haven would allow the terrorist organization to inspire plan direct or conduct attack on the united state and europe a they have done in paris brussels san bernardino and now orlando of course mccain is wrong about president obama pulling the troop out of iraq that wa a decision made by president bush in president obama merely honored the agreement signed by the former presidentbut mccain could be the former senator from arizona because of his inflammatory accusation against shooting disappointed thousand of arizonan and people from across the nation said kirkpatrick spokesman db mitchell but his action are just further proof that after year in washington mccain ha changed and now american are witnessing that he s no longer a maverick arizonan know it s time for new principled leadership and that s why ann kirkpatrick saw the largest oneday fundraising number of the campaign we need a senator who will put our national security before partisan politics we must do everything we can to elect ann to the senate and we are asking you to make a donation today john mccain is currently facing one of the toughest reelection effort for a republican this year losing his race could very well tip the balance in the senate and give the majority back to the democratic partyyou can donate to kirkpatrick s campaign herefeatured image chip somodevillagetty image

hunt that s gone off the rail a few key detail about the fired antitrump investigator who wasn t fired but moved to human resource by comeypeter strzok sent antitrump message to his girlfriend aka mistress then wa just moved to hr he s a part of the comeymccabe group he handled the fake trump dossier inside the fbi alongside mccabe he wa handpicked by comey to run the hillary email investigation he wa also handpicked by mueller for the senior investigative staff coincidence like this simply don t exist burning your hardearned dollarsthe department of justice revealed on tuesday that nearly  million ha been spent so far on the investigation into russian meddling in the presidential electionthe cost cover a fivemonth period from may when the department of justice appointed Text: washington reuters  u senate democrat defeated a republican effort to undercut the iran nuclear agreement on wednesday by blocking an amendment to a spending bill that would have stopped the obama administration from buying heavy water from tehran the amendment to an energy spending bill offered by republican senator tom cotton received yes vote and no vote it had needed yes vote to advance in the member senate cotton withdrew his amendment after the vote and the senate is expected to vote later on a version of the spending bill without it the measure would have barred the use of u government fund to purchase heavy water which is nonradioactive and used in nuclear reactor and for making nuclear weapon under last years nuclear deal between iran the united state and five other world power tehran is responsible for reducing it stock of the substance which it can sell dilute or dispose of under certain condition president barack obamas administration had warned congress that it strongly opposed any move to prevent the planned purchase of  millionworth of heavy water from iran senate democrat and a handful of republican had also banded together in late april to block the cotton amendment and hence the spending bill the dustup had put a crimp in senate majority leader mitch mcconnells plan to pas bipartisan appropriation bill to keep the federal government functioning beyond sept the end of the governments fiscal year
Title_Text: bid to stop heavy water purchase from iran blocked in u senate

Text: voter identification law aka voter id are an attempt by republican lawmaker to suppress the vote with demographic that often vote for democratic candidate young voter minority the poor often when confronted with this conservative claim that the law are in place to protect the integrity of the ballot against socalled voter fraud but time and time again study have shown that voter fraud happens so infrequently it is almost nonexistentin wisconsin failed republican presidential candidate governor scott walker praised the recent implementation of voter id in wisconsin s presidential primary but one case show that the law is just a fancy modern version of jim crowwisconsin governor scott walker said his state s strict new voterid requirement worked just fine in the april primary but thousand of wisconsinite were unable to cast a ballot because of the new law one of them wa eddie lee holloway jrholloway a yearold africanamerican man moved from illinois to wisconsin in and voted without problem until wisconsin passed it voterid law in i never miss voting he said he brought his expired illinois photo id birth certificate and social security card to get a photo id for voting but the dmv in milwaukee rejected his application because the name on his birth certificate read eddie junior holloway the result of a clerical error when it wa issuedthe nation go on to report that holloway ended up spending  on record made trip between two state and wa still unable to vote in wisconsin the u court of appeal is currently reviewing a case brought before it on behalf of holloway by the aclu the aclu estimate that there are thousand of people in wisconsin who have been disenfranchised like himthis is exactly what republican want they ve said it on the record multiple time that voter id help them because it suppresses the vote their party best succeeds when less and less people get to exercise their constitutional rightsfeatured image via flickr
Title_Text: proof republican are blocking black voter this court case is exposing them

Text: new yorksan diego reuters  donald trump agreed on friday to pay  million to settle fraud lawsuit over his trump university real estate seminar in what new yorks attorney general called a stunning reversal for the u presidentelect the lawsuit had dogged trump who denied any wrongdoing throughout his campaign they led to one of the more controversial moment of his run when he claimed the judge overseeing two of the case wa biased because he wa of mexican ancestry the settlement wa announced by new york attorney general eric schneiderman who said it followed repeated refusal by trump to settle for even modest amount of compensation for the victim of his phony university lawyer for trump had argued against student who claimed they were they were lured by false promise into paying up to  to learn trumps real estate investing secrets from his handpicked instructor three lawsuit relating to trump university will be covered by the deal two class action suit in california and a new york case brought by schneiderman the agreement must still be approved by u district judge gonzalo curiel in san diego trump will not admit any wrongdoing under the agreement his attorney daniel petrocelli acknowledged trump had previously vowed to fight the case the settlement demonstrated trumps desire to set his personal feeling aside in order to work on issue facing the county petrocelli said presidentelect trump ha laser focus on moving forward its time to move on petrocelli told reporter on friday schneiderman and attorney for the student praised the deal todays  million settlement agreement is a stunning reversal by donald trump and a major victory for the over victim of his fraudulent university schneiderman said in a statement at a court hearing on friday students attorney jason forge said that out of the  million proposed settlement  million will be earmarked for student represented by schneiderman who were not part of the california class action a well a administrative cost class action lawyer for the student will not seek attorney fee but reimbursement for cost he said curiel who is presiding over the two california case had urged both side to settle trump said during his election campaign that curiel who wa born in indiana to mexican immigrant parent could not be impartial because of trumps campaign pledge to build a wall on the usmexico border to control illegal immigration in court on friday trump lawyer petrocelli praised curiel for his hard work on the case curiel said he hoped the settlement could be part of a healing process after the u election that this country very sorely needs
Title_Text: trump agrees to pay  million to settle trump university lawsuit

Text: tea party radio host and lieutenant governor of texas dan patrick ha officially made the stupidest move yet in regard to bathroom rule in our school patrick declared that texas wa prepared to forego literally billion of dollar in federal education funding rather than allow transgender child to use the bathroom we will not be blackmailed by the president s piece of silver patrick ignorantly announced the we he refers to are rich elected republican that can afford to send their kid to private school not mentioned by any republican is whether million of texas parent and child that are completely dependent on the public school system are also prepared to have their entire school system essentially shut downthis isn t just some minor budget readjustment and tightening of belt by teacher and school district this is totally defunding the education of million student who rely on federal money to attend an already desperately underfunded public school system in texasas of now the issue of school bathroom use is inevitably headed towards our court system the legal question is whether or not the federal government can continue using the civil right act to force school to allow child to use the bathroom with which they feel comfortableaccording to interpretation by the justice department title of the civil right act doe allow for the federal government to prohibit discrimination based on gender in public school that receive federal fundingif the court find in favor of the federal government which it is very likely they will the president can then try to use the cutting off of federal fund in order to get state compliance on the lawthe white house wa asked about the texas lt governor s comment press secretary josh earnest said this doe underscore the risk of electing a rightwing radio host to a statewide elected office truer word were never spokenfeatured image via brietbart
Title_Text: texas teabagger lt governor promise to take away food from poor kid to resist obama
